translated: For the Blessed One’s going to those to be trained is “gone well” in every way because it brings about their welfare and happiness.🔽And so is his natural going, which is free from the faults of laughing, yawning, stumbling, dragging the feet, being pressed, stooping, crookedness, and confusion, and which is like the gait of a royal swan, a bull, an elephant in rut, or a lion.

original: mavahasitarājahaṃsa- vasabhavāraṇamigarājagamanaṃ pakatigamanañca, vimalavipulakaruṇāsativīriyādiguṇavisesasahitampi
analyzed: vasabha vāraṇa miga rāja gamanam pakati gamanam ca vimala vipula karuṇā sati vīriya ādi guṇa visesa sahitam pi
translated: And it is accompanied by the special qualities of stainless, vast compassion, mindfulness, energy, and so forth.

original: ñāṇagamanaṃ abhinīhārato paṭṭhāya yāva mahābodhi, tāva niravajjatāya sobhanamevāti.
analyzed: ñāṇa gamanam abhinīhārataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva mahā bodhi tāva niravajja tāya sobhanam eva ati
translated: and the going by way of knowledge is good in that it is irreproachable from the time of the arousing of the enlightenment-factor up to the Great Awakening.🔽Or alternatively, he is well gone since he has gone rightly,

original: Atha vā “sayambhūñāṇena sakalampi lokaṃ pariññābhisamayavasena parijānanto sammā🔽gato avagatoti sugato. Yo hi gatyattho, so buddhayattho. Yo ca buddhayattho, so gatyatthoti.🔽Tathā lokasamudayaṃ pahānābhisamayavasena pajahanto anuppattidhammatamāpādento sammā
analyzed: atha vā sayambhu ñāṇena sakalam pi lokam pariññā abhisamaya vasena parijānanto sammā  gataḥ avagataḥ iti sugataḥ yaḥ hi gati attho so buddha yattho yaḥ ca buddha yattho saḥ gati attho ti  tathā loka samudayam pahāna abhisamaya vasena pajahantaḥ anuppatti dhamma tam āpādentaḥ sammā
translated: having fully understood the whole world by means of his own knowledge in the sense of full-understanding as abandoning and in the sense of penetration.🔽And he is well gone since he has gone rightly, having gone beyond, having reached the state of non-arising, by way of full-understanding as abandoning in the sense of penetration.

original: gato atītoti sugato. Lokanirodhaṃ sacchikiriyābhisamayavasena sammā gato adhigatoti
analyzed: gataḥ atītaḥ iti sugataḥ loka nirodham sacchikiriyā abhisamaya vasena sammā gataḥ adhigataḥ iti
translated: And he is well gone since he has gone rightly, has attained, by way of full-understanding as realization in the sense of penetration.

original: sugato. Lokanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ bhāvanābhisamayavasena sammā gato paṭipannoti🔽sugato, ayañcattho ‘sotāpattimaggena ye kilesā pahīnā, te kilese na puneti na pacceti
analyzed: sugataḥ loka nirodha gāminim paṭipadam bhāvanā abhisamaya vasena sammā gataḥ paṭipanno ti  sugataḥ sotāpatti maggena ye kilesāḥ pahīnā te kilese na puneti na pacceti
translated: And he is well gone since he has gone rightly, has practiced, by way of full-understanding as development in the sense of penetration.

original: na paccāgacchatī’ti sugatotiādinā niddesanayena vibhāvetabbo.
analyzed: na paccāgacchati iti sugataḥ iti ādinā niddesa nayena vibhāvetabbo
translated: And this meaning should be illustrated by the method of definition in the way beginning, “He is well gone since he does not again and again go back to and return to and come back to the defilements that have been abandoned by the path of stream-entry.”

original: Aparo nayo – sundaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ, nibbānameva vā gato adhigatoti sugato. Bhūtaṃ
analyzed: aparaḥ nayaḥ sundaram sammāsambodhim nibbānam eva vā gataḥ adhigataḥ iti sugataḥ bhūtam
translated: Another method: He has gone to the beautiful supreme enlightenment, or to Nibbāna, which he has attained, thus he is the “well- gone” . He speaks the truth,

original: tacchaṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ yathārahaṃ kālayuttameva vācaṃ vineyyānaṃ sammā gadatīti vā🔽sugato, da-kārassa ta-kāraṃ katvā, taṃ sugataṃ. Puññāpuññakammehi upapajjanavasena🔽gantabbāti gatiyo, upapattibhavavisesā. Tā pana nirayādibhedena pañcavidhā, sakalassāpi
analyzed: tat śam attha saṃhitam yathāraham kāla yuttam eva vācam vineyyānam sammā gadati iti vā  sugataḥ dakārassa takāram katvā tam sugatam puññāpuñña kammehi upapajjana vasena  gantabbā ti gatiyaḥ upapatti bhava visesā tā pana niraya ādi bhedena pañcavidhā sakalassa api
translated: what is fitting, and what is timely to those who need training, thus he is the “well- gone” .🔽The “destinies” are the different kinds of becoming as rebirth- linking by means of profitable and unprofitable kamma. They are of five kinds as the destiny of hell, etc.,

original: bhavagāmikammassa ariyamaggādhigamena avipākārahabhāvakaraṇena nivattitattā pañcahipi🔽tāhi visaṃyutto hutvā muttoti gativimutto. Uddhamuddhabhavagāmino hi devā taṃtaṃkammavipākadānakālānurūpena🔽tato tato bhavato muttāpi muttamattāva, na pana visaññogavasena muttā, gatipariyāpannā
analyzed: bhava gāmi kammassa ariya magga adhigamena a vipāka a raha bhāva karaṇena nivattita ttā pañcahi pi  tāhi visaṃyuttaḥ hutvā muttaḥ ti gati vimuttaḥ uddha muddha bhava gāminaḥ hi devā taṃ taṃ kamma vipāka dāna kāla anurūpena  tatas tatas bhavataḥ muttā api mutta mattā ava na pana visaññoga vasena muttā gati pariyāpannā
translated: and the Blessed One is “freed from destinies” because he has turned away from all the kinds of becoming by attaining the noble path, which makes it impossible for him to experience the kamma that leads to all kinds of becoming.🔽The gods who go to the highest kinds of becoming are freed only from the hells, etc., that they have been freed from by the time they are reborn there, but they are not freed by way of disjunction from the destinies that are still to come.

original: ca taṃtaṃbhavagāmikammassa ariyamaggena anivattitattā, na tathā bhagavā. Bhagavā
analyzed: ca taṃtaṃbhava gāmi kammassa ariya maggena a nivattita ttā na tathā bhagavā bhagavā
translated: And they are still included among the destinies because they have not turned away from the kamma that leads to the different kinds of becoming by means of the noble path. But the Blessed One is not like that.

original: pana yathāvuttappakārena visaṃyutto hutvā muttoti. Tasmā anena bhagavato katthacipi
analyzed: pana yathā vutta ppakārena visaṃyuttaḥ hutvā muttaḥ iti tasmai anena bhagavataḥ katthacipi
translated: but he is released, i.e. disassociated, in the way already stated. Consequently, by this expression the Blessed One shows that he is not included in any destiny.🔽And since the Blessed One is called “the deva above the devas” ,

original: gatiyā apariyāpannataṃ dasseti. Yato ca bhagavā “devātidevo”ti vuccati. Tenevāha –
analyzed: gatiyāḥ a pariyāpanna tam dasseti yatas ca bhagavā devātidevaḥ iti vuccati tena iva āha
translated: he says:🔽“By which I might have been reborn

original: “Yena devūpapatyassa, gandhabbo vā vihaṅgamo;
analyzed: yena deva upapatyassa gandhabbaḥ vā vihaṅgamaḥ
translated: As a deva, gandhabba, bird,

original: Yakkhattaṃ yena gaccheyyaṃ, manussattañca abbaje;
analyzed: yakkhattam yena gaccheyyam manussattam ca abbaje
translated: Or as a yakkha, or as a man,🔽My cankers are destroyed,

original: Te mayhaṃ āsavā khīṇā, viddhastā vinaḷīkatā”ti. ;
analyzed: te mayham āsavā khīṇāḥ vid hastāḥ vinaḷīka tā ati
translated: They are pierced, they are smashed” .

original: Taṃtaṃgatisaṃvattanakānañhi kammakilesānaṃ mahābodhimūleyeva aggamaggena pahīnattā
analyzed: taṃtaṃgati saṃvattanakānam hi kamma kilesānam mahā bodhi mūleya iva aggamaggena pahīna ttā
translated: For the kamma-formations that lead to the various kinds of destiny were abandoned by the Blessed One at the foot of the Bodhi Tree by the attainment of the supreme path.

original: natthi bhagavato taṃtaṃgatipariyāpannatāti accantameva bhagavā sabbabhavayonigativiññāṇaṭṭhitisattāvāsasattanikāyehi🔽parimuttoti. Atha vā kāmaṃ saupādisesāyapi nibbānadhātuyā tāhi gatīhi vimutto, esā
analyzed: natthi bhagavato taṃ taṃ gati pariyāpanna tā ti accantam eva bhagavā sabba bhava yoni gati viññāṇa ṭṭhiti sattā vāsa satta nikāyehi  parimuttaḥ ti atha vā kāmam sa aupādisesāya api nibbānadhātuyā tāhi gatīhi vimuttaḥ esā
translated: Consequently, the Blessed One is not included in any destiny. He is utterly released from all kinds of becoming, destiny, station of consciousness, abode of beings, and group of creatures.

original: pana “paññāpajjotavihatamohatama”nti etthevantogadhāti iminā padena anupādisesāya
analyzed: pana iminā padena an upādisesāya
translated: Or, if he is released from those destinies even in the Nibbāna element that still has a remainder of clinging, this expression “released” is nevertheless used here in the sense of the Nibbāna element without a remainder of clinging.

original: nibbānadhātuyāva thometīti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: nibbāna dhātuyā ava thometi iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: It should be regarded as the one who is intent on the element of Nibbāna.

original: Ettha pana attahitasampattiparahitapaṭipattivasena dvīhākārehi bhagavato thomanā
analyzed: ettha pana atta hita sampatti para hita paṭipatti vasena dvīhā ākārehi bhagavato thomanā
translated: Herein, the Blessed One’s intentness is shown in two ways, namely, as the fulfilment of his own welfare and as the undertaking of others’ welfare.

original: katā hoti. Tesu anāvaraṇañāṇādhigamo, saha vāsanāya kilesānamaccantappahānaṃ, anupādisesanibbānappatti🔽ca attahitasampatti nāma, lābhasakkārādinirapekkhacittassa pana sabbadukkhaniyyānikadhammadesanāpayogato
analyzed: katā hoti tesu anāvaraṇa ñāṇa adhigamo saha vāsanāya kilesānam accanta ppahānam an upādisesa nibbāna ppatti  ca atta hita sampatti nāma lābha sakkāra ādi nirapekkha cittassa pana sabba dukkha niyyānika dhamma desanā apayogato
translated: The fulfilment of his own welfare is the attainment of unobstructed knowledge, the complete destruction of cankers together with their traces, and the realization of the Nibbāna element without trace left.

original: devadattādīsupi viruddhasattesu niccaṃ hitajjhāsayatā, vinītabbasattānaṃ ñāṇaparipākakālāgamanañca
analyzed: devadatta ādīsu pi viruddha sattesu niccam ñāṇa paripāka kāla āgamanam ca
translated: But the undertaking of others’ welfare is the Blessed One’s constant desire for the welfare of all beings, even his enemies, such as Devadatta, because of his mind’s freedom from concern for gain, honour, and fame, and his use of the Dhamma to teach a way of deliverance from all suffering, and his timely guidance of beings who are teachable.

original: āsayato parahitapaṭipatti nāma. Sā pana āsayapayogato duvidhā, parahitapaṭipatti🔽tividhā ca attahitasampatti imāya gāthāya yathārahaṃ pakāsitā hoti. “Karuṇāsītalahadaya”nti
analyzed: āsayato para hita paṭipatti nāma sā pana āsaya payogataḥ duvidhā para hita paṭipatti  tividhā ca imāya gāthāya yathāraham pakāsitā
translated: This undertaking of others’ welfare is twofold as intention and as application.🔽And the fulfilment of his own welfare is threefold. These are shown by this stanza as appropriate.

original: hi etena āsayato parahitapaṭipatti, sammā gadanatthena sugatasaddena payogato parahitapaṭipatti.
analyzed: hi etena āsayataḥ para hita paṭipatti sammā gadana tthena sugata saddena payogataḥ para hita paṭipatti
translated: For by the words “Whose heart is cool with the moisture of compassion” his intention to undertake others’ welfare is shown; and by the word “Blessed” in the sense of “well preached” his application to undertake others’ welfare is shown.

original: “Paññāpajjotavihatamohatamaṃ gativimutta”nti etehi, catusaccapaṭivedhatthena ca sugatasaddena🔽tividhāpi attahitasampatti, avasiṭṭhaṭṭhena pana tena, “sanarāmaralokagaru”nti ca
analyzed: paññā pajjota vihata mohatamam gati vimuttan ti etehi catu sacca paṭivedha tthena ca sugata saddena  tividhā api atta hita sampatti ca
translated: By the word “well-farer” in the sense of the penetration of the four truths,

original: etena sabbāpi attahitasampatti, parahitapaṭipatti ca pakāsitā hoti.
analyzed: etena sabbā api atta hita sampatti para hita paṭipatti ca pakāsitā hoti
translated: all the excellence of benefit to himself is shown, and by the word “honored by gods and men” all the excellence of benefit to himself and the practice of benefit to others.

original: Atha vā hetuphalasattūpakāravasena tīhākārehi thomanā katā. Tattha hetu nāma mahākaruṇāsamāyogo,
analyzed: atha vā hetu phala sattu upakāra vasena tīhā ākārehi thomanā katā tattha hetu nāma mahā karuṇā samāyogaḥ
translated: Or else, the praise is made in three ways, by way of cause, fruit, and service. Herein, the cause is the union with great compassion

original: bodhisambhārasambharaṇañca, tadubhayampi paṭhamapadena yathārutato, sāmatthiyato
analyzed: bodhi sambhāra sambharaṇañca tat ubhayam pi paṭhama padena
translated: and the accumulation of the requisites for enlightenment. Both of these are shown by the first phrase, according to the literal meaning and according to the inner significance.

original: ca pakāsitaṃ. Phalaṃ pana ñāṇappahānaānubhāvarūpakāyasampadāvasena catubbidhaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: ca pakāsitam phalam pana ñāṇa ppahāna ānubhāva rūpa kāya sampadā vasena catubbidham tattha
translated: The fruit is fourfold, by way of the excellence of knowledge, abandonment, and material body, and by way of power. Herein,

original: sabbaññutañāṇapadaṭṭhānaṃ maggañāṇaṃ, tammūlakāni ca dasabalādiñāṇāni ñāṇasampadā,
analyzed: sabbaññuta ñāṇa padaṭṭhānam magga ñāṇam tad mūlakāni ca dasa bala ādi ñāṇāni ñāṇa sampadā
translated: the knowledge of the path, which is the basis for omniscience, and the knowledge of the ten powers, etc., which have that as their root, are the excellence of knowledge.🔽The state of being unproduced in the future by the abandonment of all defilements together with their traces is the excellence of abandonment.

original: savāsanasakalasaṃkilesānamaccantamanuppādadhammatāpādanaṃ pahānasampadā, yathicchitanipphādane
analyzed: pahāna sampadā yathicchita nipphādane
translated: The state of being able to produce at will

original: ādhipaccaṃ ānubhāvasampadā, sakalalokanayanābhisekabhūtā pana lakkhaṇānubyañjanapaṭimaṇḍitā
analyzed: ādhipaccam ā anubhāva sampadā sakala loka nayana abhiseka bhūtā pana lakkhaṇa anubyañjana paṭimaṇḍitā
translated: The perfection of influence is the perfection of majesty. The perfection of physical form is the perfection of the physical body, which is adorned with the major and minor characteristics and is the consecration for the whole world’s eyes.

original: attabhāvasampatti rūpakāyasampadā. Tāsu ñāṇappahānasampadā dutiyapadena, saccapaṭivedhatthena
analyzed: atta bhāva sampatti rūpa kāya sampadā tāsu ñāṇa ppahāna sampadā dutiya padena sacca paṭivedha tthena
translated: Of these, the perfection of knowledge and relinquishment is revealed by the second line, by the word “well-farer” in the sense of penetration of the four noble truths.

original: ca sugatasaddena pakāsitā, ānubhāvasampadā tatiyapadena, rūpakāyasampadā sobhanakāyagamanatthena
analyzed: ca sugata saddena pakāsitā ānubhāva sampadā tatiya padena rūpa kāya sampadā sobhana kāya gamana atthena
translated: The perfection of majesty is revealed by the third line, and the perfection of the physical body is revealed by the word “well-farer” in the sense of going with a beautiful body.

original: sugatasaddena lakkhaṇānubyañjanapāripūriyā vinā tadabhāvato. Yathāvuttā duvidhāpi
analyzed: sugata saddena lakkhaṇa anubyañjana pāripūriyā vinā tad abhāvataḥ yathā vuttā duvidhā api
translated: For without the fulfilment of the major and minor characteristics there is no perfection of the physical body. The two perfections just mentioned,

original: parahitapaṭipatti sattūpakārasampadā, sā pana sammā gadanatthena sugatasaddena pakāsitāti veditabbā.🔽Apica imāya gāthāya sammāsambodhi tammūla – tappaṭipattiyādayo aneke buddhaguṇā ācariyena
analyzed: para hita paṭipatti sattu upakāra sampadā sā pana sammā gadana tthena sugata saddena pakāsitā ati veditabbā  apica imāya gāthāya aneke buddha guṇāḥ ācariyena
translated: which are the perfection of benefit to beings, are revealed by the word “well-farer” in the sense of right utterance.🔽Moreover, by this stanza the Master has revealed many of the special qualities of a Buddha, such as the supreme enlightenment, the practice of the perfections, etc., which are rooted in the perfection of knowledge and relinquishment.

original: pakāsitā honti. Esā hi ācariyānaṃ pakati, yadidaṃ yena kenaci pakārena atthantaraviññāpanaṃ.
analyzed: pakāsitāḥ honti esā hi ācariyānam yat idam yena kenacid pakārena atthantara viññāpanam
translated: This is the Master’s way: to reveal one thing by another.

original: Kathaṃ? “Karuṇāsītalahadaya”nti hi etena sammāsambodhiyā mūlaṃ dasseti. Mahākaruṇāsañcoditamānaso🔽hi bhagavā saṃsārapaṅkato sattānaṃ samuddharaṇatthaṃ katābhinīhāro anupubbena pāramiyo
analyzed: katham hi etena sammāsambodhiyāḥ mūlam dasseti mahā karuṇā sañcodita mānasaḥ  hi bhagavā saṃsāra paṅkataḥ sattānam samuddharaṇa attham kata abhinīhāraḥ anupubbena pāramiyaḥ
translated: How? By the words “whose heart is tender with compassion” he shows the root of the supreme perfect enlightenment. For the Blessed One, whose mind was urged on by great compassion,

original: pūretvā anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhimadhigatoti karuṇā sammāsambodhiyā mūlaṃ. “Paññāpajjotavihatamohatama”nti🔽etena sammāsambodhiṃ dasseti. Sabbaññutañāṇapadaṭṭhānañhi aggamaggañāṇaṃ, aggamaggañāṇapadaṭṭhānañca
analyzed: pūretvā anuttaram sammāsambodhim adhigataḥ iti karuṇā sammāsambodhiyāḥ mūlam  etena sammāsambodhim dasseti sabbaññuta ñāṇa padaṭṭhānam hi aggamagga ñāṇam aggamagga ñāṇa padaṭṭhānam ca
translated: made his aspiration for the purpose of rescuing beings from the wilderness of the round, and after gradually fulfilling the pāramīs, he reached the supreme perfect enlightenment. So compassion is the root of the supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ “sammāsambodhī”ti vuccati. Sammā gamanatthena sugatasaddena sammāsambodhiyā🔽paṭipattiṃ dasseti līnuddhaccapatiṭṭhānāyūhanakāmasukhattakilamathānuyogasassatucchedābhinivesādiantadvayarahitāya
analyzed: sabbaññu ta ññāṇam sammāsambodhī iti vuccati sammā gamana atthena sugata saddena sammāsambodhiyā  paṭipattim dasseti
translated: By the words “whose darkness was dispelled by the light of wisdom” he shows the supreme perfect enlightenment. For the knowledge of the path to the supreme fruit is based on the knowledge of omniscience, and the knowledge of omniscience is based on the knowledge of the path to the supreme fruit. This is called “supreme perfect enlightenment.”🔽By the word “well-farer” he shows the practice for the supreme perfect enlightenment, which is the middle practice, free from the two extremes of indulging in sense pleasures and engaging in self-mortification, and free from the two assumptions of eternalism and annihilationism, etc.,

original: karuṇāpaññāpariggahitāya majjhimāya paṭipattiyā pakāsanato, itarehi sammāsambodhiyā
analyzed: karuṇā paññā pariggahitāya majjhimāya paṭipattiyā pakāsanataḥ itarehi sammāsambodhiyā
translated: because it is taught as being embraced by compassion and wisdom.

original: padhānāppadhānappabhedaṃ payojanaṃ dasseti. Saṃsāramahoghato sattasantāraṇañhettha
analyzed: payojanam dasseti saṃsāra mahoghato satta santāraṇam ha ittha
translated: He shows the purpose by the division into the chief and the not chief. For the chief thing here is the deliverance of beings from the great flood of saṃsāra,

original: padhānaṃ, tadaññamappadhānaṃ. Tesu ca padhānena payojanena parahitapaṭipattiṃ dasseti,🔽itarena attahitasampattiṃ, tadubhayena ca attahitapaṭipannādīsu catūsu puggalesu🔽bhagavato catutthapuggalabhāvaṃ pakāseti. Tena ca anuttaraṃ dakkhiṇeyyabhāvaṃ, uttamañca
analyzed: padhānam tad aññam appadhānam tesu ca padhānena payojanena para hita paṭipattim dasseti  itarena atta hita sampattim tad ubhayena ca atta hita paṭipanna ādīsu catūsu puggalesu  bhagavato catuttha puggala bhāvam pakāseti tena ca anuttaram dakkhiṇeyya bhāvam uttamam ca
translated: and the not chief is the opposite of that. And by the chief purpose he shows the practice of what is helpful to others,🔽and by the other he shows the accomplishment of what is helpful to himself. And by both he reveals the Blessed One’s state as the fourth kind of person among the four kinds beginning with the person who practices what is helpful to himself.

original: vandanīyabhāvaṃ, attano ca vandanāya khettaṅgatabhāvaṃ vibhāveti.
analyzed: vandanīya bhāvam ca vandanāya khettaṅgata bhāvam vibhāveti
translated: And by that he reveals his state as the unsurpassed field of merit and his state as the most excellent one worthy of homage, and he reveals the state of being a field for his own worship.

original: Apica karuṇāggahaṇena lokiyesu mahaggatabhāvappattāsādhāraṇaguṇadīpanato sabbalokiyaguṇasampatti
analyzed: api ca karuṇā ggahaṇena lokiyesu mahaggata bhāva ppatta asādhāraṇa guṇa dīpanato sabba lokiya guṇa sampatti
translated: Besides, by the mention of compassion he shows the accomplishment of all mundane special qualities since it reveals the special qualities not held in common with others that are reached with the attainment of the great in the mundane,

original: dassitā, paññāggahaṇena sabbaññutaññāṇapadaṭṭhānamaggañāṇadīpanato sabbalokuttaraguṇasampatti.
analyzed: dassitā paññā ggahaṇena sabbaññuta ññāṇa padaṭṭhāna magga ñāṇa dīpanato sabba lokuttara guṇa sampatti
translated: and by the mention of understanding he shows the accomplishment of all supramundane special qualities since it reveals the path knowledge that is the basis for the knowledge of omniscience.🔽For the meaning that is established by the mention of both is expanded in the passage beginning, “Honoured of men and gods” .

original: Tadubhayaggahaṇasiddho hi attho “sanarāmaralokagaru”ntiādinā vipañcīyatīti. Karuṇāggahaṇena
analyzed: tad ubhaya ggahaṇa siddhaḥ hi atthaḥ sa nara amara loka garunti ādinā vipañcīyati iti karuṇā ggahaṇena
translated: By the mention of compassion

original: ca nirupakkilesamupagamanaṃ dasseti, paññāggahaṇena apagamanaṃ. Tathā karuṇāggahaṇena
analyzed: ca nirupakkilesam upagamanam dasseti paññā ggahaṇena apagamanam tathā karuṇā ggahaṇena
translated: and by the word understanding he shows the going away from it.

original: lokasamaññānurūpaṃ bhagavato pavattiṃ dasseti lokavohāravisayattā karuṇāya, paññāggahaṇena
analyzed: loka samaññā anurūpam bhagavataḥ pavattim dasseti loka vohāra visaya ttā karuṇāya paññā ggahaṇena
translated: Similarly, by the word compassion he shows the Blessed One’s occurrence in conformity with the world’s designation, since compassion is the province of worldly usage,

original: lokasamaññāya anatidhāvanaṃ. Sabhāvānavabodhena hi dhammānaṃ sabhāvaṃ atidhāvitvā
analyzed: loka samaññāya an atidhāvanam sabhāva an avabodhena hi dhammānam sabhāvam atidhāvitvā
translated: and by the word understanding he shows that he does not outrun the world’s designation. For it is by not understanding the individual essences of states that one outruns their individual essences and so comes to misapprehend them as a being, and so on.

original: sattādiparāmasanaṃ hoti. Tathā karuṇāggahaṇena mahākaruṇāsamāpattivihāraṃ dasseti,
analyzed: sattā ādi parāmasanam hoti tathā karuṇā ggahaṇena mahākaruṇā samāpatti vihāram dasseti
translated: Similarly, by the word compassion he shows the Blessed One’s abiding in the attainment of great compassion,

original: paññāggahaṇena tīsu kālesu appaṭihatañāṇaṃ, catusaccañāṇaṃ, catupaṭisambhidāñāṇaṃ,
analyzed: paññā ggahaṇena tīsu kālesu appaṭihata ñāṇam catu sacca ñāṇam catu paṭisambhidā ñāṇam
translated: and by the word understanding he shows the knowledge unobstructed about the three temporal divisions, the knowledge of the four truths, the knowledge of the four discriminations,

original: catuvesārajjañāṇaṃ, karuṇāggahaṇena mahākaruṇāsamāpattiñāṇassa gahitattā sesāsādhāraṇañāṇāni,🔽cha abhiññā, aṭṭhasu parisāsu akampanañāṇāni, dasa balāni, cuddasa buddhaguṇā, soḷasa
analyzed: catu vesārajja ñāṇam karuṇā ggahaṇena mahākaruṇā samāpatti ñāṇassa gahita ttā sesa a sādhāraṇa ñāṇāni  cha abhiññāḥ aṭṭhasu parisāsu akampana ñāṇāni dasa balāni cuddasa buddha guṇā soḷasa
translated: the knowledge of the four confidences, and the knowledge of great compassion that is included by the word compassion, and the other kinds of knowledge that are not common to disciples,🔽the six kinds of direct-knowledge, the kinds of knowledge that are unshaken by the eight kinds of persons, the ten powers, the fourteen kinds of knowledge distinctive to a Buddha, the sixteen kinds of knowledge of what may and may not be,

original: ñāṇacariyā, aṭṭhārasa buddhadhammā, catucattārīsa ñāṇavatthūni, sattasattati ñāṇavatthūnīti
analyzed: ñāṇa cariyāḥ aṭṭhārasa buddha dhammā catucattārīsa ñāṇa vatthūni satta sattati ñāṇa vatthūni iti
translated: the eighteen principal qualities of a Buddha, the forty-four cases of knowledge, the seventy-two cases of knowledge,

original: evamādīnaṃ anekesaṃ paññāpabhedānaṃ vasena ñāṇacāraṃ dasseti. Tathā karuṇāggahaṇena🔽caraṇasampattiṃ, paññāggahaṇena vijjāsampattiṃ. Karuṇāggahaṇena attādhipatitā, paññāggahaṇena
analyzed: evamādīnam anekesam paññā apabhedānam vasena ñāṇa cāram dasseti tathā karuṇā ggahaṇena  caraṇa sampattim paññā ggahaṇena vijjā sampattim karuṇā ggahaṇena attā adhipati tā paññā ggahaṇena
translated: He shows the way of knowledge by means of these and other such various kinds of knowledge. Likewise, by the mention of compassion🔽he shows the perfection of conduct, and by the mention of wisdom the perfection of clear vision. By the mention of compassion🔽he shows the supremacy of self, and by the mention of wisdom the supremacy of the Dhamma. By the mention of compassion

original: dhammādhipatitā. Karuṇāggahaṇena lokanāthabhāvo, paññāggahaṇena attanāthabhāvo. Tathā
analyzed: dhamma adhipati tā karuṇā ggahaṇena loka nātha bhāvo paññā ggahaṇena atta nātha bhāvo tathā
translated: he shows the state of being a protector of the world, and by the mention of wisdom the state of being one’s own protector. Likewise,

original: karuṇāggahaṇena pubbakārībhāvo, paññāggahaṇena kataññutā. Karuṇāggahaṇena aparantapatā,🔽paññāggahaṇena anattantapatā. Karuṇāggahaṇena vā buddhakaradhammasiddhi, paññāggahaṇena
analyzed: karuṇā ggahaṇena pubba kārī bhāvaḥ paññā ggahaṇena kataññu tā karuṇā ggahaṇena aparantapa tā  paññā ggahaṇena anattantapa tā karuṇā ggahaṇena vā buddha kara dhamma siddhi paññā ggahaṇena
translated: by the mention of compassion he shows the state of being a forerunner, and by the mention of wisdom the state of being grateful. By the mention of compassion🔽he shows the state of being a benefactor of the future, and by the mention of wisdom the state of being a benefactor of the present. By the mention of compassion

original: buddhabhāvasiddhi. Tathā karuṇāggahaṇena parasantāraṇaṃ, paññāggahaṇena attasantāraṇaṃ.🔽Tathā karuṇāggahaṇena sabbasattesu anuggahacittatā, paññāggahaṇena sabbadhammesu
analyzed: tathā karuṇā ggahaṇena para santāraṇam paññā ggahaṇena atta santāraṇam  tathā karuṇā ggahaṇena sabba sattesu anuggaha citta tā paññā ggahaṇena sabba dhammesu
translated: he shows the accomplishment of the factors of a Buddha, and by the mention of wisdom the accomplishment of Buddhahood. Likewise, by the mention of compassion🔽he shows the state of being a comforter of others, and by the mention of wisdom the state of being one’s own comforter.

original: virattacittatā dassitā hoti sabbesañca buddhaguṇānaṃ karuṇā ādi tannidānabhāvato,
analyzed: viratta citta tā dassitā hoti sabbesam ca buddha guṇānam karuṇā ādi tad nidāna bhāvato
translated: By the mention of compassion he shows the state of mind that is helpful to all beings, and by the mention of wisdom the state of mind that is detached from all things. And all the qualities of a Buddha are shown by the mention of compassion, because compassion is their source,

original: paññā pariyosānaṃ tato uttari karaṇīyābhāvato. Iti ādipariyosānadassanena sabbe buddhaguṇā
analyzed: paññā pariyosānam tatas uttari karaṇīya abhāvato iti ādi pariyosāna dassanena sabbe buddha guṇā
translated: and wisdom is the culmination, because there is nothing further to be done beyond that. So by showing the beginning, middle, and end, all the special qualities of the Buddhas are shown.

original: dassitā honti. Tathā karuṇāggahaṇena sīlakkhandhapubbaṅgamo samādhikkhandho dassito
analyzed: dassitāḥ honti tathā karuṇā ggahaṇena sīla kkhandha pubbaṅgamaḥ samādhi kkhandho dassito
translated: Similarly, by the mention of compassion, the concentration aggregate, which has virtue as its forerunner, is shown,

original: hoti. Karuṇānidānañhi sīlaṃ tato pāṇātipātādiviratippavattito, sā ca jhānattayasampayoginīti,
analyzed: hoti karuṇā nidānam hi sīlam tatas pāṇa atipāta ādi virati pavattito sā ca jhāna ttaya sampayoginī iti
translated: for virtue has compassion as its source, since it occurs in the form of abstention from killing living beings, etc., and that abstention is associated with the three jhānas.

original: paññāvacanena paññākkhandho. Sīlañca sabbabuddhaguṇānaṃ ādi, samādhi majjhe, paññā
analyzed: paññā vacanena paññā kkhandho sīlañca sabba buddha guṇānaṃ ādi samādhi majjhe paññā
translated: And by the mention of wisdom, the wisdom aggregate is shown.

original: pariyosānanti evampi ādimajjhapariyosānakalyāṇā sabbe buddhaguṇā dassitā honti nayato
analyzed: pariyosānanti evam pi ādi majjha pariyosāna kalyāṇā sabbe buddha guṇāḥ dassitāḥ honti nayataḥ
translated: And so, too, all the special qualities of the Buddhas are shown as good in the beginning, middle, and end, since they are shown by the method.

original: dassitattā. Eso eva hi niravasesato buddhaguṇānaṃ dassanupāyo, yadidaṃ nayaggāhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: dassita ttā esaḥ eva hi niravasesataḥ buddha guṇānam dassan upāyaḥ yat idam naya ggāhaṇam
translated: For this is the only way to show the special qualities of the Buddhas without omission, namely, by the method of the aggregates, etc.,

original: aññathā ko nāma samattho bhagavato guṇe anupadaṃ niravasesato dassetuṃ. Tenevāha –
analyzed: aññathā kaḥ nāma samatthaḥ bhagavataḥ guṇe anupadam niravasesataḥ dassetum tena iva āha
translated: since no one else is able to show the Blessed One’s special qualities without omission and according to their distinctive nature. That is why it is said:

original: “Buddhopi buddhassa bhaṇeyya vaṇṇaṃ,
analyzed: buddhaḥ api buddhassa bhaṇeyya vaṇṇam
translated: “Even if he were to praise the Buddha’s special qualities

original: Kappampi ce aññamabhāsamāno.
analyzed: kappam pi ce aññam a bhāsamāno
translated: For an eon, speaking without cease,

original: Khīyetha kappo ciradīghamantare,
analyzed: khīyetha cira dīgham antare
translated: The aeon might be exhausted, so long a time,

original: Vaṇṇo na khīyetha tathāgatassā”ti.
analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ na khīyetha tathāgatassa ati
translated: But the Realised One’s beauty would not be exhausted.”

original: Teneva ca āyasmatā sāriputtattherenāpi buddhaguṇaparicchedanaṃ pati bhagavatā anuyuttena
analyzed: tena iva ca āyasmatā sāriputta ttherena api buddha guṇa paricchedanam bhagavatā anuyuttena
translated: And also by the venerable Sāriputta, the Elder, who was devoted to the analysis of the qualities of the Fortunate One,

original: “no hetaṃ bhante”ti paṭikkhipitvā “api ca me bhante dhammanvayo vidito”ti sampasādanīyasutte vuttaṃ.
analyzed: no ha etam bhante iti paṭikkhipitvā api ca me bhante dhamma anvayaḥ vidito ti sampasādanīya sutte vuttam
translated: after he had replied: “No, reverend Sir,” and said: “But, reverend Sir, the sequence of the Dhamma is known to me,” as it is said in the Sampasādanīya Sutta.

original: Evaṃ saṅkhepena sakalasabbaññuguṇehi bhagavato thomanāpubbaṅgamaṃ paṇāmaṃ katvā idāni
analyzed: evam saṅkhepena sakala sabbaññu guṇehi bhagavataḥ thomanā pubbaṅgamam paṇāmam katvā idāni
translated: Having thus made a salutation which is preceded by praise of the Fortunate One’s qualities in their entirety in brief,

original: saddhammassāpi thomanāpubbaṅgamaṃ paṇāmaṃ karonto “buddhopī”tiādimāha. Tatthāyaṃ
analyzed: saddhammassa api thomanā pubbaṅgamam paṇāmam karontaḥ buddhaḥ pi iti ādim āha tattha ayam
translated: now making a salutation which is preceded by praise of the True Dhamma in brief he said: “Buddhopi,” etc. Herein,

original: saha padasambandhena saṅkhepattho – yathāvuttavividhaguṇagaṇasamannāgato buddhopi🔽yaṃ ariyamaggasaṅkhātaṃ dhammaṃ, saha pubbabhāgapaṭipattidhammena vā ariyamaggabhūtaṃ
analyzed: saha pada sambandhena saṅkhepa atthaḥ yathā vutta vividha guṇa gaṇa samannāgataḥ buddhaḥ api  yam ariya magga saṅkhātam dhammam saha pubbabhāga paṭipatti dhammena vā ariya magga bhūtam
translated: this is the meaning in brief with the connection of the words: The Realised One, who is endowed with the various qualities as described,🔽having developed the Dhamma which is called the Noble Path,🔽or the Dhamma which is the Noble Path together with the Dhamma of practice which is the preliminary work,

original: dhammaṃ bhāvetvā ceva yaṃ phalanibbānasaṅkhātaṃ dhammaṃ, pariyattidhammapaṭipattidhammehi
analyzed: dhammam bhāvetvā ca iva yam phala nibbāna saṅkhātam dhammam pariyatti dhamma paṭipatti dhammehi
translated: and having developed the Dhamma which is the fruit and Nibbāna,

original: vā saha phalanibbānabhūtaṃ dhammaṃ sacchikatvā ca sammāsambodhisaṅkhātaṃ buddhabhāvamupagato,
analyzed: vā saha phala nibbāna bhūtam dhammam sacchikatvā ca sammāsambodhi saṅkhātam buddha bhāvam upagataḥ
translated: and having realized the Dhamma, which is the fruit and the extinction, he attained the state of Buddhahood, which is called Supreme Perfect Awakening.

original: vītamalamanuttaraṃ taṃ dhammampi vandeti.
analyzed: vīta malam anuttaram tam dhammam pi vandeti
translated: He also pays homage to the Dhamma, which is stainless and unsurpassed.

original: Tattha buddhasaddassa tāva “bujjhitā saccānīti buddho. Bodhetā pajāyāti buddho”tiādinā🔽niddesanayena attho veditabbo. Atha vā aggamaggañāṇādhigamena savāsanāya sammohaniddāya
analyzed: tattha buddha saddassa tāva bujjhitā saccāni iti buddhaḥ pajāyāti buddha uti ādinā  niddesa nayena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ atha vā aggamagga ñāṇa adhigamena sa vāsanāya sammoha niddāya
translated: Herein, the word “Buddha” should be understood in the sense of “awakened” by way of the definition: “He is the Buddha because he has awakened to the truths, because he has awakened the people, and so on.

original: accantavigamanato, aparimitaguṇagaṇālaṅkatasabbaññutaññāṇappattiyā vikasitabhāvato🔽ca buddhavāti buddho jāgaraṇavikasanatthavasena. Atha vā kassacipi ñeyyadhammassa
analyzed: accanta vigamanataḥ aparimita guṇa gaṇa alaṅkata sabbaññuta ññāṇa ppattiyāḥ vikasita bhāvataḥ  ca buddhavāti buddhaḥ jāgaraṇa vikasana attha vasena atha vā kassaci pi ñeyya dhammassa
translated: Or else, he is the Buddha because he has gone beyond the sleep of delusion together with its residues by attaining the knowledge of the path of the highest fruit, and because he has blossomed by attaining the knowledge of omniscience adorned with the multitude of immeasurable good qualities,

original: anavabuddhassa abhāvena ñeyyavisesassa kammabhāvāgahaṇato kammavacanicchāyābhāvena
analyzed: anavabuddhassa abhāvena ñeyya visesassa kamma bhāva āgahaṇato kamma vacanicchāyā abhāvena
translated: in the sense of the meaning of “awakening” and “blossoming.” Or else, the word “Buddha” is a verbal noun in the sense of the meaning of “understanding,” because there is no truth-object that is not understood by him, and because there is no appearance of the mode of activity of one who has not grasped the mode of activity of the object of knowledge,

original: avagamanatthavasena kattuniddesova labbhati, tasmā buddhavāti buddhotipi vattabbo.
analyzed: avagamana attha vasena kattu niddesaḥ uva labbhati tasmā buddhavā ati buddhaḥ ti pi vattabbaḥ
translated: since there is no object of knowledge that is not known by him. Therefore, it is also proper to say that he is the Buddha because he is the one who has awakened.

original: Padesaggahaṇe hi asati gahetabbassa nippadesatāva viññāyati yathā “dikkhito na dadātī”ti.
analyzed: padesa ggahaṇe hi asati gahetabbassa nippadesa tā ava viññāyati yathā dikkhitaḥ na dadāti iti
translated: For if there were no specification of a place, then the absence of specification in what is to be specified would be understood, as in the statement, “He who is pointed out by the direction does not give.”

original: Evañca katvā kammavisesānapekkhā kattari eva buddhasaddasiddhi veditabbā, atthato
analyzed: evam ca katvā kamma visesa anapekkhā kattari eva buddha sadda siddhi veditabbā atthataḥ
translated: And when it is so taken, the word “Buddha” should be understood to be established in the agent only, which requires a particular action, and in the sense of

original: pana pāramitāparibhāvito sayambhuñāṇena saha vāsanāya vihataviddhastaniravasesakilesomahākaruṇāsabbaññutaññāṇādiaparimeyyaguṇagaṇādhāro
analyzed: pana pāramitā paribhāvitaḥ sayambhu ñāṇena saha vāsanāya vihata viddhasta niravasesa kilesaḥ mahā karuṇā sabbaññuta ññāṇa ādi aparimeyya guṇa gaṇa ādhāraḥ
translated: the continuum of aggregates that is the bearer of immeasurable qualities such as the knowledge of omniscience, great compassion, and the complete destruction of defilements without remainder, together with the knowledge that is self-arisen and perfected by the perfections, and the latent tendencies.

original: khandhasantāno buddho, yathāha –
analyzed: khandha santānaḥ buddhaḥ yathā āha
translated: As it is said:

original: “Buddhoti yo so bhagavā sayambhū anācariyako pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu sāmaṃ saccāni abhisambujjhi, tattha ca sabbaññutaṃ patto, balesu ca vasībhāva”nti.
analyzed: buddhaḥ ti yaḥ saḥ bhagavā sayambhu an ācariyako pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu sāmam saccāni abhisambujjhi tattha ca sabbaññu tam pattaḥ balesu ca vasībhāvanti
translated: “Buddha means the Blessed One who is self-arisen, without a teacher, who fully awakened to the truths by himself in regard to things that were previously unknown, and who attained omniscience in that regard, and mastery over the ignorant.”

original: Apisaddo sambhāvane, tena evaṃ guṇavisesayutto sopi nāma bhagavā īdisaṃ dhammaṃ bhāvetvā,
analyzed: api saddaḥ sambhāvane tena evam guṇa visesa yuttaḥ saḥ api nāma bhagavā īdisam dhammam bhāvetvā
translated: The word “also” is for emphasis. Thus, it is said that the Blessed One, who is endowed with such special qualities, having developed such a Dhamma,

original: sacchikatvā ca buddhabhāvamupagato, kā nāma kathā aññesaṃ sāvakādibhāvamupagamaneti
analyzed: sacchikatvā ca buddha bhāvam upagataḥ kā nāma kathā aññesam sāvaka ādi bhāvam upagamanā iti
translated: and having realized it, attained Buddhahood. What need is there to speak of others attaining the states of disciples and so on?

original: dhamme sambhāvanaṃ dīpeti. Buddhabhāvanti sammāsambodhiṃ. Yena hi nimittabhūtena
analyzed: dhamme sambhāvanam dīpeti buddha bhāvanti sammāsambodhim yena hi nimitta bhūtena
translated: He shows the respect due to the Dhamma. The word “awakening” is the supreme enlightenment. For it is by means of the supreme path knowledge, which is the basis for the knowledge of omniscience,

original: sabbaññutaññāṇapadaṭṭhānena aggamaggañāṇena, aggamaggañāṇapadaṭṭhānena ca sabbaññutaññāṇena
analyzed: sabbaññu taññāṇa padaṭṭhānena aggamagga ñāṇena aggamagga ñāṇa padaṭṭhānena ca sabbaññu taññāṇena
translated: and by means of the knowledge of omniscience, which is the basis for the supreme path knowledge,

original: bhagavati “buddho”ti nāmaṃ, tadārammaṇañca ñāṇaṃ pavattati, tamevidha “bhāvo”ti vuccati.
analyzed: bhagavati buddhaḥ iti nāmam tad ārammaṇam ca ñāṇam pavattati bhāvaḥ ti vuccati
translated: that the Blessed One comes to be called “Buddha” and that the knowledge with that as its object occurs. And that is called “awakening.”

original: Bhavanti buddhisaddā etenāti hi bhāvo. Tathā hi vadanti –
analyzed: bhavanti buddhi saddāḥ etena ati hi bhāvo tathā hi vadanti
translated: For “awakening” is said to be that by means of which the word “awakened” comes to be. For it is said:

original: “Yena yena nimittena, buddhi saddo ca vattate;
analyzed: yena yena nimittena buddhi saddo ca vattate
translated: “By whatever sign the word ‘awakened’ comes to be,

original: Taṃtaṃnimittakaṃ bhāvapaccayehi udīrita”nti.
analyzed: tad tad nimittakam bhāva paccayehi udīritan ti
translated: That sign is called ‘awakening’ by those who teach the conditions.”

original: Bhāvetvāti uppādetvā, vaḍḍhetvā vā. Sacchikatvāti paccakkhaṃ katvā. Ceva-saddo ca-saddo🔽ca tadubhayattha samuccaye. Tena hi saddadvayena na kevalaṃ bhagavā dhammassa bhāvanāmattena
analyzed: bhāvetvā iti uppādetvā vaḍḍhetvā vā sacchikatvā iti paccakkham katvā ca iva saddo ca saddo  ca samuccaye tena hi sadda dvayena na kevalam bhagavā dhammassa bhāvanā mattena
translated: “Having awakened” means having aroused, having developed. “Having realized” means having made evident. The word “also” is a particle indicating conjunction.🔽Thus by the two words “awakened” and “realized” the Blessed One is shown not only to have come to be “awakened” by the mere fact of the development of the Dhamma,

original: buddhabhāvamupagato, nāpi sacchikiriyāmattena, atha kho tadubhayenevāti samuccinoti.
analyzed: buddha bhāvam upagataḥ na api sacchikiriyā mattena atha kho tat ubhayena iva ati samuccinoti
translated: but also by the fact of its realization.

original: Upagatoti patto, adhigatoti attho. Etassa “buddhabhāva”nti padena sambandho. Vītamalanti
analyzed: upagataḥ ti pattaḥ adhigataḥ iti atthaḥ etassa buddha bhāvanti padena sambandhaḥ vīta malanti
translated: Upagato means attained; the meaning is, reached. It is connected with the words “the state of Buddhahood” in the verse. Vītamalanti

original: ettha virahavasena eti pavattatīti vīto, malato vīto, vītaṃ vā malaṃ yassāti vītamalo,🔽taṃ vītamalaṃ. “Gatamala”ntipi pāṭho dissati, evaṃ sati saupasaggo viya anupasaggopi
analyzed: ettha viraha vasena eti pavattati iti vītaḥ malataḥ vītaḥ vītam vā malam yassa ati vīta malaḥ  tam vīta malam gata malam tipi pāṭhaḥ dissati evam sati sa upasaggaḥ viya anupasaggaḥ api
translated: Herein, it goes by way of separation, thus it is vīta ; it is separated from stain, thus it is vītamalam ;🔽or it is that in which stain is removed, thus it is vītamalam . The reading gatamalaṃ is also found; and in that case the word gata should be understood to have the meaning of separation, since verbal roots have many meanings.🔽For the meaning of gata is “it goes, it departs,”

original: gatasaddo virahatthavācako veditabbo dhātūnamanekatthattā. Gacchati apagacchatīti
analyzed: gata saddaḥ viraha ttha vācakaḥ veditabbaḥ dhātūnam aneka attha ttā gacchati apagacchati iti
translated: thus it is gata ; or stain has gone, thus it is gata , according to the method stated above. The compound is made up in the same way. Anuttara means without a superior.

original: hi gato, dhammo. Gataṃ vā malaṃ, purimanayena samāso. Anuttaranti uttaravirahitaṃ.🔽Yathānusiṭṭhaṃ paṭipajjamāne apāyato, saṃsārato ca apatamāne katvā dhāretīti dhammo,🔽navavidho lokuttaradhammo. Tappakāsanattā, sacchikiriyāsammasanapariyāyassa ca labbhamānattā
analyzed: hi gataḥ dhammaḥ gatam vā malam purima nayena samāsaḥ uttara virahitam  yathānusiṭṭham paṭipajjamāne apāyataḥ saṃsārataḥ ca a patamāne katvā dhāreti iti dhammo  navavidhaḥ lokuttara dhammaḥ tad pakāsana ttā sacchikiriyā sammasana pariyāyassa ca labbhamāna ttā
translated: The Dhamma is that which bears, having made those who practice in accordance with the instruction, fall not into the states of loss and the round of rebirths.🔽The supramundane Dhamma consisting of the nine supramundane states is included here, because it is the cause of the removal of the stain of defilement and because the expression “to be realized by the wise for themselves” is applicable to it.

original: pariyattidhammopi idha saṅgahito. Tathā hi “abhidhammanayasamuddaṃ adhigacchi, tīṇi
analyzed: pariyatti dhammo api idha saṅgahito tathā hi abhidhamma naya samuddam tīṇi
translated: The Dhamma of the scriptures is also included here, because it is the ocean of the method of the Abhidhamma, and because the expression “to be realized by the wise for themselves” is applicable to it in the sense of being the cause of the realization of the supramundane Dhamma. For it is said: “He attained the ocean of the method of the Abhidhamma, the three

original: piṭakāni sammasī”ti ca aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ, tathā “yaṃ dhammaṃ bhāvetvā sacchikatvā”ti🔽ca vuttattā bhāvanāsacchikiriyāyogyatāya buddhakaradhammabhūtāhi pāramitāhi saha
analyzed: piṭakāni sammasi iti ca aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam tathā yam dhammam bhāvetvā sacchikatvā iti  ca vutta ttā bhāvanā sacchikiriyā yogyatāya buddha kara dhamma bhūtāhi pāramitāhi saha
translated: and in the Commentary it is said, “He massed the Piṭakas,” and so on, and because it is said, “Having developed and realized the Dhamma,”

original: pubbabhāgaadhisīlasikkhādayopi idha saṅgahitāti veditabbā. Tāpi hi vigatapaṭipakkhatāya
analyzed: pubbabhāga adhisīla sikkhā ādayaḥ api idha saṅgahitā ati veditabbā tā api hi vigata paṭipakkha tāya
translated: the training in the higher virtue, etc., in the preliminary part of the path, should be understood as included here too, since it is fit to be developed and realized and is a factor of Buddhahood like the pāramīs.

original: vītamalā, anaññasādhāraṇatāya anuttarā ca. Kathaṃ pana tā bhāvetvā, sacchikatvā ca🔽bhagavā buddhabhāvamupagatoti? Vuccate – sattānañhi saṃsāravaṭṭadukkhanissaraṇāya
analyzed: vīta malāḥ anañña sādhāraṇa tāya anuttarā ca katham pana tāḥ bhāvetvā sacchikatvā ca  bhagavā buddha bhāvam upagataḥ iti vuccate sattānam hi saṃsāra vaṭṭa dukkha nissaraṇāya
translated: For that training too is stainless because it is free from opposition, and it is unsurpassed because it is not shared by others.🔽But how did the Blessed One attain Buddhahood by developing and realizing these?🔽We reply: The Blessed One made his great aspiration for the purpose of deliverance of beings from the suffering of the round of rebirths.

original: [nissaraṇatthāya (paṇṇāsa ṭī.) nissaraṇe (katthaci)] katamahābhinīhāro mahākaruṇādhivāsanapesalajjhāsayo
analyzed: nissaraṇa atthāya nissaraṇe katthaci kata mahā abhinīhāraḥ mahā karuṇā adhivāsana pesala jjhāsayaḥ
translated: Having the nature of great compassion, of endurance of the burden of beings, of the desire to be a refuge,

original: paññāvisesapariyodātanimmalānaṃ dānadamasaññamādīnaṃ uttamadhammānaṃ kappānaṃ satasahassādhikāni
analyzed: paññā visesa pariyodāta nimmalānam dāna dama saññama ādīnam uttama dhammānam kappānam sata sahassa adhikāni
translated: he developed for four incalculable periods and 100,000 eons the supreme Dhamma beginning with generosity, virtue, and renunciation, which is purified and bright, being free from cankers and beyond training.

original: cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni sakkaccaṃ nirantaraṃ niravasesaṃ bhāvanāsacchikiriyāhi kammādīsu
analyzed: cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni sakkaccam nirantaram niravasesam bhāvanā sacchikiriyāhi kamma ādīsu
translated: For four incalculable ages he has developed the four paths of stream-entry, etc., with urgency, uninterruptedly, and without remainder, and he has realized them by knowledge.

original: adhigatavasībhāvo acchariyācinteyyamahānubhāvo adhisīlādhicittānaṃ paramukkaṃsapāramippatto🔽bhagavā paccayākāre catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassamukhena mahāvajirañāṇaṃ pesetvā anuttaraṃ
analyzed: adhigata vasībhāvaḥ acchariya acinteyya mahā anubhāvaḥ adhi sīla adhicittānam param ukkaṃsa pārami patto  bhagavā paccaya ākāre catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa mukhena mahā vajira ñāṇam pesetvā anuttaram
translated: He has attained mastery in action, etc., and he is endowed with the inconceivable and immeasurable powers of a Buddha. He has reached the perfection of the perfection of virtue and the perfection of concentration.

original: sammāsambodhisaṅkhātaṃ buddhabhāvamupagatoti.
analyzed: sammāsambodhi saṅkhātam buddha bhāvam upagataḥ iti
translated: The Blessed One has sent forth the great vajra-knowledge with its two hundred and forty koṭis of approaches, and he has attained the state of a Buddha, which is called supreme and perfect enlightenment.

original: Imāya pana gāthāya vijjāvimuttisampadādīhi anekehi guṇehi yathārahaṃ saddhammaṃ thometi.
analyzed: imāya pana gāthāya vijjā vimutti sampad ādīhi anekehi guṇehi yathāraham saddhammam thometi
translated: But in this stanza he extols the True Idea in its various aspects, according as it is fitting, by means of the various special qualities beginning with the equipment of science and deliverance.🔽How so? Herein, by “having developed” he extols the equipment of science,

original: Kathaṃ? Ettha hi “bhāvetvā”ti etena vijjāsampadāya thometi, “sacchikatvā”ti etena🔽vimuttisampadāya. Tathā paṭhamena jhānasampadāya, dutiyena vimokkhasampadāya. Paṭhamena
analyzed: katham ettha hi bhāvetvā ati etena vijjā sampadāya thoma iti sacchikatvā ati etena  vimutti sampadāya tathā paṭhamena jhāna sampadāya dutiyena vimokkha sampadāya paṭhamena
translated: by “having realized” he extols the equipment of deliverance.🔽Or alternatively, by the first line he extols the equipment of jhāna, by the second the equipment of the liberations.🔽Or alternatively, by the first line he extols the equipment of concentration, by the second the equipment of attainment.

original: vā samādhisampadāya, dutiyena samāpattisampadāya. Atha vā paṭhamena khayañāṇabhāvena,
analyzed: vā samādhi sampadāya dutiyena samāpatti sampadāya atha vā paṭhamena khaya ñāṇa bhāvena
translated: Or alternatively, by the first line he extols the state of knowing destruction,

original: dutiyena anuppādañāṇabhāvena. Paṭhamena vā vijjūpamatāya, dutiyena vajirūpamatāya.
analyzed: dutiyena anuppāda ñāṇa bhāvena paṭhamena vā vijju upamatāya dutiyena vajirūpamatāya
translated: and with the second, by the knowledge of non-arising. Or the first is like lightning and the second is like a diamond.

original: Paṭhamena vā virāgasampattiyā, dutiyena nirodhasampattiyā. Tathā paṭhamena niyyānabhāvena,
analyzed: paṭhamena vā virāga sampattiyā dutiyena nirodha sampattiyā tathā paṭhamena niyyāna bhāvena
translated: Or the first is the perfection of fading away and the second is the perfection of cessation. Likewise, the first is by the way of escape

original: dutiyena nissaraṇabhāvena. Paṭhamena vā hetubhāvena, dutiyena asaṅkhatabhāvena. Paṭhamena
analyzed: dutiyena nissaraṇa bhāvena paṭhamena vā hetu bhāvena dutiyena asaṅkhata bhāvena paṭhamena
translated: and the second is by the way of escape from that. Or the first is by the way of cause and the second is by the way of the unformed element. The first is

original: vā dassanabhāvena, dutiyena vivekabhāvena. Paṭhamena vā adhipatibhāvena, dutiyena🔽amatabhāvena dhammaṃ thometi. Atha vā “yaṃ dhammaṃ bhāvetvā buddhabhāvaṃ upagato”ti
analyzed: vā dassana bhāvena dutiyena viveka bhāvena paṭhamena vā adhipati bhāvena dutiyena  amata bhāvena dhammam thometi atha vā yam dhammam bhāvetvā buddha bhāvam upagataḥ iti
translated: by the way of seeing and the second is by the way of seclusion. Or the first is by the way of predominance and the second is by the way of the deathless. He extols the True Idea in this way.

original: etena svākkhātatāya dhammaṃ thometi, “sacchikatvā”ti etena sandiṭṭhikatāya. Tathā
analyzed: etena su ākkhāta tāya dhammam thometi sacchikatvā iti etena sandiṭṭhika tāya tathā
translated: Or alternatively, by the first phrase he extols the True Idea for its well-proclaimedness in this way: “It is the True Idea that he made to be the supreme thing in the world by developing it and attaining to the state of a Buddha” ,🔽and by the second phrase he extols it for its immediacy. Likewise,

original: paṭhamena akālikatāya, dutiyena ehipassikatāya. Paṭhamena vā opaneyyikatāya, dutiyena
analyzed: paṭhamena akālikatāya dutiyena ehipassikatāya paṭhamena vā opaneyyikatāya dutiyena
translated: by the first phrase he extols it for its urgency and by the second for its come-and-see-ness. Or the first is by the way of leading on and the second is by the way of personal experience.

original: paccattaṃveditabbatāya. Paṭhamena vā saha pubbabhāgasīlādīhi sekkhehi sīlasamādhipaññākkhandhehi,
analyzed: paccattam veditabba tāya paṭhamena vā saha pubbabhāga sīla ādīhi sekkhehi sīla samādhi paññā kkhandhehi
translated: Or the first is by the aggregates of virtue, concentration, and understanding of the learner together with the prior states associated with them, and the second is by the aggregates of virtue, concentration, and understanding of the Arahant dissociated from the prior states.

original: dutiyena saha asaṅkhatadhātuyā asekkhehi dhammaṃ thometi.
analyzed: dutiyena saha asaṅkhata dhātuyā asekkhehi dhammam thometi
translated: and with the second he extols the Dhamma as the Arahant’s state in the unformed element.

original: “Vītamala”nti iminā pana saṃkilesābhāvadīpanena visuddhatāya dhammaṃ thometi, “anuttara”nti
analyzed: iminā pana saṃkilesa abhāva dīpanena visuddha tāya dhammam thometi anuttaranti
translated: But with “Stainless” he extols the Dhamma as purified because it is the opposite of corruption. With “Unsurpassed”

original: etena aññassa visiṭṭhassa abhāvadīpanena paripuṇṇatāya. Paṭhamena vā pahānasampadāya,
analyzed: etena aññassa visiṭṭhassa abhāva dīpanena paripuṇṇa tāya paṭhamena vā pahāna sampadāya
translated: he extols it as perfect because it is the opposite of what is surpassed. Or alternatively, with the first he extols it as the perfection of abandoning,

original: dutiyena sabhāvasampadāya. Paṭhamena vā bhāvanāphalayogyatāya. Bhāvanāguṇena hi so
analyzed: dutiyena sa bhāva sampadāya paṭhamena vā bhāvanā phala yogyatāya bhāvanā guṇena hi saḥ
translated: with the second as the perfection of individual essence. Or with the first he extols it as the state of being fit for development,

original: saṃkilesamalasamugghātako, tasmānena bhāvanākiriyāya phalamāha. Dutiyena sacchikiriyāphalayogyatāya.
analyzed: saṃkilesa mala samugghātakaḥ tasmā anena bhāvanā kiriyāya phalam āha dutiyena sacchi kiriyā phala yogyatāya
translated: for it is by the virtue of development that it is the remover of the stain of corruption. So with the first he extols the fruit of the function of development. With the second he extols it as the state of being fit for realization,

original: Taduttarikaraṇīyābhāvato hi anaññasādhāraṇatāya anuttarabhāvo sacchikiriyānibbattito,
analyzed: tad uttari karaṇīya abhāvataḥ hi anañña sādhāraṇa tāya anuttara bhāvaḥ sacchikiriyā nibbattito
translated: for it is because there is nothing more to be done that it is unsurpassed, since it is not shared by others, and it is the producer of the realization of the fruit of Arahantship.

original: tasmānena sacchikiriyāphalamāhāti.
analyzed: tasmāt anena sacchikiriyā phalam āha ati
translated: So with the second he extols the fruit of realization.

original: Evaṃ saṅkhepeneva sabbasaddhammaguṇehi saddhammassāpi thomanāpubbaṅgamaṃ paṇāmaṃ
analyzed: evam saṅkhepena iva sabba saddhamma guṇehi saddhammassa api thomanā pubbaṅgamam paṇāmam
translated: So he extols the True Idea, which is the best of all ideas, with this homage that is a mere prelude,

original: katvā idāni ariyasaṅghassāpi thomanāpubbaṅgamaṃ paṇāmaṃ karonto “sugatassa orasāna”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: katvā idāni ariya saṅghassa api thomanā pubbaṅgamam paṇāmam karontaḥ sugatassa orasānaṃ ti ādim āha
translated: Having done so, he now makes a salutation to the ariyan Saṅgha, preceded by a eulogy, with the words “Sugatassa orasāna” .🔽Herein, sugatassa is a locative of the dative case, and it should be construed with puttāna .🔽Orasā is a word for a child born from one’s own womb,

original: Tattha sugatassāti sambandhaniddeso, “puttāna”nti etena sambajjhitabbo. Urasi bhavā,
analyzed: tattha sugatassa ati sambandha niddesaḥ puttānan ti etena sambajjhitabbaḥ urasi bhavā
translated: or for a child born from the womb of a slave belonging to the household, or for a child born from the womb of a slave given in lieu of wages, or for a child born from the womb of a slave given in adoption.

original: jātā, saṃvuddhā vā orasā, attajo khettajo antevāsiko dinnakoti catubbidhesu puttesu
analyzed: jātā saṃvuddhā vā orasā atta jaḥ khetta jaḥ antevāsikaḥ dinnakaḥ ti catubbidhesu puttesu
translated: Of the four kinds of children, namely, a child born from one’s own womb, a child born in one’s field, a child born as a result of a vow, and a child given in adoption,

original: attajā, taṃsarikkhatāya pana ariyapuggalā “orasā”ti vuccanti. Yathā hi manussānaṃ
analyzed: atta jāḥ taṃsa rikkha tāya pana ariya puggalāḥ orasā ti vuccanti yathā hi manussānam
translated: the child born from one’s own womb is the best. But ariyan persons are called “orasā” because they are like a child born from one’s own womb.

original: orasaputtā attajātatāya pitusantakassa dāyajjassa visesabhāgino honti, evametepi🔽saddhammasavanante ariyāya jātiyā jātatāya bhagavato santakassa vimuttisukhassa dhammaratanassa
analyzed: orasa puttāḥ atta jāta tāya pitu santakassa dāyajjassa visesa bhāginaḥ honti evam ete pi  saddhamma savana ante ariyāya jātiyā jāta tāya bhagavato santakassa vimutti sukhassa dhamma ratanassa
translated: For just as a child born from one’s own womb is a “child of the breast” and is entitled to a special share of his father’s estate,🔽so these ariyan persons are “orasā” because they are born of the noble birth of the hearing of the True Idea, and they are entitled to a special share of the Blessed One’s estate, namely, the bliss of the deliverance of the True Idea and the True Idea Jewel.

original: ca dāyajjassa visesabhāginoti. Atha vā bhagavato dhammadesanānubhāvena ariyabhūmiṃ
analyzed: ca dāyajjassa visesa bhāginaḥ ti atha vā bhagavataḥ dhamma desanā anubhāvena ariya bhūmim
translated: Or alternatively, because they are born of the Blessed One’s own womb, namely, the True Idea taught by the Blessed One, and because they are born of the Blessed One’s own breast, namely, the True Idea heard by them, they are called “orasā” .

original: okkamamānā, okkantā ca ariyasāvakā bhagavato ure vāyāmajanitābhijātatāya sadisakappanamantarena
analyzed: okkamamānāḥ okkantā ca ariya sāvakāḥ bhagavataḥ ure vāyāma janita abhijāta tāya sadisa kappanam antarena
translated: and when they have gone forth, they are the Blessed One’s bosom sons, and they are worthy to be called “bosom sons” in the true sense of the word,

original: nippariyāyeneva “orasā”ti vattabbatamarahanti. Tathā hi te bhagavatā āsayānusayacariyādhimuttiādiolokanena,
analyzed: nippariyāyena iva orasā ati vattabba tam arahanti tathā hi te bhagavatā āsaya anusaya cariyā adhimutti ādi olokanena
translated: because they are born of the breast of the Blessed One’s breast, that is to say, because they are born of his breast in the sense of his exertion. For they are nourished by the Blessed One’s breast of exertion,

original: vajjānucintanena ca hadaye katvā vajjato nivāretvā anavajje patiṭṭhāpentena sīlādidhammasarīraposanena
analyzed: vajja anucintanena ca hadaye katvā vajjataḥ nivāretvā anavajje patiṭṭhāpentena sīla ādi dhamma sarīra posanena
translated: which is the breast of the True Idea, by his remembering them with a mind of loving-kindness and by his establishing them in the blameless True Idea after turning them away from the blameful, by his nourishing them with the body of True Idea consisting in virtue, etc.,

original: saṃvaḍḍhāpitā. Yathāha bhagavā itivuttake “ahamasmi bhikkhave brāhmaṇo…pe… tassa
analyzed: saṃvaḍḍhāpitā yathā āha bhagavā itivuttake aham asmi bhikkhave brāhmaṇa upe tassa
translated: after he had taken them to his heart by looking at their inherent tendency, underlying tendency, temperament, and kind of Dhamma-penetration, and so on, and after he had turned them away from what is blameworthy and established them in what is blameless. As the Blessed One said in the Itivuttaka: “I am a brahmin, bhikkhus, a recluse, one of the most excellent in the world,🔽and you are my bosom sons, born of my breast, born of my mouth, born of the Dhamma, created by the Dhamma, heirs to the Dhamma” .

original: me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā”tiādi. Nanu sāvakadesitāpi desanā ariyabhāvāvahāti?
analyzed: me tumhe puttāḥ orasāḥ mukhataḥ jātāḥ ati ādi nanu sāvaka desitā api desanā
translated: But is not teaching by disciples also arousing of the noble state?

original: Saccaṃ, sā pana tammūlikattā, lakkhaṇādivisesābhāvato ca “bhagavato dhammadesanā”
analyzed: saccam sā pana tammūlika ttā lakkhaṇa ādi visesa abhāvataḥ ca bhagavataḥ dhamma desanā
translated: It is, but that is reckoned as “the Blessed One’s teaching of the Dhamma” because it has that as its root and because it lacks the special qualities of the characteristics, etc.,

original: icceva saṅkhyaṃ gatā, tasmā bhagavato orasaputtabhāvoyeva tesaṃ vattabboti, etena
analyzed: iccā iva saṅkhyam gatā tasmā bhagavato etena
translated: Therefore it is the Blessed One’s bosom sonship that should be mentioned in this context.

original: catubbidhesu puttesu ariyasaṅghassa attajaputtabhāvaṃ dasseti. Attano kulaṃ punenti🔽sodhenti, mātāpitūnaṃ vā hadayaṃ pūrentīti puttā, attajādayo. Ariyā pana dhammatantivisodhanena,
analyzed: catubbidhesu puttesu ariya saṅghassa atta ja putta bhāvam dasseti attanaḥ kulam punenti  sodhenti mātā pitūnam vā hadayam pūrenti iti puttāḥ atta ja ādayaḥ ariyā pana dhamma tanti visodhanena
translated: Sons are so called because they purify their own families,🔽because they cleanse their parents’ hearts, and because they are begotten by themselves.

original: dhammānudhammapaṭipattiyā cittārādhanena ca tappaṭibhāgatāya bhagavato puttā nāma,
analyzed: dhamma anudhamma paṭipattiyā citta ārādhanena ca tad paṭibhāga tāya bhagavato puttāḥ nāma
translated: But the noble ones are the Master’s sons because they are his likeness by reason of the purification of their character and by reason of their pleasing him with their practice of the way in conformity with the Dhamma.

original: tesaṃ. Tassa “samūha”nti padena sambandho.
analyzed: tesam tassa samūhanti padena sambandhaḥ
translated: The word “group” is related to them.

original: Saṃkilesanimittaṃ hutvā guṇaṃ māreti vibādhatīti māro, devaputtamāro. Sināti pare
analyzed: saṃkilesa nimittam hutvā guṇam māreti vibādhati iti māraḥ deva putta māraḥ sināti pare
translated: The Evil One is so called because he kills and destroys the special qualities by becoming the cause of defilement. The Evil One is a god, a son of a god.

original: bandhati etāyāti senā, mārassa senā tathā, mārañca mārasenañca mathenti vilothentīti🔽mārasenamathanā, tesaṃ. “Māramārasenamathanāna”nti hi vattabbepi ekadesasarūpekasesavasena
analyzed: bandhati senā mārassa senā tathā māram ca māra senañca mathenti vilothenti iti  mārasena mathanā tesam māra māra sena mathanānam ti hi vattabbe pi ekadesa sarūpa ikasesa vasena
translated: An army is so called because it binds and ties others. The Evil One’s army is so called because it is like that. They crush and destroy the Evil One and the Evil One’s army.🔽They are so called because they crush the Evil One’s army.🔽Although it should be said “the Evil One, the Evil One’s army, and the crushing of the Evil One’s army,”

original: evaṃ vuttaṃ. Mārasaddasannidhānena vā senāsaddena mārasenā gahetabbā, gāthābandhavasena
analyzed: evam vuttam māra sadda sannidhānena vā senā saddena māra senā gahetabbā gāthābandha vasena
translated: it is said in this way by the omission of a part that is indicated by the word “Evil One.” Or the Evil One’s army should be understood as the army of the Evil One by the word “army” in proximity to the word “Evil One.”

original: cettha rasso. “Mārasenamaddanāna”ntipi katthaci pāṭho, so ayuttova ariyājātikattā🔽imissā gāthāya. Nanu ca ariyasāvakānaṃ maggādhigamasamaye bhagavato viya tadantarāyakaraṇatthaṃ
analyzed: ca ittha rassaḥ katthaci pāṭhaḥ saḥ ayuttaḥ iva ariyā jātikattā  imissā gāthāya nanu ca ariya sāvakānam magga adhigama samaye bhagavataḥ viya tad antarāya karaṇa attham
translated: Here the reading is rassa. In some places the reading is “Mārasenamaddanāna” . That is inappropriate, because of the noble birth of this stanza.🔽But do not the noble disciples, at the time of attaining the path, dispel the devaputta māra and the māra-senā, just as the Exalted One did, in order to prevent them from creating obstacles?

original: devaputtamāro vā mārasenā vā na apasādeti, atha kasmā evaṃ vuttanti? Apasādetabbabhāvakāraṇassa
analyzed: deva putta māraḥ vā māra senā vā na apasādeti atha kasmai evam vuttam ti apasādetabba bhāva kāraṇassa
translated: If so, why is it said in this way? Because of the confusion of the reason for being dispelled.

original: vimathitattā. Tesañhi apasādetabbatāya kāraṇe saṃkilese vimathite tepi vimathitā
analyzed: vimathita ttā tesañhi apasādetabba tāya kāraṇe saṃkilese vimathite te api vimathitā
translated: For, when the reason for being dispelled is confused, the defilements are confused, and they are called confused.

original: nāma hontīti. Atha vā khandhābhisaṅkhāramārānaṃ viya devaputtamārassāpi guṇamāraṇe
analyzed: nāma honti iti atha vā khandha abhisaṅkhāra mārānam viya devaputta mārassa api guṇa māraṇe
translated: Or else, just as the khandhas, the abhisankhāra, and the mārā are called “the army of māra” because of the going forth as friends in the killing of the devaputta māra’s qualities,

original: sahāyabhāvūpagamanato kilesabalakāyo idha “mārasenā”ti vuccati yathāha bhagavā –
analyzed: sahāya bhāva upagamanato kilesa balakāyo idha māra senā ati vuccati yathā āha bhagavā
translated: so the army of the defilements is called “the māra-senā” here, as the Exalted One said:

original: “Kāmā te paṭhamā senā, dutiyā arati vuccati;
analyzed: kāmā te paṭhamā senā dutiyā arati vuccati
translated: “The first army of yours is desire, the second is called discontent;

original: Tatiyā khuppipāsā te, catutthī taṇhā pavuccati.
analyzed: tatiyā khuppipāsā te catutthī taṇhā pavuccati
translated: The third is your hunger and thirst, the fourth is called craving.

original: Pañcamaṃ thinamiddhaṃ te, chaṭṭhā bhīrū pavuccati;
analyzed: pañcamam thinamiddham te chaṭṭhā bhīrū pavuccati
translated: The fifth is your sloth and torpor, the sixth is called fear;

original: Sattamī vicikicchā te, makkho thambho te aṭṭhamo.🔽Lābho siloko sakkāro,
analyzed: sattamī vicikicchā te makkhaḥ thambhaḥ te aṭṭhamaḥ  lābhaḥ silokaḥ sakkāro
translated: The seventh is doubt, the eighth is stinginess and conceit.🔽Gain, fame, and honor,

original: Micchāladdho ca yo yaso;
analyzed: micchā laddhaḥ ca yaḥ yaso
translated: And the glory that comes from wrong-doing,

original: Yo cattānaṃ samukkaṃse,
analyzed: yaḥ cattānam samukkaṃse
translated: And the one who exalts himself

original: Pare ca avajānati.
analyzed: pare ca avajānati
translated: And despises others,🔽This is your army, Namuci,

original: Esā namuci te senā, kaṇhassābhippahārinī;
analyzed: esā namuci te senā kaṇhassa abhippahārinī
translated: Which leads to the destruction of the black one.🔽The one without power does not conquer it,

original: Na naṃ asūro jināti, jetvā ca labhate sukha”nti. ;
analyzed: na nam asūraḥ jināti jetvā ca labhate sukhanti
translated: And having conquered, one attains happiness.

original: Sā ca tehi ariyasāvakehi diyaḍḍhasahassabhedā, anantabhedā vā kilesavāhinī satidhammavicayavīriyasamathādiguṇapaharaṇīhi
analyzed: sā ca tehi ariya sāvakehi diyaḍḍha sahassa bhedā ananta bhedā vā kilesa vāhinī sati dhamma vicaya vīriya samatha ādi guṇa paharaṇīhi
translated: And that army of defilements, which is divided into 1,500 or innumerable divisions, which carries off the qualities of mindfulness, truth, investigation, energy, concentration, etc.,

original: odhiso mathitā, viddhaṃsitā, vihatā ca, tasmā “mārasenamathanā”ti vuccanti. Vilothanañcettha🔽viddhaṃsanaṃ, vihananaṃ vā. Apica khandhābhisaṅkhāramaccudevaputtamārānaṃ tesaṃ sahāyabhāvūpagamanatāya
analyzed: mathitā viddhaṃsitā vihatā ca tasmā mārasenamathanā ati vuccanti vilothanam ca ittha  viddhaṃsanam vihananam vā apica khandha abhisaṅkhāra maccudevaputta mārānam tesam sahāya bhāva upagamana tāya
translated: is crushed, destroyed, and annihilated by those Noble Disciples. Therefore they are called “crushers of Māra’s army.”🔽Here the crushing is the destroying and annihilating.

original: senāsaṅkhātassa kilesamārassa ca mathanato “mārasenamathanā”tipi attho gahetabbo.
analyzed: senā saṅkhātassa kilesa mārassa ca mathanataḥ atthaḥ gahetabbo
translated: Moreover, the meaning can be taken as “crushers of Māra’s army” because they crush the defilements called “Māra’s army” by their going over to the side of the aggregates, the kamma-formations, death, the devaputtamāra, and their friends.

original: Evañca sati pañcamāranimmathanabhāvena attho paripuṇṇo hoti. Ariyasāvakāpi hi samudayappahānapariññāvasena
analyzed: evam ca sati pañca māra nimmathana bhāvena atthaḥ paripuṇṇaḥ hoti ariya sāvakāḥ api hi samudaya ppahāna pariññā vasena
translated: For the noble disciples tame the Māra of the mental-data element by the full understanding of abandoning of origin,

original: khandhamāraṃ, sahāyavekallakaraṇena sabbathā, appavattikaraṇena ca abhisaṅkhāramāraṃ,🔽balavidhamanavisayātikkamanavasena maccumāraṃ, devaputtamārañca samucchedappahānavasena
analyzed: khandha māram sahāya vekalla karaṇena sabbathā appavatti karaṇena ca abhisaṅkhāra māram  bala vidhamana visaya atikkamana vasena maccu māram devaputta māram ca samuccheda ppahāna vasena
translated: the Māra of formations by the removal of his companion, and the Māra of death by preventing his occurrence in every way,

original: sabbaso appavattikaraṇena kilesamāraṃ mathentīti, iminā pana tesaṃ orasaputtabhāve🔽kāraṇaṃ, tīsu puttesu ca anujātataṃ dasseti. Mārasenamathanatāya hi te bhagavato
analyzed: sabbaso appavatti karaṇena kilesa māram mathenti iti iminā pana tesam orasa putta bhāve  kāraṇam tīsu puttesu ca anujāta tam dasseti mārasena mathana tāya hi te bhagavato
translated: and they tame the Māra of the taints by preventing his occurrence in every way by the abandoning of the taints.🔽This is the reason why they are the sons of the Chief’s chief consort,🔽and it shows that they are born of his breast and of his mouth.

original: orasaputtā, anujātā cāti.
analyzed: orasa puttā anujātā ca ati
translated: For they are the sons of the Blessed One, born of his breast and of his mouth, because they tame the army of Māra.

original: Aṭṭhannanti gaṇanaparicchedo, tenasatipi tesaṃ taṃtaṃbhedena anekasatasahassasaṅkhyābhede
analyzed: gaṇana paricchedaḥ tesam taṃ taṃ bhedena aneka sata sahassa saṅkhyā bhede
translated: “Eight of them” is a numerical determination. Although they are of many hundreds and thousands of kinds according to their different kinds,

original: ariyabhāvakaramaggaphaladhammabhedena imaṃ gaṇanaparicchedaṃ nātivattanti maggaṭṭhaphalaṭṭhabhāvānativattanatoti
analyzed: ariya bhāva kara magga phala dhamma bhedena imam gaṇana paricchedam na ativattanti magga ṭṭha phala ṭṭha bhāva an ativattanato ti
translated: they do not exceed this numerical determination because they do not exceed the state of being path and fruit, which is the state of being the Dhamma that causes the noble qualities to arise.

original: dasseti. Pi-saddo, api-saddo vā padalīḷādinā kāraṇena aṭṭhāne payutto, so “ariyasaṅgha”nti
analyzed: dasseti pi saddaḥ api saddaḥ vā padalīḷā ādinā kāraṇena aṭṭhāne payutto so ariya saṅgha nti
translated: The word pi or api is used in the sense of “in a place where it does not belong” , and it should be construed here as follows: “The ariyan Saṅgha.”

original: ettha yojetabbo, tena na kevalaṃ buddhadhammeyeva, atha kho ariyasaṅghampīti sampiṇḍeti.
analyzed: ettha yojetabbo tena na kevalam atha kho ariya saṅgham pi iti sampiṇḍeti
translated: Thus he combines the ariyan Saṅgha with the Buddha’s True Idea and Discipline.🔽Although there is no such thing as a combination apart from the components,

original: Yadipi avayavavinimutto samudāyo nāma koci natthi avayavaṃ upādāya samudāyassa vattabbattā,🔽aviññāyamānasamudāyaṃ pana viññāyamānasamudāyena visesitumarahatīti āha “aṭṭhannampi
analyzed: yadi pi avayava vinimuttaḥ samudāyaḥ nāma koci na atthi avayavam upādāya samudāyassa vattabba ttā  a viññāyamāna samudāyam pana viññāyamāna samudāyena visesitum arahati iti āha aṭṭhannam pi
translated: nevertheless, since it is necessary to speak of the combination by means of the components,🔽he says “the combination of the eight” ,

original: samūha”nti, etena “ariyasaṅgha”nti ettha na yena kenaci saṇṭhānādinā, kāyasāmaggiyā
analyzed: samūhanti etena ettha na yena kenaci saṇṭhāna ādinā kāya sāmaggiyā
translated: in order to distinguish the combination that is not recognized from the combination that is recognized. By this he distinguishes the combination as being not by any such means as shape, etc., or by a combination of bodies,🔽but by the fact that it consists of those in the path and those in fruition.

original: vā samudāyabhāvo, api tu maggaṭṭhaphalaṭṭhabhāvenevāti viseseti. Avayavameva sampiṇḍetvā
analyzed: vā samudāya bhāvaḥ api tu magga ṭṭha phala ṭṭha bhāvena iva ati visesa iti avayavam eva sampiṇḍetvā
translated: The combination is that which can be spoken of as a combination by combining the components together,

original: ūhitabbo vitakketabbo, saṃūhanitabbo vā saṅghaṭitabboti samūho, soyeva samoho vacanasiliṭṭhatādinā.
analyzed: ūhitabbaḥ vitakketabbaḥ saṃūhanitabbaḥ vā saṅghaṭitabbaḥ iti samūhaḥ saḥ yā iva samohaḥ vacana siliṭṭha tā ādinā
translated: which can be thought about and which can be combined and brought together. That same combination is a combination in the sense of the way of speaking, etc.

original: Dvidhāpi hi pāṭho yujjati. Ārakattā kilesehi, anaye na iriyanato, aye ca iriyanato
analyzed: dvidhā api hi pāṭhaḥ yujjati kilesehi anaye na aye ca
translated: Because of being far from defilements, because of not proceeding in the wrong way, and because of proceeding in the right way,

original: ariyā niruttinayena. Atha vā sadevakena lokena saraṇanti araṇīyato upagantabbato,
analyzed: ariyāḥ nirutti nayena atha vā sa devakena lokena araṇīyataḥ upagantabbataḥ
translated: the noble ones are noble by the method of verbal expression. Or alternatively, the noble ones are so called because they are sought by the world with its deities, because they are to be approached, and because the purpose of those who have approached is accomplished,

original: upagatānañca tadatthasiddhito ariyā, diṭṭhisīlasāmaññena saṃhato, samaggaṃ vā kammaṃ
analyzed: upagatānam ca tad attha siddhitaḥ ariyāḥ diṭṭhi sīla sāmaññena saṃhataḥ samaggam vā kammaṃ
translated: and they are a community because they are united by the unity of view and morality, or because they are approached as a collection,

original: samudāyavasena samupagatoti saṅgho, ariyānaṃ saṅgho, ariyo ca so saṅgho ca yathāvuttanayenāti
analyzed: samudāya vasena samupagataḥ ti saṅghaḥ ariyānam saṅgho ariyaḥ ca saḥ saṅgho ca yathā vutta nayena ati
translated: as a united action. The community of noble ones is the community of the noble ones, and it is noble and a community in the way already stated.🔽Or alternatively, the community of noble ones is the community of the noble ones.

original: vā ariyasaṅgho, taṃ ariyasaṅghaṃ. Bhagavato aparabhāge buddhadhammaratanānampi samadhigamo
analyzed: vā ariya saṅghaḥ tam ariya saṅgham bhagavataḥ apara bhāge buddha dhamma ratanānam pi samadhigamaḥ
translated: The discovery of the Buddha and the True Idea, which come next to the Blessed One,

original: saṅgharatanādhīnoti ariyasaṅghassa bahūpakārataṃ dassetuṃ idheva “sirasā vande”ti
analyzed: saṅgha ratana adhīnaḥ ti ariya saṅghassa bahu upakāra tam dassetum idha iva sirasā vandeti
translated: is dependent on the Community Jewel. In order to show the great helpfulness of the Community Jewel, it is said here, “I honour with my head,”

original: vuttaṃ. Avassañcāyamattho sampaṭicchitabbo vinayaṭṭhakathādīsupi tathā vuttattā.
analyzed: vuttam avassan ca ayam atthaḥ sampaṭicchitabbaḥ vinaya aṭṭhakathā ādīsu pi tathā vutta ttā
translated: and this meaning should be accepted as well-spoken because it is so stated in the Vinaya Commentary, etc., too.

original: Keci pana purimagāthāsupi taṃ padamānetvā yojenti, tadayuttameva ratanattayassa asādhāraṇaguṇappakāsanaṭṭhānattā,
analyzed: keci pana purima gāthāsu pi tam padam ānetvā yojenti tat ayuttam eva rata nattayassa asādhāraṇa guṇa ppakāsana ṭṭhāna ttā
translated: But some people apply that expression to the first two verses as well. That is inappropriate, since they are the place for showing the special qualities of the Triple Gem,

original: yathāvuttakāraṇassa ca sabbesampi saṃvaṇṇanākārānamadhippetattāti.
analyzed: yathā vutta kāraṇassa ca sabbesam pi saṃvaṇṇanā kārānam adhippeta ttā ti
translated: and since the method of exposition stated is intended for all three verses.

original: Imāya pana gāthāya ariyasaṅghassa pabhavasampadā pahānasampadādayo aneke guṇā dassitā
analyzed: imāya pana gāthāya ariya saṅghassa pabhava sampadā pahāna sampad ādayaḥ aneke guṇāḥ dassitā
translated: But in this verse many special qualities of the ariyan order are shown, such as the excellence of its origin, the excellence of its abandonment, and so on.

original: honti. Kathaṃ? “Sugatassa orasānaṃ puttāna”nti hi etena ariyasaṅghassa pabhavasampadaṃ
analyzed: honti katham sugatassa orasānam puttānam ti hi etena ariya saṅghassa pabhava sampadam
translated: How? By the words “sons of the Good Leader” he shows the excellence of its origin,

original: dasseti sammāsambuddhapabhavatādīpanato. “Mārasenamathanāna”nti etena pahānasampadaṃ
analyzed: dassa iti sammāsambuddha pabhava tā dīpanataḥ etena pahāna sampadam
translated: since it is shown that the ariyan order has the Perfect One for its origin. By the words “crushers of Mara’s army” he shows the excellence of its abandonment,

original: sakalasaṃkilesappahānadīpanato. “Aṭṭhannampi samūha”nti etena ñāṇasampadaṃ maggaṭṭhaphalaṭṭhabhāvadīpanato.
analyzed: sakala saṃkilesa pahāna dīpanataḥ aṭṭhannam pi samūhanti etena ñāṇa sampadam magga ṭṭha phala ṭṭha bhāva dīpanataḥ
translated: since it is shown that it has abandoned all defilements. By the words “the eightfold group” he shows the excellence of its knowledge, since it is shown that it consists of those who stand on the path and its fruition.

original: “Ariyasaṅgha”nti etena sabhāvasampadaṃ sabbasaṅghānaṃ aggabhāvadīpanato. Atha vā
analyzed: ariya saṅghanti etena sabhāva sampadam sabba saṅghānam agga bhāva dīpanataḥ atha vā
translated: By the words “the ariyan order” he shows the excellence of its nature, since it is shown that it is the best of all orders. Or else,

original: “sugatassa orasānaṃ puttāna”nti ariyasaṅghassa visuddhanissayabhāvadīpanaṃ. “Mārasenamathanāna”nti
analyzed: sugatassa orasānam puttānan ti ariya saṅghassa visuddha nissaya bhāva dīpanam māra sena mathanānam ti
translated: “Sons of the Sugata’s own mouth” : this shows the purity of the support of the Noble Sangha. “Conquerors of Mara’s army” :

original: sammāujuñāyasāmīcipaṭipannabhāvadīpanaṃ. “Aṭṭhannampi samūha”nti āhuneyyādibhāvadīpanaṃ.
analyzed: sammā ujuñāya sāmīci paṭipanna bhāva dīpanam samūhanti āhuneyya ādi bhāva dīpanam
translated: this shows the possession of right aspiration and right practice. “The eight assemblies” : this shows the state of being worthy of gifts, etc.

original: “Ariyasaṅgha”nti anuttarapuññakkhettabhāvadīpanaṃ. Tathā “sugatassa orasānaṃ puttāna”nti
analyzed: ariya saṅgha nti anuttara puññakkhetta bhāva dīpanam tathā sugatassa orasānam puttānam ti
translated: “The Noble Sangha” : this shows the state of being a supreme field of merit. Likewise, “sons of the Sugata’s own mouth”

original: etena ariyasaṅghassa lokuttarasaraṇagamanasabbhāvaṃ dasseti.
