original: viyāti ettha chandā āgamanaṃ viyāti padacchedo. Chandāti ca hetumhi nissakkavacanaṃ,
analyzed: viyā ti ettha chandāḥ āgamanam viyā ti padacchedo chandā ati ca hetumhi nissakka vacanam
translated: The analysis of the compound “chandāgamanaṃ viya” is “chandā āgamanaṃ viya” . And “chandā” is a locative of cause.

original: chandena āgamanaṃ pavattanaṃ viyāti attho, chandena akattabbakaraṇamivāti vuttaṃ🔽hoti, chandaṃ vā āgacchati sampayogavasenāti chandāgamanaṃ, tathā pavatto apāyagamanīyo
analyzed: chandena āgamanam pavattanam viya ati atthaḥ chandena a kattabba karaṇam iva ati vuttam  hoti chandam vā āgacchati sampayoga vasena ati chanda āgamanam tathā pavattaḥ apāya gamanīyaḥ
translated: What is meant is: “as if he were to go by liking, as if he were to do what should not be done by liking.”🔽Or alternatively, the meaning can be regarded as follows: “going” is going in an improper way; “going by liking” is going by liking, by affection, in an improper way.

original: akusalacittuppādo. Atha vā ananurūpaṃ gamanaṃ agamanaṃ. Chandena agamanaṃ chandāgamanaṃ,
analyzed: akusala cittuppādaḥ atha vā ananurūpam gamanam agamanam chandena agamanam chanda āgamanam
translated: Or “going” is non-going, i.e., not going in the proper way. “Going by liking” is non-going by liking.

original: chandena sinehena ananurūpaṃ gamanaṃ pavattanaṃ viya akattabbakaraṇaṃ viyāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: chandena sinehena ananurūpam gamanam pavattanam viya akattabba karaṇam viya iti vuttam
translated: What is meant is: “as if he were to go by liking, as if he were to do what should not be done by liking.”

original: hoti. Asekkhabhūtā paṭisambhidā, taṃpattāti tathā, asekkhā ca te paṭisambhidāppattā
analyzed: hoti asekkha bhūtā paṭisambhidā taṃ pattā ati tathā asekkhā ca te paṭisambhidā appattā
translated: The “analytical knowledges” are the four analytical knowledges of a trainer. “He has attained” : he has attained them in this way, i.e., as a trainer.

original: cāti vā tathā, tādise. Sekkhapaṭisambhidāppattanti etthāpi esa nayo. Parivajjentoti
analyzed: ca ati vā tathā tādise ettha api esa nayo
translated: Or alternatively, he has attained them in this way, i.e., as a trainer and as one who has attained the analytical knowledges.🔽“He avoids” : the word “because” has the sense of a reason. The meaning is: “because of the reason for avoiding.”

original: hetvatthe antasaddo, parivajjanahetūti attho. Anumatiyāti anuññāya, yācanāyāti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: hetu atthe anta saddo parivajjana hetū ti atthaḥ anumatiyā ati anuññāya yācanāya ati vuttam hoti
translated: “With approval” : with permission; what is meant is: with a request.

original: “Kiñcāpi sekkho”ti idaṃ asekkhānaṃyeva uccinitattā vuttaṃ, na sekkhānaṃ agatigamanasambhavena.
analyzed: kiñca api sekkha iti idam asekkhānam yeva vuttam na sekkhānam agati gamana sambhavena
translated: “Although he is a trainer” : this is said because only the adepts are excluded, not because the trainers are capable of going in the wrong way.

original: Paṭhamamaggeneva hi cattāri agatigamanāni pahīyanti, tasmā kiñcāpi sekkho, tathāpi🔽thero āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ uccinatūti sambandho. Na pana kiñcāpi sekkho, tathāpi abhabbo
analyzed: paṭhama maggena iva hi cattāri agati gamanāni pahīyanti tasmā kiñcā api sekkhaḥ tathā api  theraḥ āyasmantam ānandam uccinatu iti sambandhaḥ na pana kiñcā api sekkho tathā api abhabbo
translated: For the four kinds of wrong practice are abandoned by the first path only. Therefore, although he is a learner,

original: agatiṃ gantunti. “Abhabbo”tiādinā pana dhammasaṅgītiyā tassa arahabhāvaṃ dassento🔽vijjamānaguṇe katheti, tena saṅgītiyā dhammavinayavinicchaye sampatte chandādivasena
analyzed: agatim gantunti abhabbā ti ādinā pana dhammasaṅgītiyā tassa araha bhāvam dassento  vijjamāna guṇe kathā iti tena saṅgītiyā dhamma vinaya vinicchaye sampatte chanda ādi vasena
translated: the elder should choose the venerable Ananda. The construction is not, however, “although he is a learner, he is incapable of wrong practice.” But by the words “incapable” and so on, he shows that he is an Arahant by the recitation of the Dhamma.

original: aññathā akathetvā yathābhūtameva kathessatīti dasseti. Na gantabbā, ananurūpā vā
analyzed: aññathā a kathetvā yathābhūtam eva kathessati iti dasseti na gantabbā ananurūpā vā
translated: He speaks of his existing special qualities. He shows that when the recitation of the Dhamma and Discipline is completed, he will speak truly without distorting the meaning through desire and so on.🔽“Wrong practice” is a wrong course, a course that is unsuitable.

original: gatīti agati, taṃ. Pariyattoti adhigato uggahito.
analyzed: gatīti agati tam pariyattaḥ ti adhigataḥ uggahitaḥ
translated: “He has mastered” : he has attained and he has memorized.

original: “Eva”ntiādinā sanniṭṭhānagaṇanaṃ dasseti. Uccinitenāti uccinitvā gahitena. Apica evaṃ…pe… uccinīti nigamanaṃ, “tenāyasmatā”tiādi pana sanniṭṭhānagaṇanadassanantipi vadanti.
analyzed: evam ti ādinā sanniṭṭhāna gaṇanam dasseti uccinitena ati uccinitvā gahitena apica evam pe uccini iti nigamanam tena ayasmatā atiādi pana sanniṭṭhāna gaṇana dassanam ti pi vadanti
translated: By the words “thus” and so on, he shows the counting of the resolution. “He should choose” : he should choose by selecting. Furthermore, they say that the words “thus” and so on are the conclusion, and that the words “therefore by the venerable” and so on show the counting of the resolution.

original: Evaṃ saṅgāyakavicinanappakāraṃ dassetvā aññampi saṅgāyanatthaṃ desavicinanādippakāraṃ🔽dassento “atha kho”tiādimāha. Tattha etadahosīti etaṃ parivitakkanaṃ ahosi. Nu-saddena
analyzed: evam saṅgāyaka vicinana ppakāram dassetvā aññam pi saṅgāyana attham desa vicinana ādi ppakāram  dassentaḥ atha kha iti ādim āha tattha etat ahosi iti etam parivitakkanam ahosi nu saddena
translated: Having thus shown the kind of discussion that took place, he now said “Then it occurred to him” in order to show the kind of discussion that took place for the purpose of the recitation, etc., beginning with the discussion of the country.🔽Herein, this consideration occurred to him: by means of the word “now” he shows the consideration.

original: hi parivitakkanaṃ dasseti. Rājagahanti “rājagahasāmantaṃ gahetvā vutta”nti gaṇṭhipadesu🔽vadanti. Gāvo caranti etthāti gocaro, gunnaṃ caraṇaṭṭhānaṃ, so viyāti gocaro, bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: hi parivitakkanam dasseti rāja gahan ti rāja gaha sāmantam gahetvā vuttan ti gaṇṭhi padesu  vadanti gāvaḥ caranti ettha ati gocaraḥ gunnam caraṇa ṭhānam so viya ati gocaraḥ bhikkhūnam
translated: Rājagaha: it is said in the basic text that it is spoken of as “surrounding Rājagaha.”

original: caraṇaṭṭhānaṃ, mahanto so assa, etthāti vā mahāgocaraṃ. Aṭṭhārasannaṃ mahāvihārānampi
analyzed: caraṇa ṭṭhānam mahanto so assa ettha ati vā mahā gocaram aṭṭhāra sannam
translated: The place where cows graze is a grazing ground; it is a grazing ground for bulls, thus it is a great grazing ground.

original: atthitāya pahūtasenāsanaṃ.
analyzed: atthitāya pahūta senāsanam
translated: It is a place where there are eighteen great monasteries.🔽It has many resting places because of the existence of the eighteen great monasteries.

original: Thāvarakammanti ciraṭṭhāyikammaṃ. Visabhāgapuggalo subhaddasadiso. Ukkoṭeyyāti nivāreyya.
analyzed: thāvara kammanti ciraṭṭhāyi kammam visabhāga puggalaḥ subhadda sadisaḥ ukkoṭeyya ati nivāreyya
translated: A lasting undertaking: a long-lasting undertaking. A person of the opposite sex: like Subhadda. He would drive out: he would prevent .

original: Iti-saddo idamatthe, iminā manasikārena hetubhūtena etadahosīti attho. Garubhāvajananatthaṃ
analyzed: iti saddaḥ idam atthe iminā manasikārena hetu bhūtena etat ahosi iti atthaḥ garu bhāva janana attham
translated: The word iti has the meaning of idam. The meaning is: this consideration occurred to him by means of this consideration which was the cause, for the purpose of generating heaviness .

original: ñattidutiyena kammena saṅghaṃ sāvesi, na apalokanañattikammamattenāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: ñatti dutiyena kammena saṅgham sāvesi na apalokana ñatti kamma mattena ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that he informed the Sangha by means of a transaction consisting of a motion and a single proclamation, not by means of a transaction consisting of a motion and three proclamations.

original: Kadā panāyaṃ katāti āha “ayaṃ panā”tiādi. Evaṃ katabhāvo ca imāya gaṇanāya viññāyatīti
analyzed: kadā pana ayam katā iti āha ayam pana atiādi evam kata bhāvo ca imāya gaṇanāya viññāyati iti
translated: But when was this done? He said “This” , etc. And the fact that it was done in this way is known by means of this reckoning.

original: dasseti “bhagavā hī”tiādinā. Athāti anantaratthe nipāto, parinibbānantaramevāti attho.
analyzed: dasseti bhagavā hi itiādinā atha ati anantara atthe nipātaḥ parinibbā anantaram eva iti atthaḥ
translated: He shows this with the words “For the Blessed One” , etc. The word “then” is a particle denoting immediate succession; the meaning is “immediately after his final attainment of Nibbāna.”

original: Sattāhanti hi parinibbānadivasampi saṅgaṇhitvā vuttaṃ. Assāti bhagavato, “sarīra”nti
analyzed: satta aham ti hi parinibbāna divasam pi saṅgaṇhitvā vuttam assa ati bhagavato sarīram ti
translated: For the word “seven days” includes the day of the final attainment of Nibbāna. The word “his” refers to the Blessed One. The word “body” is related to the word “his.”

original: iminā sambandho. Saṃvegavatthuṃ kittetvā kittetvā aniccatāpaṭisaññuttāni gītāni gāyitvā🔽pūjāvasena kīḷanato sundaraṃ kīḷanadivasā sādhukīḷanadivasā nāma, saparahitasādhanaṭṭhena
analyzed: iminā sambandhaḥ saṃvega vatthum kittetvā kittetvā anicca tā paṭisaññuttāni gītāni gāyitvā  pūjā vasena kīḷanato sundaram kīḷana divasā sādhukīḷanadivasā nāma
translated: After reciting the reasons for his arousal of energy, and after singing the songs of the perception of impermanence,🔽he played the game of worship. The day on which he played the game well is called the day of the good play.

original: vā sādhūti vuttānaṃ sappurisānaṃ saṃvegavatthuṃ kittetvā kittetvā kīḷanadivasātipi
analyzed: vā sādhu uti vuttānam sappurisānam saṃvega vatthum kittetvā kittetvā
translated: Or alternatively, the word “good” is said of good men who are benefactors of others; the day on which he played the game after reciting the reasons for their arousal of energy is called the day of the good play.

original: yujjati. Imasmiñca purimasattāhe ekadeseneva sādhukīḷanamakaṃsu. Visesato pana dhātupūjādivasesuyeva.
analyzed: yujjati imasmin ca purima sattāhe eka desena iva visesataḥ pana
translated: and it is appropriate. And in this and the previous seven days they played well in one part only. But especially on the days of the enshrining of the relics and so on.

original: Tathā hi vuttaṃ mahāparinibbānasuttaṭṭhakathāyaṃ –
analyzed: tathā hi vuttam mahāparinibbāna sutta ṭṭhakathāyam
translated: For this is said in the Mahāparinibbāna Sutta Commentary:

original: “Ito purimesu hi dvīsu sattāhesu te bhikkhū saṅghassa ṭhānanisajjokāsaṃ karontā khādanīyaṃ🔽bhojanīyaṃ saṃvidahantā sādhukīḷikāya okāsaṃ na labhiṃsu, tato nesaṃ ahosi ‘imaṃ
analyzed: itas purimesu hi dvīsu sattāhesu te bhikkhū saṅghassa ṭhāna nisajja ukāsam karontā khādanīyam  bhojanīyam saṃvidahantā sādhukīḍikāya okāsam na labhiṃsu tatas imam
translated: “For in the first two seven-day periods the bhikkhus were making a place for the Community to sit down and lie down and were preparing fresh and cooked food,

original: sattāhaṃ sādhukīḷitaṃ kīḷissāma, ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ vijjati, yaṃ amhākaṃ pamattabhāvaṃ
analyzed: satta aham sādhu kīḷitam kīḷissāma ṭhānam kho pana itam vijjati yam amhākam pamatta bhāvam
translated: and so they had no opportunity to play well. Then they thought, ‘We shall play well in this seven-day period. But it is possible that someone might come and take the relics while we are negligent,

original: ñatvā kocideva āgantvā dhātuyo gaṇheyya, tasmā ārakkhaṃ ṭhapetvā kīḷissāmā’ti, tena te evamakaṃsū”ti.
analyzed: ñatvā kocid eva āgantvā dhātuyaḥ gaṇheyya tasmai ārakkham ṭhapetvā kīḷissāma ati tena te evam akaṃsu iti
translated: so we shall play well after we have set a guard.’ That is why they did so.”

original: Tathāpi te dhātupūjāyapi katattā dhātupūjādivasā nāma. Imeyeva visesena bhagavati
analyzed: tathā api te visesena bhagavati
translated: And because they also played well on the days of the enshrining of the relics, they are called “days of the enshrining of the relics and so on.”🔽And because there was nothing else to be done for the Blessed One in particular,

original: kattabbassa aññassa abhāvato ekadesena katampi sādhukīḷanaṃ upādāya “sādhukīḷanadivasā”ti
analyzed: kattabbassa aññassa abhāvataḥ ekadesena katam pi sādhu kīḷanam upādāya sādhu kīḷana divasā ti
translated: the playing well in one part only was called “days of playing well”

original: pākaṭā jātāti āha “evaṃ sattāhaṃ sādhukīḷanadivasā nāma ahesu”nti.🔽Citakāyāti vīsasataratanuccāya candanadārucitakāya, padhānakiccavaseneva ca sattāhaṃ
analyzed: pākaṭā jātā iti āha evam sattāham sādhu kīḷana divasāḥ nāma ahesunti  citakāya ati candana dāru citakāya padhāna kicca vasena iva ca satta aham
translated: “They played well for seven days” means that they played well for seven days.🔽“On the funeral pyre” means on the funeral pyre of sandalwood logs, which was a hundred cubits high. For seven days they kept the funeral pyre burning with the funeral rites.

original: citakāyaṃ agginā jhāyīti vuttaṃ. Na hi accantasaṃyogavasena nirantaraṃ sattāhameva
analyzed: cita kāyam agginā jhāyi iti vuttam na hi accanta saṃyoga vasena nirantaram satta aham eva
translated: For it is not the case that the funeral pyre burned continuously for seven days without interruption by the power of the fire alone.

original: agginā jhāyi tattha pacchimadivaseyeva jhāyitattā, tasmā sattāhasminti attho veditabbo.
analyzed: agginā jhāyi tattha pacchima divaseya iva jhāyi tattā tasmā satta ahasmin ti atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: For it burned only on the last day. Therefore the meaning should be understood as “for seven days.”

original: Purimapacchimānañhi dvinnaṃ sattāhānamantare sattāhe yattha katthacipi divase jhāyamāne
analyzed: purima pacchimānam hi dvinnam satta ahānam antare satta ahe yattha katthacipi divase jhāyamāne
translated: For if the funeral pyre burned on any day during the seven days between the first and the last of the seven days,

original: sati “sattāhe jhāyī”ti vattuṃ yujjati. Yathāha –
analyzed: sati sattāhe jhāyi iti vattum yujjati yathā āha
translated: it would be proper to say “it burned for seven days.” As it is said:

original: “Tena kho pana samayena cattāro mallapāmokkhā sīsaṃ nhātā ahatāni vatthāni nivatthā ‘mayaṃ bhagavato citakaṃ āḷimpessāmā’ti na sakkonti āḷimpetu”ntiādi.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena cattāraḥ malla pāmokkhāḥ sīsam nhātāḥ ahatāni vatthāni nivatthāḥ mayam bhagavataḥ citakam āḷimpessāma ati na sakkonti āḷimpetum tiādi
translated: “Now on that occasion the four Malla men, having bathed their heads and put on new clothes, said, ‘We will light the Lord’s funeral pyre,’ but they were not able to do so” .

original: Sattipañjaraṃ katvāti sattikhaggādihatthehi purisehi mallarājūnaṃ bhagavato dhātuārakkhakaraṇaṃ
analyzed: satti pañjaram katvā ati satti khagga ādi hatthehi purisehi malla rājūnam bhagavataḥ dhātu ārakkha karaṇam
translated: Having made a cage of spears: having made the kings of the Malla clan the guardians of the Blessed One’s bodily relics by means of men holding spears, swords, etc.

original: upalakkhaṇavasenāha. Sattihatthā purisā hi sattiyo yathā “kuntā pacarantī”ti, tāhi
analyzed: upalakkhaṇa vasena āha satti hatthāḥ purisāḥ hi sattiyaḥ yathā kuntā pacaranti iti tāhi
translated: This is said by way of a simile. For men holding spears are like spears that “run about” .🔽Because they are like a cage in the sense of protecting on all sides, they are a “cage of spears.”

original: samantato rakkhāpanavasena pañjarapaṭibhāgattā sattipañjaraṃ. Sandhāgāraṃ nāma rājūnaṃ🔽ekā mahāsālā. Uyyogakālādīsu hi rājāno tattha ṭhatvā “ettakā purato gacchantu, ettakā
analyzed: samantataḥ rakkhāpana vasena pañjara paṭibhāga ttā satti pañjaram sandhāgāram nāma  ekā mahā sālā uyyoga kāla ādīsu hi rājāno tattha ṭhatvā ettakā puratas gacchantu ettakā
translated: A “council chamber” is a great hall of the kings.

original: pacchato, ettakā ubhohi passehi, ettakā hatthīsu abhiruhantu, ettakā assesu, ettakā
analyzed: pacchatas ettakāḥ ubhohi passehi ettakāḥ hatthīsu abhiruhantu ettakāḥ assesu ettakā
translated: For when the time for council has arrived, the kings stand there and make agreements and set limits, saying: “So many people shall go in front, so many at the back, so many on both sides, so many shall mount the elephants, so many the horses, so many the chariots.”

original: rathesū”ti evaṃ sandhiṃ karonti mariyādaṃ bandhanti, tasmā taṃ ṭhānaṃ “sandhāgāra”nti🔽vuccati. Apica uyyogaṭṭhānato āgantvāpi yāva gehesu allagomayaparibhaṇḍādīni karonti,
analyzed: evam sandhim karonti mariyādam bandhanti tasmai tam ṭhānam  vuccati apica uyyoga ṭṭhānato āgantvā api yāva gehesu alla gomaya paribhaṇḍa ādīni karonti
translated: Therefore that place is called a “council chamber.”

original: tāva dve tīṇi divasāni rājāno tattha santhambhanti vissamanti parissayaṃ vinodentītipi
analyzed: tāva dve tīṇi divasāni rājāno tattha santhambhanti vissamanti parissayam vinodenti iti pi
translated: Moreover, even after coming from the place of council, the kings stand there for two or three days, resting and relaxing, until they have had their houses plastered with fresh cow dung, etc.

original: sandhāgāraṃ, rājūnaṃ vā saha atthānusāsanaṃ agārantipi sandhāgāraṃ ha-kārassa dha-kāraṃ,
analyzed: sandhāgāram rājūnam vā saha sandhāgāram hakārassa dhakāram
translated: Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to discuss” or “to advise.”🔽Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to decide.”🔽Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to store.”🔽The word “sandhāgāra” is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to bring together” or “to assemble.”

original: anusarāgamañca katvā, yasmā vā rājāno tattha sannipatitvā “imasmiṃ kāle kasituṃ vaṭṭati,
analyzed: anusara āgamañca katvā yasmai vā rājāno tattha sannipatitvā imasmin kāle kasitum vaṭṭati
translated: Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to discuss” or “to advise.”

original: imasmiṃ kāle vapitu”nti evamādinā nayena gharāvāsakiccāni sammantayanti, tasmā chinnavicchinnaṃ
analyzed: imasmin kāle evamādinā nayena ghara āvāsa kiccāni sammantayanti tasmāt chinna vicchinnam
translated: Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to decide.”🔽Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to store.”🔽The word “sandhāgāra” is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to bring together” or “to assemble.”

original: gharāvāsaṃ tattha sandhārentītipi sandhāgāraṃ. Visākhapuṇṇamito paṭṭhāya yāva visākhamāsassa
analyzed: ghara āvāsam tattha sandhārenti iti pi sandhāgāram visākhapuṇṇam itas paṭṭhāya yāva visākha māsassa
translated: Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to discuss” or “to advise.”🔽Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to decide.”🔽Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to store.”🔽The word “sandhāgāra” is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to bring together” or “to assemble.”🔽Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to discuss” or “to advise.”🔽Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to decide.”

original: amāvāsī, tāva soḷasa divasā sīhaḷavohāravasena gahitattā, jeṭṭhamūlamāsassa sukkapakkhe
analyzed: amāvāsī tāva soḷasa divasā sīhaḷa vohāra vasena gahita ttā jeṭṭha mūla māsassa sukka pakkhe
translated: Or it is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to store.”

original: ca pañca divasāti āha “iti ekavīsati divasā gatā”ti. Tattha carimadivaseyeva dhātuyo
analyzed: ca pañca divasā iti āha iti ekavīsati divasāḥ gatā ati tattha
translated: The word “sandhāgāra” is derived from the word “sandhā” which means “to bring together” or “to assemble.”

original: bhājayiṃsu, tasmiṃyeva ca divase ayaṃ kammavācā katā. Tena vuttaṃ “jeṭṭhamūlasukkapakkhapañcamiya”ntiādi.

original: kacavaraṃ, milātaṃ vā mālāsaṅkhātaṃ kacavaraṃ tathā. Atiharitvāti paṭhamaṃ ṭhapitaṭṭhānamabhimukhaṃ
analyzed: kaca varam milātam vā mālā saṅkhātam kaca varam tathā atiharitvā ati paṭhamam ṭhapita ṭṭhānam abhimukham
translated: Having taken it away: having taken it away from the place where it was first put,

original: haritvā. Yathāṭhāne ṭhapetvāti paṭhamaṃ ṭhapitaṭṭhānaṃ anatikkamitvā yathāṭhitaṭṭhāneyeva
analyzed: haritvā yathāṭhāne ṭhapetvā iti paṭhamam ṭhapita ṭhānam an atikkamitvā
translated: having put it back in its place: without going beyond the place where it was first put, having put it back in the place where it was first put.

original: ṭhapetvā. Bhagavato ṭhitakāle karaṇīyaṃ vattaṃ sabbamakāsīti senāsane kattabbavattaṃ
analyzed: ṭhapetvā bhagavataḥ ṭhita kāle karaṇīyam vattam sabbam akāsi iti senāsane kattabba vattam
translated: Having done all that is to be done in the Blessed One’s presence: this refers to the duties to be done in the resting place.

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Kurumāno cāti taṃ sabbaṃ vattaṃ karonto ca. Lakkhaṇe hi ayaṃ māna-saddo.
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam kurumāno ca ati tam sabbam vattam karonto ca lakkhaṇe hi ayam māna saddaḥ
translated: Doing all that: doing all those duties. For this word māna is used in the sense of lakṣaṇa .

original: Nhānakoṭṭhakassa sammajjanañca tasmiṃ udakassa upaṭṭhāpanañca, tāni ādīni yesaṃ dhammadesanāovādādīnanti
analyzed: nhāna koṭṭhakassa sammajjanam ca tasmin udakassa upaṭṭhāpanañca tāni ādīni yesam dhamma desanā ovāda ādīnam ti
translated: The cleaning of the bathing shed and the placing of water therein, and so on, are the duties beginning with the teaching of the Dhamma and giving of counsel.

original: tathā, tesaṃ kālesūti attho. Sīhassa migarājassa seyyā sīhaseyyā, taddhitavasena,
analyzed: tathā tesam kālesu iti attho sīhassa miga rājassa seyyā sīha seyyā taddhita vasena
translated: At the time for these: the meaning is, at the time for these duties. The lion’s bed is sīhaseyyā.

original: sadisavohārena vā bhagavato seyyāpi “sīhaseyyā”ti vuccati. Tejussadairiyāpathattā
analyzed: sadisa vohārena vā bhagavato seyyā api sīha seyyā ti vuccati tejuḥ sa dairiyā pathattā
translated: The Blessed One’s bed is called “the lion’s bed” because it is like the lion’s bed, or because it is endowed with the state of being a lion’s bed,

original: uttamaseyyā vā, yaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ
analyzed: uttama seyyā vā yam sandhāya vuttam atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena passena sīha seyyam
translated: or the best bed, in reference to which it is said: “Then the Fortunate One lay down in the lion’s posture on his right side,🔽🔽

original: kappesi pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno”ti, taṃ. Kappanakālo karaṇakālo nanūti yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: kappesi pāde pādam accādhāya sataḥ sampajānoti tam kappana kālaḥ karaṇa kālaḥ nanu iti yojetabbam
translated: or the best kind of bed, which is the one referred to in the passage: “Then the Blessed One, lying down in the lion- posture, on his right side, placing one foot on the other, mindful and clearly comprehending” . The words “the time for lying down, the time for doing” should be construed with each of the above terms.

original: “Yathā ta”ntiādinā yathāvuttamatthaṃ upamāya āvi karoti. Tattha yathā aññopi bhagavato…pe…
analyzed: yathā tanti ādinā upamāya karoti yathā aññaḥ api
translated: “Just as” and so on: by means of the simile he makes clear the meaning stated above. Therein, just as others, too, who were not yet free from lust for the Blessed One’s …

original: patiṭṭhitapemo ceva akhīṇāsavo ca anekesu…pe… upakārasañjanitacittamaddavo ca akāsi,
analyzed: patiṭṭhita pemo ca iva akhīṇa āsavo ca aneka isupe upakāra sañjanita citta maddavo ca akāsi
translated: and who had not yet exhausted the taints, and who had not yet attained the state of mind that is tranquil, unified, and well concentrated, and who had not yet generated the mind of love born of gratitude for the benefits received,

original: evaṃ āyasmāpi ānando bhagavato guṇa…pe… maddavo ca hutvā akāsīti yojanā. Nti nipātamattaṃ.
analyzed: evam āyasmā api ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ guṇape maddavaḥ ca hutvā akāsi iti yojanā nti nipāta mattam
translated: so too, the venerable Ananda, who was not yet free from lust for the Blessed One’s … and who had not yet exhausted the taints, and who had not yet attained the state of mind that is tranquil, unified, and well concentrated, and who had not yet generated the mind of love born of gratitude for the benefits received,🔽acted in the same way. The word “but” is merely a particle.

original: Apica etena tathākaraṇahetuṃ dasseti, yathā aññepi yathāvuttasabhāvā akaṃsu, tathā
analyzed: apica etena tathākaraṇa hetum dasseti yathā aññe pi yathā vutta sabhāvāḥ akaṃsu tathā
translated: Moreover, he shows the reason for acting in that way, just as others of the same nature acted in the way stated above.

original: āyasmāpi ānando bhagavato…pe… patiṭṭhitapemattā ceva akhīṇāsavattā ca anekesu…pe…
analyzed: āyasmā api ānandaḥ bhagavatā upe patiṭṭhita pemattā ca iva akhīṇa āsavattā ca anekesu pe
translated: So too, the venerable Ananda, who was not yet free from lust for the Blessed One’s … and who had not yet exhausted the taints, and who had not yet attained the state of mind that is tranquil, unified, and well concentrated, and who had not yet generated the mind of love born of gratitude for the benefits received,

original: upakārasañjanitacittamaddavattā cāti hetuatthassa labbhamānattā. Hetugabbhāni hi
analyzed: upakāra sañjanita citta maddava tā ca ati hetu atthassa labbhamāna ttā hetu gabbhāni hi
translated: acted in the same way. Since the meaning of reason is applicable,

original: etāni padāni tadatthasseva tathākaraṇahetubhāvato. Dhanapāladamana, suvaṇṇakakkaṭa,🔽cūḷahaṃsa -mahāhaṃsajātakādīhi cettha vibhāvetabbo. Guṇānaṃ gaṇo, soyeva amatanipphādakarasasadisatāya
analyzed: etāni padāni tad atthassa iva tathā karaṇa hetu bhāvataḥ dhanapāla damana suvaṇṇa kakkaṭa  cūḷahaṃsa mahāhaṃsa jātaka ādīhi ca ittha vibhāvetabbaḥ guṇānam gaṇaḥ amata nipphādaka rasa sadisa tāya
translated: These words are the reason why he did it in that way. The Dhanapala-damana, Suvannakakkata,

original: amataraso. Taṃ jānanapakatitāyāti patiṭṭhitapade hetu. Upakāra…pe… maddavoti upakārapubbabhāvena
analyzed: tam jānana pakati tāya ati patiṭṭhita pade hetu upakāra pe maddavo ti upakāra pubba bhāvena

original: sammājanitacittamuduko. Evampi so iminā kāraṇena adhivāsesīti dassento “tamena”ntiādimāha.

translated: In this way, showing that he endured for this reason, he said “tamena.”
