analyzed: sarīra dūsanā dosā malīna karaṇā malā
translated: Foulness is defilement, and dirt is that which soils.

original: Dhāraṇā dhātavo te tu, itthamanvatthasaññakā”ti.🔽Samassāsetunti santappetuṃ. Devatāya saṃvejitadivasato, jetavanavihāraṃ paviṭṭhadivasato
analyzed: dhāraṇāḥ dhātavaḥ te tu ittham anvattha saññakā ati  samassāsetum ti santappetum devatāya saṃvejita divasataḥ jetavana vihāram paviṭṭha divasataḥ
translated: They are called “receptacles” because they contain.🔽“To comfort”: to console. On the second day after the day on which he was inspired by the deity, or on the second day after the day on which he entered Jeta’s Wood,

original: vā dutiyadivase. Viriccati etenāti virecanaṃ, osadhaparibhāvitaṃ khīrameva virecanaṃ
analyzed: vā dutiya divase viriccati etena ati virecanam osadha paribhāvitam khīram eva virecanam
translated: “Purging” is that by which one is purged. Milk mixed with medicine is a purging.🔽“With reference to which”: with reference to which drinking of medicine.

original: tathā. Yaṃ sandhāyāti yaṃ bhesajjapānaṃ sandhāya. Aṅgapaccaṅgena sobhatīti subho,
analyzed: tathā yam sandhāya ati yam bhesajja pānam sandhāya aṅga paccaṅgena sobhati iti subho
translated: “Beautiful by means of its limbs and secondary marks”: subha.

original: manuno apaccaṃ mānavo, na-kārassa pana ṇa-kāre kate māṇavo. Manūti hi paṭhamakappikakāle
analyzed: manuno a paccam mānavaḥ nakārassa pana ṇakāre kate māṇavaḥ hi paṭhama kappika kāle
translated: “A man” is a māṇava. But when the na is changed to ṇa, it is a māṇava. For “man” is the name for a man who held the place of father and mother in the first period of the dispensation,

original: manussānaṃ mātāpituṭṭhāne ṭhito puriso, yo sāsane “mahāsammatarājā”ti vutto. So hi
analyzed: manussānam mātā pitu ṭṭhāne ṭhito purisaḥ yaḥ sāsane mahāsammata rājā ati vutto so hi
translated: and who is called “the Great Elect King” in the Dispensation. He is called “man”

original: sakalalokassa hitaṃ manabhi jānātīti manūti vuccati. Evampettha vadanti “dantaja
analyzed: sakala lokassa hitam jānāti iti vuccati evam pa ittha vadanti
translated: because he knows what is good for the whole world. So they say here: “The word ‘man’ ,

original: na-kārasahito mānavasaddo sabbasattasādhāraṇavacano, muddhaja ṇa-kārasahito pana
analyzed: nakāra sahitaḥ mānava saddaḥ sabba satta sādhāraṇa vacanaḥ ṇakāra sahitaḥ pana
translated: accompanied by the na, is a word common to all beings. But when the na is changed to ṇa,

original: māṇavasaddo kucchitamūḷhāpaccavacano”ti. Cūḷakammavibhaṅgasuttaṭṭhakathāyampi hi
analyzed: māṇava saddaḥ kucchita mūḷhā paccavacanaḥ ti hi
translated: The word māṇava is a term of contempt for fools and idiots.”🔽For in the Commentary on the Cūḷakammavibhaṅga Sutta,

original: muddhaja ṇa-kārasahitasseva māṇavasaddassa attho vaṇṇito. Taṭṭīkāyampi “yaṃ apaccaṃ
analyzed: ṇakāra sahitassa iva māṇava saddassa atthaḥ vaṇṇito tad ṭīkāyam pi yam
translated: the meaning of the word māṇava, which is formed by adding the nominal affix ṇa to the root mud, is given. And in the Subcommentary it is said:

original: kucchitaṃ mūḷhaṃ vā, tattha loke māṇavavohāro, yebhuyyena ca sattā daharakāle mūḷhadhātukā
analyzed: kucchitam mūḷham vā tattha loke māṇava vohāro yebhuyyena ca sattā dahara kāle mūḍha dhātukā
translated: “The word māṇava is a term used in the world for a contemptible fool. And beings are mostly foolish in their early years.

original: hontīti tassevattho pakāsito”ti vadanti ācariyā. Aññattha ca vīsativassabbhantaro
analyzed: honti iti tassa iva attho pakāsito ti vadanti ācariyāḥ aññattha ca vīsati vassa abbhantaro
translated: That is why the word is used.”🔽And elsewhere it is said that one under twenty years of age is a young māṇava,

original: yuvā māṇavo, idha pana tabbohārena mahallakopi. Vuttañhi cūḷakammavibhaṅgasuttavaṇṇanāyaṃ
analyzed: yuvā māṇavaḥ idha pana tad bohārena mahallakaḥ api vuttam hi cūḷakammavibhaṅga sutta vaṇṇanāyam
translated: but here the word is used figuratively for an old man. For it is said in the Commentary on the Cūḷakammavibhaṅga Sutta:

original: “māṇavoti pana taṃ taruṇakāle vohariṃsu, so mahallakakālepi teneva vohārena voharīyatī”ti,🔽subhanāmakena laddhamāṇavavohārenāti attho. So pana “satthā parinibbuto, ānandatthero
analyzed: pana tam taruṇa kāle vohariṃsu saḥ mahallaka kāle pi tena iva vohārena voharīyati iti  subha nāmakena laddha māṇava vohārena ati attho so pana satthā parinibbutaḥ ānanda thero
translated: “They used the word māṇava for him in his youth, and they continued to use it for him even in his old age.”🔽The meaning is that he was called a māṇava by the name Subha.

original: kirassa pattacīvaramādāya āgato, mahājano taṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamatī”ti sutvā “vihāraṃ
analyzed: kirassa patta cīvaram ādāya āgataḥ mahā janaḥ tam dassanāya upasaṅkamati iti sutvā vihāram
translated: Having heard that “the Master has attained final Nibbāna, and the Elder Ānanda has come bringing his bowl and robes, and the multitude is going to see him,” he thought:

original: kho pana gantvā mahājanamajjhe na sakkā sukhena paṭisanthāraṃ vā kātuṃ, dhammakathaṃ🔽vā sotuṃ, gehamāgataṃyeva naṃ disvā sukhena paṭisanthāraṃ karissāmi, ekā ca me kaṅkhā🔽atthi, tampi naṃ pucchissāmī”ti cintetvā ekaṃ māṇavakaṃ pesesi, taṃ sandhāyāha “pahitaṃ
analyzed: kho pana gantvā mahā jana majjhe na sakkā sukhena paṭisanthāram vā kātum dhamma katham  vā sotum geham āgataṃya iva nam disvā sukhena paṭisanthāram karissāmi ekā ca me kaṅkhā  atthi tam pi nam pucchissāmi iti cintetvā ekam māṇavakam pesesi tam sandhāya āha pahitam
translated: and when he has gone, it is not easy to receive him with hospitality or to listen to his preaching of the Law in the midst of the great crowd. When he comes to the house, I will receive him with hospitality. And I have a doubt,🔽I will ask him about it.” And he sent a young brāhman, and said this in reference to him.

original: māṇavaka”nti khuddake cettha kapaccayo. Etadavocāti etaṃ “akālo”tiādikaṃ vacanaṃ ānandatthero avoca.🔽Akāloti ajja gantuṃ ayuttakālo. Kasmāti ce “atthi me”tiādimāha. Bhesajjamattāti appakaṃ🔽bhesajjaṃ. Appattho hettha mattāsaddo “mattā sukhapariccāgā”tiādīsu viya. Pītāti
analyzed: māṇavakam ti khuddake ca ittha ka paccayaḥ etat avoca ati etam akāla uti ādikam vacanam ānanda ttheraḥ avoca  akālo ti ajja gantum ayutta kālo kasmā iti ce atthi mā iti ādim āha bhesajja mattā ati appakam  bhesajjam appatthaḥ ha ittha mattā saddaḥ mattā sukha pariccāga ati ādīsu viya pītā ti
translated: and when he has gone, it is not easy to receive him with hospitality and to listen to his preaching of the Dhamma in the midst of a great crowd of people. When he comes to the house, I will receive him with hospitality and I will ask him a question that I have in mind.” He sent a student to him, and in reference to him the Exalted One said, “A student was sent.” Here the word “student” is used in the sense of a young man. “He said this”: the Elder Ananda said this statement beginning with the words, “This is not the time.”

original: pivitā. Svepīti ettha “api-saddo apekkho mantā nuññāyā”ti vajirabuddhittherena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pivitā svepi iti ettha api saddo apekkhaḥ mantā nuññāya iti vajirabuddhi ttherena vuttam
translated: “This is not the time”: this is not the right time to go today. Why? “Because I have taken medicine.” “A little medicine”: a small amount of medicine. Here the word “little” is used in the sense of a small amount, as in such passages as “a little happiness” . “I have drunk”: I have drunk it. “Tomorrow”: here the word “also” is understood. This is stated by the Elder Vajirabuddhi in the commentary.

original: Ayaṃ pana tassādhippāyo – “appeva nāmā”ti saṃsayamatte vutte anuññātabhāvo na siddho,
analyzed: ayam pana tassa adhippāyaḥ appa eva nāma ati saṃsaya matte vutte anuññāta bhāvaḥ na siddho
translated: But his intention was this: “If I were to say only ‘perhaps,’ permission would not be established.

original: tasmā taṃ sādhanatthaṃ “apī”ti vuttaṃ, tena imamatthaṃ dīpeti “appeva nāma sve mayaṃ
analyzed: tasmā tam sādhana ttham api iti vuttam tena imam attham dīpeti appā iva nāma sve mayam
translated: So in order to establish it, I said ‘if.’ I mean this: ‘Perhaps tomorrow

original: upasaṅkameyyāma, upasaṅkamituṃ paṭibalā samānā upasaṅkamissāma cā”ti.🔽Dutiyadivaseti khīravirecanapītadivasato dutiyadivase. Cetakattherenāti cetiyaraṭṭhe
analyzed: upasaṅkameyyāmaḥ upasaṅkamitum paṭibalāḥ samānāḥ upasaṅkamissāma ca ati  dutiya divasa iti khīra virecana pīta divasataḥ dutiya divase cetakattherena ati cetiya raṭṭhe
translated: we might approach him, if we are able to approach him.’ ”

original: jātattā cetakoti evaṃ laddhanāmena therena. Pacchāsamaṇenāti pacchānugatena samaṇena.
analyzed: jāta ttā cetakā iti evam laddha nāmena therena pacchāsamaṇena ati pacchānugatena samaṇena
translated: On the second day: on the second day after the day on which he had drunk the milk-laxative. By the Elder Cetika: by the elder who was called Cetika because he was born in the Ceti country.🔽By a monk who was following behind: by a monk who was going along behind.

original: Sahatthe cetaṃ karaṇavacanaṃ. Subhena māṇavena puṭṭhoti “yesu dhammesu bhavaṃ gotamo
analyzed: sahatthe ca itam karaṇa vacanam subhena māṇavena puṭṭhaḥ ti yesu dhammesu bhavam gotamaḥ
translated: This is an expression of doing with one’s own hand. Asked by the brahman student Subha: “In those ideas on which Master Gotama

original: imaṃ lokaṃ patiṭṭhapesi, te tassa accayena naṭṭhā nu kho, dharanti nu kho, sace dharanti,
analyzed: imam lokam patiṭṭhapesi te tassa accayena naṭṭhāḥ nu kho dharanti nu kho sace dharanti
translated: has established this world, will they disappear when he is gone, or will they endure? If they endure,

original: bhavaṃ (natthi dī. ni. aṭṭha. 1.448) ānando jānissati, handa naṃ pucchāmī”ti evaṃ
analyzed: ānandaḥ jānissati handa nam pucchāmi iti evam
translated: Master Gotama, Master Ānanda will know. Let me ask him.”

original: cintetvā “yesaṃ so bhavaṃ gotamo dhammānaṃ vaṇṇavādī ahosi, yattha ca imaṃ janataṃ
analyzed: cintetvā saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ dhammānam vaṇṇa vādī ahosi yattha ca imam janatam
translated: having thought, “The qualities of which the Lord Gotama spoke in praise, and in which he placed confidence in this generation,

original: samādapesi nivesesi patiṭṭhāpesi, katamesānaṃ kho bho ānanda dhammānaṃ so bhavaṃ🔽gotamo vaṇṇavādī ahosī”tiādinā puṭṭho, athassa thero tīṇi piṭakāni sīlakkhandhādīhi
analyzed: samādapesi nivesesi patiṭṭhāpesi katamesānam kho bho ānanda dhammānam saḥ bhavan  gotamaḥ vaṇṇa vādī ahosi itiādinā puṭṭhaḥ athassa theraḥ tīṇi piṭakāni sīlakkhandha ādīhi
translated: Having thought thus, he asked: “In regard to which states, Master Ananda, was the Lord a speaker of that which is? In which states did he exhort, encourage and consolidate the people? “🔽“In regard to three states, Master Bharadvaja, the Lord was a speaker of that which is, and in regard to these states he exhorted, encouraged and consolidated the people. “

original: tīhi khandhehi saṅgahetvā dassento “tiṇṇaṃ kho māṇava khandhānaṃ so bhagavā vaṇṇavādī”tiādinā
analyzed: tīhi khandhehi saṅgahetvā dassento tiṇṇam kho māṇava khandhānam saḥ bhagavā vaṇṇa vādī iti ādinā
translated: In reply to this question, the Elder, grouping the three Piṭakas under the three divisions beginning with virtue, explained them to him, saying: “In regard to three states, Master Bharadvaja, the Lord was a speaker of that which is, and in regard to these states he exhorted, encouraged and consolidated the people. “

original: idha sīlakkhandhavagge dasamaṃ suttamabhāsi, taṃ sandhāyāha “imasmiṃ…pe… mabhāsī”ti.🔽Khaṇḍanti chinnaṃ. Phullanti bhinnaṃ, sevālāhichattakādivikassanaṃ vā, tesaṃ paṭisaṅkharaṇaṃ🔽sammā pākatikakaraṇaṃ, abhinavapaṭikaraṇanti vuttaṃ hoti. Upakaṭṭhāyāti āsannāya.
analyzed: idha sīlakkhandha vagge dasamam suttam abhāsi tam sandhāya āha imasmin pe mabhāsi iti  khaṇḍanti chinnam phullanti bhinnam sevā lāhi chattaka ādi vikassanam vā tesam paṭisaṅkharaṇam  sammā pākatika karaṇam abhinava paṭikaraṇanti vuttam hoti upakaṭṭhāya ati āsannāya
translated: In this Virtue Division, he spoke the tenth sutta, which is called “The Simile of the Saw. ” The meaning of that sutta should be given in detail here in the same way as it is given in the Commentarial Eights .🔽“Cut” means cut up. “Broken” means broken up. “Rotten” means rotten with the rot that eats into the grain of the wood. “Split” means split by the splitting of the wood. “Worm-eaten” means eaten by worms. “Bent” means twisted. “Crooked” means not straight. “Knotted” means with knots. “Not usable” means not usable for making a ploughshare. “Not fit for the purpose” means not fit for the purpose of a ploughshare. “He throws it aside” means he throws it aside as useless. “Near” means close.

original: Vassaṃ upanenti upagacchanti etthāti vassūpanāyikā, vassūpagatakālo, tāya. Saṅgītipāḷiyaṃ
analyzed: vassam upanenti upagacchanti ettha ati vassūpanāyikāḥ vassūpagata kālaḥ tāya saṅgīti pāḷiyam
translated: “The time for the Invitation ceremony” is the time for the Invitation ceremony. “The Invitation ceremony” is the ceremony of invitation. “The Invitation ceremony” is a term for the ceremony of invitation.

original: sāmaññena vuttampi vacanaṃ evaṃ gateyeva sandhāya vuttanti saṃsandetuṃ sādhetuṃ vā āha “evañhī”tiādi.
analyzed: sāmaññena vuttam api vacanam evam sandhāya vuttan ti saṃsandetum sādhetum vā āha evam hi itiādi
translated: “In this way” he says, in order to remove doubt and to establish the meaning of the words, which were spoken in a general way.

original: Rājagahaṃ parivāretvāti bahinagare ṭhitabhāvena vuttaṃ. Chaḍḍitapatitauklāpāti chaḍḍitā
analyzed: rāja gaham parivāretvā iti bahi nagare ṭhita bhāvena vuttam chaḍḍita patita auklāpā ati chaḍḍitā
translated: “Surrounded Rājagaha” means that they were outside the city. “Cast off, fallen, and trampled” means cast off,

original: ca patitā ca uklāpā ca. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – bhagavato parinibbānaṭṭhānaṃ gacchantehi
analyzed: ca patitā ca uklāpā ca idam vuttam hoti bhagavataḥ parinibbāna ṭhānam gacchantehi
translated: fallen, and trampled. This is what is meant: the monks who were going to the place of the Blessed One’s parinibbāna

original: bhikkhūhi chaḍḍitā vissaṭṭhā, tatoyeva ca upacikādīhi khāditattā ito cito ca patitā,🔽sammajjanābhāvena ākiṇṇakacavarattā uklāpā cāti. Tadevatthaṃ “bhagavato hī”tiādinā
analyzed: bhikkhūhi chaḍḍitā vissaṭṭhā ca upacika ādīhi khādita ttā itas ca itas ca patitā  sammajjana abhāvena uklāpā ca ati tadevattham bhagavataḥ hi iti ādinā
translated: cast off and abandoned their robes, and because of the white ants, etc., they were eaten and fell here and there,🔽and because of the sweeping they were trampled and became a mass of rags. He explains the meaning of that with “For the Blessed One’s” and so on.

original: vibhāveti. Avakuthi pūtibhāvamagamāsīti uklāpo tha-kārassa la-kāraṃ katvā, ujjhiṭṭho🔽vā kalāposamūhoti uklāpo, vaṇṇasaṅgamanavasenevaṃ vuttaṃ yathā “upakleso, sneho”
analyzed: vibhāva iti pūti bhāvam agamāsi iti uklāpaḥ thakārassa lakāram katvā ujjhiṭṭhaḥ  vā kalāposamūho ti uklāpaḥ vaṇṇa saṅgamana vasena evam vuttam yathā upaklesaḥ sneho
translated: “The avakuthi became rotten” means that the avakuthi became a mass of rags by changing the -th- to -l-.

original: – iccādi, tena yuttāti tathā. Paricchedavasena veṇīyanti dissantīti pariveṇā. Kurumānāti
analyzed: iccādi tena yuttā ati tathā pariccheda vasena veṇīyanti dissanti iti pariveṇā kurumānā ati
translated: “A mass of rags” is a heap of rags. It is said in this way because of the combination of colors, just as “upaccheda, sneha” and so on. By that it is connected, thus. “They appear as if they were a line” means they appear as if they were a line by the method of division. “Courtyards” means

original: kattukāmā. Senāsanavattānaṃ paññattattā, senāsanakkhandhake ca senāsanapaṭibaddhānaṃ🔽bahūnampi vacanānaṃ vuttattā senāsanapaṭisaṅkharaṇampi tassa pūjāyeva nāmāti āha
analyzed: kattu kāmā senāsana vattānam paññatta ttā senāsana kkhandhake ca senāsana paṭibaddhānam  bahūnam pi vacanānam vutta ttā senāsana paṭisaṅkharaṇam pi tassa pūjāya iva nāma ati āha
translated: He wanted to lay down the observance of the dwellings. Because the observance of the dwellings has been laid down in the Khandhaka on the dwellings,

original: “bhagavato vacanapūjanattha”nti. Paṭhamaṃ māsanti vassānassa paṭhamaṃ māsaṃ. Accantasaṃyoge
analyzed: bhagavataḥ vacana pūjana atthanti paṭhamam māsanti vassānassa paṭhamam māsan accanta saṃyoge
translated: and because many statements connected with the dwellings have been made there, the re-arrangement of the dwellings is also a kind of worship of the Buddha. Therefore it is said: “for the purpose of worshipping the word of the Blessed One.”🔽The first month: the first month of the rainy season. This is a statement of the use of the word “at the end” .

original: cetaṃ upayogavacanaṃ. “Titthiyavādaparimocanatthañcā”ti vuttamatthaṃ pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ
analyzed: upayoga vacanam titthiya vāda parimocana attham ca ati vuttam attham pākaṭam kātum
translated: In order to make clear the meaning of the words “for the purpose of freeing the Buddha from the criticism of the sectarians,”

original: “titthiyā hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: titthiyāḥ hi itiādi vuttam
translated: it is said: “For the sectarians would say.”

original: Yanti katikavattakaraṇaṃ. Edisesu hi ṭhānesu yaṃ-saddo taṃ-saddānapekkho teneva atthassa
analyzed: edisesu hi ṭhānesu yaṃsaddaḥ taṃsadda anapekkhaḥ tena iva atthassa
translated: Yanti is a word for a certain kind of action. In such passages as this, the word yam is not dependent on the word tam. The meaning is complete in itself.

original: paripuṇṇattā. Yaṃ vā katikavattaṃ sandhāya “atha kho”tiādi vuttaṃ, tadeva mayāpi
analyzed: paripuṇṇa ttā yam vā katika vattam sandhāya atha kha iti ādi vuttam tat eva mayā api
translated: Or else, the word yanti refers to the certain kind of action that is stated in the words “Then the Blessed One” and so on. The meaning is: that is what I have said.

original: vuttanti attho. Esa nayo īdisesu bhagavatā…pe… vaṇṇitanti senāsanavattaṃ paññapentena
analyzed: vuttam ti attho esa nayaḥ īdisesu bhagavatā āpe vaṇṇitam ti senāsana vattam paññapentena
translated: The same method applies in the passages beginning “The Blessed One” and so on. The observance of the dwellings was laid down by the Blessed One.

original: senāsanakkhandhake ca senāsanapaṭibaddhavacanaṃ kathentena vaṇṇitaṃ. Saṅgāyissāmāti
analyzed: senāsana khandhake ca senāsana paṭibaddha vacanam kathentena vaṇṇitam saṅgāyissāma ati
translated: And in the Khandhaka on the dwellings it is described in the passage on the words of the advice connected with the dwellings.

original: ettha iti-saddassa “vuttaṃ ahosī”ti ca ubhayattha sambandho, ekassa vā iti-saddassa lopo.🔽Dutiyadivaseti evaṃ cintitadivasato dutiyadivase, so ca kho vassūpanāyikadivasato
analyzed: ettha iti saddassa vuttam ahosi iti ca ubhayattha sambandhaḥ ekassa vā iti saddassa lopaḥ  dutiya divasa iti evam cintita divasataḥ dutiya divase saḥ ca kho vassūpanāyika divasato
translated: As to the words we will recite, the word iti is construed with both the words vuttam and ahosi, or else the word iti is omitted.

original: dutiyadivasova. Therā hi āsaḷhipuṇṇamito pāṭipadadivaseyeva sannipatitvā vassamupagantvā
analyzed: therāḥ hi sannipatitvā vassam upagantvā
translated: On the following day: on the second day from the day on which they had thought thus. And that was the second day from the day on which they had entered upon the rains. For the elders had assembled on the day after the full moon of July and had entered upon the rains.🔽And they had thought thus.🔽At the royal door: at the door of the royal palace.

original: evaṃ cintesunti. Rājadvāreti rājagehadvāre. Hatthakammanti hatthakiriyaṃ, hatthakammassa
analyzed: evam rāja dvāra iti rāja geha dvāre hattha kammam ati hattha kiriyam hattha kammassa
translated: Work of the hands: work with the hands. What is meant is: the doing of work with the hands.🔽They announced: they made known.

original: karaṇanti vuttaṃ hoti. Paṭivedesunti jānāpesuṃ. Visaṭṭhāti nirāsaṅkacittā. Āṇāyeva
analyzed: karaṇanti vuttam hoti paṭivedesunti jānāpesum visaṭṭhā ati nirāsaṅka cittā āṇāya iva
translated: Without misgiving: with minds free from anxiety.🔽The wheel of the command: the wheel of the command is the command itself, since it occurs by way of unobstructed occurrence.

original: appaṭihatavuttiyā pavattanaṭṭhena cakkanti āṇācakkaṃ. Tathā dhammoyeva cakkanti dhammacakkaṃ,
analyzed: a paṭihata vuttiyāḥ pavattana ṭṭhena cakkanti āṇācakkam tathā cakkanti dhammacakkam
translated: Likewise the wheel of the Dhamma: the wheel of the Dhamma is the Dhamma itself.

original: taṃ panidha desanāñāṇapaṭivedhañāṇavasena duvidhampi yujjati tadubhayeneva saṅgītiyā
analyzed: tam desanā ñāṇa paṭivedha ñāṇa vasena duvidham pi yujjati tad ubhayena iva saṅgītiyā
translated: And that is appropriate in both senses, since it is both the knowledge of teaching and the knowledge of penetration,

original: pavattanato. “Dhammacakkanti cetaṃ desanāñāṇassāpi nāmaṃ, paṭivedhañāṇassāpī”ti hi
analyzed: pavattanato dhammacakkan ti ca itam desanā ñāṇassa api nāmam paṭivedha ñāṇassa api iti hi
translated: “The Wheel of the Dhamma is a name for the knowledge of teaching and for the knowledge of penetration as well,”

original: aṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ. Sannisajjaṭṭhānanti sannipatitvā nisīdanaṭṭhānaṃ. Satta paṇṇāni
analyzed: aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam sannisajja ṭṭhānam ti sannipatitvā nisīdana ṭṭhānam satta paṇṇāni
translated: it is said in the Commentaries. The place of the assembly: the place where they sat down after assembling.

original: yassāti sattapaṇṇī, yo “chattapaṇṇo, visamacchado” tipi vuccati, tassa jātaguhadvāreti attho.
analyzed: yassa ati satta paṇṇī yaḥ chatta paṇṇo visamacchado vuccati tassa jāta guha dvārā iti attho
translated: The one with seven leaves: the one called “chattapaṇṇo, visamacchado,” the meaning is: the door of the cave of the Goatherd.

original: Vissakammunāti sakkassa devānamindassa kammākammavidhāyakaṃ devaputtaṃ sandhāyāha.
analyzed: vissa kammunā iti sakkassa devānamindassa kamma akamma vidhāyakam devaputtam sandhāya āha
translated: Vissakamma: he says this referring to the god who is the architect of Sakka, the lord of the gods.

original: Suvibhattabhittithambhasopānanti ettha suvibhattapadassa dvandato pubbe suyyamānattā
analyzed: su vibhatta bhitti thambha sopānanti ettha su vibhatta padassa dvandato pubbe
translated: Well-divided walls, pillars, and stairs: here, because the word “well-divided” is placed before the dvanda compound,

original: sabbehi dvandapadehi sambandho, tathā “nānāvidha…pe… vicitta”ntiādīsupi. Rājabhavanavibhūtinti
analyzed: sabbehi dvanda padehi sambandhaḥ tathā
translated: it is connected with all the words in the dvanda compound. Likewise, in the words “various kinds … variegated,” etc. The splendor of the royal palace:

original: rājabhavanasampattiṃ, rājabhavanasobhaṃ vā. Avahasantamivāti avahāsaṃ kurumānaṃ viya.
analyzed: rāja bhavana sampattim rāja bhavana sobham vā avahasantam iva ati avahāsam kurumānam
translated: the prosperity of the royal palace, or the beauty of the royal palace. As if mocking: as if making fun of.

original: Siriyāti sobhāsaṅkhātāya lakkhiyā. Niketanamivāti vasanaṭṭhānamiva, “jalantamivā”tipi
analyzed: siriyā ati sobhā saṅkhātāya lakkhiyā niketanam iva ati vasana ṭṭhānam iva jalantam iva atipi
translated: Glory: beauty, which is called “fortune.” A dwelling place: a place of living, “as if dancing,”

original: pāṭho. Ekasmiṃyeva pānīyatitthe nipatantā pakkhino viya sabbesampi janānaṃ cakkhūni
analyzed: ekasmiṃ yeva pānīya titthe nipatantā pakkhinaḥ viya sabbesam pi janānam cakkhūni
translated: The meaning is that they alight on the same place, on the eye of all people.

original: maṇḍapeyeva nipatantīti vuttaṃ “ekanipāta…pe… vihaṅgāna”nti. Nayanavihaṅgānanti nayanasaṅkhātavihaṅgānaṃ.
analyzed: maṇḍapeya iva nipatanti iti vuttam vihaṅgānam nayana vihaṅgānam ti nayana saṅkhāta vihaṅgānam
translated: The compound ekanipphatti is analysed in the Paṭisambhidā as follows: ekā nipphatti ekanipphatti, ekā ca sā nipphatti ca ekanipphatti.

original: Lokarāmaṇeyyakamiva sampiṇḍitanti yadi loke vijjamānaṃ rāmaṇeyyakaṃ sabbameva ānetvā🔽ekattha sampiṇḍitaṃ siyā, taṃ viyāti vuttaṃ hoti, yaṃ yaṃ vā loke ramitumarahati,
analyzed: loka rāmaṇeyyakam iva sampiṇḍitam ti yadi loke vijjamānam rāmaṇeyyakam sabbam eva ānetvā  ekattha sampiṇḍitam siyā tam viya iti vuttam hoti yam yam vā loke ramitum arahati
translated: The meaning is that they alight on the same place, on the eye of all people.🔽The compound ekanipphatti is analysed in the Paṭisambhidā as follows: ekā nipphatti ekanipphatti, ekā ca sā nipphatti ca ekanipphatti.🔽The meaning is that they alight on the same place, on the eye of all people.

original: taṃ sabbaṃ sampiṇḍitamivātipi attho. Daṭṭhabbasāramaṇḍanti pheggurahitaṃ sāraṃ viya,🔽kasaṭavinimuttaṃ pasannaṃ viya ca daṭṭhumaraharūpesu sārabhūtaṃ, pasannabhūtañca.
analyzed: tam sabbam sampiṇḍitam iva atipi atthaḥ daṭṭhabba sāram aṇḍanti pheggu rahitam sāram viya  kasaṭa vinimuttam pasannam viya ca daṭṭhumaraha rūpesu sāra bhūtam pasanna bhūtam ca
translated: The compound ekanipphatti is analysed in the Paṭisambhidā as follows: ekā nipphatti ekanipphatti, ekā ca sā nipphatti ca ekanipphatti.🔽The meaning is that they alight on the same place, on the eye of all people.🔽The compound ekanipphatti is analysed in the Paṭisambhidā as follows: ekā nipphatti ekanipphatti, ekā ca sā nipphatti ca ekanipphatti.🔽The meaning is that they alight on the same place, on the eye of all people.🔽The compound ekanipphatti is analysed in the Paṭisambhidā as follows: ekā nipphatti ekanipphatti, ekā ca sā nipphatti ca ekanipphatti.🔽The meaning is that they alight on the same place, on the eye of all people.

original: Apica daṭṭhabbo dassanīyo sārabhūto visiṭṭhataro maṇḍo maṇḍanaṃ alaṅkāro etassāti
analyzed: apica daṭṭhabbaḥ dassanīyaḥ sāra bhūtaḥ visiṭṭhataraḥ maṇḍaḥ maṇḍanam alaṅkāraḥ etassa ati
translated: The compound ekanipphatti is analysed in the Paṭisambhidā as follows: ekā nipphatti ekanipphatti, ekā ca sā nipphatti ca ekanipphatti.🔽The meaning is that they alight on the same place, on the eye of all people.🔽The compound ekanipphatti is analysed in the Paṭisambhidā as follows: ekā nipphatti ekanipphatti, ekā ca sā nipphatti ca ekanipphatti.🔽The meaning is that they alight on the same place, on the eye of all people.

original: daṭṭhabbasāramaṇḍo, taṃ. Maṇḍaṃ sūriyarasmiṃ pāti nivāreti, sabbesaṃ vā janānaṃ maṇḍaṃ
analyzed: daṭṭhabba sāra maṇḍaḥ tam maṇḍam sūriya rasmim pāti nivāreti sabbesam vā janānam maṇḍam
translated: The compound ekanipphatti is analysed in the

original: pasannaṃ pāti rakkhati, maṇḍanamalaṅkāraṃ vā pāti pivati alaṅkarituṃ yuttabhāvenāti maṇḍapo, taṃ.
analyzed: pasannam pāti rakkhati maṇḍanam alaṅkāram vā pāti pivati alaṅkaritum yutta bhāvena ati maṇḍapo tam
translated: He protects the bowl, or he drinks the bowl, i.e. the ornament, the decoration, as being suitable for adorning, thus it is a pavilion .

original: Kusumadāmāni ca tāni olambakāni ceti kusumadāmolambakāni. Visesanassa cettha paranipāto
analyzed: kusuma dāmāni ca tāni olambakāni ca iti kusuma dāma ulambakāni visesanassa ca ittha para nipātaḥ
translated: And those flower-garlands are those pendants, thus flower-garland-pendants. The word-duplication here is for the purpose of distinction,

original: yathā “agyāhito”ti. Vividhāniyeva kusumadāmolambakāni tathā, tāni viniggalantaṃ visesena
analyzed: yathā vividhāni iva kusuma dāma ulambakāni tathā tāni viniggalantam visesena
translated: like ‘agyāhito’ . And those flower-garland-pendants are of various kinds, thus they.

original: vamentaṃ nikkhāmentamiva cāru sobhanaṃ vitānaṃ etthāti tathā. Kuṭṭena gahito samaṃ
analyzed: vamentam nikkhāmentam iva cāru sobhanam vitānam ettha ati tathā kuṭṭena gahitaḥ samam
translated: They are as if emitting, as if sending forth, a lovely, beautiful, awning, thus . And it is enclosed by a wall, thus it is a walled-in place .

original: katoti kuṭṭimo, koṭṭimo vā, tādisoyeva maṇīti maṇikoṭṭimo, nānāratanehi vicitto maṇikoṭṭimo,
analyzed: kataḥ iti kuṭṭimaḥ koṭṭimaḥ vā tādisaḥ yā iva maṇī iti maṇi koṭṭimaḥ nānā ratanehi vicittaḥ maṇi koṭṭimaḥ
translated: Or it is a wall, thus it is a wall, and it is a jewel, thus it is a jewel-wall. It is a jewel-wall variegated with various gems,

original: tassa talaṃ tathā. Atha vā maṇiyo koṭṭetvā katatalattā maṇikoṭṭena nipphattanti maṇikoṭṭimaṃ,
analyzed: tassa talam tathā atha vā maṇiyaḥ koṭṭetvā kata talattāḥ maṇi koṭṭena nipphattanti maṇi koṭṭimam
translated: the floor of that is thus. Or alternatively, it is a floor made by cutting a jewel, thus it is a jewel-floor.

original: tameva talaṃ, nānāratanavicittaṃ maṇikoṭṭimatalaṃ tathā. Tamiva ca nānāpupphūpahāravicittaṃ
analyzed: tam eva talam nānā ratana vicittam maṇi koṭṭima talam tathā tam iva ca nānā pupphū upahāra vicittam
translated: That very floor, the jewel-floor, is thus. And it is as if variegated with various flower-offerings,

original: supariniṭṭhitabhūmikammanti sambandho. Pupphapūjā pupphūpahāro. Ettha hi nānāratanavicittaggahaṇaṃ🔽nānāpupphūpahāravicittatāyanidassanaṃ, maṇikoṭṭimatalaggahaṇaṃ supariniṭṭhitabhūmikammatāyāti
analyzed: su pariniṭṭhita bhūmikammanti sambandho puppha pūjā puppha upahāro ettha hi nānā ratana vicitta ggahaṇam  nānā pupphūpahāra vicitta tāyani dassanam maṇi koṭṭima tala gahaṇam su pariniṭṭhita bhūmikamma tāyāti
translated: The construction is: “the ground-work was well finished.” Flower-worship: the offering of flowers. For here the mention of the various jewels is🔽a demonstration of the variety of the flower-offerings, and the mention of the surface of the jewel-paved ground is a demonstration of the well-finishedness of the ground-work.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Nanti maṇḍapaṃ. Brahmavimānasadisanti bhāvanapuṃsakaṃ, yathā brahmavimānaṃ
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam maṇḍapam brahma vimāna sadisanti bhāva napuṃsakam yathā brahma vimānam
translated: The word “there” refers to the pavilion. Like the Brahma-palace: like the palace of Brahma. The meaning is: having decorated it so that it

original: sobhati, tathā alaṅkaritvāti attho. Visesena mānetabbanti vimānaṃ. Saddavidū pana
analyzed: sobhati tathā alaṅkaritvā iti atthaḥ visesena mānetabbanti vimānam sadda vidū pana
translated: shines. A palace is what is to be honored especially. But those who are learned in the texts

original: “vihe ākāse māyanti gacchanti devā yenāti vimāna”nti vadanti. Visesena vā sucaritakammunā🔽mīyati nimmīyatīti vimānaṃ, vīti vā sakuṇo vuccati, taṃ saṇṭhānena mīyati nimmīyatīti
analyzed: vihe ākāse māyanti gacchanti devāḥ yena ati vimānanti vadanti visesena vā su carita kammunā  mīyati nimmīyati iti vimānam vi iti vā sakuṇaḥ vuccati tam saṇṭhānena mīyati nimmīyati iti
translated: say: “Vimāna means that the gods go and come in the sky by means of it.” Or else, it is a palace because it is measured out by the good deeds of the gods.🔽Or else, vīti means a bird, and it is measured out by the shape of that bird.

original: vimānantiādināpi vattabbo. Vimānaṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “ekayojanadviyojanādibhāvena pamāṇavisesayuttatāya,
analyzed: vimāna nti ādinā api vattabbaḥ vimāna aṭṭhakathā ayam pana eka yojana dvi yojana ādi bhāvena pamāṇa visesa yutta tāya
translated: It can also be said: “Vimāna means that it is measured out by the shape of a bird.” But in the Vimāna Commentary it is said: “Because it is endowed with a measure of size, one league, two leagues, and so on,

original: sobhātisayayogena ca visesato mānanīyatāya vimāna”nti vuttaṃ. Natthi agghametesanti
analyzed: sobha atisaya yogena ca visesataḥ mānanīya tāya vimānanti vuttam natthi aggham etesan ti
translated: and because of the excellence of its beauty, it is a ‘palatial mansion’ in the special sense of being worthy of honour.🔽There is no price for them:

original: anagghāni, aparimāṇagghāni agghitumasakkuṇeyyānīti vuttaṃ hoti. Patirūpaṃ, paccekaṃ
analyzed: anagghāni a parimāṇa agghāni agghitum a sakkuṇeyyāni iti vuttam hoti patirūpam paccekam
translated: they are priceless, beyond price, beyond reckoning, is what is meant.🔽They are to be spread out separately, or each one is to be spread out, thus they are ‘spreads’; there are a hundred of them, thus it is ‘a hundred spreads’.

original: vā attharitabbānīti paccattharaṇāni, tesaṃ satāni tathā. Uttarābhimukhanti uttaradisābhimukhaṃ.
analyzed: vā attharitabbāni iti paccattharaṇāni tesam satāni tathā uttara abhimukham ti uttara disa abhimukham
translated: Facing north: facing the north direction.

original: Dhammopi satthāyeva satthukiccanipphādanatoti vuttaṃ “buddhassa bhagavato āsanārahaṃ
analyzed: dhammaḥ api satthāya iva satthu kicca nipphādanato ti vuttam buddhassa bhagavataḥ āsana arahaṃ
translated: The Dhamma is also the Teacher, because it accomplishes the Teacher’s task. Thus it is said: “The Dhamma throne, worthy of the Buddha, the Blessed One, having been prepared,

original: dhammāsanaṃ paññapetvā”ti. Yathāha “yo kho…pe… mamaccayena satthā”tiādi, tathāgatappaveditadhammadesakassa
analyzed: dhamma āsanam paññapetvā ti yathā āha yaḥ khope mamaccayena satthā atiādi tathāgata ppavedita dhamma desakassa
translated: the Elder Mahinda sat down on it.” As it is said: “Whoever … after my passing … will be the Teacher” ,

original: vā satthukiccāvahattā tathārūpe āsane nisīditumarahatīti dassetumpi evaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vā satthu kicca āvahattā tathārūpe āsane nisīditum arahati iti dassetum pi evam vuttam
translated: or it is said thus in order to show that one who teaches the Dhamma proclaimed by the Tathāgata is worthy to sit on such a throne because he bears the burden of the Teacher’s task.🔽Worthy of a seat: worthy of a seat to sit on.

original: Āsanārahanti nisīdanārahaṃ. Dhammāsananti dhammadesakāsanaṃ, dhammaṃ vā kathetuṃ
analyzed: āsana araham ti nisīdana araham dhamma āsanam ti dhamma desaka āsanam dhammam vā kathetum
translated: Dhamma throne: a seat for teaching the Dhamma, or a seat suitable for teaching the Dhamma.

original: yuttāsanaṃ. Dantakhacitanti dantehi khacitaṃ, hatthidantehi katanti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: yutta āsanam danta khacitanti dantehi khacitam hatthi dantehi katanti vuttam hoti
translated: Made of ivory: made of tusks, made of elephant tusks, is what is meant.

original: “Danto nāma hatthidanto vuccatī”ti hi vuttaṃ. Etthāti etasmiṃ dhammāsane. Mama kiccanti
analyzed: dantaḥ nāma hatthi danto vuccati iti hi vuttam ettha ati etasmim dhamma āsane mama kiccan ti
translated: “Tamed” is said to be “elephant-tamed.”

original: mama kammaṃ, mayā vā karaṇīyaṃ.
analyzed: mama kammam mayā vā karaṇīyam
translated: “My work” is my task, or what I have to do.

original: Idāni āyasmato ānandassa asekkhabhūmisamāpajjanaṃ dassento “tasmiñca panā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: idāni āyasmataḥ ānandassa asekkha bhūmi samāpajjanam dassentaḥ tasmin ca pana ati ādim āha
translated: Now, showing the Venerable Ananda’s attainment of the state of a non-learner, the Master said: “And on that day.”

original: Tattha tasmiñca pana divasaeti tathā raññā ārocāpitadivase, sāvaṇamāsassa kāḷapakkhacatutthadivaseti🔽vuttaṃ hoti. Anatthajananato visasaṅkāsatāya kileso visaṃ, tassa khīṇāsavabhāvato
analyzed: tattha tasmin ca pana tathā raññā ārocāpita divase sāvaṇa māsassa kāḷa pakkha catuttha divasa iti  vuttam hoti anattha jananataḥ visa saṅkāsa tāya kilesaḥ visam tassa khīṇa āsava bhāvato
translated: Herein, “And on that day” means on the day when the king had announced it thus, on the fourth day of the dark fortnight of the month of Assayuja.🔽Because it causes harm, defilement is a “poison,” because of the danger of poison.

original: aññathābhāvasaṅkhātā satti gandho. Tathā hi so bhagavato parinibbānādīsu vilāpādimakāsi.
analyzed: aññathābhāva saṅkhātā satti gandho tathā hi so bhagavato parinibbāna ādīsu vilāpa ādim akāsi
translated: Because of the exhaustion of the taints, the Master is “without poison,” and because of the absence of the danger of poison, he is “without the smell of poison.” For thus he did lament, etc., at the Blessed One’s parinibbāna, etc.

original: Apica visajananakapupphādigandhapaṭibhāgatāya nānāvidhadukkhahetukiriyājananako kilesova
analyzed: apica visa jananaka puppha ādi gandha paṭibhāga tāya nānāvidha dukkha hetu kiriyā jananakaḥ kilesaḥ uva
translated: Moreover, because of the resemblance to the smell of flowers, etc., that cause the emission of poison, defilement, which causes the performance of the action that is the root of manifold suffering,

original: “visagandho”ti vuccati. Tathā hi so “visaṃ haratīti visattikā, visamūlāti visattikā,
analyzed: visagandhaḥ ti vuccati tathā hi saḥ visam harati iti visattikā visa mūlā ati visattikā
translated: is called “the smell of poison.” For thus it is said: “It carries off poison, thus it is a snake ; it is a root of poison, thus it is a snake .”

original: visaphalāti visattikā, visaparibhogāti visattikā”tiādinā vuttoti. Apica visagandhonāma
analyzed: visaphalā ati visattikā visa paribhogā ati visattikā ati ādinā vuttaḥ ti apica visagandhaḥ nāma
translated: Poison fruit is poison-coated; poison enjoyment is poison-coated” .

original: virūpo maṃsādigandho, taṃsadisatāya pana kileso. “Vissasaddo hi virūpe”ti abhidhammaṭīkāyaṃvuttaṃ.
analyzed: virūpaḥ maṃsa ādi gandhaḥ tad sadisa tāya pana kilesaḥ vissa saddaḥ hi virūpa iti abhidhammaṭīkāyam vuttam
translated: Moreover, the smell of poison is the smell of flesh, etc., that is repulsive. But the defilements are like that. For it is said in the Abhidhamma Commentary: “The word ‘repulsive’ is used for what is ugly” .

original: Addhāti ekaṃsato. Saṃveganti dhammasaṃvegaṃ. “Ohitabhārāna”nti hi yebhuyyena, padhānena
analyzed: addhā ati ekaṃsatas dhamma saṃvegam hi yebhuyyena padhānena
translated: “Once and for all” : in one direction. “Disgust” : disgust with the ideas. For “having laid down the burden” is said in the main with reference to the arahant.

original: ca vuttaṃ. Edisesu pana ṭhānesu tadaññesampi dhammasaṃvegoyeva adhippeto. Tathā hi
analyzed: ca vuttam edisesu pana ṭhānesu tad aññesam pi dhamma saṃvegaḥ yā iva adhippeto tathā hi
translated: But in such passages as this, disgust with the ideas is intended as well. For it is said in the commentary on the Rajjumala-vimāna:

original: “saṃvego nāma sahottappaṃ ñāṇaṃ, so tassā bhagavato dassane uppajjī”ti rajjumālāvimānavaṇṇanāyaṃvuttaṃ,
analyzed: saṃvegaḥ nāma saha uttappam ñāṇam saḥ tassāḥ bhagavato dassane uppajji iti rajjumālā vimāna vaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttam
translated: “Disgust is knowledge accompanied by anxiety. It arose in him on seeing the Blessed One” .

original: sā ca tadā aviññātasāsanā anāgataphalāti. Itarathā hi cittutrāsavasena dosoyeva saṃvegoti
analyzed: sā ca tadā a viññāta sāsanā anāgata phalā ati itarathā hi cittu trāsa vasena saṃvegā iva
translated: And that was because she had not yet understood the dispensation and had not yet obtained the fruit of the future life. For if it had been otherwise, she would have fallen into mere hate in the form of fear of the idea of suffering,

original: āpajjati, evañca sati so tassa asekkhabhūmisamāpajjanassa ekaṃsakāraṇaṃ na siyā.
analyzed: āpajjati evam ca sati saḥ tassa asekkha bhūmi samāpajjanassa ekaṃsa kāraṇam na siyā
translated: and in that case that would not be a single cause for his reaching the state of a disciple beyond training.

original: Evamabhūto ca so idha na vattabboyevāti alamatipapañcena. Tenāti tasmā sve saṅghasannipātassa🔽vattamānattā, sekkhasakaraṇīyattā vā. Te na yuttanti tava na yuttaṃ, tayā vā sannipātaṃ
analyzed: evam abhūtaḥ ca saḥ idha na vattabbo yeva ati alam atipapañcena tena ati tasmā sve saṅgha sannipātassa  vattamāna ttā sekkhasakaraṇīya ttā vā te na yuttanti tava na yuttam tayā vā sannipātam
translated: ‘Therefore’: because of the approaching of the Community tomorrow,

original: gantuṃ na patirūpaṃ.
analyzed: gantum na pati rūpam
translated: or because of the duties of the Initiate. ‘It is not proper for you’: it is not proper for you, or it is not fitting for you to go to the meeting.

original: Metanti mama etaṃ gamanaṃ. Yvāhanti yo ahaṃ, yanti vā kiriyāparāmasanaṃ, tena “gaccheyya”nti🔽ettha gamanakiriyaṃ parāmasati, kiriyāparāmasanassa ca yaṃ taṃ-saddassa ayaṃ pakati,
analyzed: mā itanti mama etam gamanam yaḥ aham yanti vā kiriyā parāmasanam tena gaccheyyanti  ettha gamana kiriyam parāmasati kiriyā parāmasanassa ca yam taṃ saddassa ayam
translated: ‘To me’: to my going. ‘If I’: if I who am, or if I, by means of the accusative case, he refers to the action of going in the passage ‘should go’

original: yadidaṃ napuṃsakaliṅgena, ekavacanena ca yogyatā tathāyeva tattha tattha dassanato.
analyzed: yat idam napuṃsaka liṅgena ekavacanena ca yogyatā tathā yā iva tattha tattha dassanato
translated: and the natural state of the word ‘taṃ’ is that, namely, the state of being neuter and the state of being singular, because it is shown in this way in this and that place.

original: Kiriyāya hi sabhāvato napuṃsakattamekattañca icchanti saddavidū. Āvajjesīti upanāmesi.
analyzed: kiriyāya hi sabhāvataḥ napuṃsaka ttam eka ttam ca icchanti sadda vidū āvajjesi iti upanāmesi
translated: For those who know the nature of words desire that the action should be neuter and singular in reality. ‘I should inform’: I should make known.

original: Muttāti muccitā. Appattañcāti agatañca, bimbohane na tāva ṭhapitanti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: muttā ati muccitā appattam ca ati agatam ca bimbohane na tāva ṭhapitanti vuttam hoti
translated: ‘Released’: freed. ‘Not yet reached’: not yet come, not yet placed in the alms-bowl, is what is meant.

original: Etasmiṃ antareti etthantare, iminā padadvayena dassitakālānaṃ vemajjhakkhaṇe, tathādassitakāladvayassa
analyzed: etasmin antare iti ettha antare iminā pada dvayena dassita kālānam vemajjha kkhaṇe tathā dassita kāla dvayassa
translated: In the interval: in the middle, in the midst, in the middle of the time indicated by the two words “at one time” or in the middle of the two times indicated by those two words.

original: vā vivareti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: vā vivare iti vuttam hoti
translated: The meaning is: in the interval.

original: “Kāraṇe ceva citte ca, khaṇasmiṃ vivarepi ca;
analyzed: kāraṇe ca iva citte ca ca
translated: “In a cause, in consciousness, in a moment, in an interval,

original: Vemajjhādīsu atthesu ‘antarā’ti ravo gato”ti.
analyzed: vemajjha ādīsu atthesu antarā ati ravaḥ gataḥ ti
translated: In the middle and so on, the word ‘antara’ has gone.”🔽For this is said:

original: Hi vuttaṃ. Anupādāyāti taṇhādiṭṭhivasena kañci dhammaṃ aggahetvā, yehi vā kilesehi🔽muccati, tesaṃ lesamattampi aggahetvā. Āsavehīti bhavato ā bhavaggaṃ, dhammato ca
analyzed: hi vuttam an upādāya ti taṇhā diṭṭhi vasena kañci dhammam aggahetvā yehi vā kilesehi  muccati tesam lesa mattam pi aggahetvā āsavehi iti bhavataḥ ā bhavaggam dhammataḥ ca
translated: Without clinging: without taking up any state as self by craving or view. Or without taking up even a trace of the defilements🔽by which one is liberated.🔽Free from cankers: from the canker of sensual desire, from the canker of being, from the canker of ignorance, and from the canker of views. The cankers are defilements that flow out , that flow together , and that flow forth .

original: ā gotrabhuṃ savanato pavattanato āsavasaññitehi kilesehi. Upalakkhaṇavacanamattañcetaṃ.
analyzed: ā gotrabhum savanataḥ pavattanataḥ āsava saññitehi kilesehi
translated: This is a mere indication.

original: Tadekaṭṭhatāya hi sabbehipi kilesehi sabbehipi pāpadhammehi cittaṃ vimuccatiyeva.
analyzed: tad ekaṭṭhatāya hi sabbehi pi kilesehi sabbehi pi pāpa dhammehi cittam vimuccati yeva
translated: For the mind is liberated from all defilements and from all bad things because of the single state of being without clinging.

original: Cittaṃ vimuccīti cittaṃ arahattamaggakkhaṇe āsavehi vimuccamānaṃ hutvā arahattaphalakkhaṇe
analyzed: cittam vimucci iti cittam arahatta magga kkhaṇe āsavehi vimuccamānam hutvā arahatta phala kkhaṇe
translated: The mind is liberated: the mind is liberated at the moment of the path from the cankers, and at the moment of fruition it is liberated from the defilements.

original: vimucci. Tadatthaṃ vivarati “ayañhī”tiādinā. Caṅkamenāti caṅkamanakiriyāya. Visesanti🔽attanā laddhamaggaphalato visesamaggaphalaṃ. Vivaṭṭūpanissayabhūtaṃ kataṃ upacitaṃ
analyzed: vimucci tad attham vivarati ayan hi iti ādinā caṅkamena ati caṅkamana kiriyāya  attanā laddha magga phalataḥ visesa magga phalam vivaṭṭu upanissaya bhūtam katam upacitam
translated: He was liberated. The meaning of that is explained in the following passage beginning with the words “For this reason.” “In walking”: in the activity of walking. “Distinction”:

original: puññaṃ yenāti katapuñño, arahattādhigamāya katādhikāroti attho. Padhānamanuyuñjāti
analyzed: puññam yena ati kata puññaḥ arahatta adhigamāya kata adhikāraḥ iti attho padhānam anuyuñjāti
translated: the distinction of the path and fruit that he himself had attained. “Having made merit that is the condition for the turning about of the support”: he who has made merit by which he has made himself ready for the attainment of arahatship. “Apply yourself to striving”:

original: vīriyamanuyuñjāhi, arahattasamāpattiyā anuyogaṃ karohīti vuttaṃ hoti. Hohisīti bhavissasi.
analyzed: vīriyam anuyuñjāhi arahatta samāpattiyāḥ anuyogam karohi iti vuttam hoti hohisi iti bhavissasi
translated: apply yourself to energy. Make striving for the attainment of arahatship. “You will become”: you will be.

original: Kathādosoti kathāya doso vitathabhāvo. Accāraddhanti ativiya āraddhaṃ. Uddhaccāyāti🔽uddhatabhāvāya. Handāti vossaggavacanaṃ. Tena hi adhunāyeva yojemi, na panāhaṃ papañcaṃ
analyzed: kathā doso ti kathāya dosaḥ vitatha bhāvaḥ ativiyaḥ āraddham  uddhata bhāvāya handāti vossagga vacanam tena hi yojemi na pana aham
translated: “The fault of talk”: the fault of talk is the state of being diffuse. “Too much”: too much exerted. “To agitation”:

original: karomīti vossaggaṃ karoti. Vīriyasamataṃ yojemīti caṅkamanavīriyassa adhimattattā
analyzed: karomi iti vossaggam karoti vīriya samatam yojemi iti caṅkamana vīriyassa adhimatta ttā
translated: to the state of being agitated. “Well”: this is a word of relinquishment. By this he relinquishes, saying: “I now apply myself, I do not make it diffuse.” “I apply myself to the equanimity of energy”: because the energy of walking is excessive,

original: tassa hāpanavasena samādhinā samatāpādanena vīriyassa samataṃ samabhāvaṃ yojemi,
analyzed: tassa hāpana vasena samādhinā samatā āpādanena vīriyassa samatam sama bhāvam yojemi
translated: I apply myself to the equanimity, the evenness, of energy by means of concentration, by reducing it.

original: vīriyena vā samathasaṅkhātaṃ samādhiṃ yojemītipi attho. Dvidhāpi hi pāṭho dissati.
analyzed: vīriyena vā samatha saṅkhātam samādhim atthaḥ dvidhā api hi pāṭhaḥ dissati
translated: Or else the meaning is: “I shall direct my energy to concentration called serenity.” Both readings are found.🔽I shall breathe in and out, thinking, “I shall find out.”

original: Vissamissāmīti assasissāmi. Idāni tassa visesato pasaṃsanārahabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “tenā”tiādi
analyzed: vissamissāmi iti assasissāmi idāni tassa visesataḥ pasaṃsanā raha bhāvam dassetum tena atiādi
translated: Now, in order to show that he is especially worthy of praise, the Exalted One said, “For that reason,”

original: vuttaṃ. Tenāti catuiriyāpathavirahitatākāraṇena. “Anipanno”tiādīni paccuppannavacanāneva.
analyzed: vuttam tena ati catu iriyāpatha virahita tā kāraṇena anipannaḥ ti ādīni paccuppanna vacanāni eva
translated: and so on. For that reason: for the reason of being free from the four postures. Not sluggish, and so on: these are all present participles.

original: Parinibbutopi so ākāseyeva parinibbāyi. Tasmā therassa kilesaparinibbānaṃ, khandhaparinibbānañca
analyzed: parinibbutaḥ api saḥ ākāse iva parinibbāyi tasmā therassa kilesa parinibbānam khandha parinibbānañca
translated: Even though he had attained final Nibbāna, he still had a body. Therefore the Elder’s Nibbāna of the destruction of defilements and the Nibbāna of the elements’ dissolution

original: visesena pasaṃsārahaṃ acchariyabbhutamevāti.
analyzed: visesena
translated: are especially worthy of praise and are a marvel.

original: Dutiyadivaseti therena arahattapattadivasato dutiyadivase. Pañcamiyanti tithīpekkhāya
analyzed: dutiya divase ti therena arahatta patta divasataḥ dutiya divase tithi upekkhāya
translated: On the second day: on the second day after the Elder’s attainment of arahatship. On the fifth: this is said with reference to the lunar date.🔽The words “on the second day” are in apposition to “on the day of the full moon.”

original: vuttaṃ, “dutiyadivase”ti iminā tulyādhikaraṇaṃ. Bhinnaliṅgampi hi tulyatthapadaṃ
analyzed: vuttam dutiya divasa iti iminā tulya adhikaraṇam bhinna liṅgam pi hi tulya ttha padam
translated: For words of different gender are sometimes found in apposition,

original: dissati yathā “guṇo pamāṇaṃ, vīsati cittāni” iccādi. Kāḷapakkhassāti sāvaṇamāsakāḷapakkhassa.
analyzed: dissati yathā guṇaḥ pamāṇam vīsati cittāni iccādi kāḷapakkhassa ati sāvaṇa māsa kāḷapakkhassa
translated: as in the passages “guṇo pamāṇam” and “vīsati cittāni.” In the dark fortnight of the month of Āsāḷhā: in the dark fortnight of the month of Āsāḷhā.

original: Paṭhamañhi māsaṃ khaṇḍaphullapaṭisaṅkharaṇamakaṃsu, paṭhamamāsabhāvo ca majjhimappadesavohārena.
analyzed: paṭhamam hi māsam paṭhama māsa bhāvaḥ ca majjhima ppadesa vohārena
translated: For they restored the first month, and the first month was the month of Āsāḷhī according to the reckoning of the Middle Country.

original: Tattha hi purimapuṇṇamito yāva aparā puṇṇamī, tāva eko māsoti voharanti. Tato tīṇi
analyzed: tattha hi purima puṇṇamitaḥ yāva aparā puṇṇamī tāva ekaḥ māso ti voharanti tato tīṇi
translated: For there they reckon the time from the full moon of Āsāḷhī to the full moon of Āsāḷhī as a month. Then there were three

original: divasāni rājā maṇḍapamakāsi, tato dutiyadivase thero arahattaṃ sacchākāsi, tatiyadivase
analyzed: divasāni rājā maṇḍapam akāsi tatas dutiya divase theraḥ arahattam tatiya divase
translated: days on which the king had the pavilion made. On the second day the Elder attained Arahantship. On the third day

original: pana sannipatitvā therā saṅgītimakaṃsu, tasmā āsaḷhimāsakāḷapakkhapāṭipadato yāva
analyzed: pana sannipatitvā therā tasmai yāva
translated: the elders held the Recital. Therefore the time from the first day of the dark half of Āsāḷhī to the fifth day of the dark

original: sāvaṇamāsakāḷapakkhapañcamī, tāva pañcadivasādhiko ekamāso hoti. Samānoti uppajjamāno.
analyzed: sāvaṇa māsa kāḷapakkha pañcamī tāva pañca divasa adhikaḥ eka māsaḥ hoti samānaḥ ti uppajjamānaḥ
translated: half of Sāvaṇṇa is a month with five days over. ‘Was born’ means was produced.

original: Haṭṭhatuṭṭhacittoti ativiya somanassacitto, pāmojjena vā haṭṭhacitto pītiyā tuṭṭhacitto.🔽Ekaṃsanti ekasmiṃ aṃse, vāmaṃseti attho. Tathā hi vaṅgīsasuttavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttaṃ –
analyzed: haṭṭha tuṭṭha citto ti somanassa citto pāmojjena vā haṭṭha citto pītiyā tuṭṭha citto  ekaṃsanti ekasmin aṃse vāmaṃsa iti attho tathā hi vaṅgīsa sutta vaṇṇanāyam vuttam
translated: ‘With heart elate and glad’ means with a heart exceeding glad, or with a heart elated with joy and glad with happiness.🔽‘On one side’ means on one shoulder, on the left shoulder, as it is said in the commentary on the Vaṅgīsa Sutta:

original: “Ekaṃsaṃ cīvaranti ettha puna saṇṭhāpanavasena evaṃ vuttaṃ, ekaṃsanti ca vāmaṃsaṃ
analyzed: eka aṃsam cīvaranti ettha puna saṇṭhāpana vasena evam vuttam eka aṃsam ti ca vāma aṃsam
translated: ‘On one shoulder’ is said with reference to the putting on again. On one shoulder means on the left shoulder.

original: pārupitvā ṭhitassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Yato yathā vāmaṃsaṃ pārupitvā ṭhitaṃ hoti, tathā
analyzed: adhivacanam yatas yathā vāmaṃsam pārupitvā ṭhitam hoti tathā
translated: is a term for it as it is when it is worn over the left arm.

original: cīvaraṃ katvāti evamassattho veditabbo”ti.🔽Bandha…pe… viyāti vaṇṭato pavuttasuparipakkatālaphalamiva. Paṇḍu…pe… viyāti sitapītapabhāyuttapaṇḍuromajakambale🔽ṭhapito jātimā maṇi viya, jātivacanena cettha kuttimaṃ nivatteti. Samuggatapuṇṇacando
analyzed: cīvaram katvā iti evam assa atthaḥ veditabbo ti  bandhape viyāti vaṇṭataḥ pavutta su paripakka tāla phalam iva paṇḍupe viyāti sita pīta pabhā yutta paṇḍu roma ja kambale  ṭhapitaḥ jātimā maṇi viya jāti vacanena ca ittha kuttimam nivatteti samuggata puṇṇa candaḥ
translated: The meaning should be understood in this way: ‘Having made the robe like the way the cloak is worn over the left arm.’🔽‘Tied’ means tied by a knot, etc., ‘like a ripe palm fruit on its stalk.’🔽‘White’ means possessing white and yellow and red and black hairs, ‘like a fine gem placed on a fine cloth.’

original: viyāti juṇhapakkhapannarasuposathe samuggato soḷasakalāparipuṇṇo cando viya. Bālā…pe…
analyzed: viyāti juṇha pakkha pannarasa uposathe samuggataḥ soḷasa kalā paripuṇṇo candaḥ viya bālāpe
translated: The word ‘fine’ here excludes a coarse one. ‘Like the full moon risen’ means like the full moon on the fifteenth day of the bright fortnight when it is completely full.

original: viyāti taruṇasūriyapabhāsamphassena phullitasuvaṇṇavaṇṇaparāgagabbhaṃ satapattapaddhaṃ
analyzed: viyāti taruṇa sūriya pabhā samphassena phullita suvaṇṇa vaṇṇa parāga gabbham sata patta paddham
translated: ‘Like a hundred-peaked golden palm tree’ means like a golden palm tree with a hundred shoots that has blossomed through contact with the rays of the young sun.

original: viya. “Piñjarasaddo hi hemavaṇṇapariyāyo”ti sāratthadīpaniyaṃ vutto. Pariyodātenāti
analyzed: viya piñjara saddaḥ hi hema vaṇṇa pariyāyaḥ ti sāratthadīpaniyam vuttaḥ pariyodātena ati
translated: ‘The word piñjara is a synonym for golden,’ it is said in the Sārattha Dīpanī. ‘Shining’ means shining brightly.

original: pabhassarena. Sappabhenāti vaṇṇappabhāya, sīlappabhāya ca samannāgatena. Sassirikenāti
analyzed: pabhassarena sa pabhena ati vaṇṇa ppabhāya sīla ppabhāya ca samannāgatena sa sirikena ati
translated: ‘With radiance’ means possessing colour radiance and virtue radiance.

original: sarīrasobhaggādisaṅkhātāya siriyā ativiya sirimatā. Mukhavarenāti yathāvuttasobhāsamalaṅkatattā🔽uttamamukhena. Kāmaṃ “ahamasmi arahattaṃ patto”ti nārocesi, tathārūpāya pana uttamalīḷāya
analyzed: sarīra sobhagga ādi saṅkhātāya siriyā sirimatā mukha varena ati  uttama mukhena kāmam aham asmi arahattam patto ti na arocesi tathārūpāya pana uttama līḷāya
translated: and he was exceedingly glorious with glory consisting of the beauty of his body, etc. ‘With his face’: with his face endowed with the aforementioned beauty. ‘Though he did not announce: “I have attained arahatship,” still he did announce it by his supreme gracefulness,

original: gamanato passantā sabbepi tamatthaṃ jānanti, tasmā ārocento viya hotīti āha “attano🔽arahattappattiṃ ārocayamāno viya agamāsī”ti.🔽Kimatthaṃ panāyaṃ evamārocayamāno viya agamāsīti? Vuccate – so hi “attupanāyikaṃ🔽akatvā aññabyākaraṇaṃ bhagavatā saṃvaṇṇita”nti manasi karitvā “sekkhatāya dhammavinayasaṅgītiyā🔽gahetumayuttampi bahussutattā gaṇhissāmā”ti nisinnānaṃ therānaṃ arahattappattivijānanena
analyzed: gamanataḥ passantā sabbe pi tam attham jānanti tasmai ārocentaḥ viya hoti iti āha attanaḥ  arahatta pattim ārocayamānaḥ viya agamāsi iti  kimattham pana ayam evam ārocayamānaḥ viya agamāsi iti vuccate saḥ hi attu panāyikam  a katvā añña byākaraṇam bhagavatā saṃvaṇṇitam ti manasi karitvā sekkha tāya dhamma vinaya saṅgītiyā  gahetum ayuttam pi bahu ssuta ttā gaṇhissāma ati nisinnānam therānam arahatta patti vijānanena
translated: He was exceedingly glorious with glory consisting in the beauty of his person, etc. He went with a face of beauty, etc. Though he did not announce: “I have attained arahatship,” still all saw and knew that fact by his going with such supreme grace. Therefore he was as if announcing his attainment of arahatship.

original: somanassuppādanatthaṃ, “appamatto hohī”ti bhagavatā dinnaovādassa ca saphalatādīpanatthaṃ
analyzed: somanassa uppādana attham appamattaḥ hohi iti bhagavatā dinnaovādassa ca saphala tā dīpana attham
translated: Why did he go as if announcing his attainment of arahatship? It is said: he did so, considering thus: “The Blessed One has commended the declaration of the attainment of arahatship without regard for one’s own life.” He did so in order to arouse joy in the elder bhikkhus who were seated thinking: “We shall learn the Dhamma and Discipline recited at the First Great Council, even though we are of the learner’s stage.” He did so in order to show that the advice given by the Blessed One: “Be heedful” had borne fruit, etc.

original: evamārocayamāno viya agamāsīti. Āyasmato mahākassapassa etadahosi samasamaṭṭhapanādinā🔽yathāvuttakāraṇena satthukappattā. Dhareyyāti vijjamāno bhaveyya. “Sobhati vata te
analyzed: evam ārocayamānaḥ viya agamāsi iti āyasmataḥ mahākassapassa etat ahosi sama sama ṭṭhapana ādinā  yathā vutta kāraṇena satthuka ppattā dhareyya ati vijjamānaḥ bhaveyya sobhati vata te
translated: and he came as if to announce it. The venerable Kassapa thought:

original: āvuso ānanda arahattasamadhigamatā”tiādinā sādhukāramadāsi. Ayamidha dīghabhāṇakānaṃ
analyzed: āvuso ānanda arahatta samadhigama tā ati ādinā sādhukāram adāsi ayam idha
translated: because of the reason stated thus, he was worthy of the Teacher’s place. ‘Would bear’ : would be found. ‘ It is well-become to you, friend Ānanda, that you have attained Arahantship’ , and so on, he gave his approval. This is the view of the Dīghabhāṇakas here.

original: vādo. Khuddakabhāṇakesu ca suttanipātakhuddakapāṭhabhāṇakānaṃ vādotipi yujjati tadaṭṭhakathāsupi tathā vuttattā.
analyzed: vādaḥ khuddaka bhāṇakesu ca sutta nipāta khuddaka pāṭha bhāṇakānam vādaḥ iti pi yujjati tad aṭṭhakathāsu pi tathā vutta ttā
translated: And it is appropriate to the view of the Khuddakanikāya reciters and the Suttanipāta and Khuddakapāṭha reciters too, because it is stated thus in their commentaries.

original: Majjhimaṃ nikāyaṃ bhaṇanti sīlenāti majjhimabhāṇakā, tappaguṇā ācariyā. Yathāvuḍḍhanti
analyzed: majjhimam nikāyam bhaṇanti sīlena ati majjhima bhāṇakā tad paguṇāḥ ācariyāḥ yathā vuḍḍhanti
translated: The Majjhima reciters are those who recite the Majjhimanikāya. The teachers are those who have the qualities of that . ‘ In due order’ :

original: vuḍḍhapaṭipāṭiṃ, tadanatikkamitvā vā. Tatthāti tasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe. Ānandassa etamāsananti
analyzed: vuḍḍha paṭipāṭim tat an atikkamitvā vā tattha ati tasmin bhikkhu saṅghe ānandassa etam āsanam ti
translated: in the order of seniority, without exceeding that . ‘ There’ : in that Community of bhikkhus. ‘ This is Ānanda’s seat’ :

original: sambandho. Tasmiṃ samayeti tasmiṃ evaṃkathanasamaye. Thero cintesi “kuhiṃ gato”ti
analyzed: tasmin samaye iti tasmin evaṃkathana samaye theraḥ cintesi kuhim gataḥ iti
translated: the construction is this. ‘ At that time’ : at the time of this narration. The elder thought: ‘Where has he gone?’

original: pucchantānaṃ attānaṃ dassente ativiya pākaṭabhāvena bhavissamānattā, ayampi majjhimabhāṇakesveva
analyzed: pucchantānam attānam dassente ativiya pākaṭa bhāvena bhavissamāna ttā ayam pi majjhima bhāṇakesu eva
translated: because they will be very obvious in showing themselves to those who ask. This is the opinion of some of the Majjhima reciters.

original: ekaccānaṃ vādo, tasmā itipi eke vadantīti sambandho. Ākāsena āgantvā attano āsaneyeva🔽attānaṃ dassesītipi tesameva ekacce vadanti. Pulliṅgavisaye hi “eke”ti vutte sabbattha
analyzed: tasmai eke vadanti iti sambandhaḥ ākāsena āgantvā  attānam dassesi iti pi tesam eva ekacce vadanti pulliṅga visaye hi eke iti vutte sabbattha
translated: Therefore the connection is: “Thus, some say.” Some of them say that he showed himself in his own seat, having come through the air.🔽For when “some” is said in the Pulatthinagara dialect, the meaning is “some of them.”

original: “ekacce”ti attho veditabbo. Tīsupi cettha vādesu tesaṃ tesaṃ bhāṇakānaṃ tena tenākārena🔽āgatamattaṃ ṭhapetvā visuṃ visuṃ vacane aññaṃ visesakāraṇaṃ natthi. Sattamāsaṃ katāya
analyzed: ekaccā iti atthaḥ veditabbo tīsu pi ca ittha vādesu tesam tesam bhāṇakānam tena tena ākārena  āgata mattam ṭhapetvā visum visum vacane aññam visesa kāraṇam na atthi satta māsam katāya
translated: In all three opinions, apart from the mere fact of their coming in that way, there is no other special reason for the different statements of the different reciters.🔽For after the rehearsal of the Dhamma and Discipline had gone on for seven months,

original: hi dhammavinayasaṅgītiyā kadāci pakatiyāva, kadāci pathaviyaṃ nimujjitvā, kadāci
analyzed: hi dhamma vinaya saṅgītiyā kadāci pakatiyā ava kadāci pathaviyam nimujjitvā kadāci
translated: sometimes they came by their normal way, sometimes they emerged from the earth, and sometimes they came through the air.

original: ākāsena āgatattā taṃ tadāgamanamupādāya tathā tathā vadanti. Apica saṅgītiyā ādidivaseyeva
analyzed: ākāsena tam tad āgamanam upādāya tathā tathā vadanti apica
translated: And they say this and that according to the way in which they came on that occasion. Moreover, on the first day of the rehearsal,

original: paṭhamaṃ pakatiyā āgantvā tato paraṃ ākāsamabbhuggantvā parisaṃ pattakāle tato otaritvā
analyzed: paṭhamam pakatiyāḥ āgantvā tatas param ākāsam abbhut gantvā parisam patta kāle tatas otaritvā
translated: and after that he rose up into the air and came down into the assembly when it was time for him to do so.

original: bhikkhupantiṃ apīḷento pathaviyaṃ nimujjitvā āsane attānaṃ dassesītipi vadanti. Yathā🔽vā tathā vā āgacchatu, āgamanākāramattaṃ na pamāṇaṃ, āgantvā gatakāle āyasmato mahākassapassa
analyzed: bhikkhu pantim a pīḷento pathaviyam nimujjitvā āsane attānam dassesi iti pi vadanti yathā  vā tathā vā āgacchatu āgamana ākāra mattam na pamāṇam āgantvā gata kāle āyasmataḥ mahākassapassa
translated: They say that he then entered the earth without pressing down on the bhikkhunī’s foot and appeared in his seat.

original: sādhukāradānameva pamāṇaṃ satthārā dātabbasādhukāradāneneva arahattappattiyā aññesampi
analyzed: sādhukāra dānam eva pamāṇam satthārā dātabba sādhukāra dānena iva arahatta ppattiyā aññesam pi
translated: But whether he came in this way or in some other way, the manner of his coming is not the criterion. The criterion is the venerable Mahā Kassapa’s receiving of the Master’s applause when he had come and gone. For the others’ attainment of Arahantship was announced by the Master’s giving of applause,

original: ñāpitattā, bhagavati dharamāne paṭiggahetabbāya ca pasaṃsāya therassa paṭiggahitattā.
analyzed: ñāpita ttā bhagavati dharamāne paṭiggahetabbāya ca pasaṃsāya therassa paṭiggahita ttā
translated: and the venerable one’s receiving of the Master’s applause when he was still holding it was because of the Master’s praise that was to be accepted.🔽So in order to show this he said “whether in this way or in some other way.”

original: Tasmā tamatthaṃ dassento “yathā vā”tiādimāha. Sabbatthāpīti sabbesupi tīsu vādesu.
analyzed: tasmā tam attham dassentaḥ yathā vā ti ādim āha sabbattha api iti sabbesu pi tīsu vādesu
translated: In all three cases: in all three statements.

original: Bhikkhū āmantesīti bhikkhū ālapīti ayamettha attho, aññatra pana ñāpanepi dissati
analyzed: bhikkhū āmantesi iti bhikkhū ālapi iti ayam ettha atthaḥ aññatra pana ñāpane pi dissati
translated: He addressed the bhikkhus: the meaning is that he spoke to the bhikkhus. But elsewhere it is found in the sense of announcing,

original: yathā “āmantayāmi vo bhikkhave, paṭivedayāmi vo bhikkhave”ti pakkosanepi dissati
