original: vutto. Tadaṭṭhakathāya ca “taṃ sabhāvaniruttiṃ saddaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā”tiādinā tassā🔽saddārammaṇatā dassitā. “Imassa atthassa ayaṃ saddo vācako”ti hi vacanavacanatthe🔽vavatthapetvā taṃ taṃ vacanatthavibhāvanavasena pavattito saddo “desanā”ti vuccati.
analyzed: vuttaḥ tad aṭṭhakathāya ca tam sabhāva niruttim saddam ārammaṇam katvā ati ādinā tassā  sadda ārammaṇa tā dassitā imassa atthassa ayam saddaḥ vācakaḥ ti hi vacana vacana atthe  vavatthapetvā tam tam vacana attha vibhāvana vasena pavattitaḥ saddo desanā ati vuccati
translated: and in the commentary on that passage it is shown that it has sound as its object with the words, “Taking as its object that sound which is the natural language of the people” .

original: “Adhippāyo”ti etena “desanāti paññattī”ti etaṃ vacanaṃ dhammaniruttābhilāpaṃ sandhāya🔽vuttaṃ, na tato vinimuttaṃ paññattiṃ sandhāyāti dasseti anekadhā atthasambhave attanā
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ ti etena desanā ati paññattī iti etam vacanam dhamma nirutta abhilāpam sandhāya  vuttam na tatas vinimuttam paññattim sandhāya ati dasseti anekadhā attha sambhave attanā
translated: For when a sound occurs distinguishing the meaning of a word and the meaning of a statement by the words “This sound is the name for this meaning,” it is called “teaching” .

original: adhippetatthasseva vuttattāti ayaṃ saddavādīnaṃ vādato vinicchayo.🔽Paññattivādīnaṃ vāde pana sammutiparamatthabhedassa atthassānurūpavācakabhāvena paramatthasaddesu
analyzed: adhippeta tthassa iva vutta ttā ti ayam sadda vādīnam vādataḥ vinicchayo  paññatti vādīnam vāde pana sammuti paramattha bhedassa paramattha saddesu
translated: By the word “intention” he shows that the words “Teaching is a description” are said with reference to the description of the sound that is the name for the thing, not with reference to a description that is separate from that.🔽For it is said only of the meaning intended by oneself, when there is a possibility of several meanings. This is the decision in the case of the proponents of sound.

original: bhagavatā manasā vavatthāpitā tantisaṅkhātā nāmapaññatti desanā nāma, “desanā”ti
analyzed: bhagavatā manasā vavatthāpitā tanti saṅkhātā nāma paññatti desanā nāma desanā ati
translated: But in the case of the proponents of description, the teaching is a description called a “name” that is mentally formulated by the Blessed One in the ultimate terms that are appropriate to the meaning to be described, which is divided into conventional and ultimate meanings. It is called “teaching” .

original: vā vuccatīti attho. Tadeva mūlakāraṇabhūtassa saddassa dassanavasena kāraṇūpacārena
analyzed: vā vuccati iti attho tat eva mūla kāraṇa bhūtassa saddassa dassana vasena kāraṇa upacārena
translated: the meaning is that it is called “a name.” In order to show that very sound, which is the root cause, by way of the designation of the cause,

original: dassetuṃ “yathādhammaṃ dhammābhilāpoti adhippāyo”ti vuttaṃ. Kiñcāpi hi “dhammābhilāpo”ti
analyzed: dassetum yathādhammam dhamma abhilāpo ti adhippāyaḥ ti vuttam kiñcā api hi dhamma abhilāpo ti
translated: it is said: “The intention is the expression of the ideas in accordance with the ideas.” For although in the expression “the expression of the ideas”

original: ettha abhilappati uccārīyatīti abhilāpoti saddo vuccati, na paṇṇatti, tathāpi sadde
analyzed: ettha abhilappati uccārīyati iti abhilāpo ti saddo vuccati na tathā api sadde
translated: the word is called “the expression” in the sense of “is expressed,” not the concept, nevertheless,

original: vuccamāne tadanurūpaṃ vohāraṃ gahetvā tena vohārena dīpitassa atthassa jānanato sadde
analyzed: vuccamāne tad anurūpam vohāram gahetvā tena vohārena dīpitassa atthassa jānanataḥ sadde
translated: when the word is expressed, one understands the meaning indicated by that expression, having taken up the usage in accordance with it. Thus, when the word is expressed,

original: kathite tadanurūpā paṇṇattipi kāraṇūpacārena kathitāyeva hoti. Apica “dhammābhilāpoti
analyzed: kathite tad anurūpā kāraṇa upacārena kathitāya iva hoti apica dhamma abhilāpo ti
translated: the concept in accordance with it is also expressed by way of the designation of the cause. Moreover, by saying “The intention is the expression of the ideas”

original: attho”ti avatvā “dhammābhilāpoti adhippāyo”ti vuttattā desanā nāma saddo na hotīti
analyzed: atthaḥ ti avatvā dhamma abhilāpo ti adhippāyo ti vutta ttā desanā nāma saddo na hoti iti
translated: instead of saying “The meaning is the expression of the ideas,” it is shown that the teaching is not a sound.

original: dīpitameva. Tena hi adhippāyamattameva mūlakāraṇasaddavasena kathitaṃ, na idha gahetabbo
analyzed: dīpitam eva tena hi adhippāya mattam eva mūla kāraṇa sadda vasena kathitam na idha gahetabbo
translated: For in that way only the mere intention is expressed by way of the root cause, the sound, and not the meaning of the expression “teaching” should be taken here.

original: “desanā”ti etassa atthoti ayaṃ paññattivādīnaṃ vādato vinicchayo. Atthantaramāha
analyzed: desanā ati etassa attho ti ayam paññatti vādīnam vādataḥ vinicchayaḥ atthantaram āha
translated: This is the decision regarding the doctrine of the theorists.

original: “anuloma…pe… kathana”nti, etena heṭṭhā vuttaṃ desanāsamuṭṭhāpakaṃ cittuppādaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: anuloma pe kathanan ti etena heṭṭhā vuttam desanā samuṭṭhāpakam cittuppādam dasseti
translated: “The kind of understanding that is in conformity with truth, etc., and the kind of expression that is in conformity with truth” : this shows the kind of consciousness that causes the teaching to be given as described above.

original: Kathīyati attho etenāti hi kathanaṃ. Ādisaddena nītaneyyādikā pāḷigatiyo, ekattādinandiyāvattādikā
analyzed: kathīyati atthaḥ etena ati hi kathanam ādi saddena nīta neyya ādikā pāḷi gatiyaḥ ekatta ādi nandiya avatta ādikā
translated: For “expression” is that by means of which the meaning is expressed. The word “etc.” includes the kinds of language, such as that which is direct, and the kinds of expression, such as that which is in accordance with unity, etc.

original: pāḷinissitā ca nayā saṅgahitā.
analyzed: pāḷinissitā ca nayā saṅgahitā
translated: and the kinds of expression that are based on the texts.🔽“Penetration” is the kind of knowledge by means of which one penetrates oneself, or by means of which one is penetrated.

original: Sayameva paṭivijjhati, etena vā paṭivijjhantīti paṭivedho, ñāṇaṃ. Tadeva abhisameti,🔽etena vā abhisamentīti abhisamayotipi vuccati. Idāni taṃ paṭivedhaṃ abhisamayappabhedato,
analyzed: sayam eva paṭivijjhati etena vā paṭivijjhanti iti paṭivedhaḥ ñāṇam tat eva abhisameti  etena vā abhisamenti iti vuccati idāni tam paṭivedham abhisamaya ppabhedato
translated: And that is called “direct realization” because one realizes oneself, or because one is realized. Now, in order to make that penetration clear by way of the kinds of direct realization,

original: abhisamayākārato, ārammaṇato, sabhāvato ca pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ “so cā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha🔽hi lokiyalokuttaroti pabhedato, visayato, asammohatoti ākārato, dhammesu, atthesu,
analyzed: abhisamaya ākārato ārammaṇato sabhāvato ca pākaṭam kātum so ca atiādi vuttam tattha  hi lokiya lokuttaraḥ ti pabhedataḥ visayataḥ asammohato ti ākārataḥ dhammesu atthesu
translated: by way of the aspects of direct realization, by way of the object, and by way of the individual essence, he said, “And that is of two kinds, mundane and supramundane” , etc. Herein,

original: paññattīsūti ārammaṇato, atthānurūpaṃ, dhammānurūpaṃ, paññattipathānurūpanti sabhāvato
analyzed: paññattīsu iti ārammaṇataḥ attha anurūpam dhamma anurūpam paññatti patha anurūpam ti sabhāvataḥ
translated: it is of two kinds as mundane and supramundane, by way of division. It is of two kinds as having an object and as having no object, by way of object. It is of two kinds as knowledge and as vision, by way of aspect. It is of two kinds as concerned with the ultimate and as concerned with the conventional, by way of object. It is of two kinds as concerned with meaning and as concerned with the letter, by way of object. It is of two kinds as concerned with the individual essence and as concerned with the relative, by way of object. It is of two kinds as concerned with the specific nature and as concerned with the general nature, by way of object. It is of two kinds as concerned with the specific characteristic and as concerned with the general characteristic, by way of object. It is of two kinds as concerned with the individual and as concerned with the universal, by way of object. It is of two kinds as concerned with the internal and as concerned with the external, by way of object. It is of two kinds as concerned with the specific and as concerned with the general, by way of object. It is of two kinds as concerned with the past, future, and present, and as concerned with the unconditioned, by way of object. It is of two kinds as concerned with the three times and as not so concerned, by way of object. It is of two

original: ca pākaṭaṃ karoti. Tattha visayato atthādianurūpaṃ dhammādīsu avabodho nāma avijjādidhammārammaṇo,🔽saṅkhārādiatthārammaṇo, tadubhayapaññāpanārammaṇo ca lokiyo abhisamayo. Asammohato
analyzed: ca pākaṭam karoti tattha visayataḥ attha ādi anurūpam dhamma ādīsu avabodhaḥ nāma avijjā ādi dhamma ārammaṇaḥ  saṅkhāra ādi attha ārammaṇo tad ubhaya paññāpana ārammaṇo ca lokiyaḥ abhisamayaḥ a sammohato
translated: and he makes it evident. Herein, understanding of ideas, etc., according to the meaning, etc., by way of province is mundane direct-knowledge, which has as its object ideas such as ignorance, etc.,

original: atthādianurūpaṃ dhammādīsu avabodho nāma nibbānārammaṇo maggasampayutto yathāvuttadhammatthapaññattīsu🔽sammohaviddhaṃsano lokuttaro abhisamayo. Tathā hi “ayaṃ hetu, idamassa phalaṃ, ayaṃ
analyzed: attha ādi anurūpam dhamma ādīsu avabodhaḥ nāma nibbāna ārammaṇaḥ magga sampayuttaḥ yathāvutta dhammattha paññattīsu  sammoha viddha ṃsanaḥ lokuttaraḥ abhisamayaḥ tathā hi ayam hetu idam assa phalam ayam
translated: and the meaning such as determinations, etc., and the expression of both those last. Understanding of ideas, etc., according to the meaning, etc., by way of non-delusion is supramundane direct-knowledge, which has as its object extinction and is associated with the path and is the abandoning of delusion about the ideas, meanings, and expressions stated above.

original: tadubhayānurūpo vohāro”ti evaṃ ārammaṇakaraṇavasena lokiyañāṇaṃ visayato paṭivijjhati,
analyzed: tad ubhaya anurūpaḥ vohāraḥ ti evam ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena lokiya ñāṇam visayataḥ paṭivijjhati
translated: For it is thus that mundane knowledge penetrates by way of province, making its object the expression of the kind ‘ This is the cause, this is the fruit, this is the kind of talk that is appropriate to both of them ’ ;

original: lokuttarañāṇaṃ pana tesu hetuhetuphalādīsu sammohassañāṇena samucchinnattā asammohato
analyzed: lokuttara ñāṇam pana tesu hetu hetu phala ādīsu sammoha ssa ñāṇena samucchinna ttā asammohataḥ
translated: but supramundane knowledge penetrates by way of non-delusion because the knowledge of the cause, fruit, etc., has cut out delusion about them.

original: paṭivijjhati. Lokuttaro pana paṭivedho visayato nibbānassa, asammohato ca itarassātipi vadanti eke.
analyzed: paṭivijjhati lokuttaraḥ pana paṭivedhaḥ visayataḥ nibbānassa asammohato ca itarassa ati pi vadanti eke
translated: Some say that supramundane penetration penetrates by way of province the extinction, and by way of non-delusion the rest.

original: Atthānurūpaṃ dhammesūti “avijjā hetu, saṅkhārā hetusamuppannā, saṅkhāre uppādeti🔽avijjā”ti evaṃ kāriyānurūpaṃ kāraṇesūti attho. Atha vā “puññābhisaṅkhāraapuññābhisaṅkhāraāneñjābhisaṅkhāresu🔽tīsu apuññābhisaṅkhārassa avijjā sampayuttapaccayo, itaresaṃ yathānurūpa”ntiādinā
analyzed: attha anurūpam dhammesu iti avijjā hetu saṅkhārāḥ hetu samuppannā saṅkhāre uppādeti  avijjā ti evam kāriyā anurūpam kāraṇesu iti atthaḥ atha vā puñña abhisaṅkhāra apuñña abhisaṅkhāra āneñja abhisaṅkhāresu  tīsu apuñña abhisaṅkhārassa avijjā sampayutta paccayaḥ itaresam yathā anurūpam ti ādinā
translated: As to ideas according to their meaning, in the way beginning, “Ignorance is a cause, determinations are a cause, determinations have ignorance as their cause” .🔽Or else the meaning is that there is penetration as to causes according to their function, in the way beginning, “In the case of the three kinds of determinations, namely, meritorious, demeritorious, and imperturbable determinations,🔽ignorance is a condition by the conditionality of conascence, etc., for the demeritorious determinations, and for the other two kinds according as applicable” .

original: kāriyānurūpaṃ kāraṇesu paṭivedhotipi attho. Dhammānurūpaṃ atthesūti “avijjāpaccayā
analyzed: kāriya anurūpam kāraṇesu paṭivedhaḥ ti pi attho dhamma anurūpam atthesu ti avijjā paccayā
translated: As to ideas according to their meaning, in the way beginning, “With ignorance as condition there are determinations” ,🔽there is penetration as to functions according to their causes.

original: saṅkhārā”tiādinā kāraṇānurūpaṃ kāriyesu. Chabbidhāya paññattiyā patho paññattipatho,
analyzed: saṅkhāra ati ādinā kāraṇa anurūpam kāriyesu chabbidhāya paññattiyā patho paññatti patho
translated: The Path is the Mode of Conveying a Teaching.

original: tassa anurūpaṃ tathā, paññattiyā vuccamānadhammānurūpaṃ paññattīsu avabodhoti attho.
analyzed: tassa anurūpam tathā paññattiyā vuccamāna dhamma anurūpam paññattīsu avabodhaḥ ti attho
translated: The meaning is that there is penetration as to the ideas taught according as they are taught in the Modes of Conveying a Teaching.

original: Abhisamayato aññampi paṭivedhatthaṃ dassetuṃ “tesa”ntiādimāha. Paṭivijjhīyatīti paṭivedhoti
analyzed: abhisamayataḥ aññam pi paṭivedha attham dassetum tesam ti ādim āha paṭivijjhīyati iti paṭivedhaḥ ti
translated: In order to show that there is penetration for the purpose of further penetration besides that of the four kinds of exactness, he said “in each case” .

original: hi taṃtaṃrūpādidhammānaṃ aviparītasabhāvo vuccati. Tattha tatthāti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ
analyzed: hi taṃ taṃ rūpa ādi dhammānam aviparīta sabhāvaḥ vuccati tattha tattha ati tasmin tasmin
translated: For penetration is said to be the unperverted individual essence of the various ideas beginning with form.🔽Herein, in each case means in each of the four kinds of exactness.

original: piṭake, pāḷipadese vā. Salakkhaṇasaṅkhātoti ruppananamanaphusanādisakasakalakkhaṇasaṅkhāto.
analyzed: piṭake pāḷi padese vā sa lakkhaṇa saṅkhāto ti ruppana namana phusana ādi saka saka lakkhaṇa saṅkhāto
translated: in the three Piṭakas or in the Pādaṭṭhāna. The meaning of “character” is the meaning of the individual essences of the various dhammas, such as material form, feeling, etc.

original: Yathāvuttehi dhammādīhi piṭakānaṃ gambhīrabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “idānī”tiādimāha. Dhammajātanti
analyzed: yathā vuttehi dhamma ādīhi piṭakānam gambhīra bhāvam dassetuṃ idāni iti ādim āha dhamma jātan ti
translated: In order to show the profundity of the Piṭakas by means of the dhammas, etc., as stated above, he says, “Now, as to the profundity of the Piṭakas.” The “class of dhammas” is

original: kāraṇappabhedo, kāraṇameva vā. Atthajātanti kāriyappabhedo, kāriyameva vā. Yā cāyaṃ🔽desanāti sambandho. Tadatthavijānanavasena abhimukho hoti. Yo cetthāti yo etāsu taṃ
analyzed: kāraṇa ppabhedaḥ kāraṇam eva vā attha jātanti kāriya ppabhedaḥ kāriyam eva vā yā ca ayam  sambandho tad attha vijānana vasena abhimukhaḥ hoti yaḥ ca itthā ati yaḥ etāsu tam
translated: a classification by way of cause, or it is the cause itself. The “class of meanings” is a classification by way of effect, or it is the effect itself. And this

original: taṃ piṭakāgatāsu dhammatthadesanāsu paṭivedho, yo ca etesu piṭakesu tesaṃ tesaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: tam piṭaka āgatāsu dhamma attha desanāsu paṭivedhaḥ yaḥ ca etesu piṭakesu tesam tesam dhammānam
translated: is the connection: by means of the knowledge of their meaning, he is face to face with the dhammas. “And the penetration of the dhammas” means the penetration of the various dhammas found in the various Piṭakas. “And the unperverted nature of the dhammas” means their true nature.

original: aviparītasabhāvoti attho. Sambharitabbato kusalameva sambhāro, so sammā anupacito
analyzed: aviparīta sabhāvaḥ ti attho sambharitabbataḥ kusalam eva sambhāro saḥ sammā an upacito
translated: The accumulation is only the wholesome, because it is to be accumulated. When it is properly accumulated,

original: yehi te anupacitakusalasambhārā, tatova duppaññehi, nippaññehīti attho. Na hi paññavato,
analyzed: yehi te anupacita kusala sambhārā tatas va duppaññehi nippaññehi iti atthaḥ na hi paññavataḥ
translated: those who have not accumulated the wholesome are called “unwise” . The meaning is: those who are not wise. For the unwise,

original: paññāya vā duṭṭhubhāvo dūsitabhāvo ca sambhavatīti nippaññattāyeva duppaññā yathā
analyzed: paññāya vā duṭṭhu bhāvaḥ dūsita bhāvaḥ ca sambhavati iti nippaññattāya iva duppaññā yathā
translated: or for wisdom, there is no possibility of perversion or corruption. Because of their unwisdom, they are unwise.

original: “dussīlo”ti. Ettha ca avijjāsaṅkhārādīnaṃ dhammatthānaṃ duppaṭivijjhatāya dukkhogāhatā,
analyzed: dussīlaḥ ti ettha ca avijjā saṅkhāra ādīnam dhammatthānam duppaṭivijjha tāya dukkha ugāha tā
translated: and “unvirtuous” . And here the meaning is hard to penetrate because of the difficulty of penetrating the states beginning with ignorance and formations,

original: tesaṃ paññāpanassa dukkarabhāvato taṃdesanāya, abhisamayasaṅkhātassa paṭivedhassa🔽uppādanavisayīkaraṇānaṃ asakkuṇeyyattā, aviparītasabhāvasaṅkhātassa paṭivedhassa
analyzed: tesam paññāpanassa dukkara bhāvataḥ tad desanāya abhisamaya saṅkhātassa paṭivedhassa  uppādana visayīkaraṇānam a sakkuṇeyya ttā a viparīta sabhāva saṅkhātassa paṭivedhassa
translated: because of the difficulty of teaching them, and because of the impossibility of making the penetration called “direct-knowledge” the province of the arising of the knowledge of these states,

original: dubbiññeyyatāya dukkhogāhatā veditabbā. Evampīti pi-saddo pubbe vuttaṃ pakārantaraṃ
analyzed: dubbiññeyya tāya dukkha ugāha tā veditabbā evam pi iti pi saddaḥ pubbe vuttam pakāra antaram
translated: and because of the difficulty of knowing the penetration called “the true individual essence” . This is how the meaning should be understood as hard to penetrate.🔽The word “also” in the phrase “and also” combines what has been said above with what follows.

original: sampiṇḍeti. Evaṃ paṭhamagāthāya anūnaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ paridīpitatthabhāvaṃ dassento “ettāvatā”tiādimāha.🔽“Siddhe hi satyārambho atthantaraviññāpanāya vā hoti, niyamāya vā”ti iminā punārambhavacanena
analyzed: sampiṇḍa iti evam paṭhama gāthāya anūnam paripuṇṇam paridīpita attha bhāvam dassentaḥ ettāvatā ati ādim āha  siddhe hi sati ārambhaḥ atthantara viññāpanāya vā hoti niyamāya vā ati iminā puna ārambha vacanena
translated: And showing that the meaning of the first stanza is complete without anything lacking, he said “So far” .

original: anūnaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ paridīpitatthabhāvaṃ dasseti. Ettāvatāti paricchedatthe nipāto,
analyzed: anūnam paripuṇṇam paridīpita attha bhāvam dasseti ettāvatā iti pariccheda tthe nipātaḥ
translated: For “when a matter is established, the beginning of a new statement is either for the purpose of showing another meaning or for the purpose of a rule” . So by this new statement he shows that the meaning of the teaching is complete without anything lacking. The particle “so far” is in the sense of a limit.

original: ettakena vacanakkamenāti attho. Etaṃ vā parimāṇaṃ yassāti ettāvaṃ, tena, etaparimāṇavatā
analyzed: ettakena vacana kkamena ati attho etam vā parimāṇam yassa ati ettāvam tena eta parimāṇavatā
translated: The meaning is: by this much of the expression. Or else, he who has this much of a measure is “ettāvaṃ”;

original: saddatthakkamenāti attho. “Sadde hi vutte tadatthopi vuttoyeva nāmā”ti vadanti. Vutto
analyzed: sadda ttha kkamena ati attho sadde hi vutte tad atthaḥ pi vuttaḥ yeva nāma ati vadanti vuttaḥ
translated: the meaning is: by one who has this much of a measure of the expression of the meaning of the words. For they say: “When the words are uttered, the meaning is also uttered.”

original: saṃvaṇṇito attho yassāti vuttatthā.🔽Etthāti etissā gāthāya. Evaṃ attho, vinicchayoti vā seso. Tīsu piṭakesūti ettha “ekekasmi”nti
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇitaḥ atthaḥ yassa ati vutta tthā  ettha ati etissā gāthāya evam atthaḥ vinicchayo ti vā sesaḥ tīsu piṭakesu iti ettha eka ekasmin ti
translated: He who has the meaning uttered, praised, is “vuttattho.”🔽“Etthā” means “in this verse.” The meaning is: “thus.” Or else, the remainder is: “in the Vinaya.”🔽“In the three Piṭakas” here should be understood as “in each one”

original: adhikārato, pakaraṇato vā veditabbaṃ. “Ekamekasmiñcetthā”ti hi heṭṭhā vuttaṃ. Atha
analyzed: adhikārataḥ pakaraṇataḥ vā veditabbam ekam ekasmin ca itthā iti hi heṭṭhā vuttam atha
translated: by implication or by the method of the text. For it is said below: “In each one of these.”

original: vā vatticchānupubbikattā saddapaṭipattiyā niddhāraṇamidha avattukāmena ādhāroyeva
analyzed: vā sadda paṭipattiyāḥ niddhāraṇam idha a vattu kāmena
translated: Or else, since the expression of the words is in the order of the letters, the basis is stated here by one who wishes to express it.

original: vutto. Na cettha codetabbaṃ “tīsuyeva piṭakesu tividho pariyattibhedo daṭṭhabbo siyā”ti
analyzed: vuttaḥ na ca ittha codetabbam tīsu yeva piṭakesu tividhaḥ pariyatti bhedaḥ daṭṭhabbo siyāti
translated: One should not object here: “The threefold division of the tradition should be seen in the three Piṭakas only.”

original: samudāyavasena vuttassāpi vākyassa avayavādhippāyasambhavato. Dissati hi avayavavākyanipphatti
analyzed: samudāya vasena vuttassa api vākyassa avayava adhippāya sambhavataḥ dissati hi avayava vākya nipphatti
translated: Because it is possible that the sentence stated by way of the whole has the individual as its purport. For the individual sentence is seen to be produced

original: “brāhmaṇādayo bhuñjantū”tiādīsu, tasmā alamatipapañcena. Yathā attho na virujjhati,
analyzed: brāhmaṇa ādayaḥ bhuñjantu uti ādīsu tasmai alam atipapañcena yathā atthaḥ na virujjhati
translated: In such passages as “Let brahmans, etc., eat,” etc. Therefore enough of this over-elaboration.

original: tathāyeva gahetabboti. Evaṃ sabbattha. Pariyattibhedoti pariyāpuṇanaṃ pariyatti.🔽Pariyāpuṇanavācako hettha pariyattisaddo, na pana pāḷipariyāyo, tasmā pariyāpuṇanappakāroti
analyzed: tathāya iva gahetabbaḥ ti evam sabbattha pariyatti bhedaḥ ti pariyāpuṇanam pariyatti  pariyāpuṇana vācakaḥ ha ittha pariyatti saddaḥ na pana pāḷi pariyāyaḥ tasmā pariyāpuṇana pakāraḥ ti
translated: It should be taken just as the meaning is not contradicted. So in all cases.🔽As to the analysis of the learning: learning is the learning of the texts.

original: attho. Atha vā tīhi pakārehi pariyāpuṇitabbā pāḷiyo eva “pariyattī”ti vuccanti. Tathā🔽ceva abhidhammaṭṭhakathāya sīhaḷagaṇṭhipade vuttanti vadanti. Evampi hi alagaddūpamāpariyāpuṇanayogato🔽“alagaddūpamā pariyattī”ti pāḷipi sakkā vattuṃ. Evañca katvā “duggahitā upārambhādihetu
analyzed: atthaḥ atha vā tīhi pakārehi pariyāpuṇitabbā pāḷiyaḥ eva pariyattī iti vuccanti tathā  ca iva abhidhamma ṭṭhakathāya sīha ḷagaṇṭhi pade vuttanti vadanti evam pi hi a lagat dūpamā pariyāpuṇana yogataḥ  sakkā vattum evam ca katvā upārambha ādi hetu
translated: The word pariyatti here is a word for learning, not for the collection of texts. So the meaning is: the way of learning. Or alternatively, the texts that have to be learned in three ways are called “the learning.”🔽And they say that this is so because it is stated in the Sinhalese Commentaries.🔽For in that way it is possible to speak of the texts as “the learning that is like the simile of the eel.”

original: pariyāpuṭā alagaddūpamā”ti parato niddesavacanampi upapannaṃ hoti. Tattha hi pāḷiyeva
analyzed: pariyāpuṭā a lagat dūpamā ti paratas niddesa vacanam pi upapannam hoti tattha hi pāḷiyā iva
translated: And when it is put like this, the description in the Niddesa of the learning as “mislearned, misapprehended, like the simile of the eel”

original: “duggahitā, pariyāpuṭā”ti ca vattuṃ yuttā.
analyzed: duggahitā pariyāpuṭā ati ca vattum yuttā
translated: is appropriate. For there it is proper to speak only of the texts as “mislearned” and “misapprehended.”

original: Alagaddo alagaddaggahaṇaṃ upamā etissāti alagaddūpamā. Alagaddassa gahaṇañhettha🔽alagaddasaddena vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Āpūpikoti ettha āpūpa-saddena āpūpakhādanaṃ
analyzed: alagaddaḥ alagadda gahaṇam upamā etissa ati alagaddu upamā alagaddassa gahaṇam ha itthā  alagadda saddena vuttanti daṭṭhabbam āpūpiko ti ettha āpūpa saddena āpūpa khādanam
translated: The simile of the snake’s seizing is the simile of the snake’s seizing, since the simile is of the snake’s seizing. For the seizing of the snake is🔽spoken of here by the word “snake.” As in the case of the word “cake” in the🔽phrase “one who eats cakes” , and as in the case of the word “lute” in the

original: viya, veṇikoti ettha vīṇāsaddena vīṇāvādanaggahaṇaṃ viya ca. Alagaddaggahaṇena hi🔽pariyatti upamīyati, na alagaddena. “Alagaddaggahaṇūpamā”ti vā vattabbe majjhepadalopaṃ
analyzed: viya veṇikaḥ ti ettha vīṇā saddena vīṇā vādana ggahaṇam viya ca a lagadda ggahaṇena hi  upamīyati na alagaddena vā vattabbe majjhe pada lopam
translated: phrase “one who plays the lute.” For the learning is compared to the seizing🔽of the snake, not to the snake. Or else, although it should be said “the simile🔽of the seizing of the snake,” the middle term is omitted, as in the case of the

original: katvā “alagaddūpamā”ti vuttaṃ “oṭṭhamukho”tiādīsu viya. Alagaddoti ca āsīviso vuccati.
analyzed: katvā alagaddūpamā iti vuttam oṭṭhamukho ti ādīsu viya alagaddo ti ca āsīvisaḥ vuccati
translated: phrase “one with a mouth like a pot” . And the word “snake” is used to refer🔽to the poisonous snake.🔽For “poison” is a name for the snake’s poison, and that is complete, fully

original: Gadoti hi visassa nāmaṃ, tañca tassa alaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ atthi, tasmā alaṃ pariyatto🔽paripuṇṇo gado assāti alagaddo anunāsikalopaṃ, da-kārāgamañca katvā, alaṃ vā jīvitaharaṇe
analyzed: gado ti hi visassa nāmam tat ca tassa alam paripuṇṇam atthi tasmai alam pariyattaḥ  paripuṇṇaḥ gadaḥ assa ati alagaddaḥ anunāsika lopam dakāra āgamam ca katvā alam vā jīvita haraṇe
translated: developed, in it, thus it is a snake with poison complete, fully developed.🔽Or it is a snake with poison that is able to take away life, by the omission of🔽the nasal sound and the addition of the dental . The meaning, the purpose,

original: samattho gado yassāti alagaddo vuttanayena. Vaṭṭadukkhato nissaraṇaṃ attho payojanametissāti
analyzed: samatthaḥ gadaḥ yassa ti alagaddaḥ vutta nayena vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ nissaraṇam attho payojanam etissa ati
translated: of this is the escape from the suffering of the round.

original: nissaraṇatthā. Bhaṇḍāgāre niyutto bhaṇḍāgāriko, rājaratanānupālako, so viyāti tathā,
analyzed: nissaraṇa atthā bhaṇḍāgāre niyuttaḥ bhaṇḍāgārikaḥ rāja ratana anupālako saḥ viyāti tathā
translated: for the purpose of escape. Appointed to the storehouse is the storehouse-keeper, the guardian of the king’s treasures, he is like that, thus,

original: dhammaratanānupālako khīṇāsavo. Aññamatthamanapekkhitvā bhaṇḍāgārikasseva sato pariyatti
analyzed: dhamma ratana anupālakaḥ khīṇa āsavaḥ aññam attham an apekkhitvā bhaṇḍāgārikassa iva sataḥ pariyatti
translated: It is for the purpose of escape. The store-keeper is one appointed to a store, a royal treasure-keeper. He is like that, thus he is a store-keeper. The one who has destroyed the taints is a treasure-keeper of the treasure of the Dhamma. The learning of the store-keeper,

original: bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti.🔽Duggahitāti duṭṭhu gahitā. Tadeva sarūpato niyametuṃ “upārambhādihetu pariyāpuṭā”ti
analyzed: bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti  duggahitā ati duṭṭhu gahitā tat eva sarūpataḥ niyametum upārambha ādi hetu pariyāpuṭā ti
translated: which is the learning of the store-keeper, is the learning of the store-keeper.

original: āha, upārambhaitivādappamokkhādihetu uggahitāti attho. Lābhasakkārādihetu pariyāpuṇanampi
analyzed: āha upārambha etivāda ppamokkha ādi hetu uggahitā ati atthaḥ lābha sakkāra ādi hetu pariyāpuṇanam pi
translated: Misunderstood: badly grasped. In order to define that itself in its own-nature, he said, “because of the cause of dispute, etc., it is a wrapping.” The meaning is: because of the cause of dispute, of the escape from the assertion, etc., it is grasped. The learning which is memorized because of the cause of gain, honour, etc.,

original: ettheva saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Vuttañhetaṃ alagaddasuttaṭṭhakathāyaṃ –🔽“Yo buddhavacanaṃ uggahetvā ‘evaṃ cīvarādīni vā labhissāmi, catuparisamajjhe vā maṃ
analyzed: ettha iva saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbam vuttam ha etam alagadda sutta ṭṭhakathāyam  yaḥ buddha vacanam uggahetvā evam cīvara ādīni vā labhissāmi catu parisamajjhe vā mama
translated: should be regarded as included here too. For this is said in the commentary to the Alagaddūpama Sutta:

original: jānissantī’ti lābhasakkārahetu pariyāpuṇāti, tassa sā pariyatti alagaddapariyatti
analyzed: jānissanti iti lābha sakkāra hetu pariyāpuṇāti tassa sā pariyatti a lagadda pariyatti
translated: “One who memorizes the word of the Buddha and memorizes it because of the cause of gain and honour, thinking ‘Thus I will get robes, etc., or people in the four assemblies will know me,’ his learning is called the learning of the crocodile.

original: nāma. Evaṃ pariyāpuṇanato hi buddhavacanaṃ apariyāpuṇitvā niddokkamanaṃ varatara”nti.
analyzed: nāma evam pariyāpuṇanataḥ hi buddha vacanam a pariyāpuṇitvā niddokkamanam varataranti
translated: For by memorizing in this way, it is better to throw away the word of the Buddha without memorizing it at all.”

original: Nanu ca alagaddaggahaṇūpamā pariyatti “alagaddūpamā”ti vuccati, evañca sati suggahitāpi🔽pariyatti “alagaddūpamā”ti vattuṃ vaṭṭati tatthāpi alagaddaggahaṇassa upamābhāvena
analyzed: nanu ca alagat dagga haṇu upamā pariyatti alagat dūpamā ati vuccati evam ca sati suggahitā api  vattum vaṭṭati tattha api upamā bhāvena
translated: But is not the learning likened to the seizing of a snake, called “the simile of the seizing of a snake”? And if that is so, then it is proper to call the learning “the simile of the seizing of a snake” even when it is well taken up.🔽For there too the seizing of the snake is a simile.🔽

original: pāḷiyaṃ vuttattā. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: pāḷiyam vuttattā vuttam ha etam
translated: But is not the learning similed to the catching of an eel called “the learning similed to the catching of an eel”? And so it is right to say that even the learning that is well learned is similed to the catching of an eel. For in that case the catching of the eel is stated in the text as a simile because it is a simile for the learning. For this is said:

original: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso alagaddatthiko alagaddagavesī alagaddapariyesanaṃ
analyzed: seyyathāpi bhikkhave purisaḥ alagaddatthikaḥ alagadda gavesī alagadda pariyesanam
translated: “Bhikkhus, suppose a man needing a crocodile, seeking a crocodile, wandering in search of a crocodile,

original: caramāno, so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ, tamenaṃ ajapadena daṇḍena suniggahitaṃ
analyzed: caramānaḥ saḥ passeyya mahantam alagaddam tam enam aja padena daṇḍena su niggahitam
translated: were to cut down a large tree on the bank of a river and leave it there, and a large crocodile seized it.

original: niggaṇheyya, ajapadena daṇḍena suniggahitaṃ niggahitvā gīvāya suggahitaṃ gaṇheyya.
analyzed: niggaṇheyya aja padena daṇḍena su niggahitam niggahitvā gīvāya suggahitam gaṇheyya
translated: Then the man might catch hold of it by the tail, saying: ‘This crocodile is swift and strong, and if he goes into the water and dives, he will get away from me, but if I keep him on land I can do what I like with him.’

original: Kiñcāpi so bhikkhave, alagaddo tassa purisassa hatthaṃ vā bāhaṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ
analyzed: kiñca api saḥ bhikkhave alagaddaḥ tassa purisassa hattham vā bāham vā aññataram vā aṅga paccaṅgam
translated: And though that crocodile might wrap his coils round that man’s hand or arm or some other part of his body,

original: bhogehi paliveṭheyya. Atha kho so neva tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigaccheyya maraṇamattaṃ
analyzed: bhogehi paliveṭheyya atha kho saḥ na iva tatonidānam maraṇam vā nigaccheyya maraṇa mattam
translated: yet he would not on that account come to death or deadly suffering.

original: vā dukkhaṃ. Taṃ kissa hetu, suggahitattā bhikkhave, alagaddassa. Evameva kho bhikkhave,
analyzed: vā dukkham tam kissa hetu suggahita ttā bhikkhave alagaddassa evam eva kho bhikkhave
translated: or it is painful. And why? Because the crocodile was wrongly seized. So too, bhikkhus,

original: idhekacce kulaputtā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti suttaṃ geyya”ntiādi.
analyzed: idha ekacce kula puttāḥ dhammam pariyāpuṇanti suttam geyya ntiādi
translated: here some clansmen learn the Dhamma … in brief and in detail.”

original: Tasmā idha duggahitā eva pariyatti alagaddūpamāti ayaṃ viseso kuto viññāyati, yena
analyzed: tasmai eva ayam viseso kutas viññāyati yena
translated: So how is it known that the distinction here is that only the learning that is wrongly grasped is like the crocodile?

original: duggahitā upārambhādihetu pariyāpuṭā “alagaddūpamā”ti vuccatīti? Saccametaṃ, idaṃ🔽pana pārisesañāyena vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tathā hi nissaraṇatthabhaṇḍāgārikapariyattīnaṃ🔽visuṃ gahitattā pārisesato alagaddassa duggahaṇūpamāyeva pariyatti “alagaddūpamā”ti
analyzed: duggahitā upārambha ādi hetu pariyāpuṭā vuccati iti saccam etam idam  pana pārisesa ñāyena vuttanti daṭṭhabbam tathā hi nissaraṇa attha bhaṇḍa āgārika pariyattīnam  visum gahita ttā pārisesataḥ alagaddassa duggahaṇa upamāya iva alagaddūpamā ti
translated: And why is the learning that is wrongly grasped called “like the crocodile” because of the reason of the dispute, etc.?🔽This is true, but it should be regarded as stated by way of a remainder,🔽for the learning that is the storehouse of the escape from suffering is stated separately as “like the right seizure of the crocodile.”

original: viññāyati. Alagaddassa suggahaṇūpamā hi pariyatti nissaraṇatthā vā hoti, bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti
analyzed: viññāyati alagaddassa su gahaṇa upamā hi pariyatti nissaraṇa atthā vā hoti bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti
translated: So it is only the learning that is wrongly grasped that is like the crocodile. For the learning that is like the right seizure of the crocodile is either the learning that is the storehouse of the escape from suffering or the learning that is the storehouse of the Dhamma.

original: vā. Tasmā suvuttametaṃ “duggahitā…pe… pariyattī”ti. Idāni tamatthaṃ pāḷiyā sādhento
analyzed: vā tasmā su vuttam etam duggahi tāpe iti idāni tam attham pāḷiyā sādhentaḥ
translated: So it is rightly said that the learning that is wrongly grasped is like the crocodile. Now, in order to establish that meaning, he said:

original: “yaṃ sandhāyā”tiādimāha. Tattha yanti yaṃ pariyattiduggahaṇaṃ. Majjhimanikāye mūlapaṇṇāsake
analyzed: yam sandhāya ati ādim āha tattha yanti yam majjhima nikāye mūla paṇṇāsake
translated: In the Majjhima Nikāya, in the Mūlapaṇṇāsaka,

original: alagaddasutte bhagavatā vuttaṃ.🔽Alagaddatthikoti āsīvisena, āsīvisaṃ vā atthiko, alagaddaṃ gavesati pariyesati sīlenāti
analyzed: alagadda sutte bhagavatā vuttam  alagaddatthikaḥ iti āsīvisena āsīvisam vā atthikaḥ alagaddam gavesati pariyesati sīlena ati
translated: it is said by the Blessed One in the Alagaddūpama Sutta.🔽“Alagaddatthiko” means “one who is in need of a snake” or “one who is in need of a cobra”, he seeks for a cobra, he searches for a cobra.

original: alagaddagavesī. Alagaddapariyesanaṃ caramānoti āsīvisapariyesanatthaṃ caramāno. Tadatthe
analyzed: alagadda gavesī alagadda pariyesanam caramāno ti āsīvisa pariyesana attham caramāno tad atthe
translated: “Alagaddagavesī” means “one who seeks for a cobra”. “Alagaddapariyesanaṃ caramāno” means “one who is searching for a cobra”. This is a reflexive pronoun,

original: hetaṃ paccattavacanaṃ, upayogavacanaṃ vā, alagaddapariyesanaṭṭhānaṃ vā caramāno.
analyzed: paccatta vacanam upayoga vacanam vā alagadda pariyesana ṭhānam vā caramāno
translated: or it is a pronoun of use, or it is a place where one searches for a cobra.

original: Alagaddaṃ pariyesanti etthāti hi alagaddapariyesanaṃ. Tamenanti taṃ alagaddaṃ. Bhogeti
analyzed: alagaddam pariyesanti ettha ati hi alagadda pariyesanam tam enanti tam alagaddam bhogeti
translated: “Alagaddapariyesanaṃ” means “a search for a cobra”. “Tamenā” means “by that cobra”. “Bhoge” means

original: sarīre. “Bhogo tu phaṇino tanū”ti hi vuttaṃ. Bhujīyati kuṭilaṃ karīyatīti bhogo.
analyzed: sarīre bhogaḥ tu phaṇinaḥ hi vuttam bhujīyati kuṭilam karīyati iti bhogaḥ
translated: in the body. For it is said: “Bhogo tu phaṇino tanū” . “Bhogo” means “that which is coiled up”.

original: Tassāti purisassa. Hatthe vā bāhāya vāti sambandho. Maṇibandhato paṭṭhāya yāva agganakhā
analyzed: tassa iti purisassa hatthe vā bāhāya vā ati sambandhaḥ maṇibandhataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva agga nakhā
translated: “Tassā” means “of that man”. “Hatthe vā bāhāya vā” means “from the wrist to the tip of the fingernail”.

original: hattho. Saddhiṃ aggabāhāya avasesā bāhā, katthaci pana kapparato paṭṭhāya yāva agganakhā
analyzed: hattho saddhim agga bāhāya avasesāḥ bāhā katthaci pana kappa rataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva agga nakhā
translated: Hand. The rest of the arm, except for the upper arm, is called “hand” in some places, and from the wrist down to the tip of the fingernail is called “hand” in other places.

original: “hattho”ti vuttaṃ bāhāya visuṃ anāgatattā. Vuttalakkhaṇaṃ hatthañca bāhañca ṭhapetvā🔽avasesaṃ sarīraṃ aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ. Tatonidānanti tannidānaṃ, taṃkāraṇāti attho. Taṃ
analyzed: hattho ti vuttam bāhāya visum anāgata ttā vutta lakkhaṇam hattham ca bāham ca ṭhapetvā  avasesam sarīram aṅga paccaṅgam tatonidānam ti tad nidānam taṃkāraṇā ati
translated: “Hand” is mentioned separately from “arm” because it is not included in the arm.🔽Except for the hand and the arm, the rest of the body is “limbs and minor parts of the body.”🔽“Because of that” means “because of that cause,” “because of that reason.”

original: hatthādīsu ḍaṃsanaṃ nidānaṃ kāraṇaṃ etassāti “tannidāna”nti hi vattabbe “tatonidāna”nti
analyzed: hattha ādīsu ḍaṃsanam nidānam kāraṇam etassa ati tat nidānam ti hi vattabbe tatonidānam ti
translated: “Because of that” should be said, but “because of that cause” is said.

original: purimapade paccattatthe nissakkavacanaṃ katvā, tassa ca lopamakatvā niddeso, hetvatthe🔽ca paccattavacanaṃ. Kāraṇatthe nipātapadametantipi vadanti. Apica “tatonidāna”nti🔽etaṃ “maraṇaṃ vā maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkha”nti ettha vuttanayena visesanaṃ. Taṃ kissa
analyzed: purima pade paccatta atthe nissakka vacanam katvā tassa ca lopam akatvā niddesaḥ hetu atthe  ca paccatta vacanam kāraṇa atthe nipāta padam etat tipi vadanti api ca tatonidānam ti  etam maraṇam vā maraṇa mattam vā dukkhanti ettha vutta nayena visesanam tam kissa
translated: The word “that” is used in the instrumental case in the first part of the compound, and the word “cause” is omitted.🔽It is said that the word “cause” is used in the instrumental case. Others say that the word “cause” is a particle word in the sense of reason.🔽Moreover, “because of that” is a qualification in the same way as it is said in the passage “death or death-like suffering.” What is the reason for that?

original: hetūti yaṃ vuttaṃ hatthādīsu ḍaṃsanaṃ, tannidānañca maraṇādiupagamanaṃ, taṃ kissa
analyzed: hetū ti yam vuttam hattha ādīsu ḍaṃsanam tad nidānam ca maraṇa ādi upagamanam tam kissa
translated: It is said that the cause of death and the like is the wounding of the hand and so on.

original: hetu kena kāraṇenāti ce? Tassa purisassa alagaddassa duggahitattā.
analyzed: hetu kena kāraṇena ati ce tassa purisassa alagaddassa duggahita ttā
translated: Why? Because of the man’s wrong seizing of the snake.

original: Idhāti imasmiṃ sāsane. Moghapurisāti guṇasārarahitatāya tucchapurisā. Dhammanti pāḷidhammaṃ.
analyzed: idha ati imasmin sāsane mogha purisā ati guṇa sāra rahita tāya tuccha purisā dhammanti pāḷi dhammam
translated: Here in this Dispensation: in this dispensation. Empty men: void of the essence of special qualities. Dhamma: the text-dhamma.

original: Pariyāpuṇantīti uggaṇhanti, sajjhāyanti ceva vācuggataṃ karontā dhārenti cāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: pariyāpuṇanti iti uggaṇhanti sajjhāyanti ca iva vācuggatam karontāḥ dhārenti ca ati vuttam
translated: They learn: they take up. They recite: they make it into speech. They bear it in mind: they remember it.

original: hoti. “Dhamma”nti sāmaññato vuttameva sarūpena dasseti “sutta”ntiādinā. Na hi suttādinavaṅgato
analyzed: hoti dhammanti sāmaññataḥ vuttam eva sarūpena dasseti suttanti ādinā na hi sutta ādi navaṅgato
translated: “Dhamma” is shown in its individual essence by the words “discourse” , etc., for the word “dhamma” is used generally.

original: añño dhammo nāma atthi. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “tesaṃ dhammāna”nti. Atthanti cettha sambandhīniddeso
analyzed: aññaḥ dhammaḥ nāma atthi tathā hi vuttam tesam dhammānam ti attham ti ca ittha sambandhī niddeso
translated: For there is no dhamma other than the ninefold one beginning with discourse. That is why it is said “of those dhammas.”🔽Herein, the word “meaning” is a demonstrative pronoun referring to what is demonstrated.

original: eso, atthanti ca yathābhūtaṃ bhāsitatthaṃ, payojanatthañca sāmaññaniddesena, ekasesanayena
analyzed: ca yathābhūtam bhāsita attham payojana attham ca sāmañña niddesena ekasesa nayena
translated: And the “meaning” is the meaning of what is spoken in accordance with actuality and the meaning of the purpose.🔽Or it is said by the method of particularizing what is demonstrated generally.

original: vā vuttaṃ. Yañhi padaṃ sutisāmaññena anekadhā atthaṃ dīpeti, taṃ sāmaññaniddesena,
analyzed: vā vuttam yat hi padam suti sāmaññena anekadhā attham dīpeti tam sāmañña niddesena
translated: For when a word illuminates a meaning in many ways by the general method of hearing, then it is said by the method of particularizing what is demonstrated generally.

original: ekasesanayena vāti sabbattha veditabbaṃ. Na upaparikkhantīti na pariggaṇhanti na
analyzed: eka sesa nayena vā ati sabbattha veditabbam na upaparikkhanti iti na pariggaṇhanti na
translated: This should be understood in every instance. They do not investigate: they do not discern.

original: vicārenti. Ikkhasaddassa hi dassanaṅkesu idha dassanameva attho, tassa ca pariggaṇhanacakkhulocanesu
analyzed: vicārenti ikkha saddassa hi dassana aṅkesu idha dassanam eva attho tassa ca pariggaṇhana cakkhu locanesu
translated: They do not investigate. For the word “see” in the phrase “seeing, seeing” has the meaning of seeing in the sense of looking, and that is only the looking of the eye faculty in the act of discerning.

original: pariggaṇhanameva, tañca vicāraṇā pariyādānavasena dubbidhesu vicāraṇāyeva, sā ca
analyzed: pariggaṇhanam eva tat ca vicāraṇā pariyādāna vasena dubbidhesu vicāraṇāya iva sā ca
translated: And that is only the investigation in the act of discerning, and that is twofold as exhausting the aspect of discerning by way of discerning the specific and general characteristics, and by way of discerning the four noble truths.

original: vīmaṃsāyeva, na vicāro, vīmaṃsā ca nāmesā bhāsitatthavīmaṃsā, payojanatthavīmaṃsā🔽cāti idha dubbidhāva adhippetā, tāsu “imasmiṃ ṭhāne sīlaṃ kathitaṃ, imasmiṃ samādhi,
analyzed: vīmaṃsāya iva na vicāraḥ vīmaṃsā ca nāma esā bhāsita ttha vīmaṃsā payojana ttha vīmaṃsā  ca ati idha adhippetā tāsu imasmin ṭhāne sīlam kathitam imasmin samādhi
translated: And that is only the investigation of the meaning of the teaching and the investigation of the meaning of the purpose.

original: imasmiṃ paññā, mayañca taṃ pūressāmā”ti evaṃ bhāsitatthavīmaṃsañceva “sīlaṃ samādhissa🔽kāraṇaṃ, samādhi vipassanāyā”tiādinā payojanatthavīmaṃsañca na karontīti attho. Anupaparikkhatanti
analyzed: imasmin paññā mayam ca tam pūressāma ati evam bhāsi tattha vīmaṃsam ca iva sīlam samādhissa  kāraṇam samādhi vipassanāya ati ādinā payojana attha vīmaṃsañca na karonti iti atthaḥ
translated: Herein, the investigation of the meaning of the teaching is the discerning of the meaning of the teaching in this way: “In this place virtue is taught, in this concentration, in this wisdom, and we shall fulfil that.”🔽And the investigation of the meaning of the purpose is the discerning of the meaning of the purpose in this way: “Virtue is the cause of concentration, concentration is the cause of insight” and so on.🔽The meaning is that they do not do this investigation.

original: anupaparikkhantānaṃ tesaṃ moghapurisānaṃ. Na nijjhānakkhamantīti nijjhānaṃ nissesena
analyzed: an upaparikkhantānam tesam moghapurisānam na nijjhāna khamanti iti nijjhānam nissesena
translated: They do not examine: they do not examine the meaning of the teaching and the meaning of the purpose.

original: pekkhanaṃ paññaṃ na khamanti. Jhe-saddo hi idha pekkhaneyeva, na cintanajhāpanesu,
analyzed: pekkhanam paññam na khamanti jhesaddaḥ hi idha na cintana jhāpanesu
translated: They do not allow the seeing of the meaning by understanding. For the word jhāna here is only seeing, not thinking and absorption.

original: tañca ñāṇapekkhanameva, na cakkhupekkhanaṃ, ārammaṇūpanijjhānameva vā, na lakkhaṇūpanijjhānaṃ,
analyzed: tat ca ñāṇa pekkhanam eva na cakkhu pekkhanam ārammaṇa upanijjhānam eva vā na lakkhaṇa upanijjhānam
translated: And that is only seeing by knowledge, not seeing by the eye, or it is only the seeing of the object, not the seeing of the characteristic.

original: tasmā paññāya disvā rocetvā gahetabbā na hontīti adhippāyo veditabbo. Nissesena jhāyate
analyzed: tasmā paññāya disvā rocetvā gahetabbāḥ na honti iti adhippāyaḥ veditabbaḥ nissesena jhāyate
translated: So the intention should be understood thus: ‘They are not to be grasped by being seen and approved by understanding.’🔽For ‘jhāna’ is ‘seeing’ in the sense of looking on, and ‘khamantī’ is ‘they allow’ in the sense of ‘they are not unwilling to be seen.’

original: pekkhateti hi nijjhānaṃ. Sandhivasena anusvāralopo nijjhānakkhamantīti, “nijjhānaṃ
analyzed: pekkhata iti hi nijjhānam sandhi vasena anusvāra lopaḥ nijjhāna khamanti iti nijjhānam
translated: The reading ‘nijjhānakkhamantī’ is also allowable, and it conveys the meaning that ‘they are not unwilling to be seen by the jhāna of penetration.’

original: khamantī”tipi pāṭho, tena imamatthaṃ dīpeti “tesaṃ paññāya atthassa anupaparikkhanato🔽te dhammā na upaṭṭhahanti, imasmiṃ ṭhāne sīlaṃ, samādhi, vipassanā, maggo, vaṭṭaṃ,
analyzed: khamanti iti pi pāṭhaḥ tena imam attham dīpeti tesam paññāya atthassa an upaparikkhanato  te dhammā na upaṭṭhahanti imasmin ṭhāne sīlam samādhi vipassanā maggaḥ vaṭṭam
translated: So the meaning can be regarded as follows: ‘Because they do not investigate the meaning with understanding,

original: vivaṭṭhaṃ kathitanti evaṃ jānituṃ na sakkā hontī”ti.
analyzed: vivaṭṭham kathitanti evam jānitum na sakkāḥ honti iti
translated: those things do not appear to them in such a way that they can be known thus: “Herein, virtue, concentration, understanding, the path, the fruit, and Nibbāna are taught, and here is the round of rebirths.”’

original: Upārambhānisaṃsā cevāti paresaṃ vāde dosāropanānisaṃsā ca hutvā. Bhuso ārambhanañhi
analyzed: upārambha anisaṃsā ca iva ati paresam vāde dosa āropanā anisaṃsā ca hutvā
translated: And they are a source of dispute: they are a source of dispute in the sense of a source of imputation of faults to others’ views.

original: paresaṃ vāde dosāropanaṃ upārambho, pariyattiṃ nissāya paravambhananti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: paresam vāde dosa āropanam upārambhaḥ pariyattim nissāya para vambhanam ti vuttam hoti
translated: and the ascription of faults to the opponents’ doctrine is the “rebuke” . The “criticism” is the disparaging of others’ scriptures.

original: Tathā hesa “paravajjānupanayanalakkhaṇo”ti vutto. Iti vādappamokkhānisaṃsā cāti iti
analyzed: tathā ha isa paravajja an upanayana lakkhaṇaḥ ti vuttaḥ iti vāda ppamokkha anisaṃsā ca ati iti
translated: So it is said that it has the characteristic of “assigning other people’s faults” . And it has the benefit of “deliverance from doctrines” .🔽So it is said that it has the benefit of deliverance from doctrines in this way.

original: evaṃ etāya pariyattiyā vādappamokkhānisaṃsā attano upari parehi āropitassa vādassa
analyzed: evam etāya pariyattiyā vāda ppamokkha anisaṃsāḥ attanaḥ upari parehi āropitassa vādassa
translated: It has the purpose of delivering oneself from a doctrine that others ascribe to oneself,

original: niggahassa attato, sakavādato vā pamokkhapayojanā ca hutvā. Iti saddo idamatthe,🔽tena “pariyāpuṇantī”ti ettha pariyāpuṇanaṃ parāmasati. Vadanti niggaṇhanti etenāti
analyzed: niggahassa attataḥ sakavādataḥ vā pamokkha payojanā ca hutvā iti saddaḥ idam atthe  tena pariyāpuṇanti iti ettha pariyāpuṇanam parāmasati vadanti niggaṇhanti etena ati
translated: or from one’s own doctrine. The word “so” has the meaning of “thus.”🔽By it he “touches” the “learning” in the sense of “he takes it up.”

original: vādo, doso, pamuccanaṃ, pamuccāpanaṃ vā pamokkho, attano upari āropitassa pamokkho
analyzed: vādaḥ dosaḥ pamuccanam pamuccāpanam vā pamokkhaḥ attanaḥ upari āropitassa pamokkho
translated: They “speak” , they “rebuke” with it, thus it is “doctrine” . Fault is “deliverance” or “the causing of deliverance.”

original: ānisaṃso yesaṃ tathā. Āropitavādo hi “vādo”ti vutto yathā “devena datto datto”ti.
analyzed: ānisaṃsaḥ yesam tathā āropita vādaḥ hi vādaḥ iti vuttaḥ yathā devena dattaḥ dattaḥ iti
translated: Those that have the benefit of deliverance from a doctrine ascribed to them are “tathā.” For the doctrine ascribed is called “doctrine” in the way in which “given by the god, given” is said.

original: Vādoti vā upavādonindā yathāvuttanayeneva samāso. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – parehi sakavāde
analyzed: vādaḥ iti vā upavādaḥ nindā yathā vutta nayena iva samāsaḥ idam vuttam hoti parehi saka vāde
translated: Or alternatively, “doctrine” is the censure of the ascription in the way already stated. The compound is resolved in this way. This is what is said: others ascribe a doctrine to one’s own doctrine,

original: dose āropite, nindāya vā āropitāya taṃ dosaṃ, nindaṃ vā evañca evañca mocessāmāti🔽iminā ca kāraṇena pariyāpuṇantīti. Atha vā so so vādo iti vādo iti-saddassa saha🔽vicchāya ta-saddatthe pavattattā. Itivādasa pamokkho yathāvuttanayena, so ānisaṃso
analyzed: dose āropite nindāya vā āropitāya tam dosam nindam vā evañca evañca mocessāma ati  iminā ca kāraṇena pariyāpuṇanti iti atha vā saḥ saḥ vādaḥ iti vādaḥ iti saddassa saha  vicchāya ta sadda tthe pavatta ttā pamokkhaḥ yathā vutta nayena saḥ ānisaṃso
translated: and when a charge of failing in virtue or of failing in mode of living has been brought against him, he thinks, “I will clear this failing in virtue or this failing in mode of living by such and such a means,”🔽and it is for this reason that they learn it. Or alternatively, the word iti is a particle that has the meaning of the particle ta, which is used in the sense of the locative case, in the expression iti vāde,🔽and the meaning is that the escape is in the discussion in the way already stated. Those who have that as their purpose

original: yesaṃ tathā, taṃ taṃ vādapamocanānisaṃsā hutvāti attho. Yassa catthāyāti yassa ca
analyzed: tathā tam tam vāda pamocana anisaṃsāḥ hutvā ati atthaḥ yassa ca tthāya ati yassa ca
translated: are those who have that as the purpose of the escape from the various discussions. The meaning is that they learn it for that purpose. For the sake of what?

original: sīlādipūraṇassa, maggaphalanibbānabhūtassa vā anupādāvimokkhassa atthāya. Abhedepi
analyzed: sīla ādi pūraṇassa magga phala nibbāna bhūtassa vā anupādāvimokkhassa atthāya abhede pi
translated: For the sake of the fulfilment of virtue, etc., or for the sake of the deliverance by non- grasping consisting in the path, fruition, and extinction.

original: bhedavohāro eso yathā “paṭimāya sarīra”nti, bhedyabhedakaṃ vā etaṃ yathā “kathinassatthāya
analyzed: bheda vohāraḥ esaḥ yathā paṭimāya sarīranti bhedya bhedakam vā etam yathā kathinaḥ satthāya
translated: This is a mode of expression in terms of non-division, as in the expression “image body” . Or it is a mode of expression in terms of the divisible and the divider, as in the expression “cloth for the robe” .

original: ābhataṃ dussa”nti. “Tañcassa attha”nti hi vuttaṃ. Ca-saddo avadhāraṇe, tena tadatthāya🔽eva pariyāpuṇanaṃ sambhavati, nāññatthāyāti vinicchinoti. Dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇantīti
analyzed: ābhatam dussanti hi vuttam ca saddaḥ avadhāraṇe tena tad atthāya 🔽eva pariyāpuṇanam sambhavati na aññatthāya ati vinicchinoti dhammam pariyāpuṇanti iti
translated: For it is said, “That is its purpose” . The word ca has the meaning of “only.” So it is decided that the learning is only for that purpose, not for any other.🔽They learn the True Idea.

original: hi jātiācāravasena duvidhāpi kulaputtā ñāyena dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇantīti attho. Tañcassa🔽atthaṃ nānubhontīti assa dhammassa sīlādipūraṇasaṅkhātaṃ, maggaphalanibbānabhūtaṃ
analyzed: hi jāti ācāra vasena duvidhā api kula puttāḥ ñāyena dhammam pariyāpuṇanti iti attho tat ca assa  attham na anubhonti iti assa dhammassa sīla ādi pūraṇa saṅkhātam magga phala nibbāna bhūtam
translated: The meaning is that the clansmen of both kinds, namely, those who are by birth and those who are by action, learn the Dhamma by the method of the True Idea.

original: vā anupādāvimokkhasaṅkhātaṃ atthaṃ ete duggahitagāhino nānubhonti na vindantiyeva.🔽Aparo nayo – yassa upārambhassa, itivādappamokkhassa vā atthāya ye moghapurisā dhammaṃ
analyzed: vā anupādāvimokkha saṅkhātam attham ete duggahita gāhinaḥ na anubhonti na  aparaḥ nayaḥ yassa upārambhassa itivāda ppamokkhassa vā atthāya ye mogha purisāḥ dhammaṃ
translated: And they do not experience its meaning: they do not experience the meaning of that Dhamma, which is called the fulfilment of virtue, etc., or which is called the deliverance of the unformed element consisting in the path, fruition, and extinction.

original: pariyāpuṇanti, te parehi “ayamattho na hotī”ti vutte duggahitattāyeva “tadatthova🔽hotī”ti paṭipādanakkhamā na honti, tasmā parassa vāde upārambhaṃ āropetuṃ attano
analyzed: pariyāpuṇanti te parehi ayam attho na hoti iti vutte duggahita ttāya iva tad atthaḥ uva  hoti iti paṭipādana khamāḥ na honti tasmā parassa vāde upārambham āropetum attanaḥ
translated: Another method: those worthless men who learn the Dhamma for the sake of a dispute or for the sake of a quibble are not able to prove that “That is the meaning” when others say “That is not the meaning” because of their wrong grasp.

original: vādaṃ pamocetuñca asakkontāpi taṃ atthaṃ nānubhonti ca na vindantiyevāti evampettha
analyzed: vādam pamocetum ca a sakkontā api tam attham na anubhonti ca na vindantiyā iva ati evam pa ittha
translated: So they do not experience the meaning and do not find it even though they are unable to impute a dispute to the other’s statement or to extricate their own statement.🔽This is how the meaning should be regarded here. For the word “only” has the purpose of a restrictive in this case too.

original: attho daṭṭhabbo. Idhāpi hi ca-saddo avadhāraṇatthova. “Tesa”ntiādīsu tesaṃ te dhammā
analyzed: atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ idha api hi ca saddo avadhāraṇa atthaḥ iva tesam ti ādīsu tesam te dhammā
translated: In the passage beginning with “They” , the meaning is this.

original: duggahitattā upārambhamānadabbamakkhapalāsādihetubhāvena dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya
analyzed: duggahita ttā upārambha māna dabba makkha palāsa ādi hetu bhāvena dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya
translated: They lead to harm and suffering for a long time, because of being wrongly grasped, in the sense of being a cause of anger, contempt, insolence, and conceit, etc.

original: saṃvattantīti attho. Duggahitāti hi hetugabbhavacanaṃ. Tenāha “duggahitattā bhikkhave,🔽dhammāna”nti. Ettha ca kāraṇe phalavohāravasena “te dhammā ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattantī’ti🔽vuttaṃ yathā “ghatamāyu, dadhi bala”nti. Tathā hi kiñcāpi na te dhammā ahitāya dukkhāya🔽saṃvattanti, tathāpi vuttanayena pariyāpuṇantānaṃ sajjhāyanakāle, vivādakāle ca tammūlakānaṃ
analyzed: saṃvattanti iti atthaḥ duggahitā ati hi hetu gabbha vacanam tena āha duggahita ttā bhikkhave  ettha ca kāraṇe phala vohāra vasena te dhammāḥ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti iti  vuttam yathā tathā hi kiñcā api na te dhammāḥ ahitāya dukkhāya  saṃvattanti tathā api vutta nayena pariyāpuṇantānam sajjhāyana kāle vivāda kāle ca tad mūlakānam
translated: The meaning is: “because of being wrongly grasped.” For the words “wrongly grasped” are a statement of the cause. Therefore it is said: “Because, bhikkhus, they have been wrongly grasped” .🔽And here the words “they lead to harm and suffering” are said by a figurative use of cause for effect, as in the passage: “Milk is life, ghee is life, oil is life, meat is life, curd is life” .

original: upārambhādīnaṃ anekesaṃ akusalānaṃ uppattisambhavato “te…pe… saṃvattantī”ti vuccati.
analyzed: upārambha ādīnam anekesam akusalānam uppatti sambhavataḥ tepe saṃvattanti iti vuccati
translated: For although those ideas do not lead to harm and suffering, still they are said to do so because of the possibility of the arising of many unprofitable ideas such as anger, etc., in the case of those who learn them in the way stated and in the case of those who have a dispute with them at the time of recitation.

original: Taṃ kissa hetūti ettha nti yathāvuttassatthassa ananubhavanaṃ, tesañca dhammānaṃ
analyzed: tat kissa hetu uti ettha nti yathā vuttassa atthassa ananubhavanam tesam ca dhammānaṃ
translated: “ Why is that? ” Herein, “why is that? ” is a question for the purpose of eliciting the reason for the matter stated thus “They lead to harm and suffering” .

original: ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanaṃ parāmasati. Kissāti sāmivacanaṃ hetvatthe, tathā hetūti paccattavacanañca.
analyzed: ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanam parāmasati kissa iti sāmi vacanam hetu atthe tathā hetu uti paccatta vacanam ca
translated: He misapprehends it as leading to harm and suffering. “What?” is a word of possession in the sense of cause, and “thus” is a word of specification.

original: Yā panāti ettha kiriyā pāḷivasena vuttanayena attho veditabbo. Tattha kiriyāpakkhe
analyzed: yā pana ati ettha kiriyā pāḷi vasena vutta nayena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ tattha kiriyā pakkhe
translated: “But if” : here the meaning should be understood according to the method stated in the text. There, in the section on action,

original: yā suggahitāti abhedepi bhedavohāro “cārikaṃ pakkamati, cārikaṃ caramāno”tiādīsu
analyzed: yā abhede pi cārikam pakkamati cārikam caramānaḥ tiādīsu
translated: “well taken up” : although there is no difference, the expression of difference is like that in the passages “he sets out on a journey,” “he is travelling on a journey.”

original: viya. Tadevatthaṃ vivarati “sīlakkhandhādī”tiādinā, ādisaddena cettha samādhivipassanādīnaṃ
analyzed: viya tad evattham vivarati sīla kkhandha ādi iti ādinā ādi saddena ca ittha samādhi vipassanā ādīnam
translated: He explains the meaning of that in the passage beginning “the aggregate of virtue” . And here the word “etc.” includes concentration, insight, etc.

original: saṅgaho. Yo hi buddhavacanaṃ uggaṇhitvā sīlassa āgataṭṭhāne sīlaṃ pūretvā, samādhino
analyzed: saṅgahaḥ yaḥ hi buddha vacanam uggaṇhitvā sīlassa āgata ṭṭhāne sīlam pūretvā samādhino
translated: For one who, having learned the Buddha’s word, fulfills virtue in the place where virtue is taught,🔽causes concentration to grow in the place where concentration is taught,

original: āgataṭṭhāne samādhiṃ gabbhaṃ gaṇhāpetvā, vipassanāya āgataṭṭhāne vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā,
analyzed: āgata ṭṭhāne samādhim gabbham gaṇhāpetvā vipassanāya āgata ṭṭhāne vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā
translated: establishes insight in the place where insight is taught,

original: maggaphalānaṃ āgataṭṭhāne “maggaṃ bhāvessāmi, phalaṃ sacchikarissāmī”ti uggaṇhāti,
analyzed: magga phalānaṃ āgata ṭṭhāne maggam bhāvessāmi phalam sacchikarissāmi iti uggaṇhāti
translated: and learns in the place where the path and fruit are taught, “I will develop the path and realize the fruit,”

original: tasseva sā pariyatti nissaraṇatthā nāma hoti. Yanti yaṃ pariyattisuggahaṇaṃ. Vuttaṃ
analyzed: tassa iva sā pariyatti nissaraṇa atthā nāma hoti yanti yam pariyatti su gahaṇam vuttam
translated: The meaning of the words is this. “Yanti”: the right grasping of the study is called “yanti.”🔽This is said in the Alagaddūpama Sutta.

original: alagaddasutte. Dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantīti sīlādīnaṃ āgataṭṭhāne sīlādīni🔽pūrentānampi arahattaṃ patvā parisamajjhe dhammaṃ desetvā dhammadesanāya pasannehi
analyzed: alagadda sutte dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya saṃvattanti iti sīla ādīnam āgata ṭṭhāne sīla ādīni  pūrentānam pi arahattam patvā parisamajjhe dhammaṃ desetvā dhamma desanāya pasannehi
translated: “They lead to welfare and happiness for a long time”: they lead to welfare and happiness for a long time for those who fulfill virtue, etc., in the places where they have arisen,🔽for those who, having attained arahantship, teach the Dhamma in the midst of the assembly and enjoy the requisites offered by the faithful,🔽for those who refute the doctrines of others by means of the True Idea,

original: upanīte cattāro paccaye paribhuñjantānampi paresaṃ vāde sahadhammena upārambhaṃ āropentānampi🔽sakavādato parehi āropitadosaṃ pariharantānampi dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantīti
analyzed: upanīte cattāro paccaye paribhuñjantānam pi paresam vāde sahadhammena upārambham āropentānam pi  parehi āropita dosam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya saṃvattanti iti
translated: and for those who, when others find fault with their doctrines, avoid the fault by means of their own doctrines.

original: attho. Tathā hi na kevalaṃ suggahitapariyattiṃ nissāya maggabhāvanāphalasacchikiriyādīniyeva,
analyzed: tathā hi na kevalam sugga hita pariyattim nissāya magga bhāvanā phala sacchikiriyā ādīni eva
translated: For in this way not only the development of the path and the realization of the fruit, etc., are successful by means of the rightly grasped study,

original: api tu paravādaniggahasakavādapatiṭṭhāpanānipi ijjhanti. Tathā ca vuttaṃ parinibbānasuttā
analyzed: api tu paravāda niggaha sakavāda patiṭṭhāpanāni ijjhanti tathā ca vuttam parinibbāna suttā
translated: but also the refutation of the doctrines of others and the establishment of one’s own doctrines. And this is said in the Parinibbana Sutta:🔽“Bhikkhus, if anyone should speak thus: ‘Having rejected this doctrine and view, I shall make known another doctrine and view,’ that is a mere empty boast on his part. For if one were to take up this doctrine and view and examine it by theory,

original: dīsu “uppannaṃ parappavādaṃ sahadhammena suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṃ dhammaṃ desessantī”tiādi.
analyzed: dīsu uppannam para pavādam sahadhammena su niggahitam niggahetvā sa ppāṭihāriyam dhammam desessanti itiādi
translated: and in the Dīghas: “They will refute with Dhamma in accordance with Dhamma any counter-arguments that may arise, and they will teach the Dhamma accompanied by miracles” .

original: Yaṃ panāti etthāpi vuttanayena duvidhena attho. Dukkhaparijānena pariññātakkhandho.
analyzed: yam pana ati ettha api vutta nayena duvidhena atthaḥ dukkha parijānena pariññāta kkhandho
translated: “But the one who” : here too the meaning is twofold in the way already stated. He has fully understood the aggregates by means of full understanding of suffering.

original: Samudayappahānena pahīnakileso. Paṭividdhārahattaphalatāya paṭividdhākuppo. Akuppanti
analyzed: samudaya pahānena pahīna kilesaḥ paṭividdha arahatta phala tāya paṭividdha akuppo
translated: He has abandoned defilements by means of abandoning their origin. He has penetrated the non-delusion of the fruit of Arahantship. “Non-delusion” is

original: ca arahattaphalassetaṃ nāma. Satipi hi cattunnaṃ maggānaṃ, catunnañca phalānaṃ avinassanabhāve🔽sattannaṃ sekkhānaṃ sakasakanāmapariccāgena uparūpari nāmantarappattito tesaṃ maggaphalāti
analyzed: ca arahatta phalassa itam nāma sati api hi cattunnam maggānam catunnam ca phalānam a vinassana bhāve  sattannam sekkhānam saka saka nāma pariccāgena upari upari nāma ntara ppattito tesam magga phalā ti
translated: a name for the fruit of Arahantship. For although the four paths and the four fruits do not perish,🔽the four paths and the four fruits are not called “non-delusion” because the seven kinds of trainers have acquired different names in ascending order by relinquishing their former names.

original: “akuppāmi”ti na vuccanti. Arahā pana sabbadāpi arahāyeva nāmāti tasseva phalaṃ puggalanāmavasena
analyzed: akuppām iti na vuccanti arahā pana sabbadā api arahāya iva nāma ati tassa iva phalam puggala nāma vasena
translated: But the Arahant is always called an Arahant. Therefore his fruit alone is called “non-delusion” by the name of the person.

original: “akuppa”nti vuttaṃ, iminā ca imamatthaṃ dasseti “khīṇāsavasseva pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti
analyzed: akuppanti vuttam iminā ca imam attham dasseti khīṇāsavassa iva pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti
translated: And by this he shows the meaning of this: “The learning that is the learning of one whose cankers are destroyed is the learning of the store-master.

original: nāmā”ti. Tassa hi apariññātaṃ, appahīnaṃ abhāvitaṃ, asacchikataṃ vā natthi, tasmā
analyzed: nāma ati tassa hi a pariññātam a pahīnam a bhāvitam a sacchikatam vā natthi tasmā
translated: For there is nothing that he has not fully understood, abandoned, developed, or realized.

original: so buddhavacanaṃ pariyāpuṇantopi tantidhārako paveṇīpālako vaṃsānurakkhakova hutvā🔽pariyāpuṇāti, tenevāha “paveṇīpālanatthāyā”tiādi. Paveṇī cettha dhammasantati dhammassa
analyzed: saḥ buddha vacanam pariyāpuṇantaḥ api tanti dhārakaḥ paveṇī pālakaḥ vaṃsa anurakkhakaḥ iva hutvā  pariyāpuṇāti tena iva āha paveṇī pālana atthāya atiādi paveṇī ca ittha dhamma santati dhammassa
translated: Therefore, although he learns the Buddha’s word, he is like a keeper of the tradition, a guardian of the lineage, a preserver of the line.

original: avicchedena pavatti. Buddhassa bhagavato vaṃsoti ca yathāvuttapaveṇīyeva.
analyzed: avicchedena pavatti buddhassa bhagavataḥ vaṃso ti ca yathā vutta paveṇīyā iva
translated: He learns it thus. “For the preservation of the line” : here the line is the continuity of the Dhamma, the occurrence of the Dhamma without break. The line of the Buddha, the Blessed One, is just the aforesaid continuity.

original: Nanu ca yadi paveṇīpālanatthāya buddhavacanassa pariyāpuṇanaṃ bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti,
analyzed: nanu ca yadi paveṇī pālana tthāya buddha vacanassa pariyāpuṇanam bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti
translated: But if the learning of the Buddha’s word is the learning of the storekeeper, for the preservation of the line,

original: atha kasmā “khīṇāsavo”ti visesetvā vuttaṃ. Ekaccassa hi puthujjanassāpi ayaṃ nayo
analyzed: atha kasmā khīṇāsavaḥ ti visesetvā vuttam ekaccassa hi puthujjanassa api ayam nayo
translated: why is it said with the distinction “whose cankers are destroyed”? For this method is found even in some ordinary men.

original: labbhati. Tathā hi ekacco puthujjano bhikkhu chātakabhayādinā ganthadhuresu ekasmiṃ
analyzed: labbhati tathā hi ekaccaḥ puthujjanaḥ bhikkhu chātaka bhaya ādinā gantha dhuresu ekasmiṃ
translated: For a certain ordinary man, a bhikkhu, when the burden of the texts is being borne by others through fear of the heat, etc.,

original: ṭhāne vasitumasakkontesu sayaṃ bhikkhācārena atikilamamāno “atimadhuraṃ buddhavacanaṃ
analyzed: ṭhāne vasitum a sakkontesu sayam bhikkhācārena ati kilamamānaḥ ati madhuram buddha vacanam
translated: himself becomes exhausted by going on his alms round. He thinks: “The Buddha’s word is very sweet.

original: mā nassatu, tantiṃ dhāressāmi, vaṃsaṃ ṭhapessāmi, paveṇiṃ pālessāmī”ti pariyāpuṇāti.
analyzed: mā nassatu tantim dhāressāmi vaṃsam ṭhapessāmi paveṇim pālessāmi iti pariyāpuṇāti
translated: He thinks, “Let it not be lost. I shall keep it in mind. I shall establish a lineage. I shall preserve the tradition.”

original: Tasmā tassāpi pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti nāma kasmā na hotīti? Vuccate – evaṃ
analyzed: tasmā tassa api pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti nāma kasmā na hoti iti vuccate evam
translated: So why is it not called the storeman’s learning? It is said:

original: santepi hi puthujjanassa pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti nāma na hoti. Kiñcāpi hi
analyzed: sante pi hi puthujjanassa pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti nāma na hoti kiñcā api hi
translated: Nevertheless, the learning of the worldling is not called the storeman’s learning. For although

original: puthujjano “paveṇiṃ pālessāmī”ti ajjhāsayena pariyāpuṇāti, attano pana bhavakantārato🔽avitiṇṇattā tassa sā pariyatti nissaraṇatthāyeva nāma hoti, tasmā puthujjanassa pariyatti
analyzed: puthujjanaḥ paveṇim pālessāmi iti ajjhāsayena pariyāpuṇāti attanaḥ pana bhava kantārato  a vitiṇṇattā tassa sā pariyatti nissaraṇa atthāya iva nāma hoti tasmā puthujjanassa pariyatti
translated: the worldling memorizes the texts with the intention of preserving the tradition, he does not cross the desert of existence.

original: alagaddupamā vā hoti, nissaraṇatthā vā. Sattannaṃ sekkhānaṃ nissaraṇatthāva. Khīṇāsavānaṃ🔽bhaṇḍāgārikapariyattiyevāti veditabbaṃ. Khīṇāsavo hi bhaṇḍāgārika sadisattā “bhaṇḍāgāriko”ti
analyzed: alagaddupamā vā hoti nissaraṇa atthā vā sattannam sekkhānam nissaraṇa atthā ava khīṇāsavānam  bhaṇḍāgārika pariyattiyā iva ati veditabbam khīṇa asavaḥ hi bhaṇḍāgārika sadisa ttā bhaṇḍāgārikā uti
translated: Therefore his learning is like a blind man’s or it is for the purpose of escape. The learning of the seven kinds of noble disciples is for the purpose of escape. The learning of the one whose cankers are destroyed

original: vuccati. Yathā hi bhaṇḍāgāriko alaṅkārabhaṇḍaṃ paṭisāmetvā pasādhanakāle tadupiyaṃ
analyzed: vuccati yathā hi bhaṇḍāgārikaḥ alaṅkāra bhaṇḍam paṭisāmetvā pasādhana kāle
translated: should be understood as the storeman’s learning. The one whose cankers are destroyed is called a “storeman” because he is like a storeman. For just as a storeman stores away the goods that are brought to him,🔽so the one whose cankers are destroyed memorizes the texts that he has heard.

original: alaṅkārabhaṇḍaṃ rañño upanāmetvā taṃ alaṅkaroti, evaṃ khīṇāsavopi dhammaratanabhaṇḍaṃ
analyzed: alaṅkāra bhaṇḍam raññaḥ upanāmetvā tam alaṅkaroti evam khīṇāsavaḥ api dhamma ratana bhaṇḍam
translated: He adorns the king with the ornaments he has brought. So too the one with cankers destroyed,

original: sampaṭicchitvā mokkhādhigamāya bhabbarūpe sahetuke satte passitvā tadanurūpaṃ dhammadesanaṃ
analyzed: sampaṭicchitvā mokkha adhigamāya bhabba rūpe sa hetuke satte passitvā tad anurūpam dhamma desanaṃ
translated: having accepted the treasure of the Dhamma, sees that beings are capable of attaining deliverance if they have the right conditions,

original: vaḍḍhetvā maggaṅgabojjhaṅgādisaṅkhātena lokuttarena alaṅkārena alaṅkarotīti.
analyzed: vaḍḍhetvā maggaṅga bojjhaṅga ādi saṅkhātena lokuttarena alaṅkārena alaṅkaroti iti
translated: and he adorns them with the supramundane ornaments of the path factors, enlightenment factors, etc.,🔽having increased the teaching of the Dhamma in accordance with their capacity.

original: Evaṃ tisso pariyattiyo vibhajitvā idāni tīsupi piṭakesu yathārahaṃ sampattivipattiyo
analyzed: evam tissaḥ pariyattiyaḥ vibhajitvā idāni tīsu pi piṭakesu yathāraham sampatti vipattiyaḥ
translated: Having thus analysed the three kinds of learning, the Master now shows the success and failure in the three Piṭakas,

original: niddhāretvā vibhajanto “vinaye panā”tiādimāha. “Sīlasampadaṃ nissāya tisso vijjā🔽pāpuṇātī”tiādīsu yasmā sīlaṃ visujjhamānaṃ satisampajaññabalena, kammassakatāñāṇabalena
analyzed: niddhāretvā vibhajantaḥ vinaye pana ati ādim āha sīla sampadam nissāya tissaḥ vijjā  pāpuṇāti iti ādīsu yasmā sīlam visujjhamānam sati sampajañña balena kammassaka tā ñāṇa balena
translated: saying “But in the Vinaya,” etc. In the passage beginning “Having the success of virtue as a support, he reaches the three true knowledges,”🔽since virtue, when being purified, is purified from the stain of defilement and reaches fulfilment by means of the power of mindfulness and full awareness and by means of the power of knowledge of the owner of the kamma,

original: ca saṃkilesamalato visujjhati, pāripūriñca gacchati, tasmā sīlasampadā sijjhamānā
analyzed: ca saṃkilesa malataḥ visujjhati pāripūrim ca gacchati tasmā sīla sampadā sijjhamānā

original: upanissayasampattibhāvena satibalaṃ, ñāṇabalañca paccupaṭṭhapetīti tassā vijjattayūpanissayatā

original: veditabbā sabhāgahetusampādanato. Satibalena hi pubbenivāsavijjāsiddhi. Sampajaññabalena
analyzed: veditabbā sa bhāga hetu sampādanato sati balena hi pubbenivāsa vijjā siddhi sampajañña balena
translated: It should be understood as the fulfilment of the condition of being a homogeneous cause. For the success of the knowledge of recollection of past lives is due to the power of mindfulness.

original: sabbakiccesu sudiṭṭhakāritāparicayena cutūpapātañāṇānubaddhāya dutiyavijjāya siddhi.
analyzed: sabba kiccesu su diṭṭha kāri tā paricayena cutu upapāta ñāṇa anubaddhāya dutiya vijjāya siddhi
translated: The success of the second knowledge, which is accompanied by the knowledge of passing away and reappearance, is due to the power of full awareness,

original: Vītikkamābhāvena saṃkilesappahānasabbhāvato vivaṭṭūpanissayatāvasena ajjhāsayasuddhiyā
analyzed: vītikkama abhāvena saṃkilesa ppahāna sabbhāvataḥ vivaṭṭu upanissaya tā vasena ajjhāsaya suddhiyā

original: tatiyavijjāsiddhi. Puretarasiddhānaṃ samādhipaññānaṃ pāripūriṃ vinā sīlassa āsavakkhayañāṇūpanissayatā🔽sukkhavipassakakhīṇāsavehi dīpetabbā. “Samāhito yathābhūtaṃ pajānātī”ti vacanato
analyzed: puretara siddhānam samādhi paññānam pāripūrim vinā sīlassa āsava kkhaya ñāṇa upanissaya tā  sukkha vipassaka khīṇāsavehi dīpetabbā samāhitaḥ yathābhūtam pajānāti iti vacanato
translated: It should be shown by the dry insight worker and the canker-free disciple that the condition of the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is virtue.

original: samādhisampadā chaḷabhiññatāya upanissayo. “Yogā ve jāyate bhūrī”ti vacanato pubbayogena

translated: The fulfilment of concentration is a condition for the six kinds of direct knowledge by way of the condition of predominance, according to the statement: “One who is concentrated knows and sees correctly” .

original: upanissayo. Ettha ca “sīlasampadaṃ nissāyā”ti vuttattā yassa samādhivijambhanabhūtā
analyzed: upanissayaḥ ettha ca sīla sampadam nissāya ati vutta ttā yassa samādhi vijambhana bhūtā
translated: and the support condition. And since it is said “depending on virtue perfected,”🔽if the three knowledges are not perfected in one who has not perfected concentration,

original: anavasesā cha abhiññā na ijjhanti, tassa ukkaṭṭhaparicchedavasena na samādhisampadā
analyzed: anavasesā cha abhiññāḥ na ijjhanti tassa ukkaṭṭha pariccheda vasena na samādhi sampadā

original: atthīti satipi vijjānaṃ abhiññekadesabhāve sīlasampadāsamudāgatā eva tisso vijjā

original: gahitā, yathā ca paññāsampadāsamudāgatā catasso paṭisambhidā upanissayasampannassa
analyzed: gahitā yathā ca paññā sampadā samudāgatā catasso paṭisambhidā upanissaya sampannassa
translated: are included, just as the four discriminations that are perfected with the perfection of understanding

original: maggeneva ijjhanti maggakkhaṇeyeva tāsaṃ paṭiladdhattā. Evaṃ sīlasampadāsamudāgatā
analyzed: maggena iva ijjhanti magga kkhaṇeya iva tāsam evam sīla sampadā samudāgatā
translated: are perfected only through the path in one who possesses the support condition, because they are acquired only at the moment of the path.🔽And just as the three knowledges that are perfected with the perfection of virtue

original: tisso vijjā, samādhisampadāsamudāgatā ca cha abhiññā upanissayasampannassa maggeneva🔽ijjhantīti maggādhigameneva tāsaṃ adhigamo veditabbo. Paccekabuddhānaṃ, sammāsambuddhānañca
analyzed: tissaḥ vijjā samādhi sampadā asamudāgatā ca cha abhiññā upanissaya sampannassa maggena iva  ijjhanti iti magga adhigamena iva tāsam adhigamaḥ veditabbo paccekabuddhānam sammāsambuddhānam ca
translated: and the six kinds of direct-knowledge that are perfected with the perfection of concentration are perfected only through the path in one who possesses the support condition,🔽so their acquisition should be understood as occurring only through the acquisition of the path.

original: paccekabodhisammāsambodhisamadhigamasadisā hi imesaṃ ariyānaṃ ime visesādhigamāti.
analyzed: pacceka bodhi sammāsambodhi samadhigama sadisāḥ hi imesam ariyānam ime visesa adhigamā ti
translated: For the acquisition of these special qualities by these Noble Ones is like the acquisition of the Hermit Buddha’s enlightenment and the Enlightened One’s supreme enlightenment.

original: Tāsaṃyeva ca tattha pabhedavacanatoti ettha “tāsaṃyevā”ti avadhāraṇaṃ pāpuṇitabbānaṃ🔽chaḷabhiññācatupaṭisambhidānaṃ vinaye pabhedavacanābhāvaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Verañjakaṇḍe
analyzed: tāsam yeva ca tattha pabheda vacanato ti ettha tāsam yeva ati avadhāraṇam pāpuṇitabbānam  vinaye pabheda vacana abhāvam sandhāya vuttam verañja kaṇḍe
translated: And because they are distinguished there in the Abhidhamma,🔽The word “only” should be supplied to the words “the three kinds of clear knowledge” in the first passage.

original: hi tisso vijjāva vibhattāti. Casaddena samuccinanañca tāsaṃ ettha ekadesavacanaṃ🔽sandhāya vuttaṃ abhiññāpaṭisambhidānampi ekadesānaṃ tattha vuttattā. Dutiye “tāsaṃyevā”ti
analyzed: hi tissaḥ vijjāva vibhattā ati ca saddena tāsam ettha eka desa vacanam  sandhāya vuttam abhiññā paṭisambhidānam pi eka desānam tattha vutta ttā dutiye tāsam yeva āti
translated: For the three kinds of clear knowledge are distinguished in the Verañjā Sutta .🔽And the word “also” refers to the inclusion of the others there.🔽For the kinds of direct-knowledge and the analytical knowledges are included among the others mentioned there.

original: avadhāraṇaṃ catasso paṭisambhidā apekkhitvā kataṃ, na tisso vijjā. Tā hi chasu abhiññāsu

translated: In the second passage the word “only” is supplied with reference to the four analytical knowledges, not to the three kinds of clear knowledge.🔽For these are included among the six kinds of direct-knowledge and are therefore distinguished in the Suttas.

original: antogadhattā sutte vibhattāyevāti. Ca-saddena ca paṭisambhidānamekadesavacanaṃ samuccinoti.
analyzed: sutte vibhattāya iva ati ca saddena ca paṭisambhidānam eka desa vacanam samuccinoti
translated: And the word “also” refers to the inclusion of the analytical knowledges among the others there.

original: Tatiye “tāsañcā”ti ca-saddena sesānampi tattha atthibhāvaṃ dīpeti. Abhidhamme hi
analyzed: tatiye tāsam ca iti ca saddena sesānam pi tattha atthi bhāvam dīpeti abhidhamme hi
translated: In the third passage the word “also” shows that the others are included there too.

original: tisso vijjā, cha abhiññā, catasso ca paṭisambhidā vuttāyeva. Paṭisambhidānaṃ pana
