analyzed: pāṭihāriyassa bhagavataḥ desanāya saṃsūcanataḥ vividha pāṭihāriyanti vuttam anekavidha pāṭihāriya dassananti attho
translated: The teaching is of various kinds according to the various kinds of teaching. This meaning will become clear later in the commentary on the eleventh sutta, the Kevatta Sutta . Or else, since that entire variety of wonders is included in the Blessed One’s teaching, it is said that “the teaching is of various kinds of wonders” ; the meaning is that it shows various kinds of wonders.

original: Dhammaniruttiyāva bhagavati dhammaṃ desente sabbesaṃ suṇantānaṃ nānābhāsitānaṃ taṃtaṃbhāsānurūpato🔽desanā sotapathamāgacchatīti āha “sabba…pe… māgacchanta”nti. Sotameva sotapatho,
analyzed: dhamma niruttiyā va bhagavati dhammam desente sabbesam suṇantānam nānā bhāsitānam taṃ taṃ bhāsa anurūpato  desanā sota patham āgacchati iti āha sabbape mā āgacchantanti sotam eva sota pathaḥ
translated: When the Blessed One teaches the Dhamma by means of the language of the Dhamma, the teaching comes within the range of the ear of all who listen, in accordance with their respective languages.

original: savanaṃ vā sotaṃ, tassa patho tathā, sotadvāranti attho. Sabbākārenāti yathādesitākārena.
analyzed: savanam vā sotam tassa pathaḥ tathā sota dvāran ti attho sabba ākārena ati yathā desita ākārena
translated: Thus it is said: “All, etc. , come within the range of the ear.” The ear itself is the range of the ear. Or the ear is hearing; the range of that is thus; the meaning is: the door of the ear. In all its modes: in the modes in which it is taught.

original: Ko samattho viññātuṃ, asamatthoyeva, tasmāti pāṭhaseso. Panāti ekaṃsatthe, tena saddhāsatidhitivīriyādibalasaṅkhātena
analyzed: kaḥ samatthaḥ viññātum asamatthaḥ yeva tasmā ti pāṭha sesaḥ pana ati ekaṃsatthe tena saddhā sati dhiti vīriya ādi bala saṅkhātena
translated: Who is able to know it? Only one who is able is not. Thus there is a difference in the reading. But: in the sense of one. By that: by the strength called faith, devotion, energy, etc.

original: sabbathāmena ekaṃseneva sotukāmatāsaṅkhātakusalacchandassa jananaṃ dasseti. Janetvāpīti
analyzed: ekaṃsena iva sotu kāma tā saṅkhāta kusala chandassa jananam dasseti janetvā api iti
translated: He shows the arousing of the desire to listen, which is called profitable intention, by means of the whole of the word sabba-sotukāmo .

original: ettha pi-saddo, api-saddo vā sambhāvanattho “buddhopi buddhabhāvaṃ bhāvetvā”tiādīsu
analyzed: ettha pi saddaḥ api saddaḥ vā sambhāvanā atthaḥ buddhaḥ api buddha bhāvam bhāvetvā ati ādīsu
translated: The particle pi in the words janetvā pi is a particle of supposition, like the particle api in such passages as “Buddho pi buddhabhāvaṃ bhāvetvā” .

original: viya, tena “sabbathāmena ekaṃseneva sotukāmataṃ janetvāpi nāma ekenākārena sutaṃ,
analyzed: viya tena ekaṃsena iva sotu kāmatam janetvā api nāma ekena ākārena sutam
translated: So the meaning here is that he shows his supposition of the Dhamma as heard by saying “Even though he had aroused the desire to listen by means of the whole of the word sabba-sotukāmo , still he heard it in one way only,🔽so how much more so in another way? ”

original: kimaṅgaṃ pana aññathā”ti tathāsute dhamme sambhāvanaṃ karoti. Keci pana “edisesu🔽garahattho”ti vadanti, tadayuttameva garahatthassa avijjamānattā, vijjamānatthasseva
analyzed: kim aṅgam pana aññathā ti tathā sute dhamme sambhāvanam karoti keci pana edisesu  gara hattho ti vadanti tat ayuttam eva gara hatthassa a vijjamāna ttā vijjamāna tthassa iva
translated: But some say that the particle pi has the sense of “in such a case” .🔽That is quite inappropriate, because there is no such sense of the particle pi, and because the particles pi and nipāta are only a sign of what is present.

original: ca upasagganipātānaṃ jotakattā. “Nānānayanipuṇa”ntiādinā hi sabbappakārena sotumasakkuṇeyyabhāvena
analyzed: ca upasagga nipātānam jotaka ttā nānā naya nipuṇa nti ādinā hi sabba ppakārena sotum asakkuṇeyya bhāvena
translated: For by the words “Skilled in the various paths” he shows his supposition of the Dhamma as heard here by the fact that it is impossible to hear it in all its aspects.

original: dhammassa idha sambhāvanameva karoti, tasmā “api dibbesu kāmesu, ratiṃ so nādhigacchatī”tiādīsuyeva
analyzed: dhammassa idha sambhāvanam eva karoti tasmai api dibbesu kāmesu ratim saḥ na adhigacchati
translated: So it is only in such passages as “Api dibbesu kāmesu, ratiṃ so nādhigacchati” that the particle pi has the sense of “in such a case” .

original: garahatthasambhavesu garahattho veditabboti. Api-saddo ca īdisesu ṭhānesu nipātoyeva,🔽na upasaggo. Tathā hi “api-saddo ca nipātapakkhiko kātabbo, yattha kiriyāvācakato
analyzed: gara hattha sambhavesu gara hatthaḥ veditabbaḥ iti api saddo ca īdisesu ṭhānesu  na upasaggaḥ tathā hi apisaddaḥ ca nipāta pakkhikaḥ kātabbaḥ yattha kiriyā vācakato
translated: And the word api in such places is a mere particle,🔽not a prefix. For thus the etymologists say: “The word api should be taken as a particle, where it is not before an

original: pubbo na hotī”ti akkharacintakā vadanti. Mayāpīti ettha pana na kevalaṃ mayāva, atha
analyzed: pubbaḥ na hoti iti akkhara cintakāḥ vadanti mayā api iti ettha pana na kevalam atha
translated: expression of action.” And in mayāpi, the meaning should be taken as “not only by me,

original: kho aññehipi tathārūpehīti sampiṇḍanattho gahetabbo.
analyzed: kho aññehi pi tathārūpehi iti sampiṇḍana tthaḥ gahetabbaḥ
translated: but also by others of the same kind.”

original: Sāmaṃ bhavatīti sayambhū, anācariyako. Na mayaṃ idaṃ sacchikatanti ettha pana “na
analyzed: sāmam bhavati iti sayambhū ettha pana na
translated: Sāmaṃ bhavatīti = sayambhū, self-become, self-arisen. Na mayaṃ idaṃ sacchikatanti = “not by us

original: attano ñāṇeneva attanā sacchikata”nti pakaraṇato attho viññāyati. Sāmaññavacanassāpi
analyzed: attanaḥ ñāṇena iva attanā sacchikatam ti pakaraṇataḥ attho viññāyati sāmañña vacanassa api
translated: is this realized.” Here the meaning is understood from the context: “not by ourselves alone through our own knowledge is it realized.”

original: hi sampayogavippayogasahacaraṇavirodhasaddantarasannidhānaliṅgaocityakāladesapakaraṇādivasena
analyzed: hi
translated: For the meaning of a general term can be grasped by way of a particular, according to the presence of such particularities as association, dissociation, co-existence, opposition, proximity, remoteness, time, place, context, etc.

original: visesatthaggahaṇaṃ sambhavati. Evaṃ sabbattha. Parimocentoti “puna caparaṃ bhikkhave,
analyzed: visesa attha ggahaṇam sambhavati evam sabbattha parimocento ti puna caparam bhikkhave
translated: It is the same in all cases. Parimocento = “delivering.”

original: idhekacco pāpabhikkhu tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā attano dahatī”ti
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ pāpa bhikkhu tathāgata ppaveditam dhamma vinayam pariyāpuṇitvā attanaḥ dahati iti
translated: Herein, some evil bhikkhu, after learning the Dhamma and Discipline announced by the Tathāgata, burns it himself” .

original: vuttadosato parimocāpanahetu. Hetvatthe hi anta-saddo “asambudhaṃ buddhanisevita”ntiādīsu
analyzed: vutta dosataḥ parimocāpana hetu hetu atthe hi anta saddaḥ asambudham buddha nisevita nti ādīsu
translated: The word “end” is used here in the sense of cause, as in such passages as “The unawakened one is served by the awakened one” .

original: viya. Imassa suttassa saṃvaṇṇanāppakāravicāraṇena attano ñāṇassa paccakkhataṃ sandhāya🔽“idāni vattabba”nti vuttaṃ. Esā hi saṃvaṇṇanākārānaṃ pakati, yadidaṃ saṃvaṇṇetabbadhamme
analyzed: viya imassa suttassa saṃvaṇṇanā appakāra vicāraṇena attanaḥ ñāṇassa paccakkhatam sandhāya  idāni vattabbam ti vuttam esā hi saṃvaṇṇanā kārānam pakati yat idam saṃvaṇṇetabba dhamme
translated: The words “Now what is to be said” are said with reference to the fact that his own knowledge is evident through the investigation of the method of exposition of this sutta.

original: sabbattha “ayamimassa attho, evamidha saṃvaṇṇayissāmī”ti puretarameva saṃvaṇṇanāppakāravicāraṇā.
analyzed: sabbattha ayam imassa attho evam idha saṃvaṇṇayissāmi iti puretaram eva saṃvaṇṇanā appakāra vicāraṇā
translated: For this is the nature of expositions, that the method of exposition is investigated beforehand in all cases with the thought “This is the meaning of this, and thus I shall explain it here.”🔽The meaning of the words “foremost in …” has already been given.

original: Etadaggapadassattho vuttova. “Bahussutāna”ntiādīsu pana aññepi therā bahussutā, satimanto,
analyzed: etad agga padassa attho vuttaḥ iva bahussuta ananti ādīsu pana aññe pi therāḥ bahussutā satimanto
translated: But there are other elders too who are learned, mindful,

original: gatimanto, dhitimanto, upaṭṭhākā ca atthi, ayaṃ panāyasmā buddhavacanaṃ gaṇhanto
analyzed: gatimantaḥ dhitimantaḥ upaṭṭhākā ca atthi ayam pana ayasmai buddha vacanam gaṇhanto
translated: wise, resolute, and attendants, and this venerable elder, while receiving the Buddha’s word,

original: dasabalassa sāsane bhaṇḍāgārikapariyattiyaṃ ṭhatvā gaṇhi, tasmā bahussutānaṃ aggo
analyzed: dasabalassa sāsane bhaṇḍāgārika pariyattiyam ṭhatvā gaṇhi tasmai bahu ssutānam aggaḥ
translated: and he was called the foremost of those who have learned much.

original: nāma jāto. Imassa ca therassa buddhavacanaṃ uggahetvā dhāraṇasati aññehi therehi
analyzed: nāma jātaḥ imassa ca therassa buddha vacanam uggahetvā dhāraṇa sati aññehi therehi
translated: And this Elder, after learning the Buddha’s Word, had a memory for the Dhamma that was stronger than that of other Elders,🔽and therefore he was called the foremost of those who have a good memory.

original: balavatarā ahosi, tasmā satimantānaṃ aggo nāma jāto. Ayamevāyasmā ekapade ṭhatvā
analyzed: balavatarā ahosi tasmā satimantānam aggaḥ nāma jātaḥ ayam eva ayasmai ekapade ṭhatvā
translated: And this venerable one, standing in one place,

original: saṭṭhipadasahassāni gaṇhanto satthārā kathitaniyāmena sabbapadāni jānāti, tasmā gatimantānaṃ
analyzed: saṭṭhi pada sahassāni gaṇhantaḥ satthārā kathita niyāmena sabba padāni jānāti tasmai gatimantānam
translated: knew all the words spoken by the Teacher, as he recited the sixty-eight thousand sections of the Dhamma in the order in which they were spoken by the Teacher,🔽and therefore he was called the foremost of those who have a good delivery.

original: aggo nāma jāto. Tasseva cāyasmato buddhavacanaṃ uggaṇhanavīriyaṃ, sajjhāyanavīriyañca
analyzed: aggaḥ nāma jātaḥ tassa iva ca āyasmataḥ buddha vacanam uggaṇhana vīriyam sajjhāyana vīriyam ca
translated: And this venerable one’s energy in learning the Buddha’s Word and in reciting it

original: aññehi asadisaṃ ahosi, tasmā dhitimantānaṃ aggo nāma jāto. Tathāgataṃ upaṭṭhahanto🔽cesa na aññesaṃ upaṭṭhākabhikkhūnaṃ upaṭṭhahanākārena upaṭṭhahati. Aññepi hi tathāgataṃ
analyzed: aññehi asadisam ahosi tasmā dhitimantānam aggaḥ nāma jātaḥ tathāgatam upaṭṭhahanto  na aññesam upaṭṭhāka bhikkhūnam upaṭṭhahana ākārena upaṭṭhahati aññe pi hi tathāgatam
translated: was unequalled by that of others, and therefore he was called the foremost of those who have a good understanding.🔽While attending on the Tathāgata,🔽he did not attend on him in the way that other attendant monks did. For other monks had attended on the Tathāgata,

original: upaṭṭhahiṃsu, na ca pana buddhānaṃ manaṃ gahetvā upaṭṭhahituṃ sakkonti, ayaṃ pana
analyzed: upaṭṭhahiṃsu na ca pana buddhānam manam gahetvā upaṭṭhahitum sakkonti ayam pana
translated: but they were not able to attend on him in a way that would please the Buddhas. But this Elder

original: thero upaṭṭhākaṭṭhānaṃ laddhadivasato paṭṭhāya āraddhavīriyo hutvā tathāgatassa manaṃ
analyzed: thero upaṭṭhāka ṭṭhānam laddha divasataḥ paṭṭhāya āraddha vīriyaḥ hutvā tathāgatassa manaṃ
translated: The Elder, having received the position of attendant, was energetic from the day he received it, and he attended on the Realised One,

original: gahetvā upaṭṭhahi, tasmā upaṭṭhākānaṃ aggo nāma jāto. Atthakusaloti bhāsitatthe,
analyzed: gahetvā upaṭṭhahi tasmai upaṭṭhākānam aggaḥ nāma jātaḥ attha kusalaḥ ti bhāsita tthe
translated: pleasing his mind. Therefore he became known as the foremost of attendants. Skilled in the meaning: he is skilled in the meaning of what is said,

original: payojanatthe ca cheko. Dhammoti pāḷidhammo, nānāvidho vā hetu. Byañjananti akkharaṃ🔽atthassa byañjanato. Padena hi byañjitopi attho akkharamūlakattā padassa “akkharena
analyzed: payojana atthe ca chekaḥ dhammo ti pāḷi dhammaḥ nānāvidhaḥ vā hetu byañjananti akkharam  atthassa byañjanataḥ padena hi byañjitaḥ api atthaḥ akkhara mūlaka ttā padassa akkharena
translated: and in the purpose of it. Dhamma: the Dhamma of the texts, or the various kinds of causes. Expression: the syllable,🔽because of the expression of the meaning by means of the syllable. For although the meaning is expressed by means of the word, because the word is rooted in the syllable, it is said: “expressed by means of the syllable.”

original: byañjito”ti vuccati. Atthassa viyañjanato vā vākyampi idha byañjanaṃ nāma. Vākyena
analyzed: byañjitā iti vuccati atthassa viyañjanataḥ vā vākyam pi idha byañjanam nāma vākyena
translated: Or the sentence is also called “expression” here, because of the expression of the meaning by means of the sentence.

original: hi attho paripuṇṇaṃ byañjīyati, yato “byañjanehi vivaratī”ti āyasmatā mahākaccāyanattherena
analyzed: hi attho paripuṇṇam byañjīyati yatas byañjanehi āyasmatā mahākaccāyana ttherena
translated: For the meaning is fully expressed by means of the sentence, and therefore it was said by the venerable Elder Mahākaccāyana: “He explains by means of expressions.”

original: vuttaṃ. Niruttīti nibbacanaṃ, pañcavidhā vā niruttinayā. Tesampi hi saddaracanāvisesena
analyzed: vuttam nirutti iti nibbacanam pañcavidhā vā nirutti nayā tesam pi hi sadda racanā visesena
translated: The recitation: the recitation, or the five methods of recitation. For the recitation is also called “expression” here, because of the expression of the meaning by means of the recitation.

original: atthādhigamahetuto idha gahaṇaṃ yujjati. Pubbāparaṃ nāma pubbāparānusandhi, suttassa
analyzed: attha adhigama hetutaḥ idha gahaṇam yujjati pubbāparam nāma pubbāpara anusandhi suttassa
translated: For the meaning is expressed by means of the recitation, and therefore it was said by the venerable Elder Mahākaccāyana: “He explains by means of expressions.”🔽The connection: the connection between the earlier and later parts of the sutta,

original: vā pubbabhāgena aparabhāgassa saṃsandanaṃ. Bhagavatā ca pañcavidhaetadaggaṭṭhānena
analyzed: vā pubba bhāgena apara bhāgassa saṃsandanam bhagavatā ca pañcavidha etad agga ṭṭhānena
translated: and the latter part is connected with the former part. And the Blessed One’s fivefold pre-eminence,

original: dhammasenāpatinā ca pañcavidhakosallena pasaṭṭhabhāvānurūpanti sambandho. Dhāraṇabalanti🔽dhāraṇasaṅkhātaṃ balaṃ, dhāraṇe vā balaṃ, ubhayatthāpi dhāretuṃ sāmatthiyanti vuttaṃ
analyzed: dhamma senāpatinā ca pañcavidha kosallena pasaṭṭha bhāva anurūpanti sambandhaḥ dhāraṇa balanti  dhāraṇa saṅkhātam balam dhāraṇe vā balam ubhayatthā api dhāretum sāmatthiyam ti vuttam
translated: and the general’s fivefold skillfulness, are in conformity with the excellence of the Dhamma. The word “strength” in the phrase “strength of retention”🔽is a strength called “retention,” or it is a strength in retention. In both cases it means the ability to retain.🔽The meaning is: “having shown, as a cause for showing.” And the word “strength” in the phrase “strength of discernment”

original: hoti. Dassento hutvā, dassanahetūtipi attho. Tañca kho atthato vā byañjanato vā anūnamanadhikanti
analyzed: hoti dassentaḥ hutvā dassana hetu utipi attho tat ca kho atthataḥ vā byañjanataḥ vā anūnam anadhikanti
translated: is a discernment called “strength,” or it is a strength in discernment. In both cases it means the ability to discern.

original: avadhāraṇaphalamāha. Na aññathā daṭṭhabbanti pana nivattetabbatthaṃ. Na aññathāti🔽ca bhagavato sammukhā sutākārato na aññathā, na pana bhagavatā desitākārato. Acinteyyānubhāvā
analyzed: avadhāraṇa phalam āha na aññathā daṭṭhabbanti pana nivattetabbattham na aññathā ti  ca bhagavato sammukhā suta ākārataḥ na aññathā na pana bhagavatā desitā ākārataḥ acinteyyā anubhāvā
translated: The meaning is: “having discerned, as a cause for discerning.” The word “strength” in the phrase “strength of energy”🔽is an energy called “strength,” or it is a strength in energy. In both cases it means the ability to strive.🔽The meaning is: “having striven, as a cause for striving.” The word “strength” in the phrase “strength of knowledge”🔽is a knowledge called “strength,” or it is a strength in knowledge. In both cases it means the ability to know.🔽The meaning is: “having known, as a cause for knowing.” The word “strength” in the phrase “strength of relinquishment”

original: hi bhagavato desanā, evañca katvā “sabbappakārena ko samattho viññātu”nti heṭṭhā
analyzed: hi bhagavataḥ desanāḥ evañca katvā sabba ppakārena kaḥ samatthaḥ viññātunti heṭṭhā
translated: is a relinquishment called “strength,” or it is a strength in relinquishment. In both cases it means the ability to relinquish.

original: vuttavacanaṃ samatthitaṃ hoti, itarathā bhagavatā desitākāreneva sotuṃ samatthattā
analyzed: vutta vacanam samatthitam hoti itarathā bhagavatā desita ākārena iva sotum samattha ttā
translated: The meaning is: “having relinquished, as a cause for relinquishing.” The word “strength” in the phrase “strength of retention”🔽is a retention called “strength,” or it is a strength in retention. In both cases it means the ability to retain.🔽The meaning is: “having retained, as a cause for retaining.” The word “strength” in the phrase “strength of discernment”🔽is a discernment called “strength,” or it is a strength in discernment. In both cases it means the ability to discern.🔽The meaning is: “having discerned, as a cause for discerning.” The word “strength” in the phrase “strength of energy”🔽is an energy called “strength,” or it is a strength in energy. In both cases it means the ability to strive.🔽The meaning is: “having striven, as a cause for striving.” The word “strength” in the phrase “strength of knowledge”🔽is a knowledge called “strength,” or it is a strength in

original: tadetaṃ na vattabbaṃ siyā. Yathāvuttena pana atthena dhāraṇabaladassanañca na virujjhati🔽sutākārāvirujjhanavasena dhāraṇassa adhippetattā, aññathā bhagavatā desitākāreneva
analyzed: tat etam na vattabbam siyā yathā vuttena pana atthena dhāraṇa bala dassanam ca na virujjhati  suta ākāra a virujjhana vasena dhāraṇassa adhippeta ttā aññathā bhagavatā desita ākārena iva
translated: but this is not to be said. However, the seeing of the power of retention in the sense stated is not contradicted,🔽because retention is intended in the sense of the non-contradiction of the form of the learning; for if it were not so, then it would be contradicted by the words stated above,

original: dhārituṃ samatthanato heṭṭhā vuttavacanena virujjheyya. Na hettha dvinnaṃ atthānaṃ
analyzed: dhāritum samatthanataḥ heṭṭhā vutta vacanena virujjheyya na ha ittha dvinnam atthānam
translated: because it would be possible to retain it in the very form taught by the Blessed One. But here it is not proper to avoid the contradiction of the two meanings

original: atthantaratāparihāro yutto tesaṃ dvinnampi atthānaṃ sutabhāvadīpanena ekavisayattā,
analyzed: atthantara tā parihāraḥ yuttaḥ tesam dvinnam pi atthānam suta bhāva dīpanena eka visaya ttā
translated: by the method of a third meaning, because the two meanings have the same province, since they both illustrate the state of learning.

original: itarathā thero bhagavato desanāya sabbathā paṭiggahaṇe pacchimatthavasena samattho,
analyzed: itarathā theraḥ bhagavataḥ desanāya sabbathā paṭiggahaṇe pacchimattha vasena samatthaḥ
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the elder was able to receive the teaching in all ways by the last meaning,

original: purimatthavasena ca asamatthoti āpajjeyyāti.🔽“Yo paro na hoti, so attā”ti vuttāya niyakajjhattasaṅkhātāya santatiyā pavattanako
analyzed: purimattha vasena ca asamatthaḥ ti āpajjeyya ati  yaḥ paraḥ na hoti saḥ attā ati vuttāya niyaka jjhatta saṅkhātāya santatiyā pavattanakaḥ
translated: but was unable by the first meaning.🔽The word “me” is of three kinds, referring to the occurrence in the continuity called “one’s own” and “internal” when it is said, “What is not another is self.”

original: tividhopi me-saddo, tasmā kiñcāpi niyakajjhattasantativasena ekasmiṃ yevatthe me-saddo
analyzed: tividhaḥ pi mesaddo tasmā kiñca api niyaka jjhatta santati vasena ekasmin yevatthe mesaddo
translated: Therefore, although the word “me” refers to a single meaning in the sense of “one’s own” and “internal” continuity,

original: dissati, tathāpi karaṇasampadānasāminiddesavasena vijjamānavibhattibhedaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: dissati tathā api karaṇa sampadāna sāmi niddesa vasena vijjamāna vibhatti bhedam sandhāya
translated: and it is seen in that way, nevertheless it is said that “it is seen in three meanings” in order to show the mode of the declensional endings that exist by way of the indication of the master of the accomplishment of the act.

original: vuttaṃ “tīsu atthesu dissatī”ti, tīsu vibhattiyatthesu attanā saññuttavibhattito
analyzed: vuttam tīsu atthesu dissati iti tīsu vibhattiya tthesu attanā
translated: The meaning is: it is seen in the three meanings of the declensional endings by the declensional ending connected with itself.

original: dissatīti attho. Gāthābhigītanti gāthāya abhigītaṃ abhimukhaṃ gāyitaṃ. Abhojaneyyanti
analyzed: dissati iti atthaḥ gāthā abhigītam ti gāthāya abhigītam abhimukham gāyitam abhojaneyyam ti
translated: Sung in the verses: sung in the verses, sung in front, sung. Not to be eaten:

original: bhojanaṃ kātumanaraharūpaṃ. Abhigītapadassa kattupekkhattā mayāti attho. Evaṃ sesesupi🔽yathārahaṃ. Sutasaddassa kammabhāvasādhanavasena dvādhippāyikapadattā yathāyogaṃ
analyzed: bhojanam abhigīta padassa mayā iti atthaḥ evam sesesu pi  yathāraham suta saddassa kamma bhāva sādhana vasena dvi ādhippāyika padattā yathāyogam
translated: the form that is fit to be made into food. The meaning is: “I” because of the nominative case of the word sung. So too in the rest

original: “mayā suta”nti ca “mama suta”nti ca atthadvaye yujjati.
analyzed: mayā sutanti ca mama sutanti ca attha dvaye yujjati
translated: as appropriate. Because of the two meanings of the word heard, the word heard is appropriate in the two meanings “heard by me” and “heard by me” by way of the mode of the action of the word heard.

original: Kiñcāpi upasaggo kiriyaṃ viseseti, jotakamattabhāvato pana satipi tasmiṃ sutasaddoyeva
analyzed: kiñca api upasaggo kiriyam viseseti jotaka matta bhāvato pana tasmin
translated: Although the prefix distinguishes the action, nevertheless, because of the mere state of the indication, even though it exists, the word heard🔽speaks of this and that meaning. Therefore the inclusion of the word heard without the prefix in the explanation of the meaning

original: taṃ taṃ atthaṃ vadatīti anupasaggassa sutasaddassa atthuddhāre saupasaggassa gahaṇaṃ
analyzed: tam tam attham vadati iti anupasaggassa suta saddassa attha uddhāre sa upasaggassa gahaṇam
translated: is the inclusion of the word heard with the prefix.

original: na virujjhatīti āha “saupasaggo ca anupasaggo cā”ti. Assāti sutasaddassa. Upasaggavasenapi
analyzed: na virujjhati iti āha sa upasaggaḥ ca anupasaggaḥ ca ati assa ati suta saddassa upasagga vasena api
translated: “With and without misapprehension” is said because it is not misapprehended. “Assa” is the sound of “suta.”

original: dhātusaddo visesatthavācako yathā “anubhavati parābhavatī”ti vuttaṃ “gacchantoti
analyzed: dhātu saddaḥ visesa attha vācakaḥ yathā anubhavati parābhavati iti vuttam gacchantaḥ iti
translated: The word “dhātu” expresses a distinction by way of misapprehension, just as it is said, “anubhavati parābhavatī,” and it is said, “the meaning is ‘going.’“

original: attho”ti. Tathā anupasaggopi dhātusaddo saupasaggo viya visesatthavācakoti āha “vissutadhammassāti🔽attho”ti. Evamīdisesu. Sotaviññeyyanti sotadvāranissitena viññāṇena viññātabbaṃ,
analyzed: atthaḥ iti tathā anupasaggaḥ api dhātu saddo saupasaggaḥ viya visesa attha vācakaḥ ti āha vissuta dhammassa ati  atthaḥ ti evamīdisesu sota viññeyyanti sota dvāra nissitena viññāṇena viññātabbam
translated: In the same way, the word “dhātu” without misapprehension, like with misapprehension, expresses a distinction, and therefore it is said, “the meaning is ‘well-known Dhamma.’“🔽In this way, “to be cognized by the ear” means to be cognized by the consciousness dependent on the ear-door.🔽This is a discourse with its equipment, and the meaning is “to be cognized by the ear-door.”

original: sasambhārakathā vā esā, sotadvārena viññātabbanti attho. Sotadvārānusāraviññātadharoti🔽sotadvārānusārena manoviññāṇena viññātadhammadharo. Na hi sotadvāranissitaviññāṇamattena
analyzed: sa sambhāra kathā vā esā sota dvārena viññātabbanti  sota dvāra anusārena manaḥ viññāṇena viññāta dhamma dharaḥ na hi sota dvāra nissita viññāṇa mattena
translated: “One who bears the Dhamma cognized by following the ear-door”🔽means one who bears the Dhamma cognized by mind-consciousness following the ear-door.

original: dhammo viññāyati, atha kho tadanusāramanoviññāṇeneva, sutadharoti ca tathā viññātadhammadharo
analyzed: dhammaḥ viññāyati atha kho tad anusāra manaḥ viññāṇena iva suta dharo ti ca tathā viññāta dhamma dharo
translated: For the Dhamma is not cognized by the mere consciousness dependent on the ear-door, but rather by the mind-consciousness following it. “One who bears what is heard” means one who bears the Dhamma cognized in that way.

original: vutto, tasmā tadatthoyeva sambhavatīti evaṃ vuttaṃ. Kammabhāvasādhanāni sutasadde
analyzed: vuttaḥ tasmā sambhavati iti evam vuttam kamma bhāva sādhanāni suta sadde
translated: Therefore it is said that it is only the meaning of that that is possible.

original: sambhavantīti dassetuṃ “idha panā”tiādimāha. Pubbāparapadasambandhavasena atthassa🔽upapannatā, anupapannatā ca viññāyati, tasmā sutasaddasseva vasena ayamattho “upapanno,
analyzed: sambhavanti iti dassetum idha pana ati ādim āha pubba apara pada sambandha vasena atthassa  upapanna tā anupapanna tā ca viññāyati tasmā suta saddassa iva vasena ayam atthaḥ upapannaḥ
translated: In order to show that the words of the sutta are possible in the sense of the state of being a deed, he says, “But here,” etc.

original: anupapanno”ti vā na viññātabboti codanāya pubbāparapadasambandhavasena etadatthassa
analyzed: anupapannaḥ ti vā na viññātabbaḥ ti codanāya pubba apara pada sambandha vasena etad atthassa
translated: The meaning is understood and not understood according to the connection of the words in the order in which they are given. Therefore it should not be understood that this meaning is understood or not understood according to the word of the sutta only.

original: upapannataṃ dassetuṃ “me-saddassa hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Mayāti atthe satīti kattutthe
analyzed: upapanna tam dassetum hi itiādi vuttam mayā ati atthe sati iti kattutthe
translated: In order to show that this meaning is understood according to the connection of the words in the order in which they are given, it is said, “For the word me,” etc.🔽When the word me is used in the sense of mayā, in the accusative case,

original: karaṇaniddesavasena mayāti atthe vattabbe sati, yadā me-saddassa kattuvasena karaṇaniddeso,🔽tadāti vuttaṃ hoti. Mamāti atthe satīti sambandhīyatthe sāminiddesavasena mamāti
analyzed: karaṇa niddesa vasena mayā ati atthe vattabbe sati yadā me saddassa kattu vasena karaṇa niddesaḥ  tadā iti vuttam hoti mama ati atthe sati iti sambandhīya tthe sāmi niddesa vasena mama ati
translated: in the sense of the agent, and the word me is used in the sense of mayi, in the locative case,

original: atthe vattabbe sati, yadā sambandhavasena sāmi niddeso, tadāti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: atthe vattabbe sati yadā sambandha vasena sāmi niddeso tadā iti vuttam hoti
translated: in the sense of the possessor, then it is said that the meaning is understood according to the connection of the words in the order in which they are given.

original: Evaṃ saddato ñātabbamatthaṃ viññāpetvā idāni tehi dassetabbamatthaṃ nidassento “evametesū”tiādimāha.
analyzed: evam saddataḥ ñātabbam attham viññāpetvā idāni tehi dassetabbam attham nidassentaḥ evam etesu iti ādim āha
translated: Having thus made known the meaning to be known by means of faith, the Master now said “Evam-etam” , etc., in order to point out the meaning to be shown by them.

original: Sutasaddasannidhāne payuttena evaṃ-saddena savanakiriyājotakeneva bhavitabbaṃ vijjamānatthassa
analyzed: suta sadda sannidhāne payuttena evaṃsaddena savana kiriyā jotakena iva bhavitabbam vijjamāna atthassa
translated: The word evaṃ should be taken as indicating the act of hearing only, by means of the word evaṃ occurring in the proximity of the word suta , because the function of a prefix is merely to indicate.

original: jotakamattattā nipātānanti vuttaṃ “evanti sotaviññāṇādiviññāṇakiccanidassana”nti.
analyzed: jotaka matta ttā nipātānam ti vuttam eva nti sota viññāṇa ādi viññāṇa kicca nidassanan ti
translated: Therefore it is said: “Evam-etaṃ is the indication of the function of the ear-consciousness, etc., and of the consciousnesses.”

original: Savanāya eva hi ākāro, nidassanaṃ, avadhāraṇampi, tasmā yathāvutto evaṃ-saddassa
analyzed: savanāya eva hi ākāraḥ nidassanam avadhāraṇam pi tasmā yathā vuttaḥ evaṃsaddassa
translated: For the mode, the indication, and the limitation are only of the act of hearing. Therefore, of the word evaṃ, which is stated thus,🔽the meaning of the three kinds is intended here as indicating the act of hearing.

original: tividhopi attho savanakiriyājotakabhāvena idhādhippetoti. Ādi-saddena cettha sampaṭicchanādīnaṃ
analyzed: tividhaḥ api attho savana kiriyā jotaka bhāvena idha adhippeto ti ādi saddena ca ittha sampaṭicchanā ādīnam
translated: By means of the word ādi here, the inclusion of the consciousnesses of the ear-door, such as the act of receiving , etc.,

original: sotadvārikaviññāṇānaṃ, tadabhinipātānañca manodvārika viññāṇānaṃ gahaṇaṃ veditabbaṃ,
analyzed: sota dvārika viññāṇānam tad abhinipātānam ca manaḥ dvārika viññāṇānam gahaṇam veditabbaṃ
translated: and the inclusion of the consciousnesses of the mind-door which are the result of the impact of the former, should be understood.🔽Because the meaning cognized by the consciousnesses following the ear-door is here called the word suta .

original: yato sotadvārānusāraviññātatthe idha sutasaddoti vutto. Avadhāraṇaphalattā saddapayogassa
analyzed: yatas sota dvāra anusāra viññāta tthe idha suta saddo ti vuttaḥ avadhāraṇa phala ttā sadda payogassa
translated: The function of the word is the result of the limitation.

original: sabbampi vākyaṃ antogadhāvadhāraṇaṃ, tasmā “suta”nti etassa sutamevāti ayamattho
analyzed: sabbam pi vākyam antogadha avadhāraṇam tasmā sutam iti etassa sutam eva ati ayam attho
translated: and the whole sentence is a restrictive one. Therefore the meaning “what is heard is only what is heard” is obtained.

original: labbhatīti āha “assavanabhāvapaṭikkhepato”ti. Etena hi vacanena avadhāraṇena nirākataṃ
analyzed: labbhati iti āha assavana bhāva paṭikkhepato ti etena hi vacanena avadhāraṇena nirākatam
translated: He says: “because of the exclusion of the state of non-hearing.” For by this statement he shows the exclusion

original: dasseti. Yathā pana yaṃ sutaṃ sutamevāti niyametabbaṃ, tathā ca taṃ sutaṃ sammā sutaṃ
analyzed: dasseti yathā pana yam sutam sutam eva ati niyametabbam tathā ca tam sutam sammā sutam
translated: by the restriction. But just as what is heard must be restricted to what is heard only, so that what is heard is rightly heard.

original: hotīti avadhāraṇaphalaṃ dassetuṃ vuttaṃ “anūnādhikāviparītaggahaṇanidassana”nti.🔽Atha vā saddantaratthāpohanavasena saddo atthaṃ vadati, tasmā “suta”nti etassa asutaṃ
analyzed: hoti iti avadhāraṇa phalam dassetum vuttam anūna adhika aviparīta ggahaṇa nidassanam ti  atha vā sadda antara ttha apohana vasena saddo attham vadati tasmā etassa a sutam
translated: In order to show the fruit of the restriction, it is said: “because of the indication of the grasping of what is not less, not more, and not wrong.”

original: na hotīti ayamattho labbhatīti sandhāya “assavanabhāvapaṭikkhepato”ti vuttaṃ, iminā
analyzed: na hoti iti ayam atthaḥ labbhati iti sandhāya assavana bhāva paṭikkhepato ti vuttam iminā
translated: Or else, a word expresses a meaning by the mode of the exclusion of another word. Therefore the meaning “what is heard is not what is not heard” is obtained. With reference to this he says: “because of the exclusion of the state of non-hearing.” By this

original: diṭṭhādinivattanaṃ karoti diṭṭhādīnaṃ “asuta”nti saddantaratthabhāvena nivattetabbattā.
analyzed: diṭṭha ādi nivattanam karoti diṭṭha ādīnam saddanta rattha bhāvena nivattetabba ttā
translated: he makes the turning away from the seen, etc., for the seen, etc., must be turned away from by the mode of the meaning of the word “what is not heard.”

original: Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – na idaṃ mayā attano ñāṇena diṭṭhaṃ, na ca sayambhuñāṇena sacchikataṃ,
analyzed: idam vuttam hoti na idam mayā attanaḥ ñāṇena diṭṭham na ca sayambhu ñāṇena sacchikatam
translated: This is what is said: This is not seen by me with my own knowledge, nor is it realized by self-awakening,

original: atha kho sutaṃ, tañca kho sutaṃ sammadevāti. Tadeva sammā sutabhāvaṃ sandhāyāha “anūnā…pe…
analyzed: atha kho sutam tat ca kho sutam sammat eva ati tat eva sammā suta bhāvam sandhāya āha anūnāpe
translated: Then it was heard, and that hearing was correct, dear Sir.” With reference to that very state of being correctly heard he said: “Not less…etc…

original: dassana”nti. Hoti cettha –
analyzed: dassananti hoti ca ittha
translated: seeing.” And here it is:

original: “Evādisattiyā ceva, aññatthāpohanena ca;
analyzed: eva ādi sattiyā ca iva aññattha apohanena ca
translated: “By such a statement and by the exclusion of another meaning,

original: Dvidhā saddo atthantaraṃ, nivatteti yathāraha”nti.
analyzed: dvidhā saddo atthantaram nivatteti yathā ārahanti
translated: The word ‘only’ in two ways sets aside another meaning as appropriate.”

original: Apica avadhāraṇatthe evaṃ-sadde ayamatthayojanā karīyatīti tadapekkhassa sutasaddassa
analyzed: apica avadhāraṇa atthe evaṃsadde ayam attha yojanā tad apekkhassa suta saddassa
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the word ‘eva’ (only) is in the sense of limitation. This is the way the meaning should be interpreted. Therefore, the word ‘suta’ (heard) which is dependent on that,

original: sāvadhāraṇattho vutto “assavanabhāvapaṭikkhepato”ti, tadavadhāraṇaphalaṃ dasseti
analyzed: sa avadhāraṇa atthaḥ vuttaḥ assavana bhāva paṭikkhepato ti tad avadhāraṇa phalam dasseti
translated: has the meaning of limitation stated thus: “by the exclusion of the state of not hearing.” The fruit of that limitation is shown

original: “anū…pe… dassana”nti iminā. Savana-saddo cettha bhāvasaddena yogato kammasādhano
analyzed: anūpe dassanan ti iminā savana saddo ca ittha bhāva saddena yogataḥ kamma sādhano
translated: by this: “not less…etc… seeing.” And here the word ‘suta’ (heard) should be understood as a verbal noun in the sense of an action,

original: veditabbo “suyyatī”ti. Anūnādhikatāya bhagavato sammukhā sutākārato aviparītaṃ, aviparītassa
analyzed: veditabbaḥ suyyati iti anūna adhikatāya bhagavato sammukhā suta ākārataḥ aviparītam aviparītassa
translated: in the sense of ‘is heard.’ The state of being not less or more, the state of being heard in the presence of the Blessed One, the state of being not distorted, or the state of being the grasping of a sutta which is not distorted,

original: vā suttassa gahaṇaṃ, tassa nidassanaṃ tathā, iti savanahetu suṇantapuggalasavanavisesavasena ayaṃ yojanā katā.
analyzed: vā suttassa gahaṇam tassa nidassanam tathā iti savana hetu suṇanta puggala savana visesa vasena ayam yojanā katā
translated: the state of showing that, in that way, in this way the interpretation has been made by way of the person who hears, the distinction of hearing, and the cause of hearing.

original: Evaṃ padattayassa ekena pakārena atthayojanaṃ dassetvā idāni pakārantarenāpi taṃ🔽dassetuṃ “tathā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tassāti yā bhagavato sammukhā dhammassavanākārena
analyzed: evam pada ttayassa ekena pakārena attha yojanam dassetvā idāni pakāra antarena api tam  dassetum tathā tiādi vuttam tattha tassa ti yā bhagavato sammukhā dhamma ssavana ākārena
translated: Having thus shown the meaning of the three terms in one way, he now says “Likewise” in order to show it in another way. Herein, his means the Blessed One’s. The hearing of the True Idea in his presence is the hearing of the True Idea in the Blessed One’s presence.

original: pavattā manodvārikaviññāṇavīthi, tassā. Sā hi nānāppakārena ārammaṇe pavattituṃ samatthā,
analyzed: pavattā manodvārika viññāṇa vīthi tassā sā hi nānā appakārena ārammaṇe pavattitum samatthā
translated: Having thus shown the interpretation of the three terms in one way, he now says “Likewise” in order to show it in another way. Herein, of that: of that mind-door process of consciousness that occurs in the mode of listening to the Dhamma face to face with the Blessed One. For that is able to occur with respect to an object in various modes,

original: na sotadvārika viññāṇavīthi ekārammaṇeyeva pavattanato, tathā ceva vuttaṃ “sotadvārānusārenā”ti.🔽Tena hi sotadvārikaviññāṇavīthi nivattati. Nānappakārenāti vakkhamānena anekavihitena
analyzed: na sota dvārika viññāṇa vīthi eka ārammaṇe iva iva pavattanato tathā ca iva vuttam sota dvāra anusārena ati  tena hi sotadvārika viññāṇa vīthi nivattati nāna ppakārena ati vakkhamānena aneka vihitena
translated: unlike the ear-door process of consciousness, which occurs only with respect to a single object. And that is why it was said above, “By following the ear door” .

original: byañjanatthaggahaṇākārasaṅkhātena nānāvidhena ākārena, etena imissā yojanāya ākārattho
analyzed: byañjana attha ggahaṇa ākāra saṅkhātena nānāvidhena ākārena etena imissā yojanāya ākāra atthaḥ
translated: For it is by that that the ear-door process of consciousness turns back. In various modes: in various ways, in the mode called “grasping the letter and the meaning in many ways,” as will be stated .

original: evaṃ-saddo gahitoti dasseti. Pavattibhāvappakāsananti pavattiyā atthibhāvappakāsanaṃ.
analyzed: evam saddaḥ gahitaḥ ti dasseti pavatti bhāva pakāsanam ti pavattiyāḥ atthi bhāva pakāsanam
translated: By this he shows that the word “thus” is taken in the sense of mode in this interpretation. As showing the existence of the occurrence: as showing the existence of the occurrence.

original: Yasmiṃ pakāre vuttappakārā viññāṇavīthi nānappakārena pavattā, tadeva ārammaṇaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: yasmin pakāre vutta ppakārā viññāṇa vīthi nānā pakārena pavattā tat eva ārammaṇam sandhāya
translated: The “teaching of the Dhamma” is said with reference to the object of the kind of consciousness described in the way stated above, which occurs in various ways.

original: “dhammappakāsana”nti vuttaṃ, na pana sutasaddassa dhammatthaṃ, tena vuttaṃ “ayaṃ
analyzed: dhamma ppakāsanam ti vuttam na pana suta saddassa dhamma attham tena vuttam ayaṃ
translated: But it is not the meaning of the Dhamma as sound, and so it is said, “This Dhamma is heard.”

original: dhammo suto”ti. Tassā hi viññāṇavīthiyā ārammaṇameva “ayaṃ dhammo suto”ti vuccati.🔽Tañca niyamiyamānaṃ yathāvuttāya viññāṇavīthiyā ārammaṇabhūtaṃ suttameva. Ayañhetthātiādi
analyzed: dhammo sutoti tassā hi viññāṇa vīthiyā ārammaṇam eva ayam dhammo sutoti vuccati  tat ca niyamiyamānam yathā vuttāya viññāṇa vīthiyā ārammaṇa bhūtam suttam eva ayam hi itthā tiādi
translated: For the object of that consciousness is called “This Dhamma is heard.”🔽And when that is specified, it is the sutta itself that becomes the object of the consciousness described above. “This is what is meant here” is stated

original: vuttassevatthassa pākaṭīkaraṇaṃ. Tappākaṭīkaraṇattho hettha hi-saddo. Viññāṇavīthiyā
analyzed: vuttassa iva atthassa pākaṭīkaraṇam tad pākaṭīkaraṇa atthaḥ ha ittha hi saddaḥ viññāṇa vīthiyā
translated: in order to make the meaning of what was said above clear. For the word “here” has the meaning of making clear.

original: karaṇabhūtāya mayā na aññaṃ kataṃ, idaṃ pana ārammaṇaṃ kataṃ. Kiṃ pana tanti ce?
analyzed: karaṇa bhūtāya mayā na aññam katam idam pana ārammaṇam katam kim pana tanti ce
translated: I have not done anything else to the consciousness described above, which is the means, but I have made this the object. But what is it?

original: Ayaṃ dhammo sutoti. Ayaṃ panetthādhippāyo – ākāratthe evaṃ-sadde “ekenākārenā”ti
analyzed: ayam dhammo suto ti ayam pana itthā adhippāyaḥ ākāra atthe evaṃsadde ekena ākārena ati
translated: “This Dhamma is heard.” The intention here is this: in the expression “in one way” the word “way” has the meaning of mode.

original: yo ākāro vutto, so atthato sotadvārānusāraviññāṇavīthiyā nānappakārena ārammaṇe pavattibhāvoyeva,
analyzed: yaḥ ākāraḥ vutto so atthato sota dvāra anusāra viññāṇa vīthiyā nānappakārena ārammaṇe
translated: The mode stated is in fact the occurrence in various ways as object of the consciousness described above, which is the means, in the hearing-process.

original: tena ca tadārammaṇabhūtassa dhammasseva savanaṃ kataṃ, na aññanti. Evaṃ savanakiriyāya
analyzed: tena ca tad ārammaṇa bhūtassa dhammassa iva savanam katam na evam savana kiriyāya
translated: and by that the sound of the object of the ear was made, not that of anything else.🔽

original: karaṇakattukammaviseso imissā yojanāya dassito.
analyzed: karaṇa kattu kamma visesaḥ imissā yojanāya dassito
translated: and by that the hearing of the state of things that is the object of that is done, not of anything else. Thus the difference between the instrument and the action is shown in the act of hearing in this interpretation.

original: Aññampi yojanamāha “tathā”tiādinā. Nidassanatthaṃ evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā nidassanena
analyzed: aññam pi yojanam āha tathā ti ādinā nidassana attham evaṃsaddam gahetvā nidassanena
translated: He gives another interpretation with “So too” . Taking the word “so” as having the purpose of pointing out,

original: ca nidassitabbassāvinābhāvato “evanti nidassitabbappakāsana”nti vuttaṃ. Iminā hi
analyzed: ca nidassitabbassa avinābhāvataḥ evanti nidassitabba ppakāsanan ti vuttam iminā hi
translated: he says: “So too is the pointing out of what is to be pointed out” because what is to be pointed out cannot be without the pointing out. For by this

original: tadavinābhāvato evaṃsaddena sakalampi suttaṃ paccāmaṭṭhanti dasseti, sutasaddassa🔽kiriyāparattā, savanakiriyāya ca sādhāraṇaviññāṇappabandhapaṭibaddhattā tasmiñca🔽viññāṇappabandhe puggalavohāroti vuttaṃ “puggalakiccappakāsana”nti. Sādhāraṇaviññāṇappabandho
analyzed: tad avinābhāvataḥ evaṃsaddena sakalam pi suttam paccāmaṭṭhanti dasseti suta saddassa  kiriyā aparattā savana kiriyāya ca sādhāraṇa viññāṇa ppabandha paṭibaddha ttā tasmin ca  viññāṇa ppabandhe puggala vohāro ti vuttam puggala kicca ppakāsanan ti sādhāraṇa viññāṇa ppabandho
translated: he shows that the whole sutta is referred to by the word “so” because it cannot be without that . The word “heard”🔽is subordinate to the action, and the act of hearing is bound up with a continuity of consciousness shared in common, and in that continuity of consciousness the person is spoken of. Thus it is said: “The pointing out of the function of the person.”

original: hi paṇṇattiyā idha puggalo nāma, savanakiriyā pana tassa kiccaṃ nāma. Na hi puggalavohārarahite
analyzed: hi paṇṇattiyāḥ idha puggalaḥ nāma savana kiriyā pana tassa kiccam nāma na hi puggala vohāra rahite
translated: For the shared continuity of consciousness is here called the “person” by description, and the act of hearing is called its “function.” For without the description “person”

original: dhammappabandhe savanakiriyā labbhati vohāravisayattā tassā kiriyāyāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: dhammappabandhe savana kiriyā labbhati vohāra visaya ttā tassā kiriyāya ati daṭṭhabbam
translated: The act of hearing is to be regarded as the province of the term “heard” because it is the province of the term “heard” in the sense of the act of hearing.

original: “Ida”ntiādi piṇḍatthadassanaṃ mayāti yathāvuttaviññāṇappabandhasaṅkhātapuggalabhūtena🔽mayā. Sutanti savanakiriyāsaṅkhātena puggalakiccena yojitaṃ, imissā pana yojanāya
analyzed: idam tiādi piṇḍa attha dassanam mayā ati yathā vutta viññāṇa ppabandha saṅkhāta puggala bhūtena  mayā sutanti savana kiriyā saṅkhātena puggala kiccena yojitam imissā pana yojanāya
translated: “This” is the demonstration of the meaning of the clause. “By me” is by me as a person consisting of the continuity of consciousness described above.

original: puggalabyāpāravisayassa puggalassa, puggalabyāpārassa ca nidassanaṃ katanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: puggala byāpāra visayassa puggalassa puggala byāpārassa ca nidassanam katan ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: “Heard” is connected with the act of hearing as a person’s action. But the meaning of the connection should be regarded as the demonstration of the person as the province of the person’s action and of the person’s action itself.

original: Ākāratthameva evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā purimayojanāya aññathāpi atthayojanaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: ākāra attham eva evaṃsaddam gahetvā purima yojanāya aññathā api attha yojanam dassetum
translated: Taking the word “thus” in the sense of manner, the following interpretation is given in order to show another meaning:🔽“Thus” is said in order to show the manner of the occurrence of the consciousnesses in the continuity of consciousness.

original: “tathā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Cittasantānassāti yathāvuttaviññāṇappabandhassa. Nānākārappavattiyāti🔽nānappakārena ārammaṇe pavattiyā. Nānappakāraṃ atthabyañjanassa gahaṇaṃ, nānappakārassa
analyzed: tathā tiādi vuttam citta santānassa ati yathā vutta viññāṇa ppabandhassa nānā ākāra ppavattiyā ati  nānā pakārena ārammaṇe pavattiyā nānā ppakāram attha byañjanassa gahaṇam nānā ppakārassa
translated: The occurrence of the consciousnesses in the continuity of consciousness is the manner of the occurrence of the consciousnesses.🔽The meaning of the word “thus” is the manner of occurrence of the consciousnesses.

original: vā atthabyañjanassa gahaṇaṃ tathā, tatoyeva sā “ākārapaññattī”ti vuttāti tadevatthaṃ
analyzed: vā attha byañjanassa gahaṇam tathā sā ākāra paññatti iti vuttā ati
translated: The meaning of the word “thus” is the manner of occurrence of the consciousnesses.🔽The meaning of the word “thus” is the manner of occurrence of the consciousnesses.🔽The meaning of the word “thus” is the manner of occurrence of the consciousnesses.🔽The meaning of the word “thus” is the manner of occurrence of the consciousnesses.🔽The meaning of the word “thus” is the manner of occurrence of the consciousnesses.🔽The meaning of the word “thus” is the manner of occurrence of the consciousnesses.🔽The meaning of the word “thus” is the manner of occurrence of the consciousnesses.🔽The meaning of the word “thus” is the manner of occurrence of the consciousnesses.

original: samattheti “evanti hī”tiādinā. Ākārapaññattīti ca upādāpaññattiyeva, dhammānaṃ pana🔽pavattiākāramupādāya paññattattā tadaññāya upādāpaññattiyā visesanatthaṃ “ākārapaññattī”ti
analyzed: samatthā iti evam ti hi itiādinā ākāra paññatti iti ca upādā paññattiyā iva dhammānam pana  pavatti ākāram upādāya paññatta ttā tad aññāya upādā paññattiyāḥ visesana attham ākāra paññatti iti
translated: “The mode-concept” is the same as the description-concept. But it is called “mode-concept” in order to distinguish it from the other description-concept, because it is described by taking the mode of occurrence of the ideas as the description.

original: vuttā visayaniddesoti uppattiṭṭhānaniddeso. Sotabbabhūto hi dhammo savanakiriyākattubhūtassa🔽puggalassa savanakiriyāvasena pavattiṭṭhānaṃ kiriyāya kattukammaṭṭhattā tabbasena
analyzed: vuttā visaya niddeso ti uppatti ṭṭhāna niddeso sotabba bhūtaḥ hi dhammo savana kiriyā kattu bhūtassa  puggalassa savana kiriyā vasena pavatti ṭṭhānam kiriyāya kattu kamma ṭṭhattā tad basena
translated: “The object-description” is the description of the place of arising. For the idea that is to be heard is the place of occurrence of the person who is the doer of the act of hearing, because the act is the thing to be done by him;

original: ca tadādhārassāpi dabbassa ādhārabhāvassa icchitattā, idha pana kiriyāya kattupavattiṭṭhānabhāvo
analyzed: ca tad ādhārassa api dabbassa ādhāra bhāvassa icchita ttā idha pana kiriyāya kattu pavatti ṭṭhāna bhāvaḥ
translated: and because the state of being the support of that is also admitted in the case of the stick, etc., which are the support of that. But here the state of being the place of occurrence of the act by the doer is intended;

original: icchitoti kammameva ādhāravasena vuttaṃ, tenāha “kattu visayaggahaṇasanniṭṭhāna”nti,
analyzed: icchito ti kammam eva ādhāra vasena vuttam tena āha kattu visaya ggahaṇa sanniṭṭhānam ti
translated: so only the act is mentioned as the support. Hence he said “the object-description is the determination of the doer and the object.”

original: ārammaṇameva vā visayo. Ārammaṇañhi tadārammaṇikassa pavattiṭṭhānaṃ. Evampi hi attho
analyzed: ārammaṇam eva vā visayaḥ ārammaṇam hi tad ārammaṇikassa pavatti ṭṭhānam evam pi hi atthaḥ
translated: Or the object is the object of the act of hearing. For the object is the place of occurrence of the act of hearing that has the object as its doer.🔽In this way too the meaning is more easily understood.

original: suviññeyyataro hoti. Yathāvuttavacane piṇḍatthaṃ dassetuṃ “ettāvatā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: su viññeyyataraḥ hoti yathā vutta vacane piṇḍa attham dassetum ettāvatā atiādi vuttam
translated: In order to point out the meaning of the words as stated, he said “In this way” and so on.

original: Ettāvatā ettakena yathāvuttatthena padattayena, kataṃ hotīti sambandho. Nānākārappavattenāti
analyzed: ettāvatā ettakena yathā vutta atthena padattayena katam hoti iti sambandhaḥ nānā ākāra ppavattena ati
translated: By the occurrence in various modes:🔽by the occurrence in various modes in the object.🔽By the continuity of consciousness:

original: nānappakārena ārammaṇe pavattena. Cittasantānenāti yathāvuttaviññāṇavīthisaṅkhātena🔽cittappabandhena. Gahaṇasadde cetaṃ karaṇaṃ. Cittasantānavinimuttassa kassaci kattu🔽paramatthato abhāvepi saddavohārena buddhiparikappitabhedavacanicchāya cittasantānato
analyzed: nānappakārena ārammaṇe pavattena citta santānena ati yathā vutta viññāṇa vīthi saṅkhātena  citta ppabandhena gahaṇa sadde ca itam karaṇam citta santāna vinimuttassa kassaci  paramatthataḥ abhāve pi sadda vohārena buddhi parikappita bheda vacanicchāya citta santānato
translated: by the continuity of consciousness called the “process of consciousness” .🔽This is the instrumental case.

original: aññamiva taṃsamaṅgiṃ katvā abhedepi bhedavohārena “cittasantānena taṃsamaṅgino”ti
analyzed: aññam iva taṃsamaṅgim katvā abhede pi bheda vohārena citta santānena
translated: Although there is no other doer apart from the continuity of consciousness in the ultimate sense, still, in order to show the difference that is imagined by the intellect by the conventional expression, it is said: “by the continuity of consciousness, by the continuity of consciousness that is as if it were separate from the continuity of consciousness.”🔽For a sound is not necessarily in the ultimate sense the object of a conventional expression.

original: vuttaṃ. Vohāravisayo hi saddo nekantaparamatthikoti (kārakarūpasiddhiyaṃ yo kāreti
analyzed: vuttam vohāra visayaḥ hi saddo nekanta paramatthiko ti yaḥ kāreti
translated: (In the Kāraka-rūpa-siddhi, the Hetu-sutta should be looked up.)

original: sahetusuttaṃ passitabbaṃ) savanakiriyāvisayopi sotabbadhammo savanakiriyāvasena pavattacittasantānassa
analyzed: sa hetu suttam passitabbam savana kiriyā visayaḥ api sotabba dhammo savana kiriyā vasena pavatta citta santānassa
translated: Although the object of hearing is the object of the act of hearing, still, the continuity of consciousness that occurs by way of the act of hearing is said to be the doer of the act of hearing.

original: idha paramatthato kattubhāvato tassa visayoyevāti vuttaṃ “kattu visayaggahaṇasanniṭṭhāna”nti.
analyzed: idha paramatthataḥ kattu bhāvataḥ tassa visayaḥ yeva ati vuttam kattu visaya ggahaṇa sanniṭṭhānam ti
translated: Herein, it is the object of the doer in the ultimate sense, which is why it is said that the act of apprehending and determining is the object of the doer.

original: Apica savanavasena cittappavattiyā eva savanakiriyābhāvato taṃvasena tadaññanāmarūpadhammasamudāyabhūtassa
analyzed: apica savana vasena citta ppavattiyāḥ eva savana kiriyā bhāvataḥ tad vasena tad añña nāma rūpa dhamma samudāya bhūtassa
translated: Besides, since the act of hearing is the mere occurrence of consciousness by way of hearing, and since the doer of that act is the aggregate of mental and bodily phenomena that is other than that,

original: taṃkiriyākattu ca visayo hotīti katvā tathā vuttaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – purimanaye
analyzed: ca visayaḥ hoti iti katvā tathā vuttam idam vuttam hoti purima naye
translated: it is said thus because it is the object of that doer. What is meant is this: in the former method,

original: savanakiriyā, takkattā ca paramatthato tathāpavattacittasantānameva, tasmā kiriyāvisayopi
analyzed: savana kiriyā ca paramatthato tathā pavatta citta santānam eva tasmā kiriyā visayaḥ api
translated: the act of hearing and the doer are the mere occurrence of consciousness in that way in the ultimate sense, and therefore the object of the act is also

original: “kattu visayo”ti vutto. Pacchimanaye pana tathāpavattacittasantānaṃ kiriyā, tadaññadhammasamudāyo
analyzed: kattu visayaḥ ti vuttaḥ pacchima naye pana tathā pavatta citta santānam kiriyā tad añña dhamma samudāyo
translated: said to be the object of the doer. But in the latter method, the occurrence of consciousness in that way is the act, and the aggregate of other phenomena is the doer,

original: pana kattā, tasmā kāmaṃ ekantato kiriyāvisayoyevesa dhammo, tathāpi kiriyāvasena
analyzed: pana kattā tasmā kāmam ekantato dhammo tathā api kiriyā vasena
translated: and therefore, although this phenomenon is the object of the act in the ultimate sense, still it is said to be

original: “tabbantakattu visayo”ti vuttoti. Taṃsamaṅginoti tena cittasantānena samaṅgino. Kattūti
analyzed: visayaḥ ti vuttaḥ ti tad samaṅginaḥ iti tena citta santānena samaṅginaḥ kattu iti
translated: the object of the doer by way of the act. “Possessed of that” means possessed of that continuity of consciousness. “Doer” means

original: kattārassa. Visayoti ārammaṇavasena pavattiṭṭhānaṃ, ārammaṇameva vā. Sutākārassa
analyzed: kattārassa visayo ti ārammaṇa vasena pavatti ṭṭhānam ārammaṇam eva vā suta ākārassa
translated: and of the speaker. The domain is the place of occurrence by way of the object, or the object itself.

original: ca therassa sammā nicchitabhāvato “gahaṇasanniṭṭhāna”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ca therassa sammā nicchita bhāvataḥ gahaṇa sanniṭṭhānam ti vuttam
translated: And because the Elder had well-ascertained the mode of the Suttas, it is said: “the determination of the mode of apprehension.”

original: Aparo nayo – yassa…pe… ākārapaññattīti ākāratthena evaṃ-saddena yojanaṃ katvā tadeva🔽avadhāraṇatthampi gahetvā imasmiṃyeva naye yojetuṃ “gahaṇaṃ kataṃ” icceva avatvā
analyzed: aparaḥ nayaḥ yassape ākāra paññatti iti ākāra atthena evaṃsaddena yojanam katvā tat eva  avadhāraṇa attham pi gahetvā imasmin yeva naye yojetum gahaṇam katam a vatvā
translated: Another method: “The mode of apprehension of the one who has heard much, etc., is the mode of apprehension of the one who has heard much, etc.,” is the method of construing the word evaṃ by way of the meaning of mode.🔽But without saying “the mode of apprehension is made,” it is said: “the determination of the mode of apprehension is made,” taking the word evaṃ also by way of the meaning of determination.

original: “gahaṇasanniṭṭhānaṃ kata”nti vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Avadhāraṇena hi sanniṭṭhānamidhādhippetaṃ,🔽tasmā “ettāvatā”tiādinā avadhāraṇatthampi evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā ayameva yojanā katāti
analyzed: gahaṇa sanniṭṭhānam katam ti vuttan ti daṭṭhabbam avadhāraṇena hi sanniṭṭhānam idha adhippetam  tasmai ettāvatā ati ādinā avadhāraṇa attham pi evaṃsaddam gahetvā ayam eva yojanā katā ati
translated: For by way of determination, the meaning of determination is intended.

original: dassetīti veditabbaṃ, imissā pana yojanāya gahaṇākāragāhakatabbisayavisesanidassanaṃ katanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: dasseti iti veditabbam imissā pana yojanāya katam ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that by the words “at this point,” etc., the method of construing the word evaṃ by way of the meaning of determination is shown. But in this method of construing, the mode of apprehension, the one who apprehends, and the distinction of the domain are shown.

original: Aññampi yojanamāha “atha vā”tiādinā. Pubbe attanā sutānaṃ nānāvihitānaṃ suttasaṅkhātānaṃ
analyzed: aññam pi yojanam āha atha vā ti ādinā pubbe attanā sutānam nānā vihitānam sutta saṅkhātānam
translated: Another method of construing is stated by the words “or else,” etc. Previously, the various Suttas, which are called “heard by oneself,”

original: atthabyañjanānaṃ upadhāritarūpassa ākārassa nidassanassa, avadhāraṇassa vā pakāsanasabhāvo
analyzed: attha byañjanānam upadhārita rūpassa ākārassa nidassanassa avadhāraṇassa vā pakāsana sabhāvaḥ
translated: the nature of the manifestation of the form of the meaning and the phrasing that has been attended to, or the nature of the manifestation of the definition.🔽The word ‘thus’ is the form of the definition that has been attended to, and it is the basis for the designation of the person,

original: evaṃ-saddoti tadākārādibhūtassa upadhāraṇassa puggalapaññattiyā upādānabhūtadhammappabandhabyāpāratāya
analyzed: evaṃsaddo ti tad ākāra ādi bhūtassa upadhāraṇassa puggala paññattiyāḥ upādāna bhūta dhamma ppabandha byāpāra tāya
translated: because it is the function of the dhammas that are the basis for the designation of the person.

original: “puggalakiccaniddeso”ti vuttaṃ attanā sutānañhi atthabyañjanānaṃ puna upadhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: puggala kicca niddesaḥ ti vuttam attanā sutānam hi attha byañjanānam puna upadhāraṇam
translated: Therefore it is said that ‘the function of the person is demonstrated’. For the re-attending to the meaning and the phrasing that has been heard by oneself

original: ākārādittayaṃ, tañca evaṃ-saddassa attho. So pana yaṃ dhammappabandhaṃ upādāya puggalapaññatti
analyzed: ākāra ādi ttayam tat ca evaṃsaddassa attho saḥ pana yam dhamma ppabandham upādāya puggala paññatti
translated: is the triad of the form, etc., and that is the meaning of the word ‘thus’. But that is the function of the dhammas that are the basis for the designation of the person,

original: pavattā, tassa byāpārabhūtaṃ kiccameva, tasmā evaṃ-saddena puggalakiccaṃ niddisīyatīti.
analyzed: pavattā tassa byāpāra bhūtam kiccam eva tasmai evaṃsaddena puggala kiccam niddisīyati iti
translated: which is the function that is the basis for the designation of the person. Therefore the function of the person is demonstrated by the word ‘thus’.

original: Kāmaṃ savanakiriyā puggalabyāpāropi avisesena, tathāpi visesato viññāṇabyāpārovāti
analyzed: kāmam savana kiriyā puggala byāpāraḥ api avisesena tathā api visesataḥ viññāṇa byāpāraḥ uvāti
translated: Although the function of hearing is the basis for the designation of the person without distinction, nevertheless, in particular, it is the basis for the designation of consciousness.

original: vuttaṃ “viññāṇakiccaniddeso”ti. Tathā hi puggalavādīnampi savanakiriyā viññāṇanirapekkhā
analyzed: vuttam viññāṇa kicca niddeso ti tathā hi puggala vādīnam pi savana kiriyā viññāṇa nirapekkhā
translated: Therefore it is said that ‘the function of consciousness is demonstrated’. For even those who maintain the doctrine of the person, the function of hearing is not independent of consciousness,🔽but is dependent on consciousness.

original: natthi savanādīnaṃ visesato viññāṇabyāpārabhāvena icchitattā. Meti saddappavattiyā🔽ekanteneva sattavisayattā, viññāṇakiccassa ca sattaviññāṇānamabhedakaraṇavasena tattheva
analyzed: natthi savana ādīnam visesataḥ viññāṇa byāpāra bhāvena icchita ttā mā iti sadda ppavattiyā  ekantena iva satta visaya ttā viññāṇa kiccassa ca satta viññāṇānam abheda karaṇa vasena tattha eva
translated: because it is not held that hearing, etc., are the manifestation of consciousness in a particular way. The “me” is the object of the consciousness of sound,🔽because it is the object of the seven consciousnesses without distinction, and because the function of consciousness is to make known the object, which is done by the seven consciousnesses in a single act.

original: samodahitabbato “ubhayakiccayuttapuggalaniddeso”ti vuttaṃ. “Aya”ntiādi tappākaṭīkaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: ubhaya kicca yutta puggala niddeso ti vuttam ayan ti ādi tad pākaṭīkaraṇam
translated: because hearing, etc., are not intended as a special kind of consciousness. ‘Me’ is said with reference to the fact that the occurrence of the sound is the object of the self only, and that the function of consciousness is to be included there itself by way of not making a distinction among the seven kinds of consciousness. Thus it is said, ‘The self is indicated as having the two functions.’ ‘Aya’ is the making of that manifest.

original: Ettha hi savanakiccaviññāṇasamaṅgināti evaṃ-saddena niddiṭṭhaṃ puggalakiccaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: ettha hi savana kicca viññāṇa samaṅginā ti evaṃsaddena niddiṭṭham puggala kiccam sandhāya
translated: For here the function of the self is indicated by the word ‘me’ in the phrase ‘endowed with the consciousness that has the function of hearing,’

original: vuttaṃ, taṃ pana puggalassa savanakiccaviññāṇasamaṅgībhāvena puggalakiccaṃ nāmāti🔽dassetuṃ “puggalakiccasamaṅginā”ti avatvā “savanakiccaviññāṇasamaṅginā”ti āha, tasmā🔽“puggalakicca”nti niddiṭṭhasavanakiccavatā viññāṇena samaṅgināti attho. Viññāṇavasena,
analyzed: vuttam tam pana puggalassa savana kicca viññāṇa samaṅgībhāvena puggala kiccam nāma ati  dassetum puggala kicca samaṅginā iti avatvā savana kicca viññāṇa samaṅginā iti āha tasmā  puggala kiccanti niddiṭṭha savana kiccavatā viññāṇena samaṅginā ti atthaḥ viññāṇa vasena
translated: but that is called the function of the self because of the self’s being endowed with the consciousness that has the function of hearing.🔽In order to show that, he says ‘endowed with the consciousness that has the function of hearing,’ instead of saying ‘endowed with the function of the self.’ Therefore the meaning is: ‘endowed with the consciousness that is indicated by the phrase “the function of the self,” and that has the function of hearing.’

original: laddhasavanakiccavohārenāti ca sutasaddena niddiṭṭhaṃ viññāṇakiccaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: laddha savana kicca vohārena iti ca suta saddena niddiṭṭham viññāṇa kiccam sandhāya vuttam
translated: ‘With reference to the consciousness’ means with reference to the function of consciousness indicated by the word ‘heard.’

original: Savanameva kiccaṃ yassāti tathā. Savanakiccanti vohāro savanakiccavohāro, laddho
analyzed: savanam eva kiccam yassa ati tathā savana kiccanti vohāraḥ savana kicca vohāraḥ laddho
translated: “He who has the mere function of hearing is thus” . The term of expression for the function of hearing is the “term of expression for the function of hearing” .

original: so yenāti tathā. Laddhasavanakiccavohārena viññāṇasaṅkhātena vasena sāmatthiyenāti
analyzed: saḥ yena ati tathā laddha savana kicca vohārena viññāṇa saṅkhātena vasena sāmatthiyena ati
translated: He who has that is “thus” . The meaning is that he is “thus” by the existence of the consciousness called the “term of expression for the function of hearing” .

original: attho. Ayaṃ pana sambandho – savanakiccaviññāṇasamaṅginā puggalena mayā laddhasavanakiccavohārena
analyzed: atthaḥ ayam pana sambandhaḥ savana kicca viññāṇa samaṅginā puggalena mayā laddha savana kicca vohārena
translated: The construction is this: “By me who possesses the consciousness called the ‘term of expression for the function of hearing’ which is the function of the person who hears,

original: viññāṇavasena karaṇabhūtena sutanti.
analyzed: viññāṇa vasena karaṇa bhūtena sutanti
translated: the hearing was done by means of the consciousness called the ‘term of expression for the function of hearing’ which is the instrument.”

original: Apica “eva”nti saddassattho avijjamānapaññatti, “suta”nti saddassattho vijjamānapaññatti,🔽tasmā te tathārūpapaññatti upādānabhūtapuggalabyāpārabhāveneva dassento āha “evanti
analyzed: apica evam iti saddassatthaḥ avijjamāna paññatti sutam iti saddassatthaḥ vijjamāna paññatti  tasmā te tathārūpa paññatti upādāna bhūta puggala byāpāra bhāvena iva dassentaḥ āha evam ti
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the word “eva” is a non-existent designation, and the meaning of the word “suta” is an existent designation.

original: puggalakiccaniddeso. Sutanti viññāṇakiccaniddeso”ti. Na hi paramatthatoyeva niyamiyamāne
analyzed: puggala kicca niddeso sutanti viññāṇa kicca niddeso ti na hi paramatthato yā iva niyamiyamāne
translated: Therefore, showing the person who is the basis for the designation in such a way, he said: “Evaṃ is the designation of the function of the person. Sutan ti is the designation of the function of consciousness.”

original: sati puggalakiccaviññāṇakiccavasena ayaṃ vibhāgo labbhatīti. Imissā pana yojanāya
analyzed: sati puggala kicca viññāṇa kicca vasena ayam vibhāgaḥ labbhati iti imissā pana yojanāya
translated: For, when the absolute is being defined, this distinction is not possible by way of the function of the person and the function of consciousness.

original: kattubyāpārakaraṇabyāpārakattuniddeso katoti veditabbo.
analyzed: kattu byāpāra karaṇa byāpāra kattu niddeso kataḥ iti veditabbo
translated: But in this interpretation, it should be understood that the designation of the function of the doer and the function of the instrument is made.

original: Sabbassāpi saddādhigamanīyassa atthassa paññattimukheneva paṭipajjitabbattā, sabbāsañca
analyzed: sabbassa api sadda adhigamanīyassa atthassa paññatti mukhena iva paṭipajjitabba ttā sabbāsam ca
translated: Because all the meaning that can be arrived at by means of the scriptures must be undertaken by means of the determinations of the scriptures, and because all the determinations

original: paññattīnaṃ vijjamānādivasena chasu paññattibhedesu antogadhattā tāsu “eva”ntiādīnaṃ🔽paññattīnaṃ sarūpaṃ niddhāretvā dassento “evanti cā”tiādimāha. Tattha “eva”nti ca
analyzed: paññattīnam vijjamāna ādi vasena chasu paññatti bhedesu tāsu eva nti ādīnam  paññattīnam sarūpam niddhāretvā dassentaḥ evam iti ca ati ādim āha tattha evam iti ca
translated: are included among the six kinds of determinations classed as existent, etc.,

original: “me”ti ca vuccamānassa atthassa ākārādibhūtassa dhammānaṃ asallakkhaṇabhāvato avijjamānapaññattibhāvoti
analyzed: mā iti ca vuccamānassa atthassa ākāra ādi bhūtassa dhammānam asat lakkhaṇa bhāvataḥ avijjamāna paññatti bhāvo ti
translated: he said “Evaṃ ca me sutaṃ” , showing the nature of the determinations “evaṃ” , etc., by extracting them. Herein, the meaning expressed by “evaṃ” and “me” is not a determination that exists, because it is not a characteristic of dhammas that have a mode, etc.

original: āha “saccikaṭṭhaparamatthavasena avijjamānapaññattī”ti. Saccikaṭṭhaparamatthavasenāti🔽ca bhūtatthauttamatthavasenāti attho. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yo māyāmarīciādayo viya🔽abhūtattho, anussavādīhi gahetabbo viya anuttamattho ca na hoti, so rūpasaddādisabhāvo,
analyzed: āha saccikaṭṭha paramattha vasena avijjamāna paññatti iti saccikaṭṭha paramattha vasena ati  ca bhūtattha auttamattha vasena ati idam vuttam hoti yaḥ māyā marīci ādayaḥ viya  abhūta atthaḥ anussava ādīhi gahetabbaḥ viya anuttama atthaḥ ca na hoti saḥ rūpa sadda ādi sabhāvaḥ
translated: Therefore he said “a determination that does not exist in the sense of the real, the ultimate” .🔽In the sense of the real, the ultimate : the meaning is, in the sense of the true, the supreme. This is what is said: that meaning which is not a meaning that is unreal, like a magical creation, a mirage, etc.,

original: ruppanānubhavanādisabhāvo vā attho “saccikaṭṭho, paramattho”ti ca vuccati, “evaṃ
analyzed: ruppana anubhavana ādi sabhāvaḥ vā attho saccikaṭṭhaḥ paramattho ti ca vuccati evam
translated: or which is not a meaning that is not supreme, like what can be grasped by those who are on hearsay, is a meaning that is the real, the ultimate, and it is called “the real, the ultimate” .🔽“Evaṃ me sutaṃ” is said of that.

original: me”ti padānaṃ pana attho abhūtattā, anuttamattā ca na tathā vuccati, tasmā bhūtatthauttamatthasaṅkhātena
analyzed: mā iti padānam pana atthaḥ abhūtattā anuttamattā ca na tathā vuccati tasmā bhūta ttha auttamattha saṅkhātena
translated: But the meaning of the words “me” is not so stated because it is not real and because it is not supreme. Therefore it is only a designation that is not found in the ultimate sense, which is called the real and the supreme.

original: saccikaṭṭhaparamatthavasena visesanabhūtena avijjamānapaññattiyevāti. Etena ca visesanena
analyzed: saccikaṭṭha paramattha vasena visesana bhūtena avijjamāna paññattiyā iva ati etena ca visesanena
translated: And by this distinction

original: bālajanehi “atthī”ti parikappitaṃ paññattimattaṃ nivatteti. Tadevatthaṃ pākaṭaṃ karoti,
analyzed: bāla janehi atthi iti parikappitam paññattimattam nivatteti tadevattham pākaṭam karoti
translated: he sets aside the mere designation imagined by foolish people as “is,” and he makes that meaning clear,

original: hetunā vā sādheti “kiñhettha ta”ntiādinā. Yaṃ dhammajātaṃ, atthajātaṃ vā “eva”nti🔽vā “me”ti vā niddesaṃ labhetha, taṃ ettha rūpaphassādidhammasamudāye, “evaṃ me”ti
analyzed: hetunā vā sādha iti kim ha ittha tanti ādinā yam dhamma jātam attha jātam vā evam ti  vā mā iti vā niddesam labhetha tam ettha rūpa phassa ādi dhamma samudāye evam mā iti
translated: or he proves it by a reason, saying, “What is there in that?” Whatever kind of state of dhammas or of meanings is designated by “thus”🔽or by “me,” that is not found in the ultimate sense in this collection of dhammas such as material form, contact, etc., or in the meaning of the words “thus to me.” The construction is this.

original: padānaṃ vā atthe. Paramatthato na atthīti yojanā. Rūpaphassādibhāvena niddiṭṭho paramatthato
analyzed: padānam vā atthe paramatthataḥ na atthi iti yojanā rūpa phassa ādi bhāvena niddiṭṭhaḥ paramatthato
translated: In the ultimate sense there is in this meaning, which is designated as material form, contact, etc.,

original: ettha attheva, “evaṃ me”ti pana niddiṭṭho natthīti adhippāyo. Sutanti pana saddāyatanaṃ
analyzed: ettha attha iva evam mā iti pana niddiṭṭhaḥ natthi iti adhippāyaḥ sutam ti pana sadda āyatanam
translated: but what is designated as “thus to me” is not. The word “thus” is the sound base .

original: sandhāyāha “vijjamānapaññattī”ti. “Saccikaṭṭhaparamatthavasenā”ti cettha adhikāro.
analyzed: sandhāya āha vijjamāna paññatti iti saccikaṭṭha paramattha vasena ati ca ittha adhikāraḥ
translated: “As a designation that exists” is said by way of the intention. “If by way of the ultimate in the sense of the individual essence” is the subject matter here.

original: “Yañhī”tiādi tappākaṭīkaraṇaṃ, hetudassanaṃ vā. Yaṃ taṃ saddāyatanaṃ sotena sotadvārena,
analyzed: yat hi itiādi tad pākaṭīkaraṇam hetu dassanam vā yam tam sadda āyatanam sotena sota dvārena
translated: “That which” and so on is the making of that clear, or the showing of the reason. That sense-sphere of sound which is reached by the ear, by the ear-door,

original: tannissitaviññāṇena vā upaladdhaṃ adhigamitabbanti attho. Tena hi saddāyatanamidha
analyzed: tad nissita viññāṇena vā upaladdham adhigamitabbanti attho tena hi sadda āyatanam idha
translated: or by the consciousness dependent on it, is what is meant by “to be reached.” By that he shows that the sense-sphere of sound is here

original: gahitaṃ kammasādhanenāti dasseti.🔽Evaṃ aṭṭhakathānayena paññattisarūpaṃ niddhāretvā idāni aṭṭhakathāmuttakenāpi nayena
analyzed: gahitam kamma sādhanena ati dasseti  evam aṭṭhakathā nayena paññatti sarūpam niddhāretvā idāni aṭṭhakathā muttakena api nayena
translated: taken by the instrument of the verb “to be reached.”🔽Having thus extracted the form of designation by way of the method of the commentary, now, by way of the method stated in the commentary,

original: vuttesu chasu paññattibhedesu “eva”ntiādīnaṃ paññattīnaṃ sarūpaṃ niddhārento “tathā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: vuttesu chasu paññatti bhedesu evam ti ādīnam paññattīnam sarūpam niddhārentaḥ tathā iti ādim āha
translated: he says “thus” and so on, extracting the form of the designations “as a designation,” and so on, among the six kinds of designation.

original: Upādāpaññatti ādayo hi porāṇaṭṭhakathāto muttā saṅgahakāreneva ācariyena vuttā. Vitthāro
analyzed: upādā paññatti ādayaḥ hi porāṇa aṭṭhakathātaḥ muttā saṅgaha kārena iva ācariyena vuttā vitthāraḥ
translated: For the designations “as a designation,” and so on, are stated by the teacher only by way of inclusion, being extracted from the old commentary. The detail🔽should be taken from the Abhidhamma commentary. That sound, that kind of state,

original: abhidhammaṭṭhakathāya gahetabbo. Taṃ tanti taṃ taṃ dhammajātaṃ, sotapathamāgate dhamme
analyzed: abhidhamma ṭṭhakathāya gahetabbo tam tan ti tam tam dhamma jātam sota patham āgate dhamme
