analyzed: attho iminā vacanena iva yonisas manasikarotaḥ nānā pakāra paṭivedha sambhavataḥ aggi viya
translated: By this statement itself, when one gives proper attention, the possibility of penetration of the various kinds of meaning arises, just as fire is known by smoke as its effect.

original: dhūmena kāriyena kāraṇabhūto so viññāyatīti tadanvayampi atthāpattiyā dasseti. Esa
analyzed: dhūmena kāriyena kāraṇa bhūto so viññāyati iti tad anvayam pi atthāpattiyā dasseti esa
translated: Therefore, he shows the meaning of the passage by the meaning of the passage.🔽This method should be applied everywhere as appropriate.

original: nayo sabbattha yathārahaṃ. “Brahmajālaṃ āvuso kattha bhāsita”ntiādi pucchāvasena🔽adhunā pakaraṇappattassa vakkhamānassa suttassa “suta”nti padena vuccamānaṃ bhagavato
analyzed: sabbattha yathāraham brahmajālam āvuso kattha bhāsita ntiādi pucchā vasena  adhunā pakaraṇa ppattassa vakkhamānassa suttassa sutam ti padena vuccamānam bhagavataḥ
translated: The question “Where was the Brahmajāla spoken, friend?”🔽and so on, shows the meaning of the passage by the meaning of the passage.🔽The statement “It shows non-distraction” is made because the hearing of the Blessed One’s

original: sammukhā savanaṃ samādhānamantarena na sambhavatīti katvā vuttaṃ “avikkhepaṃ dīpetī”ti.
analyzed: sammukhā savanam samādhānam antarena na sambhavati iti katvā vuttam avikkhepam dīpeti iti
translated: word, which is being spoken by the phrase “heard,” cannot be accomplished without concentration.

original: “Vikkhittacittassā”tiādinā byatirekakāraṇena ñāpakahetuṃ dassetvā tadeva samattheti
analyzed: vikkhitta cittassa ati ādinā byatireka kāraṇena ñāpaka hetum dassetvā tat eva samatthā iti
translated: Having shown the reason for the knowledge by the reason for the distinction with the words “of one whose mind is distracted,” and so on, he confirms that very thing

original: “tathā hī”tiādinā. Sabbasampattiyāti sabbena atthabyañjanadesakapayojanādinā sampattiyā.
analyzed: tathā hi itiādinā sabba sampattiyā ti sabbena attha byañjana desaka payojana ādinā sampattiyā
translated: with “For thus,” and so on. “All excellence” means excellence in all respects, such as meaning, phrasing, purpose, and so on.

original: Kiṃ iminā pakāsitanti āha “yoniso manasikārena cetthā”tiādi. Etthāti etasmiṃ dhammadvaye.
analyzed: kim iminā pakāsitanti āha yonisas manasikārena ca itthā atiādi etthā iti etasmim dhamma dvaye
translated: What is shown by this? He says “Herein, by proper attention,” and so on. “Herein” means in this pair of ideas.

original: “Na hi vikkhittacitto”tiādinā kāraṇabhūtena avikkhepena, sappurisūpanissayena ca🔽phalabhūtassa saddhammassavanassa siddhiyā eva samatthanaṃ vuttaṃ, avikkhepena pana🔽sappurisūpanissayassa siddhiyā samatthanaṃ na vuttaṃ. Kasmāti ce? Vikkhittacittānaṃ
analyzed: na hi vikkhitta cittaḥ ti ādinā kāraṇa bhūtena avikkhepena sappurisa upanissayena ca  phala bhūtassa saddhamma ssavanassa siddhiyāḥ eva samatthanam vuttam avikkhepena pana  sappurisa upanissayassa siddhiyā samatthanam na vuttam kasmā iti ce vikkhitta cittānam
translated: “For one whose mind is distracted” and so on shows the possibility of success in listening to the true Dhamma, which is the fruit, by means of non-distraction and good friendship, which are the causes. But it does not show the possibility of success in non-distraction and good friendship by means of listening to the true Dhamma, which is the fruit. Why is this? Because those whose minds are distracted

original: sappurise payirupāsanābhāvassa atthato siddhattā. Atthavaseneva hi so pākaṭoti na vutto.🔽Etthāha – yathā yoniso manasikārena phalabhūtena attasammāpaṇidhipubbekatapuññatānaṃ🔽kāraṇabhūtānaṃ siddhi vuttā tadavinābhāvato, evaṃ avikkhepena phalabhūtena saddhammassavanasappurisūpanissayānaṃ
analyzed: sappurise atthataḥ siddha ttā attha vasena iva hi so pākaṭaḥ ti na vutto  ettha āha yathā yonisas manasikārena phala bhūtena atta sammāpaṇidhi pubbekata puñña tānam  kāraṇa bhūtānam siddhi vuttā tad avinābhāvataḥ evam avikkhepena phala bhūtena saddhamma ssavana sappurisa upanissayānam
translated: “For one whose mind is distracted” and so on shows the possibility of success in listening to the true Dhamma as the fruit of non-distraction and reliance on good people as the cause. But it does not show the possibility of success in non-distraction and reliance on good people as the fruit of listening to the true Dhamma as the cause. Why not? Because the fact that those whose minds are distracted do not rely on good people is established by the meaning. For it is not stated because it is obvious by the meaning.

original: kāraṇabhūtānaṃ siddhi vattabbā siyā assutavato, sappurisūpanissayavirahitassa ca
analyzed: kāraṇa bhūtānam siddhi vattabbā siyā assutavataḥ sappurisa upanissaya virahitassa ca
translated: Here it may be asked: “Just as the success of right intention and previous merit as the causes of the fruit, namely, wise attention, is stated because they are inseparable from it, so too the success of listening to the true Dhamma and reliance on good people as the causes of the fruit, namely, non-distraction, should be stated. For it is not possible to listen to the true Dhamma and to rely on good people without non-distraction.”

original: tadabhāvato. Evaṃ santepi “na hi vikkhittacitto”tiādisamatthanavacanena avikkhepena,
analyzed: tad abhāvataḥ evam sante api na hi vikkhitta citta uti ādi samatthana vacanena avikkhepena
translated: and because of the absence of that.🔽Even so, by the words of the meaning of the text, “One whose mind is distracted does not know or see things as they really are,” it is shown that it is by non-distraction,

original: sappurisūpanissayena ca kāraṇabhūtena saddhammassavanasseva phalabhūtassa siddhi
analyzed: sappurisa upanissayena ca kāraṇa bhūtena saddhamma ssavanassa iva phala bhūtassa siddhi
translated: And that is so. Nevertheless, the success of listening to the True Idea is stated as the fruit of the cause consisting in listening to the True Idea with non-distraction, which is stated by the words ‘ For one whose cognizance is distracted’ , etc., and with the support of good people as the reason.

original: vuttā, kasmā panevaṃ vuttāti? Vuccate – adhippāyantarasambhavato hi tathā siddhi
analyzed: vuttā kasmā pana ivam vuttā iti vuccate adhippāya ntara sambhavataḥ hi tathā siddhi
translated: But why is it stated thus? It is stated thus, we say, because of the possibility of another intention.

original: vuttā. Ayaṃ panetthādhippāyo – saddhammassavanasappurisūpanissayā na ekantena avikkhepassa🔽kāraṇaṃ bāhirakāraṇattā, avikkhepo pana sappurisūpanissayo viya saddhammassavanassa
analyzed: vuttā ayam pana itthā adhippāyaḥ saddhamma ssavana sappurisa upanissayāḥ na ekantena avikkhepassa  kāraṇam bāhira kāraṇa ttā avikkhepaḥ pana sappurisa upanissayaḥ viya saddhamma ssavanassa
translated: But the intention here is this: that listening to the True Idea and the support of good people are not the only reason for non-distraction, which is the fruit of listening to the True Idea, because they are external reasons,

original: ekantakāraṇaṃ ajjhattikakāraṇattā, tasmā ekantakāraṇe honte kimatthiyā anekantakāraṇaṃ🔽pati phalabhāvaparikappanāti tathāyevetassa siddhi vuttāti. Ettha ca paṭhamaṃ phalena
analyzed: ekanta kāraṇam ajjhattika kāraṇa ttā tasmai ekanta kāraṇe honte kim atthiyāḥ anekanta kāraṇam  pati phala bhāva parikappanā ti tathāya iva etassa siddhi vuttā ati ettha ca paṭhamam phalena
translated: but non-distraction is the only reason for listening to the True Idea, like the support of good people, because it is an internal reason. So when it is the only reason, what is the point of postulating a fruit in the form of a reason that is not the only one?🔽That is why its success is stated thus. And here the first demonstration of the success of the reason by the fruit is like the filling of a river by the water that falls from the sky above,

original: kāraṇassa siddhidassanaṃ nadīpūrena viya upari vuṭṭhisabbhāvassa, dutiyaṃ kāraṇena
analyzed: kāraṇassa siddhi dassanam nadīpūrena viya upari vuṭṭhi sabbhāvassa dutiyam kāraṇena
translated: and the second demonstration of the success of the fruit by the reason is like the filling of a water-carrying vessel by the water that falls from the sky above.

original: phalassa siddhidassanaṃ ekantavassinā viya meghavuṭṭhānena vuṭṭhipavattiyā.
analyzed: phalassa siddhi dassanam ekantavassinā viya megha vuṭṭhānena vuṭṭhi pavattiyā
translated: The seeing of the success of the fruit is like the appearance of rain by the bursting of the clouds.

original: “Aparo nayo”tiādinā aññathāpi dīpetabbatthamāha, yasmā na hotīti sambandho. Evanti…pe…
analyzed: aparaḥ naya uti ādinā aññathā api dīpetabba attham āha yasmai na hoti iti sambandhaḥ
translated: “Another method” : he says this in order to show it in another way too. The construction is: “because it is not so.” “Thus” : …

original: nānākāraniddesoti heṭṭhā vuttaṃ, so ca ākāroti sotadvārānusāraviññāṇavīthisaṅkhātassa🔽cittasantānassa nānākārena ārammaṇe pavattiyā nānatthabyañjanaggahaṇasaṅkhāto so
analyzed: nānā ākāra niddeso ti heṭṭhā vuttam so ca ākāro ti sota dvāra anusāra viññāṇa vīthi saṅkhātassa  citta santānassa nānā ākārena ārammaṇe pavattiyā nānattha byañjana ggahaṇa saṅkhāto so
translated: “The description of the various aspects” is what was said above. And that aspect is the occurrence of the mental continuum called the cognitive series of the consciousness that follows the ear-door.

original: bhagavato vacanassa atthabyañjanappabhedaparicchedavasena sakalasāsanasampattiogāhanākāro.
analyzed: bhagavato vacanassa attha byañjana ppabheda pariccheda vasena sakala sāsana sampatti ogāhana ākāro
translated: That is, the apprehension of the various meanings and terms, which is the mode of the Blessed One’s utterance in the form of the delimitation of the division of meaning and of the division of the terms.🔽It is thus good, etc. : it is thus beautiful, excellent, because it is the cause for the fulfilment of the entire absence of deficiency. By the apprehension of the various meanings and terms as stated.

original: Evaṃ bhaddakoti niravasesaparahitapāripūribhāvakāraṇattā evaṃ yathāvuttena nānatthabyañjanaggahaṇena
analyzed: evam bhaddakaḥ ti niravasesa para hita pāripūri bhāva kāraṇattā evam yathā vuttena nānattha byañjana ggahaṇena
translated: It is thus good, etc. : it is thus beautiful, excellent, because it is the cause for the fulfilment of the entire absence of deficiency. By the apprehension of the various meanings and terms as stated.

original: sundaro seṭṭho, samāsapadaṃ vā etaṃ evaṃ īdiso bhaddo yassāti katvā. Na paṇihito
analyzed: sundaraḥ seṭṭhaḥ samāsa padam vā etam evam īdisaḥ bhaddaḥ yassa ati katvā na paṇihitaḥ
translated: It is a compound word. Or it may be taken as follows: “Thus is he good, of such a kind.” Not directed, not fixed,

original: appaṇihito, sammā appaṇi hito attā yassāti tathā, tassa. Pacchimacakkadvayasampattinti
analyzed: appaṇihito sammā appaṇi hitaḥ attā yassa ati tathā tassa pacchima cakka dvaya sampattiḥ ti
translated: not fully directed, not fully fixed, is the self of him who is thus. Of him who is thus, of him who possesses the last two eyes.

original: attasammāpaṇidhipubbekatapuññatāsaṅkhātaguṇadvayasampattiṃ. Guṇasseva hi aparāparavuttiyā
analyzed: atta sammāpaṇidhi pubbekata puñña tā saṅkhāta guṇa dvaya sampattim guṇassa iva hi apara apara vuttiyā
translated: The two qualities are the right direction of one’s own effort and the possession of merit accumulated in the past.🔽For the wheel is so called because of the occurrence of the quality in successive stages.

original: pavattanaṭṭhena cakkabhāvo. Caranti vā etena sattā sampattibhavaṃ, sampattibhavesūti
analyzed: pavattana ṭṭhena cakka bhāvaḥ caranti vai etena sattā sampatti bhavam sampatti bhavesu iti
translated: Or alternatively, beings go with it to a happy destiny, or to happy destinies, thus it is a wheel .

original: vā cakkaṃ. Yaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “cattārimāni bhikkhave, cakkāni, yehi samannāgatānaṃ
analyzed: vā cakkam yam sandhāya vuttam cattāri imāni bhikkhave cakkāni yehi samannāgatānam
translated: And it is in this sense that it is said: “Bhikkhus, there are these four wheels. When these four wheels are established in the world,

original: devamanussānaṃ catucakkaṃ vattatī”tiādi pacchimabhāvo cettha desanākkamavaseneva.
analyzed: deva manussānam catu cakkam vattati itiādi pacchima bhāvaḥ ca ittha desanā kkama vasena iva
translated: the wheel-turning monarch’s wheel moves forward by going away from here” , and so on. But the last two wheels are mentioned in the order in which they are established.

original: Purimacakkadvayasampattinti patirūpadesavāsasappurisūpanissayasaṅkhātaguṇadvayasampattiṃ.
analyzed: purima cakka dvaya sampattim ti pati rūpa desa vāsa sappurisa upanissaya saṅkhāta guṇa dvaya sampattim
translated: The possession of the two qualities is the possession of the two qualities consisting in living in a suitable place and associating with good people.

original: Sesaṃ vuttanayameva. Tasmāti purimakāraṇaṃ purimassevāti idha kāraṇamāha “na hī”tiādinā.
analyzed: sesam vutta nayam eva tasmā iti purima kāraṇam purimassa iva ati idha kāraṇam āha na hi iti ādinā
translated: The rest is as already stated. As to “the reason for the former is the same as that for the latter”: the reason for the former is the same as that for the latter.

original: Tena kiṃ pakāsitanti āha “iccassā”tiādi. Iti imāya catucakkasampattiyā kāraṇabhūtāya.
analyzed: tena kim pakāsitan ti āha iccassa atiādi iti imāya catu cakka sampattiyā kāraṇa bhūtāya
translated: What does that show? It shows that the wheel-turning monarch’s wheel moves forward by going away from here because of the possession of the four wheels.🔽The Elder Assagutta’s.

original: Assa therassa. Pacchimacakkadvayasiddhiyāti pacchimacakkadvayassa atthibhāvena siddhiyā.
analyzed: assa therassa pacchima cakka dvaya siddhiyā ati pacchima cakka dvayassa atthi bhāvena siddhiyā
translated: As to the establishment of the latter two wheels: as to the establishment of the existence of the latter two wheels.

original: Āsayasuddhīti vipassanāñāṇasaṅkhātāya anulomikakhantiyā, kammassakatāñāṇa-maggañāṇasaṅkhātassa
analyzed: āsaya suddhi iti vipassanā ñāṇa saṅkhātāya anulomika khantiyā kammassaka tā ñāṇa magga ñāṇa saṅkhātassa
translated: Purity of the heart: the heart is twofold as the understanding of the way to penetrate to the four noble truths, called conformity, and the knowledge of the way things are, called🔽knowledge of what can be and what cannot be, and knowledge of the path.

original: yathābhūtañāṇassa cāti duvidhassāpi āsayassa asuddhihetubhūtānaṃ kilesānaṃ dūrībhāvena
analyzed: yathābhūta ñāṇassa ca ati duvidhassa api āsayassa asuddhi hetu bhūtānam kilesānam dūrībhāvena
translated: Purity of the heart is due to the removal of defilements that are the cause of impurity in both of these.

original: suddhi. Tadeva hi dvayaṃ vivaṭṭanissitānaṃ suddhasattānaṃ āsayo. Sammāpaṇihitatto🔽hi pubbe ca katapuñño suddhāsayo hoti. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “sammāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ, seyyaso
analyzed: tat eva hi dvayam vivaṭṭa nissitānam suddha sattānam āsayo sammā paṇihita tto  hi pubbe ca kata puññaḥ suddha āsayaḥ hoti tathā hi vuttam sammā paṇihitam cittam seyyasaḥ
translated: For that is the heart of those who are pure in the sense of being devoted to the revolution of the cycle of rebirths.

original: naṃ tato kare”ti, “katapuññosi tvaṃ ānanda, padhānamanuyuñja khippaṃ hohisi anāsavo”ti🔽ca. Keci pana “kattukamyatāchando āsayo”ti vadanti, tadayuttameva “tāya ca āsayasuddhiyā🔽adhigamabyattisiddhī”ti vacanena virodhato. Evampi maggañāṇasaṅkhātassa āsayassa
analyzed: nam tatas kara iti kata puññaḥ asi tvam ānanda padhānam anuyuñja khippam hohisi anāsavaḥ ti  ca keci pana kattu kamyatā chandaḥ āsaya uti vadanti tat ayuttam eva ca  adhigama byatti siddhi iti vacanena virodhataḥ evam pi magga ñāṇa saṅkhātassa āsayassa
translated: For it is said: “The heart rightly directed, will make him better still” , and: “You have made merit, Ānanda, devote yourself to striving, soon you will be free from cankers” .🔽But some say that the heart is the desire to act. That is inappropriate, because it is contradicted by the words, “And by that purity of heart the perfection of penetration is reached” .

original: suddhi na yuttā tāya adhigamabyattisiddhiyā avattabbatoti? No na yutto purimassa
analyzed: na yuttā tāya adhigama byatti siddhiyā a vattabbato ti no na yuttaḥ purimassa
translated: And it is inappropriate to say that the purity of the heart consisting of knowledge of the path is due to that perfection of penetration, because that cannot be said.🔽No, it is not inappropriate.

original: maggassa, pacchimānaṃ maggānaṃ, phalānañca kāraṇabhāvato. Payogasuddhīti yonisomanasikārapubbaṅgamassa🔽dhammassavanapayogassa visadabhāvena suddhi, sabbassa vā kāyavacīpayogassa niddosabhāvena
analyzed: maggassa pacchimānam maggānam phalānam ca kāraṇa bhāvato payoga suddhī iti yoniso manasikāra pubbaṅgamassa  dhamma ssavana payogassa visada bhāvena suddhi sabbassa vā kāya vacī payogassa niddosa bhāvena
translated: because they are the cause of the paths and of the fruits. Purity of effort: purity by the clarity of the effort of listening to the Dhamma, which is preceded by right reflection;

original: suddhi. Patirūpadesavāsī, hi sappurisasevī ca yathāvuttavisuddhapayogo hoti. Tathāvisuddhena
analyzed: pati rūpa desa vāsī hi sappurisa sevī ca yathā vutta visuddha payogaḥ hoti tathā visuddhena
translated: or purity by the freedom from defilements of all bodily and verbal effort. For one who lives in a suitable locality and associates with true people has the effort that has been purified in the way just described. With such purified effort,

original: yonisomanasikārapubbaṅgamena dhammassavanapayogena, vippaṭisārābhāvāvahena ca kāyavacīpayogena
analyzed: yoni soma nasikāra pubbaṅgamena dhamma ssavana payogena vippaṭisāra abhāva āvahena ca kāya vacī payogena
translated: with the effort of listening to the Dhamma preceded by right reflection, and with the bodily and verbal effort that is accompanied by the absence of regret,

original: avikkhittacitto pariyattiyaṃ visārado hoti, tathābhūto ca thero, tena viññāyati purimacakkadvayasiddhiyā
analyzed: a vikkhitta cittaḥ pariyattiyam visāradaḥ hoti tathābhūto ca thero tena viññāyati purima cakka dvaya siddhiyā
translated: he is confident in study with an undistracted mind. And when he is such, it is known that the elder has achieved purity of effort by the achievement of the first two factors.

original: therassa payogasuddhi siddhāvāti. Tena kiṃ vibhāvitanti āha “tāya cā”tiādi. Adhigamabyattisiddhīti
analyzed: therassa siddhau āti tena kim vibhāvitan ti āha tāya ca atiādi adhigama byatti siddhi iti
translated: Thus it is established that the elder has achieved purity of effort. What has he developed by that? He says, “And by that,” etc. Achievement of the condition for penetration:

original: paṭivedhasaṅkhāte adhigame chekabhāvasiddhi. Adhigametabbato hi paṭivijjhitabbato
analyzed: paṭivedha saṅkhāte adhigame cheka bhāva siddhi adhigametabbataḥ hi paṭivijjhitabbataḥ
translated: achievement of the state of being able to penetrate the penetration called “realization.” For it is because it is to be penetrated that it is called “penetration.”

original: paṭivedho “adhigamo”ti aṭṭhakathāsu vutto, āgamoti ca pariyatti āgacchanti attatthaparatthādayo
analyzed: paṭivedhaḥ adhigamo ti aṭṭhakathāsu vuttaḥ āgamaḥ ti ca pariyatti āgacchanti atta ttha para ttha ādayaḥ
translated: “Penetration” is called “attainment” in the commentaries. “Tradition” is the tradition of the scriptures.

original: etena, ābhuso vā gamitabbo ñātabboti katvā.
analyzed: etena ābhusaḥ vā gamitabbaḥ ñātabbaḥ iti katvā
translated: By this, the meaning is that the tradition should be understood as being conveyed by the venerable elder.

original: Tena kimanubhāvitanti āha “itī”tiādi. Itīti evaṃ vuttanayena, tasmā siddhattāti vā
analyzed: tena kim anubhāvitan ti āha iti itiādi iti iti evam vutta nayena tasmā vā
translated: What is the significance of this? He says “thus,” etc. Thus means in the manner stated. Therefore, the meaning is established.

original: kāraṇaniddeso. Vacananti nidānavacanaṃ lokato, dhammato ca siddhāya upamāya tamatthaṃ
analyzed: kāraṇa niddesaḥ vacananti nidāna vacanam lokataḥ dhammato ca siddhāya upamāya tam attham
translated: This is the explanation of the reason. The statement is the statement of the source. The simile is stated in order to make known that meaning which is established both from the world and from the Dhamma.

original: ñāpetuṃ “aruṇuggaṃ viyā”tiādimāha. “Upamāya midhekacce, atthaṃ jānanti paṇḍitā”ti🔽hi vuttaṃ. Aruṇoti sūriyassa udayato pubbabhāge uṭṭhitaraṃsi, tassa uggaṃ uggamanaṃ
analyzed: aruṇuggam viya iti ādim āha upamāya midhā ekacce attham jānanti paṇḍitā ti  hi vuttam aruṇo ti sūriyassa udayataḥ pubba bhāge uṭṭhita raṃsi tassa uggam uggamanam
translated: “By a simile some wise men understand the meaning,” it is said. Dawn is the light that arises before the sun. Its “rising” is its arising.

original: udayato udayantassa udayāvāsamuggacchato sūriyassa pubbaṅgamaṃ purecaraṃ bhavituṃ
analyzed: udayataḥ udayantassa udaya āvāsam uggacchataḥ sūriyassa pubbaṅgamam purecaram bhavitum
translated: The “rising place” of the sun that is rising and coming up is the east. The dawn is fit to be the forerunner, the one that goes in front, of the sun that is rising.

original: arahati viyāti sambandho. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – āgamādhigamabyattiyā īdisassa therassa
analyzed: arahati viya iti sambandhaḥ idam vuttam hoti āgama adhigama byattiyā īdisassa therassa
translated: This is the connection. This is what is said: By the tradition, attainment, and the scriptures, such a venerable elder

original: vuttanidānavacanaṃ bhagavato vacanassa pubbaṅgamaṃ bhavitumarahati, nidānabhāvaṃ
analyzed: vutta nidāna vacanam bhagavataḥ vacanassa pubbaṅgamam bhavitum arahati nidāna bhāvam
translated: The words of the nidāna are fit to be the forerunner of the Blessed One’s words, and they have become the nidāna.

original: gataṃ hotīti idamatthajātaṃ anubhāvitanti.🔽Idāni aparampi pubbe vuttassa asammohāsammosasaṅkhātassa dīpetabbassatthassa dīpakehi
analyzed: gatam hoti iti idam attha jātam anubhāvitanti  idāni aparam pi pubbe vuttassa asammoha asammosa saṅkhātassa dīpetabbassa atthassa dīpakehi
translated: This is the meaning of the words “is made known.”🔽Now, in order to make known the meaning to be made known, which is called non-confusion and confusion, that was to be illuminated by the words “thus have I heard” and “heard,” by means of the illuminations

original: evaṃ-sadda suta-saddehi pakāsetabbamatthaṃ pakāsento “aparo nayo”tiādimāha. Tattha🔽hi “nānappakārapaṭivedhadīpakena, sotabbappabhedapaṭivedhadīpakenā”ti ca iminā tehi
analyzed: evaṃsadda suta saddehi pakāsetabbam attham pakāsentaḥ aparaḥ naya uti ādim āha tattha  hi nānā pakāra paṭivedha dīpakena sotabba ppabheda paṭivedha dīpakena ati ca iminā tehi
translated: of the words “thus have I heard” and “heard,” he said “Another method” and so on. Herein,🔽by the words “by means of the illumination of the penetration of the various aspects” and “by means of the illumination of the penetration of the classification of what is to be heard” he refers to the meaning to be illuminated, which is called non-confusion and confusion,

original: saddehi pubbe dīpitaṃ asammohāsammosasaṅkhātaṃ dīpetabbatthamāha asammohena nānappakārapaṭivedhassa,
analyzed: saddehi pubbe dīpitam asammoha asammosa saṅkhātam dīpetabba attham āha asammohena nānā pakāra paṭivedhassa
translated: that was illuminated by those words, because the penetration of the various aspects is effected by non-confusion, and the penetration of the classification of what is to be heard is effected by non-forgetting.

original: asammosena ca sotabbappabhedapaṭivedhassa sijjhanato. “Attano”tiādīhi pana pakāsetabbatthaṃ.
analyzed: asammosena ca sotabba ppabheda paṭivedhassa sijjhanataḥ attanā iti ādīhi pana pakāsetabba ttham
translated: But by the words “of his own hearing” and so on he refers to the meaning to be made known.

original: Tena vuttaṃ ācariyadhammapālattherena “nānappakārapaṭivedhadīpakenātiādinā evaṃ-sadda
analyzed: tena vuttam ācariya dhammapāla ttherena nānā pakāra paṭivedha dīpakena ati ādinā evaṃsadda
translated: Therefore the teacher, the Elder Dhammapāla, said: “By means of the illumination of the penetration of the various aspects” and so on. The words “thus have I heard” are the illumination of the penetration of the various aspects.

original: suta-saddānaṃ therassa atthabyañjanesu asammohāsammosadīpanato catupaṭisambhidāvasena
analyzed: suta saddānam therassa attha byañjanesu asammoha asammosa dīpanato catu paṭisambhidā vasena
translated: and the Elder’s non-confusion and confusion about the meaning and the phrasing of the sounds heard show the four kinds of discrimination

original: atthayojanaṃ dassetī”ti. Hetugabbhañcetaṃ padadvayaṃ, nānappakārapaṭivedhasaṅkhātassa,
analyzed: attha yojanam dasseti iti hetu gabbham ca itam pada dvayam nānā pakāra paṭivedha saṅkhātassa
translated: by way of the four kinds of interpretation of the meaning. And the two terms ‘heard’ and ‘sounds’ are a ‘matrix of causes’ in the sense that they illuminate the meaning to be illuminated, which is called ‘penetration of the various kinds’

original: sotabbappabheda-paṭivedhasaṅkhātassa ca dīpetabbatthassa dīpakattāti vuttaṃ hoti.🔽Santassa vijjamānassa bhāvo sabbhāvo, atthapaṭibhānapaṭisambhidāhi sampattiyā sabbhāvo
analyzed: sotabba ppabheda paṭivedha saṅkhātassa ca dīpetabba atthassa dīpaka ttā iti vuttam hoti  santassa vijjamānassa bhāvaḥ sabbhāvaḥ attha paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāhi sampattiyā sabbhāvaḥ
translated: and ‘penetration of the classification of what is to be heard’ respectively.🔽The ‘own-nature’ of that is the ‘own-nature of the heard’ . The ‘own-nature’ is the state of being of what exists. The ‘own-nature of the heard’ is the state of being of the excellence of the discrimination consisting in the expression of the meaning.

original: tathā. “Sambhava”ntipi pāṭho, sambhavanaṃ sambhavo, atthapaṭibhānapaṭisambhidāsampattīnaṃ
analyzed: tathā sambhavanti pi sambhavanam sambhavaḥ attha paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā sampattīnam
translated: Similarly, ‘sambhava’ is a reading for ‘sabbhava’ . The ‘own-nature of the heard’ is the state of being of the excellence of the discrimination consisting in the expression of the meaning.

original: sambhavo tathā. Evaṃ itaratthāpi. “Sotabbappabhedapaṭivedhadīpakenā”ti etena pana
analyzed: sambhavaḥ tathā evam itarattha api sotabba ppabheda paṭivedha dīpakena ati etena pana
translated: Similarly, the other meanings. By the words ‘by the illumination of the penetration of the classification of what is to be heard’

original: ayaṃ suta-saddo evaṃ-saddasannidhānato, vakkhamānāpekkhāya vā sāmaññeneva vuttepi
analyzed: ayam suta saddaḥ evaṃsadda sannidhānataḥ vakkhamāna apekkhāya vā sāmaññena iva vutte pi
translated: it is shown that although the word ‘heard’ is stated in a general way because of the proximity of the word ‘eva’ or because of the expectation of what is to be stated,🔽nevertheless it refers to a particular kind of thing to be heard. And here the words ‘by the illumination of the penetration of the classification of what is to be heard’

original: sotabbadhammavisesaṃ āmasatīti dasseti. Ettha ca sotabbadhammasaṅkhātāya pāḷiyā nidassetabbānaṃ
analyzed: sotabba dhamma visesam āmasati iti dasseti ettha ca sotabba dhamma saṅkhātāya pāḷiyā nidassetabbānam
translated: show that the words of the texts called ‘things to be heard’ are to be illuminated by the discrimination consisting in the expression of the meaning.

original: bhāsitatthapayojanatthānaṃ, tīsu ca ñāṇesu pavattañāṇassa nānappakārabhāvato tabbhāvapaṭivedhadīpakena
analyzed: bhāsita ttha payojana tthānam tīsu ca ñāṇesu pavatta ñāṇassa nānā pakāra bhāvataḥ tad bhāva paṭivedha dīpakena
translated: and the meaning and the purpose of what is spoken, and the knowledge that occurs in the three knowledges, because of the variety of aspects,

original: evaṃ-saddena atthapaṭibhānapaṭisambhidāsampattisabbhāvadīpanaṃ yuttaṃ, sotabbadhammassa🔽pana atthādhigamahetuto, taṃvasena ca tadavasesahetuppabhedassa gahitattā, niruttibhāvato
analyzed: evam saddena attha paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā sampatti sabbhāva dīpanam yuttam sotabba dhammassa  pana attha adhigama hetuto taṃ vasena ca tad avasesa hetu ppabhedassa gahita ttā nirutti bhāvato
translated: it is fitting that the word “thus” should be explained as the possession of the excellence of the discernment of perspicuity of meaning,🔽but the word “heard” should be understood as the possession of the excellence of the discernment of perspicuity of language,🔽because of the meaning of language, and because of the inclusion of the other causes and the different kinds of causes by means of that, and because it is the cause for the attainment of the meaning of the Dhamma that is to be heard,🔽and because it is the illumination of the different kinds of what is to be heard.

original: ca sotabbappabhedadīpakena suta-saddena dhammaniruttipaṭisambhidāsampattisabbhāvadīpanaṃ
analyzed: ca sotabba ppabheda dīpakena suta saddena dhamma nirutti paṭisambhidā sampatti sabbhāva dīpanam
translated: For the purpose of showing just that meaning,🔽it is said thus: “The illumination of non-delusion, the illumination of non-forgetting,”

original: yuttanti veditabbaṃ. Tadevatthañhi ñāpetuṃ “asammohadīpakena, asammosadīpakenā”ti🔽ca avatvā tathā vuttanti.🔽Evaṃ asammohāsammosasaṅkhātassa dīpetabbassatthassa dīpakehi evaṃ-sadda suta-saddehi
analyzed: yuttam ti veditabbam a sammoha dīpakena a sammosa dīpakena ati  ca avatvā tathā vuttanti  evam asammoha asammosa saṅkhātassa dīpetabbassa atthassa dīpakehi evaṃsadda suta saddehi
translated: and not “the illumination of non-delusion, the illumination of non-forgetting.”🔽Having thus shown the meaning to be shown by the words “thus” and “heard,”🔽which are the illumination of the meaning called non-delusion and non-forgetting,🔽now, the meaning to be shown by the words “with wisdom” and “with attention,”

original: pakāsetabbamatthaṃ pakāsetvā idāni yonisomanasikārāvikkhepasaṅkhātassa dīpetabbassatthassa
analyzed: pakāsetabbam attham pakāsetvā idāni yoniso manasikāra avikkhepa saṅkhātassa dīpetabbassa atthassa
translated: which are the illumination of the meaning called right reflection and non-distraction,

original: dīpakehipi tehi pakāsetabbamatthaṃ pakāsento “evanti cā”tiādimāha. Tattha hi “evanti…pe…🔽bhāsamāno, sutanti idaṃ…pe… bhāsamāno”ti ca iminā tehi saddehi pubbe dīpitaṃ yonisomanasikārāvikkhepasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: dīpakehi pi tehi pakāsetabbam attham pakāsentaḥ evam iti ca ati ādim āha tattha hi  bhāsamānaḥ sutanti idam pe bhāsamānaḥ iti ca iminā tehi saddehi pubbe dīpitam yoniso manasikāra avikkhepa saṅkhātam
translated: and he says “Thus … and so on” in order to reveal the meaning that is to be revealed by means of those terms. Herein, he says “Thus … and so on” …🔽and so on, and “Heard thus … and so on” … and so on, in order to reveal the meaning to be revealed, namely, the right reflection and the non-distraction that were revealed by those terms.

original: dīpetabbatthamāha, “ete mayā”tiādīhi pana pakāsetabbatthaṃ savanayogadīpakanti ca
analyzed: dīpetabba attham āha ete mayā ati ādīhi pana pakāsetabba attham savana yoga dīpakam ti ca
translated: And by “These ideas I have heard” and so on he reveals the meaning to be revealed, namely, the illumination of the application of hearing.🔽And he says this in order to show that the application of hearing is successful by means of non-distraction.

original: avikkhepavasena savanayogassa sijjhanato tadeva sandhāyāha. Tathā hi ācariyadhammapālattherena
analyzed: avikkhepa vasena savana yogassa sijjhanataḥ tat eva sandhāya āha tathā hi ācariya dhammapāla ttherena
translated: For this is said by the teacher, the Elder Dhammapāla:

original: vuttaṃ “savanadhāraṇavacīparicariyā pariyattidhammānaṃ visesena sotāvadhāraṇapaṭibaddhāti
analyzed: vuttam savana dhāraṇa vacī paricariyā pariyatti dhammānam visesena sotāvadhāraṇa paṭibaddhā ti
translated: “The application of hearing is bound up with the hearing and retaining of the ideas of the scriptures by means of the special qualities of the hearing, retaining, verbal rehearsal, and reviewing.

original: te avikkhepadīpakena sutasaddena yojetvā”ti. Manodiṭṭhīhi pariyattidhammānaṃ anupekkhanasuppaṭivedhā
analyzed: te avikkhepa dīpakena suta saddena yojetvā ati manaḥ diṭṭhīhi pariyatti dhammānam an upekkhana su paṭivedhā
translated: So they are applied by means of the term ‘heard,’ which is the illumination of non-distraction.”🔽The reviewing of the ideas of the scriptures by means of the mental seeing is bound up with the special qualities of attention.

original: visesato manasikārapaṭibaddhā, tasmā taddīpakavacaneneva ete mayā dhammā manasānupekkhitā
analyzed: visesataḥ manasikāra paṭibaddhā tasmā tad dīpaka vacanena iva ete mayā dhammā manasā anupekkhitā
translated: So he says “These ideas I have reviewed with my mind” and so on with the term that is the illumination of that.

original: diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhāti imamatthaṃ pakāsetīti vuttaṃ “evanti ca…pe… dīpetī”ti tattha
analyzed: diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā ti imam attham pakāseti iti vuttam evam ti cape dīpeti iti tattha
translated: He shows the meaning of “He has seen with wisdom” thus: “He has penetrated with wisdom” .

original: dhammāti pariyattidhammā. Manasānupekkhitāti “idha sīlaṃ kathitaṃ, idha samādhi,🔽idha paññā, ettakāva ettha anusandhayo”tiādibhedena manasā anupekkhitā. Diṭṭhiyā🔽suppaṭividdhāti nijjhānakkhantisaṅkhātāya, ñātapariññāsaṅkhātāya vā diṭṭhiyā tattha
analyzed: dhammā ati pariyatti dhammā manasā an upekkhitā idha sīlam kathitam idha samādhi  idha paññā ettakā va ettha anusandhayo ti ādi bhedena manasā anupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā  suppaṭividdhā ti nijjhāna kkhanti saṅkhātāya ñāta pariññā saṅkhātāya vā diṭṭhiyā tattha
translated: Herein, Dhamma is the Dhamma of the scriptures.🔽He has seen with wisdom: he has penetrated with wisdom that is called “seeing” in the sense of acquiescence in insight or in the sense of full-understanding by knowing.

original: vuttarūpārūpadhamme “iti rūpaṃ, ettakaṃ rūpa”ntiādinā suṭṭhu vavatthāpetvā paṭividdhā.
analyzed: vutta rūpa arūpa dhamme iti rūpam ettakam rūpa nti ādinā suṭṭhu vavatthāpetvā paṭividdhā
translated: He has seen with wisdom: he has penetrated with wisdom that is called “seeing” in the sense of acquiescence in insight or in the sense of full-understanding by knowing.

original: Savanadhāraṇavacīparicariyā ca pariyattidhammānaṃ visesena sotāvadhāraṇapaṭibaddhā,🔽tasmā taddīpakavacaneneva bahū mayā dhammā sutā dhātā vacasā paricitāti imamatthaṃ
analyzed: savana dhāraṇa vacī paricariyā ca pariyatti dhammānam visesena sotāvadhāraṇa paṭibaddhā  tasmai tad dīpaka vacanena iva bahū mayā dhammā sutā dhātā vacasā paricitā ati imam attham
translated: And the service of the ear, memory, and speech in regard to the Dhamma of the scriptures is especially bound up with hearing and remembering.🔽Therefore he shows the meaning of “I have heard much, I have remembered what I have heard, I have used speech well” by the words “Heard” .

original: pakāsetīti vuttaṃ “sutanti idaṃ…pe… dīpetī”ti. Tattha sutāti sotadvārānusārena viññātā.
analyzed: pakāseti iti vuttam sutam ti idam pe dīpeti iti tattha sutā ati sota dvāra anusārena viññātā
translated: Herein, heard is cognized by the ear door.

original: Dhātāti suvaṇṇabhājane pakkhittasīhavasā viya manasi suppatiṭṭhitabhāvasādhanena
analyzed: dhātā iti suvaṇṇa bhājane pakkhitta sīha vasā viya manasi su patiṭṭhita bhāva sādhanena
translated: “Dwelling on” : by the accomplishment of the state of being well-established in the mind, as if the essence of a lion were poured into a golden vessel.

original: upadhāritā. Vacasā paricitāti paguṇatāsampādanena vācāya paricitā sajjhāyitā. Idāni
analyzed: upadhāritā vacasā paricitā ati paguṇa tā sampādanena vācāya paricitā idāni
translated: “Mulling over” : by the accomplishment of the state of being familiar, mulling over with speech, reciting. Now,🔽illustrating the meaning to be illustrated by the two terms stated thus,🔽he said “By both of these” , etc. Herein, “by both of these” : by the two terms stated thus,

original: pakāsetabbatthadvayadīpakena yathāvuttasaddadvayena vibhāvetabbamatthaṃ vibhāvento
analyzed: pakāsetabba attha dvaya dīpakena yathā vutta sadda dvayena vibhāvetabbam attham vibhāventaḥ
translated: by the means of illustration of the meaning to be illustrated in the former and the latter method.

original: “tadubhayenapī”tiādimāha. Tattha tadubhayenāti purimanaye, pacchimanaye ca yathāvuttassa🔽pakāsetabbassatthassa pakāsakena tena dubbidhena saddena. Atthabyañjanapāripūriṃ🔽dīpentoti ādarajananassa kāraṇavacanaṃ. Tadeva kāraṇaṃ byatirekena vivarati, yuttiyā🔽vā daḷhaṃ karoti “atthabyañjanaparipuṇṇañhī”tiādinā. Asuṇantoti cettha lakkhaṇe,
analyzed: tad ubhayena api itiādim āha tattha tad ubhayena ati purima naye pacchima naye ca yathā vuttassa  pakāsetabbassa atthassa pakāsakena tena dubbidhena saddena attha byañjana pāripūrim  dīpento ti ādara jananassa kāraṇa vacanam tat eva kāraṇam byatirekena vivarati yuttiyā  vā daḷham karoti attha byañjana paripuṇṇam hi itiādinā a suṇantaḥ iti ca ittha lakkhaṇe
translated: “Illuminating the fulfilment of the meaning and the letter” : this is a statement of the reason for arousing respect. He elucidates that very reason by way of an alternative, or he makes it firm by way of a reason,🔽with “For the Dhamma, bhikkhus, is well-expounded by me, etc.” Herein, the word “anta” is in the sense of a characteristic,

original: hetumhi vā anta-saddo. Mahatā hitāti mahantato hitasmā. Paribāhiroti sabbato bhāgena bāhiro.
analyzed: hetumhi vā anta saddaḥ mahatā hitā ati mahantataḥ hitasma paribāhiraḥ ti sabbatas bhāgena bāhiraḥ
translated: or in the sense of a reason. “For the welfare of a great multitude” : for the welfare of a great many. “Out of sympathy for the world” : out of sympathy for the whole world. “For the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and men” : for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and men. “Not for the sake of worldly gain” : not for the sake of worldly gain such as gain, honour, or fame. “Not for the sake of a boon” : not for the sake of a boon such as heaven. “Not for the sake of a cause” : not for the sake of a cause such as ‘By this I shall become a deva or a gandhabba or a yakkha or a human being.’ “Not for the sake of a reason” : not for the sake of a reason such as ‘By this I shall become a deva or a gandhabba or a yakkha or a human being.’ “Not for the sake of a cause” : not for the sake of a cause such as ‘By this I shall become a deva or a gandhabba or a yakkha or a human being.’ “Not for the sake of a reason” : not for the sake of a reason such as ‘By this I shall become a deva or a gandhabba or a yakkha or a human being.’ “Not for the sake of a cause” : not for the sake of

original: Etena pana vibhāvetabbatthadīpakena saddadvayena anubhāvetabbatthamanubhāvento “evaṃ🔽me sutanti iminā”tiādimāha. Pubbe visuṃ visuṃ atthe yojitāyeva ete saddā idha ekassevānubhāvatthassa
analyzed: etena pana vibhāvetabba attha dīpakena sadda dvayena anubhāvetabba attham anubhāventaḥ evam  me sutam ti iminā atiādim āha pubbe visum visum atthe yojitāya iva ete saddāḥ idha ekassa iva anubhāva atthassa
translated: By this pair of words, which illuminate the meaning to be illustrated, he illustrates the meaning to be illuminated. “By this ‘Thus have I heard’ he says.🔽The words, which are applied separately to the meaning in the previous passage, are taken here as the words that illuminate the meaning to be illuminated.🔽The word ‘indeed’ is used to show that they are taken in this way.

original: anubhāvakabhāvena gahitāti ñāpetuṃ “sakalenā”ti vuttaṃ. Kāmañca me-saddo imasmiṃ🔽ṭhāne pubbena yojito, tadapekkhānaṃ pana evaṃ-sadda suta-saddānaṃ sahacaraṇato, avinābhāvato
analyzed: anubhāvaka bhāvena gahitā iti ñāpetum sakalena iti vuttam kāmam ca me saddaḥ imasmin  ṭhāne pubbena yojitaḥ tad apekkhānam pana evaṃsadda suta saddānam sahacaraṇataḥ avinābhāvato
translated: The word ‘indeed’ is used in this place as if it were connected with the previous word, but it should be regarded as being said in this way because of the association and the inseparability of the words ‘thus’ and ‘heard’ which are dependent on it.

original: ca tathā vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tathāgatappaveditanti tathāgatena pakārato viditaṃ,
analyzed: ca tathā vuttanti daṭṭhabbam tathāgata ppaveditam ti tathāgatena pakārataḥ viditam
translated: ‘Expounded by the Tathāgata’: known by the Tathāgata in the sense of having been spoken by him.

original: bhāsitaṃ vā. Attano adahantoti attani “mameda”nti aṭṭhapento. Bhummatthe cetaṃ sāmivacanaṃ.🔽Asappurisabhūminti asappurisavisayaṃ, so ca atthato apakataññutāsaṅkhātā “idhekacco
analyzed: bhāsitam vā attano a dahanto ti attani mama idam ti aṭṭhapentaḥ bhumma tthe ca itam sāmi vacanam  asappurisa bhūminti asappurisa visayam saḥ ca atthataḥ apakataññu tā saṅkhātā idha ekacco
translated: ‘Not laying hold of it as his own’: not establishing it in himself as ‘mine.’ This is a possessive adjective in the sense of a locative.

original: pāpabhikkhu tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā attano dahatī”ti evaṃ
analyzed: pāpa bhikkhu tathāgata ppaveditam dhamma vinayam pariyāpuṇitvā attanaḥ dahati iti evam
translated: ‘The plane of the unskilled’: the domain of the unskilled. And that is said to be the plane of the unskilled in the sense of ingratitude, as follows: ‘Herein, a certain evil bhikkhu, having learned the Dhamma and Discipline expounded by the Tathāgata, lays hold of it as his own and then teaches it to others.’

original: mahācoradīpakena bhagavatā vuttā anariyavohārāvatthā, tathā cāha “tathāgata…pe… adahanto”ti.🔽Hutvāti cettha seso. Tathā sāvakattaṃ paṭijānantoti sappurisabhūmiokkamanasarūpakathanaṃ.
analyzed: mahācoradīpakena bhagavatā vuttā tathā ca āha a dahantā iti  hutvā iti ca ittha sesaḥ tathā sāvaka ttam paṭijānanto ti sappurisa bhūmi ukkamana sarūpa kathanam

translated: At that time, it seems, some devatās

original: desanākusalo, idāni dhammaṃ deseti, sakyakulappasuto tathāgatassa bhātā, cūḷapituputto🔽ca, kiṃ nu kho so sayaṃ sacchikataṃ dhammaṃ deseti, udāhu bhagavatoyeva vacanaṃ yathāsuta”nti,
analyzed: desanā kusalaḥ idāni dhammam deseti sakya kula ppasutaḥ tathāgatassa bhātā cūḷa pitu putto  ca kim nu kho so sayam sacchikatam dhammam deseti udāhu bhagavato yā iva vacanam yathāsutam ti
translated: thought thus: “The Blessed One has attained final Nibbāna, and this venerable Ānanda, who is skilled in the system of the texts, is teaching the Dhamma. He is a clansman of the Sakyans, the Blessed One’s brother, his father’s younger brother’s son. Now, does he teach the Dhamma he has realized himself, or does he teach the Blessed One’s word as he heard it?”

original: tesameva cetoparivitakkamaññāya tadabhipariharaṇatthaṃ asappurisabhūmisamatikkamanādiattho
analyzed: tesam eva cetaḥ upari vitakka maññāya tad abhipariharaṇa attham
translated: And knowing in his mind the thoughts occurring to them, he uttered this stanza in order to remove their doubts by showing that he was not teaching as one who had realized the Dhamma by his own ingenuity, but that he was teaching the Blessed One’s word as he had heard it.

original: anubhāvitoti. Sāyeva yathāvuttā anariyavohārāvatthā asaddhammo, tadavatthānokkamanasaṅkhātā
analyzed: anubhāvito ti sāyā iva yathā vuttā anariya vohāra avatthā tad avatthāna ukkamana saṅkhātā
translated: The same subject matter as the above-mentioned unrighteous speech is the “unrighteous doctrine,”

original: ca sāvakattapaṭijānanā saddhammo. Evaṃ sati pariyāyantarena purimatthameva dassetīti
analyzed: ca sāvaka tta paṭijānanā saddhammaḥ evam sati pariyāya antarena purimattham eva dasseti iti
translated: and the declaration of discipleship, which is the “righteous doctrine,” is the “righteousness” in the sense of the act of going out of that subject matter.🔽So it is the same subject matter that is shown in a different way in the second stanza.

original: gahetabbaṃ. Apica kuhanalapanādivasena pavatto akusalarāsi asaddhammo, tabbirahitabhāvo🔽ca saddhammo. “Kevala”ntiādināpi vuttassevatthassa pariyāyantarena dassanaṃ, yathāvuttāya
analyzed: gahetabbam apica kuhana lapana ādi vasena pavattaḥ akusala rāsi asat dhammaḥ tad virahita bhāvo  ca saddhammaḥ kevala nti ādinā api vuttassa iva atthassa pariyāya antarena dassanam yathā vuttāya
translated: and should be taken. Furthermore, the unprofitable mass of talk consisting in hypocrisy, etc., is an untrue Dhamma, and the absence of that is

original: anariyavohārāvatthāya parimoceti. Sāvakattaṃ paṭijānanena satthāraṃ apadisatīti attho.🔽Apica satthukappādikiriyato attānaṃ parimoceti takkiriyāsaṅkāya sambhavato. “Satthu
analyzed: anariya vohārau atthāya parimoca iti sāvaka ttam paṭijānanena satthāram apadisati iti attho  apica satthu kappa ādi kiriyataḥ attānam parimoca iti tad kiriyā āsaṅkāya sambhavataḥ satthu
translated: the true Dhamma. The words “only” , etc., show the same meaning in a different way. He exonerates himself from the subject of the unprofitable talk consisting in talk that is not factual, etc., mentioned above. The meaning is that he exonerates the Master by acknowledging his discipleship.

original: bhagavatoyeva vacanaṃ mayāsuta”nti satthāraṃ apadisatīti atthantaramanubhāvanaṃ hoti.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ yā iva vacanam satthāram apadisati iti atthantaram anubhāvanam hoti
translated: Furthermore, he exonerates himself from the act of making the Master’s utterance his own, since there is the possibility of misrepresentation. The meaning is that he exonerates the Master by saying “I have heard only the Blessed One’s utterance.”

original: “Jinavacana”ntiādipi pariyāyantaradassanaṃ, atthantaramanubhāvanameva vā. Appetīti
analyzed: pariyāya antara dassanam atthantaram anubhāvanam eva vā appeti iti
translated: The words “the Victor’s utterance” , etc., show the same meaning in a different way, or else they are a mere amplification. The word “only”

original: nidasseti. Diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaparamatthesu yathārahaṃ satte netīti netti, dhammoyeva🔽netti tathā. Vuttanayena cettha ubhayathā adhippāyo veditabbo.
analyzed: nidasseti diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika paramatthesu yathāraham satte neti iti 🔽tathā vutta nayena ca ittha ubhayathā adhippāyaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: indicates. The Dhamma is a leader since it leads beings as is fitting in the case of each to the highest good in this life and in the life to come. It is a leader in the same way that the Dhamma is a leader.

original: Aparampi anubhāvetabbamatthamanubhāveti “apicā”tiādinā. Tattha uppāditabhāvatanti🔽desanāvasena pavattitabhāvaṃ. Purimavacanaṃ vivarantoti bhagavatā desitavasena purimataraṃ
analyzed: aparam pi anubhāvetabbam attham anubhāveti apica iti ādinā tattha  desanā vasena pavattita bhāvam purima vacanam bhagavatā desita vasena purimataram
translated: He shows another meaning that should be inferred, namely, “And further,” etc. Herein,🔽he has generated the state means he has caused the state to occur by way of teaching.

original: saṃvijjamānaṃ bhagavatā vacanameva uttāniṃ karonto, idaṃ vacananti sambandho. Catūhi
analyzed: saṃvijjamānam bhagavatā vacanam eva uttānim karontaḥ idam catūhi
translated: Explaining the former statement means making the former statement, which is found in the scriptures, clear by the Blessed One’s own statement. The connection is: “This statement.”

original: vesārajjañāṇehi visāradassa, visāradahetubhūtacatuvesārajjañāṇasampannassa vā. Dasañāṇabaladharassa.
analyzed: vesārajja ñāṇehi visāradassa visārada hetu bhūta catu vesārajja ñāṇa sampannassa vā dasa ñāṇa baladharassa
translated: He is confident because of the four kinds of confident knowledge, or he is endowed with the four kinds of confident knowledge that are the cause of confidence. He is the bearer of the ten powers of knowledge.

original: Sammāsambuddhabhāvasaṅkhāte uttamaṭṭhāne ṭhitassa, usabhassa idanti vā atthena āsabhasaṅkhāte🔽akampanasabhāvabhūte ṭhāne ṭhitassa. “Evameva kho bhikkhave, yadā tathāgato loke
analyzed: sammāsambuddha bhāva saṅkhāte uttama ṭṭhāne ṭhitassa usabhassa idam ti vā atthena āsabha saṅkhāte  akampana sabhāva bhūte ṭhāne ṭhitassa evam eva kho bhikkhave yadā tathāgataḥ loke
translated: He is established in the supreme place called the state of a Perfectly Enlightened One, or he is established in the place called the “leader,” which is of the nature of unshakability.

original: uppajjati…pe… so dhammaṃ desetī”tiādinā sīhopamasuttādīsu āgatena anekanayena sīhanādanadino.
analyzed: so dhammam deseti iti ādinā sīhopama sutta ādīsu āgatena aneka nayena
translated: He is the one who has roared his lion’s roar in many ways, as in the Sīhanāda Sutta, etc., with the words, “Bhikkhus, when a Tathāgata arises in the world, an Arahant, a Perfectly Enlightened One, … he teaches the Dhamma thus: …”

original: Sabbasattesu, sabbasattānaṃ vā uttamassa. Na cettha niddhāraṇalakkhaṇābhāvato niddhāraṇavasena
analyzed: sabba sattesu sabba sattānam vā uttamassa na ca ittha niddhāraṇa lakkhaṇa abhāvataḥ niddhāraṇa vasena
translated: “Of all beings” or “of the highest of all beings.” Here the compound is not a determinative compound because there is no characteristic of determinative compounds.

original: samāso. Sabbattha hi sakkataganthesu, sāsanaganthesu ca evameva vuttaṃ. Dhammena
analyzed: samāsaḥ sabbattha hi sakkata ganthesu sāsana ganthesu ca evam eva vuttam dhammena
translated: For it is said in the texts of the Sakavādin and in the texts of the Dispensation thus:

original: sattānamissarassa. Dhammasseva issarassa taduppādanavasenātipi vadanti. Sesapadadvayaṃ
analyzed: dhammassa iva issarassa vadanti sesa pada dvayam
translated: “Of beings by Dhamma.” They also say: “Of the Dhamma as the Ruler by the Dhamma as the cause of his arising.” The other two terms

original: tassevatthassa pariyāyantaradīpanaṃ. Dhammena lokassa padīpamiva bhūtassa, taduppādakabhāvena
analyzed: dhammena lokassa padīpam iva bhūtassa tad uppādaka bhāvena
translated: indicate the same meaning by a different method. “Of the Dhamma as the light of the world” means of the Dhamma as the cause of the arising of the world.

original: vā dhammasaṅkhātapadīpasampannassa. “Dhammakāyoti bhikkhave, tathāgatassetaṃ adhivacana”nti
analyzed: vā dhamma saṅkhāta padīpa sampannassa dhamma kāyaḥ ti bhikkhave tathāgatassa etam adhivacanan ti
translated: Or it means of the Dhamma as the light, that is, of the Dhamma as the cause of the arising of the light. For it is said: “Bhikkhus, the Tathāgata is called the Dhamma-body” .

original: hi vuttaṃ. Dhammena lokapaṭisaraṇabhūtassa, dhammasaṅkhātena vā paṭisaraṇena sampannassa.
analyzed: hi vuttam dhammena loka paṭisaraṇa bhūtassa dhamma saṅkhātena vā paṭisaraṇena sampannassa
translated: “Of the Dhamma as the refuge of the world” means of the Dhamma as the cause of the arising of the refuge of the world. Or it means of the Dhamma as the refuge, that is, of the Dhamma as the cause of the arising of the refuge.

original: “Yaṃnūnāhaṃ…pe… tameva dhammaṃ sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā upanissāya vihareyya”nti
analyzed: yaṃ nūna aham pe tam eva dhammam sakkatvā garum katvā mānetvā pūjetvā upanissāya vihareyyanti
translated: “Suppose I were to honour, respect, revere, and venerate that Dhamma, and to live in dependence on it” .

original: hi vuttaṃ. Saddhindriyādisaddhammasaṅkhātassa varacakkassa pavattino, saddhammānametassa🔽vā āṇācakkavarassa pavattino sammāsambuddhassa tassa bhagavato idaṃ vacanaṃ sammukhāva
analyzed: hi vuttam saddhi indriya ādi saddhamma saṅkhātassa vara cakkassa pavattinaḥ saddhammānam etassa  vā āṇācakkavarassa pavattinaḥ sammāsambuddhassa tassa bhagavataḥ idam vacanam
translated: For this is said: “The Blessed One is the one who sets rolling the wheel of the True Dhamma, which is a wheel that has a single revolution and three revolutions and that is unsurpassed and has a twelve-fold base, and which is set rolling by the Vanquishing Master Builder in the plane of the universal builder.🔽This is the Blessed One’s word, which I have received directly,

original: mayā paṭiggahitanti yojetabbaṃ. Byañjaneti padasamudāyabhūte vākye. Kaṅkhā vā vimati
analyzed: mayā paṭiggahitan ti yojetabbam byañjanā iti pada samudāya bhūte vākye kaṅkhā vā vimati
translated: in the phrasing, that is to say, in the sentence, which is a collection of words.

original: vāti ettha daḷhataraṃ niviṭṭhā vicikicchā kaṅkhā. Nātisaṃsappanaṃ matibhedamattaṃ
analyzed: vāti ettha daḷhataram niviṭṭhā vicikicchā kaṅkhā na ati saṃsappanam mati bheda mattam
translated: Doubt is a vacillation that is firmly settled. Uncertainty is a mere division of opinion that is not very strong.

original: vimati. Sammukhā paṭiggahitamidaṃ mayāti tathā akattabbabhāvakāraṇavacanaṃ. Attanā🔽uppāditabhāvaṃ appaṭijānanto purimavacanaṃ vivarantoti pana assaddhiyavināsanassa,🔽saddhāsampadamuppādanassa ca kāraṇavacanaṃ. “Teneta”ntiādinā yathāvuttamevatthaṃ
analyzed: vimati sammukhā paṭiggahitam idam mayā iti tathā a kattabba bhāva kāraṇa vacanam attanā  uppādita bhāvam a paṭijānanto purima vacanam vivaranto ti pana assaddhiya vināsanassa  saddhā sampadam uppādanassa ca kāraṇa vacanam tena itaḥ ti ādinā yathāvuttam evattham
translated: This is the Blessed One’s word, which I have received directly, and it should not be otherwise.🔽He is explaining the former statement by saying that he does not admit that he has himself produced it, and he is stating the reason why it should not be otherwise.

original: udānavasena dasseti.
analyzed: udāna vasena dassa iti
translated: He shows by way of an utterance the very meaning stated in the way beginning “Therefore, Ananda” .

original: “Evaṃ me suta”nti evaṃ vadanto gotamagottassa sammāsambuddhassa sāvako, gotamagottasambandho
analyzed: evam me sutam ti evam vadantaḥ gotama gottassa sammāsambuddhassa sāvakaḥ gotama gotta sambandho
translated: “Thus have I heard” : the disciple of the Perfectly Enlightened One of the Gotama family, the venerable Ananda, who is himself of the Gotama family,

original: vā sāvako āyasmā ānando bhagavatā bhāsitabhāvassa, sammukhā paṭiggahitabhāvassa ca🔽sūcanato, tathāsūcaneneva ca khalitadunniruttādigahaṇadosābhāvassa sijjhanato sāsane🔽assaddhaṃ vināsayati, saddhaṃ vaḍḍhetīti attho. Ettha ca pañcamādayo tisso atthayojanā
analyzed: vā sāvakaḥ āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavatā bhāsita bhāvassa sammukhā paṭiggahita bhāvassa ca  sūcanataḥ tathā sūcanena iva ca khalita dunnirutta ādi gahaṇa dosa abhāvassa sijjhanataḥ sa āsane  assaddham vināsayati saddham vaḍḍheti iti attho ettha ca pañcama ādayo tisso attha yojanā
translated: by this statement shows that he has heard the Dhamma spoken by the Blessed One and has received it in his presence.🔽And by this very statement he shows that he is free from the faults of forgetfulness, confusion, etc. The meaning is that he destroys lack of faith and increases faith in the Dhamma.

original: ākārādiatthesu aggahitavisesameva evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā dassitā, tato parā tisso ākāratthameva🔽evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā vibhāvitā, pacchimā pana tisso yathākkamaṃ ākāratthaṃ, nidassanatthaṃ,
analyzed: ākāra ādi atthesu aggahita visesam eva evaṃsaddam gahetvā dassitā tatas parā tissaḥ ākāra attham eva  evaṃsaddam gahetvā vibhāvitā pacchimā pana tissaḥ yathākkamam ākāra attham nidassana ttham
translated: Herein, the first three of the five ways of explaining the word evam are shown by taking the word evaṃ as referring to the meaning of mode, etc., without distinguishing them. The next three are shown by taking the word evaṃ as referring to the meaning of mode only.🔽The last three are shown by taking the word evaṃ as referring respectively to the meaning of mode, the meaning of indication, and the meaning of limitation.

original: avadhāraṇatthañca evaṃ-saddaṃ gahetvā yojitāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Honti cettha –
analyzed: avadhāraṇa attham ca evaṃsaddam gahetvā yojitā ati daṭṭhabbam honti ca ittha
translated: Herein, the following are the five meanings of the word evaṃ:🔽Seeing, revealing,

original: “Dassanaṃ dīpanañcāpi, pakāsanaṃ vibhāvanaṃ;🔽Anubhāvanamiccattho, kiriyāyogena pañcadhā.
analyzed: dassanam dīpanam ca api pakāsanam vibhāvanam 🔽anubhāvanam iccattho kiriyā yogena pañcadhā
translated: Illuminating, distinguishing,🔽Approving, in the sense of “thus it is,” and in the sense of “it is done” .

original: Dassito paramparāya, siddho nekatthavuttiyā;
analyzed: dassitaḥ paramparāya siddhaḥ na eka attha vuttiyā
translated: It is established by the method of succession, And by the method of the single meaning.

original: Evaṃ me sutamiccettha, padattaye nayaññunā”ti.🔽Eka-saddo pana aññaseṭṭhāsahāyasaṅkhyādīsu dissati. Tathā hesa “sassato attā ca loko🔽ca, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti ittheke abhivadantī”tiādīsu aññatthe dissati, “cetaso🔽ekodibhāva”ntiādīsu seṭṭhe, “ekovūpakaṭṭho”tiādīsu asahāye, “ekova kho bhikkhave,
analyzed: evam me sutam icca itthā padattaye  eka saddo pana añña seṭṭhā sahāya saṅkhyā ādīsu dissati tathā ha isa sassataḥ attā ca loko  ca idam eva saccam mogham aññanti itthā ike abhivadanti iti ādīsu aññatthe dissati cetasaḥ  eka udi bhāvanti ādīsu seṭṭhe asahāye ekaḥ uva kho bhikkhave
translated: Thus the wise one, in the three words, “Thus have I heard,”

original: khaṇo ca samayo ca brahmacariyavāsāyā”tiādīsu saṅkhyāyaṃ, idhāpi saṅkhyāyamevāti🔽dassento āha “ekanti gaṇanaparicchedaniddeso”ti ekoyevesa samayo, na dve vā tayo
analyzed: ca samayo ca brahmacariya vāsāya ati ādīsu saṅkhyāyam idha api saṅkhyāyam eva ati  dassentaḥ āha ekam ti gaṇana pariccheda niddeso ti samayaḥ na dve vā tayo
translated: The word “one” is found in the sense of “another,” “best,” “companionless,” “number,” and so on. Thus it is found in the sense of “another” in such passages as “The self and the world are eternal—this alone is the truth, other than this is false” (Sn 1079). It is found in the sense of “best” in such passages as “unification of mind” . It is found in the sense of “companionless” in such passages as “standing alone” . It is found in the sense of “number” in such passages as “There is only one occasion, monks, there is only one occasion for living the holy life” . Here too it is in the sense of “number.”

original: vāti ūnādhikābhāvena gaṇanassa paricchedaniddeso ekanti ayaṃ saddoti attho, tena
analyzed: vā ti ūna adhika abhāvena gaṇanassa pariccheda niddesaḥ ekam ti ayam saddo ti attho tena
translated: To show this he says, “The word ‘one’ is a designation of the delimitation of number.” There is only one occasion, not two or three. Thus it is a designation of the delimitation of number by way of the absence of excess or deficiency. The meaning is: the word “one” is thus.

original: kassa paricchindananti anuyoge sati “samaya”nti vuttanti dassento āha “samayanti
analyzed: kassa paricchindananti anuyoge sati samaya nti vuttanti dassentaḥ āha samaya nti
translated: To show that the answer is “occasion” when the question is “What is delimited?” he says, “The word ‘occasion’ is a designation of the delimitation of time.”

original: paricchinnaniddeso”ti. Evaṃ paricchedaparicchinnavasena vuttepi “ayaṃ nāma samayo”ti🔽sarūpato aniyamitattā aniyamitavacanamevāti dasseti “ekaṃ…pe…. dīpana”nti iminā.
analyzed: paricchinna niddeso ti evam pariccheda paricchinna vasena vutte api ayam nāma samayaḥ ti  sarūpataḥ aniyamita ttā aniyamita vacanam eva ati dasseti ekaṃpe dīpanam ti iminā
translated: Though it is stated thus by way of the limitedness of the description, still, since it is not determined in the form “this is the time,”🔽he shows that the expression is not determined.

original: Idāni samayasaddassa anekatthavuttitaṃ atthuddhāravasena dassetvā idhādhippetamatthaṃ
analyzed: idāni samaya saddassa aneka attha vutti tam attha uddhāra vasena dassetvā idha adhippetam attham
translated: Now, having shown by way of the explanation of the meaning that the word samaya has many meanings, he determines the meaning intended here by the words “tattha” , etc.

original: niyamento “tatthā”tiādimāha. Tatthāti tasmiṃ “ekaṃ samaya”nti padadvaye, samabhiniviṭṭho
analyzed: tattha ati ādim āha tattha iti tasmin ekam pada dvaye samabhiniviṭṭhaḥ
translated: The construction is: “tattha” in the two words “ekaṃ samayaṃ” , the word samaya is firmly fixed;

original: samaya saddoti sambandho. Na pana dissatīti tesvekasmiṃyeva atthe idha pavattanato.🔽Samavāyeti paccayasāmaggiyaṃ, kāraṇasamavāyeti attho. Khaṇeti okāse. Hetudiṭṭhīsūti
analyzed: samaya saddo ti sambandhaḥ na pana dissati iti tesu ekasmin yeva atthe idha pavattanato  samavāya iti paccaya sāmaggiyam kāraṇa samavāya iti atthaḥ khaṇe iti okāse hetu diṭṭhīsu iti
translated: but it is not seen in the sense of one of those meanings here, because it occurs in only one meaning.🔽Samavāya means the coming together of conditions; the meaning is: the coming together of causes. Khaṇa means occasion. Hetu-diṭṭhi-sū means

original: hetumhi ceva laddhiyañca. Assāti samayasaddassa. Kālañca samayañca upādāyāti ettha
analyzed: hetumhi ca iva laddhiyam ca assa ati samaya saddassa kālañca samayañca upādāya ati ettha
translated: in the cause and in the view of the cause. Assa means of the word samaya. Kālañca samayañca upādāyāti ettha

original: kālo nāma upasaṅkamanassa yuttakālo. Samayo nāma tasseva paccayasāmaggī, atthato
analyzed: kālaḥ nāma upasaṅkamanassa yutta kālo samayaḥ nāma tassa iva paccaya sāmaggī atthataḥ
translated: kālo means the time suitable for approaching. Samayo means the coming together of the same conditions as that, the meaning is:

original: pana tadanurūpasarīrabalañceva tappaccayaparissayābhāvo ca. Upādānaṃ nāma ñāṇena
analyzed: pana tad anurūpa sarīra balañca iva tad paccaya parissaya abhāvo ca upādānam nāma ñāṇena
translated: and the bodily strength suitable to that, and the absence of any affliction due to that. “Apprehending” is the apprehending of them by knowledge.

original: tesaṃ gahaṇaṃ, tasmā yathāvuttaṃ kālañca samayañca paññāya gahetvā upadhāretvāti
analyzed: tesam gahaṇam tasmai yathāvuttam kālañca samayañca paññāya gahetvā upadhāretvā ati
translated: Therefore the meaning is: “having apprehended the time and the occasion as stated, having considered them.”

original: attho. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – sace amhākaṃ sve gamanassa yuttakālo bhavissati, kāye balamattā
analyzed: attho idam vuttam hoti sace amhākam sve gamanassa yutta kālaḥ bhavissati kāye bala mattā
translated: This is what is said: “If the time suitable for our going tomorrow will be, if the bodily strength will be sufficient,

original: ca pharissati, gamanapaccayā ca añño aphāsuvihāro na bhavissati, athetaṃ kālañca
analyzed: ca pharissati gamana paccayā ca aññaḥ aphāsu vihāro na bhavissati atha etam kālañ ca
translated: and if there will be no other discomfort due to the going, then having considered that time

original: gamanakāraṇasamavāyasaṅkhātaṃ samayañca upadhāretvā appeva nāma svepi āgaccheyyāmāti.
analyzed: gamana kāraṇa samavāya saṅkhātam samayam ca upadhāretvā appā iva nāma svāḥ pi āgaccheyyāma iti
translated: and the occasion called the concurrence of the reason for going, perhaps I will come tomorrow.”

original: Khaṇoti okāso. Tathāgatuppādādiko hi maggabrahmacariyassa okāso tappaccayapaṭilābhahetuttā.
analyzed: okāsaḥ tathāgata uppāda ādikaḥ hi magga brahmacariyassa okāsaḥ tad paccaya paṭilābha hetu ttā
translated: “Moment” is opportunity. For the opportunity for the path and the life of purity is the obtaining of the conditions for them.

original: Khaṇo eva ca samayo. Yo “khaṇo”ti ca “samayo”ti ca vuccati, so ekovāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: khaṇaḥ eva ca samayaḥ yaḥ khaṇo ti ca samayo ti ca vuccati saḥ ekaḥ uva ati adhippāyo
translated: And the moment is the occasion. The intention is that the moment and the occasion that are called “moment” and “occasion” are one and the same.

original: Diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānaṃ uṇhasamayo. Vassānassa paṭhamo māso pariḷāhasamayo. Mahāsamayoti
analyzed: diyaḍḍhaḥ māso sesaḥ gimhānaṃ uṇha samayaḥ vassānassa paṭhamaḥ māso pariḷāha samayaḥ mahāsamayo ti
translated: Two and a half months remain of the hot season. The first month of the rainy season is the season of heat. The great season is the season of the rains.

original: mahāsamūho. Samāso vā esa, byāso vā. Pavuṭṭhaṃ vanaṃ pavanaṃ, tasmiṃ, kapilavatthusāmante
analyzed: mahā samūhaḥ samāsaḥ vā esa byāsaḥ vā pavuṭṭham vanam pavanam tasmim kapilavatthu sāmante
translated: A great wood. This is a compound word, or it is a disjoined word. A wood that is surrounded is a “vana” . In that, near the vicinity of Kapilavatthu,

original: mahāvanasaṅkhāte vanasaṇḍeti attho. Samayopi khoti ettha samayoti sikkhāpadapūraṇassa
analyzed: mahā vana saṅkhāte vana saṇḍe ti attho samayaḥ api kho ti ettha samayaḥ ti sikkhāpada pūraṇassa
translated: the meaning is that it is a forest grove called a “great wood.” The word “also” (pi) means that there is a reason for the fulfillment of the training rule.

original: hetu. Bhaddālīti tassa bhikkhussa nāmaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – tayā bhaddāli paṭivijjhitabbayuttakaṃ
analyzed: hetu bhaddālī iti tassa bhikkhussa nāmam idam vuttam hoti tayā bhaddāli paṭivijjhitabba yuttakam
translated: “Bhaddiya” is the name of that monk. This is what is said: “Bhaddiya, there is a reason that is suitable for you to penetrate,

original: ekaṃ kāraṇaṃ atthi, tampi te na paṭividdhaṃ na sallakkhitanti. Kiṃ taṃ kāraṇanti
analyzed: ekam kāraṇam atthi tat pi te na paṭividdham na sallakkhitan ti kim tam kāraṇam ti
translated: but that is not penetrated by you, not considered by you.” What is that reason?

original: āha “bhagavāpi kho”tiādi.
analyzed: āha bhagavān api kha uti ādi
translated: He said, “The Fortunate One also,” etc.

original: “Uggahamāno”tiādīsu mānoti tassa paribbājakassa pakatināmaṃ, kiñci kiñci pana sippaṃ
analyzed: uggaha māno ti ādīsu māno ti tassa paribbājakassa pakati nāmam kiñci kiñci pana sippam
translated: In the words “one who is learning,” etc., “mā” is the ordinary name of that wanderer. But because he is able to learn some craft or other,

original: uggahetuṃ samatthatāya “uggahamāno”ti naṃ sañjānanti, tasmā “uggahamāno”ti vuccati.
analyzed: uggahetum samattha tāya uggahamānaḥ iti nam sañjānanti tasmai uggahamānaḥ iti vuccati
translated: they know him as “one who is learning,” therefore he is called “one who is learning.”

original: Samaṇamuṇḍikassa putto samaṇamuṇḍikāputto. So kira devadattassa upaṭṭhāko. Samayaṃ
analyzed: samaṇa muṇḍikassa putto samaṇa muṇḍikā putto so kira devadattassa upaṭṭhāko samayam
translated: The son of the ascetic Muṇḍika is “Samaṇamuṇḍikāputta.” He was, it seems, a supporter of Devadatta. The word “time” (samaya)

original: diṭṭhiṃ pakārena vadanti etthāti samayappavādako, tasmiṃ, diṭṭhippavādaketi attho.
analyzed: diṭṭhim pakārena vadanti ettha ati samaya ppavādako tasmin diṭṭhi ppavādaka iti attho
translated: They proclaim their own doctrines there, thus it is a place for proclaiming doctrines. The meaning is: in that place for proclaiming doctrines.

original: Tasmiṃ kira ṭhāne caṅkītārukkhapokkharasātippabhūtayo brāhmaṇā, nigaṇṭhācelakaparibbājakādayo
analyzed: tasmim kira ṭhāne brāhmaṇāḥ nigaṇṭha ācelaka paribbājaka ādayaḥ
translated: It seems that in that place brahmans, naked ascetics, and wanderers of various kinds,

original: ca pabbajitā sannipatitvā attano attano samayaṃ pakārena vadanti kathenti dīpenti,🔽tasmā so ārāmo “samayappavādako”ti vuccati. Sveva tindukācīrasaṅkhātāya timbarūsakarukkhapantiyā
analyzed: ca pabbajitā sannipatitvā attanaḥ attanaḥ samayam pakārena vadanti kathenti dīpenti  tasmā saḥ ārāmaḥ samaya ppavādakaḥ ti vuccati su eva tindukā cīra saṅkhātāya timba rūsaka rukkha pantiyā
translated: having assembled in the monastery after wandering about in the surrounding country, proclaim their own doctrines, speak about them, and explain them.

original: parikkhittattā “tindukācīro”ti vuccati. Ekā sālā etthāti ekasālako. Yasmā panettha🔽paṭhamaṃ ekā sālā ahosi, pacchā pana mahāpuññaṃ poṭṭhapādaparibbājakaṃ nissāya bahū
analyzed: parikkhitta ttā tindukācīro ti vuccati ekā sālā ettha ati eka sālakaḥ yasmā pana ittha  paṭhamam ekā sālā ahosi pacchā pana mahā puññam poṭṭhapāda paribbājakam nissāya bahū
translated: Therefore the monastery is called “a place for proclaiming doctrines.” It is also called “the Tinduka-acira grove” because it is surrounded by a fence of tinduka and aciru trees.

original: sālā katā, tasmā tameva paṭhamaṃ kataṃ ekaṃ sālaṃ upādāya laddhapubbanāmavasena “ekasālako”ti
analyzed: sālā katā tasmā tam eva paṭhamam katam ekam sālam upādāya laddha pubba nāma vasena eka sālakā ti
translated: It has one hall, thus it is “the one hall.” But it is called “the one hall” because it was first built with one hall, and later, through the Elder Potthapada’s great merit, many halls were added.

original: vuccati. Mallikāya nāma pasenadirañño deviyā uyyānabhūto so pupphaphalasacchanno
analyzed: vuccati mallikāya nāma pasenadi raññaḥ deviyā uyyāna bhūto so puppha phala sacchanno
translated: It was a pleasure garden of Queen Mallika, the chief consort of King Pasenadi of Kosala. It was well supplied with flowers and fruits.

original: ārāmo, tena vuttaṃ “mallikāya ārāme”ti. Paṭivasatīti tasmiṃ phāsutāya vasati.🔽Diṭṭhe dhammeti paccakkhe attabhāve. Atthoti vuḍḍhi. Kammakilesavasena samparetabbato
analyzed: ārāmaḥ tena vuttam mallikāya ārāmeti paṭivasati iti tasmin phāsutāya vasati  diṭṭhe dhamme iti paccakkhe atta bhāve attho ti vuḍḍhi kamma kilesa vasena samparetabbato
translated: “Mallika’s park”: the park belonging to Mallika. “Dwells” : he lives there because it is peaceful.🔽“In this very life” : in the present existence. “Welfare” : prosperity.🔽“The next world” : the world beyond, because it is to be reached by kamma and defilements.

original: sammā pāpuṇitabbato samparāyo, paraloko, tattha niyutto samparāyiko, paralokattho.🔽Atthābhisamayāti yathāvuttaubhayatthasaṅkhātahitapaṭilābhā. Samparāyikopi hi attho
analyzed: sammā pāpuṇitabbataḥ samparāyaḥ para loko tattha niyuttaḥ samparāyikaḥ para loka attho  attha abhisamayā iti yathā vutta aubhayattha saṅkhāta hita paṭilābhā samparāyikaḥ api hi atthaḥ
translated: “The next world” is the world beyond, the world of the future, because it is to be reached by kamma and defilements.🔽“The attainment of welfare” : the attainment of the two kinds of welfare mentioned above.🔽For even the welfare of the next world is called “attained” because it is produced by a cause.

original: kāraṇassa nipphannattā paṭiladdho nāma hotīti taṃ atthadvayamekato katvā “atthābhisamayā”ti
analyzed: kāraṇassa nipphanna ttā paṭiladdhaḥ nāma hoti iti tam attha dvayam ekatas katvā attha abhisamayā ati
translated: Thus the two kinds of welfare are taken together and called “the attainment of welfare.”

original: vuttaṃ. Dhiyā paññāya taṃtadatthe rāti gaṇhāti, dhī vā paññā etassatthīti dhīro.
analyzed: vuttam dhiyā paññāya tat tat atthe rāti gaṇhāti dhī vā paññā etassa atthi iti dhīraḥ
translated: “With wisdom” : he takes up the various kinds of welfare with wisdom, with understanding. Or he is called wise because he has gone out from here with wisdom.

original: Paṇḍā vuccati paññā. Sā hi sukhumesupi atthesu paḍati gacchati, dukkhādīnaṃ vā pīḷanādiākāraṃ
analyzed: paṇḍā vuccati paññā sā hi su khumesu pi atthesu paḍati gacchati dukkha ādīnam vā pīḷana ādi ākāram
translated: “Understanding” is called wisdom. It is so called because it goes to subtle meanings, or because it knows the characteristics of suffering, etc.

original: jānātīti paṇḍā. Tāya ito gatoti paṇḍito. Atha vā itā sañjātā paṇḍā etassa, paḍati
analyzed: jānāti iti paṇḍā tāya itas gataḥ iti paṇḍitaḥ atha vā itā sañjātā paṇḍā etassa paḍati
translated: “Gone out from here” : he has gone out from this world.

original: vā ñāṇagatiyā gacchatīti paṇḍito. Sammā mānābhisamayāti mānassa sammā pahānena. Sammāti🔽cettha aggamaggañāṇena samucchedappahānaṃ vuttaṃ. Antanti avasānaṃ. Pīḷanaṃ taṃsamaṅgino🔽hiṃsanaṃ avipphāritākaraṇaṃ. Tadeva attho tathā ttha-kārassa ṭṭha-kāraṃ katvā. Samecca🔽paccayehi katabhāvo saṅkhataṭṭho. Dukkhadukkhatādivasena santāpanaṃ paridahanaṃ santāpaṭṭho.
analyzed: vā ñāṇa gatiyā gacchati iti paṇḍito sammā māna abhisamayā ati mānassa sammā pahānena sammā iti  ca ittha aggamagga ñāṇena samuccheda pahānam vuttam antam ti avasānam pīḷanam tad samaṅginaḥ  hiṃsanam a vipphārita akaraṇam tat eva tathā tthakārassa ṭṭhakāram katvā samet ca  paccayehi kata bhāvaḥ saṅkhata ṭṭhaḥ dukkha dukkha tā ādi vasena santāpanam paridahanam santāpa ṭṭhaḥ
translated: and he goes by the way of knowledge, he is wise. ‘Rightly he has penetrated conceit’: by rightly abandoning conceit. ‘Rightly’🔽here means the abandoning by cutting off with the knowledge of the path of arahatship. ‘End’ means end. ‘Oppression’ is the afflicting of those who are in association with it.🔽‘Afflicting’ is the non-abandoning of it. The meaning is the same as that of the word ‘affliction’. ‘Thus’ is the word ‘thus’ with the ‘t’ and ‘th’ transposed. ‘Having met’🔽means having made the state of being formed by conditions. ‘The state of being formed’ is the burning up, the consuming, by the suffering of suffering, etc.🔽

original: Jarāya, maraṇena cāti dvidhā vipariṇāmetabbo vipariṇāmaṭṭho. Abhisametabbo paṭivijjhitabbo🔽abhisamayaṭṭho, pīḷanādīniyeva. Tāni hi abhisametabbabhāvena ekībhāvamupanetvā “abhisamayaṭṭho”ti
analyzed: jarāya maraṇena ca ati dvidhā vipariṇāmetabbaḥ vipariṇāma ṭṭhaḥ abhisametabbaḥ paṭivijjhitabbaḥ  abhisamaya ṭṭhaḥ pīḷana ādīni eva tāni hi abhisametabba bhāvena ekībhāvam upanetvā abhisamaya ṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: and he goes by the way of knowledge, he is wise. The meaning of full understanding of conceit: by the full abandoning of conceit. Herein, by the knowledge of the path of arahatship the abandoning by cutting off is referred to. The end: the conclusion. Affliction: the afflicting of those who are in association with it. The meaning is the same as that of the word “affliction” with the “t” changed to “ṭ” . The meaning of the conditioned: the state of being made by conditions. The meaning of burning: the burning and scorching by the suffering of suffering, etc. The meaning of change: the state of being subject to change in the two ways of aging and death. The meaning of full understanding: what is to be penetrated by full understanding.

original: vuttāni. Abhisamayassa vā paṭivedhassa attho gocaro abhisamayaṭṭhoti tāniyeva tabbisaya-bhāvūpagamana-sāmaññato
analyzed: vuttāni abhisamayassa vā paṭivedhassa atthaḥ gocaraḥ abhisamaya ṭṭho ti tāniyā iva tad visaya bhāva upagamana sāmaññato
translated: The meaning of affliction, etc., is stated by way of their being brought together under the heading of what is to be fully understood. For these are called the meaning of full understanding because they are brought together under the heading of what is to be fully understood. Or alternatively, the meaning of full understanding is the province of penetration. The meaning of these is their being the province of that.

original: ekattena vuttāni. Ettha ca upasaggānaṃ jotakamattattā tassa tassa atthassa vācako
analyzed: ekattena vuttāni ettha ca upasaggānam tassa tassa atthassa vācakaḥ
translated: and they are stated by one . And here the word “occasion” is the name-giver for the meaning of each of the above because it is the mere indicator of the prefix .

original: samayasaddo evāti samayasaddassa atthuddhārepi saupasaggo abhisamayo vutto.
analyzed: samaya saddo eva ati samaya saddassa attha uddhāre pi sa upasaggaḥ abhisamayaḥ vutto
translated: So the “penetration” is said to be with prefix in the explanation of the meaning of the word “occasion.”

original: Tesu pana atthesu ayaṃ vacanattho – sahakārīkāraṇavasena sannijjhaṃ sameti samavetīti
analyzed: tesu pana atthesu ayam vacanatthaḥ sahakārī kāraṇa vasena sannijjham sameti samaveti iti
translated: And the word-meaning in these meanings is this: It is an occasion , a concurrence , in the sense of a co-operating cause, because it concurs , is concurrent ,

original: samayo, samavāyo. Sameti samāgacchati maggabrahmacariyamettha tadādhārapuggalavasenāti🔽samayo, khaṇo. Samenti ettha, etena vā saṃgacchanti dhammā, sattā vā sahajātādīhi,🔽uppādādīhi cāti samayo, kālo. Dhammappavattimattatāya hi atthato abhūtopi kālo dhammappavattiyā🔽adhikaraṇaṃ, karaṇaṃ viya ca parikappanāmattasiddhena rūpena voharīyati. Samaṃ, sammā
analyzed: samayaḥ samavāyo sameti samāgacchati magga brahmacariyam ettha tad ādhāra puggala vasena ati  samayaḥ khaṇaḥ samenti ettha etena vā saṃgacchanti dhammā sattāḥ vā sahajāta ādīhi  uppāda ādīhi ca ati samayaḥ kālaḥ dhamma ppavatti mattatāya hi atthataḥ abhūtaḥ api kālaḥ dhamma ppavattiyā  adhikaraṇam karaṇam viya ca parikappanā matta siddhena rūpena samam sammā
translated: It is an occasion , a moment , because the path and the life of purity concur , are concurrent , here in the person who is the basis for that.🔽It is an occasion , a time , because states or beings concur , are concurrent , here with the things beginning with arising or because they concur , are concurrent , with it.🔽For although as a meaning “time” is non-existent, it is nevertheless a footing for the occurrence of states, like a doing, and it is spoken of by means of a form consisting in mere supposition.

original: vā avayavānaṃ ayanaṃ pavatti avaṭṭhānanti samayo, samūho yathā “samudāyo”ti. Avayavānaṃ
analyzed: vā avayavānam ayanam pavatti avaṭṭhānam ti samayaḥ samūhaḥ yathā samudāyo iti avayavānam
translated: It is an occasion , a collection , because there is a going , a occurrence , of the components in a uniform way, without distinction.

original: sahāvaṭṭhānameva hi samūho, na pana avayavavinimutto samūho nāma koci paramatthato
analyzed: saha avaṭṭhānam eva hi samūhaḥ na pana avayava vinimuttaḥ samūhaḥ nāma koci paramatthato
translated: For a collection is just the co-presence of the components, but there is no such thing as a collection apart from the components in the ultimate sense.

original: atthi. Paccayantarasamāgame eti phalaṃ uppajjati, pavattati vā etasmāti samayo, hetu🔽yathā “samudayo”ti. So hi paccayantarasamāgamaneneva attano phalaṃ uppādaṭṭhitisamaṅgībhāvaṃ🔽karoti. Sameti saṃyojanabhāvato sambandho hutvā eti attano visaye pavattati, daḷhaggaṇabhāvato🔽vā taṃsaññuttā sattā ayanti etena yathābhinivesaṃ pavattantīti samayo, diṭṭhi. Diṭṭhisaṃyojanena
analyzed: atthi paccaya antara samāgame eti phalam uppajjati pavattati vā etasma ati samayaḥ hetu  yathā samudayaḥ ti saḥ hi paccaya antara samāgamanena iva attanaḥ phalam uppāda ṭṭhiti samaṅgībhāvam  karoti sameti saṃyojana bhāvataḥ sambandhaḥ hutvā eti attanaḥ visaye pavattati daḷhaggaṇa bhāvataḥ  vā sattāḥ ayanti etena yathā abhinivesam pavattanti iti samayaḥ diṭṭhi diṭṭhi saṃyojanena
translated: A condition is a cause that is a coming together of conditions. It is a cause in the sense of a coming together of conditions. It is a cause in the sense of a coming together of conditions because the fruit arises, occurs, or comes about through its coming together with the other conditions.
