original: ñāṇena sammā etabbo abhigantabboti abhisamayo, dhammānaṃ aviparīto sabhāvo. Abhimukhabhāvena
analyzed: ñāṇena sammā etabbaḥ abhigantabbaḥ ti abhisamayaḥ dhammānam aviparītaḥ sabhāvaḥ abhimukha bhāvena
translated: “It is the penetration, the right approach, by means of knowledge” : it is the penetration of the individual essences of states without perversion.

original: taṃ taṃ sabhāvaṃ sammā eti gacchati bujjhatīti abhisamayo, dhammānaṃ yathābhūtasabhāvāvabodho.
analyzed: tam tam sabhāvam sammā eti gacchati bujjhati iti abhisamayaḥ dhammānam yathā bhūta sabhāva avabodhaḥ
translated: “It is the right approach, the right going, the right awakening, by means of the face of the object” : it is the right understanding of the individual essences of states as they are.

original: Nanu ca atthamattaṃ yathādhippetaṃ pati saddā abhinivisantīti na ekena saddena aneke
analyzed: nanu ca attha mattam yathā adhippetam pati saddāḥ abhinivisanti iti na ekena saddena aneke
translated: But do not the sounds themselves settle down on the mere meaning as intended? So it is not by a single sound that many

original: atthā abhidhīyanti, atha kasmā idha samayasaddassa anekadhā attho vuttoti? Saccametaṃ🔽saddavisese apekkhite saddavisese hi apekkhite na ekena saddena anekatthābhidhānaṃ🔽sambhavati. Na hi yo kālādiattho samaya-saddo, soyeva samūhādiatthaṃ vadati. Ettha
analyzed: atthāḥ abhidhīyanti atha kasmai idha samaya saddassa anekadhā atthaḥ vuttaḥ iti saccam etam  sadda visese apekkhite sadda visese hi apekkhite na ekena saddena aneka attha abhidhānam  sambhavati na hi yaḥ kāla ādi attho samaya saddo samūha ādi attham vadati ettha
translated: meanings are expressed. Then why is the meaning of the word “occasion” stated here in many ways? That is true,🔽but when a particular sound is required, many meanings cannot be expressed by a single sound. For the meaning of “occasion” as time, etc., is not the same as the meaning of “occasion” as a collection, etc. Here

original: pana tesaṃ tesamatthānaṃ samayasaddavacanīyatāsāmaññamupādāya anekatthatā samaya-saddassa
analyzed: pana tesam tesam atthānam samaya sadda vacanīya tā sāmaññam upādāya aneka attha tā samaya saddassa
translated: the word “occasion” is said to have many meanings because of the similarity of the fact that all those meanings are expressible by the word “occasion.”

original: vuttāti. Evaṃ sabbattha atthuddhāre. Hoti cettha –
analyzed: vuttā iti evam sabbattha attha uddhāre hoti ca ittha
translated: This is the method of interpretation in all instances. And here it may be said:

original: “Sāmaññavacanīyataṃ, upādāya anekadhā;
analyzed: sāmaññavacanīya tam upādāya anekadhā
translated: “The word ‘time’ is used in many ways,🔽According to the meaning intended. The word is not the meaning;

original: Atthaṃ vade na hi saddo, eko nekatthako siyā”ti.🔽Samavāyādiatthānaṃ idha asambhavato, kālasseva ca apadisitabbattā “idha panassa kālo
analyzed: attham vade na hi saddaḥ ekaḥ na ikatthakaḥ siyāti  samavāya ādi atthānam idha asambhavataḥ kālassa iva ca apadisitabba ttā idha panassa kālo
translated: The meaning may be one, the word may be different.”🔽Since the meaning of ‘occasion’ is not possible here in the sense of ‘coming together,’ etc., and since it must be stated at the very outset, it is said: “Here the meaning of ‘occasion’ is time.”

original: attho”ti vuttaṃ. Desadesakādīnaṃ viya hi kālassa nidānabhāvena adhippetattā sopi
analyzed: atthaḥ ti vuttam desa desaka ādīnam viya hi kālassa nidāna bhāvena adhippeta ttā saḥ api
translated: For time is intended here as the nidāna in the same way as place, etc., are intended.

original: idha apadisīyati. ‘Iminā kīdisaṃ kālaṃ dīpetīti āha “tenā”tiādi. Tenāti kālatthena🔽samaya-saddena. Aḍḍhamāso pakkhavasena vutto, pubbaṇhādiko divasabhāgavasena, paṭhamayāmādiko
analyzed: idha apadisīyati iminā kīdisam kālam dīpeti iti āha tena atiādi tena ati kālatthena  samaya saddena aḍḍha māsaḥ pakkha vasena vuttaḥ pubbaṇha ādikaḥ divasa bhāga vasena paṭhama yāma ādikaḥ
translated: Therefore it is stated here. ‘What kind of time is indicated by this?’—to answer this he says ‘by the word occasion’ and so on.🔽By the word occasion, which has the meaning of time,🔽a fortnight is indicated in terms of the half-month, the morning, etc., in terms of the part of the day, the first watch, etc.,

original: pahāravasena. Ādi-saddena khaṇalayādayo saṅgahitā, aniyamitavasena ekaṃ kālaṃ dīpetīti attho.
analyzed: pahāra vasena ādi saddena khaṇa laya ādayo saṅgahitāḥ aniyamita vasena ekam kālam dīpeti iti attho
translated: in terms of the hour. The word ‘etc.’ includes the moment, the second, etc. The meaning is that an unspecified time is indicated.

original: Kasmā panettha aniyamitavasena kālo niddiṭṭho, na utusaṃvaccharādinā niyamitavasenāti
analyzed: kasmā pana ittha a niyamita vasena kālaḥ niddiṭṭhaḥ na utu saṃvacchara ādinā niyamita vasena ati
translated: But why is time stated here in an unspecified way, and not in a specified way such as ‘season,’ ‘year,’ etc.?

original: āha “tattha kiñcāpī”tiādi. Kiñcāpi paññāya viditaṃ suvavatthāpitaṃ, tathāpīti sambandho.
analyzed: āha tattha kiñcāpi itiādi kiñcā api paññāya viditam tathā api iti sambandho
translated: To answer this he says ‘although it is known by wisdom’ and so on. The construction is: although it is known by wisdom and well-defined, nevertheless.

original: Vacasā dhāretuṃ vā sayaṃ uddisituṃ vā parena uddisāpetuṃ vā na sakkā nānappakārabhāvato
analyzed: vacasā dhāretum vā sayam uddisitum vā parena uddisāpetum vā na sakkā nānā pakāra bhāvato
translated: It is not possible to remember it verbally or to recite it oneself or to get it recited by another, because of its many different aspects.🔽And it has to be said in many ways, because it has to be said as long as the division of time lasts.

original: bahu ca vattabbaṃ hoti yāva kālappabhedo, tāva vattabbattā. “Ekaṃ samaya”nti vutte
analyzed: bahu ca vattabbam hoti yāva kāla ppabhedaḥ tāva vattabbattā ekam samayam iti vutte
translated: But when it is said “at one time,”🔽it shows that there is no division of time here that is endless and unfathomable.

original: pana na so kālappabhedo atthi, yo etthānantogadho siyāti dasseti “ekeneva padena
analyzed: pana na so kāla ppabhedaḥ atthi yaḥ ettha ananta gadhaḥ siyā ti dasseti ekena iva padena
translated: “Having summarized that meaning in a single phrase” is what is meant.

original: tamatthaṃ samodhānetvā”ti iminā. Evaṃ lokiyasammatakālavasena samayatthaṃ dassetvā
analyzed: tam attham samodhānetvā ti iminā evam lokiya sammata kāla vasena samaya ttham dassetvā
translated: Having thus shown the meaning of “occasion” according to the time accepted in the world,

original: idāni sāsane pākaṭakālavasena samayatthaṃ dassetuṃ “ye vā ime”tiādi vuttaṃ. Apica
analyzed: idāni sāsane pākaṭa kāla vasena samaya ttham dassetum ye vā ime iti ādi vuttam api ca
translated: he now said “or whatever other occasions there are” in order to show the meaning of “occasion” according to the time that is evident in the Dispensation.🔽Moreover,

original: utusaṃvaccharādivasena niyamaṃ akatvā samayasaddassa vacane ayampi guṇo laddhoyevāti
analyzed: utu saṃvacchara ādi vasena niyamam a katvā samaya saddassa vacane ayam pi guṇaḥ laddhaḥ yā iva ati
translated: this quality is also obtained in the expression of the word “occasion” without specifying it by way of season, year, etc.

original: dassento “ye vā ime”tiādimāha. Sāmaññajotanā hi visese avatiṭṭhati tassā visesaparihāravisayattā.
analyzed: dassentaḥ ye vā ime iti ādim āha sāmañña jotanā hi visese avatiṭṭhati tassāḥ visesa parihāra visaya ttā
translated: Therefore, showing this, he said “or whatever other occasions there are.” For the indication of the general rule remains in the particular, because the particular is the province of the avoidance of the general rule.

original: Tattha ye ime samayāti sambandho. Bhagavato mātukucchiokkamanakālo cettha gabbhokkantisamayo.
analyzed: tattha ye ime samayā ati sambandhaḥ bhagavataḥ mātukucchi ukkamana kālo ca ittha gabbha ukkanti samayo
translated: Herein, the construction is: “whatever other occasions there are.” The occasion of the Blessed One’s descent from the Tusita heaven into his mother’s womb is the occasion of his conception.

original: Cattāri nimittāni passitvā saṃvejanakālo saṃvegasamayo. Chabbassāni sambodhisamadhigamāya🔽cariyakālo dukkarakārikasamayo. Devasikaṃ jhānaphalasamāpattīhi vītināmanakālo diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārasamayo,
analyzed: cattāri nimittāni passitvā saṃvejana kālaḥ saṃvega samayaḥ cha bassāni sambodhi samadhigamāya  cariya kālaḥ dukkara kārika samayaḥ devasikam jhāna phala samāpattīhi vītināmana kālaḥ diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra samayaḥ
translated: The time for being stirred to urgency is the time for urgency when he has seen the four kinds of evidence. The time for the practice is the time for the performance of the difficult practice for the attainment of enlightenment after six years. The time for abiding in bliss here and now is the time for the realization of the jhāna and fruition attainments by day and by night.

original: visesato pana sattasattāhāni jhānasamāpattivaḷañjanakālo. Pañcacattālīsavassāni taṃtaṃdhammadesanākālo
analyzed: visesataḥ pana satta satta ahāni jhāna samāpatti vaḷañjana kālo pañcacattālīsa vassāni taṃ taṃ dhamma desanā kālo
translated: And in particular the time for the development of the jhāna attainments is the time for the development of the jhāna attainments for seven days. The time for teaching the Dhamma is the time for teaching the Dhamma in the various ways for fifty-four years.

original: desanāsamayo. Ādi-saddena yamakapāṭihāriyasamayādayo saṅgaṇhāti. Pakāsāti dasasahassilokadhātupakampanaobhāsapātubhāvādīhi
analyzed: desanā samayaḥ ādi saddena yamaka pāṭihāriya samaya ādayo saṅgaṇhāti pakāsāti dasa sahassi lokadhātu pakampana obhāsa pātubhāva ādīhi
translated: The word “also” includes the time of the twin miracle, etc., as well. “Manifested”: manifested by the quaking, the lighting up, etc., of the ten-thousand world-element.

original: pākaṭā. “Ekaṃ samaya”nti vutte tadaññepi samayā santīti atthāpattito tesu samayesu
analyzed: pākaṭāḥ ekam samayanti vutte tad aññe pi samayāḥ santi iti attha āpattito tesu samayesu
translated: When it is said “at one time,” it is implied that there are other times as well. And among those times,

original: idha desanāsamayasaṅkhāto samayaviseso “ekaṃ samaya”nti vuttoti dīpetīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: idha desanā samaya saṅkhātaḥ samaya visesaḥ ekam samayanti vuttaḥ ti dīpeti iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: the time that is a particular time for teaching the Dhamma is what is called “one time” and is referred to by the words “at one time.” This is the meaning.

original: Yathāvuttappabhedesuyeva samayesu ekadesaṃ pakārantarehi saṅgahetvā dassetuṃ “yo
analyzed: yathāvutta ppabhedesu yā iva samayesu eka desam pakāra antarehi saṅgahetvā dassetum yaḥ
translated: The intention is to show that by combining one part of the various kinds of times mentioned above with other parts,

original: cāya”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha hi ñāṇakiccasamayo, attahitapaṭipattisamayo ca abhisambodhisamayoyeva.
analyzed: cāyanti ādi vuttam tattha hi ñāṇa kicca samayaḥ atta hita paṭipatti samayaḥ ca abhisambodhi samayaḥ yā iva
translated: and so on. Herein, the occasion for the knowledge-act and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to oneself are the same as the occasion of enlightenment.

original: Ariyatuṇhībhāvasamayo diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārasamayo. Karuṇākiccaparahitapaṭipattidhammikathāsamayo
analyzed: ariya tuṇhībhāva samayaḥ diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra samayaḥ karuṇā kicca para hita paṭipatti dhammikathā samayaḥ
translated: The occasion for the noble silence and the occasion for the pleasant abiding here and now are the same as the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to oneself. The occasion for the act of compassion and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to others and the occasion for the talk on the True Idea are the same as the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to others.

original: desanāsamayo, tasmā tesu vuttappabhedesu samayesu ekadesova pakārantarena dassitoti🔽daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Sannipatitānaṃ vo bhikkhave dvayaṃ karaṇīyaṃ dhammī kathā vā ariyo vā
analyzed: desanā samayaḥ tasmā tesu vutta ppabhedesu samayesu eka desaḥ uva pakāra antarena dassito ti  daṭṭhabbam sannipatitānam vaḥ bhikkhave dvayam karaṇīyam dhammī kathā vā ariyaḥ vā
translated: The occasion for the teaching is the same as the occasion for the talk on the True Idea. So it should be regarded as being shown in another way as one part out of the various kinds of occasion mentioned.

original: tuṇhībhāvo”ti vuttasamaye sandhāya “sannipatitānaṃ karaṇīyadvayasamayesū”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tuṇhībhāvaḥ ti vutta samaye sandhāya sannipatitānam karaṇīya dvaya samayesu iti vuttam
translated: “Bhikkhus, when you have met together two things should be done by you: talk on the True Idea or noble silence” . It is with reference to the occasion stated thus that it is said in the Paṭisambhidā “In the two kinds of occasion for what should be done by those who have met together” .

original: Tesupi samayesūti karuṇākiccaparahitapaṭipattidhammikathādesanāsamayesupi. Aññataraṃ🔽samayaṃ sandhāya “ekaṃ samaya”nti vuttaṃ atthato abhedattā.
analyzed: tesu pi samayesu iti karuṇā kicca para hita paṭipatti dhammi kathā desanā samayesu pi aññataram  samayam sandhāya ekam samaya nti vuttam atthataḥ abheda ttā
translated: In those occasions too: in the occasion for the act of compassion and the occasion for the practice of what is beneficial to others and the occasion for the talk on the True Idea and the occasion for the teaching.

original: Aññattha viya bhummavacanena ca karaṇavacanena ca niddesamakatvā idha upayogavacanena
analyzed: aññattha viya bhumma vacanena ca karaṇa vacanena ca niddesam a katvā idha upayoga vacanena
translated: With reference to one of these it is said “on one occasion” . The meaning is the same, but the locative case is used instead of the ablative case as elsewhere. And instead of stating the occasion by means of the locative case and the instrumental case as elsewhere, here it is stated by means of the ablative case.

original: niddesapayojanaṃ niddhāretukāmo parammukhena codanaṃ samuṭṭhapeti “kasmā panetthā”tiādinā.
analyzed: niddesa payojanam niddhāretu kāmo parammukhena codanam samuṭṭhapeti kasmā pana itthā atiādinā
translated: He who wishes to extract the purpose of the exposition raises the question by the opponent with “But why is it said here?”

original: Etthāti “ekaṃ samaya”nti imasmiṃ pade, karaṇavacanena niddeso kato yathāti sambandho.
analyzed: ettha iti ekam imasmin pade karaṇa vacanena niddeso kataḥ yathā iti sambandho
translated: Here means in this word “at one time,” the exposition is made by the instrumental case, thus is the connection.

original: Bhavanti etthāti bhummaṃ, okāso, tattha pavattaṃ vacanaṃ vibhatti bhummavacanaṃ.
analyzed: bhavanti ettha ati bhummam okāsaḥ tattha pavattam vacanam vibhatti bhummavacanam
translated: It is the locative case, the place, the speech occurring there is the locative speech.

original: Karoti kiriyamabhinipphādebhi etenāti karaṇaṃ, kiriyānipphattikāraṇaṃ. Upayujjitabbo
analyzed: karoti kiriyam abhinipphādebhi etena ati karaṇam kiriyā nipphatti kāraṇam upayujjitabbaḥ
translated: The instrument is that by which an action is brought about, the cause of the accomplishment of an action.

original: kiriyāyāti upayogo, kammaṃ, tattha vacanaṃ tathā. “Tatthā”tiādinā yathāvuttacodanaṃ
analyzed: kiriyāya iti upayogaḥ kammam tattha vacanam tathā tattha ati ādinā yathāvutta codanam
translated: The locative case is that which is to be used in an action, the verb, the speech there is so. “There” etc. he answers the question as stated.

original: pariharati. Tatthāti tesu abhidhammatadaññasuttapadavinayesu. Tathāti bhummavacanakaraṇavacanehi
analyzed: pariharati tattha ati tesu abhidhamma tad añña sutta pada vinayesu tathā ati bhumma vacana karaṇa vacanehi
translated: There means in those Abhidhamma, Sutta, and Vinaya texts. So means by the locative case and the instrumental case.

original: atthasambhavato cāti yojetabbaṃ, adhikaraṇabhāvenabhāvalakkhaṇatthānaṃ, hetukaraṇatthānañca
analyzed: attha sambhavataḥ ca ati yojetabbam adhikaraṇa bhāvenabhāva lakkhaṇa tthānam hetu karaṇa tthānam ca
translated: It should be connected with “because the meaning is possible,” the state of being a subject, the meaning of the characteristic of non-existence, and the meaning of the cause.

original: sambhavatoti attho. Idhāti idhasmiṃ suttapade. Aññathāti upayogavacanena. Atthasambhavatoti
analyzed: sambhavato ti atthaḥ idhā ti idhasmim sutta pade aññathā iti upayoga vacanena attha sambhavato ti
translated: the meaning is, ‘is possible.’ Here: in this sutta passage. Otherwise: by the word ‘occasion.’ It is possible:

original: accantasaṃyogatthassa sambhavato.
analyzed: ac c anta saṃyoga atthassa sambhavataḥ
translated: because the meaning of ‘extreme conjunction’ is possible.

original: “Tattha hī”tiādi tabbivaraṇaṃ. Itoti “ekaṃ samaya”nti suttapadato. Adhikaraṇatthoti
analyzed: tattha hi itiādi tad vivaraṇam itas ti ekam sutta padataḥ adhikaraṇa attho ti
translated: ‘For there’ is the explanation of that. From here: from the sutta passage ‘at one time.’ The meaning of ‘occasion’:

original: ādhārattho. Bhavanaṃ bhāvo, kiriyā, kiriyāya kiriyantaralakkhaṇaṃ bhāvenabhāvalakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: ādhāra atthaḥ bhavanam bhāvaḥ kiriyā kiriyāya kiriya antara lakkhaṇam bhāvenabhāva lakkhaṇam
translated: the meaning of ‘basis.’ Existence is a state, an action, a characteristic of another action in an action, a characteristic of a state in a state,

original: tadevattho tathā. Kena samayatthena idaṃ atthadvayaṃ sambhavatīti anuyoge sati tadatthadvayasambhavānurūpena
analyzed: tathā kena samaya tthena idam attha dvayam sambhavati iti anuyoge sati tad attha dvaya sambhava anurūpena
translated: that is the meaning, and so on. When there is the question ‘By what meaning of “occasion” is this pair of meanings possible? ‘ , then in accordance with the possibility of that pair of meanings,

original: samayatthena, taṃ daḷhaṃ karonto “adhikaraṇañhī”tiādimāha. Padatthatoyeva hi yathāvuttamatthadvayaṃ
analyzed: samaya tthena tam daḷham karontaḥ adhikaraṇam hi iti ādim āha padattha toyā iva hi yathā uttamattha dvayam
translated: by the meaning of ‘occasion’ he makes that firm, saying ‘For an occasion is a basis for the meaning of time and the meaning of a collection.’ For the pair of meanings stated thus is established only by the word ‘occasion,’

original: siddhaṃ, vibhatti pana jotakamattā. Tattha kālasaṅkhāto, kālasaddassa vā attho yassāti
analyzed: siddham vibhatti pana jotakamattā tattha kāla saṅkhātaḥ kāla saddassa vā atthaḥ yassa ati
translated: but the case-ending is merely an indicator. Herein, the meaning of ‘time’ is that which is called ‘time’ or the meaning of the word ‘time’;

original: kālattho. Samūhasaṅkhāto, ‘samūhasaddassa vā attho yassāti samūhattho, ko so? Samayo.
analyzed: kāla atthaḥ samūha saṅkhāto samūha saddassa vā atthaḥ yassa ati samūha atthaḥ kaḥ saḥ samayaḥ
translated: the meaning of ‘collection’ is that which is called ‘collection’ or the meaning of the word ‘collection.’ What is it? It is ‘occasion.’

original: Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – kālattho, samūhattho ca samayo tattha abhidhamme vuttānaṃ phassādidhammānaṃ🔽adhikaraṇaṃ ādhāroti, yasmiṃ kāle, dhammapuñje vā kāmāvacaraṃ kusalaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ
analyzed: idam vuttam hoti kāla atthaḥ samūha atthaḥ ca samayaḥ tattha abhidhamme vuttānam phassa ādi dhammānam  adhikaraṇam yasmin kāle dhamma puñje vā kāmāvacaram kusalam cittam uppannam
translated: What is meant is this: the time and the collection are the occasion in the sense of a basis for the states of contact, etc., which are given in the Abhidhamma as follows:🔽“When a profitable consciousness of the sense sphere has arisen in a given aggregate of existence,

original: hoti, tasmiṃyeva kāle, dhammapuñje vā phassādayopi hontīti ayañhi tattha attho. Nanu
analyzed: hoti tasmin yeva kāle dhamma puñje vā phassa ādayaḥ api honti iti ayam hi tattha atthaḥ nanu
translated: at that time, in that aggregate of existence, contact is a condition, by way of a condition qua object, for that profitable consciousness of the sense sphere, and that profitable consciousness of the sense sphere is a condition, by way of a condition qua object, for contact” .

original: cāyaṃ upādāpaññattimatto kālo, vohāramatto ca samūho, so kathaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ siyā
analyzed: ca ayam upādā paññatti mattaḥ kālaḥ vohāra mattaḥ ca samūho so katham adhikaraṇam siyā
translated: But is not time a mere designation based on clinging, and is not a collection a mere expression, so how can they be a basis for the states given in the Abhidhamma?

original: tattha vuttadhammānanti? Nāyaṃ doso. Yathā hi kālo sayaṃ paramatthato avijjamānopi🔽sabhāvadhammaparicchinnattā ādhārabhāvena paññāto, sabhāvadhammaparicchinno ca taṅkhaṇappavattānaṃ🔽tato pubbe, parato ca abhāvato “pubbaṇhejāto, sāyanhe āgacchatī”tiādīsu, samūho ca
analyzed: tattha vutta dhammānam ti na ayam dosaḥ yathā hi kālaḥ sayam paramatthataḥ a vijjamānaḥ api  sabhāva dhamma paricchinna ttā ādhāra bhāvena paññātaḥ sabhāva dhamma paricchinno ca taṅkhaṇa ppavattānam  tatas pubbe paratas ca abhāvataḥ pubbaṇhe jātaḥ sāyanhe āgacchati iti ādīsu samūhaḥ ca
translated: There is no fault here. For just as time, though itself non-existent in the ultimate sense,🔽is known as a basis since it is defined by states that exist in the ultimate sense, and is defined by states that exist in the ultimate sense in the sense that the states that occur at that time do not occur before or after,🔽as in the expressions “he was born in the morning” and “he will come in the evening,” so too a collection, though itself non-existent apart from its components,

original: avayavavinimutto visuṃ avijjamānopi kappanāmattasiddhattā avayavānaṃ ādhārabhāvena
analyzed: avayava vinimuttaḥ visum a vijjamānaḥ api kappanā matta siddha ttā avayavānam ādhāra bhāvena
translated: is known as a basis for the components since it is established as a mere concept.

original: paññāpīyati “rukkhe sākhā, yavarāsiyaṃ pattasambhūto”tiādīsu, evamidhāpi sabhāvadhammaparicchinnattā,🔽kappanāmattasiddhattā ca tadubhayaṃ tattha vuttadhammānaṃ adhikaraṇabhāvena paññāpīyatīti.
analyzed: paññāpīyati rukkhe sākhā yava rāsiyam patta sambhūtā ti ādīsu evam idha api sa bhāva dhamma paricchinna ttā  ca tat ubhayam tattha vutta dhammānam adhikaraṇa bhāvena paññāpīyati iti
translated: “Branch in a tree, leaf in a creeper” , and so on. So too here, because of the delimitation by the individual essence of the states, and because of the mere designation of the name “aggregate” as a collective one, both are designated as the “bases” of the states mentioned there.

original: “Khaṇasamavāyahetusaṅkhātassā”tiādi bhāvenabhāvalakkhaṇatthasambhavadassanaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: khaṇa samavāya hetu saṅkhātassa ati ādi bhāvena bhāva lakkhaṇa attha sambhava dassanam tattha
translated: “The basis is called the ‘moment’ and so on” is shown in order to point out the possibility of the characteristic of non-existence. Herein,

original: khaṇo nāma aṭṭhakkhaṇavinimutto navamo buddhuppādakkhaṇo, yāni vā panetāni “cattārimāni🔽bhikkhave, cakkāni, yehi samannāgatānaṃ devamussānaṃ catucakkaṃ pavattatī”ti ettha
analyzed: khaṇaḥ nāma aṭṭhakkhaṇa vinimuttaḥ navamaḥ buddhuppāda kkhaṇaḥ yāni vā pana itāni cattārimāni  bhikkhave cakkāni yehi samannāgatānam deva mussānam catu cakkam pavattati iti ettha
translated: the “moment” is the ninth moment of the arising of a Buddha, which is not included in the eight moments . Or the four “wheels” mentioned in the passage:🔽“Bhikkhus, there are four wheels. When these are present in a king’s wheel-turning monarch’s son, prince,🔽youth, and charioteer, he is called a wheel-turning monarch. What are the four?🔽Here, bhikkhus, a wheel-turning monarch, having been born of a noble family, rules over the earth to the shores of the ocean, by right and with a righteous rule. This is the first wheel of the wheel-turning monarch.🔽Again, bhikkhus, a wheel-turning monarch is of pure and perfect breed, of the true royal race, and no ground for censure of his birth can be found in him by any means. This is the second wheel of the wheel-turning monarch.🔽Again, bhikkhus, a wheel-turning monarch is handsome, comely, and graceful, possessing supreme beauty of complexion, and no man can be found equal to him in beauty, to say nothing of being superior. This is the third wheel of the wheel-turning monarch.

original: patirūpadesavāso sappurisūpanissayo attasammāpaṇīdhi pubbekatapuññatāti cattāri cakkāni
analyzed: patir upadesa vāsaḥ sappurisa upanissayaḥ atta sammāpaṇīdhi pubbekata puñña tā ati cattāri cakkāni
translated: Again, bhikkhus, a wheel-turning monarch is virtuous, of good character, and no criticism can be found in him on the grounds of virtue, to say nothing of gross misconduct. This is the fourth wheel of the wheel-turning monarch” .

original: vuttāni, tāni ekajjhaṃ katvā okāsaṭṭhena “khaṇo”ti veditabbāni. Tāni hi kusaluppattiyā
analyzed: vuttāni tāni ekajjham katvā okāsa ṭṭhena veditabbāni tāni hi kusala uppattiyā
translated: These should be understood as the “moment” in the sense of opportunity for the arising of the profitable.

original: okāsabhūtāni. Samavāyo nāma “cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇa”ntiādinā🔽niddiṭṭhā cakkhuviññāṇādisādhāraṇaphalanipphādakattena saṇṭhitā cakkhurūpādipaccayasāmaggī.
analyzed: okāsa bhūtāni samavāyaḥ nāma cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇa nti ādinā  niddiṭṭhā cakkhu viññāṇa ādi sādhāraṇa phala nipphādaka ttena saṇṭhitā cakkhu rūpa ādi paccaya sāmaggī
translated: and the conditions are the eye, etc., which are the bases for the arising of the eye-consciousness, etc. The conjunction is the concurrence of the eye, visible data, etc., which is the condition for the arising of the eye-consciousness, etc., and which is the state of proximity of the eye, visible data, etc., as the common cause for the production of the eye-consciousness, etc., as stated in the passage: “Dependent on eye and visible data eye-consciousness arises” .

original: Cakkhurūpādīnañhi cakkhuviññāṇādi sādhāraṇaphalaṃ. Hetu nāma yonisomanasikārādijanakahetu.
analyzed: cakkhu rūpa ādīnam hi cakkhu viññāṇa ādi sādhāraṇa phalam hetu nāma yoniso manasikāra ādi janaka hetu
translated: For the eye, visible data, etc., are the common cause for the production of the eye-consciousness, etc. The cause is the cause that generates, such as proper attention, etc.

original: Yathāvuttassa khaṇasaṅkhātassa, samavāyasaṅkhātassa, hetusaṅkhātassa ca samayassa🔽sattāsaṅkhātena bhāvena tesaṃ phassādīnaṃ dhammānaṃ sattāsaṅkhāto bhāvo lakkhīyati
analyzed: yathā vuttassa khaṇa saṅkhātassa samavāya saṅkhātassa hetu saṅkhātassa ca samayassa  sattā asaṅkhātena bhāvena tesam phassa ādīnam dhammānam sattā asaṅkhātaḥ bhāvaḥ lakkhīyati
translated: The state of being of the states called moment, conjunction, and cause is indicated by the state of being of the states called contact, etc.,

original: viññāyatīti attho. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yathā “gāvīsu duyhamānāsu gato, duddhāsu āgato”ti🔽ettha dohanakiriyāya gamanakiriyā lakkhīyati, evamidhāpi yathāvuttassa samayassa
analyzed: viññāyati iti attho idam vuttam hoti yathā gāvīsu duyhamānāsu gataḥ duddhāsu āgataḥ ti  ettha dohana kiriyāya gamana kiriyā lakkhīyati evam idha api yathā vuttassa samayassa
translated: which are the states of being of the states of consciousness, etc., that are the fruit of the states called moment, conjunction, and cause. The meaning is that they are known. This is what is said: just as in the passage, “When the cows were being milked he went; when they were milked he came” ,

original: sattākiriyāya cittassa uppādakiriyā, phassādīnaṃ bhavanakiriyā ca lakkhīyatīti. Nanu
analyzed: sattā kiriyāya cittassa uppāda kiriyā phassa ādīnam bhavana kiriyā ca lakkhīyati iti nanu
translated: the act of going is indicated by the act of milking, so too here the act of arising of consciousness, and the act of being of contact, etc., are indicated by the act of being of the states called moment, conjunction, and cause, respectively.

original: cettha sattākiriyā avijjamānāva, kathaṃ tāya lakkhīyatīti? Saccaṃ, tathāpi “yasmiṃ🔽samaye”ti ca vutte satīti ayamattho viññāyamāno evahoti aññakiriyāsambandhābhāve
analyzed: ca ittha sattā kiriyā a vijjamānā ava katham tāya lakkhīyati iti saccam tathā api yasmin  samaya iti ca vutte sati iti ayam attho viññāyamānaḥ añña kiriyā sambandha abhāve
translated: But since the state of being is not present here, how can it be indicated by that? —It is true that it is not present, but still the meaning of “being” is understood when the words “at that time” are said, because the meaning of the words is not devoid of the state of being, since there is no connection with another state of being.

original: padatthassa sattāvirahābhāvato, tasmā atthato gamyamānāya tāya sattākiriyāya lakkhīyatīti.🔽Ayañhi tattha attho – yasmiṃ yathāvutte khaṇe, paccayasamavāye, hetumhi vā sati kāmāvacaraṃ🔽kusalaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, tasmiṃyeva khaṇe, paccayasamavāye, hetumhi vā sati
analyzed: padatthassa sattā viraha abhāvataḥ tasmai atthataḥ gamyamānāya tāya sattā kiriyāya lakkhīyati iti  ayam hi tattha atthaḥ yasmin yathā vutte khaṇe paccaya samavāye hetumhi vā sati kāmāvacaram  kusalam cittam uppannam hoti tasmiṃ yeva khaṇe paccaya samavāye hetumhi vā sati
translated: So it is indicated by the state of being, which is understood as the meaning.

original: phassādayopi hontīti. Ayaṃ pana attho abhidhammeyeva nidassanavasena vutto, yathārahamesa
analyzed: phassa ādayaḥ api honti iti ayam pana atthaḥ abhidhammeya iva nidassana vasena vuttaḥ yathāraham esa
translated: For this is the meaning here: “At the time, at the conjunction of conditions, or at the moment of the cause, when a profitable consciousness belonging to the sense sphere has arisen, at that same time, at that conjunction of conditions, or at that moment of the cause, contact, etc., are also present.” But this meaning is stated by way of showing the demonstration in the Abhidhamma. The method should be applied in other sutta passages as appropriate.

original: nayo aññesupi suttapadesūti. Tasmāti adhikaraṇatthassa, bhāvenabhāvalakkhaṇatthassa
analyzed: nayaḥ aññesu pi sutta padesu iti tasmā ati adhikaraṇa atthassa bhāvena bhāva lakkhaṇa tthassa
translated: “Because”: because the meaning of the state of being and the meaning of the function are possible.

original: ca sambhavato. Tadatthajotanatthanti tadubhayatthassa samayasaddatthabhāvena vijjamānasseva
analyzed: ca sambhavataḥ tad attha jotana ttham ti tad ubhaya tthassa samaya saddattha bhāvena vijjamānassa iva
translated: “For the purpose of illuminating that meaning”: for the purpose of illuminating the meaning of both of those, which is the meaning of the word “occasion,” which is present.

original: bhummavacanavasena dīpanatthaṃ. Vibhattiyo hi padīpo viya vatthuno vijjamānasseva
analyzed: bhumma vacana vasena dīpana attham vibhattiyaḥ hi padīpaḥ viya vatthunaḥ vijjamānassa iva
translated: and the meaning of the words is shown by the words of the text. For the case endings are like a lamp for the meaning that exists in the word,

original: atthassa jotakāti, ayamattho saddasatthesu pākaṭoyeva.🔽Hetuattho, karaṇattho ca sambhavatīti “annena vasati, vijjāya vasatī”tiādīsu viya
analyzed: atthassa jotakā ti ayam atthaḥ sadda satthesu  hetu attho karaṇa attho ca sambhavati iti annena vasati vijjāya vasati itiādīsu
translated: since they illuminate it. This meaning is clear in the treatises on grammar.🔽The meaning of cause and the meaning of instrument are possible. As in the case of “He lives by almsfood,” “He lives by knowledge,”

original: hetuattho, “pharasunā chindati, kudālena khaṇatī”tiādīsu viya karaṇattho ca sambhavati.
analyzed: hetu atthaḥ pharasunā chindati kudālena khaṇati iti ādīsu viya karaṇa atthaḥ ca sambhavati
translated: the meaning of cause is possible. As in the case of “He cuts with an axe,” “He digs with a spade,”

original: Kathaṃ pana sambhavatīti āha “yo hi so”tiādi. Vinaye āgatasikkhāpadapaññattiyācanavatthuvasena
analyzed: katham pana sambhavati iti āha yaḥ hi saḥ ti ādi vinaye āgata sikkhāpada paññatti yācana vatthu vasena
translated: the meaning of instrument is possible. But how is it possible? He said “For that which is” and so on. In the Vinaya, the subject of the request for the announcement of the training rule that has occurred

original: theraṃ mariyādaṃ katvā “sāriputtādīhipi duviññeyyo”ti vuttaṃ. Tena samayena hetubhūtena
analyzed: theram mariyādam katvā sāriputta ādīhi pi du viññeyyaḥ ti vuttam tena samayena hetu bhūtena
translated: having made a limit for the Elder, it is said “It is to be known by two” beginning with Sāriputta. At that time, by that which is the cause

original: karaṇabhūtenāti ettha pana taṃtaṃvatthuvītikkamova sikkhāpadapaññattiyā hetu ceva
analyzed: karaṇa bhūtena āti ettha pana taṃ taṃ vatthu vītikkamaḥ u sikkhāpada paññattiyāḥ hetu ca iva
translated: by that which is the instrument. But here, the transgression of that and that subject is both the cause and the instrument for the announcement of the training rule.

original: karaṇañca. Tathā hi yadā bhagavā sikkhāpadapaññattiyā paṭhamameva tesaṃ tesaṃ tattha
analyzed: karaṇam ca tathā hi yadā bhagavā sikkhāpada paññattiyā paṭhamam eva tesam tesam tattha
translated: For thus, when the Blessed One first of all in that and that place

original: tattha sikkhāpadapaññattihetubhūtaṃ taṃ taṃ vītikkamaṃ apekkhamāno viharati, tadā
analyzed: tattha sikkhāpada paññatti hetu bhūtam tam tam vītikkamam apekkhamānaḥ viharati tadā
translated: He lives looking for the transgression that is the reason for the laying down of training rules.

original: taṃ taṃ vītikkamaṃ apekkhitvā tadatthaṃ vasatīti siddho vatthuvītikkamassa sikkhāpadapaññattihetubhāvo
analyzed: tam tam vītikkamam apekkhitvā tad attham vasati iti siddhaḥ vatthu vītikkamassa sikkhāpada paññatti hetu bhāvaḥ
translated: Then, looking for the transgression, he lives for the sake of that. So the laying down of training rules has the transgression of the basis as its reason.

original: “annenavasatī”tiādīsu annamapekkhitvā tadatthaṃ vasatītiādinā kāraṇena annādīnaṃ
analyzed: annena vasati iti ādīsu annam apekkhitvā tad attham vasati iti ādinā kāraṇena anna ādīnam
translated: In the case of “he lives not looking for food,” etc., the reason is that he lives for the sake of that, not looking for food, etc.

original: hetubhāvo viya. Sikkhāpadapaññattikāle pana teneva pubbasiddhena vītikkamena sikkhāpadaṃ
analyzed: hetu bhāvaḥ viya sikkhāpada paññatti kāle pana tena iva pubba siddhena vītikkamena sikkhāpadam
translated: So food, etc., have the nature of a reason. But at the time of the laying down of the training rules, the training rule is laid down because of that same previously established transgression.

original: paññapeti, tasmā sikkhāpadapaññattiyā sādhakatamattā karaṇabhāvopi vītikkamasseva
analyzed: paññapeti tasmā sikkhāpada paññattiyā sādhakatama ttā karaṇa bhāvaḥ api vītikkamassa iva
translated: Therefore, since it is only the laying down of the training rules that establishes it, the nature of instrument also belongs to the transgression.

original: siddho “asinā chindatī”tiādīsu asinā chindanakiriyaṃ sādhetītiādinā kāraṇena asiādīnaṃ🔽karaṇabhāvo viya. Evaṃ santepi vītikkamaṃ apekkhamāno teneva saddhiṃ tannissitampi
analyzed: siddhaḥ asinā chindati itiādīsu asinā chindana kiriyam sādha iti itiādinā kāraṇena  karaṇa bhāvaḥ viya evam sante pi vītikkamam apekkhamāno tena iva saddhim tad nissitam pi
translated: In the case of “he cuts with a knife,” etc., the reason is that the action of cutting with a knife, etc., is established.🔽So the knife, etc., have the nature of an instrument. Even so, since he lives looking for the transgression, he lives looking for the time that is dependent on that. So time also has the nature of a reason here.

original: kālaṃ apekkhitvā viharatīti kālassāpi idha hetubhāvo vutto, sikkhāpadaṃ paññapento
analyzed: kālam apekkhitvā viharati iti kālassa api idha hetu bhāvaḥ vutto sikkhāpadam paññapento
translated: When he lays down the training rule,

original: ca taṃ taṃ vītikkamakālaṃ anatikkamitvā teneva kālena sikkhāpadaṃ paññapetīti vītikkamanissayassa
analyzed: ca tam tam vītikkama kālam an atikkamitvā tena iva kālena sikkhāpadam paññapeti iti vītikkama nissayassa
translated: and he lays down the training rule at that very time without exceeding the time for the transgression. Thus the time for the transgression is said to be the means.

original: kālassāpi karaṇabhāvo vutto, tasmā iminā pariyāyena kālassāpi hetubhāvo, karaṇabhāvo🔽ca labbhatīti vuttaṃ “tena samayena hetubhūtena karaṇabhūtenā”ti, nippariyāyena pana🔽vītikkamoyeva hetubhūto, karaṇabhūto ca. So hi vītikkamakkhaṇe hetu hutvā pacchā
analyzed: kālassa api karaṇa bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ tasmai iminā pariyāyena kālassa api hetu bhāvaḥ karaṇa bhāvo  ca labbhati iti vuttam tena samayena hetu bhūtena karaṇa bhūtena ati nippariyāyena pana  hetu bhūto karaṇa bhūto ca saḥ hi vītikkama khaṇe hetu hutvā pacchā
translated: Therefore it is said that the time is both the cause and the means. But in the true sense,

original: sikkhāpadapaññāpanakkhaṇe karaṇampi hotīti. Sikkhāpadāni paññāpayantoti vītikkamaṃ
analyzed: sikkhāpada paññāpana khaṇe karaṇam pi hoti iti sikkhāpadāni paññāpayanto ti vītikkamam
translated: the transgression is both the cause and the means. For at the time of the transgression it is the cause, and afterwards, at the time of the laying down of the training rule, it is the means.

original: pucchitvā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā otiṇṇavatthuṃ taṃ puggalaṃ paṭipucchitvā,
analyzed: pucchitvā bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā otiṇṇa vatthum tam puggalam paṭipucchitvā
translated: ‘Laying down the training rules’: after asking about the transgression, he gathers together the Sangha of monks, and he questions the person who has committed the offense about the action that he has committed.

original: vigarahitvā ca taṃ taṃ vatthuotiṇṇakālaṃ anatikkamitvā teneva kālena karaṇabhūtena
analyzed: vigarahitvā ca tam tam vatthu utiṇṇa kālam an atikkamitvā tena iva kālena karaṇa bhūtena
translated: After criticizing him, he lays down the training rules at that very time without exceeding the time for the action that has been committed.

original: sikkhāpadāni paññapento. Sikkhāpadapaññattihetuñca apekkhamānoti tatiyapārājikādīsu
analyzed: sikkhāpadāni paññapento sikkhāpada paññatti hetuñca apekkhamāno ti tatiya pārājika ādīsu
translated: ‘And he has regard to the cause for the laying down of the training rules’: in the case of the third offense entailing expulsion and so on,

original: viya sikkhāpadapaññattiyā hetubhūtaṃ taṃ taṃ vatthuvītikkamasamayaṃ apekkhamāno tena
analyzed: viya sikkhāpada paññattiyāḥ hetu bhūtam tam tam vatthu vītikkama samayam apekkhamāno tena
translated: The Blessed One, looking for the time of the transgression of the various bases that were the cause for the announcement of the training precepts,

original: samayena hetubhūtena bhagavā tattha tattha vihāsīti attho.
analyzed: samayena hetu bhūtena bhagavā tattha tattha vihāsi iti attho
translated: dwelt there at that time, which was the cause.

original: “Sikkhāpadāni paññāpayanto, sikkhāpadapaññattihetuñca apekkhamāno”ti idaṃ yathākkamaṃ🔽karaṇabhāvassa, hetubhāvassa ca samatthanavacanaṃ, tasmā tadanurūpaṃ “tenasamayena
analyzed: sikkhāpadāni paññāpayantaḥ sikkhāpada paññatti hetuñca apekkhamāno ti idam yathākkamam  karaṇa bhāvassa hetu bhāvassa ca samatthana vacanam tasmai tad anurūpam tena samayena
translated: “Announcing the training precepts and looking for the cause for the announcement of the training precepts” is the statement of the equality of the state of doing and the state of being the cause.🔽Therefore, although it should be said in accordance with that, “at that time,

original: karaṇabhūtena hetubhūtenā”ti evaṃ vattabbepi paṭhamaṃ “hetubhūtenā”ti uppaṭipāṭivacanaṃ
analyzed: karaṇa bhūtena hetu bhūtena ati evam vattabbe pi paṭhamam hetu bhūtena ati uppaṭi pāṭi vacanam
translated: by the state of being the cause, by the state of being the reason,” the statement in the reverse order

original: tattha hetubhāvassa sātisayamadhippetattā vuttanti veditabbaṃ. “Bhagavā hi verañjāyaṃ
analyzed: tattha hetu bhāvassa sa atisayam adhippeta ttā vuttan ti veditabbam bhagavā hi verañjāyam
translated: should be known as being made because the state of being the cause is excessively indicated there. “For the Blessed One,

original: viharanto dhammasenāpatittherassa sikkhāpadapaññattiyācanahetubhūtaṃ parivitakkasamayaṃ
analyzed: viharantaḥ dhammasenāpati therassa sikkhāpada paññatti yācana hetu bhūtam parivitakka samayam
translated: while dwelling at Verañjā, looking for the time of the reflection that was the cause for the Elder Dhamma-sena’s request for the announcement of the training precepts,

original: apekkhamāno tena samayena hetubhūtena vihāsī”ti tīsupi kira gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ.
analyzed: apekkhamānaḥ tena samayena hetu bhūtena vihāsi iti tīsu pi kira gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam
translated: dwelt there at that time, which was the cause.” It is said in all three key passages.

original: “Kiṃ panettha yutticintāya, ācariyassa idha kamavacanicchā natthīti evametaṃ gahetabbaṃ🔽– aññāsupi hi aṭṭhakathāsu ayameva anukkamo vutto, na ca tāsu ‘tena samayena verañjāyaṃ
analyzed: kim pana ittha yutti cintāya ācariyassa idha kama vacana icchā natthi iti evam etam gahetabbam  aññāsu pi hi aṭṭhakathāsu ayam eva anukkamaḥ vuttaḥ na ca tāsu tena samayena verañjāyam
translated: “What is the use of reasoning here? The teacher’s wish is not to be gainsaid.

original: viharatī’ti vinayapāḷipade hetuatthasseva sātisayaṃ adhippetabhāvadīpanatthaṃ vutto
analyzed: viharati iti vinaya pāḷi pade hetu atthassa iva sa atisayam adhippeta bhāva dīpana attham vuttaḥ
translated: For this is the order in the other commentaries too, and in them the words ‘at that time in Verañjā’ are not stated in order to show that the reason is the only meaning that can be ascribed to the words of the Vinaya Piṭaka.

original: avisayattā, sikkhāpadāni paññāpayanto hetubhūtena, karaṇabhūtena ca samayena vihāsi,🔽sikkhāpadapaññattihetuñca apekkhamāno hetubhūtena samayena vihāsīti evamettha yathālābhaṃ🔽sambandhabhāvato evaṃ vutto”tipi vadanti. Tasmāti yathāvuttassa duvidhassāpi atthassa
analyzed: a visaya ttā sikkhāpadāni paññāpayantaḥ hetu bhūtena karaṇa bhūtena ca samayena vihāsi  sikkhāpada paññatti hetuñca apekkhamānaḥ hetu bhūtena samayena vihāsi iti evam ettha yathālābham  sambandha bhāvataḥ evam vuttaḥ iti pi vadanti tasmā ti yathā vuttassa duvidhassa api atthassa
translated: They are not the province of the Vinaya Piṭaka. He lived at the time which was the reason and the instrument for the laying down of the training precepts.🔽He lived at the time which was the reason, looking for the reason for the laying down of the training precepts. Thus it is stated in this way according to the available connection.”🔽So they say. Therefore: because of the possibility of the aforesaid twofold meaning;

original: sambhavato. Tadatthajotanatthanti vuttanayena karaṇavacanena tadubhayatthassa jotanatthaṃ.
analyzed: sambhavataḥ tad attha jotana attham ti vutta nayena karaṇa vacanena tad ubhaya tthassa jotana attham
translated: for the purpose of showing that meaning: for the purpose of showing that twofold meaning by the instrumental case in the way stated.

original: Tatthāti tasmiṃ vinaye. Ettha ca sikkhāpadapaññattiyā eva vītikkamasamayassa sādhakatamattā
analyzed: tattha ati tasmin vinaye ettha ca sikkhāpada paññattiyāḥ eva vītikkama samayassa sādhakatama ttā
translated: Herein, in this Discipline. And here the function of the time of transgression is simply to make it possible for the announcement of the training precept to be made.

original: tassa karaṇabhāve “sikkhāpadāni paññāpayanto”ti ajjhāharitapadena sambandho, hetubhāve
analyzed: tassa karaṇa bhāve sikkhāpadāni paññāpayanto ti ajjhāharita padena sambandhaḥ hetu bhāve
translated: So the connection is with the phrase “announcing the training precepts” in the sense of instrumentality. But in the sense of cause

original: pana tadapekkhanamattattā “viharatī”ti padenevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tathāyeva hi vuttaṃ
analyzed: pana tad apekkhana matta ttā viharati iti padena iva ati daṭṭhabbam tathāya iva hi vuttam
translated: it is only a condition, and so it should be regarded as connected by the phrase “lived on”. For that is how it is expressed:

original: “tena samayena hetubhūtena, karaṇabhūtena ca sikkhāpadāni paññāpayanto, sikkhāpadapaññattihetuñca
analyzed: tena samayena hetu bhūtena karaṇa bhūtena ca sikkhāpadāni paññāpayantaḥ sikkhāpada paññatti hetuṃ ca
translated: “At that time the Blessed One, by means of the cause, which was the instrumentality, and by means of the instrumentality, which was the cause, announced the training precepts,

original: apekkhamāno bhagavā tattha tattha vihāsī”ti. Karaṇañhi kiriyatthaṃ, na hetu viya
analyzed: apekkhamānaḥ bhagavā tattha tattha vihāsi iti karaṇam hi kiriya attham na hetu
translated: and the Blessed One lived there and there, looking for the cause for the announcement of the training precepts.”🔽For the instrument is the meaning of action, not the cause of the action as the cause is.

original: kiriyākāraṇaṃ. Hetu pana kiriyākāraṇaṃ, na karaṇaṃ viya kiriyatthoti.🔽“Idha panā”tiādinā upayogavacanassa accantasaṃyogatthasambhavadassanaṃ, accantameva
analyzed: kiriyā kāraṇam hetu pana kiriyā kāraṇam na karaṇam viya  idha pana ati ādinā upayoga vacanassa accanta saṃyoga ttha sambhava dassanam
translated: But the cause is the cause of the action, not the meaning of the action as the instrument is.

original: dabbaguṇakiriyāhi saṃyogo accantasaṃyogo, nirantarameva tehi saṃyuttabhāvoti vuttaṃ
analyzed: dabba guṇa kiriyāhi saṃyogaḥ accanta saṃyogaḥ nirantaram eva tehi saṃyutta bhāvaḥ ti vuttam
translated: “Here, however, the phrase ‘in this case’ shows that the expression ‘used’ can have the meaning of complete conjunction. Complete conjunction is the complete conjunction with the qualities of burning, etc.; the state of being uninterruptedly connected with them is what is meant.

original: hoti. Soyevattho tathā. Evaṃjātiketi evaṃsabhāve. Kathaṃ sambhavatīti āha “yañhī”tiādi.
analyzed: tathā evaṃjātikā iti evam sabhāve katham sambhavati iti āha yat hi itiādi
translated: and so on. The meaning is the same. “Of that kind” : of that nature. “How does it come about?” He says: “For what reason” and so on.

original: Accantamevāti ārabbhato paṭṭhāya yāva desanāniṭṭhānaṃ, tāva ekaṃsameva, nirantaramevāti🔽attho. Karuṇāvihārenāti parahitapaṭipattisaṅkhātena karuṇāvihārena. Tathā hi karuṇānidānattā
analyzed: accantam eva ati ārabbhataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva desanā niṭṭhānam tāva ekaṃsam eva nirantaram eva ati  attho karuṇā vihārena ati para hita paṭipatti saṅkhātena karuṇā vihārena tathā hi karuṇā nidāna ttā
translated: “Without a break” : from the beginning of the sutta up to the end of the teaching, it is the same, without a break. This is the meaning.🔽“By the practice of compassion” : by the practice of compassion called the performance of benefit for others. For the teaching here is called “the practice of compassion” because it is the cause of compassion,

original: desanāya idha parahitapaṭipatti “karuṇāvihāro”ti vuttā, na pana karuṇāsamāpattivihāro.
analyzed: desanāya idha para hita paṭipatti karuṇā vihāraḥ ti vuttā na pana karuṇā samāpatti vihāro
translated: not because it is the practice of the meditation on compassion.

original: Na hi desanākāle desetabbadhammavisayassa desanāñāṇassa sattavisayāya mahākaruṇāya🔽sahuppatti sambhavati bhinnavisayattā, tasmā karuṇāya pavatto vihāroti katvā parahitapaṭipattivihāro
analyzed: na hi desanā kāle desetabba dhamma visayassa desanā ñāṇassa satta visayāya mahā karuṇāya  sahuppatti sambhavati bhinna visaya ttā tasmā karuṇāya pavatto vihāro ti katvā para hita paṭipatti vihāro
translated: For at the time of teaching, the knowledge of the teaching which has as its domain the Dhamma to be taught, and the great compassion which has as its domain the living beings,🔽cannot occur together, because they have different domains. Therefore, the practice of benefit for others should be understood here as “the practice of compassion” in the sense that it is the practice which occurs through compassion.

original: idha “karuṇāvihāro”ti veditabbo. Tasmāti accantasaṃyogatthasambhavato. Tadatthajotanatthanti
analyzed: idha karuṇā vihāraḥ ti veditabbo tasmā ati tad attha jotana ttham
translated: “For that reason” : because it is possible to have the meaning of “without a break.” “For the purpose of illuminating that meaning” :

original: vuttanayena upayogavibhattiyā tadatthassa jotanatthaṃ upayoganiddeso kato yathā “māsaṃ
analyzed: vutta nayena upayoga vibhattiyā tad atthassa jotana attham upayoga niddeso kataḥ yathā māsam
translated: The expression of the function is made in order to show the meaning of that by the instrumental case-ending in the way stated, just as in the passage, “He prepares for a month, he eats for a day.”

original: sajjhāyati, divasaṃ bhuñjatī”ti. Tenāti yena kāraṇena abhidhamme, ito aññesu ca suttapadesu🔽bhummavacanassa adhikaraṇattho, bhāvenabhāvalakkhaṇattho ca, vinaye karaṇavacanassa
analyzed: divasam bhuñjati iti tena ati yena kāraṇena abhidhamme itas aññesu ca sutta padesu  bhumma vacanassa adhikaraṇa tthaḥ bhāvena bhāva lakkhaṇa tthaḥ ca vinaye karaṇa vacanassa
translated: “By that”: by that reason by which the meaning of the locative case-ending in the Abhidhamma and in other sutta passages🔽is the meaning of the objective, and the meaning of the characteristic of the state of non-existence, and in the Vinaya the meaning of the instrumental case-ending

original: hetuattho, karaṇattho ca idha upayogavacanassa accantasaṃyogattho sambhavati, tenāti
analyzed: hetu attho karaṇa ttho ca idha upayoga vacanassa sambhavati tena ati
translated: is the meaning of the cause, and the meaning of the instrument, here the meaning of the expression of the function is the meaning of the utmost conjunction.

original: attho. Etanti yathā vuttassatthassa saṅgahagāthāpadaṃ aññatrāti abhidhamme ito aññesu
analyzed: atthaḥ etat ti yathā vuttassa atthassa saṅgaha gāthā padam aññatra ati abhidhamme itas aññesu
translated: “By that” is the meaning. “That”: the verse-line of the summary of the meaning stated thus. “Elsewhere”: in the Abhidhamma and in other sutta passages

original: suttapadesu, vinaye ca. Samayoti samayasaddo. Saddeyeva hi vibhattiparā bhavatiatthe
analyzed: sutta padesu vinaye ca samayaḥ ti samaya saddaḥ hi vibhatti parā bhavati atthe
translated: and in the Vinaya. “At the time”: the word samaya is a word that has a case-ending only in the sense of a sound,

original: asambhavato. Soti sveva samayasaddo.
analyzed: a sambhavataḥ so ti su eva samaya saddo
translated: because it is impossible in the sense of a meaning. “That”: that very word samaya.

original: Evaṃ attano matiṃ dassetvā idāni porāṇācariyamatiṃ dassetuṃ “porāṇā panā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: evam attanaḥ matim dassetvā idāni porāṇa ācariya matim dassetum porāṇā pana atiādi vuttaṃ
translated: Having thus shown his own opinion, in order to show the opinion of the ancient teachers, he said “The ancient teachers,” and so on.

original: Porāṇāti ca purimā aṭṭhakathācariyā. “Tasmiṃ samaye”ti vā…pe… “ekaṃ samaya”nti vā
analyzed: porāṇā ati ca purimā aṭṭhakathā cariyā tasmin vāpe ekam vā
translated: Or “at that time” … or “on one occasion” …

original: esa bhedoti sambandho. Abhilāpamattabhedoti vacanamattena bhedo viseso, na pana atthena,
analyzed: esa bhedo ti sambandhaḥ abhilāpa matta bhedo ti vacana mattena bhedaḥ visesaḥ na pana atthena
translated: This is the difference. The difference is merely verbal, by way of the word, not by way of meaning.

original: tenāha “sabbattha bhummamevattho”ti, sabbesupi atthato ādhāro eva atthoti vuttaṃ
analyzed: tena āha sabbattha bhummam eva atthaḥ iti sabbesu pi atthataḥ ādhāraḥ eva atthaḥ iti vuttam
translated: Hence he says, “The meaning is the same in all cases.” The meaning is the same in all cases, that is, the meaning is the same in all cases as the basis.

original: hoti. Iminā ca vacanena suttavinayesu vibhattivipariṇāmo kato, bhummatthe vā upayogakaraṇavibhattiyo
analyzed: ho ti iminā ca vacanena sutta vinayesu vibhatti vipariṇāmaḥ kataḥ bhumma tthe vā upayoga karaṇa vibhattiyo
translated: And by this statement he shows that the case endings are changed in the Sutta and Vinaya, or that the case endings are used in the sense of the locative.

original: siddhāti dasseti. “Tasmā”tiādinā tesaṃ matidassane guṇamāha.
analyzed: dasseti tasmā ti ādinā tesam mati dassane guṇam āha
translated: “Therefore” and so on—he states the virtue of their opinion.

original: Bhāriyaṭṭhena garu. Tadevatthaṃ saṅketato samattheti “garuṃ hī”tiādinā saṅketavisayo
analyzed: bhāriya aṭṭhena garu saṅketato samatthā iti garum hi iti ādinā saṅketa visayaḥ
translated: Heavy in the sense of weighty. He defines the word “bhagavā” by way of conventional usage as “one who is heavy with good qualities.”🔽For the word, which has a conventional usage as its domain, is a revealer of that particular meaning.

original: hi saddo taṃvavatthitoyeva cesa atthabodhakoti. Garunti garukātabbaṃ janaṃ. “Loke”ti
analyzed: hi saddaḥ ca isa attha bodhakaḥ ti garunti garu kātabbam janam loke iti
translated: “One who is heavy” is one who is to be respected. “In the world”

original: iminā na kevalaṃ sāsaneyeva, lokepi garukātabbaṭṭhena bhagavāti saṅketasiddhīti dasseti.
analyzed: iminā na kevalam sāsane yā iva loke pi garu kātabba ṭṭhena bhagavā ati saṅketa siddhi iti dasseti
translated: shows that the conventional usage of the word “bhagavā” is established not only in the Dispensation but also in the world by way of the meaning of “one who is to be respected.”

original: Yadi garukātabbaṭṭhena bhagavā, atha ayameva sātisayaṃ bhagavā nāmāti dassento “ayañcā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: yadi bhagavā atha ayam eva sa atisayam bhagavā nāma ati dassentaḥ ayam ca atiādim āha
translated: If the Blessed One is so called in the sense of one who is to be venerated, then he is the Blessed One in the highest degree. Showing this, he said, “And this Blessed One.”

original: Tathā hi lokanātho aparimitanirupamappabhāvasīlādiguṇavisesasamaṅgitāya, sabbānatthaparihārapubbaṅgamāya🔽niravasesahitasukhavidhānatapparāya niratisayāya payogasampattiyā sadevamanussāya
analyzed: tathā hi lokanāthaḥ aparimita nirupama ppabhāva sīla ādi guṇa visesa samaṅgi tāya sabba anattha parihāra pubbaṅgamāya  niravasesa hita sukha vidhāna tapparāya niratisayāya payoga sampattiyā sa deva manussāya
translated: For the Lord of the World is the most venerable object of beings in countless world systems because he is endowed with the special qualities of virtue, etc., which are immeasurable and unsurpassed,🔽because he is the supreme fulfillment of the highest and most excellent form of service, which consists in the removal of all misfortune and the bestowal of every kind of benefit and happiness,

original: pajāya accantupakāritāya ca aparimāṇāsu lokadhātūsu aparimāṇānaṃ sattānaṃ uttamaṃ🔽gāravaṭṭhānanti. Na kevalaṃ lokeyeva, atha kho sāsanepīti dasseti “porāṇehī”tiādinā,
analyzed: ca aparimāṇāsu lokadhātūsu aparimāṇānam sattānam uttamam  gārava ṭṭhānam ti na kevalam loke iva atha kho sāsane pi iti dasseti porāṇehi itiādinā
translated: and because he is the most helpful to the world of gods and humans.🔽He is not only so called in the world, but also in the Dispensation. To show this, he said, “The ancient teachers,” etc.

original: porāṇehīti ca aṭṭhakathācariyehīti attho. Seṭṭhavācakavacanampi seṭṭhaguṇasahacaraṇato
analyzed: porāṇehi iti ca aṭṭhakathā cariyehi iti attho seṭṭha vācaka vacanam pi seṭṭha guṇa sahacaraṇato
translated: The meaning is: the ancient teachers of the commentaries. The word “best” is said to be the Blessed One because it is associated with the best qualities.

original: seṭṭhamevāti vuttaṃ “bhagavāti vacanaṃ seṭṭha”nti. Vuccati attho, etenāti hi vacanaṃ,
analyzed: seṭṭham evā ti vuttam bhagavā ati vacanam seṭṭhanti vuccati atthaḥ etena ati hi vacanam
translated: “The word ‘Blessed One’ is best” means: the word is spoken, the meaning is expressed, by this .

original: saddo. Atha vā vuccatīti vacanaṃ, attho, tasmā yo “bhagavā”ti vacanena vacanīyo attho,
analyzed: saddaḥ atha vā vuccati iti vacanam tasmai yaḥ bhagavā ati vacanena vacanīyaḥ attho
translated: Or else “is spoken of” is the expression, and “meaning” is the meaning. So the meaning is this: the meaning that is to be expressed by the expression “Blessed One”

original: so seṭṭhoti attho. Bhagavāti vacanamuttamanti etthāpi eseva nayo. Gāravayuttoti garubhāvayutto
analyzed: so seṭṭhaḥ ti atthaḥ bhagavā ati vacanam uttaman ti ettha api esā iva nayaḥ gārava yutto ti garu bhāva yuttaḥ
translated: is the best. The meaning of “The expression ‘Blessed One’ is the best” is to be construed in this way too. Endowed with respect: endowed with the state of being weighty;

original: garuguṇayogattā, sātisayaṃ vā garukaraṇārahatāya gāravayutto, gāravārahoti attho.
analyzed: garu guṇa yoga ttā sa atisayam vā garu karaṇa āraha tāya gārava yuttaḥ gārava ārahaḥ ti attho
translated: because of being endowed with weighty special qualities. Or else he is endowed with respect in the sense of being worthy of the highest respect; he is worthy of respect, is the meaning.

original: Yena kāraṇattayena so tathāgato garu bhāriyaṭṭhena, tena “bhagavā”ti vuccatīti sambandho.
analyzed: yena kāraṇattayena saḥ tathāgataḥ tena bhagavā ati vuccati iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The Blessed One is called “Blessed” because of these three reasons in the sense of being weighty and venerable.

original: Garutākāraṇadassanañhetaṃ padattayaṃ. “Sippādisikkhāpakāpi garūyeva nāma honti, na
analyzed: garu tā kāraṇa dassanam ha etam padattayam sippa ādi sikkhāpakā api garūyā iva nāma honti na
translated: For this triad of terms shows the reasons for his being weighty. Some say that “teachers of crafts and so on are called ‘weighty’ but are not endowed with respect;

original: ca gāravayuttā, ayaṃ pana tādiso na hoti, tasmā garūti katvā ‘gāravayutto’ti vutta”nti
analyzed: ca gārava yuttā ayam pana tādisaḥ na hoti tasmā garu iti katvā gārava yuttaḥ ti vuttanti
translated: but he is not like that. Therefore he is called ‘endowed with respect’ because he is weighty.”

original: keci. Evaṃ sati tadetaṃ visesanapadamattaṃ, purimapadadvayameva kāraṇadassanaṃ siyā.
analyzed: evam sati tat etam visesana pada mattam purima pada dvayam eva kāraṇa dassanam siyā
translated: If that is so, then this is merely a term of distinction; the first two terms would show the reasons.

original: Apicāti atthantaravikappatthe nipāto, aparo nayoti attho. Tattha –
analyzed: api ca iti atthantara vikappa tthe nipātaḥ aparaḥ
translated: Or else: the particle “or else” has the sense of “another way” or “another method.” Herein:

original: “Vaṇṇagamo vaṇṇavipariyāyo,
analyzed: vaṇṇa gamaḥ vaṇṇa vipariyāyaḥ
translated: “The coming of a colour, the passing away of a colour,

original: Dve cāpare vaṇṇavikāranāsā;
analyzed: dve ca apare vaṇṇa vikāra nāsā
translated: Two others, the alteration and the disappearance of a colour,

original: Dhātūnamatthātisayena yogo,
analyzed: dhātūnam attha atisayena yogaḥ
translated: The combination of elements in excess,

original: Taduccate pañcavidhā niruttī”ti. –
analyzed: tat uccate pañcavidhā nirutti iti
translated: These are the five kinds of pronunciation. ”

original: Vuttaṃ niruttilakkhaṇaṃ gahetvā, “pisodarādīni yathopadiṭṭha”nti vuttasaddanayena
analyzed: vuttam nirutti lakkhaṇam gahetvā pisodara ādīni yathā upadiṭṭhanti vutta sadda nayena
translated: Taking the definition of pronunciation as stated, or taking the definition of the group of words beginning with “pisodara” as given in the method of words stated thus: “As has been taught,”🔽and the definition of the group of words beginning with “ākata” as given in the method of words stated thus: “As has been taught,”🔽and the definition of the group of words beginning with “pakkha” as given in the method of words stated thus: “As has been taught,”🔽and the definition of the group of words beginning with “palāsa” as given in the method of words stated thus: “As has been taught,”🔽and the definition of the group of words beginning with “lokiya” as given in the method of words stated thus: “As has been taught,”

original: vā pisodarādiākatigaṇapakkhepalakkhaṇaṃ gahetvā lokiya lokuttarasukhābhinibbattakaṃ
analyzed: vā gahetvā lokiya lokuttara sukha abhinibbattakam
translated: and the definition of the group of words beginning with “lokuttara” as given in the method of words stated thus: “As has been taught,”

original: sīlādipārappattaṃ bhāgyamassa atthīti “bhāgyavā”ti vattabbe “bhagavā”ti vuttanti🔽āha “bhāgyavā”ti. Tathā anekabhedabhinnakilesasatasahassāni, saṅkhepato vā pañcamāre
analyzed: sīla ādi pāra ppattam bhāgyam assa atthi iti bhāgyavā ati vattabbe bhagavā ati vuttanti  āha bhāgyavāti tathā aneka bheda bhinna kilesa sata sahassāni saṅkhepataḥ vā pañca māre
translated: and the definition of the group of words beginning with “sukha” as given in the method of words stated thus: “As has been taught,”

original: abhañjīti “bhaggavā”ti vattabbe “bhagavā”ti vuttanti dasseti “bhaggavā”ti iminā.
analyzed: abhañji iti bhaggavā iti vattabbe bhagavā iti vuttanti dasseti bhaggavā iminā
translated: and the definition of the group of words beginning with “abhinibbattaka” as given in the method of words stated thus: “As has been taught,”🔽and the definition of the group of words beginning with “sīla” as given in the method of words stated thus: “As has been taught,”

original: Loke ca bhaga-saddo issariyadhammayasasirīkāmapayattesu chasu dhammesu pavattati,
analyzed: loke ca bhaga saddaḥ issariya dhamma yasa sirī kāma payattesu chasu dhammesu pavattati
