He teaches one meaning in many ways, in many expressions, in many doors to the Dhamma. He teaches

original: hāni, āveṇiko cāyaṃ buddhadhammo. Sabbaññutaññāṇassa hi suppaṭividitabhāvena paṭisambhidāñāṇehi
analyzed: hāni āveṇikaḥ ca ayam buddha dhammo sabbaññu ta ññāṇassa hi suppaṭividita bhāvena paṭisambhidā ñāṇehi
translated: and there is no deficiency in the Buddha’s dispensation. For just as the knowledge of the analytical insights is unobstructed in the three instances of meaning, etc.,

original: viya tenapi ñāṇena atthe, dhamme, niruttiyā ca appaṭihatavuttitāya buddhalīḷāya ekampi
analyzed: viya tena api ñāṇena atthe dhamme niruttiyā ca appaṭihata vutti tāya buddha līḷāya ekam pi
translated: so too the knowledge of the Buddha’s sport in the three instances of meaning, of the law, and of language is unobstructed. He teaches a single meaning in many ways,

original: atthaṃ anekehi pariyāyehi bodheti, na pana tasmiṃ saddavohāre, tathābodhane vā mandabhāvo
analyzed: attham anekehi pariyāyehi bodheti na pana tasmin sadda vohāre tathā bodhane vā manda bhāvaḥ
translated: but he is not slow in the verbal expression or in the teaching of that meaning.

original: sammābodhanassa sādhanattā, na ca tena atthassa vitthārabhāvo ekassevatthassa desetabbassa🔽subbijānanakāraṇattā, nāpi tabbacanena dhammadesanāhāni tassa desanāsampattibhāvato.
analyzed: sammābodhanassa sādhana ttā na ca tena atthassa vitthāra bhāvaḥ ekassa iva atthassa desetabbassa  su bijānana kāraṇa ttā nā api tad bacanena dhamma desanā hāni tassa desanā sampatti bhāvato
translated: For the verbal expression is the means of teaching the meaning correctly, and the teaching of the meaning in detail is the means of teaching the single meaning to be taught.

original: Tasmā sātthakaṃ pariyāyavacanaṃ, na cāpi taṃ ganthagāravādianekadosakaranti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: sātthakam pariyāya vacanam na ca api tam gantha gārava ādi aneka dosa karanti daṭṭhabbam
translated: Therefore the Buddha’s teaching is meaningful, and it is not to be regarded as having the many faults of being verbose, etc.

original: Yaṃ panetaṃ vuttaṃ “yadi ca taṃ vattabbaṃ siyā, tadeva vuttaṃ assa, na tadañña”nti,
analyzed: yat pana itam vuttam yadi ca tat vattabbam siyā tat eva vuttam assa na tad aññanti
translated: But it was said above, “If it is to be said, then that itself should be said, not something else.”

original: tampi na yuttaṃ payojanantarasambhavato. Tadeva hi avatvā tadaññassa vacanena desanākkhaṇe
analyzed: tat pi na yuttam payojana antara sambhavato tat eva hi avatvā tad aññassa vacanena desanā kkhaṇe
translated: But that is not right, because another purpose is possible. For without mentioning that, the teaching is given by means of other words at the time of teaching.

original: samāhitacittānampi sammadeva paṭiggaṇhantānaṃ taṃtaṃpadantogadhapavattinimittamārabbha
analyzed: samāhita cittānam pi sammat eva paṭiggaṇhantānam tat taṃ pada ntogadha pavatti nimittam ārabbha
translated: And even those whose minds are concentrated and who receive it properly come to understand the meaning by means of the sign that occurs in the words of the text.

original: tadatthādhigamo hoti, itarathā tasmiṃyeva pade punappunaṃ vutte tesaṃ tadatthānadhigatatā
analyzed: tad attha adhigamaḥ hoti itarathā tasmin yeva pade punappunam vutte tesam tad attha anadhigata tā
translated: Otherwise, if the text were repeated again and again, they would not understand the meaning of the text.

original: siyāti. Honti cettha –
analyzed: siyāti honti ca itthā
translated: If this is so, then the following verses may be cited:

original: “Yena kenaci atthassa, bodhāya aññasaddato;🔽Vikkhittakamanānampi, pariyāyakathā katā.
analyzed: yena kenaci atthassa bodhāya añña saddato  vikkhitta kamanānam pi pariyāya kathā katā
translated: “For the purpose of understanding the meaning in any way,🔽The teaching by synonyms is given, even to those who are distracted and inattentive.

original: Mandānañca amūḷhatthaṃ, atthantaranisedhayā;🔽Taṃtaṃnāmaniruḷhatthaṃ, pariyāyakathā katā.
analyzed: mandānam ca a mūḍha ttham atthantara nisedhayā  taṃ taṃ nāma niruḷha attham pariyāya kathā katā
translated: And for the purpose of preventing the meaning from being confused,🔽The teaching by synonyms is given, for those who are slow-witted and not confused.

original: Desakānaṃ sukaratthaṃ, tantiatthāvabodhane;
analyzed: desakānam sukarattham tanti attha avabodhane
translated: For the purpose of making it easy for people of different countries to understand the meaning of the text,

original: Dhammaniruttibodhatthaṃ, pariyāyakathā katā.
analyzed: dhamma nirutti bodha attham pariyāya kathā katā
translated: The teaching by synonyms is given for the purpose of understanding the language of the Dhamma.

original: Veneyyānaṃ tattha bījavāpanatthañca attano;
analyzed: veneyyānam tattha bīja vāpana attham ca attanaḥ
translated: And for the purpose of sowing the seed of understanding in the minds of those who need training,

original: Dhammadhātuyā līḷāya, pariyāyakathā katā.
analyzed: dhammadhātuyāḥ līḷāya pariyāya kathā katā
translated: The teaching by synonyms is given for the purpose of delighting in the Dhamma-element.

original: Tadeva tu avatvāna, tadaññehi pabodhanaṃ;
analyzed: tat eva tu avatvāna tat aññehi
translated: But without mentioning that, the teaching by means of others

original: Sammāpaṭiggaṇhantānaṃ, atthādhigamāya kata”nti.
analyzed: sammā paṭiggaṇhantānam attha adhigamāya katanti
translated: And for the sake of the attainment of the meaning by those who receive it rightly.

original: Idaṃ pana nibbeṭhanaṃ īdiseyeva, na sabbattha kātabbanti dassento “idañcā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: idam pana nibbeṭhanam īdisā iya iva na sabbattha kātabbanti dassentaḥ idam ca atiādim āha
translated: But this explanation is to be given only in such a case, not in every case. This is shown by the words “And this” .

original: Tattha avaṇṇeyevāti kāraṇapatirūpaṃ vatvā, avatvā vā dosapatiṭṭhāpanavasena nindāya
analyzed: tattha a vaṇṇeyā iva ati kāraṇa patirūpam vatvā a vatvā vā dosa patiṭṭhāpana vasena nindāya
translated: Herein, he is not to be praised means that he is not to be praised by way of establishing his faults, either by giving a reason or not.

original: eva. Na sabbatthāti na kevalaṃ akkosanakhuṃsanavambhanādīsu sabbattha nibbeṭhanaṃ
analyzed: eva na sabbattha iti na kevalam akkosana khuṃsana vambhana ādīsu sabbattha nibbeṭhanam
translated: Not in every case means that the explanation is not to be given in every case, such as abuse, reviling, and disparaging.

original: kātabbanti attho. Tadevatthaṃ “yadi hī”tiādinā pākaṭaṃ karoti. “Sāsaṅkanīyo hotī”ti
analyzed: kātabbam ti yadi hi iti ādinā pākaṭam karoti sāsaṅkanīyaḥ hoti iti
translated: The meaning is that it is to be given only in the case of a question. He makes this clear by the words “For if” .

original: vuttaṃ tathānibbeṭhetabbatāya kāraṇameva “tasmā”ti paṭiniddisati. “Oṭṭhosī”tiādi🔽“na sabbatthā”ti etassa vivaraṇaṃ. Jātināmagottakammasippaābādha liṅga kilesa āpatti
analyzed: vuttam tathā nibbeṭhetabba tāya kāraṇam eva tasmā iti paṭiniddisati  na sabbattha āti etassa vivaraṇam jāti nāma gotta kamma sippa ābādha liṅga kilesa āpatti
translated: The reason for the explanation is shown by the words “Therefore” , which refer to the words “he is suspected” .🔽The words “You are a pot-bird” , etc.,🔽are an explanation of the words “not in every case.”🔽By way of the ten grounds for abuse, namely, by way of clan, name, race, craft, disease, sex, defilement, offense, and abuse.

original: akkosanasaṅkhātehi dasahi akkosavatthūhi. Adhivāsanameva khanti, na diṭṭhinijjhānakkhamanādayoti adhivāsanakhanti.
analyzed: akkosana saṅkhātehi dasahi akkosa vatthūhi adhivāsanam eva khanti na diṭṭhi nijjhāna khamana ādayo ti adhivāsana khanti
translated: Patience is endurance. It is not the patience of acquiescence in views, etc. It is the patience of endurance.

original: 6. Evaṃ avaṇṇabhūmiyā saṃvaṇṇanaṃ katvā idāni vaṇṇabhūmiyāpi saṃvaṇṇanaṃ kātumāha
analyzed: evam avaṇṇa bhūmiyā saṃvaṇṇanam katvā idāni vaṇṇa bhūmiyā api saṃvaṇṇanam kātum āha
translated: 6. After this commendation of the ground for dispraise, he now said “Evaṃ” , etc., in order to commend the ground for praise.🔽Herein, ground for dispraise means a place for the manifestation of dispraise.

original: “eva”ntiādi. Tattha avaṇṇabhūmiyanti avaṇṇappakāsanaṭṭhāne. Tādilakkhaṇanti ettha
analyzed: evam tiādi tattha avaṇṇa bhūmiyanti avaṇṇa ppakāsana ṭhāne ta ādi lakkhaṇan ti ettha
translated: As to the characteristic of that:

original: “pañcahākārehi tādī iṭṭhāniṭṭhe tādī, cattāvīti tādī, tiṇṇāvīti tādī, muttāvīti tādī,
analyzed: pañcahā akārehi tādī iṭṭha aniṭṭhe tādī cattāvī iti tādī tiṇṇāvī iti tādī muttāvī iti tādī
translated: “He is the same with the five modes, he is the same with the desirable and the undesirable, he is the same with the four, he is the same with the three, he is the same with the two,🔽he is the same with the indication of that” .

original: taṃniddesā tādī”ti niddesanayena pañcasu atthesu idha paṭhamenatthena tādī. Tatrāyaṃ niddeso –
analyzed: taṃ niddesā tādī iti niddesa nayena pañcasu atthesu idha paṭhamena atthena tādī tatra ayam niddeso
translated: Herein, the first of the five meanings is intended here. The indication is this:

original: Kathaṃ arahā iṭṭhāniṭṭhe tādī, arahā lābhepi tādī, alābhepi tādī, yasepi, ayasepi,
analyzed: katham arahāḥ iṭṭha aniṭṭhe tādī arahāḥ lābhe pi tādī alābhe pi tādī yase pi a yase pi
translated: How is it that the Perfect One is the same with the desirable and the undesirable? The Perfect One is the same with gain and with non-gain, with fame and with non-fame,

original: pasaṃsāyapi, nindāyapi, sukhepi, dukkhepi tādī, ekañce bāhaṃ gandhena limpeyyuṃ,
analyzed: pasaṃsāya api nindāya api sukhe pi dukkhe pi tādī ekaṃ ce bāham gandhena limpeyyuṃ
translated: with honour and with non-honour, with happiness and with suffering. If they were to smear one arm with scented oil

original: ekañce bāhaṃ vāsiyā taccheyyuṃ, amusmiṃ natthi rāgo, amusmiṃ natthi paṭigho, anunayapaṭighavippahīno
analyzed: ekañce bāham vāsiyā tat cheyyuṃ amusmin natthi rāgaḥ amusmin natthi paṭighaḥ anunaya paṭigha vippahīno
translated: and to cut off the other with a sharp sword, he would have no liking for the one and no dislike for the other. He has abandoned approval and resistance,

original: ugghāṭinigghāṭivītivatto, anurodhavirodhasamatikkanto, evaṃ arahā iṭṭhāniṭṭhe tādīti.
analyzed: ugghāṭi nigghāṭi vītivattaḥ anurodha virodha samatikkantaḥ evam arahā iṭṭha aniṭṭhe tādi iti
translated: has surmounted impulsion and counter-impulsion, and has gone beyond perception and non-perception. That is how the Perfect One is the same with the desirable and the undesirable.

original: Vacanattho pana tamiva dissatīti tādī, iṭṭhamiva aniṭṭhampi passatīti attho. Tassa🔽lakkhaṇaṃ tādilakkhaṇaṃ, iṭṭhāniṭṭhesu samapekkhanasabhāvo. Atha vā tamiva dissate
analyzed: vacana atthaḥ pana tam iva dissati iti tādī iṭṭham iva aniṭṭham pi passati iti atthaḥ tassa  lakkhaṇam ta ādi lakkhaṇam iṭṭha aniṭṭhesu samapekkhana sabhāvaḥ atha vā tam iva dissate
translated: But the meaning of the word is this: it is “like that” in that it sees what is agreeable as if it were disagreeable.

original: tādī, so eva sabhāvo, tadeva lakkhaṇaṃ tādilakkhaṇanti. Vaṇṇabhūmiyaṃ tādilakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: tādī saḥ eva sabhāvaḥ tat eva lakkhaṇam tādi lakkhaṇan ti vaṇṇa bhūmiyam tādi lakkhaṇam
translated: The characteristic of that is the characteristic of equanimity, the state of equal regard for what is agreeable and disagreeable. Or alternatively, it is “like that” in that it is seen as if it were that, and that itself is the individual essence, that itself is the characteristic, thus it is the characteristic of equanimity. The meaning is that he shows the characteristic of equanimity in the plane of colour.

original: dassetunti sambandho. Para-saddo aññattheti āha “ye kecī”tiādi. Ānandanti bhusaṃ
analyzed: dassetum ti sambandhaḥ para saddaḥ aññattha iti āha ye keci itiādi ānandanti bhusam
translated: The word “other” has the meaning of “different,” thus he says “whatever” and so on.

original: pamodanti taṃsamaṅgino sattā etenāti ānandasaddassa karaṇatthataṃ dasseti. Sobhanamano
analyzed: pamodanti taṃsamaṅgino sattāḥ etena ati ānanda saddassa karaṇa ttha tam dasseti sobhana mano
translated: The word “joy” shows the instrumental case in the sense of “by that”: beings who possess that are delighted and rejoice.

original: sumano, cittaṃ, sobhanaṃ vā mano yassāti sumano, taṃsamaṅgīpuggalo. Nanu ca cittavācakabhāve🔽sati cetasikasukhassa bhāvatthatā yuttā, puggalavācakabhāve pana cittameva bhāvattho
analyzed: su mano cittam sobhanam vā manaḥ yassa ati su mano tad samaṅgī puggalaḥ nanu ca citta vācaka bhāve  sati cetasika sukhassa bhāva ttha tā yuttā puggala vācaka bhāve pana cittam eva bhāva tthaḥ
translated: The mind is beautiful, thus it is “beautiful-minded” . Or alternatively, he who has a beautiful mind is “beautiful-minded” , that is, a person who possesses that .

original: siyā, na cetasikasukhaṃ, sumanasaddassa dabbanimittaṃ pati pavattattā yathā “daṇḍittaṃ
analyzed: siyā na cetasika sukham sumana saddassa dabba nimittam pati pavatta ttā yathā
translated: But since the word “beautiful-minded” is a designation for the mind, is it not appropriate that the state of being should be the mental factor of happiness, and that if it is a designation for a person, the state of being should be the mind, not the mental factor of happiness, because the word “beautiful-minded” occurs in the sense of a sign of confidence ?🔽“The beautiful-minded are confident” .

original: sikhitta”ntiādīti? Saccametaṃ dabbe apekkhite, idha pana tadanapekkhitvā tena dabbena
analyzed: sikhitta nti ādi iti saccam etam dabbe apekkhite idha pana tat an apekkhitvā tena dabbena
translated: “He is trained” and so on? This is true if Dabba is considered, but here, without considering him, by that Dabba

original: yuttaṃ mūlanimittabhūtaṃ cetasikasukhameva apekkhitvā sumanasaddo pavatto, tasmā
analyzed: yuttam mūla nimitta bhūtam cetasika sukham eva apekkhitvā sumana saddo pavatto tasmā
translated: ‘He is skilled’ and so on? That is true when Dabba is intended, but here, without Dabba being intended, only mental happiness is intended, which is the root sign and the cause of the mental happiness that is associated with Dabba.🔽Therefore the word ‘happy’ occurs here,

original: etthāpi cetasikasukhameva bhāvattho sambhavati, tenāha “cetasikasukhassetaṃ adhivacana”nti.
analyzed: ettha api cetasika sukham eva bhāva tthaḥ sambhavati tena āha cetasika sukhassa itam adhivacanam ti
translated: and so the mental happiness is the meaning here too. That is why he said ‘This is a designation for mental happiness.’

original: Etena hi vacanena tadaññacetasikānampi cittapaṭibaddhattā, cittakiriyattā ca yathāsambhavaṃ
analyzed: etena hi vacanena tad añña cetasikānam pi citta paṭibaddha ttā citta kiriya ttā ca yathāsambhavam
translated: For by this statement the other mental states are included too, because they are bound up with consciousness and are functions of consciousness.

original: somanassabhāvo āpajjatīti codanaṃ nāpajjateva ruḷhisaddattā tassa yathā “paṅkaja”nti
analyzed: somanassa bhāvaḥ āpajjati iti codanam na āpajjatā iva ruḷhi saddattā tassa yathā
translated: So the objection does not apply. He avoids it by the word ‘overflowing,’ as in ‘lotus’ .

original: pariharati. Ubbilayatīti ubbilaṃ, bhindati purimāvatthāya visesaṃ āpajjatīti attho.
analyzed: pariharati ubbilayati iti ubbilam bhindati purima avatthāya visesam āpajjati iti atthaḥ
translated: Overflows: overflows by overflowing, that is, it breaks through the previous state and reaches distinction, is the meaning.

original: Tadeva ubbilāvitaṃ paccayantarāgamādivasena. Uddhaṃ palavatīti vā ubbilāvitaṃ akārānaṃ
analyzed: tat eva ubbilāvitam paccaya antara āgama ādi vasena uddham palavati iti vā ubbilāvitam
translated: That same overflowing, by the arrival of other conditions, and so on. Or it overflows by overflowing upwards.

original: ikāraṃ, ākārañca katvā, cittameva “cetaso”ti vuttattā. Taddhite pana siddhe taṃ abyatirittaṃ
analyzed: ikāram ākāram ca katvā cittam eva cetasā iti taddhite pana siddhe
translated: The letter a is made into i and the letter ā is made into i, and then consciousness itself is called ‘of the mind’ .🔽But when the compound is formed, the i is made into a by the rule ‘avyādisu iṇ’ .

original: tasmiṃ pade vacanīyassa sāmaññabhāvato, tassa vā saddassa nāmapadattā, tasmā kassāti
analyzed: tasmin pade vacanīyassa sāmañña bhāvato tassa vā saddassa nāma padattā tasmā kassa ati
translated: Because of the general nature of what is to be spoken of in that word, or because of the name-base of that sound, therefore “of what?”

original: sambandhīvisesānuyoge “cetaso”ti vuttanti dassetuṃ “kassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Esa nayo
analyzed: sambandhī visesa anuyoge cetasaḥ ti vuttanti dassetum kassa atiādi vuttam esa nayo
translated: In order to show that “of what?” is said in order to include a particular connection, “of the mind” is said. This method🔽is the same in the other cases.

original: īdisesu. Yāya uppannāya kāyacittaṃ vātapūritabhastā viya uddhumāyanākārappattaṃ hoti
analyzed: īdisesu yāya uppannāya kāya cittam vāta pūrita bhastā viya uddhumāyana ākāra ppattam hoti
translated: By which, when it arises, the body and mind become inflated like a bellows filled with wind, and reach the state of the appearance of inflation

original: tassā gehasitāya odagyapītiyā etaṃ adhivacananti sarūpaṃ dasseti “uddhaccāvahāyā”tiādinā.
analyzed: tassāḥ gehasitāya odagyapītiyāḥ etam adhivacananti sarūpam dassa iti uddhacca avahāya ati ādinā
translated: This is a designation for the happiness of the home life that has been enjoyed. He shows its nature with “arisen from agitation” and so on.

original: Uddhaccāvahāyāti uddhatabhāvāvahāya. Uppilāpeti cittaṃ uppilāvitaṃ karotīti ubbilāpanā,
analyzed: uddhacca avahāya ati uddhata bhāva avahāya uppilāpa iti cittam uppilāvitam karoti iti ubbilāpanā
translated: Arisen from agitation: arisen from the state of agitation. It agitates the mind, it makes it agitated, thus it is agitation ;

original: sā eva pīti, tassā. Khandhavasena dhammavisesattaṃ āha “idhāpī”tiādinā. Avaṇṇabhūmimapekkhāya
analyzed: sā eva pi iti tassā khandha vasena dhamma visesa ttam āha idha api iti ādinā avaṇṇa bhūmim apekkhāya
translated: that itself is happiness. He says that there is a difference in states by way of the aggregates with “here too.”

original: api-saddo “ayampi pārājiko”tiādīsu viya, idha ca kiñcāpi tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ubbilāvitameva
analyzed: api saddaḥ ayam pi pārājika uti ādīsu viya idha ca kiñcā api tesam bhikkhūnam ubbilāvitam eva
translated: The word “too” is like in the passage “This one too is expelled” . And although there is no agitation at all in those monks, still,

original: natthi, atha kho āyatiṃ kulaputtānaṃ edisesupi ṭhānesu akusaluppattiṃ paṭisedhento
analyzed: natthi atha kho āyatim kula puttānam edisesu pi ṭhānesu akusala uppattim paṭisedhento
translated: looking to the future, he is preventing the arising of unwholesome states in young men of good family in such places as this with

original: dhammanettiṃ ṭhapetīti. Dvīhi padehi saṅkhārakkhandho, ekena vedanākkhandho vuttoti
analyzed: dhamma nettim ṭhapeti iti dvīhi padehi saṅkhāra kkhandhaḥ ekena vedanā kkhandhaḥ vuttaḥ ti
translated: By the first two terms the formations aggregate is included, and by the last the feeling aggregate.

original: etthāpi “tesaṃ vasena sesānaṃ sampayuttadhammānaṃ karaṇaṃ paṭikkhittamevā”ti ca aṭṭhakathāyaṃ🔽vuttanayena sakkā viññātunti na vuttaṃ. “Pi-saddo sambhāvanattho”tiādinā vuttanayena
analyzed: ettha api tesam vasena sesānam sampayutta dhammānam karaṇam paṭikkhittam eva ati ca aṭṭhakathāyam  vutta nayena sakkā viññātunti na vuttam pi saddo sambhāvanā attho ti ādinā vutta nayena
translated: So here too it can be understood in the way stated in the commentary: “The doing of the remaining associated states is also thereby prohibited.”

original: cettha attho yathāsambhavaṃ veditabbo.🔽Tumhaṃyevassa tena antarāyoti etthāpi “antarāyo”ti idaṃ “ubbilāvitattassa akaraṇīyatākāraṇavacana”tiādinā
analyzed: ca ittha atthaḥ yathāsambhavam veditabbaḥ  tumhaṃyeva assa tena ettha api idam ubbila vitattassa a karaṇīya tā a kāraṇa vacana ti ādinā
translated: The meaning here should be understood as appropriate in the way stated in the following passage: “The word pi is in the sense of sambhāvanā” .

original: heṭṭhā avaṇṇapakkhe amhehi vuttanayānusārena attho daṭṭhabbo. Ettha ca “ānandino🔽ubbilāvitā”ti dīpitaṃ pītimeva gahetvā “tena ubbilāvitattenā”ti vacanaṃ somanassarahitāya
analyzed: heṭṭhā avaṇṇa pakkhe amhehi vutta naya anusārena atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo ettha ca ānandinaḥ  dīpitam pītim eva gahetvā tena vacanam somanassa rahitāya
translated: “You alone are to blame for that” : here too the meaning should be understood in the way stated below in the section on the criticism, in the passage beginning: “The word ‘obstruction’ is a term for the state of being unworkable due to overflowing” .

original: pītiyā abhāvato tabbacaneneva “sumanā”ti dīpitaṃ somanassampi siddhamevāti katvā
analyzed: pītiyāḥ abhāvataḥ tad bacanena iva sumanā iti dīpitam somanassam pi siddham evā iti katvā
translated: And here, taking only the joy indicated by the words “rejoicing, overflowing,” the statement “because of that overflowing” shows that the happiness indicated by the words “glad in heart” is established by that statement itself, since there is no joy without happiness.

original: vuttaṃ. Atha vā somanassassa antarāyakaratā pākaṭā, na tathā pītiyāti evaṃ vuttanti
analyzed: vuttam atha vā somanassassa antarāya kara tā pākaṭā na tathā pītiyā ti evam vuttan ti
translated: and so on. Or else it should be regarded as said because it is evident that it obstructs joy, not so happiness.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Kasmā panetanti yathāvuttaṃ atthaṃ avibhāgato manasi katvā codeti. Ācariyo
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam kasmā pana itanti yathāvuttam attham avibhāgataḥ manasi katvā codeti ācariyaḥ
translated: But why? He asks this after taking the meaning stated as if it were not yet explained.🔽The teacher,

original: “sacca”nti tamatthaṃ paṭijānitvā “taṃ panā”tiādinā vibhajjabyākaraṇavasena pariharati.
analyzed: tam attham paṭijānitvā tam panāti ādinā vibhajja byākaraṇa vasena pariharati
translated: after acknowledging the meaning by saying “True,” replies by way of an analysis-answer beginning with “But that.”

original: Tattha etanti ānandādīnamakaraṇīyatāvacanaṃ, nanu bhagavatā vaṇṇitanti sambandho.
analyzed: tattha etat ti ānanda ādīnam akaraṇīya tā vacanam nanu bhagavatā vaṇṇitam iti sambandhaḥ
translated: Herein, that is a statement of the non-doing of Ānanda and the others. The construction is: “Is it not praised by the Blessed One?”

original: Buddhoti kittayantassāti “buddho”ti vacanaṃ guṇānussaraṇavasena kathentassa sādhujanassa.
analyzed: buddhaḥ iti kittayantassa ati buddhaḥ iti vacanam guṇa anussaraṇa vasena kathentassa sādhu janassa
translated: Of one who is praising the Buddha: of a good person who is speaking the word “Buddha” by way of recollecting his special qualities.

original: Kasiṇenāti kasiṇatāya sakalabhāvena. Jambudīpassāti cetassa avayavabhāvena sambandhīvacanaṃ.
analyzed: kasiṇena ati kasiṇatāya sakala bhāvena jambudīpassa ati cetassa avayava bhāvena sambandhīvacanam
translated: By the kasiṇa: by the kasiṇa in the sense of the whole. The word “Jambudīpa” is related to the word “heart” in the sense of a part.

original: Apare pana “jambudīpassāti karaṇavacanatthe sāmivacana”ti vadanti, tesaṃ matena kasiṇajambudīpasaddānaṃ
analyzed: apare pana jambudīpassa ati karaṇa vacana atthe vadanti tesam matena kasiṇa jambudīpa saddānam
translated: But others say that the word “Jambudīpa” is a genitive of relationship in the sense of an instrumental. According to their view, the words “kasiṇa” and “Jambudīpa” are related to the word “heart” in the sense of a genitive of separation.

original: samānādhikaraṇabhāvo daṭṭhabbo, karaṇavacanañca nissakkatthe. Pageva ekadesato panāti
analyzed: samāna adhikaraṇa bhāvaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ karaṇa vacanam ca nissakka atthe pagā iva ekadesato pana āti
translated: The word “even” in the passage “even from one part” is for emphasis.

original: api-saddo sambhāvane. Ādi-saddena cettha –🔽“Mā soci udāyi, ānando avītarāgo kālaṃ kareyya, tena cittappasādena sattakkhattuṃ🔽devarajjaṃ kāreyya, sattakkhattuṃ imasmiṃyeva jambudīpe mahārajjaṃ kāreyya, apica
analyzed: api saddaḥ sambhāvane ādi saddena ca ittha  mā soci udāyi ānandaḥ a vīta rāgaḥ kālam kareyya tena citta ppasādena satta kkhattum  deva rajjam kāreyya sattakkhattum imasmin yeva jambudīpe mahā rajjam kāreyya apica
translated: And here the word “etc.” includes the sutta passage:

original: udāyi ānando diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyissatī”tiādisuttaṃ –
analyzed: udāyi ānandaḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme parinibbāyissati iti ādi suttam
translated: “Do not grieve, Udayi. If Ananda were to die without having abandoned passion, by reason of his confidence in the Dhamma he would become a god and rule over the gods for seven times seven days. He would become a king in this Rose-Apple Isle for seven times seven days. Moreover, Udayi, Ananda will attain final Nibbana in this very life.”

original: Saṅgahitaṃ. Nti suttantare vuttaṃ pītisomanassaṃ. Nekkhammassitanti kāmato nikkhamane🔽kusaladhamme nissitaṃ. Idhāti imasmiṃ sutte. Gehassitanti gehavāsīnaṃ samudāciṇṇato
analyzed: saṅgahitam nti sutta antare vuttam pīti somanassam nekkhammassitam ti kāmatas nikkhamane  kusala dhamme nissitam idha ati imasmin sutte gehassitam ti geha vāsīnam samudāciṇṇataḥ
translated: The joy and happiness mentioned in the sutta passage are stated in another sutta:🔽“Relying on renunciation” means relying on the wholesome states that are the renunciation of sense pleasures.🔽“Here” means in this sutta. “Relying on the household life” means relying on the sense pleasures called the “household life,” which are the practice of householders.

original: gehasaṅkhāte kāmaguṇe nissitaṃ. Kasmā tadevidhādhippetanti āha “idañhī”tiādi. “Āyasmato
analyzed: geha saṅkhāte kāma guṇe nissitam kasmā āyasmataḥ
translated: Why is that kind of confidence mentioned? The answer is: “Because it is stated here.”

original: channassa uppannasadisa”nti vuttamatthaṃ pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ, samatthetuṃ vā “tenevā”tiādi
analyzed: channassa uppanna sadisanti vuttam attham pākaṭam kātum samatthetum vā tena iva atiādi
translated: “Like that which arose in the Venerable Channa” is said in order to make clear the meaning stated in the sutta passage, or to prove it.

original: vuttaṃ. Visesaṃ nibbattetuṃ nāsakkhi bhagavati, dhamme ca pavattagehassitapematāya.🔽Parinibbānakāleti parinibbānāsannakāle bhagavatā paññattena tajjitoti vā sambandho.
analyzed: vuttam visesam nibbattetum nā asakkhi bhagavati dhamme ca pavatta geha ssita pema tāya  parinibbāna kāleti parinibbāna āsanna kāle bhagavatā paññattena tajjito ti vā sambandhaḥ
translated: He was unable to produce it in the Blessed One, because of the Blessed One’s absence of affection for the life of a householder and his love for the life of a recluse.🔽At the time of the Blessed One’s final Nibbāna: the meaning is, at the time of the Blessed One’s final Nibbāna, it was produced by the Saṅgha, or it was produced at the time of the Blessed One’s final Nibbāna by one who had been instructed by the Blessed One.

original: Parinibbānakāleti vā bhagavato parinibbutakāle saṅghena tajjito nibbattetīti vā sambandho.
analyzed: parinibbāna kāle iti vā bhagavataḥ parinibbuta kāle saṅghena tajjitaḥ nibbatteti iti vā sambandhaḥ
translated: Or alternatively, at the time of the Blessed One’s final Nibbāna: the meaning is, after the Blessed One’s final Nibbāna, it was produced by the Saṅgha.

original: Brahmadaṇḍenāti “bhikkhūhi itthannāmo neva vattabbo, na ovaditabbo, nānusāsitabbo”ti
analyzed: brahmadaṇḍena ati bhikkhūhi itthannāmaḥ na iva vattabbaḥ na ovaditabbaḥ na anusāsitabbaḥ ti
translated: By the brahma-wheel: by the brahma-wheel consisting in the announcement “Bhikkhus, so-and-so is not to be admonished, instructed, or advised by bhikkhus.”

original: katena brahmadaṇḍena. Tajjitoti saṃvejito. Tasmāti yasmā gehassitapītisomanassaṃ🔽jhānādīnaṃ antarāyakaraṃ, tasmā. Vuttañhetaṃ bhagavatā sakkapañhasutte “somanassaṃpāhaṃ
analyzed: katena brahmadaṇḍena tajjitaḥ iti saṃvejitaḥ tasmā iti yasmā gehassita pīti somanassam  jhāna ādīnam antarāya karam tasmā vuttam ha etam bhagavatā sakkapañha sutte
translated: Instructed: stirred up. Therefore: because affection and delight in the life of a householder

original: devānaminda, duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbampi asevitabbampī”ti.
analyzed: devānaminda duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbam pi a sevitabbam pi iti
translated: is an obstacle to the jhānas, etc., therefore. For this is said by the Blessed One in the Sakkapañha Sutta: “Delight and joy, Prince, I say, are of two kinds, to be cultivated and not to be cultivated” .

original: “Ayañhī”tiādinā tadevatthaṃ kāraṇato samattheti. Rāgasahitattā hi sā antarāyakarāti.

original: Ayaṃ pana aṭṭhakathāmuttako nayo – oramattakanti ettha oranti apārabhāgo “orato bhogaṃ🔽oraṃ pāra”ntiādīsu viya. Atha vā heṭṭhāattho orasaddo oraṃ āgamanāya ye paccayā,🔽te orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanānītiādīsu viya. Sīlañhi samādhipaññāyo apekkhitvā apārabhāge,
analyzed: ayam pana aṭṭhakathā muttakaḥ nayo ettha apāra bhāgaḥ orataḥ bhogaṃ 🔽oraṃ pāranti ādīsu viya atha vā heṭṭhā attho ora saddo oraṃ āgamanāya ye paccayā 🔽te orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni itiādīsu viya sīlam hi samādhi paññāyaḥ apekkhitvā apāra bhāge
