original: nānāvidhā janā nīvaraṇā etesaṃ, puthūhi vā nīvaraṇehi janā āvutā…pe… paṭikujjitāti🔽nibbacanaṃ dasseti. Puthūsu nīcadhammasamācāresu jāyati, puthūnaṃ vā abbhantare jano🔽antogadho, puthu vā bahuko janoti atthaṃ dasseti “puthūna”ntiādinā, etena ca tatiyapādaṃ
analyzed: nānāvidhāḥ janāḥ nīvaraṇāḥ etesam puthūhi vā nīvaraṇehi janāḥ  nibbacanam dasseti puthūsu nīca dhamma samācāresu jāyati puthūnam vā abbhantare jano  antogadho puthu vā bahukaḥ janoti attham dasseti puthūn anti ādinā etena ca tatiya pādam
translated: People are hindered by these various things, or people are hindered by many things, thus they are “hindered by many things” .🔽He shows the explanation. He shows the meaning “born among many, among those of low qualities and conduct,” or “people born among many, born among the multitude,” or “people born among many, born among the multitude within,” or “many people born,” thus “born among many” .🔽By this he opens up the third line or he interprets it.

original: vivarati, samattheti vā. “Puthuvā”tiādinā pana catutthapādaṃ. Puthu visaṃsaṭṭho eva
analyzed: samatthā iti vā puthuvā ati ādinā pana catuttha pādam puthu eva
translated: By “among many” he opens up the fourth line.

original: jano puthujjanoti ayañhettha vacanattho.
analyzed: janaḥ puthujjanaḥ ti ayam ha ittha vacana atthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the word is this: people who are dissociated from many are “ordinary people” .

original: Yehi guṇavisesehi nimittabhūtehi bhagavati “tathāgato”ti ayaṃ samaññā pavattā, taṃ
analyzed: yehi guṇa visesehi nimitta bhūtehi bhagavati tathāgataḥ ti ayam samaññā pavattā taṃ
translated: The following is said in order to show the special qualities that are the reason why the name “Tathāgata” is used for the Blessed One:🔽“The Blessed One is a Tathāgata for eight reasons.”

original: dassanatthaṃ “aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi bhagavā tathāgato”tiādi vuttaṃ. Ekopi hi saddo anekapavattinimittamadhikicca
analyzed: dassana attham aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi bhagavā tathāgataḥ tiādi vuttam ekaḥ api hi saddaḥ aneka pavatti nimittam
translated: For a single word can have many reasons for its use according to its meaning.

original: anekadhā atthappakāsako, bhagavato ca sabbepi nāmasaddā anekaguṇanemittikāyeva. Yathāha –
analyzed: anekadhā attha ppakāsakaḥ bhagavataḥ ca sabbe pi nāma saddāḥ aneka guṇa nemittikāya iva yathā āha
translated: And all the names for the Blessed One are expressive of his special qualities, as it is said:

original: “Asaṅkhyeyyāni nāmāni, saguṇena mahesino;
analyzed: asaṅkhyeyyāni nāmāni saguṇena mahesino
translated: “The names of the Great Sage are innumerable,

original: Guṇena nāmamuddheyyaṃ, api nāmasahassato”ti. ;🔽Kāni pana tānīti anuyoge sati paṭhamaṃ tassarūpaṃ saṅkhepato uddisitvā “katha”ntiādinā
analyzed: guṇena nāmam uddheyyam api  kāni pana tāni iti anuyoge sati paṭhamam tad sarūpam saṅkhepato uddisitvā kathanti ādinā
translated: And even a thousand names would not exhaust his qualities.”🔽But what are they? When asked this, he first of all gives a brief enumeration of them with the words “The path,” etc.,🔽and then he explains them with the words “The path that has come down,” etc.

original: niddisati. Tathā āgatoti ettha ākāraniyamanavasena opammasampaṭipādanattho tathā-saddo.🔽Sāmaññajotanāya visesāvaṭṭhānato, visesatthinā ca sāmaññasaddassāpi visesattheyeva
analyzed: niddisati tathā āgataḥ ti ettha ākāra niyamana vasena opamma sampaṭipādana tthaḥ tathā saddaḥ  sāmañña jotanāya visesa avaṭṭhānataḥ visesatthinā ca sāmañña saddassa api
translated: Herein, the word “thus” has the meaning of a simile, in the sense of a restriction of the mode .🔽Because of the inclusion of the particular in the general, and because the word “the path” is not required to have the meaning of the particular, the word “come” should be regarded as having the meaning of “gone” in the sense of the practice ,

original: anupayujjitabbato paṭipadāgamanattho āgata saddo daṭṭhabbo, na ñāṇagamanattho tathalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: an upayujjitabbataḥ paṭipad āgamana atthaḥ āgata saddaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ na ñāṇa gamana atthaḥ tatha lakkhaṇam
translated: and not as having the meaning of “gone” in the sense of knowledge, as in such passages as “The Tathāgata has come to the characteristic of that” ,

original: āgato”tiādīsu viya, nāpi kāyagamanādi attho “āgato kho mahāsamaṇo, māgadhānaṃ giribbaja”ntiādīsu
analyzed: āgataḥ iti ādīsu viya na api kāya gamana ādi atthaḥ āgataḥ kho mahā samaṇaḥ māgadhānam giribbajan ti ādīsu
translated: nor as having the meaning of “gone” in the sense of bodily movement, etc., as in such passages as “The Great Ascetic has come, the Great Ascetic has arrived” .

original: viya. Tattha yassa ākārassa niyamanavasena opammasampaṭipādanattho tathā-saddo, tadākāraṃ
analyzed: viya tattha yassa ākārassa niyamana vasena opamma sampaṭipādana atthaḥ tathā saddaḥ tad ākāram
translated: Herein, the word “thus” has the meaning of a simile in the sense of a restriction of the mode of the particular.

original: karuṇāpadhānattā tassa mahākaruṇāmukhena purimabuddhānaṃ āgamanapaṭipadāya udāharaṇavasena🔽sāmaññato dassento “yathā sabbaloke”tiādimāha. Yaṃtaṃ-saddānaṃ ekantasambandhabhāvato
analyzed: tassa mahā karuṇā mukhena purima buddhānam āgamana paṭipadāya udāharaṇa vasena  sāmaññataḥ dassentaḥ yathā sabba loka iti ādim āha ekanta sambandha bhāvataḥ
translated: Because of his pre-eminence in compassion, he illustrates the coming and going of the former Buddhas by way of the Great Compassion.🔽Showing them in common, he says, “As all the world,” etc. The words “as” and “all” are related to each other in the sense of totality.

original: cettha tathā-saddassatthadassane yathā-saddena attho vibhāvito. Tadeva vitthāreti
analyzed: ca ittha tathāsaddassa attha dassane yathāsaddena atthaḥ vibhāvito tat eva vitthāra iti
translated: Here the word “as” is explained by the word “all” in the sense of “thus.” He elaborates on that:

original: “yathā vipassī bhagavā”tiādinā, vipassīādīnañcettha channaṃ sammāsambuddhānaṃ mahāpadānasuttādīsu
analyzed: yathā vipassī bhagavā ati ādinā vipassī ādīnam ca ittha channam sammāsambuddhānam mahā padāna sutta ādīsu
translated: “As Vipassi, the Blessed One,” etc. Here, because of the detailed explanation of the great births of the six Perfectly Enlightened Ones, Vipassi, etc.,

original: sampahulaniddesena supākaṭattā, āsannattā ca tesaṃ vasena taṃ paṭipadaṃ dassetīti
analyzed: sampahula niddesena su pākaṭa ttā āsanna ttā ca tesam vasena tam paṭipadam dasseti iti
translated: in the Mahapadana Sutta, etc., they are well known and near at hand. Therefore, he shows the practice by way of them.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Āgato yathā, tathā āgatoti sabbatra sambandho. “Kiṃ vuttaṃ hotī”tiādināpi
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam āgataḥ yathā tathā āgataḥ iti sabbatra sambandhaḥ kim vuttam hoti itiādinā api
translated: This is how it should be understood. The word “as” is related to the words “came” and “gone” in the same way. “What is meant?” etc.

original: tadeva paṭiniddisati. Tattha yena abhinīhārenāti manussattaliṅgasampattihetusatthāradassanapabbajjāguṇasampattiadhikārachandānaṃ
analyzed: tat eva paṭiniddisati tattha yena abhinīhārena ati manussatta liṅga sampatti hetu satthāra dassana pabbajjā guṇa sampatti adhikāra chandānam
translated: He explains the same thing. Here, “by the aspiration” means by the aspiration for the attainment of the human state, the sight of the Master, the going forth, the attainment of the special qualities, and the desire for the opportunity.

original: vasena aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgatena mahāpaṇidhānena. Sabbesañhi buddhānaṃ paṭhamapaṇidhānaṃ
analyzed: vasena aṭṭhaṅga samannāgatena mahā paṇidhānena sabbesam hi buddhānam paṭhama paṇidhānam
translated: and the great aspiration endowed with the eight factors. For the aspiration of all Buddhas

original: imināva nīhārena samijjhati. Abhinīhāroti cettha mūlapaṇidhānassetaṃ adhivacananti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Evaṃ mahābhinīhāravasena “tathāgato”ti padassa atthaṃ dassetvā idāni pāramīpūraṇavasenapi
analyzed: iminā ava nīhārena samijjhati abhinīhāraḥ ti ca ittha mūla paṇidhānassa etam adhivacanan ti daṭṭhabbam  evam mahā abhinīhāra vasena tathāgato ti padassa attham dassetvā idāni pāramī pūraṇa vasena api
translated: succeeds by this very method. Herein, the word “aspiration” should be regarded as a designation for the fundamental aspiration.🔽Having thus shown the meaning of the word “Tathāgata” by way of the great aspiration, he now says, “Or else,” in order to show it also by way of the fulfilment of the pāramīs.

original: dassetuṃ “atha vā”tiādimāha. “Ettha ca suttantikānaṃ mahābodhiyānapaṭipadāya kosallajananatthaṃ
analyzed: dassetum atha vā ti ādim āha ettha ca suttantikānam mahā bodhiyāna paṭipadāya kosalla janana attham
translated: And here, in order to generate skill in the great path of spiritual development of the suttas,🔽this detailed explanation of the pāramīs is given.

original: pāramīsu ayaṃ vitthārakathā”tiādinā ācariyadhammapālattherena yā pāramīsu vinicchayakathā🔽vuttā, kiñcāpi sā amhehi idha vuccamānā ganthavitthārakarā viya bhavissati, yasmā
analyzed: pāramīsu ayam vitthāra kathā ati ādinā ācariya dhammapāla ttherena yā pāramīsu vinicchaya kathā  vuttā kiñcā api sā amhehi idha vuccamānā gantha vitthāra karā viya bhavissati yasmā
translated: Although this exposition of the pāramīs given by the teacher, the Elder Dhammapāla,🔽may seem to us to be too detailed,

original: panāyaṃ saṃvaṇṇanā etissaṃ pacchā pamādalekhavisodhanavasena, tadavasesatthapariyādānavasena
analyzed: pana ayam saṃvaṇṇanā etissam pacchā pamāda lekha visodhana vasena tad avasesa attha pariyādāna vasena
translated: nevertheless, since this commentary is being written for the purpose of removing later lapses and for exhausting the residue of kamma,

original: ca pavattā, tasmā sāpi pāramīkathā idha vattabbāyevāti tato ceva cariyāpiṭakaṭṭhakathāto
analyzed: ca pavattā tasmā sā api pāramīkathā idha vattabbāya iva ati tatas ca iva cariyā piṭaka ṭṭhakathāto
translated: Therefore, that perfection should be mentioned here as well.🔽🔽Therefore, the commentary on the Cariyāpiṭaka

original: ca āharitvā yathārahaṃ gāthābandhehi samalaṅkaritvā atthamadhippāyañca visodhayamānā bhavissati. Kathaṃ?🔽Kā panetā pāramiyo, kenaṭṭhena katīvidhā;
analyzed: ca āharitvā yathāraham gāthā bandhehi samalaṅkaritvā attham adhippāyam ca visodhayamānā bhavissati katham  kā pana itā pāramiyaḥ kenaṭṭhena katīvidhā
translated: Therefore this perfection too should be mentioned here. So it will be mentioned, after being brought in from the Cariyāpiṭaka Commentary, and it will be adorned with verses in the way appropriate to each case and its meaning and purport will be clarified. How?🔽What are these perfections? In what sense are they perfections? How many are there?

original: Ko ca tāsaṃ kamo kāni, lakkhaṇādīni sabbathā.🔽Ko paccayo, saṃkileso, vodānaṃ paṭipakkhako;
analyzed: kaḥ ca tāsam kamaḥ kāni lakkhaṇa ādīni sabbathā  kaḥ paccayaḥ saṃkilesaḥ vodānam paṭipakkhako
translated: What is their order? What are their characteristics, etc.?🔽What is their condition? What their defilement? What their cleansing? What their opposites?

original: Paṭipattivibhāgo ca, saṅgaho sampadā tathā.
analyzed: paṭipatti vibhāgaḥ ca saṅgahaḥ sampadā tathā
translated: What is the analysis of their practice? What their inclusion? What their development?

original: Kittakena sampādanaṃ, ānisaṃso ca kiṃ phalaṃ;
analyzed: kittakena sampādanam ca kim phalam
translated: In what way are they fulfilled? What their benefit? What their culmination?

original: Pañhametaṃ vissajjitvā, bhavissati vinicchayo.
analyzed: pañham etam vissajjitvā bhavissati vinicchayaḥ
translated: When this question has been answered, the exposition will be completed.

original: Tatridaṃ vissajjanaṃ –
analyzed: tatra idam vissajjanam
translated: Here is the answer:

original: Kā panetā pāramiyoti –
analyzed: kā panetā
translated: What are these perfections?🔽Except for craving, conceit, etc.,

original: Taṇhāmānādimaññatra, upāyakusalena yā;
analyzed: taṇhā māna ādi maññatra upāya kusalena yā
translated: Whatever is governed by knowledge

original: Ñāṇena pariggahitā, pāramī sā vibhāvitā.
analyzed: ñāṇena pariggahitā pāramī sā vibhāvitā
translated: Is a perfection, it is said.

original: Taṇhāmānādinā hi anupahatā karuṇūpāyakosallapariggahitā dānādayo guṇasaṅkhātā etā kiriyā “pāramī”ti vibhāvitā.
analyzed: taṇhā māna ādinā hi anupahatā karuṇūpāya kosalla pariggahitā dāna ādayaḥ guṇa saṅkhātā etā kiriyā pāramī iti vibhāvitā
translated: For generosity and the other pāramīs are called “perfections” when they are not corrupted by craving, conceit, etc., and are imbued with compassion and skillful means.

original: Kenaṭṭhena pāramiyoti –
analyzed: kenaṭṭhena
translated: In what sense are they pāramīs?🔽The prefix paraṃ has the sense of supreme,

original: Paramo uttamaṭṭhena, tassāyaṃ pāramī tathā;
analyzed: paramaḥ uttama ṭṭhena tassa ayam pāramī tathā
translated: And this is a pāramī in that way;🔽It is action, or it is a state, and generosity and the rest

original: Kammaṃ bhāvoti dānādi, taddhitato tidhā matā.
analyzed: kammam dāna ādi tidhā matā
translated: Are considered pāramīs in three ways.

original: Pūreti mavati pare, paraṃ majjati mayati;
analyzed: pūra iti pare param majjati
translated: It fulfills, it excels, it is supreme,🔽It is immersed in, it is immersed,

original: Munāti minoti tathā, minātīti vā paramo.
analyzed: munāti minoti tathā mināti iti vā
translated: It is measured, it is measured out, and in that way it is measured out;🔽It is a pāramī in the sense of supreme.

original: Pāre majjati sodheti, mavati mayatīti vā;
analyzed: pāre majjati sodha iti mavati mayati iti vā
translated: It is immersed in, it is purified, it is excelled, it is immersed,

original: Māyeti taṃ vā munāti, minoti mināti tathā.🔽Pāramīti mahāsatto, vuttānusārato pana;
analyzed: māyā iti tam vā munāti minoti mināti tathā  pāramī iti mahāsattaḥ vutta anusārataḥ pana
translated: It is measured, it is measured out, and in that way it is measured out;🔽A pāramī is considered to be🔽A supreme being, according to the commentaries,

original: Taddhitatthattayeneva, pāramīti ayaṃ matā.
analyzed: pāramī iti ayam matā
translated: And in the sense of a derivative word, and in the sense of a noun,🔽And in the sense of a verbal adjective.

original: Dānasīlādiguṇavisesayogena hi sattuttamatāya mahābodhisatto paramo, tassa ayaṃ, bhāvo,
analyzed: dāna sīla ādi guṇa visesa yogena hi sattuttamatāya mahā bodhisatto paramaḥ tassa ayam bhāvo
translated: The Great Being, who is supreme because of his excellence in generosity, virtue, etc., is called “supreme” . This is his “state” .🔽Or a pāramī is action, that is, the act of giving, etc.

original: kammanti vā pāramī, dānādikiriyā. Atha vā parati pūretīti paramo niruttinayena, dānādiguṇānaṃ
analyzed: vā pāramī dāna ādi kiriyā atha vā parati pūreti iti paramaḥ nirutti nayena
translated: Or else, it fulfills the other shore , and so it is supreme in the sense of a noun, because of the excellence of generosity, etc.

original: pūrako, pālako ca bodhisatto, paramassa ayaṃ, bhāvo, kammaṃ vā pāramī. Apica pare
analyzed: pūrako pālako ca bodhisatto paramassa ayam bhāvaḥ kammam vā pāramī apica pare
translated: Pūraka, Pālaka, the Bodhisatta, the highest, this is, the state, the action, or the perfection. Moreover, others

original: satte mavati attani bandhati guṇavisesayogena, paraṃ vā atirekaṃ majjati saṃkilesamalato,
analyzed: satte mavati bandhati guṇa visesa yogena param vā atirekam majjati saṃkilesa malataḥ
translated: are made to grow, he binds them to himself by means of the special qualities, or he plunges the other into the excess of defilement,

original: paraṃ vā seṭṭhaṃ nibbānaṃ visesena mayati gacchati, paraṃ vā lokaṃ pamāṇabhūtena
analyzed: param vā seṭṭham nibbānam visesena gacchati param vā lokam pamāṇa bhūtena
translated: or he makes the other, the highest, Nibbāna, go by means of the special quality, or he measures, he defines, the other world, as if it were this world,

original: ñāṇavisesena idhalokamiva munāti paricchindati, paraṃ vā ativiya sīlādiguṇagaṇaṃ🔽attano santāne minoti pakkhipati, paraṃ vā attabhūtato dhammakāyato aññaṃ, paṭipakkhaṃ🔽vā tadanatthakaraṃ kilesacoragaṇaṃ mināti hiṃsatīti paramo, mahāsatto, “paramassa
analyzed: ñāṇa visesena idha lokam iva munāti paricchindati param vā sīla ādi guṇa gaṇam  attano santāne minoti pakkhipati param vā atta bhūtataḥ dhammakāyataḥ aññam paṭipakkham  vā tad anattha karam kilesa cora gaṇam mināti hiṃsati iti paramaḥ mahāsatto paramassa
translated: or he brings, he places, the other, the multitude of special qualities such as virtue, etc.,

original: aya”ntiādinā vuttanayena pāramī. Pāre vā nibbāne majjati sujjhati, satte ca sodheti,
analyzed: ayanti ādinā vutta nayena pāramī pāre vā nibbāne majjati sujjhati satte ca sodheti
translated: into his own being, or he kills, he harms, the other, the multitude of defilements, the enemies, who are different from the Dhamma body, which is his own self, or who are opposed to it. Thus the highest is the great being. “The highest this is” etc., in the way stated, is the perfection. Or he plunges into the other shore, Nibbāna, he is purified, and he purifies beings,

original: tattha vā satte mavati bandhati yojeti, taṃ vā mayati gacchati, satte ca māyeti gameti,
analyzed: tattha vā satte mavati bandhati yojeti tam vā mayati gacchati satte ca māyeti gameti
translated: or he makes beings grow, he binds them to himself, he makes the other go, he goes to it, and he makes beings go, he sends them,

original: taṃ vā yāthāvato munāti paricchindati, tattha vā satte minoti pakkhipati, tattha
analyzed: tam vā yāthāvataḥ munāti paricchindati tattha vā satte minoti pakkhipati tattha
translated: Or else, he is a Muni because he measures out that which is as it really is, or he is a Muni because he measures out, i.e., places, beings in that , or he is a Muni because he measures out, i.e., harms, the defilements of beings in that .

original: vā sattānaṃ kilesāriṃ mināti hiṃsatīti pāramī, mahāsatto, “tassa aya”ntiādinā dānādikiriyāva
analyzed: vā sattānam kilesa arim mināti hiṃsati iti pāramī mahāsatto tassa
translated: The Great Being is a pāramitā because it is his “this” , etc., and the performance of giving, etc., is a pāramitā because it is his “that” .

original: pāramīti. Iminā nayena pāramīnaṃ vacanattho veditabbo.
analyzed: pāramī iti iminā nayena pāramīnam vacana atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: This is how the word-meaning of the pāramīs should be understood.🔽As to their number: in brief they are ten, but they are given in full in the Buddhavamsa in the chapter called “The Lineage of Buddhas” . For it is said there:

original: Katividhāti saṅkhepato dasavidhā, tā pana buddhavaṃsapāḷiyaṃ sarūpato āgatāyeva. Yathāha “vicinanto tadādakkhiṃ, paṭhamaṃ dānapārami”ntiādi. Yathā cāha –

original: “Kati nu kho bhante buddhakārakā dhammāti? Dasa kho sāriputta buddhakārakā dhammā,🔽katame dasa? Dānaṃ kho sāriputta buddhakārako dhammo, sīlaṃ nekkhammaṃ paññā vīriyaṃ
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante buddha kārakāḥ dhammā ati dasa kho sāriputta buddha kārakāḥ dhammā  katame dasa dānam kho sāriputta buddha kārako dhammaḥ sīlam nekkhammam paññā vīriyam
translated: “How many things, venerable sir, produce a Buddha?” “Ten things, Sāriputta, produce a Buddha.

original: khanti saccaṃ adhiṭṭhānaṃ mettā upekkhā buddhakārako dhammo, ime kho sāriputta dasa
analyzed: khanti saccam adhiṭṭhānam mettā upekkhā buddha kārakaḥ dhammaḥ ime kho sāriputta dasa
translated: What are the ten? Giving, virtue, renunciation, wisdom, energy, patience, truthfulness, resolution, loving kindness, and equanimity. These ten things produce a Buddha.”

original: buddhakārakā dhammāti. Idamavoca bhagavā, idaṃ vatvāna sugato athāparaṃ etadavoca satthā –

analyzed: dānam sīlam ca nekkhammam paññā vīriyena pañcamam
translated: ‘ Giving, virtue, renunciation, Wisdom, energy come fifth,

translated: Patience, truth, determination, Loving kindness, equanimity: these are ten ’ .

analyzed: kaḥ ca tāsam kamo ti ettha kamaḥ nāma desanā kkamo so ca paṭhama samādāna hetuko samādānam  pavicaya hetukam iti yathā ādimhi paṭhama abhinīhāra kāle pavicitā samādinnā ca tathā
translated: And what is their sequence? Herein, sequence is the order in which they are taught, and that is due to the order in which they are undertaken,🔽and the undertaking is due to the order in which they are investigated,

translated: ‘ This sequence is declared As that in which they are undertaken first,

translated: So renunciation is mentioned next to virtue. And after the words “When he has abandoned the transgression of obsession” he said: “When he is established in the way of the practice,” and after the words “When he is established in the way of the practice” he

analyzed: paññāya anantaram vīriyam vuttam  vīriyena titikkhā siddhitaḥ vīriyavā hi āraddha vīriya tā satta saṅkhārehi upanītam

analyzed: avijahana vacanataḥ satta suñña tā dhamma nijjhāna kkhantim vatvā tad upabrūhita ñāṇa saccassa  vacanato ca khantiyā anantaram saccam vuttam adhiṭṭhānena sacca siddhitaḥ acala adhiṭṭhānassa
translated: Because of the fact that one does not abandon speaking the truth by means of patience, after having shown patience towards the emptiness of beings and the emptiness of things, one speaks the truth by means of the knowledge that is increased by that .🔽and because of the fact that one speaks the truth by means of knowledge, after patience, truth is mentioned. Because of the establishment of truth by means of determination.

original: hi virati sijjhati. Avisaṃvāditaṃ vatvā tattha acalabhāvavacanato. Saccasandho hi

translated: For, the determined abstention is successful of one who has an unshakeable determination. Because of the fact that one speaks words that are unshakeable in that , after having spoken words that are not deceptive.

original: Yathābhūtañāṇavā hi bodhisambhāresu adhiṭṭhāti, te ca niṭṭhāpeti. Paṭipakkhehi akampiyabhāvato

translated: For, the one who speaks words of knowledge determines himself in the requisites for enlightenment and he completes them. Because of the fact that one is unshakeable by means of the opposite .

analyzed: ca saccassa anantaram adhiṭṭhānam vuttam mettāya para hita karaṇa samādāna adhiṭṭhāna siddhito

analyzed: adhiṭṭhānam vatvā hitu upasaṃhāra vacanataḥ bodhi sambhāre hi adhitiṭṭhamānaḥ mettā vihārī
translated: Because resolution is accomplished by the undertaking of loving-kindness, which is the doing of good to others,🔽and because loving-kindness is stated after resolution, which is the doing of good to others,

original: hoti. Acalādhiṭṭhānassa samādānāvikopanena samādānasambhavato ca adhiṭṭhānassānantaraṃ
analyzed: hoti acala adhiṭṭhānassa samādāna a vikopanena samādāna sambhavato ca adhiṭṭhānassa anantaram

analyzed: mettā vuttā upekkhāya mettā visuddhitaḥ sattesu hitu upasaṃhāram vatvā tad aparādhesu  udāsīna tā vacanataḥ mettā bhāvanam vatvā tad nissanda bhāvanā vacanataḥ hita kāma satte pi
