original: diṭṭhattā ca vuttaṃ “avasesā pana dve pucchā buddhānaṃ atthī”ti. Yā panetā “sattādhiṭṭhānā
analyzed: diṭṭha ttā ca vuttam avasesā pana dve pucchā buddhānam atthi iti yā pana itā satta adhiṭṭhānā
translated: But the other kinds of questions stated in the Niddesa, such as the questions based on beings,

original: pucchā dhammādhiṭṭhānā pucchā ekādhiṭṭhānā pucchā anekādhiṭṭhānā pucchā”tiādinā aparāpi🔽anekadhā pucchāyo niddese āgatā, tā sabbāpi niddhāretvā idha avicayanaṃ “alaṃ ettāvatāva,
analyzed: pucchā dhamma adhiṭṭhānā pucchā eka adhiṭṭhānā pucchā aneka adhiṭṭhānā pucchā ati ādinā aparā api  anekadhā pucchāyaḥ niddese āgatā tā sabbā api niddhāretvā idha a vicayanam alam
translated: questions based on ideas, questions based on one thing, questions based on several things, etc.,🔽are all included in these four. So it is enough to confine the analysis to these four.

original: atthikehi pana iminā nayena niddhāretvā vicetabbā”ti nayadānassa sijjhanatoti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: atthikehi pana iminā nayena niddhāretvā vicetabbā ati naya dānassa sijjhanato ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: But if anyone wants to, he can include the others too by this method and then analyse them. This is how the method should be understood.

original: 8. Pucchā ca nāmesā vissajjanāya satiyeva yuttarūpāti codanāya “idānī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pucchā ca nāma isā vissajjanāya satiyā iva yutta rūpā ati codanāya idāni itiādi vuttam
translated: And since a question is only a question if it is answered, the objection is answered by the words “Now, as to the question” .

original: Atipātanaṃ atipāto. Ati-saddo cettha atirekattho. Sīghabhāvo eva ca atirekatā, tasmā🔽saraseneva patanasabhāvassa antarā eva atirekaṃ pātanaṃ, saṇikaṃ patituṃ adatvā sīghaṃ
analyzed: atipātanam atipātaḥ atisaddo ca ittha atireka atthaḥ sīgha bhāvaḥ eva ca atireka tā tasmā  sa rasena iva patana sabhāvassa antarā eva atirekam pātanam saṇikam patitum a datvā sīgham
translated: “Overthrowing” is over-throwing . The prefix ati here has the sense of excess. And excess is swiftness.

original: pātananti attho, abhibhavanattho vā, atikkamma satthādīhi abhibhavitvā pātananti
analyzed: pātanam ti atthaḥ abhibhavana atthaḥ vā atikkamma sattha ādīhi abhibhavitvā pātanam ti
translated: So it is the swiftness of the falling itself that is the over-throwing, the falling quickly without waiting for the time to fall, is what is meant. Or the meaning can be taken as “falling after overcoming” , that is, after overcoming the knife, etc., by passing beyond them.

original: vuttaṃ hoti, vohāravacanametaṃ “atipāto”ti. Atthato pana pakaraṇādivasenādhigatattā
analyzed: vuttam hoti vohāra vacanam etam atipāto ti atthataḥ pana pakaraṇa ādi vasena adhigata ttā
translated: “Killing breathing things” is said; but in fact, since it has been understood by means of the text- passages, etc.,

original: pāṇavadho pāṇaghātoti vuttaṃ hotīti adhippāyo. Vohāratoti paññattito. Sattoti khandhasantāno.
analyzed: pāṇa vadho pāṇa ghāto ti vuttam hoti iti adhippāyaḥ vohārato ti paññattito satto ti khandha santāno
translated: the intention is that “killing breathing things” is said for the purpose of killing a breathing thing. “In usage” means in the designation. “A breathing thing” is a continuum of aggregates.

original: Tattha hi sattapaññatti. Vuttañca –
analyzed: tattha hi satta paññatti vuttam ca
translated: For that is the designation of a breathing thing. And it is said:🔽“Just as when there is a collection of parts

original: “Yathā hi aṅgasambhārā, hoti saddo ratho iti;
analyzed: yathā hi aṅga sambhārā hoti saddo ratho iti
translated: The word ‘chariot’ comes to be,🔽So when there is a collection of aggregates

original: Evaṃ khandhesu santesu, hoti sattoti sammutī”ti. ;
analyzed: evam khandhesu santesu hoti satto ti sammutī iti
translated: The convention ‘breathing thing’ comes to be” .

original: Jīvitindriyanti rūpārūpajīvitindriyaṃ. Rūpajīvitindriye hi vikopite itarampi taṃsambandhatāya🔽vinassati. Kasmā panettha “pāṇassa atipāto”ti, “pāṇoti cettha vohārato satto”ti ca
analyzed: rūpa arūpa jīvita indriyam rūpa jīvita indriye hi vikopite itaram pi  vinassati kasmā pana ittha pāṇassa atipāto ti pāṇo iti ca ittha vohārato satto ti ca
translated: “The life faculty” is the material and immaterial life faculty. For when the material life faculty is disturbed, the other, which is associated with it,🔽is destroyed too. But why is the singular number used here in “the killing of breathing things” and “a breathing thing” in the sense of a being?

original: ekavacananiddeso kato, nanu niravasesānaṃ pāṇānaṃ atipātato virati idha adhippetā.
analyzed: eka vacana niddeso kataḥ nanu niravasesānam pāṇānam atipātataḥ virati idha adhippetā
translated: Is not abstention from killing all breathing things what is intended here?

original: Tathā hi vakkhati “sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampīti sabbe pāṇabhūte”tiādinā bahuvacananiddesanti?
analyzed: tathā hi vakkhati sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī iti sabbe
translated: For it is said: “He is full of pity for all breathing things that live” , and so on, and the plural number is used there.

original: Saccametaṃ, pāṇabhāvasāmaññena panettha ekavacananiddeso kato, tattha pana sabbasaddasannidhānena
analyzed: saccam etam pāṇa bhāva sāmaññena pana ittha ekavacana niddeso kato tattha pana sabba sadda sannidhānena
translated: But the singular is used here because of the similarity of the living beings.

original: puthuttaṃ suviññāyamānamevāti sāmaññaniddesamakatvā bhedavacanicchāvasena bahuvacananiddeso🔽kato. Kiñca bhiyyo – sāmaññato saṃvarasamādānaṃ, tabbisesato saṃvarabhedoti imassa
analyzed: puthuttam su viññāyamānam evā ti sāmañña niddesam akatvā bheda vacanicchā vasena bahuvacana niddesaḥ  kataḥ kiñca bhiyyas sāmaññato saṃvara samādānam tad visesato saṃvara bhedaḥ ti imassa
translated: But the plural is used here because of the wish to state the distinction, since the word all is present there.

original: visesassa ñāpanatthampi ayaṃ vacanabhedo katoti veditabbo. “Pāṇassa atipāto”tiādi
analyzed: visesassa ñāpana attham pi ayam vacana bhedaḥ kataḥ iti veditabbaḥ pāṇassa atipātaḥ tiādi
translated: And further, this distinction of words should be understood as made in order to show the distinction of this kind: the undertaking of restraint is in general, the distinction of restraint is in particular.

original: hi saṃvarabhedadassanaṃ. “Sabbe pāṇabhūte”tiādi pana saṃvarasamādānadassananti. Saddavidū
analyzed: hi saṃvara bheda dassanam sabbe pāṇa bhūta itiādi pana saṃvara samādāna dassananti sadda vidū
translated: “The killing of a living being” and so on shows the distinction of restraint. “All living beings” and so on shows the undertaking of restraint.

original: pana “īdisesu ṭhānesu jātidabbāpekkhavasena vacanabhedamattaṃ, atthato samāna”nti vadanti.
analyzed: pana īdisesu ṭhānesu jāti dabba apekkha vasena vacana bheda mattam atthataḥ samāna nti vadanti
translated: But those who are skilled in the use of words say that in such cases the distinction of words is merely a matter of the wish to use a particular word, and that the meaning is the same.

original: Tasmiṃ pana pāṇeti yathāvutte dubbidhepi pāṇe. Pāṇasaññinoti pāṇasaññāsamaṅgino puggalassa.
analyzed: tasmim pana pāṇa iti yathā vutte dubbidhe pi pāṇe pāṇa saññinaḥ ti pāṇa saññā samaṅgino puggalassa
translated: But in this case, “living being” refers to the two kinds of living beings as stated. “One who has the perception of living beings” is a person who possesses the perception of living beings.

original: Yāya pana cetanāya pavattamānassa jīvitindriyassa nissayabhūtesu mahābhūtesu upakkamakaraṇahetu
analyzed: yāya pana cetanāya pavattamānassa jīvitindriyassa nissaya bhūtesu mahābhūtesu upakkama karaṇa hetu
translated: But the volition by means of which the great primaries that are the support of the life faculty occurring thus are harmed,

original: taṃmahābhūtapaccayā uppajjanakamahābhūtā nuppajjissanti, sā tādisapayogasamuṭṭhāpikā🔽cetanā pāṇātipātoti āha “jīvitindriyupacchedakaupakkamasamuṭṭhāpikā”ti, jīvitindriyupacchedakassa
analyzed: tad mahābhūta paccayāḥ uppajjanaka mahābhūtāḥ na uppajjissanti sā tādisa payoga samuṭṭhāpikā  cetanā pāṇātipāto ti āha jīvita indriya upacchedaka aupakkama samuṭṭhāpikā ati jīvita indriya upacchedakassa
translated: and by reason of which the great primaries that arise subsequently to those great primaries do not arise, is the volition that originates the effort that is the cause of the cutting off of the life faculty.

original: kāyavacīpayogassa tannissayesu mahābhūtesu samuṭṭhāpikāti attho. Laddhupakkamāni🔽hi bhūtāni purimabhūtāni viya na visadāni, tasmā samānajātiyānaṃ bhūtānaṃ kāraṇāni
analyzed: kāya vacī payogassa tad nissayesu mahābhūtesu samuṭṭhāpikā ati atthaḥ laddhu pakkamāni  hi bhūtāni purima bhūtāni na visadāni tasmāt samāna jātiyānam bhūtānam kāraṇāni
translated: That is why it is said, “That which originates the effort that is the cause of the cutting off of the life faculty.” The meaning is: that which originates the effort that is the cause of the cutting off of the life faculty in the great primaries that are its support, in the bodily and verbal efforts.🔽For the great primaries that are harmed are not clear like the preceding great primaries. Therefore they are not the cause of great primaries of the same kind.

original: na hontīti tesuyeva upakkame kate tato parānaṃ asati antarāye uppajjamānānaṃ bhūtānaṃ,🔽tannissitassa ca jīvitindriyassa upacchedo hoti. “Kāyavacīdvārāna”nti etena vitaṇḍavādimataṃ
analyzed: na honti iti upakkame kate tatas parānam asati antarāye uppajjamānānam bhūtānam  tad nissitassa ca jīvitindriyassa upacchedaḥ hoti etena vitaṇḍa vādi matam
translated: So when the effort is made in those great primaries, then, if there is no intervention, the great primaries that arise subsequently and the life faculty dependent on them are cut off.

original: manodvāre pavattāya vadhakacetanāya pāṇātipātabhāvaṃ paṭikkhipati.
analyzed: manaḥ dvāre pavattāya vadhaka cetanāya pāṇātipāta bhāvam paṭikkhipati
translated: By the words “in the doors of the body and of speech” he rejects the view of the Vaitulyavādins that the volition to kill, which occurs in the mind door, is killing.

original: Payogavatthumahantatādīhi mahāsāvajjatā tehi paccayehi uppajjamānāya cetanāya balavabhāvato🔽veditabbā. Ekassāpi hi payogassa sahasā nipphādanavasena, kiccasādhikāya bahukkhattuṃ
analyzed: payoga vatthu mahanta tā ādīhi mahā sāvajja tā tehi paccayehi uppajjamānāya cetanāya balava bhāvato  veditabbāḥ ekassa api hi payogassa sahasā nipphādana vasena kicca sādhikāya bahu kkhattum
translated: The great blameworthiness should be understood as due to the strength of the volition that arises with those conditions, because of the magnitude of the action, the magnitude of the object, and so on.

original: pavattajavanehi laddhāsevanāya ca sanniṭṭhāpakacetanāya vasena payogassa mahantabhāvo.🔽Satipi kadāci khuddake ceva mahante ca pāṇe payogassa samabhāve mahantaṃ hanantassa
analyzed: pavatta javanehi laddha āsevanāya ca sanniṭṭhāpaka cetanāya vasena payogassa mahanta bhāvo  sati pi kadāci khuddake ca iva mahante ca pāṇe payogassa sama bhāve mahantam hanantassa
translated: For the magnitude of the action is due to the magnitude of the volition that brings the action to completion, which arises with the repeated occurrence of the impulsions that give effect to the action, and which is reinforced by practice.🔽And the magnitude of the object is due to the fact that the volition arises more strongly in one who kills a large animal than in one who kills a small one, even when the action is the same in both cases.

original: cetanā tibbatarā uppajjatīti vatthussa mahantabhāvo. Iti ubhayampetaṃ cetanāya balavabhāveneva🔽hoti. Satipi ca payogavatthūnaṃ amahantabhāve hantabbassa guṇamahattenapi tattha
analyzed: cetanā tibbatarā uppajjati iti vatthussa mahanta bhāvaḥ iti ubhayam petam cetanāya balava bhāvena iva  hoti sati pi ca payoga vatthūnam a mahanta bhāve hantabbassa guṇa mahattena api tattha
translated: So both these factors are due to the strength of the volition.🔽And even when the action and the object are not great, the volition is strong when the object to be killed possesses special qualities,

original: pavattaupakāracetanā viya khettavisesanipphattiyā apakāracetanāpi balavatī, tibbatarā
analyzed: pavatta aupakāra cetanā viya khetta visesa nipphattiyā apakāra cetanā api balavatī tibbatarā
translated: like the volition that helps to produce a special field of merit.

original: ca uppajjatīti tassā mahāsāvajjatā daṭṭhabbā. Tenāha “guṇavantesū”tiādi. “Kilesāna”ntiādinā🔽pana satipi payogavatthuguṇānaṃ amahantabhāve kilesupakkamānaṃ mudutibbatāya cetanāya
analyzed: ca uppajjati iti tassāḥ mahā sāvajja tā daṭṭhabbā tena āha guṇavantesu itiādi kilesa ananti ādinā  pana sati pi payoga vatthu guṇānam amahanta bhāve kilesu pakkamānam mudu tibba tāya cetanāya
translated: and it arises in him, it should be seen that it is very blameworthy. Hence he said “in those possessed of special qualities” .

original: dubbalabalavabhāvavasena appasāvajjamahāsāvajjabhāvo veditabboti dasseti.🔽Sambharīyanti saharīyanti etehīti sambhārā, aṅgāni. Tesu pāṇasaññitā, vadhakacittañca🔽pubbabhāgiyānipi honti. Upakkamo pana vadhakacetanāsamuṭṭhāpito sahajātova. Pañcasambhāravatī
analyzed: dubbala balava bhāva vasena appasāvajja mahāsāvajja bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ ti dasseti  sambharīyanti saharīyanti etehi iti sambhārāḥ aṅgāni tesu pāṇa saññitā vadhaka cittam ca  pubbabhāgiyāni pi honti upakkamaḥ pana vadhaka cetanā samuṭṭhāpito sahajātaḥ va pañca sambhāravatī
translated: But by the words “in defilements” he shows that even though the object of the effort and the special qualities are not great, still the volition that is weak or strong should be understood to be less blameworthy or very blameworthy respectively, according to the weakness or strength of the defilement that accompanies it.

original: pana pāṇātipātacetanāti sā pañcasambhāravinimuttā daṭṭhabbā. Esa nayo adinnādānādīsupi.🔽Etthāha – khaṇe khaṇe nirujjhanasabhāvesu saṅkhāresu ko hanti, ko vā haññati, yadi
analyzed: pana pāṇa atipāta cetanā ati sā pañca sambhāra vinimuttā daṭṭhabbā esa nayaḥ adinnādāna ādīsu pi  ettha āha khaṇe khaṇe nirujjhana sabhāvesu saṅkhāresu kaḥ hanti kaḥ vā haññati yadi
translated: “The requisites” are the factors, the limbs, by which these things are “carried out” , that is, done. Among them, the perception of a living being and the mind to kill are the preliminary steps. But the effort is the co-nascent state originated by the volition to kill. But the volition to kill is to be regarded as free from the five requisites. The same method applies to taking what is not given and the rest.

original: cittacetasikasantāno, evaṃ so anupatāpanachedanabhedanādivasena na vikopanasamattho,
analyzed: citta cetasika santānaḥ evam saḥ anupatāpana chedana bhedana ādi vasena na vikopana samatthaḥ
translated: Here it may be asked: In formations that are by nature ceasing every moment, who is the killer or the one killed? If it is a continuum of consciousness and consciousness-concomitants, then it is not capable of being disturbed by the cutting up, the piercing, etc.,

original: nāpi vikopanīyo, atha rūpasantāno, evampi so acetanatāya kaṭṭhakaliṅgarūpamoti na🔽tattha chedanādinā pāṇātipāto labbhati yathā matasarīre. Payogopi pāṇātipātassa paharaṇappakārādiatītesu
analyzed: na api vikopanīyaḥ atha rūpa santānaḥ evam pi saḥ acetana tāya na  tattha chedana ādinā pāṇātipātaḥ labbhati yathā mata sarīre payogaḥ api pāṇātipātassa paharaṇa ppakāra ādi atītesu
translated: So it is like a piece of wood or a clod.

original: vā saṅkhāresu bhaveyya, anāgatesu vā paccuppannesu vā. Tattha na tāva atītānāgatesu
analyzed: vā saṅkhāresu bhaveyya anāgatesu vā paccuppannesu vā tattha na tāva atīta anāgatesu
translated: The act of killing can be in the past, future, or present. It cannot be in the past or future,

original: sambhavati tesaṃ abhāvato. Paccuppannesu ca saṅkhārānaṃ khaṇikattā saraseneva nirujjhanasabhāvatāya🔽vināsābhimukhesu nippayojano eva payogo siyā. Vināsassa ca kāraṇarahitattā na paharaṇappakārādipayogahetukaṃ
analyzed: sambhavati tesam abhāvato paccuppannesu ca saṅkhārānam khaṇika ttā sarasena iva nirujjhana sabhāva tāya  vināsa abhimukhesu nippayojanaḥ eva payogaḥ siyā vināsassa ca kāraṇa rahita ttā na paharaṇa ppakāra ādi payoga hetukam
translated: because they do not exist. And it cannot be in the present, because the formations are momentary and are by nature already ceasing as soon as they arise.🔽The act would be useless, since they are facing cessation. And since cessation has no cause, death is not caused by an act of killing.

original: maraṇaṃ, nirīhakatāya ca saṅkhārānaṃ kassa so payogo, khaṇikattā vadhādhippāyasamakālabhijjanakassa
analyzed: maraṇam nirīhaka tāya ca saṅkhārānam kassa so payogaḥ khaṇika ttā vadha adhippāya sama kāla bhijjanakassa
translated: And since formations are inert, who could be the doer of the act? And since they are momentary, there is no one who could be killed, since the one who would kill and the one who would be killed are not simultaneous.

original: kiriyāpariyosānakālānavaṭṭhānato kassa vā pāṇātipātakammabaddhoti?
analyzed: kiriyā pariyosāna kāla an avaṭṭhānato kassa vā pāṇātipāta kamma baddho ti
translated: And since the act does not continue to exist until the time of death, who is bound by the kamma of killing?

original: Vuccate – vadhakacetanāsahito saṅkhārānaṃ puñjo sattasaṅkhāto hanti, tena pavattitavadhappayoganimittāpagatusmāviññāṇajīvitindriyo🔽matavohārappavattinibandhano yathāvuttavadhappayogākaraṇe uppajjanāraho rūpārūpadhammasamūho🔽haññati, kevalo vā cittacetasikasantāno, vadhappayogāvisayabhāvepi tassa pañcavokārabhave
analyzed: vuccate vadhaka cetanā sahitaḥ saṅkhārānam puñjaḥ satta saṅkhātaḥ hanti tena                                  haññati kevalaḥ vā citta cetasika santānaḥ vadha ppayogā visaya bhāve pi tassa pañcavokāra bhave
translated: Reply: The mass of formations accompanied by the volition to kill kills the being called “a living creature.” The mass of material and immaterial phenomena that is ready to arise when the means of killing set in motion by that volition have ceased is killed. Or the mere continuum of consciousness and consciousness-concomitants is killed. Even though that is not the object of the means of killing, still, in the five-constituent existence,

original: rūpasantānādhīnavuttitāya rūpasantāne parena payojitajīvitindriyupacchedakapayogavasena
analyzed: rūpa santāna adhīna vutti tāya rūpa santāne parena payojita jīvitindriya upacchedaka payoga vasena
translated: its occurrence is dependent on the material continuum. Therefore, when the means of killing set in motion by another person cut off the life faculty in the material continuum,

original: tannibbattivibandhakavisadisarūpuppattiyā vihate vicchedo hotīti na pāṇātipātassa
analyzed: tad nibbatti vibandhaka visadisa rūpa uppattiyā vihate vicchedaḥ hoti iti na pāṇātipātassa
translated: the material continuum is damaged by the production of material phenomena similar to the obstruction of the arising of that . Thus there is a break in the continuum. Therefore, killing is not impossible.

original: asambhavo, nāpi ahetuko pāṇātipāto, na ca payogo nippayojano paccuppannesu saṅkhāresu
analyzed: asambhavaḥ na api ahetuko pāṇātipātaḥ na ca payogaḥ nippayojano paccuppannesu saṅkhāresu
translated: Nor is killing without a cause, nor is the means of killing useless in the present formations.

original: katapayogavasena tadanantaraṃ uppajjanārahassa saṅkhārakalāpassa tathāanuppattito,
analyzed: kata payoga vasena tad anantaram uppajjanā rahassa saṅkhāra kalāpassa tathā anuppattitaḥ
translated: Because of the performance of the means of killing, the mass of formations that is ready to arise next does not arise in that way.

original: khaṇikānaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ khaṇikamaraṇassa idha maraṇabhāvena anadhippetattā santatimaraṇassa
analyzed: khaṇikānam saṅkhārānam khaṇika maraṇassa idha maraṇa bhāvena an adhippeta ttā santati maraṇassa
translated: Because momentary death of momentary formations is not intended here as death,

original: ca yathāvuttanayena sahetukabhāvato na ahetukaṃ maraṇaṃ, na ca katturahito pāṇātipātappayogo
analyzed: ca yathā vutta nayena sa hetuka bhāvataḥ na ahetukam maraṇam na ca kattuḥ ahitaḥ pāṇa atipāta ppayogo
translated: and because death in a continuity is not without cause, since it has a cause in the way already stated, and because the act of killing is not🔽without an agent,

original: nirīhakesupi saṅkhāresu sannihitatāmattena upakārakesu attano attano anurūpaphaluppādananiyatesu
analyzed: nirīhakesu pi saṅkhāresu sannihita tā mattena upakārakesu attanaḥ attanaḥ anurūpa phala uppādana niyatesu
translated: and because the expression “he kills” is established as a mode of expression for the causes that are not themselves active but are helpful by mere presence and are fixed to produce their own particular fruits,

original: kāraṇesu kattuvohārasiddhito yathā “padīpo pakāseti, nisākaro candimā”ti, na ca kevalassa🔽vadhādhippāyasahabhuno cittacetasikakalāpassa pāṇātipāto icchito santānavasena avaṭṭhitasseva🔽paṭijānanato, santānavasena pavattamānānañca padīpādīnaṃ attakiriyāsiddhi dissatīti
analyzed: kāraṇesu kattu vohāra siddhitaḥ yathā padīpaḥ pakāseti nisākaro na ca kevalassa  vadha adhippāya sahabhuno citta cetasika kalāpassa pāṇātipāto icchito santāna vasena avaṭṭhitassa eva  paṭijānanataḥ santāna vasena pavattamānānam ca padīpa ādīnam atta kiriyā siddhi dissati iti
translated: just as it is said “The lamp illuminates,” “The moon the night,” and because it is not maintained that killing is the mere volition associated with the wish to kill,🔽but because it is admitted as existing in a continuity, and because it is seen that such things as a lamp succeed in their function when they occur in a continuity,

original: attheva pāṇātipātena kammabaddhoti. Ayañca vicāro adinnādānādīsupi yathāsambhavaṃ vibhāvetabbo.
analyzed: attha iva pāṇa atipātena kamma baddhaḥ ti ayam ca vicāraḥ adinna ādāna ādīsu pi yathāsambhavam vibhāvetabbaḥ
translated: there is a person bound by kamma through killing. And this discussion should be extended as appropriate to taking what is not given, and so on.

original: Sāhatthikoti sayaṃ mārentassa kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā paharaṇaṃ. Āṇattikoti
analyzed: sāhatthikā ti sayam mārentassa kāyena vā kāya paṭibaddhena vā paharaṇam āṇattikā ti
translated: “By one’s own hand” means killing oneself with one’s own body or with something attached to one’s body.🔽“By command” means

original: aññaṃ āṇāpentassa “evaṃ vijjhitvā vā paharitvā vā mārehī”ti āṇāpanaṃ. Nissaggiyoti
analyzed: aññam āṇāpentassa evam vijjhitvā vā paharitvā vā mārehi iti āṇāpanam nissaggiyaḥ ti
translated: ordering another person to kill, saying, “Kill him in such-and-such a way.”🔽“By throwing” means

original: dūre ṭhitaṃ māretukāmassa kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā usuyantapāsāṇādīnaṃ nissajjanaṃ.
analyzed: dūre ṭhitam māretu kāmassa kāyena vā kāya paṭibaddhena vā usu yanta pāsāṇa ādīnam nissajjanam
translated: throwing a stone, a clod, a stick, or a knife from a distance with the intention of killing.🔽“By fixed contrivance” means

original: Thāvaroti asañcārimena upakaraṇena māretukāmassa opātāpassenaupanikkhipanaṃ, bhesajjasaṃvidhānañca.
analyzed: thāvaro ti a sañcārimena upakaraṇena māretu kāmassa opātāpassena upanikkhipanam bhesajja saṃvidhānam ca
translated: setting a trap or a snare in order to kill a living being that moves about or one that does not move about.🔽“By magical power” means

original: Vijjāmayoti māraṇatthaṃ mantaparijappanaṃ āthabbaṇikādīnaṃ viya. Āthabbaṇikā hi āthabbaṇaṃ
analyzed: māraṇa attham manta parijappanam āthabbaṇikā ādīnam viya āthabbaṇikāḥ hi āthabbaṇam
translated: reciting a magical formula for the purpose of killing, as do the Athabbhanikas.🔽The Athabbhanikas use their Athabbha formulas

original: payojenti nagare vā ruddhe saṅgāme vā paccupaṭṭhite paṭisenāya paccatthikesu paccāmittesu
analyzed: payojenti nagare vā ruddhe saṅgāme vā paccupaṭṭhite paṭi senāya paccatthikesu pacca amittesu
translated: when a town is besieged or when a battle is imminent, in order to kill the enemy or to defeat the enemy.

original: ītiṃ uppādenti upaddavaṃ uppādenti rogaṃ uppādenti pajjarakaṃ uppādenti sūcikaṃ uppādenti
analyzed: ītim uppādenti upaddavam uppādenti rogam uppādenti pajjarakam uppādenti sūcikam uppādenti
translated: They cause disease, they cause misfortune, they cause sickness, they cause agitation, they cause pain.

original: visūcikaṃ karonti pakkhandiyaṃ karonti. Vijjādharā ca vijjaṃ parivattetvā nagare🔽vā ruddhe…pe… pakkhandiyaṃ karonti. Iddhimayoti kammavipākajiddhimayo dāṭhākoṭanādīni
analyzed: visūcikam karonti pakkhandiyam karonti vijjādharā ca vijjam parivattetvā nagare  vā pakkhandiyam karonti iddhi mayaḥ ti kamma vipāka jiddhi mayaḥ dāṭhā koṭana ādīni
translated: They make a fire-brand, they make a torch. And the magicians, having turned their magic on the city,

original: viya. Piturañño kira sīhaḷanarindassa dāṭhākoṭanena cūḷasumanakuṭumbiyassa maraṇaṃ🔽hoti. “Imasmiṃ panatthe”tiādinā ganthagāravaṃ pariharitvā tassa anūnabhāvampi karoti
analyzed: viya pituḥ aññaḥ kira sīhaḷa narindassa dāṭhā koṭanena cūḷa sumana kuṭumbiyassa maraṇam  hoti imasmin panattha iti ādinā gantha gāravam pariharitvā tassa anūna bhāvam pi karoti
translated: make a siege, etc. Iddhima means the iddhi that is the result of kamma, like the striking of the tooth-gem. For the death of Culla Sumana’s wife, it seems, was due to the striking of the tooth-gem of the king, the lord of the Sihala people.🔽“But in this case” , etc., is said by way of avoiding the fault of over-simplicity in the statement of the meaning.

original: “atthikehī”tiādinā. Idha avuttopi hi esa attho atidisanena vutto viya anūno paripuṇṇoti.
analyzed: atthikehi itiādinā idha avuttaḥ api hi esa atthaḥ atidisanena vuttaḥ viya anūnaḥ paripuṇṇaḥ ti
translated: “For one who is desirous” , etc., is said by way of showing that the meaning, though not stated here, is not incomplete, being as if stated by implication.

original: Dussīlassa bhāvo dussīlyaṃ, yathāvuttā cetanā. “Pahāyā”ti ettha tvā-saddo pubbakāleti
analyzed: dussīlassa bhāvaḥ dussīlyam yathā vuttā cetanā pahāya ati ettha tvāsaddaḥ pubba kāle iti
translated: Dussīlyaṃ = the state of being unvirtuous, the volition described above. “Pahāyā” : here the word tvā is to be construed with pubbakāle .

original: āha “pahīnakālato paṭṭhāyā”ti, hetuatthataṃ vā sandhāya evaṃ vuttaṃ. Etena hi pahānahetukā
analyzed: āha pahīna kālataḥ paṭṭhāya iti hetu attha tam vā sandhāya evam vuttam etena hi pahāna hetukā
translated: “From the time of abandoning” is said. Or it is said thus with reference to the meaning of cause. For by this he shows that the kind of abstention intended here is that which is the cause of abandoning,

original: idhādhippetā samucchedanikā viratīti dasseti. Kammakkhayañāṇena hi pāṇātipātadussīlyassa
analyzed: idha adhippetā samucchedanikā virati iti dasseti kamma kkhaya ñāṇena hi pāṇātipāta dussīlyassa
translated: the kind that cuts off. For by the knowledge of the exhaustion of kamma the unvirtuousness consisting in the killing of breathing things is abandoned and cut off.

original: pahīnattā bhagavā accantameva tato paṭiviratoti vuccati samucchedavasena pahānaviratīnamadhippetattā.
analyzed: pahīna ttā bhagavā accantam eva tatas paṭivirataḥ ti vuccati samuccheda vasena pahāna viratīnam adhippeta ttā
translated: and since he has abandoned them, he is said to be “completely refrained” from them, since what is intended is the refraining from them by cutting them off.

original: Kiñcāpi “pahāya paṭivirato”ti padehi vuttānaṃ pahānaviramaṇānaṃ purimapacchimakālatā
analyzed: kiñcā api pahāya paṭivirataḥ ti padehi vuttānam pahāna viramaṇānam purima pacchima kāla tā
translated: And although there is no prior or subsequent time stated for the abandoning and refraining expressed by the words “having abandoned” and “refrained,”

original: natthi, maggadhammānaṃ pana sammādiṭṭhiādīnaṃ, paccayabhūtānaṃ sammāvācādīnañca paccayuppannabhūtānaṃ
analyzed: natthi magga dhammānam pana sammādiṭṭhi ādīnam paccaya bhūtānam sammāvācā ādīnam ca paccaya uppanna bhūtānam
translated: nevertheless, since the states of the path, right view, etc., and their conditions, right speech, etc., are respectively the prior and subsequent states,

original: paccayapaccayuppannabhāve apekkhite sahajātānampi paccayapaccayuppannabhāvena gahaṇaṃ🔽purimapacchimabhāvena viya hoti. Paccayo hi purimataraṃ paccayasattiyā ṭhito, tato
analyzed: paccaya paccaya uppanna bhāve apekkhite sahajātānam pi paccaya paccaya uppanna bhāvena gahaṇam  purima pacchima bhāvena viya hoti paccayaḥ hi purimataram paccaya sattiyā ṭhitaḥ tatas
translated: the inclusion of the conascent states as conditions and as the conditionally-arisen is🔽like the inclusion of the prior and subsequent states. For a condition is established as a condition by the presence of its controlling faculty prior to the conditionally-arisen state,

original: paraṃ paccayuppannaṃ paccayasattiṃ paṭicca pavattati, tasmā gahaṇappavattiākāravasena
analyzed: param paccaya uppannam paccaya sattim paṭicca pavattati tasmā gahaṇa ppavatti ākāra vasena
translated: and the latter occurs by depending on the controlling faculty of the former. Therefore,

original: sahajātādipaccayabhūtesu sammādiṭṭhiādīsu pahāyakadhammesu pahānakiriyāya purimakālavohāro,
analyzed: sahajāta ādi paccaya bhūtesu sammādiṭṭhi ādīsu pahāyaka dhammesu pahāna kiriyāya purima kāla vohāro
translated: in the case of the states of right view, etc., which are conditions and conditionally-arisen in the sense of being conascent, etc., with the states of abandoning, the expression “prior time” is used for the action of abandoning.

original: tappaccayuppannāsu ca viratīsu viramaṇakiriyāya aparakālavohāro sambhavati. Tasmā
analyzed: tad paccaya uppannāsu ca viratīsu viramaṇa kiriyāya apara kāla vohāraḥ sambhavati tasmā
translated: And the abstention that has arisen with that as its object is the action of abstaining.

original: “sammādiṭṭhiādīhi pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya sammāvācādīhi pāṇātipātā paṭivirato”ti pāḷiyaṃ attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi ādīhi pāṇa atipātam pahāya sammā vācā ādīhi pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ ti pāḷiyam attho daṭṭhabbo
translated: So the meaning of the passage should be regarded as follows: “Having abandoned killing living beings by means of right view, etc., he abstains from killing living beings by means of right speech, etc.”

original: Ayaṃ panettha aṭṭhakathāmuttako nayo – pahānaṃ samucchedavasena viratipaṭippassaddhivasena
analyzed: ayam pana ittha aṭṭhakathā muttakaḥ nayaḥ pahānam samuccheda vasena virati paṭippassaddhi vasena
translated: But this is the method of explanation in the commentary: “Abandoning should be construed as ‘having cut off’ and ‘abstaining’ as ‘having tranquilized’ by means of the path.

original: yojetabbā, tasmā maggena pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya phalena pāṇātipātā paṭiviratoti attho.
analyzed: yojetabbā tasmā maggena pāṇātipātam pahāya phalena pāṇātipātā paṭivirataḥ ti attho
translated: So the meaning is: ‘Having abandoned killing living beings by means of the path, he abstains from killing living beings by means of the fruition.’

original: Apica pāṇo atipātīyati etenāti pāṇātipāto, pāṇaghātahetubhūto dhammasamūho. Ko paneso?
analyzed: apica pāṇaḥ atipātīyati etena ati pāṇātipātaḥ pāṇa ghāta hetu bhūto dhamma samūhaḥ kaḥ pana iso
translated: ” Moreover, it is killing living beings because living beings are killed by it. The meaning is: a class of states that is a cause of killing living beings. But what is that?

original: Ahirikānottappadosamohavihiṃsādayo kilesā. Te hi bhagavā ariyamaggena pahāya samugghāṭetvā
analyzed: ahirika anottappa dosa moha vihiṃsā ādayaḥ kilesā te hi bhagavā ariya maggena pahāya samugghāṭetvā
translated: It is the defilements such as lack of shame, lack of fear, delusion, and cruelty. For the Blessed One, having abandoned and eradicated those by means of the noble path,

original: pāṇātipātadussīlyato accantameva paṭivirato kilesesu pahīnesu tannimittakammassa
analyzed: pāṇa atipāta dussīlyataḥ accantam eva paṭivirataḥ kilesesu pahīnesu tad nimitta kammassa
translated: abstains from killing living beings and from all kinds of evil, having completely tranquilized the defilements.

original: anuppajjanato, tasmā maggena pāṇātipātaṃ yathāvuttakilesaṃ pahāya teneva pāṇātipātā
analyzed: an uppajjanataḥ tasmā maggena pāṇātipātam yathā vutta kilesam pahāya tena iva pāṇātipātā
translated: And because the kamma that has those as its root does not arise when the defilements are abandoned, he abstains from killing living beings by means of the path, having abandoned the killing of living beings, that is, the defilements, as stated.

original: dussīlyacetanā paṭiviratoti attho. Esa nayo “adinnādānaṃ pahāyā”tiādīsupi.
analyzed: dussīlya cetanā paṭivirataḥ ti attho esa nayaḥ adinnādānam pahāya ati ādīsu pi
translated: the meaning is, refraining from the volition of misconduct. So too with “abstaining from taking what is not given” and the rest.

original: Orato viratoti pariyāyavacanametaṃ, pati-visaddānaṃ vā paccekaṃ yojetabbato tathā🔽vuttaṃ. Oratoti hi avarato abhimukhaṃ rato, tena ujukaṃ viramaṇavasena sātisayataṃ🔽dasseti. Paṭiratassa cetaṃ atthavacanaṃ. Viratoti visesena rato, tena saha vāsanāya🔽viramaṇabhāvaṃ, ubhayena pana samucchedaviratibhāvaṃ vibhāveti. Eva-saddo pana tassā
analyzed: oratas virataḥ iti pariyāya vacanam etam vā paccekam tathā  vuttam oratas ti hi avaratas abhimukham tena ujukam viramaṇa vasena  dassa iti paṭiratassa ca itam attha vacanam virataḥ ti visesena rataḥ tena saha vāsanāya  viramaṇa bhāvam ubhayena pana samuccheda virati bhāvam eva saddaḥ pana tassā
translated: “From what is not good” : this is a synonym for “from evil” . Or it can be construed with each of the terms “from evil” and “from what is not good” .

original: viratiyā kālādivasena apariyantataṃ dassetuṃ vutto. So ubhayattha yojetabbo. Yathā
analyzed: viratiyāḥ kāla ādi vasena apariyanta tam dassetum vuttaḥ saḥ ubhayattha yojetabbaḥ yathā
translated: Thus it is said. “From what is not good” : from what is low, from what is in front, from what is delightful. By this he shows the excess of his abstinence by way of abstinence from what is straight. This is a statement of the meaning of “from what is straight.” “From evil” : from what is special. By this he shows the state of abstinence together with the residual stain. By both he shows the state of abstinence by way of complete cutting off. But the word “eva” is said in order to show the boundlessness of that abstinence by way of time, etc. It should be construed in both places.

original: hi aññe samādinnaviratikāpi anavaṭṭhitacittatāya lābhajīvitādihetu samādānaṃ bhinnanti,
analyzed: hi aññe samādinna viratikā api anavaṭṭhita citta tāya lābha jīvita ādi hetu samādānam bhinnanti
translated: For just as others, though they have undertaken abstinence, break their undertaking because of their unsettled minds for the sake of gain, life, etc.,🔽so the Blessed One did not. For he was completely abstinent because he had completely abandoned the taking of life.

original: na evaṃ bhagavā, sabbaso pahīnapāṇātipātattā panesa accantavirato evāti. “Natthi
analyzed: na evam bhagavā sabbaso pahīna pāṇātipāta ttā pana esa accanta virataḥ evā ati natthi
translated: “There is no evil deed

original: tassā”tiādinā eva-saddena dassitaṃ yathāvuttamatthaṃ nivattetabbatthavasena samattheti.
analyzed: tassa ati ādinā eva saddena dassitam yathāvuttam attham nivattetabba attha vasena samatthā iti
translated: The word “only” in the passage “only the state of being abandoned by the supramundane path” shows that the meaning stated should be limited to the state of being abandoned by the supramundane path.

original: Tattha vītikkamissāmīti uppajjanakā dhammāti saha pāṭhasesena sambandho. Te pana
analyzed: tattha vītikkamissāmi iti uppajjanakāḥ dhammā ti saha pāṭha sesena sambandhaḥ te pana
translated: Herein, the construction is: “I will transgress the states that arise together with the arising of the thought ‘I will transgress.’ ”

original: anavajjadhammehi vokiṇṇā antarantarā uppajjanakā dubbalā sāvajjā dhammā, yasmā ca
analyzed: anavajja dhammehi vokiṇṇāḥ antarantarā uppajjanakā dubbalā sāvajjāḥ dhammāḥ yasmai ca
translated: But these states that arise together with the arising of the thought “I will transgress” are weak states of defilement that are reprehensible and are interspersed with blameless states.

original: “kāyavacīpayogaṃ upalabhitvā imassa kilesā uppannā”ti viññunā sakkā ñātuṃ, tasmā
analyzed: kāya vacī payogam upalabhitvā imassa kilesāḥ uppannā ati viññunā sakkā ñātum tasmā
translated: And because it is possible for a discerning person to know that the defilements have arisen in him after observing bodily and verbal actions,

original: te imināva pariyāyena “cakkhusotaviññeyyā”ti vuttā, na pana cakkhusotaviññāṇārammaṇattā.🔽Ato sasambhārakathāya cakkhusotehi, tannissitaviññāṇehi vā kāyikavācasikapayogamupalabhitvā
analyzed: te iminā ava pariyāyena cakkhu sota viññeyyā ti vuttā na pana cakkhu sota viññāṇa ārammaṇa ttā  atas sa sambhāra kathāya cakkhu sotehi tad nissita viññāṇehi vā kāyika vācasika payogam upalabhitvā
translated: these states are called “cognizable by the eye and ear” in this way, not because they are objects of eye- and ear-consciousness.🔽Therefore, in the explanation of the context, the meaning should be understood thus: “after observing bodily and verbal actions by means of the eye and ear, or by means of the consciousnesses dependent on them, they are cognizable by mind-consciousness.”

original: manoviññāṇena viññeyyāti attho daṭṭhabbo. Kāyikāti kāyena katā pāṇātipātādinipphādakā
analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇena viññeyyā ti attho daṭṭhabbo kāyikā ati kāyena katā pāṇātipāta ādi nipphādakā
translated: Bodily means done by body, produced by body, strong unwholesome states that bring about killing-breathing-things, etc.

original: balavanto akusalā. “Kāḷakā” tipi ṭīkāyaṃ uddhatapāṭho, kaṇhapakkhikā balavanto akusalāti
analyzed: balavantaḥ akusalā kāḷakā tipi ṭīkā ayam uddhata pāṭhaḥ kaṇha pakkhikāḥ balavantaḥ akusalā ti
translated: The reading “blacks” in the Commentary is a variant reading. The meaning is: strong unwholesome states belonging to the dark side.

original: attho. “Imināvā”tiādinā nayadānaṃ karoti, tañca kho “adinnādānaṃ pahāya adinnādānā
analyzed: naya dānam karoti tat ca kho adinnādānam pahāya adinnādānā
translated: “Meaning” is the meaning of the words. “By this method” he gives the method of explanation, and that in the words “having abandoned taking what is not given …

original: paṭivirato”tiādipadesu.🔽Pāpe sametīti samaṇo, gotamasamaññā, tena gottenasambandho gotamoti atthaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: paṭivirataḥ ti ādi padesu  pāpe sameti iti samaṇaḥ gotama samaññā tena attham sandhāya
translated: he abstains from taking what is not given.”🔽“He meets with evil” is a recluse . The meaning is: “he is related to the clan called Gotama.”

original: “samaṇoti bhagavā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Gottavasena laddhavohāroti sambandho. Brahmadattena🔽bhāsitavaṇṇānusandhiyā imissā desanāya pavattanato, tena ca bhikkhusaṅghavaṇṇassāpi
analyzed: samaṇaḥ iti bhagavā atiādi vuttam gotta vasena laddha vohāro iti sambandhaḥ brahmadattena  bhāsita vaṇṇa anusandhiyāḥ imissā desanāya pavattanato tena ca bhikkhu saṅgha vaṇṇassa api
translated: “The Blessed One is a recluse” is said with reference to that meaning. The connection is: “he is called by the name Gotama by reason of the clan.”🔽Because this teaching was given in response to the praise spoken by Brahmadatta,

original: bhāsitattā bhikkhusaṅghavaṇṇopi vuttanayena desitabbo, so na desito. Kiṃ so pāṇātipātā
analyzed: bhāsita ttā bhikkhu saṅgha vaṇṇaḥ api vutta nayena desitabbaḥ saḥ na desitaḥ kim so pāṇa atipātā
translated: and because the praise of the Community of Bhikkhus was also spoken by him, the praise of the Community of Bhikkhus should be taught in the same way, but it is not taught.

original: paṭiviratabhāvo bhikkhusaṅghassa na vijjatīti anuyogamapanento “na kevalañcā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: paṭivirata bhāvaḥ bhikkhu saṅghassa na vijjati iti anuyogam apanentaḥ na kevalam ca ati ādim āha
translated: “But does the state of abstinence from killing living beings not exist in the Community of Bhikkhus?” He answers “And not only that” in order to remove that objection.

original: Evaṃ sati kasmā na desitoti punānuyogaṃ pariharati “desanā panā”tiādinā. Evanti evameva.
analyzed: evam sati kasmā na desitā iti punar anuyogam pariharati desanā evanti evam eva
translated: “If that is so, why is it not taught?” He answers that objection with “But the teaching.” “Thus” is “in that way.”

original: Etthāyamadhippāyo –“atthi bhikkhave, aññe ca dhammā”tiādinā anaññasādhāraṇe buddhaguṇe
analyzed: ettha ayam adhippāyaḥ atthi bhikkhave aññe ca dhammā ti ādinā anañña sādhāraṇe buddha guṇe
translated: The intention here is this. The Blessed One, wishing to increase the teaching by way of the special qualities of the Buddha, which are not shared by others, beginning with the words “There are, bhikkhus, other dhammas,”

original: ārabbha upari desanaṃ vaḍḍhetukāmo bhagavā ādito paṭṭhāya “tathāgatassa vaṇṇaṃ vadamāno🔽vadeyyā”tiādinā buddhaguṇavaseneva desanaṃ ārabhi, na bhikkhusaṅghaguṇavasenāpi.
analyzed: ārabbha upari desanam vaḍḍhetu kāmaḥ bhagavā āditas paṭṭhāya tathāgatassa vaṇṇam vadamāno  vadeyya ati ādinā buddha guṇa vasena iva desanam ārabhi na bhikkhu saṅgha guṇa vasena api
translated: began the teaching with the words “Were one to speak in praise of the Tathāgata, speaking rightly,🔽speaking truthfully, speaking meaningfully,

original: Esā hi bhagavato desanāya pakati, yadidaṃ ekaraseneva desanaṃ dassetuṃ labbhamānassāpi
analyzed: esā hi bhagavataḥ desanāya pakati yat idam ekarasena iva desanam dassetum labbhamānassa api
translated: This is the Blessed One’s normal way of teaching, namely, that even when it is possible to teach with a single flavor,

original: kassaci aggahaṇaṃ. Tathā hi rūpakaṇḍe dukādīsu, tanniddesesu ca hadayavatthu na gahitaṃ.🔽Itaravatthūhi asamānagatikattā desanābhedo hotīti. Yathā hi cakkhuviññāṇādīni ekantato
analyzed: kassaci a gahaṇam tathā hi rūpa kaṇḍe duka ādīsu tad niddesesu ca hadaya vatthu na gahitam  itara vatthūhi asamāna gatika ttā desanā bhedaḥ hoti iti yathā hi cakkhu viññāṇa ādīni ekantataḥ
translated: he does not include anyone. For in the Description of the Aggregates, the Description of the Bases, and the Description of the Elements, the heart-basis is not included.🔽The difference in the teaching is due to the difference in the bases.🔽For just as eye-consciousness, etc., are entirely dependent on the eye, etc.,

original: cakkhādinissayāni, na evaṃ manoviññāṇaṃ ekantena hadayavatthunissayaṃ āruppe tadabhāvato,
analyzed: cakkha ādi nissayāni na evam manaḥ viññāṇam ekantena hadaya vatthu nissayam āruppe tad abhāvato
translated: so too the mind-element is not entirely dependent on the heart-basis. In the immaterial sphere it does not exist,

original: nissayanissitavasena ca vatthudukādidesanā pavattā “atthi rūpaṃ cakkhuviññāṇassa
analyzed: nissaya nissita vasena ca vatthu duka ādi desanā pavattā atthi rūpam cakkhu viññāṇassa
translated: and the teaching of the bases, elements, and faculties proceeds by way of the support and the supported. “There is form that is the object of eye-consciousness,

original: vatthu, atthi rūpaṃ na cakkhuviññāṇassa vatthū”tiādinā. Yampi manoviññāṇaṃ ekantato
analyzed: vatthu atthi rūpam na cakkhu viññāṇassa vatthu uti ādinā yam pi manaḥ viññāṇam ekantato
translated: “Is there any materiality that is not a physical basis for eye-consciousness? ” and so on. And although mind-consciousness is entirely dependent on the heart-basis,

original: hadayavatthunissayaṃ, tassa vasena “atthi rūpaṃ manoviññāṇassa vatthū”tiādinā dukādīsu🔽vuccamānesupi na tadanurūpā ārammaṇadukādayo sambhavanti. Na hi “atthi rūpaṃ manoviññāṇassa
analyzed: hadaya vatthu nissayam tassa vasena atthi rūpam manaḥ viññāṇassa vatthu iti ādinā duka ādīsu  vuccamānesu pi na tad anurūpāḥ ārammaṇa duka ādayaḥ sambhavanti na hi atthi rūpam manaḥ viññāṇassa
translated: when the dyads beginning with “Is there any materiality that is a physical basis for mind-consciousness? ” are stated,

original: ārammaṇaṃ, atthi rūpaṃ na manoviññāṇassa ārammaṇa”nti sakkā vattuṃ tadanārammaṇarūpassābhāvatoti
analyzed: ārammaṇam atthi rūpam na manaḥ viññāṇassa ārammaṇanti sakkā vattum tad anārammaṇa rūpassa abhāvato ti
translated: the corresponding objects, etc., are not possible. For it cannot be said: “Is there any materiality that is an object of mind-consciousness? Is there any materiality that is not an object of mind-consciousness? ” because there is no materiality that is not an object of mind-consciousness.

original: vatthārammaṇadukā bhinnagatikā siyuṃ, tasmā na ekarasā desanā bhaveyyāti na vuttaṃ,🔽tathā nikkhepakaṇḍe cittuppādavibhāgena visuṃ avuccamānattā avitakkaavicārapadavissajjane
analyzed: vattha ārammaṇa dukāḥ bhinna gatikā siyum tasmā na ekarasā desanā bhaveyya ati na vuttam  tathā nikkhepa kaṇḍe cittuppāda vibhāgena visum a vuccamāna ttā avitakka avicāra pada vissajjane
translated: So the dyads of physical basis and object would have different courses, and therefore the teaching would not be of one taste. That is why it is not stated.🔽And because it is not stated separately in the Description of the Arising of Consciousness by way of the division of consciousnesses in the Description of the Kinds of Consciousness ,

original: “vicāro cā”ti vattuṃ na sakkāti āvitakkavicāramattapadavissajane labbhamānopi vitakko
analyzed: vicāraḥ ca ati vattum na sakkā ati ā vitakka vicāra matta pada vissajane labbhamānaḥ api vitakko
translated: it is not possible to say “and applied thought” in the answer to the question about the absence of applied thought and sustained thought. So although it is possible to say “applied thought” in the answer to the question about mere applied thought and sustained thought,

original: na uddhato. Aññathā hi “vitakko cā”ti vattabbaṃ siyā, evamevidhāpi bhikkhusaṅghaguṇo🔽na desitoti. Kāmaṃ saddato evaṃ na desito, atthato pana brahmadattena bhāsitavaṇṇassa
analyzed: na uddhataḥ aññathā hi vitakko ca ati vattabbam siyā evam evidhā api bhikkhu saṅgha guṇo  na desito ti kāmam saddataḥ evam na desitaḥ atthataḥ pana brahmadattena bhāsita vaṇṇassa
translated: not in vain. For otherwise he would have had to say “and applied thought” .🔽So the virtue of the Community of bhikkhus is not taught in this way.

original: anusandhidassanavasena imissā desanāya āraddhattā dīpetuṃ vaṭṭatīti āha “atthaṃ panā”tiādi.
analyzed: anusandhi dassana vasena imissā desanāya āraddha ttā dīpetum vaṭṭati iti āha attham pana atiādi
translated: Granted that it is not taught in this way in the words, but it is proper to point out that it is included in the meaning, since this teaching is begun with the showing of the outcome of the praise spoken by Brahmadatta.

original: Tatthāyaṃ dīpanā – “pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato samaṇassa gotamassa
analyzed: tattha ayam dīpanā pāṇa atipātam pahāya pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ samaṇassa gotamassa
translated: Here is the way to point it out. “The Community of disciples of the Master Gotama who have abandoned killing living things, who abstain from killing living things,🔽is armed with the cudgel and the sword” , and so on.

original: sāvakasaṅgho nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho”ti vitthāretabbaṃ. Nanu dhammassāpi vaṇṇo brahmadattena🔽bhāsitoti? Saccaṃ bhāsito, so pana sammāsambuddhapabhavattā, ariyasaṅghādhārattā
analyzed: sāvaka saṅghaḥ nihita daṇḍaḥ nihita sattho ti vitthāretabbam nanu dhammassa api vaṇṇaḥ brahmadattena  bhāsito ti saccam bhāsito saḥ pana sammāsambuddha pabhava ttā ariya saṅgha ādhāra ttā
translated: But was not the Dhamma also praised by Brahmadatta?

original: ca dhammassa dhammānubhāvasiddhattā ca tesaṃ, tadubhayavaṇṇadīpaneneva dīpitoti visuṃ
analyzed: ca dhammassa dhamma anubhāva siddha ttā ca tesam tad ubhaya vaṇṇa dīpanena iva dīpitaḥ iti visum
translated: It was, but that praise is included in the praise of the two since it was spoken by him because of the Dhamma’s being the Master’s province and because of the noble Community’s being the Dhamma’s province.🔽So it is not stated separately.

original: na uddhato. Saddhammānubhāveneva hi bhagavā, bhikkhusaṅgho ca pāṇātipātādippahānasamattho
analyzed: na uddhataḥ saddhamma anubhāvena iva hi bhagavā bhikkhu saṅghaḥ ca pāṇātipāta ādi ppahāna samatthaḥ
translated: For it is by the power of the true Dhamma that the Blessed One and the Community of bhikkhus are capable of abandoning killing living things, and so on.

original: hoti. Atthāpattivasena paraviheṭhanassa parivajjitabhāvadīpanatthaṃ daṇḍasatthānaṃ
analyzed: hoti attha āpatti vasena para viheṭhanassa parivajjita bhāva dīpana attham daṇḍa satthānam
translated: The words “having laid aside the stick and the sword” are said in order to show the avoidance of harming others by way of the offence.

original: nikkhepavacanti āha “parūpaghātatthāyā”tiādi. Avattanatoti apavattanato, asañcaraṇato🔽vā. Nikkhitto daṇḍo yenāti nikkhittadaṇḍo. Tathā nikkhittasattho. Majjhimassa purisassa🔽catuhatthappamāṇo cettha daṇḍo. Tadavaseso muggarakhaggādayo satthaṃ, tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: nikkhepa vacanti āha para upaghāta atthāya atiādi avattanato ti apavattanataḥ a sañcaraṇato  vā nikkhittaḥ daṇḍaḥ yena ati nikkhitta daṇḍaḥ tathā nikkhitta satthaḥ majjhimassa purisassa  catu hattha ppamāṇaḥ ca ittha daṇḍaḥ tad avasesaḥ muggara khagga ādayaḥ sattham tena vuttam
translated: “For the purpose of striking others” and so on. “By way of the turning away” means by way of the turning away from, or by way of the not going to.🔽“He who has laid aside the stick” is one who has laid aside the stick. Likewise, “he who has laid aside the sword.” Herein, the stick is four cubits long for a man of medium size. The sword is the rest of that, namely, the sword, the knife, and so on. Therefore it is said: “And here.”

original: “ettha cā”tiādi. Viheṭhanabhāvatoti vihiṃ sanabhāvato, etena sasati hiṃsati anenāti
analyzed: ettha ca ati ādi viheṭhana bhāvataḥ uti vihiṃ sana bhāvataḥ etena sasati hiṃsati anena ati
translated: “By way of the state of harming” means by way of the state of violence. By this he shows the meaning: “By this one harms, one is violent, therefore it is a sword.”

original: satthanti atthaṃ dasseti. “Parūpaghātatthāyā”tiādinā āpannamatthaṃ vivarituṃ “yaṃ🔽panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Kataro jiṇṇo, tassa, tenavā ālambito daṇḍo kattaradaṇḍo. Dantasodhanaṃ
analyzed: sattham ti attham dasseti para upaghāta tthāya ati ādinā āpannam attham vivaritum yam  pana atiādi vuttam kataraḥ jiṇṇo tassa ālambitaḥ daṇḍo kattara daṇḍaḥ danta sodhanam
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the offence by way of the words “for the purpose of striking others” and so on, it is said: “But what is a stick?” and so on.

original: kātuṃ yoggaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ dantakaṭṭhaṃ, na pana dantasodhanakaṭṭhaṃ. “Dantakaṭṭhavāsiṃ
analyzed: kātum yoggam kaṭṭham danta kaṭṭham na pana danta sodhana kaṭṭham danta kaṭṭha vāsim
translated: What is an old man? His stick is a stick for him, a kattaradaṇḍa. A piece of wood suitable for cleaning the teeth is a dantakaṭṭha, not a piece of wood for cleaning the teeth. “A dantakaṭṭha-case”

original: vā”tipi pāṭho, dantakaṭṭhacchedanakavāsinti attho. Khuddakaṃ nakhacchedanādikiccanipphādakaṃ
analyzed: vātipi pāṭhaḥ khuddakam nakha chedana ādi kicca nipphādakam
translated: The small knife is used for cutting the finger nails and so on.🔽This is a statement of the Bhikkhu Sangha.

original: satthaṃ pipphalikaṃ. Idaṃ pana bhikkhusaṅghādhīnavacanaṃ. “Bhikkhusaṅghavasenapi🔽dīpetuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti vuttatā tassāpi ekadesena dīpanatthaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sattham pipphalikam idam pana bhikkhu saṅgha adhīna vacanam bhikkhu saṅgha vasena pi  dīpetum vaṭṭati iti vutta tā tassa api ekadesena dīpana attham vuttam
translated: It is said that it is proper to explain it by means of the Bhikkhu Sangha.🔽The word “lajjā” has the meaning of “hiri” . Therefore it is said: “The characteristic of the shame of the evil.”

original: Lajjā-saddo hiriatthoti āha “pāpajigucchanalakkhaṇāyā”ti. Dhammagarutāya hi buddhānaṃ,
analyzed: lajjā saddaḥ hiri atthaḥ ti āha pāpa jigucchana lakkhaṇāya ati dhamma garutāya hi buddhānam
translated: For the shame of the Buddhas is the heaviness of the Dhamma,

original: dhammassa ca attādhīnattā attādhipatibhūtā lajjāva vuttā, na lokādhipatibhūtaṃ ottappaṃ.
analyzed: dhammassa ca atta adhīna ttā atta adhipati bhūtā lajjā ava vuttā na loka adhipati bhūtam ottappam
translated: and the shame of the Dhamma is the heaviness of the self. Therefore, the shame is said to be the self-master, not the shame of the world which is the master.

original: Apica “lajjī”ti ettha vuttalajjāya ottappampi vuttameva, tasmā lajjāti hiriottappānamadhivacanaṃ
analyzed: apica lajjī iti ettha vutta lajjāya ottappam pi vuttam eva tasmā lajjā ati hiri uttappānam adhivacanam
translated: Moreover, in the word “lajjī” , the shame which is said is also said to be the shame of the world. Therefore, the shame is to be seen as the designation of the shame of the world and the shame of the self.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Na hi pāpajigucchanaṃ pāputtāsanarahitaṃ, pāpabhayaṃ vā alajjanaṃ nāma
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam na hi pāpa jigucchanam pāpa uttāsana rahitam pāpa bhayam vā alajjanam nāma
translated: For there is no shame of the evil which is without the fear of the evil or the fear of the evil.

analyzed: atthi iti dayam āpannaḥ ti kasmā vuttam nanu dayā saddaḥ dayā pannaḥ ti ādīsu

Midati sinehatīti mettā, sā etassa atthīti mettaṃ, mettaṃ🔽cittaṃ etassāti mettacitto, mettāya sampayuttaṃ cittaṃ etassāti vā, tassa bhāvo mettacittatā🔽mettā eva mūlabhūtena tannimittena puggalasmiṃ buddhiyā, saddassa ca pavattanato.

translated: And does it occur with compassion too? —This is true. But this word “compassion” is used when it occurs with the intention of protecting,🔽as in “He has compassion on them” . So it is said here of the kind that occurs with loving-kindness.

original: “Pāṇabhūteti pāṇajāte”ti vuttaṃ. Evaṃ sati pāṇo bhūto yesanti pāṇabhūtāti nibbacanaṃ🔽kattabbaṃ. Atha vā jīvitindriyasamaṅgitāya pāṇasaṅkhāte taṃtaṃkammānurūpaṃ pavattanato
analyzed: pāṇa bhūtā iti pāṇa jātā iti vuttam evam sati pāṇaḥ bhūtaḥ yesanti pāṇa bhūtā ati nibbacanam  kattabbam atha vā jīvitindriya samaṅgi tāya pāṇa saṅkhāte tat tat kamma anurūpam pavattanato

original: hoti, tasmā purimapadatthabhūtā mettā eva paccayabhāvena “tāya eva dayāpannatāyā”ti
analyzed: hoti tasmā purima padattha bhūtā mettā eva paccaya bhāvena tāya eva dayā āpanna tāya ati
translated: and since it is, therefore loving-kindness, which is the meaning of the first word, is stated as the condition in the words “by that same compassion” .
