translated: They say: “A loan is the giving of money by way of saying, ‘Make a profit from this capital and give me back the capital together with the profit.’ A mortgage is the temporary giving of an object.”

original: catuguṇaṃ hotīti attho. Subhassa, subhena vā gamanaṃ pavattanaṃ subhago, tassa karaṇaṃ
analyzed: catuguṇam hoti iti attho subhassa subhena vā gamanam pavattanam subhagaḥ tassa karaṇam
translated: “What is pledged today becomes double or quadruple” means: if the object pledged today, then tomorrow it becomes double, and the day after tomorrow it becomes quadruple.

original: subhagakaraṇaṃ, taṃ pana piyamanāpassa, sassirīkassa vā karaṇamevāti āha “piyamanāpakaraṇa”ntiādi.
analyzed: subhaga karaṇam tam pana piya manāpassa sassirīkassa vā karaṇam eva ati āha piya manāpa karaṇa ntiādi
translated: “A good bargain” is the making of a good deal. But that is the making of a pleasing or a beautiful deal. Therefore he says: “The making of a pleasing deal, etc.”

original: Sassirīkakaraṇanti sarīrasobhaggakaraṇaṃ. Vilīnassāti patiṭṭhahitvāpi paripakkamapāpuṇitvā
analyzed: sassirīka karaṇam ti sarīra sobhagga karaṇam vilīnassa ati patiṭṭhahitvā api paripakkam apāpuṇitvā
translated: “For the beautifying of the body” means for the purpose of making the body beautiful. “When it has melted down” means when it has reached maturity after settling down.

original: vilopassa. Tathā paripakkabhāvena aṭṭhitassa. Pariyāyavacanametaṃ padacatukkaṃ. Bhesajjadānanti🔽gabbhasaṇṭhāpanabhesajjassa dānaṃ. Tīhi kāraṇehīti ettha vātena, pāṇakehi vā gabbhe🔽vinassante na purimakammunā okāso kato, tappaccayā eva kammaṃ vipaccati, sayameva
analyzed: vilopassa tathā paripakka bhāvena aṭṭhitassa pariyāya vacanam etam pada catukkam bhesajja dānam ti  gabbha saṇṭhāpana bhesajjassa dānam tīhi kāraṇehi iti ettha vātena pāṇakehi vā gabbhe  vinassante na purima kammunā okāsaḥ kato tad paccayā eva kammam vipaccati sayam eva
translated: “Of the melting down” means of the melting down that has reached maturity by that process. This is a set of four terms in which the words are synonyms. “Medicines” means

original: pana kammunā okāse kate na ekantena vātā, pāṇakā vā apekkhitabbāti kammassa visuṃ🔽kāraṇabhāvo vuttoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Vinayaṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana vātena pāṇakehi vā gabbho
analyzed: pana kammunā okāse kate na ekantena vātā pāṇakā vā apekkhitabbā ati kammassa visum  kāraṇa bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ ti daṭṭhabbam vinaya ṭṭhakathā ayam pana vātena pāṇakehi vā gabbhaḥ
translated: medicines for retaining the embryo. “For three reasons”: here, when the embryo is destroyed by wind or by germs, no opportunity is made by previous kamma; kamma ripens only on that condition. But when an opportunity is made by kamma, then the wind and the germs are not necessarily to be looked for.

original: vinassanto kammaṃ vinā na vinassatīti adhippāyena tamaññātra dvīhi kāraṇehīti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vinassantaḥ kammam vinā na vinassati iti adhippāyena tam aññā atra dvīhi kāraṇehi iti vuttam
translated: Thus the state of being a separate cause of kamma is stated. But in the Vinaya Commentary it is said that the meaning intended is that when the embryo is destroyed by wind or by germs, it is destroyed not without kamma, and therefore it is said that it is destroyed by two reasons.

original: Nibbāpanīyanti upasamakaraṃ. Paṭikammanti yathā te na khādanti, tathā paṭikaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: nibbāpanīyanti upasama karam paṭikammanti yathā te na khādanti tathā paṭikaraṇam
translated: “For the allaying” means for the purpose of allaying. “For the cure” means for the purpose of curing them so that they do not eat.

original: Bandhakaraṇanti yathā jiṃ cāletuṃ na sakkoti, evaṃ anāloḷitakaraṇaṃ. Parivattanatthanti
analyzed: bandha karaṇam ti yathā jim cāletum na sakkoti evam an āloḍita karaṇam parivattana attham
translated: Making fast: making it so that it cannot be moved by pulling. For the purpose of turning round:

original: āvudhādinā saha ukkhittahatthānaṃ aññattha parivattanatthaṃ, attanā gopitaṭṭhāne
analyzed: āvudha ādinā saha ukkhitta hatthānam aññattha parivatta nattham attanā gopita ṭṭhāne
translated: for the purpose of turning round in another place those whose hands are raised with weapons, etc., in them, in a place concealed by oneself;

original: akhipetvā parattha khipanatthanti vuttaṃ hoti. Khipatīti ca aññattha khipatīti attho.
analyzed: a khipetvā parattha khipana atthanti vuttam hoti khipati iti ca aññattha khipati iti attho
translated: what is meant is: for the purpose of throwing it in another place after having thrown it in a place concealed by oneself. “Throws” means throws in another place.

original: Vinicchayaṭṭhāneti aḍḍavinicchayaṭṭhāne. Icchitatthassa devatāya kaṇṇe kathanavasena🔽jappanaṃ kaṇṇajappananti ca vadanti. Devataṃ otāretvāti ettha mantajappanena devatāya
analyzed: vinicchaya ṭṭhāne iti aḍḍa vinicchaya ṭṭhāne icchitatthassa devatāya kaṇṇe kathana vasena  jappanam kaṇṇa jappananti ca vadanti devatam ettha manta jappanena devatāya
translated: In a place for settling disputes: in a place for settling disputes.🔽They say that “whispering in the ear” is the whispering in the ear of a deity by one who desires something.

original: otāraṇaṃ. Jīvikatthāyāti yathā pāricariyaṃ katvā jīvitavutti hoti, tathā jīvitavuttikaraṇatthāya.
analyzed: otāraṇam jīvika tthāya ati yathā pāricariyam katvā jīvita vutti hoti tathā jīvita vutti karaṇa tthāya
translated: “To bring down the deity”: here, bringing down the deity by means of the recitation of the incantation. For the sake of livelihood: for the purpose of making a living by doing service.

original: Ādiccapāricariyāti karamālāhi pūjaṃ katvā sakaladivasaṃ ādiccābhimukhāvaṭṭhānena
analyzed: ādicca pāricariyā ati kara mālāhi pūjam katvā sakala divasam ādicca abhimukha avaṭṭhānena
translated: Service to the sun: service to the sun by worshipping with garlands of karambha flowers and by standing facing the sun all day.

original: ādiccassa paricaraṇaṃ. “Tathevā”ti iminā “jīvikatthāyā”ti padamākaḍḍhati. Sirivhāyananti
analyzed: ādiccassa paricaraṇam tathā iva ati iminā jīvika atthāya ati padam ākaḍḍhati sirivhāyanam ti
translated: “In the same way” means he includes the words “for the sake of livelihood.” Service to Śrī:

original: ī-kārato a-kāralopena sandhiniddeso, tenāha “siriyā avhāyana”nti. “Sirenā”ti pana
analyzed: īkārataḥ akāra lopena sandhi niddeso tena āha siriyā sirena ati pana
translated: The sandhi-rule is that the a-vowel is dropped after the i-vowel. Thus he says “by the head’s invocation.” But “by the head’s”

original: ṭhānavasena avhāyanākāraṃ dasseti. Ye tu a-kārato a-kārassa lopaṃ katvā “siravhāyana”nti
analyzed: ṭhāna vasena avhāyana ākāram dasseti ye tu akārataḥ akārassa lopam katvā siravhāyananti
translated: shows the mode of invocation by the place. But those who read “by the head’s invocation” after dropping the a-vowel after the a-vowel

original: paṭhanti, tesaṃ pāṭhe ayamattho “mantaṃ jappetvā sirasā icchitassa atthassa avhāyana”nti.
analyzed: paṭhanti tesam pāṭhe ayam atthaḥ mantam jappetvā sirasā icchitassa atthassa
translated: have this meaning in their reading: “the invocation of the desired meaning by the head after muttering the charm.”

original: 27. Devaṭṭhānanti devāyatanaṃ. Upahāranti pūjaṃ. Samiddhikāleti āyācitassa atthassa
analyzed: deva ṭṭhāna nti devāyatanam upahāra nti pūjam samiddhi kāle iti āyācitassa atthassa
translated: “Devaṭṭhāna” is a shrine. “Upahāra” is worship. “Samiddhikāle” is at the time of the success of the

original: siddhakāle. Santipaṭissavakammanti devatāyācanāya yā santi paṭikattabbā, tassā paṭissavakaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: siddha kāle santi paṭissava kammanti devatā yācanāya yā santi paṭikattabbā tassā paṭissava karaṇam
translated: desired meaning. “Santipaṭissavakamma” is the performance of the promise of the boon to be granted by the deity after the invocation of the deity.

original: Santīti cettha mantajappanena pūjākaraṇaṃ, tāya santiyā āyācanappayogoti attho. Tasminti
analyzed: santi iti ca ittha manta jappanena pūjā karaṇam tāya santiyā āyācana payogo ti attho tasmin ti
translated: Herein, “santi” means the performance of worship by the muttering of the charm. The meaning is that the invocation is for the purpose of that boon. “Tasmin”

original: yaṃ “sace me idaṃ nāma samijjhissatī”ti vuttaṃ, tasmiṃ paṭissavaphalabhūte yathābhipatthitakammasmiṃ.
analyzed: yam sace me idam nāma samijjhissati iti vuttam tasmin paṭissava phala bhūte yathā abhipatthita kammasmin
translated: means in that promised fruit, in the desired undertaking, which is what was said thus “If this or that succeeds for me.”

original: Tassāti yo “paṇidhī”ti ca vutto, tassa paṭissavassa. Yathāpaṭissavañhi upahāre kate
analyzed: tassa ati yaḥ paṇidhi iti ca vutto tassa paṭissavassa yathāpaṭissavam hi upahāre kate
translated: ‘His’: of the one called ‘wish’. ‘His promise’: for the promise is made when the offering is made,

original: paṇidhiāyācanā katā niyyātitā hotīti. Gahitamantassāti uggahitamantassa. Payogakaraṇanti🔽upacārakammakaraṇaṃ. Itīti kāraṇatthe nipāto, tena vassavossa-saddānaṃ purisapaṇḍakesu🔽pavattiṃ kāraṇabhāvena dasseti, paṇḍakato visesena asati bhavatīti vasso. Purisaliṅgato🔽virahena avaasati hīḷito hutvā bhavatīti vosso. Viseso rāgassavo yassāti vasso. Vigato
analyzed: paṇidhi āyācanā katā niyyātitā hoti iti gahitam antassa ati uggahitam antassa payoga karaṇanti  upacāra kamma karaṇam iti iti kāraṇa atthe nipātaḥ tena purisa paṇḍakesu  pavattim kāraṇa bhāvena dasseti paṇḍakataḥ visesena asati bhavati iti vassaḥ purisa liṅgato  virahena avaasati hīḷitaḥ hutvā bhavati iti vossaḥ visesaḥ rāga ssavaḥ yassa ati vassaḥ vigataḥ
translated: as the wish is made by the request. ‘One who has taken the formula’: one who has learned the formula. ‘The performance of the rite’:

original: rāgassavo yassāti vossoti niruttinayena padasiddhītipi vadanti. Vassakaraṇaṃ tadanurūpabhesajjena.
analyzed: rāga ssavaḥ yassa ati vossaḥ ti nirutti nayena vadanti vassa karaṇam tad anurūpa bhesajjena
translated: the performance of the ceremony. ‘Thus’: the particle ‘iti’ is in the sense of ‘reason’; thus he shows the reason for the occurrence of the words ‘vassavassa’ in the case of a man-pretender. ‘Vassavassa’ means ‘there is no existence without a paṇḍaka’. ‘Vossavassa’ means ‘there is no existence without a man-sign’. ‘Vassavassa’ means ‘one who has passion’. ‘Vossavassa’ means ‘one who is without passion’. Thus they say that the words are established by derivation. ‘Vassavassa’ is the making of a man-pretender with medicine that is suitable for that purpose.

original: Vossakaraṇaṃ pana uddhatabījatādināpi, teneva jātakaṭṭhakathāyaṃ “vossavarāti uddhatabījā
analyzed: vossa karaṇam pana uddhata bīja tā ādinā api tena iva jāta kaṭṭha kathā ayam uddhata bījā
translated: ‘Vossavassa’ is the making of a man-pretender even with a seed that is agitated. Therefore in the commentary to the Jātaka it is said: “Vossavarāti uddhatabījaṃ

original: orodhapālakā”ti vuttaṃ. Acchandikabhāvamattanti itthiyā akāmabhāvamattaṃ. Liṅganti purisanimittaṃ.
analyzed: orodha pālakā iti vuttam acchandika bhāva mattam ti itthiyāḥ akāma bhāva mattam liṅgam ti purisa nimittam
translated: “Those who guard the fields” is said. The mere state of being unapproachable: the mere state of being unapproachable by a woman. The sign of a man: the sign of a male.

original: Vatthubalikammakaraṇanti gharavatthusmiṃ balikammassa karaṇaṃ, taṃ pana upaddavapaṭibāhanatthaṃ,
analyzed: vatthu bali kamma karaṇam ti ghara vatthusmim bali kammassa karaṇam tam pana upaddava paṭibāhana attham
translated: The performance of rites in the house: the performance of rites in the house for the purpose of averting misfortune,

original: vaḍḍhanatthañca karonti, mantajappanena attano, aññesañca mukhasuddhikaraṇaṃ. Tesanti
analyzed: vaḍḍhana attham ca karonti manta jappanena attanaḥ aññesam ca mukha suddhi karaṇam tesan ti
translated: and for the purpose of prosperity. By muttering prayers: by the purification of one’s own mouth and that of others. To others:

original: aññesaṃ. Yoganti bhesajjapayogaṃ. Vamananti pacchindanaṃ. Uddhaṃvirecananti vamanabhedameva
analyzed: aññesam bhesajja payogam vamananti pacchindanam uddhaṃvirecananti vamana bhedam eva
translated: to others. A medical treatment: a medical treatment. Emetics: purgatives. Purgatives:

original: “uddhaṃ dosānaṃ nīharaṇa”nti vuttattā. Virecananti pakativirecanameva. Adhovirecananti
analyzed: dosānam nīharaṇanti vutta ttā virecananti pakati virecanam eva adhovirecananti
translated: purgatives. “Because of the removal of impurities upwards” is said. Purgatives: purgatives. Purgatives:

original: suddhavatthikasāvavatthiādivatthikiriyā “adho dosānaṃ nīharaṇa”nti vuttattā. Atho
analyzed: suddhavatthi kasāvavatthi ādi vatthi kiriyā adhas dosānam nīharaṇan ti vutta ttā atho
translated: purgatives. “Because of the removal of impurities downwards” is said. A purgative:

original: vamanaṃ uggiraṇameva, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ dosanīharaṇaṃ. Tathā virecanaṃ virekova, adhovirecanaṃ
analyzed: vamanam uggiraṇam eva uddhaṃvirecanam dosanīharaṇam tathā virecanam adhovirecanam
translated: a purgative. Emetics: vomiting. Purgatives: the removal of impurities upwards. Similarly, purgatives: purgatives. Purgatives:🔽purgatives.

original: dosanīharaṇanti ayametesaṃ viseso pākaṭo hoti. Dosānanti ca pittādidosānanti attho.🔽Semhanīharaṇādi sirovirecanaṃ. Kaṇṇabandhanatthanti chinnakaṇṇānaṃ saṅghaṭanatthaṃ.
analyzed: dosa nīharaṇanti ayam etesam viseso pākaṭaḥ hoti dosānam ti ca pitta ādi dosānam ti attho  semha nīharaṇa ādi sirovirecanam kaṇṇa bandhana tham ti chinna kaṇṇānam saṅghaṭana ttham
translated: The difference between them is obvious. “Bile-removers” : the meaning is “bile-removers” such as yellow gall nuts.🔽“Pus-removers” is a purgative for the head. “For tying up the ears” : for the purpose of bringing together ears that are split.

original: Vaṇaharaṇatthanti arupanayanatthaṃ. Akkhitappanatelanti akkhīsu usumassa nīharaṇatelaṃ.
analyzed: vaṇa haraṇa ttham akkhi tappana telam akkhīsu usumassa nīharaṇa telam
translated: “For removing sores” : for the purpose of bringing out pus. “Eye-ointment for the eyes” : eye-ointment for removing heat from the eyes.

original: Yena akkhimhi añjite uṇhaṃ usumaṃ nikkhamati. Yaṃ nāsikāya gaṇhīyati, taṃ natthu.🔽Paṭalānīti akkhipaṭalāni. Nīharaṇasamatthanti apanayanasamatthaṃ. Khārañjananti khārakamañjanaṃ.🔽Sītameva saccaṃ niruttinayena, tassa kāraṇaṃ añjanaṃ saccañjananti āha “sītalabhesajjañjana”nti.
analyzed: yena akkhimhi añjite uṇham usumam nikkhamati yam nāsikāya gaṇhīyati tam  paṭalāni iti akkhi paṭalāni nīharaṇa samatthanti apanayana samattham khārañjanam ti khārakam añjanam  sītam eva saccam nirutti nayena tassa kāraṇam añjanam āha
translated: When it is applied to the eyes, the heat and the heat-origined pus come out. “Cotton” : that which is taken in the nose.🔽“Eye-scabs” : eye-scabs. “Capable of removing” : capable of taking away. “Alkaline ointment” : alkaline ointment.🔽“Cool” : cool by nature. “True” : true in the sense of being without deception. The reason for that is the ointment. Therefore it is said “cool medicinal ointment.”

original: Salākavejjakammanti akkhirogavejjakammaṃ. Salākasadisattā salākasaṅkhātassa akkhirogassa
analyzed: salāka vejja kammanti akkhi roga vejja kammam salāka sadisa ttā salāka saṅkhātassa akkhi rogassa
translated: “Treatment for the eyes” : treatment for the eyes. “Like a stick” : like a stick. “For the eye-disease called stick” : for the eye-disease called stick.

original: vejjakammanti hi sālākiyaṃ. Idaṃ pana vuttāvasesassa akkhirogapaṭikammassa saṅgahaṇatthaṃ🔽vuttaṃ “tappanādayopi hi sālākiyānevā”ti. Paṭividdhassa salākassa nikkhamanatthaṃ
analyzed: vejja kammanti hi sālākiyam idam pana vutta avasesassa akkhi roga paṭikammassa saṅgahaṇa ttham  vuttam tappana ādayaḥ pi hi paṭividdhassa salākassa nikkhamana attham
translated: “Medical treatment” is the use of a probe. But this is said for the purpose of including the treatment of the letters of the alphabet, which is a remainder of what was said.🔽For the treatment of the letters of the alphabet is also a kind of medical treatment.

original: vejjakammaṃ salākavejjakammanti keci, taṃ pana sallakattiyapadeneva saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: vejja kammam salāka vejja kammanti keci tam pana sallakattiya padena iva saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbam
translated: Some say that “medical treatment” is for the purpose of removing the probe that has been inserted. But that should be regarded as included by the word “surgery.”

original: Sallassa paṭividdhassa kattanaṃ ubbāhanaṃ sallakattaṃ, tadatthāya vejjakammaṃ sallakattavejjakammaṃ.
analyzed: sallassa paṭividdhassa kattanam ubbāhanam sallakattam tad atthāya vejja kammam salla katta vejja kammam
translated: The making, the pulling out, of a probe that has been inserted is surgery. Medical treatment for the purpose of that is medical treatment for surgery.

original: Kumāraṃ bharatīti kumārabhato, tassa bhāvo komārabhaccaṃ, kumāro eva vā komāro, bhatanaṃ
analyzed: kumāram bharati iti kumārabhataḥ tassa bhāvaḥ komārabhaccam kumāraḥ eva vā komāraḥ bhatanam
translated: “A boy’s food” is what is called a boy’s food. The state of that is boy’s foodness. Or a boy is a boy; his food is food for him.

original: bhaccaṃ, tassa bhaccaṃ tathā, tadabhinipphādakaṃ vejjakammanti attho. Mūlāni padhānāni
analyzed: bhaccam tassa bhaccam tathā tad abhinipphādakam vejja kammanti attho mūlāni padhānāni
translated: That is the meaning. “Medical treatment for the purpose of that” is medical treatment that brings that about.

original: rogūpasamane samatthāni bhesajjāni mūlabhesajjāni, mūlānaṃ vā byādhīnaṃ bhesajjāni
analyzed: roga upasamane samatthāni bhesajjāni mūla bhesajjāni mūlānam vā byādhīnam bhesajjāni
translated: Medicines that are roots and are capable of allaying diseases are root medicines. Or they are medicines for diseases that have roots.

original: tathā. Mūlānubandhavasena hi duvidho byādhi. Tatra mūlabyādhimhi tikicchite yebhuyyena
analyzed: tathā mūla anubandha vasena hi duvidhaḥ tatra mūla byādhimhi tikicchite
translated: and so on. For sickness is of two kinds, as root and as sequel. When the root sickness is treated, then

original: itaraṃ vūpasamati, tenāha “kāyatikicchataṃ dassetī”tiādi. Tattha kāyatikicchatanti
analyzed: itaram vūpasamati tena āha kāya tikicchatam dasseti itiādi tattha kāya tikicchatam ti
translated: generally the other one subsides too. Hence he said, “He shows treatment for the body” and so on. Herein, treatment for the body is

original: mūlabhāvato sarīrabhūtehi bhesajjehi, sarīrabhūtānaṃ vā rogānaṃ tikicchakabhāvaṃ.🔽Khārādīnīti khārodakādīni. Tadanurūpe vaṇeti vūpasamitassa mūlabyādhino anucchavike
analyzed: mūla bhāvataḥ sarīra bhūtehi bhesajjehi sarīra bhūtānam vā rogānam tikicchaka bhāvam  khāra ādīni iti khāra udaka ādīni tad anurūpe vaṇe iti vūpasamitassa mūlabyādhinaḥ anucchavike
translated: the state of being a cure for sicknesses that are a part of the body by means of medicines that are a part of the body.🔽The word and so on in “alkaline, etc.” includes water, etc.,🔽and the wound that is suitable to it is the one that is suitable to the subsided root sickness.🔽The word and so on in “removing, etc.” includes carrying away,

original: arumhi. Tesanti mūlabhesajjānaṃ. Apanayanaṃ apaharaṇaṃ, tehi atikicchananti vuttaṃ
analyzed: arumhi mūlabhesajjānam apanayanam apaharaṇam tehi atikicchanam ti vuttam
translated: and so on. The meaning is that he treats it with those.

original: hoti. Idañca komārabhaccasallakattasālākiyādivisesabhūtānaṃ tantīnaṃ pubbe vuttattā
analyzed: hoti idam ca komāra bhacca sallakatta sālākiya ādi visesa bhūtānam tantīnam pubbe vutta ttā
translated: And this is said by way of the most outstanding instance, since the other kinds of thread, such as the Komārabhacca thread, the thread of the Sāḷikā Sutta, and so on, have already been mentioned above.

original: pārisesavasena vuttaṃ, tasmā tadavasesāya tantiyā idha saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo, sabbāni
analyzed: pārisesa vasena vuttam tasmā tad avasesāya tantiyāḥ idha saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo sabbāni
translated: Therefore the inclusion here should be understood as being of the remaining kinds of thread.

original: cetāni ājīvahetukāniyeva idhādhippetāni “micchājīvena jīvikaṃ kappentī”ti vuttattā.
analyzed: cetāni ājīva hetukāni iva idha adhippetāni micchājīvena jīvikam kappenti iti vutta ttā
translated: And all these are included here as being only due to wrong livelihood, since it is said, “They make their living by wrong livelihood.”

original: Yaṃ pana tattha tattha pāḷiyaṃ “iti vā”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha itī-ti pakāratthe nipāto,
analyzed: yam pana tattha tattha pāḷiyam iti vā ati vuttam tattha iti iti pakāra atthe nipātaḥ
translated: But what is said here and there in the text by the words “or thus” is as follows.🔽Here the word iti is a particle in the sense of “in this way,”🔽and the word vā is in the sense of “alternatively.” This is the meaning: “In this way or in some other way.”

original: vā-ti vikappanatthe. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – iminā pakārena, ito aññena vāti. Tena yāni
analyzed: vā ati vikappana atthe idam vuttam hoti iminā pakārena itas aññena vā ati tena yāni
translated: Thus it should be understood that the inclusion of the following is made by the words “or thus”:

original: ito bāhirakapabbajitā sippāyatanavijjāṭṭhānādīni jīvikopāyabhūtāni ājīvikapakatā🔽upajīvanti, tesaṃ pariggaho katoti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: itas bāhiraka pabbajitā sippāyatana vijjāṭṭhāna ādīni jīvikā upāya bhūtāni ājīvika paka tā  upajīvanti tesam pariggahaḥ kato ti veditabbam
translated: the arts and crafts, the branches of knowledge, etc., which are the means of livelihood for those who have gone forth outside the Dispensation and which they maintain as their means of livelihood.

original: Mahāsīlavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mahāsīla vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the Great Man is ended.

original: Pubbantakappikasassatavādavaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the eternalists who are speculators about the past

original: 28. Idāni suññatāpakāsanavārassatthaṃ vaṇṇento anusandhiṃ pakāsetuṃ “eva”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: idāni suñña tā pakāsana vārassa attham vaṇṇentaḥ anusandhim pakāsetum eva nti ādim āha
translated: Now, in order to set forth the connection, the Master said “Thus” at the beginning of the section on the exposition of emptiness.

original: Tattha vuttavaṇṇassāti sahatthe chaṭṭhivacanaṃ, sāmiatthe vā anusandhi-saddassa bhāvakammavasena
analyzed: tattha vutta vaṇṇassa ati saha atthe chaṭṭhi vacanam sāmi atthe vā anusandhi saddassa bhāva kamma vasena
translated: Here, the word vuttavaṇṇaṃ is in the sixth case, the locative, in the sense of “from,” or it is in the sense of “ownership,”🔽because the word anusandhi occurs in the passive voice in the sense of “action” and “cause.”

original: kiriyādesanāsu pavattanato. Bhikkhusaṅghena vuttavaṇṇassāti “yāvañcidaṃ tena bhagavatā”tiādinā
analyzed: kiriyā desanāsu pavattanataḥ bhikkhu saṅghena vutta vaṇṇassa iti yāvat idam tena bhagavatā atiādinā
translated: The word bhikkhusaṅghena vuttavaṇṇaṃ is analyzed as follows: bhikkhusaṅghena = by the Community of Bhikkhus; vuttavaṇṇaṃ = the praise spoken.

original: vuttavaṇṇassa. Tatra pāḷiyaṃ ayaṃ sambandho – na bhikkhave, ettakā eva buddhaguṇā
analyzed: vutta vaṇṇassa tatra pāḷiyam ayam sambandhaḥ na bhikkhave ettakāḥ eva buddha guṇāḥ
translated: Herein, the text is as follows: “Bhikkhus, the special qualities of a Buddha are not limited to what is clear to you.

original: ye tumhākaṃ pākaṭā, apākaṭā pana “atthi bhikkhave, aññe dhammā”ti vitthāro. “Ime
analyzed: ye tumhākam pākaṭāḥ a pākaṭāḥ pana atthi bhikkhave aññe dhammā ati vitthāraḥ ime
translated: But there are other ideas, bhikkhus, besides these ideas, and there are other special qualities of a Buddha besides these special qualities of a Buddha, bhikkhus” .

original: diṭṭhiṭṭhānā evaṃ gahitā”tiādinā sassatādidiṭṭhiṭṭhānānaṃ yathāgahitākārassa suññabhāvappakāsanato,
analyzed: diṭṭhi ṭṭhānā evam gahitā tiādinā sassata ādi diṭṭhi ṭṭhānānam yathā gahita ākārassa suñña bhāva pakāsanato
translated: The exposition of voidness is the teaching of this Thread because it shows the voidness of the aspect as assumed of the standpoints of view such as the eternity view, etc., by the words “These standpoints of view are assumed in such a way” ,

original: “tañca pajānanaṃ na parāmasatī”ti sīlādīnañca aparāmasanīyabhāvadīpanena niccasārādivirahappakāsanato,🔽yāsu vedanāsu avītarāgatāya bāhirānaṃ etāni diṭṭhivibandhakāni sambhavanti, tāsaṃ
analyzed: tat ca na parāmasati iti sīla ādīnam ca a parāmasanīya bhāva dīpanena nicca sāra ādi viraha ppakāsanato  yāsu vedanāsu avīta rāga tāya etāni diṭṭhi vibandhakāni sambhavanti tāsam
translated: and because it shows the absence of any permanent core, etc., by showing how the virtue, etc., are not to be clung to by the words “And that understanding does not misapprehend” ,

original: paccayabhūtānañca sammohādīnaṃ vedakakārakasabhāvābhāvadassanamukhena sabbadhammānaṃ
analyzed: paccaya bhūtānam ca sammoha ādīnam vedaka kāraka sabhāva abhāva dassana mukhena sabba dhammānam
translated: and because it shows the absence of any self-confined in any ideas by the words “In whatever feelings … there is no misapprehending of virtue, etc., as a self” ,

original: attattaniyatāvirahadīpanato, anupādāparinibbānadīpanato ca ayaṃ desanā suññatāvibhāvanappadhānāti
analyzed: atta tta niyata aviraha dīpanataḥ anupāda aparinibbāna dīpanataḥ ca ayam desanā suñña tā vibhāvana padhānā ti
translated: and because it shows the extinction by non-grasping by the words “He is called a bhikkhu who has been shaken, not unshaken, by the shaking of ideas, who has been stirred, not unstirred, by the stirring of ideas, who has been extinguished, not unextinguished, by the extinction of ideas” .

original: āha “suññatāpakāsanaṃ ārabhī”ti.
analyzed: āha suññata apakāsanam ārabhi iti
translated: So it was in order to show the exposition of voidness that the Blessed One “began the exposition of voidness” .

original: Pariyattīti vinayādibhedabhinnā manasā vavatthāpitā tanti. Desanāti tassā tantiyā
analyzed: pariyattī iti vinaya ādi bheda bhinnā manasā vavatthāpitā tanti tassā tantiyā
translated: ‘The learning’ is the thread of the Teaching as defined by the mind, divided into the Vinaya, etc.

original: manasā vavatthāpitāya vibhāvanā, yathādhammaṃ dhammābhilāpabhūtā vā paññāpanā, anulomādivasena🔽vā kathananti pariyattidesanānaṃ viseso pubbeyeva vavatthāpitoti imamatthaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: manasā vavatthāpitāya vibhāvanā yathādhammam dhamma abhilāpa bhūtā vā paññāpanā anuloma ādi vasena  vā kathanan ti pariyatti desanānam visesaḥ pubbe iya iva vavatthāpito ti imam attham sandhāya
translated: ‘The teaching’ is the exposition of that thread of the Teaching as defined by the mind, or the definition of it as the knowledge that is the expression of the Teaching according to the Teaching, or🔽the explanation of it by the method of the ‘concordant,’ etc. The difference between the learning and the teaching has already been defined above. With this meaning in mind it is said: ‘The teaching and the learning.’

original: “desanāya, pariyattiya”nti ca vuttaṃ. Evamādīsūti ettha ādi-saddena saccasabhāvasamādhipaññāpakatipuññāpattiñeyyādayo
analyzed: desanāya pariyattiyanti ca vuttam evamādīsu iti ettha ādi saddena
translated: ‘And so on’ includes the Truths, the nature of things, concentration, understanding, the natural result of kamma, merit, the training rules, the knowable, etc.

original: saṅgayhanti. Tathā hi ayaṃ dhamma-saddo “catunnaṃ bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ ananubodhā”tiādīsu
analyzed: saṅgayhanti tathā hi ayam dhamma saddo catunnam bhikkhave dhammānam an anubodha ati ādīsu
translated: For this word ‘Dhamma’ occurs in the sense of ‘Truth’ in such passages as ‘Bhikkhus, it is through not fully understanding four dhammas’ ,

original: sacce pavattati, “kusalā dhammā akusalā dhammā”tiādīsu sabhāve, “evaṃdhammā te bhagavanto
analyzed: sacce pavattati kusalāḥ dhammāḥ akusalāḥ dhammā ati ādīsu sabhāve evaṃdhammā te bhagavanto
translated: in the sense of ‘the nature of things’ in such passages as ‘Wholesome dhammas, unwholesome dhammas’ , in the sense of ‘concentration’ in such passages as ‘Such was their Dhamma’ ,

original: ahesu”ntiādīsu samādhimhi, “saccaṃ dhammo dhiti cāgo, sa ve pecca na socati”tiādīsu
analyzed: samādhimhi saccam dhammaḥ ca āgo sa ve na
translated: in the sense of ‘generosity’ in such passages as ‘Truth, Dhamma, self-control, generosity—he has no cause for sorrow in the other world’ ,

original: paññāyaṃ, “jātidhammānaṃ bhikkhave, sattānaṃ evaṃ icchā uppajjatī”tiādīsu pakatiyaṃ,
analyzed: paññāyam jāti dhammānam bhikkhave sattānam evam icchā uppajjati iti ādīsu pakatiyam
translated: In the case of the words “paññāya” , “jātidhammānaṃ bhikkhave sattānaṃ evaṃ icchā uppajjati” , etc., it is in the sense of nature.

original: “dhammo suciṇṇo sukhamāvahātī”tiādīsu puññe, “cattāro pārājikā dhammā”tiādīsu āpattiyaṃ,
analyzed: dhammo su ciṇṇaḥ sukham āvahāti itiādīsu puññe cattāro pārājikāḥ dhammā atiādīsu āpattiyam
translated: In the case of the words “dhammo suciṇṇo sukhamāvahāti” , etc., it is in the sense of merit. In the case of the words “cattāro pārājikā dhammā” , etc., it is in the sense of offence.

original: “sabbe dhammā sabbākārena buddhassa bhagavato ñāṇamukhe āpāthamāgacchantī”tiādīsu
analyzed: sabbe dhammā sabba ākārena buddhassa bhagavataḥ ñāṇa mukhe āpātham āgacchanti itiādīsu
translated: In the case of the words “sabbe dhammā sabbākārena buddhassa bhagavato ñāṇamukhe āpāthamāgacchantī” , etc., it is in the sense of the knowable.🔽The meaning is: the seven kinds of living beings are void of self, and are mere dhamma.

original: ñeyye pavattati. Dhammā hontīti sattajīvato suññā dhammamattā hontīti attho. Kimatthiyaṃ
analyzed: ñeyye pavattati dhammāḥ honti iti satta jīvataḥ suññāḥ dhamma mattāḥ honti iti attho kimatthiyam
translated: What is the purpose of the word “dhamma”?

original: guṇe pavattananti āha “tasmā”tiādi.
analyzed: guṇe āha tasmā atiādi
translated: The answer is: “Therefore, etc.”

original: Makasatuṇḍasūciyāti sūcimukhamakkhikāya tuṇḍasaṅkhātāya sūciyā. Alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭho🔽viyāti sambandho. Aññatra tathāgatāti ṭhapetvā tathāgataṃ. “Duddasā”ti padeneva tesaṃ
analyzed: makasa tuṇḍa sūciyā ti sūci mukha makkhikāya tuṇḍa saṅkhātāya sūciyā alabbhaneyya patiṭṭho  viya ati sambandhaḥ aññatra tathāgatā ati ṭhapetvā tathāgatam duddasā ati padena iva tesam
translated: The tip of a needle of a gnat: the tip of the needle-like proboscis of a mosquito.🔽The compound is to be resolved as follows: “alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭho viya aññatra tathāgatā.”🔽The words “duddasā” show that those dhammas are difficult to penetrate.

original: dhammānaṃ dukkhogāhatā pakāsitāti “alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭhā” icceva vuttaṃ. Labhitabbāti
analyzed: dhammānam dukkha ugāha tā pakāsitā ati alabbhaneyya patiṭṭhā icca iva vuttam labhitabbā ati
translated: Therefore, it is said: “alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭho.”

original: labbhanīyā, sā eva labbhaneyyā, labhīyate vā labbhanaṃ, tamarahatīti labbhaneyyā,
analyzed: labbhanīyā sā eva labbhaneyyā labhīyate vā labbhanam tam arahati iti labbhaneyyā
translated: What is to be reached is what is reachable. Or the reachable is that which is reached. Or the reachable is that which is capable of being reached.

original: na labbhaneyyā alabbhaneyyā, patiṭṭhahanti etthāti patiṭṭhā, patiṭṭhahanaṃ vā patiṭṭhā,🔽alabbhaneyyā patiṭṭhā etthāti alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭhā. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – sace koci
analyzed: na labbhaneyyā a labbhaneyyā patiṭṭhahanti ettha ati patiṭṭhā patiṭṭhahanam vā patiṭṭhā  alabbhaneyyā patiṭṭhā ettha ati alabbhaneyya patiṭṭhā idam vuttam hoti sace koci
translated: What is not to be reached is un-reachable. It is a standing-place, or it is the act of standing,

original: attano pamāṇaṃ ajānanto ñāṇena te dhamme ogāhituṃ ussāhaṃ kareyya, tassa taṃ ñāṇaṃ
analyzed: attanaḥ pamāṇam a jānantaḥ ñāṇena te dhamme ogāhitum ussāham kareyya tassa tam ñāṇam
translated: The un-reachable standing-place is the un-reachable standing-place. This is what is said: if anyone, not knowing his own measure, were to make an effort to fathom those ideas with his knowledge,

original: appatiṭṭhameva makasatuṇḍasūci viya mahāsamuddeti. Ogāhitumasakkuṇeyyatāya “ettakā🔽ete īdisā vā”ti te passituṃ na sakkāti vuttaṃ “gambhīrattā eva duddasā”ti. Ye pana
analyzed: appatiṭṭham eva makasa tuṇḍa sūci viya mahā samudde iti ogāhitum a sakkuṇeyya tāya ettakā  ete īdisāḥ vā ti te passitum na sakkā iti vuttam gambhīra ttā eva duddasā ati ye pana
translated: his knowledge would be like a ploughshare in the great ocean,

original: daṭṭhumeva na sakkā, tesaṃ ogāhitvā anu anu bujjhane kathā eva natthīti āha “duddasattā🔽eva duranubodhāti. Sabbakilesapariḷāhapaṭippassaddhisaṅkhātaaggaphalamatthake samuppannatā,
analyzed: daṭṭhum eva na sakkā tesam ogāhitvā anu anu bujjhane kathā eva natthi iti āha duddasa ttā 🔽eva duranubodhā ti sabba kilesa pariḷāha paṭippassaddhi saṅkhāta agga phala matthake samuppanna tā
translated: it would not be able to stand the fathoming, and so it is said that ‘ they are hard to see because of their profundity ‘. But those who cannot see them at all have no question of fathoming them, and so it is said that ‘ they are hard to fathom because of their profundity ‘.🔽The meaning is that they are not to be seen by anyone who has not reached the plane of seeing .🔽The meaning is that they are not to be seen by anyone who has not reached the plane of seeing .🔽The meaning is that they are not to be seen by anyone who has not reached the plane of seeing .

original: purecarānucaravasena nibbutasabbakilesapariḷāhasamāpattisamokiṇṇattā ca nibbutasabbapariḷāhā.🔽Tabbhāvato santāti attho. Santārammaṇāni maggaphalanibbānāni anupasantasabhāvānaṃ
analyzed: purecara anucara vasena nibbuta sabba kilesa pariḷāha samāpatti samokiṇṇa ttā ca nibbuta sabba pariḷāhā  tad bhāvataḥ santā ti attho santa ārammaṇāni magga phala nibbānāni anupasanta sabhāvānam
translated: and because of being mixed with the attainment of the cessation of all defilements and of all the fires of passion, etc., which have been extinguished by the practice of the path, they are “extinguished” .🔽The meaning is that they are “peaceful” in the sense of being in that state.

original: kilesānaṃ, saṅkhārānañca abhāvato.🔽Atha vā kasiṇugghāṭimākāsatabbisayaviññāṇānaṃ anantabhāvo viya susamūhatavikkhepatāya
analyzed: abhāvataḥ  atha vā ananta bhāvaḥ viya su samūha ta vikkhepa tāya
translated: The path, fruition, and Nibbāna, which are the objects of the peaceful, are peaceful in the sense of being the nature of the complete pacification of defilements and formations.

original: niccasamāhitassa manasikārassa vasena tadārammaṇadhammānaṃ santabhāvo veditabbo.
analyzed: nicca samāhitassa manasikārassa vasena tad ārammaṇa dhammānam santa bhāvaḥ veditabbo
translated: Or alternatively, just as the space that is the object of the kasiṇa is infinite, so too the objects of the mind should be understood to be peaceful by virtue of the attention that is constantly concentrated, having completely abandoned distraction.

original: Avirajjhitvā nimittapaṭivedho viya issāsānaṃ avirajjhitvā dhammānaṃ yathābhūtasabhāvāvabodho
analyzed: a virajjhitvā nimitta paṭivedhaḥ viya issāsānam a virajjhitvā dhammānam yathā bhūta sabhāva avabodho
translated: Just as the hitting of the target without missing is the supreme delight of archers, so too the direct knowledge of dhammas without missing is the supreme delight of those who are devoted to insight.

original: sāduraso mahārasova hotīti āha “atittikaraṇaṭṭhenā”ti, atappanakaraṇasabhāvenāti
analyzed: sādu rasaḥ mahā rasaḥ uva hoti iti āha a tittikaraṇa ṭṭhena ati a tappana karaṇa sabhāvena ati
translated: Therefore it is said: “In the sense of satisfying, of satiating” . The meaning is: in the sense of being the nature of satiating, of satisfying.

original: attho. Sohiccaṃ titti tappananti hi pariyāyo. Atittikaraṇaṭṭhenāti patthetvā sādurasakaraṇaṭṭhenātipi
analyzed: attho sohiccam titti tappananti hi pariyāyaḥ a titti karaṇa ṭṭhena ati patthetvā sādu rasa karaṇa ṭṭhena atipi
translated: For the word “satisfying” is synonymous with “satiating” and “satisfying.” In the sense of satisfying means in the sense of satisfying by seeking.

original: atthaṃ vadanti. Paṭivedhappattānaṃ tesu ca buddhānameva sabbākārena visayabhāvūpagamanato
analyzed: attham vadanti paṭivedha ppattānam tesu ca buddhānam eva sabba ākārena visaya bhāva upagamanato
translated: and they speak of the meaning. And because only Buddhas have the whole field of that meaning,

original: na takkabuddhiyā gocarāti āha “uttamañāṇavisayattā”tiādi. Nipuṇāti ñeyyesu tikkhappavattiyā
analyzed: na takka buddhiyāḥ gocarā iti āha uttama ñāṇa visaya ttā atiādi nipuṇā ati ñeyyesu tikkha ppavattiyā
translated: it is not the province of the guesser’s knowledge. That is why he said “because it is the province of the highest knowledge.” “Subtle” : it is subtle because of the subtlety of the object.

original: chekā. Yasmā pana so chekabhāvo ārammaṇe appaṭihatavuttitāya, sukhumañeyyaggahaṇasamatthatāya
analyzed: chekāḥ yasmā pana saḥ cheka bhāvaḥ ārammaṇe appaṭihata vutti tāya sukhuma ñeyya ggahaṇa samattha tāya
translated: But the subtlety is evident because of the unobstructed occurrence of the knowledge in the object and because of the ability to apprehend a subtle object.

original: ca supākaṭo hoti, tasmā vuttaṃ “saṇhasukhumasabhāvattā”ti. Paṇḍitehiyevāti avadhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: ca su pākaṭaḥ hoti tasmā vuttam saṇha sukhuma sabhāvattā ati avadhāraṇam
translated: That is why he said “because of the nature of its subtlety and subtleness.”

original: samatthetuṃ “bālānaṃ avisayattā”ti āha.
analyzed: samatthetum bālānam a visaya ttā iti āha
translated: The qualification “only by the wise” is given because it is not the province of fools.

original: Ayaṃ aṭṭhakathānayato aparo nayo – vinayapaṇṇattiādigambhīraneyyavibhāvanato gambhīrā.
analyzed: ayam aṭṭhakathā nayataḥ aparaḥ nayaḥ vinaya paṇṇatti ādi gambhīra neyya vibhāvanataḥ gambhīrā
translated: This is another method of explanation different from that of the commentary. It is “profound” because it reveals the profundity of the object to be known, such as the analysis of the Vinaya rules.

original: Kadāciyeva asaṅkhyeyye mahākappe atikkamitvāpi dullabhadassanatāya duddasā. Dassanañcettha
analyzed: kadāciya iva asaṅkhyeyye mahā kappe atikkamitvā api dullabha dassana tāya duddasā dassanam ca ittha
translated: It is “difficult to see” because it is not seen even after a very long time, after the lapse of incalculable great aeons. But “seeing” here should be understood as the eye of wisdom.

original: paññācakkhuvaseneva veditabbaṃ. Dhammanvayasaṅkhātassa anubodhassa kassacideva sambhavato
analyzed: paññā cakkhu vasena iva veditabbam dhamma anvaya saṅkhātassa anubodhassa kassacid eva sambhavataḥ
translated: It is “difficult to comprehend” because it is only possible for some to comprehend it by the understanding called “conformity to the True Idea.”

original: duranubodhā. Santasabhāvato, veneyyānañca sabbaguṇasampadānaṃ pariyosānattā santā.🔽Attano paccayehi padhānabhāvaṃ nītatāya paṇītā. Samadhigatasaccalakkhaṇatāya atakkehi🔽puggalehi, atakkena vā ñāṇena avacaritabbato atakkāvacarā. Nipuṇaṃ, nipuṇe vā atthe
analyzed: duranubodhā santa sabhāvataḥ veneyyānam ca sabba guṇa sampadānam pariyosānattā santā  attanaḥ paccayehi padhāna bhāvam nīta tāya paṇītā samadhigata sacca lakkhaṇa tāya a takkehi  puggalehi atakkena vā ñāṇena avacaritabbataḥ atakkāvacarāḥ nipuṇam nipuṇe vā atthe
translated: It is hard to understand. It is peaceful because of the state of peace, and because it is the culmination of all the good qualities of the disciples.🔽It is sublime because it has been brought to the highest point by its own conditions. It is not within the sphere of reasoning because it cannot be investigated by people who are not seers, or by knowledge that is not penetrating.

original: saccapaccayākārādivasena vibhāvanato nipuṇā. Loke aggapaṇḍitena sammāsambuddhena
analyzed: sacca paccaya ākāra ādi vasena vibhāvanataḥ nipuṇā loke agga paṇḍitena sammāsambuddhena
translated: It is subtle because it is subtle in meaning, or🔽because it is subtle in the way it is analyzed by means of the characteristics of the truths, etc.

original: veditabbato pakāsitabbato paṇḍitavedanīyā.🔽Anāvaraṇañāṇapaṭilābhato hi bhagavā “sabbavidūhamasmi, dasabalasamannāgato bhikkhave,
analyzed: veditabbataḥ pakāsitabbataḥ paṇḍita vedanīyā  anāvaraṇa ñāṇa paṭilābhataḥ hi bhagavā sabba vidūham asmi dasa bala samannāgataḥ bhikkhave
translated: It is to be known by the wise because it is to be known and revealed by the supremely wise one, the Perfectly Enlightened One.🔽For the Blessed One, by attaining unobstructed knowledge, revealed his own qualities of omniscience, etc., with such statements as: “I am all-knowing, bhikkhus,

original: tathāgato”tiādinā attano sabbaññutādiguṇe pakāsesi, tenevāha “sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā
analyzed: tathāgataḥ iti ādinā attanaḥ sabbaññu tā ādi guṇe pakāsesi tena iva āha sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā
translated: the Tathāgata, the One Endowed with the Ten Powers.” Therefore it is said: “He reveals after realizing it by himself with direct knowledge.”

original: pavedetī”ti. Sayaṃ-saddena, niddhāritāvadhāraṇena vā nivattetabbamatthaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: paveda iti iti sayam saddena niddhārita avadhāraṇena vā nivattetabbam attham dassetum
translated: In order to show the meaning that is to be excluded by the word “himself” or by the specification,🔽he said:

original: “anaññaneyyo hutvā”ti vuttaṃ, aññehi abodhito hutvāti attho. Abhiññāti ya-kāralopo🔽“aññāṇatā āpajjatī”tiādīsu viyāti dasseti “abhivisiṭṭhena ñāṇenā”ti iminā. Apica🔽“sayaṃ abhiññā”ti padassa anaññaneyyo hutvāti atthavacanaṃ, “sacchikatvā”ti padassa
analyzed: an aññaneyyaḥ hutvā iti vuttam aññehi a bodhitaḥ hutvā iti atthaḥ abhiññā iti yakāra lopaḥ  aññāṇa tā āpajjati itiādīsu viyā ati dasseti abhivisiṭṭhena ñāṇena ati iminā apica  sayam abhiññā ati padassa anaññaneyyaḥ hutvā iti attha vacanam sacchikatvā iti padassa
translated: “Having become one who is not dependent on others” is said, the meaning is: having become one who is not instructed by others.🔽“Having direct knowledge” is the omission of the ya-vowel sign.🔽“Having direct knowledge” is shown in the words “having become one who is not dependent on others” as in the passages beginning with “he falls into ignorance” and so on.🔽Moreover, the words “having become one who is not dependent on others” are a statement of the meaning of the words “having direct knowledge,”

original: pana sayameva…pe… katvāti. Sayaṃ-saddā hi sacchikatvāti etthāpi sambajjhitabbo. Abhivisiṭṭhena
analyzed: pana katvā iti sayam saddāḥ hi sacchikatvā iti ettha api sambajjhitabbaḥ abhivisiṭṭhena
translated: but the words “having realized for himself with direct knowledge”🔽are a statement of the meaning of the words “having realized for himself with direct knowledge.”

original: ñāṇenāti ca tassa hetuvacanaṃ, karaṇavacanaṃ vā.
analyzed: ñāṇena ati ca tassa hetu vacanam karaṇa vacanam vā
translated: The words “with direct knowledge” are a statement of the reason or a statement of the instrument.

original: Tattha kiñcāpi sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ phalanibbānāni viya sacchikātabbasabhāvaṃ na hoti,🔽āsavakkhayañāṇe pana adhigate adhigatameva hoti, tasmā tassa paccakkhakaraṇaṃ sacchikiriyāti
analyzed: tattha kiñcā api sabbaññuta ññāṇam phala nibbānāni viya sacchikātabba sabhāvam na hoti  āsava kkhaya ñāṇe pana adhigate adhigatam eva hoti tasmā tassa paccakkhakaraṇam sacchikiriyāti
translated: Herein, although the knowledge of omniscience is not of the nature to be realized like the fruit of Nibbāna,🔽when the knowledge of the destruction of the taints is attained, it is attained, therefore the making it evident is the realization.🔽Therefore it is said: “having made it evident with direct knowledge.” This is a statement of the reason in the sense of cause, or a statement of the instrument,

original: āha “abhivisiṭṭhena ñāṇena paccakkhaṃ katvā”ti. Hetuatthe cetaṃ karaṇavacanaṃ, aggamaggañāṇasaṅkhātassa
analyzed: āha abhivisiṭṭhena ñāṇena paccakkham katvā iti hetu atthe ca itam karaṇa vacanam agga magga ñāṇa saṅkhātassa
translated: the knowledge called the path of Arahantship.

original: abhivisiṭṭhañāṇassādhigamahetūti attho. Abhivisiṭṭhañāṇanti vā paccavekkhaṇāñāṇe🔽adhippete karaṇatthe karaṇavacanampi yujjateva. Pavedanañcettha aññāvisayānaṃ saccādīnaṃ
analyzed: abhivisiṭṭha ñāṇassa adhigama hetu uti atthaḥ abhivisiṭṭha ñāṇam ti vā paccavekkhaṇā ñāṇe  adhippete karaṇa atthe karaṇa vacanam pi yujjatā iva pavedanam ca ittha aññā visayānam sacca ādīnam
translated: The meaning is: for the purpose of attaining the knowledge that is pre-eminent. Or else, the knowledge that is pre-eminent is the knowledge of reviewing.🔽The instrumental case is appropriate in the sense of instrument.

original: desanākiccasādhanato, “ekomhi sammāsambuddho”tiādinā paṭijānanato ca veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: desanā kicca sādhanataḥ ekaḥ amhi sammāsambuddhaḥ ti ādinā paṭijānanataḥ ca veditabbam
translated: The meaning of “opening” here should be understood as the accomplishment of the function of teaching the truths, etc., which are the domain of the other kinds of knowledge, and as the declaration “I am the One in the world who is fully enlightened” .

original: Guṇadhammehīti guṇasaṅkhātehi dhammehi. Yathābhūtameva yathābhuccaṃ sakatthe ṇyapaccayavasena.🔽Vadamānāti ettha sattiattho mānasaddo yathā “ekapuggalo bhikkhave, loke uppajjamāno
analyzed: guṇa dhammehi iti guṇa saṅkhātehi dhammehi yathābhūtam eva yathābhuccam saka tthe ṇya paccaya vasena  vadamānā ti ettha satti atthaḥ māna saddaḥ yathā eka puggalaḥ bhikkhave loke uppajjamānaḥ
translated: By means of the dhammas that are his special qualities: by means of the dhammas called “special qualities.” As it really is : as it really is, according to the real state of things, by means of the gerundive suffix ṇya.

original: uppajjatī”ti, tasmā vattuṃ ussāhaṃ karontoti attho. Evaṃbhūtā hi vattukāmā nāma honti,🔽tenāha “tathāgatassā”tiādi. Sāvasesaṃ vadantāpi viparītavadantā viya sammā vadantīti
analyzed: uppajjati iti tasmai vattum ussāham karontaḥ iti attho evaṃbhūtāḥ hi vattu kāmāḥ nāma honti  tena āha tathāgatassa atiādi sa avasesam vadantā api viparīta vadantā viya sammā vadanti iti
translated: When he speaks: the word “manas” has the meaning of “sati” . As in the passage: “Bhikkhus, there is the case where one person arises in the world for the welfare of the multitude, for the happiness of the multitude, out of compassion for the world, for the good, welfare, and happiness of devas and humans” .🔽Therefore the meaning is: he makes the effort to speak. For those who wish to speak are of such a nature.🔽Hence it is said: “of the Tathāgata,” etc.🔽Even when they speak with remainder, they speak correctly, and so it is not proper to say that they speak falsely.

original: na vattabbāti yathā sammā vadanti, tathā dassetuṃ “ahāpetvā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tena hi
analyzed: na vattabbā iti yathā sammā vadanti tathā dassetum a hāpetvā atiādi vuttam tena hi
translated: In order to show how they speak correctly, it is said: “without exception,” etc.

original: anavasesavadanameva sammā vadananti dasseti. “Vattuṃ sakkuṇeyyu”nti iminā ca “vadeyyu”nti
analyzed: anavasesa vadanam eva sammā vadananti dassa iti vattum sakkuṇeyyun ti iminā ca vadeyyun ti
translated: He shows that the Blessed One is speaking correctly without exception. By “they could speak” he shows the meaning of the word “would” in “they would speak” .

original: etassa samatthanatthabhāvamāha yathā “so imaṃ vijaṭaye jaṭa”nti ye evaṃ bhagavatā🔽thomitā, te dhammā katameti yojanā. “Atthi bhikkhave, aññeva dhammā”tiādipāḷiyā “sabbaññutaññāṇa”nti🔽vuttavacanassa virodhibhāvaṃ codento “yadi eva”ntiādimāha. Tattha yadi evanti evaṃ
analyzed: etassa samattha nattha bhāvam āha yathā saḥ imam vijaṭaye jaṭanti ye evam bhagavatā  thomitā te dhammā katamā iti yojanā atthi bhikkhave aññe eva dhammā ti ādi pāḷiyā sabbaññuta ññāṇam ti  vutta vacanassa virodhi bhāvam codentaḥ yadi eva iti ādim āha tattha yadi eva iti evam
translated: The question is asked: “What are those things that the Blessed One has extolled in this way: ‘They could speak’?”🔽He asks the question: “If that is so,” etc., pointing out the contradiction in the statement “knowledge of omniscience” . Herein, if that is so means if the statement “knowledge of omniscience” is so.

original: “sabbaññutaññāṇa”nti vuttavacanaṃ yadi siyāti attho. Bahuvacananiddesoti “atthi bhikkhave”tiādīni
analyzed: sabbaññu taññāṇanti vutta vacanam yadi siyāti atthaḥ bahuvacana niddeso ti atthi bhikkhave itiādīni
translated: The plural in “these things” is said with reference to the passage beginning, “Bhikkhus, there are other things” .

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Atthi-saddopi hi idha bahuvacanoyeva “atthi khīrā, atthi gāvo”tiādīsu
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam atthi saddaḥ api hi idha bahuvacanaḥ yā iva atthi khīrāḥ atthi gāvaḥ ti ādīsu
translated: For the word “is” here is in the plural only, like such expressions as “There is milk, there are cows.”

original: viya nipātabhāvasseva icchitattā. Yadipi tadidaṃ ñāṇaṃ ekameva sabhāvato, tathāpi
analyzed: nipāta bhāvassa iva icchita ttā yadi pi tat idam ñāṇam ekam eva tathā api
translated: Although this knowledge is only one in its individual essence, still it is called “these things” in the sense of its being the basis for the ascription of the knowledge of omniscience.

original: sampayogato, ārammaṇato ca puthuvacanappayogamarahatīti vissajjeti “puthucitta…pe…
analyzed: sampayogataḥ ārammaṇato ca puthuvacana ppayogam arahati iti vissajja iti
translated: It is proper to use the word “diverse” because of the diversity of association and of object. He answers, “Because of the diversity of consciousnesses, etc., and because of the diversity of objects.”

original: rammaṇato”ti iminā. Puthucittasamāyogatoti puthūhi cittehi sampayogato. Puthūni ārammaṇāni
analyzed: rammaṇato ti iminā puthu citta samāyogato ti puthūhi cittehi sampayogato puthūni ārammaṇāni
translated: Because of the diversity of association with consciousnesses: because of the diversity of association with the various kinds of consciousness.🔽Diverse objects

original: etassāti puthuārammaṇaṃ, tabbhāvato sabbārammaṇattāti vuttaṃ hoti.🔽Apica puthu ārammaṇaṃ ārammaṇametassāti puthuārammaṇārammaṇanti etasmiṃ atthe “oṭṭhamukho,
analyzed: etassa iti puthu ārammaṇam tad bhāvato sabba ārammaṇa ttā iti vuttam hoti  apica puthu ārammaṇam ārammaṇam etassa ati puthu ārammaṇa ārammaṇam ti etasmin atthe oṭṭhamukhaḥ
translated: belong to it: thus it has diverse objects. What is meant is that it has all objects.

original: kāmāvacara”ntiādīsu viya ekassa ārammaṇasaddassa lopaṃ katvā “puthuārammaṇato”ti🔽vuttaṃ, tenassa puthuñāṇakiccasādhakattaṃ dasseti. Tathā hetaṃ ñāṇaṃ tīsu kālesu
analyzed: kāmāvacaranti ādīsu viya ekassa ārammaṇa saddassa lopam katvā puthu ārammaṇato ti  vuttam tena assa puthuñāṇa kicca sādhaka ttam dasseti tathā ha etam ñāṇam tīsu kālesu
translated: Moreover, it has diverse objects as object: thus it has diverse objects as object. In this sense, omitting the word “as” as in the expressions “the mouth of the Oṭṭha river” and “the world of the sense sphere,” he says “because of the diversity of objects.”

original: appaṭihatañāṇaṃ, catuyoniparicchedakañāṇaṃ, pañcagatiparicchedakañāṇaṃ, chasu asādhāraṇañāṇesu
analyzed: appaṭihata ñāṇam catu yoni paricchedaka ñāṇam pañca gati paricchedaka ñāṇam chasu asādhāraṇa ñāṇesu
translated: He shows that it accomplishes the function of diverse knowledge thus. For this knowledge is knowledge unobstructed as to the three times, knowledge discerning the four kinds of generation, knowledge discerning the five destinies, the six kinds of direct knowledge,

original: sesāsādhāraṇañāṇāni, sattāriyapuggalavibhāvanakañāṇaṃ, aṭṭhasu parisāsu akampanañāṇaṃ,
analyzed: sesa asādhāraṇa ñāṇāni sattāriya puggala vibhāvanaka ñāṇam aṭṭhasu parisāsu akampana ñāṇam
translated: the remaining kinds of direct knowledge that are not shared by disciples, knowledge discerning the seven kinds of persons, knowledge unshaken as to the eight assemblies,

original: navasattāvāsaparijānanañāṇaṃ, dasabalañāṇanti evamādīnaṃ anekasatasahassabhedānaṃ🔽ñāṇānaṃ yathāsambhavaṃ kiccaṃ sādheti, tesaṃ ārammaṇabhūtānaṃ anekesampi dhammānaṃ
analyzed: nava sattā vāsa parijānana ñāṇam dasa bala ñāṇam ti evamādīnam aneka sata sahassa bhedānam  ñāṇānam yathāsambhavam kiccam sādheti tesam ārammaṇa bhūtānam anekesam pi dhammānam
translated: The knowledge of the nine abodes of beings, the knowledge of the ten powers, and so on, are of many hundreds of thousands of kinds.🔽The knowledge of the four noble truths is the function of these knowledges, as appropriate, and of the many things that are their objects,🔽because they are the objects of those knowledges. “That” and so on are the respective obscurations to those knowledges. “As it is said” and so on

original: tadārammaṇabhāvatoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Tañhī”tiādi yathākkamaṃ tabbivaraṇaṃ. “Yathāhā”tiādinā🔽paṭisambhidāmaggapāḷiṃ sādhakabhāvena dasseti. Tatthāti atītadhamme. Ekavāravasena
analyzed: tad ārammaṇa bhāvato ti daṭṭhabbam tat hi itiādi yathākkamam tad vivaraṇam yathā āha atiādinā  paṭisambhidā magga pāḷim sādhaka bhāvena dasseti tattha ati atīta dhamme eka vāra vasena
translated: shows the sutta passages of the discernment of meaning as being the means of establishing the knowledge of the four noble truths. “That” means past things.🔽Having turned away from the state of being the object of the knowledge of the four noble truths, which is the function of the knowledge of the four noble truths, the knowledge of the four noble truths occurs again and again

original: puthuārammaṇabhāvaṃ nivattetvā anekavāravasena kamappavattiyā taṃ dassetuṃ “punappunaṃ🔽uppattivasenā”ti vuttaṃ. Kamenāpi hi sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ visayesu pavattati, na tathā
analyzed: puthu ārammaṇa bhāvam nivattetvā aneka vāra vasena kama ppavattiyā tam dassetum punappunam  uppatti vasena iti vuttam kamena api hi sabbaññu ta ññāṇam visayesu pavattati na tathā
translated: in the form of the knowledge of the four noble truths. In order to show that, it is said: “by way of arising again and again.”🔽For the knowledge of omniscience occurs in its objects by way of the knowledge of the four noble truths, not by way of the knowledge of omniscience itself.

original: sakiṃyeva. Yathā bāhirakā vadanti “sakiṃyeva sabbaññū sabbaṃ jānāti, na kamenā”ti.
analyzed: sakiṃya iva yathā bāhirakāḥ vadanti sakiṃya iva sabbaññū sabbam jānāti na kamena ati
translated: It is not like the knowledge of omniscience, which occurs in its objects all at once, not by way of the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: Yadi evaṃ acinteyyāparimeyyappabhedassa ñeyyassa paricchedavatā ekena ñāṇena niravasesato
analyzed: yadi evam acinteyya aparimeyya pabhedassa ñeyyassa paricchedavatā ekena ñāṇena niravasesataḥ
translated: If that is so, then how can the knowledge of omniscience, which is the object of the knowledge of the four noble truths, be known by the knowledge of the four noble truths, which is limited to the knowledge of the four noble truths?🔽For the knowable is of inconceivable and immeasurable variety.

original: kathaṃ paṭivedhoti, ko vā evamāha “paricchedavantaṃ sabbaññutaññāṇa”nti. Aparicchedañhi
analyzed: katham paṭivedhaḥ iti kaḥ vā evam āha paricchedavantam sabbaññuta ññāṇam ti a paricchedam hi
translated: How is it penetrated? Or who says that the knowledge of omniscience has a limitation?

original: taṃ ñāṇaṃ ñeyyamiva. Vuttañhetaṃ “yāvatakaṃ ñāṇaṃ, tāvatakaṃ ñeyyaṃ. Yāvatakaṃ ñeyyaṃ,
analyzed: tam ñāṇam ñeyyam iva vuttam ha etam yāvatakam ñāṇam tāvatakam ñeyyam yāvatakam ñeyyam
translated: For that knowledge is unlimited like the knowable. This is said: “As far as there is knowledge, there is that much knowable. As far as there is knowable,🔽there is that much knowledge.”

original: tāvatakaṃ ñāṇa”nti evampi jātibhūmisabhāvādivasena, disādesakālādivasena ca anekabhedabhinne
analyzed: evam pi jāti bhūmi sabhāva ādi vasena disā desa kāla ādi vasena ca aneka bheda bhinne
translated: Thus, when the knowable, which is differentiated in many ways by way of birth, plane, nature, etc., and by way of direction, place, time, etc., is being grasped in order,

original: ñeyye kamena gayhamāne anavasesapaṭivedho na sambhavatiyevāti? Nayidamevaṃ. Yañhi
analyzed: ñeyye kamena gayhamāne anavasesa paṭivedhaḥ na sambhavati yā iva ati yat hi
translated: it is not possible to penetrate it without remainder?

original: kiñci bhagavatā ñātumicchitaṃ sakalamekadeso vā, tattha appaṭihatacāritāya paccakkhato🔽ñāṇaṃ pavattati. Vikkhepābhāvato ca bhagavā sabbakālaṃ samāhitoti ñātumicchitassa
analyzed: kiñci bhagavatā ñātum icchitam sakalam eka desaḥ vā tattha appaṭihata cāritāya paccakkhataḥ  ñāṇam pavattati vikkhepa abhāvato ca bhagavā sabbakālam samāhitaḥ ti ñātum icchitassa
translated: This is not so. For whatever the Exalted One wishes to know, whether it be all or a part,🔽knowledge occurs to him in regard to that, unobstructedly, face to face.🔽And because he is free from distraction, the Exalted One is always concentrated. Therefore, it is not possible to deny that he has face-to-face knowledge of what he wishes to know.

original: paccakkhabhāvo na sakkā nivāretuṃ. Vuttañhi “ākaṅkhāpaṭibaddhaṃ buddhassa bhagavato
analyzed: paccakkha bhāvaḥ na sakkā nivāretum vuttam hi ākaṅkhā paṭibaddham buddhassa bhagavato
translated: For it is said: “The knowledge of the Exalted Buddha is bound to his wish.”

original: ñāṇa”ntiādi, nanu cettha dūrato cittapaṭaṃ passantānaṃ viya, “sabbe dhammā anattā”ti
analyzed: ñāṇa ntiādi nanu ca ittha dūratas citta paṭam passantānam viya sabbe dhammā anattā ti
translated: But if it is asked: “Is it not so that, like those who see a cloth from a distance, he knows only the general nature of dhammas, not their specific natures?”

original: vipassantānaṃ viya ca anekadhammāvabodhakāle anirūpitarūpena bhagavato ñāṇaṃ pavattatīti🔽gahetabbanti? Gahetabbaṃ acinteyyānubhāvatāya buddhañāṇassa. Tenevāha “buddhavisayo🔽acinteyyo”ti, idaṃ panettha sanniṭṭhānaṃ – sabbākārena sabbadhammāvabodhanasamatthassa
analyzed: vipassantānam viya ca aneka dhamma avabodha kāle anirūpita rūpena bhagavataḥ ñāṇam pavattati iti  gahetabbanti gahetabbam acinteyya anubhāva tāya buddha ñāṇassa tena iva āha buddha visayaḥ  acinteyyaḥ ti idam pana ittha sanniṭṭhānam sabba ākārena sabba dhamma avabodhana samatthassa
translated: And at the time of the penetration of many ideas by those who are penetrating insight, the Blessed One’s knowledge occurs in the unapprehended aspect.

original: ākaṅkhāpaṭibaddhavuttino anāvaraṇañāṇassa paṭilābhena bhagavā santānena sabbadhammapaṭivedhasamattho
analyzed: ākaṅkhā paṭibaddha vuttinaḥ anāvaraṇa ñāṇassa paṭilābhena bhagavā santānena sabba dhamma paṭivedha samatthaḥ
translated: So it is to be taken? It is to be taken, because of the inconceivable power of the Buddha’s knowledge. That is why it is said, “The province of Buddhas is inconceivable” . This is the conclusion here: the Blessed One was able to penetrate all ideas by means of the attainment of the unobstructed knowledge that occurs according to wish, which is able to penetrate all ideas in all their modes.

original: ahosi sabbaneyyāvaraṇassa pahānato, tasmā sabbaññū, na sakiṃyeva sabbadhammāvabodhato
analyzed: ahosi sabba neyya āvaraṇassa pahānato tasmā sabbaññū na sakiṃyeva sabba dhamma avabodhato
translated: He was able to do so because of the abandoning of all obscurations that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing. Therefore he is omniscient, not because of penetration of all ideas at once.

original: yathāsantānena sabbassa indhanassa dahanasamatthatāya pāvako “sabbabhū”ti vuccatīti.
analyzed: yathā santānena sabbassa indhanassa dahana samattha tāya pāvako sabbabhūti vuccati iti
translated: Just as fire is called “all-consuming” because it is able to burn all combustible matter by means of a continuity,

original: Kāmañcāyamattho pubbe vitthāritoyeva, pakārantarena pana sotujanānuggahakāmatāya,
analyzed: kāmam ca ayam atthaḥ pubbe vitthāritaḥ yā iva pakāra antarena pana sotu jana anuggaha kāma tāya
translated: And this meaning has already been given in detail above . But because of his desire to help the understanding of people of little knowledge,

original: imissā ca porāṇasaṃvaṇṇanāvisodhanavasena pavattattā puna vibhāvitoti na cettha punaruttidoso
analyzed: imissā ca porāṇa saṃvaṇṇanā visodhana vasena pavatta tā puna vibhāvitaḥ ti na ca ittha punarutti doso
translated: And since this is given in order to purify the ancient commentaries, it is not a repetition here.

original: pariyesitabbo, evamīdisesu. Ettha ca kiñcāpi bhagavato dasabalādiñāṇānipi anaññasādhāraṇāni,
analyzed: evam īdisesu ettha ca kiñcā api bhagavataḥ dasa bala ādi ñāṇāni pi anañña sādhāraṇāni
translated: But it should be sought in such passages as this. And here, although the Blessed One’s knowledge of the ten powers, etc., is not shared by others,

original: sabbadesavisayattā pana tesaṃ ñāṇānaṃ na tehi buddhaguṇā ahāpetvā gahitā nāma honti.
analyzed: sabba desa visaya ttā pana tesam ñāṇānam na tehi buddha guṇāḥ a hāpetvā gahitāḥ nāma honti
translated: nevertheless, since his knowledge has all objects, it is not that his special qualities as a Buddha are not included when that is included.

original: Sabbaññutaññāṇassa pana nippadesavisayattā tasmiṃ gahite sabbepi buddhaguṇā gahitā
analyzed: sabbaññu ta ññāṇassa pana nippadesa visaya ttā tasmin gahite sabbe api buddha guṇāḥ gahitā
translated: But when the knowledge of omniscience is included, then all his special qualities as a Buddha are included, as it were,

original: eva nāma honti, tasmā pāḷiatthānusārena tadeva ñāṇaṃ gahitanti veditabbaṃ. Pāḷiyampi
analyzed: eva nāma honti tasmā pāḷi attha anusārena tat eva ñāṇam gahitan ti veditabbam pāḷiyam pi
translated: since it has all objects without exception. So it should be understood that it is that knowledge that is included in the sense of the meaning of the text.

original: hi “yehi tathāgatassa yathābhuccaṃ vaṇṇaṃ sammā vadamānā vadeyyu”nti tameva pakāsitaṃ🔽tamantarena aññassa nippadesavisayassa abhāvato, nippadesavisayeneva ca yathābhuccaṃ
analyzed: hi ye hi tathāgatassa yathābhuccam vaṇṇam sammā vadamānāḥ vadeyyuḥ ti tam eva pakāsitam  tam antarena aññassa nippadesa visayassa abhāvataḥ nippadesa visayena iva ca yathābhuccam
translated: For in the text it is that knowledge that is revealed when it is said, “By means of which they would rightly praise the Tathāgata’s praiseworthy qualities as they really are” .

original: sammā vadanasambhavatoti.
analyzed: sammā
translated: And that is because there is no other knowledge with all objects without exception apart from that, and because it is only by means of knowledge with all objects without exception that it is possible to praise rightly as it really is.

original: Aññevāti ettha eva-saddo sanniṭṭhāpanatthoti dassetuṃ “aññevāti idaṃ panettha vavatthāpanavacana”nti
analyzed: aññā iva āti ettha eva saddo sanniṭṭhāpana attho ti dassetum aññā iva āti idam pana ittha vavatthāpana vacananti
translated: The word eva here is for the purpose of emphasis. To show this, he says: “The word eva is a term for delimitation.”🔽

original: vuttaṃ, vavatthāpanavacananti ca sanniṭṭhāpanavacananti attho, sanniṭṭhāpanañca avadhāraṇameva.
analyzed: vuttam vavatthāpana vacanan ti ca sanniṭṭhāpana vacanan ti attho sanniṭṭhāpanam ca avadhāraṇam eva
translated: The word eva here is for the purpose of delimitation. In order to show this he says, “This is a delimiting expression.” And a delimiting expression is a defining expression. And defining is the same as delimiting.

original: Kathanti āha “aññevā”tiādi. “Na pāṇātipātā veramaṇiādayo”ti iminā avadhāraṇena nivattitaṃ🔽dasseti. Ayañca eva-saddo aniyatadesatāya ca-saddo viya yattha vutto, tato aññatthāpi
analyzed: katham ti āha aññā iva itiādi na pāṇa atipātāḥ veramaṇi ādayo ti iminā avadhāraṇena nivattitam  dasseti ayam ca eva saddo aniyata desa tāya ca saddaḥ viya yattha vutto tatas aññattha api
translated: How? He says, “It is only this” and so on. By the delimiting expression “not abstention from killing living beings, etc.,” he shows what is excluded.

original: vacanicchāvasena upatiṭṭhatīti āha “gambhīrāvā”tiādi. Iti-saddena ca ādiatthena duddasāva🔽na sudasā, duranubodhāva na suranubodhā, santāva na darathā, paṇītāva na hīnā, atakkāvacarāva
analyzed: vacanicchā vasena upatiṭṭhati iti āha gambhīrāva atiādi iti saddena ca ādi atthena duddasāva  na sudasā duranubodhāva na suranubodhā santau na darathā paṇītā ava na hīnau a takka avacarāva
translated: And this word eva, like the word ca, which is used to show no distinction of place, is established by the wish to speak in a place other than that in which it is used. Therefore he says, “It is deep,” and so on.

original: na takkāvacarā, nipuṇāva na lūkhā, paṇḍitavedanīyāva na bālavedanīyāti nivattitaṃ
analyzed: na takka avacarā nipuṇā ava na lūkhā paṇḍita vedanīyā ava na bāla vedanīyā ati nivattitam
translated: And by the word iti, in the sense of “thus,” he shows what is excluded, namely, that it is not easy to see, but difficult to see, not easy to understand, but difficult to understand, not a tangle, but a calm, not low, but refined, not within the sphere of reasoning, but beyond the sphere of reasoning, not crude, but subtle, not to be known by the fool, but to be known by the wise.

original: dasseti. Sabbapadehīti yāva “paṇḍitavedanīyā”ti idaṃ padaṃ, tāva sabbapadehi.🔽Evaṃ nivattetabbataṃ yuttiyā daḷhīkaronto “sāvakapāramiñāṇa”ntiādimāha. Tattha sāvakapāramiñāṇanti🔽sāvakānaṃ dānādipāramipāripūriyā nipphannaṃ vijjattayachaḷabhiññācatupaṭisambhidābhedaṃ🔽ñāṇaṃ, tathā paccekabuddhānaṃ paccekabodhiñāṇaṃ. Tatoti sāvakapāramiñāṇato. Tatthāti🔽sāvakapāramiñāṇe. Tatopīti anantaraniddiṭṭhato paccekabodhiñāṇatopi. Api-saddena,🔽pi-saddena vā ko pana vādo sāvakapāramiñāṇatoti sambhāveti. Tatthāpīti paccekabodhiñāṇepi.
analyzed: dassa iti sabba padehi iti yāva paṇḍita vedanīyā ati idam padam tāva sabba padehi  evam nivattetabba tam yuttiyā daḷhīkarontaḥ sāvaka pāramiñāṇa nti ādim āha tattha sāvaka pāramiñāṇam ti  sāvakānam dāna ādi pārami pāripūriyā nipphannam vijjattaya chaṭ abhiññā catu paṭisambhidā bhedam  ñāṇam tathā paccekabuddhānam pacceka bodhi ñāṇam tato ti sāvaka pārami ñāṇato tattha ati  sāvaka pārami ñāṇe tatas api iti anantara niddiṭṭhato pacceka bodhi ñāṇataḥ api api saddena  pi saddena vā kaḥ pana vādaḥ sāvaka pārami ñāṇato ti sambhāveti tattha api iti pacceka bodhi ñāṇe pi
translated: and he shows it with all the words, from “giver of all” down to “one who feels the feeling of the wise man.”

original: Ito panāti sabbaññutaññāṇato pana, tasmā ettha sabbaññutaññāṇe vavatthānaṃ labbhatīti🔽adhippāyo. Gambhīresu visesā, gambhīrānaṃ vā visesena gambhīrā. Ayañca gambhīro ayañca
analyzed: itas pana ati sabbaññu taññāṇato pana tasmai ettha sabbaññu taññāṇe vavatthānam labbhati iti 🔽adhippāyaḥ gambhīresu visesāḥ gambhīrānam vā visesena gambhīrāḥ ayam ca gambhīraḥ ayam ca
translated: And in order to strengthen the argument for the way in which it is to be rejected he says “knowledge of the disciple’s perfection” and so on. Herein, knowledge of the disciple’s perfection is the knowledge consisting of the three kinds of true knowledge and the six kinds of direct-knowledge, which is produced in disciples by their perfecting the pāramīs beginning with giving. And knowledge of the Paccekabuddha’s enlightenment is the knowledge of the Paccekabuddhas. Beyond that: beyond the knowledge of the disciple’s perfection. Therein: in the knowledge of the disciple’s perfection. Beyond that too: beyond the knowledge of the Paccekabuddha’s enlightenment just mentioned. The word api in fact is to be construed with the word pi in the text. What need is there to speak of the knowledge of the disciple’s perfection? He construes it thus. There too: in the knowledge of the Paccekabuddha’s enlightenment. Beyond that too: beyond the knowledge of the Paccekabuddha’s enlightenment. Beyond that: beyond the knowledge of omniscience. The intention is that the distinction can be made in this way in the case of the knowledge of omniscience. It is profound in its distinction, or it is profound because of the profundity of its distinction. And this is profound, and this is profound because of the profundity of its distinction.

original: gambhīro ime imesaṃ visesena gambhīrāti vā gambhīratarā. Tarasaddenevettha byavacchedanaṃ siddhaṃ.
analyzed: visesena siddham
translated: or they are profound in comparison with those, and so are more profound. The distinction is established by the word “only.”

original: Etthāyaṃ yojanā – kiñcāpi sāvakapāramiñāṇaṃ heṭṭhimaṃ heṭṭhimaṃ sekkhañāṇaṃ puthujjanañāṇañca🔽upādāya gambhīraṃ, paccekabodhiñāṇaṃ pana upādāya na tathā gambhīranti “gambhīramevā”ti
analyzed: ettha ayam yojanā kiñca api sāvaka pārami ñāṇam heṭṭhimam heṭṭhimam sekkha ñāṇam puthujjana ñāṇañca  upādāya gambhīram pacceka bodhi ñāṇam pana upādāya na tathā gambhīram ti gambhīram eva ati
translated: Here is the construction of the passage: Although the knowledge of the perfection of disciples is profound in comparison with the knowledge of the trainees and the ordinary men below them,🔽it cannot be distinguished as “profound only” in comparison with the knowledge of the paccekabuddhas.

original: na sakkā byavacchijjituṃ, tathā paccekabodhiñāṇampi yathāvuttaṃ ñāṇamupādāya gambhīraṃ,
analyzed: na sakkā byavacchijjitum tathā pacceka bodhi ñāṇam pi yathā vuttam ñāṇam upādāya gambhīram
translated: And the knowledge of the paccekabuddhas, although profound in comparison with the knowledge mentioned above,

original: sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ pana upādāya na evaṃ gambhīranti “gambhīramevā”ti na sakkā byavacchijjituṃ,
analyzed: sabbaññu ta ññāṇam pana upādāya na evam gambhīram ti gambhīram eva ati na sakkā byavacchijjitum
translated: cannot be distinguished as “profound only” in comparison with the knowledge of omniscience.

original: tasmā tattha vavatthānaṃ na labbhati. Sabbaññutaññāṇadhammā pana sāvakapāramiñāṇādīnamiva
analyzed: tasmā tattha vavatthānam na labbhati sabbaññu taññāṇa dhammā pana sāvaka pārami ñāṇa ādīnam iva
translated: Therefore, no distinction can be made in this case. But the knowledge of omniscience, like the knowledge of the perfection of disciples, etc.,

original: kiñci upādāya gambhīrābhāvābhāvato “gambhīrā evā”ti vavatthānaṃ labbhatīti. Yathā
analyzed: kiñci upādāya gambhīra abhāva abhāvataḥ gambhīrāḥ eva ati vavatthānam labbhati iti yathā
translated: cannot be distinguished as “profound only” because it is not profound in comparison with anything.🔽Thus, a distinction can be made in this case.

original: cettha vavatthānaṃ dassitaṃ, evaṃ sāvakapāramiñāṇaṃ duddasaṃ. “Paccekabodhiñāṇaṃ
analyzed: ca ittha vavatthānam dassitam evam sāvaka pārami ñāṇam duddasam pacceka bodhi ñāṇam
translated: The exposition is shown here. So the knowledge of the perfection of disciples is hard to see.

original: pana tato duddasataranti tattha vavatthānaṃ natthī”tiādinā vavatthānasambhavo netabbo,
analyzed: pana tatas duddasataranti tattha vavatthānam natthi iti ādinā vavatthāna sambhavaḥ netabbo
translated: But the knowledge of the enlightenment of a paccekabuddha is harder to see than that. There is no exposition there. The meaning should be understood in this way.

original: tenevāha “tathā duddasāva…pe… veditabba”nti.🔽Pucchāvissajjanantipi pāṭho, tassā pucchāya vissajjananti attho. Etanti yathāvuttaṃ
analyzed: tena iva āha tathā duddasā vape veditabbanti  pucchā vissajjana ntipi pāṭhaḥ tassā pucchāya vissajjana nti atthaḥ etat ti yathā vuttam
translated: That is why it is said, “It is just as hard to see … and so on. ”

original: vissajjanavacanaṃ. Evanti iminā diṭṭhīnaṃ vibhajanākārena. Etthāyamadhippāyo – bhavatu
analyzed: vissajjana vacanam evanti iminā diṭṭhīnam vibhajana ākārena ettha ayam adhippāyaḥ bhavatu
translated: The reading “question-answer” is also found. The meaning is: the answer to that question. Herein, this is the statement of the answer. Thus: by the method of classifying the views. The intention here is as follows.

original: tāva niravasesabuddhaguṇavibhāvanupāyabhāvato sabbaññutaññāṇameva ekampi puthunissayārammaṇañāṇakiccasiddhiyā
analyzed: tāva niravasesa buddha guṇa vibhāvan upāya bhāvato sabbaññuta ññāṇam eva ekam pi puthu nissaya ārammaṇa ñāṇa kicca siddhiyā
translated: Let it be that the knowledge of omniscience is the only means of revealing all the special qualities of a Buddha without exception.

original: “atthi bhikkhave, aññeva dhammā”tiādinā bahuvacanena uddiṭṭhaṃ, tassa pana vissajjanaṃ
analyzed: atthi bhikkhave aññā iva dhammā ti ādinā bahuvacanena uddiṭṭham tassa pana vissajjanam
translated: It is stated in the plural by the words “There are, bhikkhus, other dhammas” and so on, and its exposition

original: saccapaccayākārādivisayavisesavasena anaññasādhāraṇena vibhajananayena anārabhitvā
analyzed: sacca paccaya ākāra ādi visaya visesa vasena anañña sādhāraṇena vibhajana nayena an ārabhitvā
translated: is not undertaken by the method of classifying it as not shared by others, according to the distinction in the object, that is, the mode of conditionality, and so on.

original: sanissayānaṃ diṭṭhigatānaṃ vibhajananayena kasmā āraddhanti? Tattha yathā saccapaccayākārādīnaṃ
analyzed: sa nissayānam diṭṭhi gatānam vibhajana nayena kasmai āraddhanti tattha yathā sacca paccaya ākāra ādīnam
translated: Why does he begin with the analysis of the views that are the underlying tendencies? Herein, just as the analysis of the truths, conditions, aspects, etc.,

original: vibhajanaṃ anaññasādhāraṇaṃ sabbaññutaññāṇasseva visayo, evaṃ niravasesadiṭṭhigatavibhajanampīti
analyzed: vibhajanam anañña sādhāraṇam sabbaññu ta ññāṇassa iva visayaḥ evam niravasesa diṭṭhi gata vibhajanam pi iti
translated: is the province of the knowledge of omniscience alone, which is not shared by others, so too the analysis of all views without exception is the province of the knowledge of omniscience alone.🔽To show this, he says: “For the Buddhas’ knowledge,” etc. Herein, the grounds are the reasons.

original: dassetuṃ “buddhānañhī”tiādi āraddhaṃ, tattha ṭhānānīti kāraṇāni. Gajjitaṃ mahantaṃ🔽hotīti desetabbassa atthassa anekavidhatāya, dubbiññeyyatāya ca nānānayehi pavattamānaṃ
analyzed: dassetum buddhānam hi itiādi āraddham tattha ṭhānāni iti kāraṇāni gajjitam mahantam  hoti iti desetabbassa atthassa anekavidha tāya dubbiññeyya tāya ca nānā nayehi pavattamānam
translated: The roar is great🔽because the teaching, which occurs by various methods, is great and extensive and has many divisions owing to the variety of meanings to be taught.

original: desanāgajjitaṃ mahantaṃ vipulaṃ, bahuppabhedañca hoti. Ñāṇaṃ anupavisatīti tato eva
analyzed: desanā gajjitam mahantam vipulam bahu ppabhedam ca hoti ñāṇam anupavisati iti tatas eva
translated: The knowledge enters in

original: ca desanāñāṇaṃ desetabbadhamme vibhāgaso kurumānaṃ anupavisati, te anupavisitvā ṭhitaṃ viya hotīti attho.
analyzed: ca desanā ñāṇam desetabba dhamme kurumānam anupavisati te anupavisitvā ṭhitam viya hoti iti attho
translated: because the teaching-knowledge, in order to make the distinctions in the things to be taught, enters in, as it were, and stands, as it were, without entering in.🔽The greatness of the Buddha’s knowledge is evident

original: Buddhañāṇassa mahantabhāvo paññāyatīti evaṃvidhassa nāma dhammassa desakaṃ, paṭivedhakañcāti
analyzed: buddha ñāṇassa mahanta bhāvo paññāyati iti evaṃvidhassa nāma dhammassa desakam paṭivedhakam ca ati
translated: because it is the teacher and the knower of such and such things.

original: buddhānaṃ desanāñāṇassa, paṭivedhañāṇassa ca uḷārabhāvo pākaṭo hoti. Desanā gambhīrā
analyzed: buddhānam desanā ñāṇassa paṭivedha ñāṇassa ca uḷāra bhāvaḥ pākaṭaḥ hoti desanā gambhīrā
translated: The greatness of the Buddhas’ knowledge of teaching and of penetration becomes evident.🔽Their teaching is profound:

original: hotīti sabhāvena gambhīrānaṃ tesaṃ catubbidhānampi desanā desetabbavasena gambhīrāva
analyzed: hoti iti sa bhāvena gambhīrānam tesam catubbidhānam pi desanā desetabba vasena gambhīrā ava
translated: all their fourfold teaching is profound in being profound by nature.

original: hoti, sā pana buddhānaṃ desanā sabbattha, sabbadā ca yānattayamukhenevāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: hoti sā pana buddhānam desanā sabbattha sabbadā ca yānattaya mukhena iva ati vuttam
translated: But the Buddhas’ teaching is always and everywhere only of three kinds, namely, the three vehicles.

original: “tilakkhaṇāhatā suññatāpaṭisaṃyuttā”ti, tīhi lakkhaṇehi āhatā, attattaniyato suññabhāvapaṭisaññuttā🔽cāti attho. Ettha ca kiñcāpi “sabbaṃ vacīkammaṃ buddhassa bhagavato ñāṇapubbaṅgamaṃ
analyzed: ti lakkhaṇa āhatā suñña tā paṭisaṃyuttā ati tīhi lakkhaṇehi āhatā suñña bhāva paṭisaññuttā  ca ati atthaḥ ettha ca kiñcā api sabbam vacī kammam buddhassa bhagavataḥ ñāṇa pubbaṅgamaṃ
translated: It is “struck with the three characteristics, associated with voidness,” that is to say, it is struck with the three characteristics of impermanence, etc., and it is associated with the perception of voidness of self and of self’s belongings.

original: ñāṇānuparivattī”ti vacanato sabbāpi bhagavato desanā ñāṇarahitā nāma natthi, samasamaparakkamanavasena🔽sīhasamānavuttitāya ca sabbattha samānussāhappavatti, desetabbadhammavasena pana
analyzed: ñāṇa anuparivattī iti vacanato sabbā api bhagavataḥ desanā ñāṇa rahitā nāma natthi samasama parakkamana vasena  sīha samāna vutti tāya ca sabbattha samāna ussāha ppavatti desetabba dhamma vasena pana
translated: And although all the Blessed One’s teaching is devoid of ignorance since it is stated thus, “All bodily work, speech and mental work of the Exalted One is preceded by knowledge and accompanied by knowledge” ,🔽nevertheless it is to be understood that the teaching is especially associated with knowledge and is more profound in those who have the same effort in all things because of their mode of life that is like the lion’s, which lives with the same effort in all directions,

original: desanā visesato ñāṇena anupaviṭṭhā, gambhīratarā ca hotīti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: desanā visesataḥ ñāṇena anupaviṭṭhā gambhīratarā ca hoti iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: and because of the teaching’s being associated with knowledge in virtue of the state of the Dhamma to be taught.

original: Kathaṃ pana vinayapaṇṇattiṃ patvā desanā tilakkhaṇāhatā, suññatāpaṭisaññuttā ca hoti,
analyzed: katham pana vinaya paṇṇattim patvā desanā ti lakkhaṇa āhatā suñña tā paṭisaññuttā ca hoti
translated: But how is it that the teaching, having reached the expression of the Discipline, is struck with the three characteristics and is related to the perception of voidness?

original: nanu tattha vinayapaṇṇattimattamevāti? Na tattha vinayapaṇṇattimattameva. Tatthāpi
analyzed: nanu tattha vinaya paṇṇattimattam eva ati na tattha vinaya paṇṇattimattam eva tattha api
translated: Is it not just the expression of the Discipline there? It is not just the expression of the Discipline there.

original: hi sannisinnaparisāya ajjhāsayānurūpaṃ pavattamānā desanā saṅkhārānaṃ aniccatādivibhāvinī🔽sabbadhammānaṃ attattaniyatā, suññabhāvappakāsinī ca hoti, tenevāha “anekapariyāyena🔽dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā”tiādi. Vinayapaññattinti vinayassa paññāpanaṃ. Ñña-kārassa pana
analyzed: hi sannisinna parisāya ajjhāsayā anurūpam pavattamānā desanā anicca tā ādi vibhāvinī  sabba dhammānam attatta niyatā suñña bhāva ppakāsinī ca hoti tena iva āha aneka pariyāyena  dhammim katham katvā atiādi vinaya paññattim ti vinayassa paññāpanam ññakārassa pana
