analyzed: sattānam āsayā anusaya ādikam ca yāthāvataḥ jānantaḥ bhagavā ṭhāna aṭṭhāna ādīsu kosallena veneyya ajjhāsayā anurūpam
translated: and knowing the dispositions, latent tendencies, etc., of beings, as they are in reality, teaches the Dhamma by means of the various methods in the proper order, according to the dispositions of those to be trained.

original: vicitranayadesanaṃ pavattesi. Bāhiraṃ pana sādhāraṇasamuṭṭhānaṃ dasasahassimahābrahmaparivārassa🔽sahampatibrahmuno ajjhesanaṃ. Tadajjhesanañhi pati dhammagambhīratāpaccavekkhaṇājanitaṃ
analyzed: vicitra naya desanam pavattesi bāhiram pana sādhāraṇa samuṭṭhānam dasa sahassi mahābrahma parivārassa  sahampati brahmunaḥ ajjhesanam tad ajjhesanam hi pati dhamma gambhīra tā paccavekkhaṇā janitam
translated: The source common to the outside world is the request of Sahampati Brahma, who was surrounded by ten thousand other Brahmas.

original: appossukkataṃ paṭippassambhetvā dhammassāmī dhammadesanāya ussāhajāto ahosi.
analyzed: appossukkatam paṭippassambhetvā dhammassāmī dhamma desanāya ussāha jātaḥ ahosi
translated: For the Blessed One, reflecting on the profundity of the Dhamma, had become inclined to inaction, but he dispelled that inclination and became eager to teach the Dhamma when he received the request.

original: Asādhāraṇampi ajjhattikabāhirato duvidhameva. Tattha ajjhattikaṃ yāya mahākaruṇāya,
analyzed: asādhāraṇam pi ajjhattika bāhirataḥ duvidham eva tattha ajjhattikam mahākaruṇāya
translated: The source that is not common is twofold: internal and external. The internal source is the great compassion

original: yena ca desanāñāṇena idaṃ suttaṃ pavattitaṃ, tadubhayameva. Sāmaññāvatthāya hi sādhāraṇampi
analyzed: yena ca desanā ñāṇena idam suttam pavattitam tat ubhayam eva sāmaññā avatthāya hi sādhāraṇam pi
translated: and the knowledge of the teaching by means of which this sutta was delivered. For although the internal source is common to all Buddhas,

original: samānaṃ mahākaruṇādivisesāvatthāya asādhāraṇaṃ bhavati, bāhiraṃ pana asādhāraṇasamuṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: samānam mahākaruṇā ādi visesa avatthāya asādhāraṇam bhavati bāhiram pana asādhāraṇa samuṭṭhānam
translated: and the same is the case with the special qualities of great compassion, etc., which are the special reason for the difference. But the external reason is the reason for the difference in the ordinary world.

original: vaṇṇāvaṇṇabhaṇananti aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ. Apica nindāpasaṃsāsu sattānaṃ veneyyāghātānandādibhāvamanāpatti.🔽Tattha ca anādīnavadassanaṃ bāhiramasādhāraṇasamuṭṭhānameva, tathā nindāpasaṃsāsu
analyzed: vaṇṇa avaṇṇa bhaṇanan ti aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam api ca nindā apasaṃsāsu sattānam veneyya āghāta ānanda ādi bhāvam anāpatti  tattha ca anādīnava dassanam bāhiram asādhāraṇa samuṭṭhānam eva tathā nindā apasaṃsāsu
translated: “The expression of dispraise and praise” is said in the commentary. Moreover, in the case of dispraise and praise, the non-offence of beings who are disciples to be trained, and so on, is due to the non-seeing of danger.

original: paṭipajjanakkamassa, pasaṃsāvisayassa ca khuddakādivasena anekavidhassa sīlassa,🔽sabbaññutaññāṇassa ca sassatādidiṭṭhiṭṭhāne, taduttari ca appaṭihatacāratāya, tathāgatassa
analyzed: paṭipajjana kkamassa pasaṃsā visayassa ca khuddaka ādi vasena anekavidhassa sīlassa  sabbaññuta ññāṇassa ca sassata ādi diṭṭhi ṭhāne tad uttari ca appaṭihata cāra tāya tathāgatassa
translated: And here the external reason for the difference is the non-seeing of danger, and likewise the non-seeing of the method of practice in the case of dispraise and praise, and the non-seeing of the many kinds of virtue, such as the minor training precepts, etc., which are the objects of praise,

original: ca katthacipi bhavādīsu apariyāpannatāya sattānamanavabodhopi bāhiramasādhāraṇasamuṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: ca katthacipi bhava ādīsu apariyāpanna tāya sattānam anavabodhaḥ api bāhiram asādhāraṇa samuṭṭhānam
translated: and the non-seeing of the knowledge of omniscience, and the non-seeing of the state beyond that, and the non-seeing of the fact that the Tathāgata’s conduct is unobstructed in regard to the bases beginning with becoming, and the non-seeing of the fact that the Tathāgata is not included anywhere in the bases beginning with becoming, and the non-understanding of beings in regard to these matters, are also external reasons for the difference.

original: Payojanampi sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇato duvidhaṃ. Tattha sādhāraṇaṃ anupādāparinibbānaṃ
analyzed: payojanam pi sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇataḥ duvidham tattha sādhāraṇam anupādā parinibbānam
translated: The purpose is twofold: common and uncommon. Herein, the common purpose is the attainment of Nibbāna without clinging.

original: vimuttirasattā sabbāyapi bhagavato desanāya, tenevāha “etadatthā kathā, etadatthā🔽mantanā”tiādi asādhāraṇaṃ pana bāhirasamuṭṭhānato vipariyāyena veditabbaṃ. Nindāpasaṃsāsu🔽hi sattānanveneyyāghātānandādibhāvappattiādikaṃ imissā desanāya phalabhūtaṃ kāraṇabhāvena🔽imaṃ desanaṃ payojeti. Phalañhi taduppādakasattiyā kāraṇaṃ payojeti nāma phale satiyeva🔽tāya sattiyā kāraṇabhāvappattito. Atha vā yathāvuttaṃ phalaṃ imāya desanāya bhagavantaṃ🔽payojetīti ācariyasāriputtattherena vuttaṃ. Yañhi desanāya sādhetabbaṃ phalaṃ, taṃ
analyzed: vimuttiḥ asattā bhagavataḥ desanāya tena iva āha etad atthā kathā etad atthā  mantana ati ādi asādhāraṇam pana bāhira samuṭṭhānataḥ vipariyāyena veditabbam nindā apasaṃsāsu  hi imissā desanāya phala bhūtam kāraṇa bhāvena  imam desanam payojā iti phalam hi tad uppādaka sattiyā kāraṇam payojā iti nāma phale satiyā iva  tāya sattiyā kāraṇa bhāva ppattitaḥ atha vā yathā vuttam phalam imāya desanāya bhagavantam  payojeti iti ācariya sāriputta therena vuttam yat hi desanāya sādhetabbam phalam tam
translated: and the liberation of the heart is the fruit of the teaching of the Blessed One. Therefore it is said: “The talk is for this, the recitation is for this” , and so on. But the uncommon purpose is the opposite of the external origin. For in the case of blame and praise, the attainment of the state of being one who should be followed, of the state of being one who is not to be blamed, of the state of being one who is glad, and so on, are the fruit of this teaching. The teaching is instigated by this as the cause. For the fruit instigates the cause by the existence of the cause of its origination. For when the fruit exists, the cause is instigated by the existence of that cause. Or else, the Blessed One is instigated by this teaching to the aforesaid fruit, according to the venerable Sāriputta. For the fruit to be accomplished by the teaching is instigated by the Blessed One.

original: ākaṅkhitabbattā desanāya desakaṃ payojeti nāma. Apica kuhanalapanādinānāvidhamicchājīvaviddhaṃsanaṃ,
analyzed: ākaṅkhitabba ttā desanāya desakam payojā iti nāma apica kuhana lapana ādi nānāvidham icchājīva viddhaṃsanam
translated: and the liberation of the heart is the fruit of the teaching of the Blessed One. Therefore it is said: “The talk is for this, the recitation is for this” , etc. But the uncommon fruit should be understood in the opposite sense to the external origination. For in the case of blame and praise, etc., the Blessed One makes the teaching the cause for the attainment of the state of being guided, of non-irritation, of gladness, etc., which is the fruit of this teaching. For the fruit makes the cause occur by its presence, since the state of being a cause belongs to it only when it is present. Or else, the Blessed One is made to occur by this teaching with the fruit as aforesaid, according to the Elder Sāriputta. For the Blessed One is made to occur by the teaching because the fruit to be accomplished by the teaching is desired. Moreover, the Blessed One is made to occur by the teaching because the teaching destroys the various kinds of wrong livelihood such as hypocrisy, scheming, etc.,

original: dvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhijālaviniveṭhanaṃ, diṭṭhisīsena paccayākāravibhāvanaṃ, chaphassāyatanavasena
analyzed: dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhi jāla viniveṭhanam diṭṭhi sīsena paccaya ākāra vibhāvanam cha phassa āyatana vasena
translated: The purpose is to remove the net of the sixty-two views, to analyse the conditions by means of the head of the views, to show the four noble truths by means of the six bases of contact,

original: catusaccakammaṭṭhānaniddeso, sabbadiṭṭhigatānaṃ anavasesapariyādānaṃ, attano anupādāparinibbānadīpanañca payojanameva.
analyzed: catu sacca kammaṭṭhāna niddeso sabba diṭṭhi gatānam anavasesa pariyādānam attanaḥ anupādā parinibbāna dīpanam ca payojanam eva
translated: to include all the views without exception, and to show the extinction of the self by non-clinging.

original: Bhājanaṃ pana desanādhiṭṭhānaṃ. Ye hi vaṇṇāvaṇṇanimittaanurodhavirodhavantacittā🔽kuhanādivividhamicchājīvaniratā sassatādidiṭṭhipaṅkanimuggā sīlakkhandhādīsu aparipūrakārino
analyzed: bhājanam pana desanā adhiṭṭhānam ye hi vaṇṇa avaṇṇa nimitta anurodha virodhavanta cittā  kuhanā ādi vividha micchājīva niratā sassata ādi diṭṭhi paṅka nimuggā sīla kkhandha ādīsu a paripūra kārinaḥ
translated: The vessel is the basis of the teaching. Those who are disciples are a vessel for this teaching,🔽who are of limited mind, who are devoted to various wrong modes of livelihood such as hypocrisy, who are sunk in the mire of such views as eternalism, who are not perfect in the aggregates of virtue, etc.,

original: abuddhaguṇavisesañāṇā veneyyā, te imissā desanāya bhājanaṃ.
analyzed: a buddha guṇa visesa ñāṇā veneyyā te imissā desanāya bhājanam
translated: and who are not aware of the special qualities of the Buddha.

original: Piṇḍattho pana idha labbhamānapadehi, samudāyena ca suttapadena yathāsambhavaṃ saṅgahito
analyzed: piṇḍatthaḥ pana idha labbhamāna padehi samudāyena ca sutta padena yathāsambhavam saṅgahitaḥ
translated: The meaning of the text is included here by the words that are found and by the sutta passage as a whole, as appropriate.

original: attho. Āghātādīnaṃ akaraṇīyatāvacanena hi dassitaṃ paṭiññānurūpaṃ samaṇasaññāya niyojanaṃ,
analyzed: atthaḥ āghāta ādīnam akaraṇīya tā vacanena hi dassitam paṭiññā anurūpam samaṇa saññāya niyojanam
translated: For the meaning shown by the statement that one should not do harm, etc., is the direction to the perception of an ascetic in accordance with the profession,

original: tathā khantisoraccānuṭṭhānaṃ, brahmavihārabhāvanānuyogo, saddhāpaññāsamāyogo, satisampajaññādhiṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: tathā khanti soracca anuṭṭhānam brahmavihāra bhāvanā anuyogaḥ saddhā paññā samāyogaḥ sati sampajaññā adhiṭṭhānam
translated: Likewise, patience, mildness, and industry, the practice of the divine abidings, the combination of faith and wisdom, the establishment of mindfulness and clear comprehension,

original: paṭisaṅkhānabhāvanābalasiddhi, pariyuṭṭhānānusayappahānaṃ, ubhayahitapaṭipatti, lokadhammehi anupalepo ca –
analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāna bhāvanā bala siddhi pariyuṭṭhāna anusaya ppahānam ubhaya hita paṭipatti loka dhammehi anupalepaḥ ca
translated: the perfection of the strength of insight, the abandoning of the latent tendencies, the practice of what is beneficial to both, and the avoidance of worldly talk,

original: Pāṇātipātādīhi paṭivirativacanena dassitā sīlavisuddhi, tāya ca hirottappasampatti,
analyzed: pāṇa atipāta ādīhi paṭivirati vacanena dassitā sīla visuddhi tāya ca hirottappa sampatti
translated: the purity of virtue shown by the undertaking of the precepts against killing, etc., and the possession of shame and moral dread,

original: mettākaruṇāsamaṅgitā, vītikkamappahānaṃ, tadaṅgappahānaṃ, duccaritasaṃkilesappahānaṃ,
analyzed: mettā karuṇā samaṅgi tā vītikkama pahānam tad aṅga ppahānam duccarita saṃkilesa ppahānam
translated: the practice of loving kindness and compassion, the abandoning of transgression, the abandoning of the factors of transgression, the abandoning of the defilement of misconduct,

original: viratittayasiddhi, piyamanāpagarubhāvanīyatānipphatti, lābhasakkārasilokasamudāgamo,
analyzed: virati ttaya siddhi lābha sakkāra si loka samudāgamaḥ
translated: the perfection of the three abstinences, the attainment of the state of being loved, respected, esteemed, and honored, the acquisition of gain and honor,

original: samathavipassanānaṃ adhiṭṭhānabhāvo, akusalamūlatanukaraṇaṃ, kusalamūlaropanaṃ, ubhayānatthadūrīkaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: samatha vipassanānam adhiṭṭhāna bhāvaḥ akusala mūla tanu karaṇam kusala mūla ropanam ubhaya anattha dūrīkaraṇam
translated: the establishment of serenity and insight, the imitation of the unwholesome roots, the planting of the wholesome roots, the keeping far away from both vehicles,

original: parisāsu visāradatā, appamādavihāro, parehi duppadhaṃsiyatā, avippaṭisārādisamaṅgitā ca –
analyzed: parisāsu visārada tā appamāda vihāro parehi duppadhaṃsiya tā a vippaṭisāra ādi samaṅgi tā ca
translated: the fearlessness in assemblies, the practice of heedfulness, the difficulty of being overcome by others, and the possession of non-remorse, etc.

original: “Gambhīrā”tiādivacanehi dassitaṃ gambhīradhammavibhāvanaṃ, alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭhatā,🔽kappānamasaṅkhyeyyenāpi dullabhapātubhāvatā, sukhumenapi ñāṇena paccakkhato paṭivijjhitumasakkuṇeyyatā,
analyzed: gambhīra ati ādi vacanehi dassitam gambhīra dhamma vibhāvanam a labbhaneyya patiṭṭha tā  kappānam asaṅkhyeyyena api dullabha pātubhāva tā sukhumena api ñāṇena paccakkhataḥ paṭivijjhitum asakkuṇeyya tā
translated: the unobtainability of a footing, the non-manifestation even in the course of three incalculable ages,🔽the impossibility of penetrating it by direct experience even with subtle knowledge,

original: dhammanvayasaṅkhātena anumānañāṇenāpi duradhigamanīyatā, passaddhasabbadarathatā,
analyzed: dhamma anvaya saṅkhātena anumāna ñāṇena api duradhigamanīya tā passaddha sabbadaratha tā
translated: the difficulty of reaching it even with inferential knowledge called “conformity” , the stilling of all agitation,

original: santadhammavibhāvanaṃ, sobhanapariyosānatā, atittikarabhāvo, padhānabhāvappatti,
analyzed: santa dhamma vibhāvanam sobhana pariyosāna tā a tittikara bhāvaḥ padhāna bhāva ppatti
translated: the exposition of the peaceful Dhamma, the consummation in what is fair, the state of being very hard to bear, the attainment of pre-eminence,

original: yathābhūtañāṇagocaratā, sukhumasabhāvatā, mahāpaññāvibhāvanā ca. Diṭṭhidīpakapadehi
analyzed: yathā bhūta ñāṇa gocara tā sukhuma sabhāva tā mahā paññā vibhāvanā ca diṭṭhi dīpaka padehi
translated: the state of being the province of knowledge of what really is, the state of being very subtle, and the exposition of great understanding.

original: dassitā samāsato sassataucchedadiṭṭhiyo līnatātidhāvanavibhāvanaṃ, ubhayavinibandhaniddeso,
analyzed: dassi tā samāsatas sassata auccheda diṭṭhiyaḥ līna tā ati dhāvana vibhāvanam ubhaya vinibandha niddeso
translated: The words “of view” show the exposition of the states of sloth and torpor and of agitation and worry, the description of the two bonds,

original: micchābhinivesakittanaṃ, kummaggapaṭipattippakāsanaṃ, vipariyesaggāhañāpanaṃ, parāmāsapariggaho,
analyzed: micchā abhinivesa kittanam kummagga paṭipatti ppakāsanam vipariyesa ggāha ñāpanam parāmāsa pariggahaḥ
translated: the glorification of wrong adherence, the demonstration of wrong practice, the disclosure of the seizure of perversions, the discernment of misapprehension,

original: pubbantāparantānudiṭṭhipatiṭṭhāpanā, bhavavibhavadiṭṭhivibhāgā, taṇhāvijjāpavatti,
analyzed: pubbanta aparanta anudiṭṭhi patiṭṭhāpanā bhava vibhava diṭṭhi vibhāgā taṇhā vijjā pavatti
translated: The establishment of the view of beginning and end, the analysis of the views of eternalism and annihilationism, the occurrence of craving and ignorance,

original: antavānantavādiṭṭhiniddeso, antadvayāvatāraṇaṃ, āsavoghayogakilesaganthasaṃyojanupādānavisesavibhajanañca –
analyzed: antavān antavā diṭṭhi niddesaḥ anta dvaya avatāraṇam āsava ogha yoga kilesa gantha saṃyojana upādāna visesa vibhajanam ca
translated: The description of the views of finitude and infinitude, the entry into the two extremes, the analysis of the defilements, fetters, and bonds,

original: Tathā “vedanānaṃ samudaya”ntiādivacanehi dassitā catunnamariyasaccānaṃ anubodhapaṭibodhasiddhi,
analyzed: tathā veda nānam anubodha paṭibodha siddhi
translated: The accomplishment of the understanding and realization of the four noble truths shown by the statement “the arising of feelings,”

original: vikkhambhanasamucchedappahānaṃ taṇhāvijjāvigamo, saddhammaṭṭhitinimittapariggaho,
analyzed: vikkhambhana samuccheda ppahānam taṇhā vijjā vigamaḥ saddhamma ṭṭhiti nimitta pariggaho
translated: The abandonment by suppression and eradication, the separation from craving and ignorance, the discernment of the sign of the establishment of the true Dhamma,

original: āgamādhigamasampatti, ubhayahitapaṭipatti, tividhapaññāpariggaho, satisampajaññānuṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: āgama adhigama sampatti ubhaya hita paṭipatti tividha paññā pariggahaḥ sati sampajaññā anuṭṭhānam
translated: The perfection of the attainment of the scriptures and realization, the practice for the welfare of both, the discernment of the threefold wisdom, the exertion of mindfulness and clear comprehension,

original: saddhāpaññāsamāyogo, vīriyasamatānuyojanaṃ, samathavipassanānipphatti ca –
analyzed: saddhā paññā samāyogaḥ vīriya samatā anuyojanam samatha vipassanā nipphatti ca
translated: The union of faith and wisdom, the application of the balance of energy, and the accomplishment of serenity and insight—

original: “Ajānataṃ apassata”nti padehi dassitā avijjāsiddhi, tathā “taṇhāgatānaṃ paritassitavipphandita”nti
analyzed: a jānatam padehi dassitāḥ tathā taṇhāgatānam
translated: The accomplishment of ignorance shown by the words “not knowing, not seeing,” and likewise “the agitation and vacillation of those who are swayed by craving,”

original: padehi taṇhāsiddhi, tadubhayena ca nīvaraṇasaññojanadvayasiddhi, anamataggasaṃsāravaṭṭānupacchedo,
analyzed: padehi taṇhā siddhi tad ubhayena ca nīvaraṇa saññojana dvaya siddhi anamatagga saṃsāra vaṭṭa an upacchedaḥ
translated: and by the two together, the two fetters of sense-desire and resistance, and the non- interruption of the round of rebirths without distinction of beginning or end,

original: pubbantāharaṇāparantānusandhānāni, atītapaccuppannakālavasena hetuvibhāgo, avijjātaṇhānaṃ
analyzed: pubbanta āharaṇa aparanta anusandhānāni atīta paccuppanna kāla vasena hetu vibhāgaḥ avijjāta ṇhānam
translated: and the carrying back of the past and the carrying on into the future, and the analysis of cause in terms of past and present time, and the non-surpassing of ignorance and craving,

original: aññamaññānativattanaṃ, aññamaññūpakāritā, paññāvimutticetovimuttīnaṃ paṭipakkhaniddeso ca –
analyzed: aññamañña anativattanam aññamaññu upakāri tā paññā vimutti cetaḥ vimuttīnam paṭipakkha niddeso ca
translated: and the mutual assistance of ignorance and craving, and the demonstration of the opposites of understanding-deliverance and heart-deliverance,

original: “Tadapi phassapaccayā”ti padena dassitā sassatādipaññāpanassa paccayādhīnavuttitā,🔽tena ca dhammānaṃ niccatāpaṭisedho, aniccatāpatiṭṭhāpanaṃ, paramatthato kārakādipaṭikkhepo,
analyzed: tat api phassa paccayā ti padena dassitā sassata ādi paññāpanassa paccaya adhīna vutti tā  tena ca dhammānam nicca tā paṭisedhaḥ anicca tā patiṭṭhāpanam paramatthataḥ kāraka ādi paṭikkhepaḥ
translated: and the fact that the teaching of eternalism, etc., is dependent on a condition, is shown by the words “With contact as condition” .🔽And by that the denial of the eternality of states is demonstrated, the establishment of their impermanence, and the rejection of a maker, etc., in the ultimate sense,

original: evaṃdhammatāniddeso, suññatāpakāsanaṃ samatthanirīha paccayalakkhaṇavibhāvanañca –
analyzed: evaṃdhammatā niddeso suññatā pakāsanam samattha nirīha paccaya lakkhaṇa vibhāvanam ca
translated: and the demonstration of the way things are, and the revelation of voidness, and the analysis of the characteristic of conditionality as devoid of conscious design,

original: “Ucchinnabhavanettiko”tiādinā dassitā bhagavato pahānasampatti, vijjāvimuttivasībhāvo,
analyzed: ucchinna bhavanettikā uti ādinā dassitā bhagavato pahāna sampatti vijjā vimutti vasībhāvo
translated: and the Blessed One’s perfection of abandoning, and the pre-eminence of his knowledge and deliverance, are shown by the words “With the support cut off that leads upwards” .

original: sikkhattayanipphatti, nibbānadhātudvayavibhāgo, caturadhiṭṭhānaparipūraṇaṃ, bhavayoniādīsu apariyāpannatā ca –
analyzed: nibbāna dhātu dvaya vibhāgo catur adhiṭṭhāna paripūraṇam bhava yoni ādīsu a pariyāpanna tā ca
translated: the fulfilment of the three trainings, the analysis of the two elements of extinction, the fulfilment of the four foundations, and the fact that he is not included among the kinds of becoming, the kinds of generation, etc.,

original: Sakalena pana suttapadena dassito iṭṭhāniṭṭhesu bhagavato tādibhāvo, tattha ca paresaṃ
analyzed: sakalena pana sutta padena dassito iṭṭha aniṭṭhesu bhagavato tādi bhāvo tattha ca paresam
translated: and the Blessed One’s suchness in regard to what is desired and not desired, as shown by the whole of the sutta, and the establishment of others in that suchness,

original: patiṭṭhāpanaṃ, kusaladhammānaṃ ādibhūtadhammadvayaniddeso sikkhattayūpadeso, attantapādipuggalacatukkasiddhi,
analyzed: patiṭṭhāpanam kusala dhammānam ādi bhūta dhamma dvaya niddeso
translated: the demonstration of the two ideas that are the beginning of profitable ideas, the demonstration of the three trainings, the success of the four kinds of persons beginning with the one who torments himself,🔽the analysis of the four kinds of action that have a mixed result, etc., the demonstration of the province of the four measureless states,

original: kaṇhakaṇhavipākādikammacatukkavibhāgo, caturappamaññāvisayaniddeso, samudayatthaṅgamādipañcakassa
analyzed: kaṇha kaṇha vipāka ādi kamma catukka vibhāgo catur appamaññā visaya niddeso samudaya tthaṅgama ādi pañcakassa
translated: the understanding of the five beginning with the meaning of rise and subsidence,

original: yathābhūtāvabodho, chasāraṇīyadhammavibhāvanā, dasanāthakadhammapatiṭṭhāpananti evamādayo
analyzed: yathā bhūta avabodho cha sāraṇīya dhamma vibhāvanā dasa nāthaka dhamma patiṭṭhāpananti evamādayo
translated: the analysis of the six ideas that are treasuries of profitable ideas, and the establishment of the ten ideas that are bases of protection,

original: yathāsambhavaṃ saṅgahetvā dassetabbā atthā piṇḍattho.
analyzed: yathāsambhavam saṅgahetvā dassetabbāḥ atthā piṇḍattho
translated: should be included and shown as the meaning in brief according to the method of the Niddesa.

original: Soḷasahāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: soḷasa hāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The sixteen kinds of outcome

original: Desanāhāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: desanā āhāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the teaching

original: Idāni nettiyā, peṭakopadese ca vuttanayavasena hārādīnaṃ niddhāraṇaṃ. Tattha “attā,
analyzed: idāni nettiyā peṭaka upadese ca vutta naya vasena hāra ādīnam niddhāraṇam tattha attā
translated: Now, the definition of the modes, etc., is given according to the method stated in the Nettippakarana and the Peṭakopadesa. Herein, “self” is a mode of perversion.🔽“

original: loko”ti ca diṭṭhiyā adhiṭṭhānabhāvena, vedanāphassāyatanādimukhena ca gahitesu pañcasu🔽upādānakkhandhesu taṇhāvajjitā pañcupādānakkhandhā dukkhasaccaṃ. Taṇhā samudayasaccaṃ.
analyzed: ca diṭṭhiyāḥ adhiṭṭhāna bhāvena vedanā phassa āyatana ādi mukhena ca gahitesu pañcasu  upādāna kkhandhesu taṇhā avajjitā pañca upādāna kkhandhāḥ dukkha saccam taṇhā samudaya saccam
translated: And the five aggregates of clinging are the truth of suffering, with craving for them as the truth of origin.

original: Taṃ pana “paritassanāgahaṇena taṇhāgatāna”nti, “vedanāpaccayā taṇhā”ti ca padehi
analyzed: tam pana paritassanā gahaṇena taṇhā gatānan ti vedanā paccayā taṇhā ati ca padehi
translated: But this craving is stated in the text in its own individual form as “craving that is in the process of arising” and as “with the arising of contact there is the arising of craving” .

original: samudayaggahaṇenañca pāḷiyaṃ sarūpena gahitameva. Ayaṃ tāva suttantanayo.
analyzed: samudaya ggahaṇena ñca pāḷiyam sarūpena gahitam eva ayam tāva
translated: This is the method of the discourses.

original: Abhidhamme pana vibhaṅgappakaraṇe āgatanayena āghātānandādivacanehi, “ātappamanvāyā”tiādipadehi,
analyzed: abhidhamme pana vibhaṅga pakaraṇe āgata nayena āghāta ānanda ādi vacanehi ātappam anvāyāti ādi padehi
translated: But in the Abhidhamma, in the Vibhaṅga, the defilements of the states classed as profitable and unprofitable, etc., are stated in the Vibhaṅga in brief by the words “with grief, with joy, etc.,” by the words “with zeal, with urgency, etc.,”

original: cittapadosavacanena, sabbadiṭṭhigatikapadehi, kusalākusalaggahaṇena, bhavaggahaṇena,
analyzed: citta pada osa vacanena sabba diṭṭhi gatika padehi kusala akusala ggahaṇena bhava ggahaṇena
translated: by the words “with agitation of consciousness, etc.,” by the words “with all wrongnesses, with all wrongnesses’ roots, etc.,” by the words “with all kinds of sensual desire, etc.,” by the words “with all kinds of greed, etc.,”

original: sokādiggahaṇena, diṭṭhiggahaṇena, tattha tattha samudayaggahaṇena cāti saṅkhepato🔽sabbalokiyakusalākusaladhammavibhāvanapadehi gahitā dhammakilesā samudayasaccaṃ.

analyzed: na mātā pitūnam na paccatthikānam subhāsita dubbhāsitassa attham ājānāti katamat ca  tam bhikkhave appamatta kaṃpe tathāgatassa vaṇṇam vadamānaḥ vadeyya ati imāya pucchāya
translated: The answer to the question, “Bhikkhus, what is the least thing, the taking up of which would lead to the harm and suffering of oneself and others for a long time?”

original: “pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato”tiādikā ayaṃ vissajjanā sameti. Bhagavā
analyzed: pāṇa atipātam pahāya pāṇa atipātā paṭiviratā iti ādikā ayam vissajjanā sameti bhagavā
translated: is the same as the answer to the question, “The taking up of the stick is the least thing, the taking up of which would lead to the harm and suffering of oneself and others for a long time.”

original: hi anuttarena pāṇātipātaviramaṇādiguṇena samannāgato, tañca kho samādhiṃ, paññañca
analyzed: hi anuttarena pāṇa atipāta viramaṇa ādi guṇena samannāgataḥ tam ca kho samādhim paññam ca
translated: for he is endowed with the supreme virtue of abstention from killing breathing things, etc., and that concentration and wisdom

original: upanidhāya appamattakaṃ oramattakaṃ sīlamattakaṃ. “Katame ca te bhikkhave, dhammā
analyzed: upanidhāya appamattakam ora mattakam sīla mattakam katame ca te bhikkhave dhammā
translated: are only a small part of that virtue. “And what, bhikkhus, are those states that are deep, deep, hard to see, hard to comprehend, peaceful, excellent, beyond the sphere of reasoning, subtle, to be experienced by the wise? “

original: gambhīrā duddasā”tiādikāya pucchāya “santi bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbantakappikā”tiādikā
analyzed: gambhīrā duddasā ati ādikāya pucchāya santi bhikkhave eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā pubbantakappikā iti ādikā
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are certain recluses and brahmins, founders of schools who are proclaimers, teachers, expounders of the path, and trainers. They are skilled in what is path and what is not path, and they declare: ‘This is the path’, ‘This is not the path’. They declare: ‘Come, practise the path in this way.’ They themselves do not practise the path in the way they advise others to do. They themselves do not avoid what they advise others to avoid. They themselves do not do what they advise others to do. They themselves do not become what they advise others to become. They themselves do not attain what they advise others to attain. They themselves do not realise what they advise others to realise.

original: vissajjanā sameti. Sabbaññutaññāṇaguṇā hi aññatra tathāgatā aññesaṃ ñāṇena alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭhattā
analyzed: vissajjanā sameti sabbaññu taññāṇa guṇāḥ hi aññatra tathāgatāḥ aññesam ñāṇena a labbhaneyya patiṭṭha ttā
translated: For the special qualities of knowledge of omniscience are not to be attained by the knowledge of others except by a Tathāgata.

original: gambhīrā duddasā duranubodhā santā paṇītā atakkāvacarā nipuṇā paṇḍitavedanīyāti iminā🔽nayena vissajjanāya pucchānurūpatāvicayanameva idha saṅgahagāthāya abhāvato anugītivicayoti.
analyzed: gambhīrā duddasā duranubodhā santā paṇītā atakka avacarā nipuṇā paṇḍita vedanīyā ati iminā  nayena vissajjanāya puccha anurūpa tā vicayanam eva idha saṅgaha gāthāya abhāvataḥ
translated: Therefore they are deep, deep, hard to see, hard to comprehend, peaceful, excellent, beyond the sphere of reasoning, subtle, to be experienced by the wise.

original: Ayaṃ padapañhādiekādasadhammavicayanalakkhaṇo vicayahāro nāma. Vuttañca “yaṃ pucchitañca
analyzed: ayam pada pañha ādi ekādasa dhamma vicayana lakkhaṇaḥ vicayahāraḥ nāma vuttam ca yam pucchitam ca
translated: In this way the answer to the question is the same as the question. The analysis of the verse of summary is called the analysis of the method of question and answer.

original: vissajjitañcā”tiādi.🔽Yuttihārasaṃvaṇṇanā
analyzed: vissajjitam ca atiādi 🔽yutti hāra saṃvaṇṇanā
translated: And it is said: “The question and the answer” , and so on.

analyzed: sāmi niddesaḥ yujjati sabhāva niruttiyā tathā apayoga dissanataḥ avaṇṇassa ca tad apekkhattā

analyzed: vā ati vikappana attha niddesaḥ yujjati nepātikānam aneka attha ttā ettha ca niyama abhāvato  bhikkhave iti āmantana niddesaḥ yujjati etassa payogassa dissanataḥ desakassa

analyzed: ca paṭiggāhaka apekkhato ti evamādinā byañjanato ca  sabbena sabbam āghāta ādīnam akaraṇam ta ādi bhāvāya saṃvattati iti yujjati iṭṭha aniṭṭhesu

Thus, etc., is appropriate as a designation of the meaning of “thus,” because of the appearance of the word in the sense of “thus,” and because of the dependence of the word on the word avaṇṇa.🔽The use of the word sabbena is appropriate as a designation of the meaning of “all,” because of the appearance of the word in the sense of “all,” and because of the dependence of the word on the word sabbaṃ.🔽The use of the word sabbaṃ is appropriate as a designation of the meaning of “all,” because of the appearance of the word in the sense of “all,” and because of the dependence of the word on the word sabbena.

analyzed: sama pavatti sabbhāvataḥ yasmin santāne āghāta ādayaḥ uppannā tad nimittakāḥ antarāyā  tassa iva sampatti vibandhāya saṃvattanti iti yujjati kammānam santāna antaresu a saṅkamanataḥ
translated: The use of the word āghātādīnaṃ is appropriate as a designation of the meaning of “anger, etc.,” because of the appearance of the word in the sense of “anger, etc.,” and because of the dependence of the word on the word akaraṇaṃ.🔽The use of the word akaraṇaṃ is appropriate as a designation of the meaning of “non-doing,” because of the appearance of the word in the sense of “non-doing,” and because of the dependence of the word on the word āghātādīnaṃ.🔽The use of the word tādibhāvāya is appropriate as a designation of the meaning of “for the sake of suchness,” because of the appearance of the word in the sense of “for the sake of suchness,” and because of the dependence of the word on the word saṃvattati.

analyzed: cittam abhibhavitvā uppannāḥ āghāta ādayaḥ subhāsita dubbhāsita sat lakkhaṇe pi asamattha tāya
translated: The use of the word iṭṭhāniṭṭhesu is appropriate as a designation of the meaning of “in regard to the desirable and the undesirable,” because of the appearance of the word in the sense of “in regard to

analyzed: saṃvattanti iti andha tamasa bhāvataḥ pāṇātipāta ādi dussīlyataḥ veramaṇī
translated: and it is fitting that the words should be understood in this way, since greed and delusion are like blind darkness.🔽and it is fitting that the words should be understood in this way, since virtue consisting in abstention from killing living things, etc.,

original: sabbasattānaṃ pāmojjapāsaṃsāya saṃvattatīti yujjati sīlasampattiyā mahato kittisaddassa
analyzed: sabba sattānam pāmojja pāsaṃsāya saṃvattati iti yujjati sīla sampattiyā mahataḥ kitti saddassa
translated: is the cause of the delight and praise of all beings, because of the great fame and renown that arises.

analyzed: abbhugga tattā gambhīra tā ādi visesa yuttena guṇena tathāgatassa vaṇṇanā ekadesa bhūtā api
translated: and it is fitting that the words should be understood in this way, since the praise of the Tathāgata’s special qualities such as profundity, etc.,

original: sakalasabbaññuguṇaggahaṇāya saṃvattatīti yujjati anaññasādhāraṇattā. Tajjāayonisomanasikāraparikkhatāni
analyzed: sakala sabbaññu guṇa ggahaṇāya saṃvattati iti yujjati anañña sādhāraṇa ttā tad jā a yoni soma nasikāra parikkhatāni
translated: is the cause of the acquisition of all the special qualities of omniscience, because they are not shared by others.

original: adhigamatakkanāni sassatavādādiabhinivesāya saṃvattantīti yujjati kappanajālassa🔽asamugghāṭitattā. Vedanādīnaṃ anavabodhena vedanāpaccayā taṇhā vaḍḍhatīti yujjati🔽assādānupassanāsabbhāvato, sati ca vedayitabhāve (vedayitarāge tattha attattaniyagāho,
analyzed: adhigama takkanāni sassata vāda ādi abhinivesāya saṃvattanti iti yujjati kappana jālassa  a samugghāṭita ttā vedanā ādīnam anavabodhena vedanā paccayā taṇhā vaḍḍhati iti yujjati  assāda anupassanā sabbhāvato sati ca vedayita bhāve vedayita rāge tattha atta tta niya gāho
translated: and it is fitting that the words should be understood in this way, since the determinations of the kind described, which are delimited by the appropriate attention,🔽are the cause of the adherence to eternalism, etc., because the net of determinations has not been removed.🔽and it is fitting that the words should be understood in this way, since craving increases with feeling as condition because of the absence of the contemplation of disappointment in it,

original: sassatādigāho ca viparipphandatīti yujjati kāraṇassa sannihitattā. Taṇhāpaccayā hi
analyzed: sassata ādi gāhaḥ ca viparipphandati iti yujjati kāraṇassa sannihita ttā taṇhā paccayā hi
translated: and when there is the state of being felt, the grasping of self and what pertains to a self occurs, and the adherence to eternalism, etc., occurs, because the cause is present.🔽For craving has feeling as its condition.

original: upādānaṃ sambhavati. Sassatādivāde paññapentānaṃ, tadanucchavikañca vedanaṃ vedayantānaṃ
analyzed: upādānam sambhavati sassata ādi vāde paññapentānam tad anucchavikam ca vedanam vedayantānam
translated: and clinging comes to be.🔽And for those who proclaim the doctrine of eternalism, etc., and for those who experience the feelings appropriate thereto,

original: phasso hetūti yujjati visayindriyaviññāṇasaṅgatiyā vinā tadabhāvato. Chaphassāyatananimittaṃ
analyzed: phassaḥ hetu iti yujjati visayindriya viññāṇa saṅgatiyā vinā tad abhāvataḥ cha phassa āyatana nimittam
translated: and clinging is possible. And it is proper to say that the six bases are the cause of contact, since there is no contact without the coming together of the object, faculty, and consciousness.

original: vaṭṭassa anupacchedoti yujjati tattha avijjātaṇhānaṃ appahīnattā. Channaṃ phassāyatanānaṃ
analyzed: vaṭṭassa an upacchedaḥ ti yujjati tattha avijjā taṇhānam appahīna ttā channam phassa āyatanānam
translated: And it is proper to say that the sign of the six bases of contact is the non- interruption of the round, since ignorance and craving are not abandoned there.

original: samudayatthaṅgamādipajānanā sabbadiṭṭhigatikasaññaṃ aticca tiṭṭhatīti yujjati catusaccapaṭivedhabhāvato.
analyzed: samudaya tthaṅgama ādi pajānanā sabba diṭṭhi gatika saññam aticca tiṭṭhati iti yujjati catu sacca paṭivedha bhāvataḥ
translated: And it is proper to say that the knowledge of the arising and passing away of the six bases of contact stands outside all views, since it is the penetration of the four truths.

original: Imāhiyeva dvāsaṭṭhiyā sabbadiṭṭhigatānaṃ antojālīkatabhāvoti yujjati akiriyavādādīnaṃ,🔽issaravādādīnañca tadantogadhattā, tathā ceva heṭṭhā saṃvaṇṇitaṃ. Ucchinnabhavanettiko
analyzed: dvāsaṭṭhiyā sabba diṭṭhi gatānam antojālīkata bhāvaḥ ti yujjati akiriya vāda ādīnam  tathā ca iva heṭṭhā saṃvaṇṇitam ucchinna bhavanettikaḥ
translated: And it is proper to say that all the sixty-two views are included in these, since the doctrines of nihilism, etc.,🔽and the doctrines of the creator god, etc., are included in them, as will be explained below.

original: tathāgatassa kāyoti yujjati bhagavato abhinīhārasampattiyā catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu
analyzed: tathāgatassa kāyo ti yujjati bhagavataḥ abhinīhāra sampattiyā catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu
translated: And it is proper to say that the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the way to cross over the flood, since the Blessed One, by the perfection of his aspiration, has established the four foundations of mindfulness in the world.

original: ṭhatvā sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ bhāvitattā. Kāyassa bhedā parinibbutaṃ
analyzed: ṭhatvā sattannam bojjhaṅgānam yathābhūtam bhāvita ttā kāyassa bhedā parinibbutam
translated: and because of the development of the seven factors of enlightenment in accordance with reality,🔽they will not see him after his death when he has attained final Nibbāna without attachment.

original: na dakkhantīti yujjati anupādisesanibbānappattiyaṃ rūpādīsu kassacipi anavasesatoti
analyzed: na dakkhanti iti yujjati an upādisesa nibbāna ppattiyam rūpa ādīsu kassaci pi anavasesato ti
translated: In the attainment of Nibbāna without residue of clinging, there is no seeing of any of the visible-data base, etc., without remainder.

original: iminā nayena atthato ca sutte byañjanatthānaṃ yuttitāvibhāvanalakkhaṇo yuttihāro
analyzed: iminā nayena atthataḥ ca sutte byañjana tthānam yutti tā vibhāvana lakkhaṇaḥ yutti hāro
translated: So the meaning of the words in the sutta is appropriate. This is how the method of interpretation should be understood as having the characteristic of revealing the appropriateness of the meaning of the words.

original: nāma yathāha “sabbesaṃ hārānaṃ, yā bhūmī”tiādi.
analyzed: nāma yathā āha sabbesam yā bhūmi itiādi
translated: For this is said: “The ground for all the methods” , and so on.

original: Padaṭṭhānahāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: padaṭṭhāna hāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Method of Footings🔽The footing for the failures beginning with “blameworthy, dispraise, dispraise, and words of dispraise” is “blameworthy, dispraise, dispraise, and words of dispraise” .

original: Vaṇṇārahāvaṇṇadubbaṇṇatānādeyyavacanatādi vipattīnaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ. Vaṇṇārahavaṇṇasubbaṇṇatāsaddheyyavacanatādi
analyzed: vaṇṇa araha avaṇṇa dubbaṇṇa tā anādeyya vacana tā ādi vipattīnam padaṭṭhānam vaṇṇa araha vaṇṇa subbaṇṇa tā saddheyya vacana tā ādi
translated: The footing for the successes beginning with “praiseworthy, praise, praise, and words of praise” is “praiseworthy, praise, praise, and words of praise” .

original: sampattīnaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ. Tathā āghātādayo nirayādidukkhassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Āghātādīnamakaraṇaṃ
analyzed: sampattīnam padaṭṭhānam tathā āghāta ādayaḥ niraya ādi dukkhassa padaṭṭhānam āghāta ādīnam akaraṇam
translated: Likewise the footing for the suffering of hell, etc., is “ill will, etc.,” and the footing for all the successes beginning with the success of the heavenly world is “non-ill will, etc.,”

original: saggasampattiyādisabbasampattīnaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ. Pāṇātipātādipaṭivirati ariyassa sīlakkhandhassa
analyzed: sagga sampattiyā ādi sabba sampattīnam padaṭṭhānam pāṇātipāta ādi paṭivirati ariyassa sīlakkhandhassa
translated: The footing for the noble aggregate of virtue is “abstinence from killing breathing things, etc.,”

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ, ariyo sīlakkhandho ariyassa samādhikkhandhassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Ariyo samādhikkhandho🔽ariyassa paññākkhandhassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Gambhīratādivisesayuttaṃ bhagavato paṭivedhappakārañāṇaṃ
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam ariyaḥ sīla kkhandho ariyassa samādhi kkhandhassa padaṭṭhānam ariyaḥ samādhi kkhandho  ariyassa paññā kkhandhassa padaṭṭhānam gambhīra tā ādi visesa yuttam bhagavataḥ paṭivedha ppakāra ñāṇam
translated: The Noble Requisite of Virtue is the footing for the Noble Requisite of Concentration. The Noble Requisite of Concentration is the footing for the Noble Requisite of Understanding. The Blessed One’s knowledge of the kind that is associated with the distinction of profundity, etc., is the footing for the knowledge of the kind that is associated with the distinction of the fruit of Stream-Entry, etc.

original: desanāñāṇassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Desanāñāṇaṃ veneyyānaṃ sakalavaṭṭadukkhanissaraṇassa padaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: desanā ñāṇassa padaṭṭhānaṃ desanā ñāṇam veneyyānam sakala vaṭṭa dukkha nissaraṇassa padaṭṭhānaṃ
translated: The noble virtue aggregate is the footing for the noble concentration aggregate. The noble concentration aggregate is the footing for the noble understanding aggregate. The Blessed One’s knowledge of penetration, which is associated with the special qualities of profundity, etc., is the footing for his knowledge of teaching. The knowledge of teaching is the footing for the escape from the whole round of suffering for those susceptible of training.

original: Sabbāyapi diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhupādānabhāvato sā yathārahaṃ navavidhassapi bhavassa padaṭṭhānaṃ.🔽Bhavo jātiyā. Jāti jarāmaraṇassa, sokādīnañca padaṭṭhānaṃ. Vedanānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ🔽samudayatthaṅgamādipaṭivedhanā catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ anubodhapaṭivedho hoti. Tattha
analyzed: sabbāya api diṭṭhiyāḥ diṭṭhupādāna bhāvato sā yathāraham navavidhassa api bhavassa padaṭṭhānam  bhavaḥ jātiyā jāti jarā maraṇassa soka ādīnam ca padaṭṭhānam vedanānam yathābhūtam  samudaya tthaṅgama ādi paṭivedhanā catunnam ariya saccānam anubodha paṭivedho hoti tattha
translated: Because of the state of clinging to views in all views, it is the footing for the ninefold becoming as appropriate.🔽Becoming is the footing for birth, and birth is the footing for ageing-and-death and for sorrow, etc. The penetration of the four noble Truths, namely, of their meaning of origination, of their meaning of cessation, and of the path’s meaning of path, etc., is the footing for the four fruits of asceticism.

original: anubodho paṭivedhassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Paṭivedho catubbidhassa sāmaññaphalassa padaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: anubodho paṭivedhassa padaṭṭhānam paṭivedho catubbidhassa sāmañña phalassa padaṭṭhānam
translated: Herein, penetration is the footing for the four fruits of asceticism. The four fruits of asceticism are the footing for the four grades of Noble Person.

analyzed: a jānatam a passatanti avijjā gahaṇam tattha avijjā saṅkhārānam padaṭṭhānam saṅkhārā
translated: “Not knowing, not seeing” includes ignorance. Herein, ignorance is the footing for determinations, determinations for

original: viññāṇassa. Yāva vedanā taṇhāya padaṭṭhānanti netvā tesaṃ “vedanāpaccayā taṇhā”tiādinā🔽pāḷiyamāgatanayena sambajjhitabbaṃ. “Taṇhāgatānaṃ paritassitavipphandita”nti ettha🔽taṇhā upādānassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. “Tadapi phassapaccayā”ti ettha sassatādipaññāpanaṃ
analyzed: viññāṇassa yāva vedanā taṇhāya padaṭṭhānan ti netvā tesam vedanā paccayā taṇhā iti ādinā  sambajjhitabbam taṇhā gatānam paritassita vipphanditanti ettha  taṇhā upādānassa padaṭṭhānam tat api phassa paccayā ti ettha sassata ādi paññāpanam
translated: consciousness, and so on up to “Feeling is the footing for craving” . So this should be construed in the way stated in the text with “With feeling as condition there arises in him craving” .

original: paresaṃ micchābhinivesassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Micchābhiniveso saddhammassavanasappurisūpanissayayonisomanasikāradhammānudhammapaṭipattīhi🔽vimukhatāya asaddhammassavanādīnañca padaṭṭhānaṃ. “Aññatra phassā”tiādīsu phasso

translated: “For those who are craving, for those who are trembling and floundering” : here craving is the footing for assuming. “That too is due to contact” : here the misapprehension of eternalism, etc., is the footing for misinterpreting others. original: padaṭṭhānahāro nāma. Vuttañhi “dhammaṃ deseti jino, tassa ca dhammassa yaṃ padaṭṭhāna”ntiādi.
analyzed: padaṭṭhāna hāraḥ nāma vuttam hi dhammam deseti jino tassa ca dhammassa yam padaṭṭhāna ntiādi
translated: The understanding of the six bases of contact as they actually are in the way of their origin, etc., is the proximate cause for disenchantment. Disenchantment is the proximate cause for dispassion, and so on up to: the destruction of the round is the proximate cause for the complete extinction through non-compulsion. The destruction of the round is the proximate cause for the omniscience of the Exalted One, and the complete extinction through non-compulsion is the proximate cause for the destruction of the round. This is the method of determining the proximate cause of the ideas stated in the scriptures, and of the proximate cause of the proximate cause of those ideas, according to the circumstances. It is called the “method of the proximate cause.” For it is said: “The Victor teaches the idea, and the proximate cause of that idea” , and so on.

original: Lakkhaṇahāravaṇṇanā🔽Āghātādiggahaṇena kodhūpanāhamakkhapalāsaissāmacchariyasārambhaparavambhanādīnaṃ

analyzed: saṅgahaḥ paṭigha cittuppāda pariyāpanna tāya eka lakkhaṇa ttā ānanda ādi gahaṇena abhijjhā visama lobha māna ati māna mada ppamādānam
translated: The inclusion of anger, enmity, contempt, domineering, envy, selfishness, obstinacy, boasting, and so on, under the heading of annoyance is because they are all included in the arising of the idea of resistance, and so they have the same characteristic. original: saṅgaho lobhacittuppādapariyāpannatāya ekalakkhaṇattā. Tathā āghātaggahaṇena avasiṭṭhaganthanīvaraṇānaṃ

translated: and the inclusion of the rest of the aggregates under greed is due to their having the same characteristic as greed. So too, the inclusion of the rest of the fetters under ill will is due to their having the same characteristic as the fetter of ill will.

original: saṅgaho kāyaganthanīvaraṇalakkhaṇena ekalakkhaṇattā. Ānandaggahaṇena phassādīnaṃ🔽saṅgaho saṅkhārakkhandhalakkhaṇena ekalakkhaṇattā. Sīlaggahaṇena adhicittādhipaññāsikkhānaṃ

translated: The inclusion of contact, etc., under joy is due to their having the same characteristic as the bodily formation.🔽The inclusion of the training in the higher consciousness and the training in the higher wisdom under virtue is due to their having the same characteristic as the training in the higher conduct.

original: saṅgaho sikkhālakkhaṇena ekalakkhaṇattā. Diṭṭhiggahaṇena avasiṭṭhaupādānānaṃ saṅgaho🔽upādānalakkhaṇena ekalakkhaṇattā. “Vedanāna”nti ettha vedanāggahaṇena avasiṭṭhaupādānakkhandhānaṃ🔽saṅgaho upādānakkhandhalakkhaṇena ekalakkhaṇattā. Tathā dhammāyatanadhammadhātupariyāpannavedanāggahaṇena

translated: The inclusion of the rest of the clingings under the false view of individuality is due to their having the same characteristic as clinging.

original: sammasanupagānaṃ sabbesampi āyatanānaṃ, dhātūnañca saṅgaho āyatanalakkhaṇena, dhātulakkhaṇena

translated: The “Enumeration of Characteristics” is so called because it is the enumeration of the characteristics of the aggregates, etc. For it is said: “When one thing is stated, other things of the same characteristic are included” .

analyzed: andham tamam tadā hoti yam kodho sahate
translated: sit down or lie down and count your breaths.🔽“If others praise me, monks, or if others honour me,

original: Imāya, “mamaṃ vā bhikkhave, pare vaṇṇaṃ…pe… na cetaso ubbilāvitattaṃ karaṇīya”nti🔽ayaṃ “dhammāpi vo bhikkhave, pahātabbā, pageva adhammā”ti, “kullūpamaṃ vo bhikkhave,
analyzed: imāya mamam vā bhikkhave pare na cetasaḥ ubbilāvitattam karaṇīyanti  ayam dhammā api vaḥ bhikkhave pahātabbā pagā iva adhammā ati kullūpamam vaḥ bhikkhave
translated: you should not for that reason exalt me in your hearts.🔽“You should abandon even those ideas that are good,🔽how much more so those that are bad.” “I will teach you a Dhamma simile, monks,

original: dhammaṃ desessāmi nittharaṇatthāya, no gahaṇatthāyā”ti ca imāya, “tatra ce tumhe…pe…🔽tumhaṃyevassa tena antarāyo”ti ayaṃ –
analyzed: dhammam desessāmi nittharaṇa tthāya no gahaṇa tthāya ati ca tatra ce  tumhaṃyevassa tena antarāyo ti ayam
translated: for the purpose of crossing over, not for the purpose of retaining.” “If you were to find a raft there, monks, for the purpose of crossing over, not for the purpose of retaining,

original: “Luddho atthaṃ na jānāti, luddho dhammaṃ na passati;
analyzed: luddhaḥ attham na jānāti luddhaḥ dhammam na passati
translated: you are the only one who has any concern in it.” This is the one that goes with the verse: “When greedy, one does not know, when greedy, one does not see.

original: Andhaṃ tamaṃ tadā hoti, yaṃ lobho sahate nara”nti. ca –
analyzed: andham tamam tadā yam lobho sahate ca
translated: Blind is the world, it seems, When lust assails a man.

original: “Kāmandhā jālasañchannā, taṇhāchadanachāditā;
analyzed: kāmandhā jāla sañchannā taṇhā chadana chāditā
translated: Blind with desire, veiled in a net, Covered by a canopy of craving,

original: Pamattabandhunābaddhā, macchāva kumīnāmukhe;
analyzed: kumīnā mukhe
translated: Bound by the kinsman of heedlessness, Like fish in a shoal in a net,

original: Jarāmaraṇamanventi, vaccho khīrapakova mātara”nti. ca –
analyzed: jarā maraṇam anventi ca
translated: They come to old age and death, Like calves to their mothers.

original: Imāya, “appamattakaṃ kho panetaṃ sīlamattaka”nti ayaṃ “vivicceva kāmehi…pe… paṭhamaṃ🔽jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati, ayampi kho brāhmaṇa yañño purimehi yaññehi appaṭṭhataro
analyzed: imāya appamattakam kho pana etam sīla mattakam ti ayam vivicca iva kāmehipe paṭhamam  jhānam upasampajja viharati ayam pi kho brāhmaṇa yaññaḥ purimehi yaññehi appaṭṭhataraḥ
translated: And by this statement: “But this is a mere trifle, just mere virtue,” the statement: “Quite secluded from sense desires, secluded from unwholesome things,” etc.,

original: ca appasamārambhataro ca mahapphalataro ca mahānisaṃsataro cā”ti imāya paṭhamajjhānassa
analyzed: ca appasamārambhataro ca mahapphalataro ca mahānisaṃsataro ca ati imāya paṭhama jhānassa
translated: is shown to be more fruitful and beneficial than the previous sacrifice.

original: sīlato mahapphalamahānisaṃsataratāvacanena jhānato sīlassa appaphalaappānisaṃsatarabhāvadīpanato.
analyzed: sīlataḥ mahapphala mahā nisaṃsatara tā vacanena jhānato sīlassa appa phala appa anisaṃsatara bhāva dīpanato
translated: And by the statement that the first jhāna is more fruitful and beneficial than virtue, the fact that virtue is less fruitful and beneficial than jhāna is shown.

original: “Pāṇātipātaṃ pahāyā”tiādidesanā “samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sīlavā ariyasīlena samannāgato”tiādidesanāya,
analyzed: pāṇa atipātam pahāya ati ādi desanā samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sīlavā ariya sīlena samannāgataḥ iti ādi desanāya
translated: The teaching beginning with “Having abandoned the killing of living beings” is shown by the teaching beginning with “The recluse Gotama is virtuous, he possesses the virtues dear to the noble ones,”

original: “aññeva dhammā gambhīrā”tiādidesanā “adhigato kho myāyaṃ dhammo gambhīro duddaso
analyzed: aññā iva dhammā gambhīrā ati ādi desanā adhigataḥ kho myā ayam dhammo gambhīraḥ duddaso
translated: “The Dhamma is profound to me, too, and hard to see, hard to understand, peaceful, excellent, beyond the sphere of logic, profound, understandable (only) to the wise.”

original: duranubodho”tiādidesanāya, gambhīratādivisesayuttadhammapaṭivedhena hi ñāṇassa gambhīrādibhāvo viññāyati.🔽“Santi bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbantakappikā”tiādidesanā “santi bhikkhave,🔽eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbantakappikā…pe… abhivadanti sassato attā ca loko ca, idameva
analyzed: duranubodhā ti ādi desanāya gambhīra tā ādi visesa yutta dhamma paṭivedhena hi ñāṇassa gambhīra ādi bhāvaḥ viññāyati  santi bhikkhave eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā santi bhikkhave  eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā pubbantakappi kāpe abhivadanti sassataḥ attā ca loko ca idam eva
translated: The teaching beginning with “Other things are deep” is in order to show the depth, etc., of the knowledge of penetration of the Dhamma endowed with the special qualities of depth, etc., since the depth, etc., of the knowledge is known through the penetration of the Dhamma endowed with the special qualities of depth, etc.

original: saccaṃ, moghamaññanti ittheke abhivadanti, asassato, sassato ca asassato ca, nevasassato🔽ca nāsassato ca, antavā, anantavā, antavā ca anantavā ca, nevantavā ca nānantavā🔽ca attā ca loko ca, idameva saccaṃ, moghamaññanti ittheke abhivadantī”tiādidesanāya.
analyzed: saccam mogham aññanti itthā ike abhivadanti a sassataḥ sassataḥ ca a sassataḥ ca na iva sassataḥ  ca na asassato ca antavā anantavā antavā ca anantavā ca na iva antavā ca na anantavā  ca attā ca loko ca idam eva saccam mogham aññanti itthā ike abhivadanti iti ādi desanāya
translated: The teaching beginning with “Bhikkhus, there are some recluses and brahmins” is in order to show the non-penetration of the Dhamma by those who are not arahants, since the penetration of the Dhamma is shown by the teaching beginning with “Bhikkhus, there are some recluses and brahmins who are speculators about the past” and so on.

original: Tathā “santi bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā aparantakappikā”tiādidesanā “santi bhikkhave
analyzed: tathā santi bhikkhave eke samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ santi bhikkhave
translated: The teaching beginning with “Bhikkhus, there are some recluses and brahmins” is in order to show the penetration of the Dhamma by those who are arahants, since the penetration of the Dhamma is shown by the teaching beginning with “Bhikkhus, there are some recluses and brahmins who are speculators about the future” and so on.

original: …pe… abhivadanti saññī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā. Ittheke abhivadanti asaññī,
analyzed: pe abhivadanti saññī attā hoti arogo param maraṇā itthā ike abhivadanti asaññī
translated: … “Some say that after death a being is percipient and happy …🔽Some say that after death a being is not percipient and not non-percipient …

original: saññī ca asaññī ca, nevasaññī ca nāsaññī ca attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā. Ittheke🔽abhivadanti sato vā pana sattassa ucchedaṃ vināsaṃ vibhavaṃ paññapenti, diṭṭhadhammanibbānaṃ
analyzed: saññī ca asaññī ca na iva saññī ca na asaññī ca attā hoti arogaḥ param maraṇā itthā ike  abhivadanti sataḥ vā pana sattassa ucchedam vināsam vibhavam paññapenti diṭṭhadhamma nibbānam
translated: Some say that after death a being is both percipient and not percipient …

original: vā paneke abhivadantī”ntiādidesanāya, “vedanānaṃ samudayañca…pe… tathāgato”tiādidesanā
analyzed: vā pana eke tathāgata uti ādi desanāya
translated: Some say that after death a being is neither percipient nor non-percipient and is happy …🔽Some say that after death a being is annihilated, is destroyed, and does not exist after death …🔽Some say that nibbana is in this very life …

original: “tadidaṃ saṅkhataṃ oḷārikaṃ, atthi kho pana saṅkhārānaṃ nirodho, atthetanti iti viditvā
analyzed: tat idam saṅkhatam oḷārikam atthi kho pana saṅkhārānam nirodhaḥ iti viditvā
translated: “This is conditioned, gross, and related to the world. But there is an unconditioned, subtle, and unrelated happiness.🔽Having seen the escape from this, the Tathagata has gone beyond it.”

original: tassa nissaraṇadassāvī tathāgato tadupātivatto”tiādidesanāya, “tadapi tesaṃ…pe… vipphanditamevā”ti
analyzed: tassa nissaraṇa dassāvī tathāgato tad upātivattaḥ ti ādi desanāya tat api vipphanditam evā ti
translated: “That too is just their wriggling, like that of a fish on dry land.

original: ayaṃ “idaṃ tesaṃ vata aññatreva saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra
analyzed: ayam idam tesam vata aññatra iva saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra
translated: This is not due to faith, personal preference, oral tradition, reflection on reasons,🔽or acceptance of a view after pondering it.

original: ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā paccattaṃyeva ñāṇaṃ bhavissati parisuddhaṃ
analyzed: ākāra parivitakkāḥ aññatra diṭṭhi nijjhāna kkhantiyā paccattam yeva ñāṇam bhavissati parisuddham
translated: “Apart from faith, apart from personal preference, apart from oral tradition, apart from reasoned reflection, apart from acceptance of a view after pondering it, there will be knowledge, there will be vision, there will be awareness, there will be insight, there will be clear knowing, there will be a higher wisdom, there will be a higher knowledge, there will be a higher comprehension, there will be a higher view, there will be a higher conviction, there will be a higher deliverance, there will be a higher progress, there will be a higher attainment, there will be a higher escape—this is impossible.”

original: pariyodāta’nti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati. Paccattaṃ kho pana bhikkhave, ñāṇe asati parisuddhe🔽pariyodāte yadapi te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā tattha ñāṇabhāvamattameva pariyodāpenti,
analyzed: pariyodātanti na itam ṭhānam vijjati paccattam kho pana bhikkhave ñāṇe asati parisuddhe  yat api te bhonto samaṇa brāhmaṇā tattha ñāṇa bhāvam attam eva pariyodāpenti
translated: “But, monks, when there is knowledge that is purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, pliable, wieldy, steady, imperturbable, then there is the possibility of realization of the fruit of true knowledge and liberation.🔽“But when those good recluses and brahmins proclaim the purification of the entire world, they do so for the sake of the five cords of sensual pleasure.

original: tadapi tesaṃ bhavataṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upādānamakkhāyatī”tiādidesanāya, “tadapi🔽phassapaccayā”ti ayaṃ “cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, tiṇṇaṃ
analyzed: tat api tesam bhavatam samaṇa brāhmaṇānam upādānam akkhāyati iti ādi desanāya tat api  phassa paccayā ti ayam cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇam tiṇṇam
translated: “But when those good recluses and brahmins proclaim the purification of the entire world, they do so for the sake of the five cords of sensual pleasure.

original: saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā, vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, taṇhāpaccayā upādāna”nti,
analyzed: saṅgati phassaḥ phassa paccayā vedanā vedanā paccayā taṇhā taṇhā paccayā upādānam ti
translated: “With the eye as condition, eye-consciousness arises; the meeting of the three is contact. With contact as condition, feeling comes to be; with feeling as condition, craving; with craving as condition, clinging; with clinging as condition, existence; with existence as condition, birth; with birth as condition, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair come to be. Such is the origin of this whole mass of suffering.

original: “chandamūlakā ime āvuso dhammā manasikārasamuṭṭhānā phassasamodhānā vedanāsamosaraṇā”ti
analyzed: chanda mūlakāḥ ime āvuso dhammā manasikāra samuṭṭhānā phassa samodhānā vedanā samosaraṇā ti
translated: “Friend, these things have desire as their root, have desire as their source, for desire is their cause and condition.

original: (pariyesitabbaṃ) ca ādidesanāya, “yato kho bhikkhave, bhikkhu channaṃ phassāyatanāna”ntiādidesanā
analyzed: pariyesitabbam ca ādi desanāya yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhu channam
translated: “But, monks, when a monk does not cling to any of the six bases for contact, it is possible that he will attain Nibbana.”

original: “yato kho bhikkhave, bhikkhu neva vedanaṃ attato samanupassati, na saññaṃ, na saṅkhāre,
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhu na iva vedanam attataḥ samanupassati na saññam na saṅkhāre
translated: does not regard formations as self…🔽does not regard consciousness as self, then he does not regard anything as self.

original: na viññāṇaṃ attato samanupassati, so evaṃ asamanupassanto na kiñci loke upādiyati,
analyzed: na viññāṇam attataḥ samanupassati saḥ evam a samanupassantaḥ na kiñci loke upādiyati
translated: When he does not regard anything as self, he does not cling to anything in the world.🔽When he does not cling, he is not agitated.

original: anupādiyaṃ na paritassati, aparitassaṃ paccattaṃyeva parinibbāyatī”tiādidesanāya,
analyzed: anupādiyam na paritassati aparitassam paccattam yeva parinibbāyati iti ādi desanāya
translated: When he does not cling, he is not agitated. When he is not agitated, he personally attains Nibbana. ”🔽“All these views…are bound to these sixty-two bases, or to something included therein. ”

original: “sabbete imeheva dvāsaṭṭhiyā vatthūhi antojālīkatā”tiādidesanā “ye hi keci bhikkhave…pe…
analyzed: sabbe te imehi iva dvāsaṭṭhiyā vatthūhi ye hi keci
translated: “Whatever ascetics and brahmins, bhikkhus, regard earth as self…🔽regard the self as embodied…🔽as unembodied…🔽as infinite…🔽as limited by the sphere of infinite consciousness…🔽as limited by the sphere of nothingness…

original: abhivadanti, sabbete imāneva pañca kāyāni abhivadanti etesaṃ vā aññatara”ntiādidesanāya,
analyzed: abhivadanti sabbe ete imāni eva pañca kāyāni abhivadanti etesam vā aññatara nti ādi desanāya
translated: as limited by the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception…🔽as limited by the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception…

original: “kāyassa bhedā…pe… devamanussā”ti ayaṃ –
analyzed: kāyassa bheda āpe deva manussā ati ayaṃ
translated: as having attained to the cessation of perception and feeling…🔽they all, bhikkhus, by diving down into this deep Dhamma, into this deep Dhamma, do not understand it.🔽“Just as a great mass of fire

original: “Accī yathā vātavegena khittā (upasivāti bhagavā),🔽Atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ;
analyzed: accī yathā vāta vegena khittā bhagavā  attham paleti naḥ upeti saṅkham
translated: Burns a great mass of firewood,

original: Evaṃ munī nāmakāyā vimutto,
analyzed: evam muniḥ nāma kāyāḥ vimuttaḥ
translated: So the sage, released from the body,

original: Atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkha”nti. –
analyzed: attham paleti naḥ upeti
translated: Burns the fuel of conceit and is not reckoned. ”

original: Ādidesanāya saddhiṃ saṃsandatīti. Ayaṃ neruttamadhippāyadesanānidānapubbāparānusandhīnaṃ catunnaṃ vibhāvanalakkhaṇo catubyūhahāro nāma. Vuttampi cetaṃ “neruttamadhippāyo”tiādi.🔽Āvattahāravaṇṇanā🔽Āghātādīnamakaraṇīyatāvacanena khantisoraccānuṭṭhānaṃ. Tattha khantiyā saddhāpaññāparāpakāradukkhasahagatānaṃ
analyzed: ādi desanāya saddhim saṃsandati iti ayam neruttama adhippāya desanā nidāna pubba apara anusandhīnam catunnam vibhāvana lakkhaṇo catu byūha hāraḥ nāma vuttam api ca itam neruttama adhippāyaḥ tiādi  āvattahāra vaṇṇanā  āghāta ādīnam akaraṇīya tā vacanena khanti soracca anuṭṭhānam tattha khantiyā saddhā paññā apara apakāra dukkha sahagatānam
translated: and it is connected with the first teaching. This is called the fourfold analysis called the “fourfold investigation” . And this is said: “The fourfold investigation is the meaning, the purport, the designation, and the connection” .🔽The explanation of the fourfold investigation🔽The non-doing of harm, etc., is the arousing of patience, gentleness, and perseverance. Herein, patience is the endurance of faith, understanding, and suffering done by another.

original: saṅgaho, tathā soraccena sīlassa. Saddhādiggahaṇena ca saddhindriyādisakalabodhipakkhiyadhammā🔽āvattanti. Sīlaggahaṇena avippaṭisārādayo sabbepi sīlānisaṃsadhammā āvattanti. Pāṇātipātādīhi🔽paṭivirativacanena appamādavihāro, tena sakalaṃ sāsanabrahmacariyaṃ āvattati. Gambhīratādivisesayuttadhammaggahaṇena
analyzed: saṅgahaḥ tathā soraccena sīlassa saddhā ādi gahaṇena ca saddhi indriya ādi sakala bodhi pakkhiya dhammā 🔽āvattanti sīla ggahaṇena avippaṭisāra ādayaḥ sabbe pi sīla anisaṃsa dhammā āvattanti pāṇātipāta ādīhi 🔽paṭivirati vacanena appamāda vihāro tena sakalam sāsana brahmacariyam āvattati gambhīra tā ādi visesa yutta dhamma ggahaṇena
