original: mahābodhipakittanaṃ. Anāvaraṇañāṇapadaṭṭhānañhi āsavakkhayañāṇaṃ, āsavakkhayañāṇapadaṭṭhānañca
analyzed: mahābodhipakittanam anāvaraṇa ñāṇa padaṭṭhānam hi āsava khaya ñāṇam āsava kkhaya ñāṇa padaṭṭhānam ca
translated: The Great Awakening is extolled. For the knowledge of the destruction of the taints has as its footing the knowledge of penetration of the way things are, and the knowledge of penetration of the way things are has as its footing the knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: anāvaraṇañāṇaṃ mahābodhīti vuccati, tena dasabalādayo sabbe buddhaguṇā āvattanti.
analyzed: anāvaraṇa ñāṇam mahābodhī iti vuccati tena dasa bala ādayo sabbe buddha guṇāḥ āvattanti
translated: Therefore the Great Awakening is said to be the knowledge of penetration of the way things are. By it all the qualities of the Buddhas, such as the ten powers, are included.

original: Sassatādidiṭṭhiggahaṇena taṇhāvijjānaṃ saṅgaho, tāhi anamataggaṃ saṃsāravaṭṭaṃ āvattati.
analyzed: sassata ādi diṭṭhi ggahaṇena taṇhā vijjānam saṅgahaḥ tāhi anamataggam saṃsāra vaṭṭam āvattati
translated: By the grasping of the views of eternalism, etc., craving and ignorance are included. By them the beginningless round of rebirths is included.

original: Vedanānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ samudayādipaṭivedhanena bhagavato pariññāttayavisuddhi, tāya
analyzed: veda nānam yathābhūtam samudaya ādi paṭivedhanena bhagavato tāya
translated: By the penetration of the origin, etc., of feeling as it really is, the Blessed One’s purification by knowledge and vision of the way things are is included.

original: paññāpāramimukhena sabbāpi pāramiyo āvattanti. “Ajānataṃ apassata”nti ettha avijjāggahaṇena
analyzed: paññāpārami mukhena sabbā api pāramiyaḥ āvattanti a jānatam a passatanti ettha avijjā ggahaṇena
translated: By it all the pāramīs headed by the pāramī of wisdom are included. In the passage, “Not knowing, not seeing” , by the grasping of ignorance

original: ayonisomanasikārapariggaho, tena ca nava ayonisomanasikāramūlakā dhammā āvattanti.
analyzed: a yoni soma nasikāra pariggaho tena ca nava a yoni soma nasikāra mūlakāḥ dhammāḥ āvattanti
translated: the grasping of unwise attention is included. By it the nine dhammas rooted in unwise attention are included.

original: “Taṇhāgatānaṃ paritassitavipphandita”nti ettha taṇhāggahaṇena nava taṇhāmūlakā dhammā
analyzed: taṇhā gatānam paritassita vipphanditan ti ettha taṇhā ggahaṇena nava taṇhā mūlakāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: In the passage, “Those who are subject to craving, who are agitated and bewildered” , by the grasping of craving the nine dhammas rooted in craving are included.

original: āvattanti. “Tadapi phassapaccayā”tiādi sassatādipaññāpanassa paccayādhīnavuttidassanaṃ,
analyzed: āvattanti tat api phassa paccaya atiādi sassata ādi paññāpanassa paccaya adhīna vutti dassanam
translated: In the passage beginning, “That too is conditioned by contact” , the teaching that the postulation of eternalism, etc., is dependent on conditions is shown.

original: tena aniccatādilakkhaṇattayaṃ āvattati. Channaṃ phassāyatanānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ pajānanena🔽vimuttisampadāniddeso, tena sattapi visuddhiyo āvattanti. “Ucchinnabhavanettiko tathāgatassa
analyzed: tena anicca tā ādi lakkhaṇa ttayam āvattati channam phassa āyatanānam yathābhūtam pajānanena  vimutti sampadā niddeso tena satta pi visuddhiyaḥ āvattanti ucchinna bhava nettiko tathāgatassa
translated: and so the three characteristics of impermanence, etc., are included. By the understanding of the six bases of contact as they really are,

original: kāyo”ti taṇhāpahānaṃ vuttaṃ, tena bhagavato sakalasaṃkilesappahānaṃ āvattatīti ayaṃ🔽desanāya gahitadhammānaṃ sabhāgavisabhāgadhammavasena āvattanalakkhaṇo āvattahāro
analyzed: kāyaḥ iti taṇhā apahānam vuttam tena bhagavataḥ sakala saṃkilesa ppahānam āvattati iti ayam  desanāya gahita dhammānam sabhāga visabhāga dhamma vasena āvattana lakkhaṇaḥ āvattahāro
translated: the description of the perfection of deliverance is given, and so the seven kinds of purification are included. The phrase “The Tathāgata’s body is free from the guide to becoming” refers to the abandoning of craving, and so the Blessed One’s abandoning of all defilements is included. This is called

original: nāma. Yathāha “ekamhi padaṭṭhāne, pariyesati sesakaṃ padaṭṭhāna”ntiādi.
analyzed: nāma yathā āha ekamhi padaṭṭhāne pariyesati sesakam padaṭṭhāna ntiādi
translated: the inclusion by way of similar and dissimilar dhammas of the dhammas included in the teaching. As it is said: “In one foundation he searches, and in the rest of the foundations as well” , and so on.

original: Vibhattihāravaṇṇanā🔽Āghātānandādayo akusalā dhammā, tesaṃ ayonisomanasikārādi padaṭṭhānaṃ. Yehi pana🔽dhammehi āghātānandādīnaṃ akaraṇaṃ appavatti, te abyāpādādayo kusalā dhammā, tesaṃ
analyzed: vibhatti hāra vaṇṇanā  āghāta ānanda ādayaḥ akusalā dhammā tesam a yoniso manasikāra ādi padaṭṭhānam yehi pana  dhammehi āghāta ānanda ādīnam akaraṇam appavatti te a byāpāda ādayaḥ kusalā dhammā tesam
translated: The explanation of the inclusion by way of analysis

original: yonisomanasikārādi padaṭṭhānaṃ. Tesu āghātādayokāmāvacarāva, abyāpādādayo catubhūmakā,
analyzed: yoniso manasikāra ādi padaṭṭhānam tesu a byāpāda ādayo catu bhūmakā
translated: The unwholesome dhammas such as ill will and delight are the foundations for wrong reflection, etc. But the wholesome dhammas such as non-ill will, etc., which prevent the arising of ill will, delight, etc., are the foundations for right reflection, etc. Among these, ill will, etc., belong to the sense sphere only, while non-ill will, etc., belong to the four planes.

original: tathā pāṇātipātādīhi paṭivirati kusalā vā abyākatā vā, tassā hirottappādayo dhammā
analyzed: tathā pāṇātipāta ādīhi paṭivirati kusalāḥ vā abyākatāḥ vā tassāḥ hirottappa ādayaḥ dhammā
translated: So too, abstinence from killing breathing things, etc., is either profitable or indeterminate.

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ. Tattha kusalā siyā kāmāvacarā, siyā lokuttarā. Abyākatā lokuttarāva.
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam tattha kusalā siyā kāmāvacarā siyā lokuttarā abyākatā
translated: The things beginning with conscience and shame are its footing. Herein, the profitable may be of the sense sphere or of the supramundane. The indeterminate is only of the supramundane.

original: “Atthi bhikkhave, aññeva dhammā gambhīrā”ti vuttadhammā siyā kusalā, siyā abyākatā.
analyzed: atthi bhikkhave aññā eva dhammā gambhīrā ti vutta dhammā siyā kusalā siyā abyākatā
translated: The things stated thus “There are, bhikkhus, other matters” may be profitable or indeterminate.

original: Tattha kusalānaṃ vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanā padaṭṭhānaṃ. Abyākatānaṃ maggadhammā, vipassanā,
analyzed: tattha kusalānam vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanā padaṭṭhānam abyākatānam magga dhammā vipassanā
translated: Herein, the profitable have insight leading to emergence as their footing. The indeterminate have the ideas of the path as their footing.

original: āvajjanā vā padaṭṭhānaṃ. Tesu kusalā lokuttarāva, abyākatā siyā kāmāvacarā, siyā
analyzed: āvajjanā vā padaṭṭhānam tesu kusalā abyākatā siyā kāmāvacarā siyā
translated: Or else, the profitable have supramundane only. The indeterminate may be of the sense sphere or supramundane.

original: lokuttarā, sabbāpi diṭṭhiyo akusalāva kāmāvacarāva, tāsaṃ avisesena micchābhinivese🔽ayonisomanasikāro padaṭṭhānaṃ. Visesato pana santatighanavinibbhogābhāvato ekattanayassa
analyzed: lokuttarā sabbā api diṭṭhiyaḥ akusalā va kāmāvacarā va tāsam avisesena micchā abhinivese  ayonisomanasikāro padaṭṭhānam visesato pana santati ghana vinibbhoga abhāvato eka ttanayassa
translated: All views are unprofitable only and of the sense sphere. For them, without distinction, wrong view is the footing.🔽But in particular, wrong grasp of unity in the mode of non-division of the compact is the footing for the eternity view accompanied by the surmise that remembers past lives.

original: micchāgāho atītajātianussaraṇatakkasahito sassatadiṭṭhiyā padaṭṭhānaṃ. Hetuphalabhāvena
analyzed: micchāgāhaḥ atīta jāti anussaraṇa takka sahitaḥ sassata diṭṭhiyā padaṭṭhānam hetu phala bhāvena
translated: The footing for the annihilation view is the wrong grasp of unity in the mode of division of the compact.

original: sambandhabhāvassa aggahaṇato nānattanayassa micchāgāho tajjāsamannāhārasahito ucchedadiṭṭhiyā
analyzed: sambandha bhāvassa aggahaṇataḥ nānatta nayassa micchāgāho uccheda diṭṭhiyā
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the state of relation, the misapprehension of the mode of plurality is the footing for the annihilation view accompanied by the corresponding nutriment.

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ. Evaṃ sesadiṭṭhīnampi yathāsambhavaṃ vattabbaṃ.
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam evam sesa diṭṭhīnam pi yathāsambhavam vattabbam
translated: So too with the other views.

original: “Vedanāna”nti ettha vedanā siyā kusalā, siyā akusalā, siyā abyākatā, siyā kāmāvacarā,
analyzed: ettha vedanā siyā kusalā siyā akusalā siyā abyākatā siyā kāmāvacarā
translated: As regards “feelings,” feeling may be profitable, unprofitable, indeterminate, of the sense sphere,

original: siyā rūpāvacarā, siyā arūpāvacarā, tāsaṃ phasso padaṭṭhānaṃ. Vedanānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ
analyzed: siyā rūpāvacarā siyā arūpāvacarā tāsam phassaḥ upadaṭṭhānam vedanānam yathābhūtam
translated: of the fine-material sphere, or of the immaterial sphere. Contact is the footing for them.

original: vedanānaṃ samudayādipaṭivedhanaṃ maggañāṇaṃ, anupādāvimutti ca phalañāṇaṃ, tesaṃ
analyzed: vedanānam samudaya ādi paṭivedhanam magga ñāṇam anupādāvimutti ca phala ñāṇam tesam
translated: The path knowledge that penetrates the arising, etc., of feelings is the knowledge of the fruit of deliverance by nongrasping.

original: “aññeva dhammā gambhīrā”ti ettha vuttanayena dhammādivibhāgo netabbo. “Ajānataṃ apassata”ntiādīsu
analyzed: aññā iva dhammā gambhīrā ti ettha vutta nayena dhamma ādi vibhāgaḥ netabbaḥ a jānatam a passatan ti ādīsu
translated: The analysis of ideas, etc., should be understood in the way stated in the case of “the ideas that are deep, etc.” .

original: avijjātaṇhā akusalā kāmāvacarā, tāsu avijjāya āsavā, ayonisomanasikāro eva vā padaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: avijjā ataṇhā akusalā kāmāvacarā tāsu avijjāya āsavāḥ ayoniso manasikāro eva vā padaṭṭhānam
translated: As regards “the unknowing, the unseeing,” ignorance and craving are unprofitable and of the sense sphere. In the case of ignorance, the taints are its footing, or else unreasoned attention.

original: Taṇhāya saṃyojaniyesu dhammesu assādadassanaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ. “Tadapi phassapaccayā”ti
analyzed: taṇhāya saṃyojaniyesu dhammesu assāda dassanam padaṭṭhānam tat api phassa paccayā ti
translated: In the case of craving, the seeing of gratification is the footing in regard to things that can act as objects for the generation of the fetters. “That too is due to contact” .

original: ettha phassassa vedanāya viya dhammādivibhāgo veditabbo. Iminā nayena phassāyatanādīnampi🔽yathārahaṃ dhammādivibhāgo netabboti ayaṃ saṃkilesadhamme, vodānadhamme ca sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇato,🔽padaṭṭhānato, bhūmito ca vibhajanalakkhaṇo vibhattihāro nāma. Yathāha “dhammañca
analyzed: ettha phassassa vedanāya viya dhamma ādi vibhāgaḥ veditabbaḥ iminā nayena phassa āyatana ādīnam pi  yathāraham dhamma ādi vibhāgaḥ netabbaḥ ti ayam saṃkilesa dhamme vodāna dhamme ca sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇato  padaṭṭhānataḥ bhūmitaḥ ca vibhajana lakkhaṇaḥ vibhattihāraḥ nāma yathā āha dhammam ca
translated: Herein, the exposition of ideas, etc., should be understood in the same way as that of contact and feeling.

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ, bhūmiñca vibhajjate ayaṃ hāro”tiādi.
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam bhūmiñca vibhajjate ayam hāraḥ ti ādi
translated: And so the exposition of ideas, etc., should be understood in the appropriate instances. This is called the Mode of Conveying a Conversion.

original: Parivattanahāravaṇṇanā
translated: The Mode of Conveying a Reversal

original: Āghātādīnamakaraṇaṃ khantisoraccāni anubrūhetvā paṭisaṅkhānabhāvanābalasiddhiyā ubhayahitapaṭipattimāvahati.🔽Āghātādayo pana pavattiyamānā dubbaṇṇataṃ, dukkhaseyyaṃ, bhogahāniṃ, akittiṃ, parehi
analyzed: khanti soraccāni ubhaya hita paṭipattim āvahati  āghāta ādayaḥ pana dubbaṇṇa tam dukkhaseyyam bhoga hānim akittim parehi
translated: The non-doing of the kinds of annoyance, etc., is what brings about the practice of what is beneficial to both oneself and others by the success of the development of patience and mildness after the practice of reflection.

original: durupasaṅkamanatañca nipphādentā nirayādīsu mahādukkhamāvahanti. Pāṇātipātādipaṭivirati
analyzed: durupasaṅkamanatam ca nipphādentā niraya ādīsu mahā dukkham āvahanti pāṇātipāta ādi paṭivirati
translated: But the doing of the kinds of annoyance, etc., brings about great suffering in the hells, etc., by producing ugliness, bad rebirth, loss of property, disrepute, and unapproachability by others.

original: avippaṭisārādikalyāṇaṃ paramparamāvahati. Pāṇātipātādi pana vippaṭisārādiakalyāṇaṃ🔽paramparamāvahati. Gambhīratādivisesayuttaṃ ñāṇaṃ veneyyānaṃ yathārahaṃ vijjābhiññādiguṇavisesamāvahati
analyzed: a vippaṭisāra ādi kalyāṇam paramparam āvahati pāṇa atipāta ādi vippaṭisāra ādi akalyāṇam  paramparam āvahati gambhīra tā ādi visesa yuttam ñāṇam veneyyānam yathāraham vijjā abhiññā ādi guṇa visesam āvahati
translated: But killing living beings, and so on, and the opposite of that are the opposite of the good, and so on.🔽Knowledge associated with the special qualities of profundity, and so on, brings about the special qualities of the various kinds of knowledge, such as the kinds of knowledge consisting in direct-knowledge, in conformity with the disciples’ needs,

original: sabbaññeyyassa yathāsabhāvāvabodhato. Tathā gambhīratādivisesarahitaṃ pana ñāṇaṃ
analyzed: sabba ñeyyassa yathā sabhāva avabodhato tathā gambhīra tā ādi visesa rahitam pana ñāṇam
translated: because it penetrates the real specific nature of all that can be known. But knowledge devoid of the special qualities of profundity, and so on,🔽does not bring about the special qualities of the kinds of knowledge as described, because it is shared by disciples and others in regard to what can be known.

original: ñeyyesu sādhāraṇabhāvato yathāvuttaguṇavisesaṃ nāvahati. Sabbāpi cetā diṭṭhiyo yathārahaṃ
analyzed: ñeyyesu sādhāraṇa bhāvataḥ yathā vutta guṇa visesam na āvahati sabbā api cetā diṭṭhiyaḥ yathāraham
translated: And all these views, according as they are,

original: sassatucchedabhāvato antadvayabhūtā sakkāyatīraṃ nātivattanti aniyyānikasabhāvattā.
analyzed: anta dvaya bhūtā sakkāyatīram na ativattanti
translated: do not transcend the near shore of personality view because they are of a kind not to lead out , since they are of a kind to lead to eternalism or to annihilationism, which are the two extremes.

original: Sammādiṭṭhi pana saparikkhārā majjhimapaṭipadābhūtā sakkāyatīramatikkamma pāraṃ gacchati
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi pana sa parikkhārā majjhima paṭipadā bhūtā sakkāya tīram atikkamma pāram gacchati
translated: But right view with its requisites, which is the middle way, goes beyond the near shore of personality view and reaches the further shore,

original: niyyānikasabhāvattā. Vedanānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ samudayādipaṭivedhanā anupādāvimuttimāvahati
analyzed: niyyānika sabhāvattā vedanānam yathābhūtam samudaya ādi paṭivedhanā anupādā vimuttim āvahati
translated: because it is of a kind to lead out . And the penetration of the true nature of feelings, and so on, as it really is, in their origination, and so on, brings about the deliverance by nonclinging,

original: maggabhāvato. Vedanānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ samudayādiasampaṭivedho saṃsāracārakāvarodhamāvahati🔽saṅkhārānaṃ paccayabhāvato. Vedayitasabhāvapaṭicchādako sammoho tadabhinandanamāvahati,
analyzed: magga bhāvataḥ yathābhūtam samudaya ādi a saṃpaṭivedhaḥ saṃsāra cāraka avarodham āvahati  saṅkhārānam paccaya bhāvataḥ vedayita sabhāva paṭicchādako sammohaḥ tad abhinandanam āvahati
translated: As to the conditionality of formations, delusion, which conceals the real nature of what is to be felt, prevents the delighting in,🔽while the penetration of them as they are in fact prevents the cleaving to and the passion for them. The wrong view of a real self, etc., is extended by craving accompanied by unwise attention and by wrong resolve.

original: yathābhūtāvabodho pana tattha nibbedhaṃ, virāgañca āvahati. Micchābhinivese ayonisomanasikārasahitā🔽taṇhā anekavihitaṃ diṭṭhijālaṃ pasāreti. Yathāvuttataṇhāsamucchedo paṭhamamaggo taṃ🔽diṭṭhijālaṃ saṅkoceti. Sassatavādādipaññāpanassa phasso paccayo asati phasse tadabhāvato.
analyzed: yathā bhūta avabodho pana tattha nibbedham virāgam ca āvahati micchā abhinivese a yoniso manasikāra sahitā  taṇhā aneka vihitam diṭṭhi jālam pasāreti yathā vutta taṇhā samucchedo paṭhama maggo taṃ  diṭṭhi jālam saṅkoceti sassata vāda ādi paññāpanassa phasso paccayaḥ asati phasse tad abhāvato
translated: The first path cuts it down; the second path with-draws it; the third path dries it up; the fourth path eliminates it.

original: Diṭṭhibandhanabaddhānaṃ phassāyatanādīnamanirodhanena phassādianirodho saṃsāradukkhassa🔽anivattiyeva yāthāvato phassāyatanādipariññā sabbadiṭṭhidassanāni ativattati, tesaṃ

original: pana tathā apariññā diṭṭhidassanaṃ nātivattati. Bhavanettisamucchedo āyatiṃ attabhāvassa
analyzed: pana tathā apariññā diṭṭhi dassanam na ativattati bhavanetti samucchedaḥ āyatim atta bhāvassa
translated: but the seeing of views does not transcend that non-penetration. The cutting off of the net of craving for renewed existence

original: anibbattiyā saṃvattati, asamucchinnāya bhavanettiyā anāgate bhavappabandho parivattatiyevāti
analyzed: a nibbattiyā saṃvattati a samucchinnāya bhava nettiyā anāgate bhava ppabandho
translated: But the seeing of views does not go beyond that, as it is not fully understood. The cutting off of the round of rebirths leads to the non-arising of a future individual existence. When the round of rebirths is not cut off, the continuity of becoming revolves.

original: ayaṃ sutte niddiṭṭhānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭipakkhato parivattanalakkhaṇo parivattanahāro
analyzed: ayam sutte niddiṭṭhānam dhammānam paṭipakkhato parivattana lakkhaṇaḥ parivattana hāro
translated: This is the mode of Conveying a Conversion, which is the characteristic of the mode of Conveying a Conversion in terms of the opposite of the ideas demonstrated in the Thread.

original: nāma. Kimāha “kusalākusale dhamme, niddiṭṭhe bhāvite pahīne cā”tiādi.
analyzed: nāma kim āha kusala akusale dhamme niddiṭṭhe bhāvite pahīne ca ati ādi
translated: What is the mode of Conveying a Conversion in terms of the opposite of the ideas demonstrated in the Thread?🔽The mode of Conveying a Conversion in terms of the opposite of the ideas demonstrated in the Thread is the characteristic of the mode of Conveying a Conversion in terms of the opposite of the ideas demonstrated in the Thread.

original: Vevacanahāravaṇṇanā🔽“Mamaṃ mama me”ti pariyāyavacanaṃ. ‘Vā yadi cā”ti pariyāyavacanaṃ. “Bhikkhave samaṇā🔽tapassino”ti pariyāyavacanaṃ. “Pare aññe paṭiviruddhā”ti…pe… naṃ. “Avaṇṇaṃ akittiṃ🔽ninda”nti…pe… naṃ. “Bhāseyyuṃ bhaṇeyyuṃ katheyyu”nti…pe… naṃ. “Dhammassa vinayassa
analyzed: vevacana hāra vaṇṇanā  mamam mama mā iti pariyāya vacanam vā yadi ca ati pariyāya vacanam bhikkhave samaṇāḥ  tapassino ti pariyāya vacanam pare aññe paṭiviruddha atipe nam avaṇṇam akittim  nindantipe nam bhāseyyum bhaṇeyyum katheyyuntipe nam dhammassa vinayassa
translated: The mode of Conveying Synonyms

original: satthusāsanassā”ti…pe… naṃ. “Saṅghassa samūhassa gaṇassā”ti…pe… naṃ. “Tatra tattha
analyzed: satthu sāsanassa atipe nam saṅghassa samūhassa gaṇassa atipe nam tatra tattha
translated: “ Mine, I, my self “ : this is a synonym. “ If, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu should speak thus “ : this is a synonym. “ Ascetics, bhikkhus “ : this is a synonym. “ Others, bhikkhus, who are opposed “ : this is a synonym. “ Dispraise, bhikkhus, blame, disparagement “ : this is a synonym. “ They would speak, bhikkhus, they would say, they would tell “ : this is a synonym. “ The True Idea, bhikkhus, the Discipline, the Teacher’s Dispensation “ : this is a synonym. “ The Community, bhikkhus, the multitude, the concourse “ : this is a synonym.

original: tesū”ti…pe… naṃ. “Tumhehi vo bhavantehī”ti…pe… naṃ. “Āghāto doso byāpādo”ti…pe… naṃ🔽“appaccayo domanassaṃ cetasikadukkha”nti…pe… naṃ. “Cetaso cittassa manaso”ti…pe…🔽naṃ. “Anabhiraddhi byāpatti manopadoso”ti…pe… naṃ. “Na no a mā”ti…pe… naṃ. “Karaṇīyā🔽uppādetabbā pavattetabbā”ti pariyāyavacanaṃ. Iminā nayena sabbapadesu vevacanaṃ vattabbanti
analyzed: naṃ tumhehi vaḥ bhavante hi itipe naṃ āghātaḥ dosaḥ naṃ  appaccayaḥ domanassam cetasika dukkha ntipe nam cetasaḥ cittassa manasaḥ itipe  naṃ naṃ no a mātipe naṃ karaṇīyā  uppādetabbā pavattetabbā ati pariyāya vacanam iminā nayena sabba padesu vevacanam vattabbanti
translated: “These are your own words, not ours.”🔽“Anger, hate, and bitterness.”🔽“Discontent and mental pain.”🔽“The mind, the heart, the spirit.”🔽“Discontent, ill will, and resentment.”🔽“We will not do what you say.”🔽“Should be aroused, should be brought into existence, should be continued.”🔽This is a roundabout way of saying the same thing. The synonyms should be explained in the same way in all the other sections.

original: pana khuddikādivasena pañcadhā paññatto. Somanassaṃ upavicāravasena chadhā, sīlaṃ🔽vārittacārittādivasena anekadhā, gambhīratādivisesayuttaṃ ñāṇaṃ cittuppādavasena
analyzed: pana khuddika ādi vasena pañcadhā paññatto somanassam upavicāra vasena chadhā sīlam
translated: It is classed as manifold according to virtue, according to the words, “The virtue of refraining and the virtue of undertaking” .🔽Knowledge is classed as fourfold or twelvefold according to the occurrence of consciousness, according to the words, “Knowledge is deep, deep to fathom, deep to penetrate, and it is classed as manifold according to the distinction of its objective fields.

original: catudhā, dvādasadhā vā, visayabhedato anekadhā ca, diṭṭhisassatādivasena dvāsaṭṭhiyā
analyzed: catudhā dvādasadhā vā visaya bhedataḥ anekadhā ca diṭṭhi sassata ādi vasena dvāsaṭṭhiyā
translated: It is classed as sixty-two according to the distinction of the sixty-two views, according to the words, ‘There are sixty-two such views’ . It is classed as manifold according to the distinction of the subdivisions included therein.

original: bhedehi, tadantogadhavibhāgena anekadhā ca, vedanā chadhā, aṭṭhasatadhā, anekadhā
analyzed: bhedehi tad anta ogadha vibhāgena anekadhā ca vedanā chadhā aṭṭha satadhā anekadhā
translated: Feeling is classed as sixfold, as eight hundred, and as manifold, according to the words, ‘There are six classes of feeling’ , ‘There are eight hundred classes of feeling’ , and ‘There are manifold classes of feeling’ .

original: ca, tassā samudayo pañcadhā, tathā atthaṅgamopi, assādo duvidhena, ādīnavo tividhena,
analyzed: ca tassā samudayaḥ pañcadhā tathā atthaṅgamaḥ api assādaḥ duvidhena ādīnavaḥ tividhena
translated: Its origin is classed as fivefold, and so is its cessation, according to the words, ‘The origin of feeling, the origin of feeling’ , and ‘The cessation of feeling, the cessation of feeling’ . Its gratification is twofold, according to the words, ‘The gratification in feeling’ . Its danger is threefold, according to the words, ‘The danger in feeling’ .

original: nissaraṇaṃ ekadhā, catudhā ca, anupādāvimutti duvidhena, “ajānataṃ apassata”nti vuttā
analyzed: nissaraṇam ekadhā catudhā ca anupādā vimutti duvidhena a jānatam a passataṃ ti vuttā
translated: Its escape is classed as fourfold and as manifold, according to the words, ‘The escape from feeling’ . Non-clinging is twofold, according to the words, ‘The non-clinging to feeling’ and ‘The non-grasping of feeling’ .

original: avijjā visayabhedena catudhā, aṭṭhadhā ca, “taṇhāgatāna”ntiādinā vuttā taṇhā chadhā,🔽aṭṭhasatadhā, anekadhā ca, phasso nissayavasena chadhā, upādānaṃ catudhā, bhavo dvidhā,
analyzed: 🔽aṭṭha satadhā anekadhā ca phassaḥ nissaya vasena chadhā upādānam catudhā bhavaḥ dvidhā
translated: Ignorance is classed as fourfold and as manifold, according to the words, ‘The unknowing of feeling’ and ‘The non-seeing of feeling’ . Craving is classed as sixfold, as eight hundredfold, and as manifold, according to the words, ‘The craving for feeling’ , ‘The craving for feeling’ , and ‘The craving for feeling’ .🔽Contact is classed as sixfold, according to the words, ‘The contact in feeling’ . Clinging is classed as fourfold, according to the words, ‘The clinging to feeling’ . Becoming is classed

translated: and lamentation is tenfold. Grief is fourfold, despair is fourfold, and suffering is fourfold. Likewise despair is fourfold.

original: paññattoti ayaṃ pabhedapaññatti, samūhapaññatti ca.

translated: This is the exposition of the analysis and the exposition of the aggregate.

analyzed: samudayaḥ hoti iti pabhava paññatti yathābhūtam pajānāti iti dukkhassa pariññā paññatti
translated: “The origination of suffering” is the exposition of the origin. “One understands as it really is” is the exposition of the full understanding of suffering.

original: samudayassa pahānapaññatti, nirodhassa sacchikiriyāpaññatti, maggassa bhāvanāpaññatti.🔽“Antojālīkatā”tiādisabbadiṭṭhīnaṃ saṅgahapaññatti. “Ucchinnabhavanettiko”tiādi duvidhena🔽parinibbānapaññattīti evaṃ āghātādīnaṃ pabhavapaññattipariññāpaññattiādivasena. Tathā

original: ca paññattibhedo vibhajjitabboti ayaṃ ekekassa dhammassa anekāhi paññattīhi paññapetabbākāravibhāvanalakkhaṇo
analyzed: ca paññatti bhedaḥ vibhajjitabbaḥ ti ayam ekekassa dhammassa anekāhi paññattīhi paññapetabba ākāra vibhāvana lakkhaṇo
translated: and the analysis of the mode of expression should be elucidated. This is the mode of Conveying a Mode of Expression called “The Mode of Expression of the Analysis of the Mode of Expression of a Single Idea in Many Ways,”

original: paññattihāro nāma, tena vuttaṃ “ekaṃ bhagavā dhammaṃ, paṇṇattīhi vividhāhi desetī”tiādi.
analyzed: paññatti hāraḥ nāma tena vuttam ekam bhagavā dhammam paṇṇattīhi vividhāhi deseti itiādi
translated: and that is why it was said above: “The Blessed One teaches a single idea in many ways with various expressions.”

original: Otaraṇahāravaṇṇanā🔽Āghātaggahaṇena saṅkhārakkhandhasaṅgaho, tathā anabhiraddhiggahaṇena. Appaccayaggahaṇena🔽vedanākkhandhasaṅgahoti idaṃ khandhamukhena otaraṇaṃ. Tathā āghātādiggahaṇena dhammāyatanaṃ,

translated: The Mode of Conveying a Penetration🔽The inclusion of the determinations aggregate by the mention of “annoyance” and likewise the inclusion of the feeling aggregate by the mention of “disappointment” and the inclusion of the perception and the formations aggregates by the mention of “no-cause” is the penetration by way of the aggregates.

original: dhammadhātu, dukkhasaccaṃ, samudayasaccaṃ vā gahitanti idaṃ āyatanamukhena, dhātumukhena,
analyzed: dhammadhātu dukkha saccam samudaya saccam vā gahitan ti idam āyatana mukhena dhātu mukhena
translated: Likewise the inclusion of the idea base and the idea element and of the truth of suffering and the truth of the origin is by the mention of “annoyance” and so on. This is the penetration by way of the bases and elements and by way of the truths.

original: saccamukhena ca otaraṇaṃ. Tathā āghātādīnaṃ sahajātā avijjā hetusahajātaaññamaññanissasampayuttaatthiavigatapaccayehi
analyzed: ca otaraṇam tathā āghāta ādīnam sahajātāḥ avijjāḥ hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissa sampayutta atthi avigata paccayehi
translated: And likewise the ignorance that is conascent with annoyance and so on is included by the conascence condition, the mutuality condition, the support condition, the association condition, the non-disappearance condition, and the presence condition.

original: paccayo, asahajātā pana anantaraniruddhā anantarasamanantaraanantarūpanissayanatthivigatāsevanapaccayehi
analyzed: paccayaḥ asahajātā pana anantara niruddhā anantara samanantara ananta rūpa nissaya natthi vigata āsevana paccayehi
translated: But those that are not conascent are conditions for those that are conascent by means of the prenascent, postnascent, proximity, absence, disappearance, and repetition conditions.

original: paccayo. Ananantarā pana upanissayavaseneva paccayo. Taṇhāupādānādi phassādīnampi
analyzed: paccayaḥ ananantarā pana upanissaya vasena iva paccayaḥ taṇhā upādāna ādi phassa ādīnam pi

analyzed: tesam sahajātānam asahajātānam ca yathāraham paccaya bhāvaḥ vattabbo koci pana ittha
translated: and for the conascent and unconascent states as appropriate. But some

analyzed: adhipati vasena koci kamma vasena koci āhāra vasena koci indriya vasena koci jhāna vasena

original: koci maggavasenāpi paccayoti ayampi viseso veditabboti idaṃ paṭiccasamuppādamukhena
analyzed: koci magga vasena api paccayaḥ ti ayam pi visesaḥ veditabbaḥ ti idam paṭiccasamuppāda mukhena
translated: and some by way of path. This is the difference that should be understood. This is the entry into dependent origination by way of dependent origination.

original: otaraṇaṃ. Imināva nayena ānandādīnampi khandhādimukhena otaraṇaṃ vibhāvetabbaṃ.🔽Tathā sīlaṃ pāṇātipātādīhi viraticetanā, abyāpādādicetasikadhammā ca, pāṇātipātādayo
analyzed: otaraṇam iminā ava nayena ānanda ādīnam pi khandha ādi mukhena otaraṇam vibhāvetabbam  tathā sīlam pāṇa atipāta ādīhi virati cetanā abyāpāda ādi cetasika dhammā ca pāṇa atipāta ādayaḥ
translated: By this same method the entry of Ānanda, etc., by way of the aggregates, etc., should be illustrated.🔽So too, virtue is the volition of refraining from killing living beings, etc., and the mental states of non-ill will, etc.; killing living beings, etc., are the volition of killing, etc., and the states associated with that volition and the states that assist it, such as shamelessness, etc.;

original: cetanāva, tesaṃ, tadupakārakadhammānañca lajjādayādīnaṃ saṅkhārakkhandhadhammāyatanādīsu
analyzed: tesam tad upakāraka dhammānam ca lajjā dayā ādīnam saṅkhāra kkhandha dhamma āyatana ādīsu
translated: in the aggregates, bases, and elements of the states of refraining and killing, etc.,

original: saṅgahato purimanayeneva khandhādimukhena otaraṇaṃ vibhāvetabbaṃ. Esa nayo ñāṇadiṭṭhivedanāavijjātaṇhādiggahaṇesupi.
analyzed: saṅgahato purima nayena iva khandha ādi mukhena otaraṇam vibhāvetabbam esa nayaḥ ñāṇa diṭṭhi vedanā avijjā taṇhā ādi gahaṇesu pi
translated: The penetration by way of the aggregates, etc., should be illustrated by the method stated above under the heading of inclusion. The same method applies to the other terms such as “knowledge,” “view,” “feeling,” “ignorance,” and “craving.”

original: Nissaraṇānupādāvimuttiggahaṇesu pana asaṅkhatadhātuvasenapi dhātumukhena otaraṇaṃ
analyzed: nissaraṇa anupādā vimutti ggahaṇesu pana asaṅkhata dhātu vasena api dhātu mukhena otaraṇam
translated: But in the case of the terms “emancipation” and “non-appropriation,” the penetration should be illustrated by way of the element of the unconditioned.

original: vibhāvetabbaṃ, tathā “vedanānaṃ…pe… anupādāvimutto”ti etena bhagavato sīlādayo pañcadhammakkhandhā,
analyzed: vibhāvetabbam tathā etena bhagavato sīla ādayaḥ pañca dhammakkhandhā
translated: And by the statement “he is emancipated through non-appropriation of feeling,” etc., the Blessed One’s five aggregates of virtue, etc.,

original: satipaṭṭhānādayo ca bodhipakkhiyadhammā pakāsitā hontīti taṃmukhenapi otaraṇaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: sati paṭṭhāna ādayo ca bodhi pakkhiya dhammā pakāsitāḥ honti iti tad mukhena api otaraṇam veditabbam
translated: and the factors of enlightenment such as the foundations of mindfulness, etc., are also revealed. Thus the penetration should be understood by way of these headings as well.

original: “Tadapi phassapaccayā”ti sassatādipaññāpanassa paccayādhīnavuttitādīpanena aniccatāmukhena
analyzed: tat api phassa paccayā ti sassatā ādi paññāpanassa paccaya adhīna vutti tā dīpanena anicca tā mukhena
translated: “That too is conditioned by contact” shows the impermanence aspect by revealing that the postulation of eternalism, etc., is dependent on conditions.

original: otaraṇaṃ, tathā evaṃdhammatāya paṭiccasamuppādamukhena otaraṇaṃ. Aniccassa dukkhānattabhāvato
analyzed: otaraṇam tathā evaṃdhammatāya paṭiccasamuppāda mukhena otaraṇam aniccassa dukkha anatta bhāvato
translated: The penetration by way of the dependent origination should be illustrated in the same way. Since the impermanent is suffering and without self,

original: appaṇihitamukhena, suññatāmukhena otaraṇaṃ. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Ayaṃ paṭiccasamuppādādimukhehi
analyzed: appaṇihita mukhena suñña tā mukhena otaraṇam sesa padesu pi esa iva nayaḥ ayam paṭiccasamuppāda ādi mukhehi
translated: the penetration by way of the signless and the desireless should be illustrated. The same method applies to the remaining terms. This is the penetration by way of dependent origination, etc.

original: suttatthassa otaraṇalakkhaṇo otaraṇahāro nāma. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “yo ca paṭiccuppādo,
analyzed: sutta tthassa otaraṇa lakkhaṇaḥ otaraṇa hāraḥ nāma tathā hi vuttam yaḥ ca paṭiccuppādo

analyzed: indriya khandhā ca dhātu āyatana ati ādi

analyzed: sodhana hāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The Mode of Conveying a Clearing Up

analyzed: mamam vā bhikkhave pare avaṇṇam bhāseyyun ti ārambhaḥ dhammassa vā avaṇṇam bhāseyyuṃ  saṅghassa vā avaṇṇam bhāseyyunti pada suddhi no ārambha suddhi tatra tumhehi na
translated: “If, bhikkhus, others speak in dispraise of me, or of a disciple of mine, or of the True Idea, or of the Order,

translated: then there should be no resentment, no annoyance, no counter-anger on your part” is the Clearing Up, both of the expression and of the undertaking.

The cause of the craving is the contemplation of gratification in things that breed craving. The cause of the contact is the sixfold base. The cause of the sixfold base is mentality-materiality. The cause of the cutting off of the net of becoming is the development of purification. This is the analysis of the cause condition.

translated: By the words “he does not arouse … anger” , etc., the contraction of craving and ignorance is shown. For when there is affection and delusion for the self, the body, and the bases, anger arises with the thought “He has done me harm,” and so on, but not when there is not. Likewise, by the words “he abstains from killing living beings” , etc., the utter abandonment of craving and ignorance is shown. For it is said: “He has known for himself and realized by his own super-knowledge the peace, which is the destruction of craving, and he is liberated by non-clinging” , and: “He understands as it really is: ‘These are the six bases for contact’ … ‘With the cessation of ignorance’ … ‘This is the path leading to the cessation of ignorance’ ” .

original: Tāsaṃ pana pubbantakappikādipadehi, “ajānataṃ apassata”ntiādipadehi ca sarūpatopi

original: dassitānaṃ taṇhāvijjānaṃ rūpadhammā, arūpadhammā ca adhiṭṭhānaṃ. Yathākkamaṃ samatho
